entities: [[(u'Knowledge creation', u'Task'), (u'learning', u'Task')], [(u'theoretical abilities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'organisational knowledge creation', u'Task'), (u'Co-Evolute methodology', u'Method')], [(u'Co-Evolute methodology', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Method')], [(u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'organisational knowledge creation', u'Task'), (u'Talbot', u'Material')], [(u'Co-Evolute methodology', u'Method')], [], [(u'Co-Evolute survey', u'Task')], [(u'Folium and Talbot applications', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Knowledge creation and learning are key issues facing companies today .', u'Creation of added value is based on the improvement of personnels performance through practical work and theoretical abilities .', u'This research examines organisational knowledge creation and learning through the Co-Evolute methodology created at the Tampere University of Technology in Pori .', u'The Co-Evolute methodology utilises ontology engineering to support the use of several specific fuzzy applications on the internet .', u'In this research two applications are presented : Folium , studying organisational knowledge creation and Talbot , studying learning the environment .', u'The Co-Evolute methodology measures the difference between current and desired states , i.e .', u'the proactive vision of the organisation or individual .', u'This paper presents the results of a Co-Evolute survey , carried out at a research institute in Turku , Finland , during 2005 .', u'This paper shows how the Folium and Talbot applications can be used to identify areas requiring development ...']

sentences: [u'Knowledge management ( KM ) is about collecting , organizing , and storing the knowledge assets of an organization to make it accessible for future knowledge reuse and application .', u'Effective knowledge management system ( KMS ) should be able to deliver relevant knowledge to the right knowledge user at the right time .', u'Yet , existing KMS is limited in several ways , and still largely relies on human efforts to access , extract and filter information pertinent to their knowledge need .', u'Successful KMS requires the identification of proper technology designed with the right system features to support the KM activities , hence achieve the goals of KM .', u'Due to this motivation , this paper aims to discuss the application of semantic technology to enhance the KMS and propose a semantic KM model to support collaborative learning environment .', u'This preliminary model has been proposed based on the review of the literatures on KM , KMS , semantic technology and collaborative learning environment and the verification of the model components will be done using a questionnaire survey .', u'A pilot survey was conducted to several academicians in Higher Learning Institutions ( HLIs ) in Malaysia to validate the survey instruments before the actual survey is carried out .', u'Rasch Unified Measurement Method ( RUMM ) is used to analyze the pilot data .', u'As a result , Person reliability is found to be quite high , but Item reliability suggested fair data .', u'A few respondents and items were identified as misfits with distorted measurements .', u'Some problematic questions are revised and the negative questions are considered to be reworded into positive questions .']

sentences: [u'Linked data represents each piece of data as a link between two things .', u'It lets software reasoners arrive at conclusions in a human-like way .', u'This column discusses how the EYE reasoner exploits linked data and how industry is employing EYE .']

sentences: [u'In the recent past , domain specific solutions for detailed semantic analysis have got acceptable by natural language processing community and use of applications involving natural language based user interface .', u'Different approaches that has been previously used is focusing on quality of text and improving the text contents by adding semantic information with text then the existing approaches used for semantic analysis can provide better results .', u'In this , an approach was presented to address the problem of non-availability of semantic information required for better semantic analysis .', u'This problem is solved by using semantic technology to annotate text of software requirements expressed in a natural language with their domain specific semantics and investigate the effect of semantic analysis with attached semantics .', u'The presented approach uses a semantic framework specifically designed for interpretation and detailed semantic analysis of natural language software requirement specifications .', u'The used framework is based on semantic technology involves knowledge extracted from existing software requirement documents and knowledge extracted from existing applications .', u'The presented approach shows that by adapting and combing existing ontologies to support knowledge management , developing system and performing experiments on requirement of real world software systems .', u'In this approach start with software requirement specification , after this clean the irrelevant requirements , convert the cleaned requirements into graph that represents inter related different elements .', u'Represent the requirement graph into sparse matrix , after these all steps ; we generate ontology with the help of OntoGen tool .']

entities: [[(u'Event-driven systems', u'Method')], [(u'complex real-world events', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'event processing systems', u'Method'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'systems', u'Generic')], [(u'Complex events', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'raw primitive events', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontological background knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'non-event concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'event processing', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'Task'), (u'event processing', u'Task'), (u'modular upper-level ontologies', u'Method'), (u'semantic enabled complex event processing', u'Task')], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'ontology engineering aspects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'scalability', u'Metric'), (u'expressiveness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reuse', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'syntax', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantics')], [], [(u'ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'event processing'), (u'modular upper-level ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic enabled complex event processing')], [(u'ontology engineering aspects', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies'), (u'scalability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'expressiveness'), (u'scalability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reuse'), (u'expressiveness', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reuse')]]
sentences: [u'Event-driven systems are highly depending on the quality of detection and processing of events .', u'Many of complex real-world events can not be processed by the existing event processing systems because they are too complex to be understood and processed by the systems .', u'Complex events can be inferred from raw primitive events based on their incoming sequence , their syntax and semantics .', u'Usage of ontological background knowledge about events and their relationship to other non-event concepts can improve the quality of event processing .', u'In this paper , we discuss the profits and problems of ontology developing and usage in the area of event processing and propose modular upper-level ontologies for semantic enabled complex event processing .', u'We discuss , why the modularity is needed and how these ontologies should be modular build up based on ontology engineering aspects to be able to address scalability , expressiveness and reuse .']

sentences: [u'Ontology evaluation is one of the most important phases of ontology engineering .', u"Researchers have identified different types of errors that should be catered in ontology evaluation process and classified them in error 's taxonomy .", u'Semantic Inconsistency errors are the most common when modeling complex taxonomic knowledge while building semantic classification within the ontology , and in ontology merging process where different subtype concepts of source ontologies map on each other .', u'In this paper , we have identified three types of semantic inconsistency errors , and provided criteria for semantic classification evaluation .', u'This criterion provides ontologists to build well-formed class hierarchy that is free from semantic inconsistency errors .', u'Moreover we emphasized on the control mechanisms ( based on this criteria ) to be perform during finding mappings between concepts in ontology merging process to achieve accurate results .', u'We have demonstrated the importance of such errors by giving different scenarios where appropriate .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Decision Table ( SDT )', u'Method'), (u"decision makers ' concepts", u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'decision knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge sharing', u'Task')], [(u'SDT', u'Method'), (u'decision resources', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'tabular format', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'SDT', u'Method'), (u'self organizations', u'Task'), (u'automatic reorganization of decision tables', u'Task')], [(u'precision', u'Metric')], [(u'Decision Support', u'Method'), (u'Database Modeling', u'Task'), (u'Ontology Engineering', u'Task'), (u'adaptive s elf- o rganization', u'Task'), (u'utomatic r eorganization procedures', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u"A Semantic Decision Table ( SDT ) provides a means to capture and examine decision makers ' concepts , as well as a tool for refining their decision knowledge and facilitating knowledge sharing in a scalable manner .", u"One challenge SDT faces is to organize decision resources represented in a tabular format based on the user 's needs at different levels .", u'It is important to make it self organized and automatically reorganized when the requirements are updated .', u'This paper describes the ongoing research on SDT and its tool that supports the self organizations and automatic reorganization of decision tables .', u'We argue that simplicity , precision , and flexibility are the key issues to respond to the paper challenge .', u'We propose a novel combination of the principles of Decision Support and Database Modeling , together with the modern technologies in Ontology Engineering , in the adaptive s elf- o rganization and a utomatic r eorganization procedures ( SOAR ) .']

entities: [[(u'light-weight ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'disjointness axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'consistency checking', u'Task'), (u'automatic evaluation of ontologies', u'Task')], [], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'disjointness axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'syntactic and semantic evidence', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'learning disjointness', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'ontology engineering environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'automatic discovery of disjointness axioms', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'syntactic and semantic evidence'), (u'methods', u'USED-FOR', u'syntactic and semantic evidence')], [(u'ontology engineering environments', u'FEATURE-OF', u'automatic discovery of disjointness axioms')]]
sentences: [u"An increasing number of applications benefits from light-weight ontologies , or to put it differently `` a little semantics goes a long way '' .", u'However , our experience indicates that more expressiveness can offer significant advantages .', u'Introducing disjointness axioms , for instance , greatly facilitates consistency checking and the automatic evaluation of ontologies .', u'In an extensive user study we discovered that proper modeling of disjointness is a difficult and very time-consuming task .', u'We therefore developed an approach to automatically enrich learned or manually engineered ontologies with disjointness axioms .', u'This approach relies on several methods for obtaining syntactic and semantic evidence from different sources which we believe to provide a solid base for learning disjointness .', u'After thoroughly evaluating the implementation of our approach we think that in future ontology engineering environments the automatic discovery of disjointness axioms may help to increase the richness , quality and usefulness of any given ontology .']

entities: [[(u'Debugging inconsistent OWL ontologies', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineers', u'Method'), (u'formalisation errors', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge model', u'Method')], [(u'Debugging services', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering tools', u'Method'), (u'debugging strategies', u'Method')], [(u'they', u'Generic'), (u'precision', u'Metric')], [(u'identification of common antipatterns', u'Task'), (u'debugging strategy', u'Method'), (u'task', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'ontology engineers', u'CONJUNCTION', u'domain experts')], [(u'ontology engineering tools', u'CONJUNCTION', u'debugging strategies'), (u'debugging strategies', u'PART-OF', u'Debugging services')], [], [(u'identification of common antipatterns', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology developers'), (u'identification of common antipatterns', u'CONJUNCTION', u'debugging strategy')]]
sentences: [u'Debugging inconsistent OWL ontologies is a tedious and time-consuming task where a combination of ontology engineers and domain experts is often required to understand whether the changes to be performed are actually dealing with formalisation errors or changing the intended meaning of the original knowledge model .', u'Debugging services from existing ontology engineering tools and debugging strategies available in the literature aid in this task .', u'However , in complex cases they are still far from providing adequate support to ontology developers , due to their lack of efficiency or precision when explaining the main causes for unsatisfiable classes , together with little support for proposing solutions for them .', u'We claim that it is possible to provide additional support to ontology developers , based on the identification of common antipatterns and a debugging strategy , which can be combined with the use of existing tools in order to make this task more effective .']

entities: [[(u'Social Psychology perspective', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology engineering processes', u'Task')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'formal psycho-social entities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'ontology', u'Method')], [(u'ontology', u'Task'), (u'domain knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologist role', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'social representation', u'Method'), (u'formal language', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Social Psychology perspective', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology engineering processes')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The Social Psychology perspective provides a new look into the ontology engineering processes .', u'In this paper , we analyze in particular how ontologies , as formal psycho-social entities , are the outcome of influences .', u'The types of influence range from the sources ( originating from the experts and the corpus authors ) to the ontologists .', u'As it is impossible to design an ontology without any influence , the ontologist should develop his awareness and has to minimize the influence through the process by taking precisely into account the ecosystem considered .', u"An ontology is a shared conceptualization establishing what must be the `` truth '' .There is a conformism to and of the ontologist and to the choice of formalism.The expert , by its special position recognized , has an influence on the individuals.Can we use texts as the correct transposition of the domain knowledge ? The ontologist role is to translate a social representation into a formal language ."]

entities: [[(u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'Decision Support Systems', u'Task')], [(u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'manual low level tasks', u'Metric'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'customer dissatisfaction', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'manual low level task', u'Task'), (u'allocation of shared resources', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'task', u'Generic'), (u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'autonomic computing', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'information source', u'Material'), (u'knowledge base representation', u'Task')], [(u'autonomic data warehouse resource configuration', u'Task'), (u'decision support systems', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'The paper addresses the problem of complexity in managing Decision Support Systems , due to the immense quantity of information available .', u'With the increase in complexity , manual low level tasks take most of the decision experts time , not allowing them to focus on higher level business objectives , leading to poor quality of service and customer dissatisfaction .', u'We treat a common manual low level task , the allocation of shared resources between groups of data warehouses .', u'We describe how this task is executed in present , and propose a solution for rendering it autonomic while focusing on the improvement of the service levels .', u'We base our proposal on the notions of autonomic computing , integration of specific heuristics and on aspects of ontology engineering as information source for knowledge base representation .', u'The paper is aimed at proposing autonomic data warehouse resource configuration , with the applicative area of decision support systems .']

entities: [[(u'Linked data systems', u'Method')], [], [(u'self-describing linked data', u'Material')]]
sentences: [u'Linked data systems rely on the quality of , and linking between , their data sources .', u'However , existing data is difficult to trace to its origin and provides no provenance for links .', u'This article discusses the need for self-describing linked data .']

entities: [[(u'product knowledge management', u'Method'), (u'ontological characterisation of engineering features', u'Task'), (u'feature-based models', u'Method'), (u'disparate application tasks', u'Task'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain entities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'product knowledge representation', u'Method')], [(u'physical layouts of material products', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'form feature', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'engineering conceptualisations', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'ontological foundations', u'USED-FOR', u'product knowledge management'), (u'feature-based models', u'USED-FOR', u'disparate application tasks')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'product knowledge representation')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The work presented in the thesis strives from the need of providing ontological foundations for product knowledge management ; in particular , it provides an ontological characterisation of engineering features on the grounds of foundational theories of ontology engineering. # R # # N # Inasmuch as feature-based models are employed for disparate application tasks , on the one side we develop a high-level understanding of features by distinguishing the domain entities that are modelled in their terms .', u'In this manner , we aim at an ontology that is not strictly committed to specific application requirements but it is broadly applicable to product knowledge representation .', u'On the other hand , we focus on the representation of ( some aspects of ) the physical layouts of material products .', u'The notion of form feature plays a relevant role in this context and attention will be paid in the different ways in which it can be understood and represented according to engineering conceptualisations .']

sentences: [u'While the general analysis of named entities has received substantial research attention , the analysis of relations over named entities has not .', u'In fact , a review of the literature on unstructured as well as structured data revealed a deficiency in research on the abstract conceptualization required to organize relations .', u'We believe that such an abstract conceptualization can benefit various communities and applications such as natural language processing , information extraction , machine learning and ontology engineering .', u"In this paper , we present CEVO ( i.e. , a Comprehensive EVent Ontology ) built on Levin 's conceptual hierarchy of English verbs that categorizes verbs with the shared meaning and syntactic behavior .", u'We present the fundamental concepts and requirements for this ontology .', u'Furthermore , we present three use cases for demonstrating the benefits of this ontology on annotation tasks : 1 ) annotating relations in plain text , 2 ) annotating ontological properties and 3 ) linking textual relations to ontological properties .']

entities: [[(u'integrity constraint validation', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'Method'), (u'expressive description logics', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'integrity constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology data', u'Material')], [(u'integrity constraint validation', u'Method'), (u'conjunctive query answering', u'Task'), (u'integrity constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'tableau algorithm', u'Method'), (u'reasoning systems', u'Method')], [(u'ontology data set', u'Material'), (u'reasoning systems', u'Method'), (u'real-life ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'modularization', u'Method'), (u'terminologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'integrity constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'integrity constraint validation', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'integrity constraint validation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology'), (u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'legal states of ontology data')], [(u'integrity constraint validation', u'USED-FOR', u'conjunctive query answering'), (u'tableau algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology knowledge base')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'In the last years , integrity constraint validation over the ontology with expressive description logics is a prominent reasoning service in ontology engineering , as integrity constraints are added into the ontology to guarantee the legal states of ontology data .', u'The integrity constraint validation can be converted into the conjunctive query answering , we thus check the satisfaction of integrity constraints in ontology knowledge base based on the tableau algorithm and further use the existing reasoning systems .', u'With the increase of the ontology data set , however , these reasoning systems reveal the bad performance in real-life ontologies .', u'In order to reduce the amount of information that must be taken into account , we apply the idea of modularization to break down the terminologies and assertions with respect to integrity constraints , and get smaller chunks for them .', u'The empirical results are presented to demonstrate the high efficiency and an improvement of integrity constraint validation .']

entities: [[(u'text understanding', u'Task'), (u'document vectorization', u'Task'), (u'text mining', u'Task'), (u'semi-automated ontology extension', u'Task'), (u'documents', u'Material'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'domain-specific texts', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'task', u'Generic')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'term clustering method', u'Method'), (u'human overhead', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'postprocessing phase', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'hierarchically organized output', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Bisecting K-Means', u'Method')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'K-Means', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'document vectorization', u'PART-OF', u'text understanding'), (u'document vectorization', u'USED-FOR', u'text mining'), (u'document vectorization', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semi-automated ontology extension'), (u'text mining', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semi-automated ontology extension'), (u'semi-automated ontology extension', u'PART-OF', u'text understanding'), (u'documents', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology engineering')], [], [(u'approach', u'COMPARE', u'term clustering method')], [], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'K-Means'), (u'gold standards', u'USED-FOR', u'K-Means')]]
sentences: [u'The discovery of semantically associated groups of terms is important for many applications of text understanding , including document vectorization for text mining , semi-automated ontology extension from documents and ontology engineering with help of domain-specific texts .', u'In [ 3 ] , we have proposed a method for the discovery of such terms and shown that its performance is superior to other methods for the same task .', u"However , we have observed that ( a ) the approach is sensitive to the term clustering method and ( b ) the performance improves with the size of the results'list , thus incurring higher human overhead in the postprocessing phase .", u'In this study , we address these issues by proposing the delivery of a hierarchically organized output , computed with Bisecting K-Means .', u'We compared the results of the new algorithm with those delivered by the original method , which used K-Means using two ontologies as gold standards .']

sentences: [u'In this paper , we describe our work on developing a model and method for extracting key entities from the online social messages regarding emergent events for enhancing ontology engineering , enabling a sensible solution for prevention of similar disasters .', u'Our work started with the development of an event modelling system using a data-cluster slicing approach , which combines analytics of social data and event lifecycle algorithms , allowing for large-scale emerging novel events to be quickly and accurately analyzed .', u'Subsequently , our system computes the energy of each collected event data sets , and then encapsulates ranked temporal , spatial and topical keywords into a structured node for event-entity extraction , in order to update event ontologies for fast response of emergent events .', u'The preliminary experimental results demonstrate that our developed system is workable , allowing for prediction of possible evolution and early warning of critical incidents with a support of dynamic entity extraction .']

sentences: [u'Ontology evaluation refers to the activity of checking the technical quality of an ontology against a frame of reference .', u'As such , it is of core importance for ontology engineering supporting scenarios such as ontology validation , knowledge selection , or the evaluation of knowledge extraction algorithms .', u'In this chapter , we provide methodological guidelines for evaluating stand-alone ontologies as well as ontology networks .', u'Our goal is not only to present the NeOn perspective on this issue but to also provide a practical outlook to the vast area of work in the area of ontology evaluation .', u'Without performing an extensive state-of-the-art analysis of this research field , we aim to illustrate how various evaluation methods developed by the NeOn project , and not only , can be used at different stages of the evaluation process .', u'We conclude the chapter with some concrete examples of performing ontology evaluation .']

sentences: [u'In the recent past , domain specific solutions for detailed semantic analysis have got acceptable by natural language processing community and use of applications involving natural language based user interface .', u'Different approaches that has been previously used is focusing on quality of text and improving the text contents by adding semantic information with text then the existing approaches used for semantic analysis can provide better results .', u'In this , an approach was presented to address the problem of non- availability of semantic information required for better semantic analysis .', u'This problem is solved by using semantic technology to annotate text of software requirements expressed in a natural language with their domain specific semantics and investigate the effect of semantic analysis with attached semantics .', u'The presented approach uses a semantic framework specifically designed for interpretation and detailed semantic analysis of natural language software requirement specifications .', u'The used framework is based on semantic technology involves knowledge extracted from existing software requirement documents and knowledge extracted from existing applications .', u'The presented approach shows that by adapting and combing existing ontologies to support knowledge management , developing system and performing experiments on requirement of real world software systems .', u'In this approach start with software requirement specification , after this clean the irrelevant requirements , convert the cleaned requirements into graph that represents inter related different elements .', u'Represent the requirement graph into sparse matrix , after these all steps ; we generate ontology with the help of OntoGen tool .']

sentences: [u'The Web has revolutionized the way we seek information on all aspects of education , entertainment , business , health and so on .', u'The Web has evolved into a publishing medium , global electronic market and increasingly , a platform for conducting electronic commerce .', u'A part of this success can be attributed to the tremendous advances made in the Artificial Intelligence field .', u'The popularity of the Web has opened many opportunities to develop smart Web-based systems using artificial intelligence techniques .', u'# R # # N # # R # # N # There exist numerous Web technology and applications that can benefit with the application of artificial intelligence techniques .', u'It is not possible to cover them all in one book with a required degree of quality , depth and width .', u'We present this book to discuss some important Web developments by using artificial intelligence techniques in the areas of Web personalisation , semantic Web and Web services. # R # # N # # R # # N # Chapter 1 will introduce the different topics discussed in this book .', u'Chapter 2 will discuss a broad overview of these Web developments that are evolved with artificial intelligence techniques to improve the Web functionality .', u'Chapters 3 , 4 and 5 discuss the problems and advancements in Personalisation in the areas of the Web personalisation with user profiles , the personalisation of Web contents in mobile devices and the personalisation of Web services respectively .', u'Chapters 6 and 7 discuss the problems of intelligently composing and discovering appropriate Web services respectively .', u'Chapters 8 and 9 will cover the issue of semantic operability problem in Semantic Web by discussing the various concepts of meta in computing and advancements in Emergent Semantics respectively .', u'Chapter 10 presents a smart Web-based system by discussing an intelligent tutoring system based on Bayesian networks .', u'Finally , chapter 11 draws the similarity and distinction between various Web-based collective decision-making systems such as recommender system , folksonmy , document ranking , etc. # R # # N # # R # # N # The primary readers of this book are undergraduate/postgraduate students , researchers and practitioners in information technology and computer science related areas .']

sentences: [u'Abstract : The semantic web movement has grown around the need to add semantics to the web in order to make it more usable # R # # N # by people and by information systems .', u'In this paper I argue that even more important than semantics is pragmatics ; # R # # N # that is , to really enhance web usability it is critical to capture and react to aspects of the end use context .', u"# R # # N # Most centrally , to make the web truly responsive to human needs , we need to understand the `` users '' of the web and their purposes for using it .", u'# R # # N # In this paper I elaborate this argument in the context of of e-learning systems .', u'# R # # N # I propose an approach to the design of e-learning systems that I call the ecological approach .', u'# R # # N # Moving from the open web to repositories of learning objects , I show how the ecological approach shows promise not only to # R # # N # allow information about learners actual interactions with learning objects to be naturally captured but also to allow # R # # N # it to be used in a multitude of ways to support learners and teachers in achieving their goals .', u'# R # # N # In a phrase , the approach involves attaching models of learners to the learning objects they interact with , # R # # N # and then mining these models for patterns that are useful for various purposes .', u'# R # # N # The ecological approach turns out to be highly suited to e-learning applications .', u'# R # # N # It also has interesting implications for e-learning research , and perhaps even for research directions for semantic web research .', u"# R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # Invited Commentary : < a class= '' rel commentary '' href= '' /2004/7/ramondt '' # R # # N # > Ramondt , L. , Smith , T and Bradshaw , P. ( 2004 ) Commentary on : McCalla , G. ( 2004 ) .", u'The Ecological Approach to the Design of E-Learning Environments : Purpose-based Capture and Use of Information About Learners [ PDF ] # R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # Editors : Terry Anderson and Denise Whitelock .']

sentences: [u'This thesis aims at addressing a major issue in Semantic Web and organisational Knowledge Management : consuming large scale semantic data in a generic , scalable and pleasing manner .', u'It proposes two solutions by de-constructing the issue into two sub problems : how can large semantic result sets be presented to users ; and how can large semantic datasets be explored and queried .', u'The first proposed solution is a dashboard-based multi-visualisation approach to present simultaneous views over different facets of the data .', u'Challenges imposed by existing technology infrastructure resulted in the development of a set of design guidelines .', u'These guidelines and lessons learnt from the development of the approach is the first contribution of this thesis .', u'# R # # N # # R # # N # The next stage of research initiated with the formulation of design principles from aesthetic design , Visual Analytics and Semantic Web principles derived from the literature .', u'These principles provide guidelines to developers for building generic visualisation solutions for large scale semantic data and constitute the next contribution of the thesis .', u'The second proposed solution is an interactive node-link visualisation approach that presents semantic concepts and their relations enriched with statistics of the underlying data .', u'This solution was developed with an explicit attention to the proposed design principles .', u'# R # # N # # R # # N # The two solutions exploit basic rules and templates to translate low level user interactions into high level intents , and subsequently into formal queries in a generic manner .', u'These translation rules and templates that enable generic exploration of large scale semantic data constitute the third contribution of the thesis .', u'An iterative User-Centered Design methodology , with the active participation of nearly a hundred users including knowledge workers , managers , engineers , researchers and students over the duration of the research was employed to develop both solutions .', u'The fourth contribution of this thesis is an argument for the continued active participation and involvement of all user communities to ensure the development of a highly effective , intuitive and appreciated solution .']

sentences: [u'Open innovation ( OI ) can be seen as systematically encouraging and exploring a wide range of internal and external sources for innovation opportunities , consciously integrating that exploration with firm capabilities # R # # N # and resources , and broadly exploiting those opportunities through multiple channels ( Cohen & Levinthal , 1990 ) .', u'In order to determine organizational competences or technological capabilities for open innovation , we explore # R # # N # the characteristics of open source software development projects as successful examples how organizations can enhance their businesses by using the ideas of open innovation .', u'Hafkesbrink & Schroll , 2009 , clustered # R # # N # organizational competences for open innovation in digital economy in three dimensions of : organizational readiness , collaborative capabilities and absorptive capacities .', u'As a backbone of each of these dimensions appear the technological enhancement and existing of adequate collaboration and communication tools .', u'One of the main benefits of the Semantic Web ( SW ) approach is the ability to # R # # N # model a knowledge structure using ontology as the starting point .', u'Ontologies are highly suitable to represent consensus knowledge and its structure .', u'This is exactly what is needed to exchange information within a community of interest and to enable automated processing of information items. # R # # N # SW technologies have the potential to improve information processing and knowledge sharing , increasing the quality of current applications and providing more sophisticated features for end users , but most of these theoretical advantages are not easily exploitable by real world applications ( Lara et all , 2002 ) .', u'In this article we explore possibilities of semantic web infrastructure development to support organizational competences for open innovation .', u'The # R # # N # idea is not new and it seems that the SW is very suitable for OI infrastructure requirements , but both disciplines recorded a decade of development without significant mutual application of research results .', u'In order to identify the # R # # N # obstacles to intensive common development , we made the SWOT analysis for introduction of SW technologies in this stage of development as a main infrastructure for open innovation organization .']

sentences: [u"The Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence , in cooperation with Stanford University 's Department of Computer Science , was pleased to present the 2009 Spring Symposium Series , held Monday through Wednesday , March 2325 , 2009 at Stanford University .", u'The titles of the nine symposia were Agents that Learn from Human Teachers , Benchmarking of Qualitative Spatial and Temporal Reasoning Systems , Experimental Design for Real-World Systems , Human Behavior Modeling , Intelligent Event Processing , Intelligent Narrative Technologies II , Learning by Reading and Learning to Read , Social Semantic Web : Where Web 2.0 Meets Web 3.0 , and Technosocial Predictive Analytics .', u'The goal of the Agents that Learn from Human Teachers was to investigate how we can enable software and robotics agents to learn from real-time interaction with an everyday human partner .', u'The aim of the Benchmarking of Qualitative Spatial and Temporal Reasoning Systems symposium was to initiate the development of a problem repository in the field of qualitative spatial and temporal reasoning and identify a graded set of challenges for future midterm and long-term research .', u'The Experimental Design symposium discussed the challenges of evaluating AI systems .', u'The Human Behavior Modeling symposium explored reasoning methods for understanding various aspects of human behavior , especially in the context of designing intelligent systems that interact with humans .', u'The Intelligent Event Processing symposium discussed the need for more AI-based approaches in event processing and defined a kind of research agenda for the field , coined as intelligent complex event processing ( iCEP ) .', u'The Intelligent Narrative Technologies II AAAI symposium discussed innovations , progress , and novel techniques in the research domain .', u'The Learning by Reading and Learning to Read symposium explored two aspects of making natural language texts semantically accessible to , and processable by , machines .', u'The Social Semantic Web symposium focused on the real-world grand challenges in this area .', u'Finally , the Technosocial Predictive Analytics symposium explored new methods for anticipatory analytical thinking that provide decision advantage through the integration of human and physical models .']

sentences: [u'The last 20 years of advancement in sequencing technologies have led to sequencing thousands of microbial genomes , creating mountains of genetic data .', u'While efficiency in generating the data improves almost daily , applying meaningful relationships between taxonomic and genetic entities on this scale requires a structured and integrative approach .', u'Currently , knowledge is distributed across a fragmented landscape of resources from government-funded institutions such as National Center for Biotechnology Information ( NCBI ) and UniProt to topic-focused databases like the ODB3 database of prokaryotic operons , to the supplemental table of a primary publication .', u'A major drawback to large scale , expert-curated databases is the expense of maintaining and extending them over time .', u'No entity apart from a major institution with stable long-term funding can consider this , and their scope is limited considering the magnitude of microbial data being generated daily .', u'Wikidata is an openly editable , semantic web compatible framework for knowledge representation .', u'It is a project of the Wikimedia Foundation and offers knowledge integration capabilities ideally suited to the challenge of representing the exploding body of information about microbial genomics .', u'We are developing a microbial specific data model , based on Wikidatas semantic web compatibility , which represents bacterial species , strains and the gene and gene products that define them .', u'Currently , we have loaded 43 694 gene and 37 966 protein items for 21 species of bacteria , including the human pathogenic bacteria Chlamydia trachomatis .', u'Using this pathogen as an example , we explore complex interactions between the pathogen , its host , associated genes , other microbes , disease and drugs using the Wikidata SPARQL endpoint .', u'In our next phase of development , we will add another 99 bacterial genomes and their gene and gene products , totaling 900,000 additional entities .', u'This aggregation of knowledge will be a platform for community-driven collaboration , allowing the networking of microbial genetic data through the sharing of knowledge by both the data and domain expert .']

sentences: [u'This multidisciplinary conference provides a unique opportunity to underline the linkage between policy and technology .', u'There are many evidences that technology may not be politically neutral , and conversely that specific policy frameworks are not technology neutral .', u'P2P technology revolutionized access to digital content for information and recreation , facing policy makers with two options : repression within a rigid legal framework or trying to find new ways so that content creators may receive a fair financial contribution .', u'A global patronage scheme ( http : //globalpatronage.org ) is being proposed .', u'In the case of scientific information , the WSIS ( http : //www.wsis.org ) recommended the use of P2P , but the paradox is that the reflection of this advance in national laws and in daily scholarly practice has been slow .', u'Concerning Free Software , if access and modification to computer code is considered as an essential expression of human freedom and accepted as a matter of public policy , the consequences in terms of software development are staggering , and in our opinion , quite beneficial .', u'Concerning Internet Governance , it is clear that the current plagues of the Internet : intrusion , phishing , DOS , spams , worms , viruses , etc ... are not going to be cured any time soon , because of political considerations over who is going to take the leading managerial role in implementing policies .', u'It is our analysis that the semantic web , much heralded as the second generation of the web , has failed to take off because of an unsuitable policy framework .', u'We present a proposal : the Semantic Web gTLDs ( http : //semantic.cc ) .', u'Crucial policy decisions have been taken , are taken , and will be taken , in the shadow , concerning emerging technologies such as Digital Object Identifiers ( DOI ) and Object Naming Service ( ONS ) that provides a linkage between RFIDs and Internet resources .', u'It is unclear if these issues are going to be discussed in Rio at the next meeting of The Internet Governance Forum ( http : //www.intgovforum.org ) which felt short so far to fulfill its WSIS mandate .', u'As a conclusion , too many scientists and technologists underestimate the importance of policy frameworks and are not participating enough in their determinations .']

sentences: [u'This dissertation studies the inference problem in the context of Semantic Web and proposes the design and implementation of a security framework to detect and prevent unwanted inferences .', u'The proposed security solution has two main functionalities : prevent undesired inferences via XML query answers , and detect undesired inferences via correlating public domain information .', u'The undesired inference via XML query answers violates data confidentiality requirement by disclosing unauthorized XML document structure .', u'The undesired inference via public domain information violates data confidentiality requirement by correlating related public data to disclose unauthorized information .', u'# R # # N # There is a separate module for each function of the security engine : the data access control module and the global data privacy control module .', u'The data access control module provides access to the XML database using secure and semantically consistent partial views .', u'The views are constructed by changing the structure of the XML document to remove vulnerabilities to undesired inferences .', u'The changes in the XML structure are guided by metadata representing semantic data correlations .', u'# R # # N # The module for global data privacy control places the XML document in the context of public information selected from the same knowledge domain .', u'The security engine performs two inference procedures to detect inference channels that lead from the public information to the protected data within an organization .', u'The inference procedures detect conflicting security classifications from ( 1 ) semantically similar replicated information , and ( 2 ) semantically similar replicated data correlations .', u'An ontology concept hierarchy defines the metadata that guides the inference process .', u'The data inference from the replicated and correlated data inference procedures is formalized in Prolog .', u'The Prolog knowledge base is a representation of the XML documents and the associated ontology .', u'# R # # N # This research is the first step towards developing security mechanisms to protect semantically enhanced , distributed information from indirect disclosure .', u'In the Semantic Web , the ontologies provide the conceptualization for the external knowledge modeling to prevent inference channels that violate the privacy of protected data .']

sentences: [u'ABSTRACT An important step of Web service Application is the discovery of useful services .', u'Keywords are used in service discovery in traditional technology like UDDI and WSDL , with the disadvantage of user inte rvention , lack of semantic description and low accuracy .', u'To cope with these problems , OWL-S is introduced and extended with QoS attributes to describe the attribute and functions of Web Services .', u'A three-level service matching algorithm based on ontology and QOS in proposed in this paper .', u'Our algorithm can match web service by utilizing the service profile , QoS parameters together with input and output of the service .', u'Simulation results shows that it greatly enhanced the speed of service matching while high accuracy is also guaranteed .', u'Keywords- Web Service ; service discovery ; ontology ; OWL-S 1 .', u'I NTRODUCTION Web service is a distributed computational model with the character of self-contented and self-describing , its advantages include across-platform , acros s-language , code reusable , interoperability and security issue [ 1 ] .', u'However there is still some challenges remain unresolved in web service application : unable to describe the target service to be searched exactly , unable to measure the matching level between candidate service and target service .', u'To cope with these problems , semantic information and onto logy is introduced in recent web service discovery technology to achieve the automation and intelligence .', u'How to match these semantic information and ontology effectively is a new challenge .', u'Semantic Web is a extending of current web , the difference lies on that the semanteme of information can be well defined under semantic web environments , make the information on web understandable to machine to achieve automatic handling [ 2 ] .', u'Extended ontology web language for service ( OWL-S ) and field ontology are used in this paper to describe service announcement and service request , a three-level service matching algorithm based on ontology and QOS is proposed in this paper [ 3 ] .', u'Accuracy and speed is gu aranteed in our scalable service discovery model , Our model can also support dynamic web service assemble process efficiently .']

sentences: [u'Ontologies are the most important construct of the Semantic Web .', u'From the first attempt of using simplified RDF syntax to the advanced features of the OWL languages , ontologies have arisen as the most viable technology offering solutions to integrate various Web resources into a more intelligent Web .', u'The work presented in this thesis is a contribution to the new generation of the Web , which should be readable and interpreted not only by humans but also by machines , such as software agents .', u"In order to allow ontologies to achieve their role of `` animating '' the traditional Web into this next generation Web , it is essential to find an efficient way to map all existent Web resources onto their corresponding ontology classes .", u'In this thesis , we propose an approach for automatic semantic annotation of Web documents which is an effective way to make the Semantic Web a reality .', u'Such an integrated Web would greatly improve the accuracy of search engines , bring a new generation of intelligent Web services , push the limits of multi-agent technologies and improve many other areas of human activity that we can not even imagine today .', u'Considering the size and the speed of the growing Web , it is clear that this task can not be achieved manually .', u'Semi-automatic and automatic annotations of Web documents using statistical text classification methods seem to be the most promising solution .', u'This work is focused on an approach based on Naive Bayes text classification adapted to some characteristics that are particular to Web documents .', u'A complete software solution is developed to allow testing feasibility of such an approach .', u'Furthermore , different variations of the text classification algorithms are tested and analysed in order to identify the most optimal approach to semantically annotate Web documents .', u'Notably , the usage of Web documents hierarchy is explored as an option to improve the accuracy of semi-automatic and automatic annotations of Web documents .', u'The results of each tested method are presented and commented .', u'Finally , some aspects that could possibly be improved or approached in a different way are identified for future work .']

sentences: [u'Web 2.0 sociable technologies and social software are presented as enablers in health and health care , for organizations , clinicians , patients and laypersons .', u'They include social networking services , collaborative filtering , social bookmarking , folksonomies , social search engines , file sharing and tagging , mashups , instant messaging , and online multi-player games .', u'The more popular Web 2.0 applications in education , namely wikis , blogs and podcasts , are but the tip of the social software iceberg .', u'Web 2.0 technologies represent a quite revolutionary way of managing and repurposing/remixing online information and knowledge repositories , including clinical and research information , in comparison with the traditional Web 1.0 model .', u'The paper also offers a glimpse of future software , touching on Web 3.0 ( the Semantic Web ) and how it could be combined with Web 2.0 to produce the ultimate architecture of participation .', u'Although the tools presented in this review look very promising and potentially fit for purpose in many health care applications and scenarios , careful thinking , testing and evaluation research are still needed in order to establish best practice models for leveraging these emerging technologies to boost our teaching and learning productivity , foster stronger communities of practice , and support continuing medical education/professional development ( CME/CPD ) and patient education .', u'Background The early World Wide Web ( Web 1.0 ) has demonstrated powerful capability to connect clinicians , patients and materials .', u'In this paper , we explore how this connective matrix may further grow through the impact of the democratic and social nature of Web 2.0 .', u'We discuss its application to education within a health and health care context and outline some of the social webs key features .', u'We compare Web 2.0 with Web 1.0 , and look forward to the arrival of Web 3.0the Semantic Web .', u'Throughout , we provide documented uses of social software such as wikis , blogs , social tagging , and emerging uses of social technology such as collaborative writing , aggregative content management , RSS ( Really Simple Syndication ) feeds and podcasting in health care contexts .']

sentences: [u'As the growing of 3D Virtual Globe , it has become a popular geospatial information browser , and has been successfully applied in vast of field.However , its application in marine information still exists lot of problems such as low-level application and lack of supports from basic theory and key technology related with marine field.So in this paper , it mainly analyzes its applicability in marine information and researches in its technical roadmap to its application in marine information and the prototype system.Firstly , it reviews the problem and historical reason that exist in its application in marine , points out the advantages which show great potential for its application , also points out the challenges ahead , to which , much attention need to be paid.Secondly , based on the comprehensive analysis of the applicability , it researches into the front technologies in 3D virtual marine and the prototype realization.By taking advantage of technology of the state-of-art such as grid and semantic web , it initiates a strategy of divide and rule that deal with the front end and back end differently to realize the prototype for Digital Ocean in full use of GIS , virtual reality , grid , and semantic web technology.Finally , under the guidance of such technical strategy , a SOA-based multi-layer prototype system ( VRMarine ) was realized by taking full use of several key technologies such as multi-source marine environmental data exchanging based on XML , service encapsulation and publishing mechanism of marine environmental information , and virtual organization of marine environmental information service and remote visualization.VRMarine not only can reappear the realistic three dimensional scene of marine environment by integrating multi-source of marine geo-information services , but also can support high dimensional spatiotemporal analysis by dynamically integrating of kinds of functional service.Its success tested the feasibility and efficiency of the strategy proposed in previous and also exposed the deficiency in the semantics utilization which is of great significance to the future development of 3D Virtual Globe and the construction of Digital Ocean and will be researched in future .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'Die Politik begreift allmahlich', u'CONJUNCTION', u'welche Chancen fur Wirtschaft')], [], [], [], [], [], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'knowledge', u'CONJUNCTION', u'social media')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Die Informationsgesellschaft und die Politik stehen in zunehmend enger Wechselwirkung zueinander .', u'Das Internet ist Ausloser und Katalysator dieses Zusammenspiels .', u'Die Politik begreift allmahlich , welche Chancen fur Wirtschaft , Bildung und soziale Entwicklung die raumlich unbeschrankte und zeitlich unmittelbare Kommunikation bietet und vor welche Herausforderungen sie uns stellt .', u'Sie sucht nach Losungen , um diese Potentiale fur die wirtschaftliche Entwicklung und eine effektive Verwaltung zu nutzen und zu entwickeln .', u'Umgekehrt verandert der Zugang zu Daten , Information , Wissen und sozialen Netzwerken nicht nur die Offentlichkeit , sondern auch Politik und das Verhaltnis des Burgers zum Staat .', u'Open Government , Open Data und Partizipation des informierten Burgers sind Stichworte fur die geforderte proaktive Transparenzpolitik des Staates , mit der sich auch das Verhaltnis von Staat und Burger verandert .', u'Das Semantic Web eroffnet neue Dimensionen des Zugangs zum Wissen .', u'Grenzen der neuen Offenheit sind durch die grundrechtlichen Anspruche des Datenschutzes gesetzt .', u'Sie mussen global bestimmt werden .', u'Was als Global Privacy Governance zu konzeptualisieren ist , erscheint als ein weiteres Symptom fur den zunehmenden Wandel , dem die Informationsgesellschaft selbst unterliegt.The Information Society and politics influence each other .', u'The Internet sparks and catalyzes this interplay .', u'Political actors are acknowledging the chances that a communication without boundaries and in real time can offer to the economy , education , and social development , but also the challenges that come with it .', u'They are looking for solutions that allow the economy and the administration to take advantage from such potential .', u'Conversely , access to information , knowledge and social media does not only change the public sphere but also politics as well as the relationship between citizen and the state .', u'Open government , open data and participation of the informed citizen are the keywords for the necessary , proactive transparency policy of the state .', u'The semantic web thereby opens new dimensions .', u'It also becomes clear that the debates related to the new regulation on data protection can not disregard the global perspective .', u'What can be conceptualized so far as Global Privacy Governance , seems to constitute a symptom for change that the information society is currently undergoing .']

sentences: [u'This thesis addresses the problem of data integration and interoperation of large-scale , widely distributed and independently maintained data , focusing on biological proteomics data which exemplifies the problem and has a practical need for better interoperation , and shows how such integrated data can be leveraged for important applications such as detailed cross-database queries in support of scientific exploratory data analysis and enhanced information retrieval .', u'Semantic web RDF and RDF databases , which fit the problem well , are used to build two biological data integration systems called YeastHub and LinkHub .', u'YeastHub is a lightweight semantic web data warehouse of joined RDF-formatted biological ( yeast ) data and allows RDF query access to it .', u"LinkHub focuses on a high-level structuring principal or `` scaffold '' for biological data , storing biological identifiers ( e.g .", u'for proteins , genes , etc . )', u'and the complex relationships among them as a large RDF directed labeled graph ; LinkHub is used through web interactive and query interfaces and also complements YeastHub .', u"Through several nontrivial RDF queries of the joined YeastHub and LinkHub data , we demonstrate that practical integrated biological data analysis can be achieved by basic , lightweight methods which do n't attempt to solve the complete integration problem .", u'# R # # N # A key focus of the LinkHub system is support for enhanced information retrieval of web documents and articles from the biomedical scientific literature ( PubMed ) .', u"We attach documents to identifier nodes in the LinkHub RDF graph and provide for the flexible retrieval of the documents through queries of the RDF graph 's relational structure .", u'In addition , we use the LinkHub RDF relational data and attached documents as training sets to construct classifiers for document relevance ranking in support of enhanced automated information retrieval of web or biomedical scientific literature documents related to biological identifiers .', u'The results of experiments done to empirically measure the performance of this enhanced automated information retrieval for proteomics ( UniProt ) identifier-related documents through the use of a manually curated bibliography of yeast protein-specific literature citations are presented .']

sentences: [u'As the number of available Web pages grows ; it is become more difficult for users finding documents relevant to their interests .', u'Clustering is the classification of a data set into subsets ( clusters ) , so that the data in each subset ( ideally ) share some common trait - often proximity according to some defined distance measure .', u'Because of the short lengths of queries , approaches based on keywords are not suitable for document clustering .', u'This paper describes a new Web Document Clustering method that makes use of user logs which allow identifying the documents the users have selected for a query .', u'The similarity between two queries may be deduced from the common documents the users selected for them .', u'This research paper show that a combination of both content based and session based clustering ( 1 ) is better than using either method alone .', u'The clustered documents are arranged based on V-Ranking .', u'In this research work , it has been proposed to display the result in visual mode of semantic search engine using V ( Visual ) - Ranking algorithm and bookshelf data structure .', u'This paper proposes a semantic web search results in visualize web graphs , representations of web structure overlaid with information and pattern tiers by providing the viewer with a qualitative understanding of the information contents .', u'for a search engine , of session based clustering .', u'In this paper it is proposed a clustering based approach to support the comprehension of web applications .', u"The approach is based on a clustering process that first computes the dissimilarity between the web pages using Latent Semantic Indexing , a well known information retrieval technique , and then group 's similar pages .", u'To automate the clustering process a prototype has been also implemented .', u'The results obtained by applying the different clustering algorithms on the static pages of three web applications developed using JSP technology .', u'Documents clustered based on both content based and session based clustering are ordered based on V-Ranking .', u'It is named so because the ordered documents are arranged in the shelf of book shelf data structure.Finallly the web search result is executed in visual mode .', u'So , the ranking algorithm is named as visual ranking .', u'The main focus of this paper is the processing of the results coming from an information retrieval system .', u'Although the relevance depends on the results quality , the effectiveness of the results processing represents an alternative way to improve the relevance for the user .', u'Given the current expectations this processing is composed by an organization step and a visualization step .', u'Then the proposed approach organizes the results according to their meaning using a Bookshelf Data Structure , and visualizes ( 2 ) them in a 3D scene to increase the representation space .', u'This paper deals with the processing of query results .', u'This processing , still neglected in some information retrieval systems , is becoming more and more important and essential .', u'The two main points to reach this goal are a good document organization and an effective visualization .', u'Concerning these two aspects , the main directions of this paper are a Clustering method and a 3D visualization .']

sentences: [u'Providing integrated access to data distributed over Linked Data Federations has become a major research challenge , mainly due to heterogeneity problems .', u'In such context , this work proposes a solution for query decomposition over Linked Data Federations , i.e. , sets of RDF data sources published according to the principles of Linked Data .', u'Our main contribution lies in the definition and implementation of a query decomposition process , considering that the data sources have structurally distinct ontologies , which describe their schemas .', u'In order to evaluate the proposed approach , a prototype was implemented and some experiments were performed .']

sentences: [u'In current data marketplace , multidimensional data cubes become isolated bits of information in lack of a comprehensive semantic relationship among their datasets .', u'To facilitate the exploration and discovery possible semantic heterogeneity among linked data cubes , Semantic Cubing Platform has been studied .', u'First , linked data marts and their data cubes have been specified by using the Federated Data warehousing Application ( FDWA ) framework and the Collective Cubing platform , which have been introduced in our previous literatures .', u'Hereafter , Metacube Services have been proposed as a middle-layer to enable interoperability analysis among linked data cubes .']

sentences: [u'The Linked Data cloud is an enormous repository of data , but it is difficult for users to find relevant data and integrate it into their datasets .', u"Users can navigate datasets in the Linked Data cloud with ontologies , but they lack detailed characterization of datasets ' contents .", u'We present an approach that leverages r2rml mappings to characterize datasets .', u'Our demonstration shows how users can easily create r2rml mappings for their datasets and then use these mappings to find data from the Linked Data cloud and integrate it into their datasets .']

sentences: [u'a new system increases efficiency by integrating Linked Data streams generated from data collectors and disseminating matched data to relevant data consumers , based on user queries .', u'The data structure , called TP-automata , suits the needs of high-performance Linked Data stream dissemination .', u'Here , the authors use a real-world dataset generated in a Smart Building IoT Project to evaluate the system .', u'Results show that the system can disseminate Linked Data Streams at one million triples per second with 100,000 registered user queries , which is several orders of magnitude faster than existing techniques .']

entities: [[(u'user privacy challenges', u'Task'), (u'personal data', u'Material')], [(u'GetThere', u'Method'), (u'passenger information system', u'Method'), (u'personal data', u'Material'), (u'data environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user privacy', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'researchers', u'Material'), (u'ethics committees', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'This paper reports the results of a study investigating the user privacy challenges when personal data is published within linked data environments .', u'Motivated by GetThere , a passenger information system that crowdsources transport information from users ( including personal data , such as their location ) , four scenarios are outlined that illustrate how linked data environments can impact upon user privacy .', u'The responsibilities of key stakeholders , including researchers , ethics committees , and the linked data community are also discussed , along with a set of guidelines designed to raise awareness of these risks and how to reduce them .']

sentences: [u"The Linked Data for Professional Education ( LD4PE ) project described in this poster is funded by the U.S. Institute for Museum and Library Services ( IMLS ) and intended to develop an `` Exploratorium '' referatory for Linked Data learning resources descriptions that map the resources to a competency index .", u'Development of the competency index and the supporting infrastructure including metadata editors are aspects of the project .', u"The poster describes the initial stages of the project 's technical architecture development and the conceptual basis and the conceptual design of the competency index as Linked Data ."]

sentences: [u'Linked Data provide many benefits to data consumers , but many publicly available datasets are still released in the Comma Separated Values ( CSV ) format , a ubiquitous common denominator .', u'We introduce a methodology to transform such datasets into Linked Data .', u'Our design is based on requirements identified while surveying existing governmental datasets released by data.gov .', u'We present an implementation-independent RDF vocabulary to describe how a CSV dataset should be promoted into Linked Data , and use a Java-based converter to produce 5.3 billion RDF triples from 312 data.gov datasets .']

entities: [[(u'Answering SPARQL queries', u'Task'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Approaches', u'Generic'), (u'distributed query processing', u'Method'), (u'delayed response times', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'indexing-based approaches', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Hybrid approaches', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'answering SPARQL queries', u'Task'), (u'fixed time constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SPARQL endpoints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web of Linked Data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Approaches', u'COMPARE', u'indexing-based approaches')], [], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'answering SPARQL queries'), (u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'SPARQL queries'), (u'SPARQL endpoints', u'USED-FOR', u'system')]]
sentences: [u'Answering SPARQL queries over the Web of Linked Data is a challenging problem .', u'Approaches based on distributed query processing provide up-to-date results but can suffer from delayed response times , indexing-based approaches provide fast response times but results can be out-of-date and the costs of indexing the growing Web of Linked Data are potentially huge .', u'Hybrid approaches try to offer the best of both .', u'In this demo paper we describe a system for answering SPARQL queries within fixed time constraints by accessing SPARQL endpoints and the Web of Linked Data directly .']

sentences: [u'In this paper , authors apply the Linked Data Design Issues to describe and retrieve information that is semantically related to open educational resources related to the Engineering Education , that are accessible via the OCW Higher Institutions .', u'Linked data have the potential of create bridges between OCW data silos .', u'To assess the impact of Linked Data in OCW , the authors present an interface of faceted search for open educational content .', u'The authors demonstrate that OCW resource metadata related to engineering open courses can be consumed and enriched using datasets hosted by the LinkedOpenData cloud .']

sentences: [u'Now that a huge amount of data is available in the Linked Data Cloud , providing techniques for its eective exploration is becoming more and more important .', u'In this paper , we propose aggregation and abstraction techniques for thematic exploration of linked data .', u'These techniques transform a basic , at view of a potentially large set of messy linked data for a given search target , into a high-level , thematic view called inCloud .', u'In an inCloud , thematic exploration is guided by few essentials auto-describing their prominence for the search target and by their reciprocal proximity relations .']

sentences: [u'In the context of exploratory OLAP , coupling the information wealth of linked data with the precision and detail of corporate data can greatly improve the effectiveness of the decision-making process .', u'In this paper we outline an approach that enables users to extend the hierarchies in their corporate cubes through a user-guided process that explores selected linked data and derives hierarchies from them .', u'This is done by identifying in the linked data the recurring modeling patterns that express roll-up relationships between RDF concepts and translating them into multidimensional knowledge .']

sentences: [u'This paper introduces a mediation architecture to help describing and consuming statistical data , exposed as RDF triples , but stored in relational databases .', u'The architecture features a catalogue of linked data cube descriptions , created according to the Linked Data principles .', u'The catalogue has a standardized description for each data cube actually stored in each statistical ( relational ) database known to the mediation environment .', u'The mediator offers an interface to browse the linked data cube descriptions and exports the data cubes as RDF triples , generated on demand from the underlying databases .']

sentences: [u'Background : Ontology Design Patterns ( ODPs ) are representational artifacts devised to offer solutions for recurring ontology design problems .', u'They promise to enhance the ontology building process in terms of flexibility , re-usability and expansion , and to make the result of ontology engineering more predictable .', u'In this paper , we analyze ODP repositories and investigate their relation with upper-level ontologies .', u'In particular , we compare the BioTop upper ontology to the Action ODP from the NeOn an ODP repository .', u'In view of the differences in the respective approaches , we investigate whether the Action ODP can be embedded into BioTop .', u'We demonstrate that this requires re-interpreting the meaning of classes of the NeOn Action ODP in the light of the precepts of realist ontologies .', u'Results : As a result , the re-design required clarifying the ontological commitment of the ODP classes by assigning them to top-level categories .', u'Thus , ambiguous definitions are avoided .', u'Classes of real entities are clearly distinguished from classes of information artifacts .', u'The proposed approach avoids the commitment to the existence of unclear future entities which underlies the NeOn Action ODP .', u'Our re-design is parsimonious in the sense that existing BioTop content proved to be largely sufficient to define the different types of actions and plans .', u'Conclusions : The proposed model demonstrates that an expressive upper-level ontology provides enough resources and expressivity to represent even complex ODPs , here shown with the different flavors of Action as proposed in the NeOn ODP .', u'The advantage of ODP inclusion into a top-level ontology is the given predetermined dependency of each class , an existing backbone structure and welldefined relations .', u'Our comparison shows that the use of some ODPs is more likely to cause problems for ontology developers , rather than to guide them .', u'Besides the structural properties , the explanation of classification results were particularly hard to grasp for self-sufficient ODPs as compared with implemented and embedded upper-level structures which , for example in the case of BioTop , offer a detailed description of classes and relations in an axiomatic network .', u'This ensures unambiguous interpretation and provides more concise constraints to leverage on in the ontology engineering process .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'real-world data', u'Material')], [], [(u'Data-as-a-Service approach', u'Method'), (u'warehousing and query federation', u'Method')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'warehousing', u'Method'), (u'fed- eration features', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'warehousing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'fed- eration features')]]
sentences: [u'Linked Data offers novel opportunities for aggregating infor- mation about a wide range of topics and for a multitude of applications .', u'While the technical specifications of Linked Data have been a major re- search undertaking for the last decade , there is still a lack of real-world data and applications exploiting this data .', u'Partly , this is due to the fact that datasets remain isolated from one another and their integration is a non-trivial task .', u'In this work , we argue for a Data-as-a-Service approach combining both warehousing and query federation to discover and con- sume Linked Data .', u'We compare our work to state-of-the-art approaches for discovering , integrating , and consuming Linked Data .', u'Moreover , we illustrate a number of challenges when combining warehousing with fed- eration features , and highlight key aspects of our research .']

entities: [[(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'classification', u'Task'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'PageRank', u'Material')], [(u'classification methods', u'Method'), (u'semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'DBpedia', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Feature selection method', u'Method'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'human readable and understandable form', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'PageRank', u'Method'), (u'generation phase', u'Task')], [(u'network relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'classification algorithms', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'In this article , we would like to present new approach to classification with Linked Data and PageRank .', u'Our research is focused on classification methods that are enhanced by semantic information .', u'The semantic information can be obtained from ontology or from Linked Data .', u'DBpedia was used as source of Linked Data in our case .', u'Feature selection method is semantically based so features can be recognized by nonprofessional users because they are in a human readable and understandable form .', u'PageRank is used during feature selection and generation phase for expansion of basic features into more general representatives .', u'It means that feature selection and processing is based on a network relations obtained from Linked Data .', u'The features can be used by standard classification algorithms .', u'We will present the promising preliminary results that show the easy applicability of this approach to different datasets .']
