sentences: [u'A domain expert can process heterogeneous data to make meaningful interpretations or predictions from the data .', u'For example , by looking at research papers and patent records , an expert can determine the maturity of an emerging technology and predict the geographic location ( s ) and time ( e.g. , in a certain year ) where and when the technology will be a success .', u'However , this is an expert- and manual-intensive task .', u'This paper presents an end-to-end system that integrates heterogeneous data sources into a knowledge graph in the RDF ( Resource Description Framework ) format using an ontology .', u'Then the user can easily query the knowledge graph to prepare the required data for different types of predictive analysis tools .', u'We show a case study of predicting the ( geographic ) center ( s ) of fuel cell technologies using data collected from public sources to demonstrate the feasibility of our system .', u'The system extracts , cleanses , and augments data from public sources including research papers and patent records .', u'Next , the system uses an ontology-based data integration method to generate knowledge graphs in the RDF format to enable users to switch quickly between machine learning models for predictive analytic tasks .', u'We tested the system using the Support Vector Machine and Multiple Hidden Markov Models and achieved 66.7 % and 83.3 % accuracy on the city and year levels of spatial and temporal resolutions , respectively .']

entities: [[(u'spatial decision support', u'Task'), (u're-usability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'inconsistent terminology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'weak conceptualization', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SDS Consortium', u'Method'), (u'SDS knowledge portal', u'Method')], [(u'SDS', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'GIScience', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'flexible schemata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fixed data structures', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'inconsistent terminology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'weak conceptualization')], [(u'SDS Consortium', u'USED-FOR', u'SDS knowledge portal')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Abstract # R # # N # # R # # N # Numerous systems and tools have been developed for spatial decision support ( SDS ) , but they generally suffer from a lack of re-usability , inconsistent terminology , and weak conceptualization .', u'We introduce a collaborative effort by the SDS Consortium to build a SDS knowledge portal .', u'We present the formal representation of knowledge about SDS , the various ontologies captured and made accessible by the portal , and the processes used to create them .', u'We describe the portal in action , and the ways in which users can search , browse , and make use of its content .', u'Finally , we discuss the lessons learned from this effort , and future development directions .', u'Our work demonstrates how ontologies and semantic technologies can support the documentation and retrieval of dynamic knowledge in GIScience by offering flexible schemata instead of fixed data structures .']

entities: [[(u'extension', u'Generic'), (u'Session Initiation Protocol ( SIP )', u'Method'), (u'contextualized service delivery', u'Task'), (u'service delivery platform', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'device specific multimedia delivery', u'Task')], [(u'SIP', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'service creation', u'Task')], [(u'Device specific multimedia delivery', u'Task'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'device descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method')], [(u'SIP extensions', u'Method'), (u'SIP Application Server', u'Method'), (u'SDP', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'IP Multimedia Subsystem', u'Task')], [(u'extensions', u'Generic'), (u'Android SIP client application', u'Method'), (u'device browser', u'Method'), (u'multimedia services', u'Task')], [(u'UA ) application', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'extension', u'USED-FOR', u'contextualized service delivery'), (u'Session Initiation Protocol ( SIP )', u'USED-FOR', u'contextualized service delivery')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'service creation')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'device descriptions')], [(u'SIP Application Server', u'USED-FOR', u'SIP extensions'), (u'SDP', u'PART-OF', u'IP Multimedia Subsystem')], [(u'Android SIP client application', u'USED-FOR', u'extensions')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper proposes an extension to Session Initiation Protocol ( SIP ) for contextualized service delivery in a service delivery platform ( SDP ) that enables device specific multimedia delivery .', u'SIP separates between session establishment and description and is thus , amenable to be extended for advanced implementations which make it an ideal platform for service creation .', u'Device specific multimedia delivery needs rich and flexible device descriptions , and our approach proposes advanced device descriptions through semantic technologies .', u'The proposed SIP extensions have been implemented on a SIP Application Server which functions as SDP in IP Multimedia Subsystem ( IMS ) .', u'The validation of the proposed extensions is shown through an Android SIP client application that acts as a device browser and recommender for different multimedia services to users .', u'An example device user agent ( UA ) application has also been implemented on a laptop .']

entities: [[(u'business process-oriented knowledge management techniques', u'Method')], [(u'scientific work processes', u'Method'), (u'techniques', u'Generic')], [(u'scientific work processes', u'Task'), (u'informal learning processes', u'Method'), (u'social interaction', u'Material')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'Knowledge-Added Process', u'Method')], [(u'models', u'Generic'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method')], [(u'social semantic desktop', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'scenarios', u'Generic'), (u'application domain rapid prototyping', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'social interaction', u'FEATURE-OF', u'informal learning processes')], [], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'methods')], []]
sentences: [u'At first glance , it seems to be quite surprising that so far traditional business process-oriented knowledge management techniques have not been transferred to research in order to improve the efficiency of scientific work on a larger scale .', u'But due to the high variability and unpredictability of scientific work processes , these techniques are not applicable .', u'In fact scientific work processes have to be understood as a network of informal learning processes with a high level of social interaction .', u'For this purpose , we have elaborated the model of a Knowledge-Added Process as a new paradigm of process-oriented support .', u'We are developing various models , methods , and tools on the basis of semantic technologies supporting this process .', u'These are bundled in a social semantic desktop and exemplified within three scenarios within the application domain rapid prototyping .']

sentences: [u'This paper proposes an ontology-enabled system for context management for smart environments .', u'Central to the system is ontological sensor modelling , which attaches metadata and meaning to sensor data , thus supporting data repurposing and high-level content recognition .', u'In addition , semantic sensor descriptions allow sensors to be automatically identified whenever they are put into an environment .', u'Based on this , a novel plug-n-measure data acquisition mechanism has been developed to automatically detect and recognise new devices and update the contextual data relating to these devices on a real-time basis .', u'The context management system has been developed based on the latest semantic technologies and deployed in an intelligent meeting room .', u'The paper describes an experiment and presents initial results , which has demonstrated that the system is working .']

entities: [[(u'analytics-based semantic relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'machine-based relevancy scoring operations', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'modeling relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'applied analytics', u'Method')], [(u'autonomous Directed Qualification of analytic-based relationships', u'Task'), (u'Prov-O Ontology', u'Method'), (u'W3C Recommendation', u'Method'), (u'relevancy ontology', u'Method'), (u'analytics terminology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantically referenced document', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concept', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'named graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'applied analytics', u'Method')], [(u'role', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'identity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'analytics-based metrics', u'Metric'), (u'semantically described documents', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'explicit and fully qualified relationships'), (u'Semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'modeling relationships')], [(u'Prov-O Ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'autonomous Directed Qualification of analytic-based relationships')], [], [(u'role', u'CONJUNCTION', u'identity'), (u'relevancy', u'CONJUNCTION', u'analytics-based metrics')]]
sentences: [u'Abstract : Successfully managing analytics-based semantic relationships and their provenance enables determinations of document importance and priority , furthering capabilities for machine-based relevancy scoring operations .', u'Semantic technologies are well suited for modeling explicit and fully qualified relationships but struggle with modeling relationships that are qualified in nature , or resultant from applied analytics .', u'Our work seeks to implement the autonomous Directed Qualification of analytic-based relationships by pairing the Prov-O Ontology ( W3C Recommendation ) with a relevancy ontology supporting analytics terminology .', u'This work results in the capability for any semantically referenced document , concept , or named graph to be associated with the results of applied analytics as Direct Qualification ( DQ ) modeled relational nodes .', u'This new capability will enable role , identity , or any other content-based measures of relevancy and analytics-based metrics for semantically described documents .']

entities: [[(u'sensors deployment', u'Task')], [(u'Smart city applications', u'Task'), (u'domain-specific problems', u'Task')], [(u'heterogeneous sensor data streams', u'Material')], [(u'domain-independent platform', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'sensor data streams', u'Material'), (u'smart city applications', u'Task')], [(u'ACEIS', u'Method'), (u'IoT streams', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic IoT stream descriptions', u'Method')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'semantic data streams', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'domain-independent platform'), (u'sensor data streams', u'CONJUNCTION', u'smart city applications')], [(u'ACEIS', u'USED-FOR', u'IoT streams'), (u'semantic IoT stream descriptions', u'USED-FOR', u'ACEIS')], [(u'semantic data streams', u'USED-FOR', u'It')]]
sentences: [u'With the growing popularity of Internet of Things ( IoT ) technologies and sensors deployment , more and more cities are leaning towards the initiative of smart cities .', u'Smart city applications are mostly developed with aims to solve domain-specific problems .', u'Hence , lacking the ability to automatically discover and integrate heterogeneous sensor data streams on the fly .', u'To provide a domain-independent platform and take full benefits from semantic technologies , in this paper we present an Automated Complex Event I mplementation System ( ACEIS ) , which serves as a middleware between sensor data streams and smart city applications .', u"ACEIS discovers and integrates IoT streams in urban infrastructures for users ' requirements expressed as complex event requests , based on semantic IoT stream descriptions .", u'It also processes complex event patterns on the fly using semantic data streams .']

entities: [[(u'automatic mechanism', u'Task'), (u'extracting knowledge', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'expandable query', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [], [(u'learning tasks', u'Task'), (u'constructed DSR graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic reasoning', u'Method')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'constructed DSR graph', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic reasoning'), (u'DSR graph', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic reasoning')], []]
sentences: [u'With the increasing volume of learning resources on the Web , the need for automatic mechanism for extracting knowledge has become more critical .', u'The aim of this paper is to propose an approach that can automatically construct directed semantic relationships between concepts to help teachers or students efficiently retrieve appropriate knowledge from the Web .', u'The most distinctive characteristic of this approach is its support for constructing with expandable query .', u'This characteristic addresses the problem of users with varying backgrounds .', u'Working with semantically similar expanded terms allows them to filter out irrelevant terms and focus on corresponding contexts .', u"In addition , we design two learning tasks to show that how this the constructed DSR graph can be used to scaffold students ' semantic reasoning .", u'The case study suggests relevant benefits of applying semantic technologies in an educational context .']

relations: [[(u'Social Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Web 2.0 applications')], [(u'information items', u'CONJUNCTION', u'social elements')], [], [(u'knowledge level', u'FEATURE-OF', u'data')], [(u'semantically empowered techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'recommender systems')], [(u'social networks', u'USED-FOR', u'hybrid recommender system')], [(u'cinematographic domain', u'COMPARE', u'state-of-the-art solutions')]]
sentences: [u'With the advent of the Social Web and the growing popularity of Web 2.0 applications , recommender systems are gaining momentum .', u'The recommendations generated by these systems aim to provide end users with suggestions about information items , social elements , products or services that are likely to be of their interest .', u'The traditional syntactic-based recommender systems suffer from a number of shortcomings that hamper their effectiveness .', u'As semantic technologies mature , they provide a consistent and reliable basis for dealing with data at the knowledge level .', u'Adding semantically empowered techniques to recommender systems can significantly improve the overall quality of recommendations .', u'In this work , a hybrid recommender system based on knowledge and social networks is presented .', u'Its evaluation in the cinematographic domain yields very promising results compared to state-of-the-art solutions .']

sentences: [u'Due to the latest advances in mobile technologies , the mobile phone has turned into an almost essential device in everyday life and one which grants access to a great variety of services .', u'However , a problem arises when it comes to interacting with devices of this kind .', u'Thus , even if most of the population is capable of working with them , there are collectives , like the elderly , that have great difficulties in this task .', u'To reduce the digital divide existing for this society section , we propose a platform that uses Near Field Communication ( NFC ) and semantic technologies .', u'Its aim is to provide different services to the user based on the reading of a combination of tags with a mobile phone , making interaction with these devices easier and more user-friendly .']

entities: [[(u'smart applications', u'Task'), (u'physical world', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'machine interpretable format', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'advertising information', u'Task'), (u'physical objects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user vicinity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'ubiquitous codes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'identifiers', u'Generic'), (u'physical objects', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Bluetooth Low Energy beacons', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'identifiers of the physical objects', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'physical object', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'iPhone 4S', u'Task')], [(u'application', u'Generic'), (u'physical objects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user vicinity', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'advertising information'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'physical objects')], [], [(u'identifiers', u'USED-FOR', u'physical objects')], [(u'Bluetooth Low Energy beacons', u'USED-FOR', u'identifiers of the physical objects')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'physical object')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Enabling smart applications to access information about the physical world in a machine interpretable format is a high priority in the Internet of Things ( IoT ) related research .', u'In this paper , we present a novel approach for advertising information related to physical objects in the user vicinity .', u'There are three distinctive features in our approach .', u'First , ubiquitous codes ( ucodes ) are used for providing globally unique identifiers for the physical objects .', u'Second , we use Bluetooth Low Energy beacons for broadcasting the identifiers of the physical objects .', u'Third , the information related to the physical object is represented with semantic technologies .', u'In order to verify our approach we have developed an example application for iPhone 4S .', u'The application presents the current physical objects in the user vicinity and shows selected information about these objects .']

entities: [[(u'WSDL', u'Method'), (u'web services', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantic description of web service', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Technologies', u'Method'), (u'continuous changing internet anatomy', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Web service technology', u'Method'), (u'web services', u'Task'), (u'semantic annotation', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic annotation', u'Method'), (u'web service semantic description', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Web service descriptions', u'Task'), (u'DBPedia', u'Method'), (u'Cross Domain Public Ontology', u'Method'), (u'WikiPedia', u'Material')], [(u'annotation', u'Task'), (u'Cross Domain Ontology', u'Method'), (u'web service', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'annotation process', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'WSDL', u'USED-FOR', u'web services'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic description of web service')], [(u'Semantic Technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'continuous changing internet anatomy')], [], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'Web service descriptions'), (u'DBPedia', u'USED-FOR', u'Web service descriptions')], [], []]
sentences: [u'WSDL is one of the most popular ways of describing web services syntactically , but it does not have provision for semantic description of web service .', u'Semantic Technologies are gaining popularity in continuous changing internet anatomy that gives rise to the web3.0 .', u'As well as Web service technology also gaining popularity , give rise to web services with semantic annotation which can be processed by machines .', u'Semantic annotation when created in context of specific domain makes the web service semantic description ambiguous to other context .', u'Here , we have taken approach to annotate Web service descriptions using DBPedia which is Cross Domain Public Ontology based on WikiPedia .', u'Value of the annotation is derived from Cross Domain Ontology which make web service more generalized beyond domain .', u'Also approach taken here is applicable for automating the annotation process .']

entities: [[(u'multimedia production', u'Task'), (u'au- diovisual repositories', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'metadata collections', u'Material')], [(u'collections', u'Generic')], [(u'metadata retrieval tasks', u'Task'), (u'multimedia search engines', u'Method')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'address- ing metadata variety', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'compression techniques', u'Method'), (u'volume dimension', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'multimedia search prototype', u'Method'), (u'con- sumes compressed RDF metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'SPARQL queries', u'Material'), (u'representative multimedia searches', u'Method'), (u'compressed space', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'address- ing metadata variety'), (u'semantic technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'compression techniques'), (u'compression techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'volume dimension')], [], [(u'representative multimedia searches', u'USED-FOR', u'SPARQL queries'), (u'compressed space', u'FEATURE-OF', u'full-text search')]]
sentences: [u'The growth in multimedia production has increased the size of au- diovisual repositories , and has also led to the formation of increasingly large metadata collections about these contents .', u'Deciding how these collections are effectively represented is challenging due to their variety and volume .', u'Besides , large volumes also affect the performance of metadata retrieval tasks , compromis- ing the success of multimedia search engines .', u'This paper focuses on this scenario and describes a case study in which semantic technologies are used for address- ing metadata variety , and advanced compression techniques for dealing with the volume dimension .', u'As a result , we obtain a multimedia search prototype that con- sumes compressed RDF metadata .', u'This approach efficiently resolves a subset of SPARQL queries by implementing representative multimedia searches , and also provides full-text search in compressed space .']

entities: [[(u'e-learning', u'Task')], [(u'problems', u'Generic'), (u'Web service paradigm', u'Method')], [(u'semantic description of learning services', u'Task'), (u'learning intention', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'learning object', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic service descriptor', u'Method'), (u'OWL-S extension', u'Method'), (u'service registry', u'Task')], [(u'semantic OWLS-LO', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Web service paradigm', u'USED-FOR', u'problems')], [], [(u'semantic service descriptor', u'USED-FOR', u'service registry'), (u'OWL-S extension', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic service descriptor'), (u'OWL-S extension', u'USED-FOR', u'service registry')], []]
sentences: [u'The essential challenge in e-learning is finding and identifying a learning object from a big corpus on the one hand , and ensuring the independence and reusability of learning objects in a different context , on the other hand .', u'These problems can be solved by using the principles of Web service paradigm .', u'In this paper , we propose a semantic description of learning services that encompasses the description of the learning intention and the use of context that characterise a learning object .', u'Then , we propose a semantic service descriptor , based on our OWL-S extension , to enrich service registry .', u'The feasibility of our extended semantic OWLS-LO is proved by experimental results obtained .']

entities: [[(u'E-health systems', u'Method'), (u'IT society', u'Task')], [(u'integration technologies', u'Method'), (u'e-health integration scenarios', u'Task'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data structures', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic model', u'Method'), (u'semantic service-oriented integration of healthcare legacy systems', u'Task'), (u'computing paradigms', u'Method'), (u'Service Oriented Architectures', u'Method'), (u'lightweight semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneous e-health systems', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'Service Oriented Architectures', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'computing paradigms'), (u'Service Oriented Architectures', u'CONJUNCTION', u'lightweight semantics'), (u'lightweight semantics', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'computing paradigms')]]
sentences: [u"E-health systems ' interoperability constitutes one of the main challenges of the IT society .", u"Although current integration technologies are up to now quite mature , if we try to increase the level of automation in e-health integration scenarios , we confront several problems and challenges regarding the documentation of the semantics related to the interfaces and the data structures of the deployed e-health systems ' services .", u'In this paper , we propose an approach , an architecture and a semantic model for the semantic service-oriented integration of healthcare legacy systems , combining the two fundamental computing paradigms , namely Service Oriented Architectures ( SOA ) and lightweight semantics , for achieving semantic interoperability among heterogeneous e-health systems .']

entities: [[(u'semantic service discovery', u'Task'), (u'global computing environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'dynamic overlay network', u'Method'), (u'semantically related services', u'Task')], [], [(u'global taxonomy', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'taxonomy', u'Generic'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'service discovery', u'Task')], [(u'distributed service discovery mechanism', u'Method'), (u'communities', u'Material'), (u'context-based service discovery', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'prototype application', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'semantically related services', u'USED-FOR', u'dynamic overlay network')], [], [], [], [(u'distributed service discovery mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'context-based service discovery'), (u'communities', u'USED-FOR', u'distributed service discovery mechanism')], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we consider semantic service discovery in a global computing environment .', u'We propose creating a dynamic overlay network by grouping together semantically related services .', u'Each such group is termed a community .', u'Communities are organized in a global taxonomy whose nodes are related contextually .', u'The taxonomy can be seen as an expandable , flexible and distributed semantic index over the system , which aims at improving service discovery .', u'We present a distributed service discovery mechanism that utilizes communities for context-based service discovery .', u'To demonstrate the viability of our approach , we have implemented an infrastructure for supporting communities as well as a prototype application that utilizes communities .']

sentences: [u'The theory of Service Oriented Environment ( SOE ) emerges with advanced connectivity of the Internet technologies , openness of business environment and prosperousness of business activities .', u'Service , as a critical object impenetrating every corner of SOE , is a hot research topic in many research domains .', u'Software Engineering ( SE ) , as a subject in engineering field , its researchers pay more attention to supporting advanced technologies for promoting service activities in SOE .', u'In this paper , we draw the position in the research field of semantic service search , service evaluation and ranking in SOE .', u'By means of the case study and literature review research approach , we discover the research motivations and research issues in this field .']

sentences: [u'Abstract In a complicated business network finding a supplier can be a very time consuming task .', u'In advanced supply networks like Build-to-Order supply chains , this task should be carried out under time constraints and under uncertainties both in suppliers and in the orders .', u'The technology of semantic service oriented architecture is aimed to support such kind of tasks , enabling construction of self-organizing adaptive supply chain networks .', u'A novel approach to network members discovery and selection based on their profiles is described .', u'The approach is grounded in a method for service discovery with incomplete information using query expansion techniques .', u'The usage of the approach is illustrated by example .']

sentences: [u'Notwithstanding the advancement of service computing in recent years , service composition is still main issue in this field .', u'In this paper , the authors present an integrated framework for semantic service composition using answer set programming .', u'Unlike the AI planning approaches of top-down workflow with nested composition and combining composition procedure into service discovery , this proposed framework integrates designed workflow with nested composition .', u'In addition , the planning is based on interface variables with validation through pre and post conditions .', u'Moreover , a unified implementation of service discovery , selection , composition and validation is achieved by answer set programming .', u'Finally , the framework performance is demonstrated by a travel booking example on QWSDataset .']

sentences: [u'This is a pioneering paper as it was the first to demonstrate the reactive nature of web services and provides a sound compositional theory for service integration .', u'It shows how temporal properties of services can be specified as part of the Interface description of Web service behaviour and shows the use of SWRL for their encoding .', u'The paper proposes a framework for enriching semantic service descriptions with two temporal assertions : assumption and commitment .', u'These assertions are formally specified in ITL .', u'They are then encoded in SWRL to make them an integral part of the OWL-S description of Web services .', u'According to Google Scholar this paper has been cited 39 times .']

sentences: [u'Services in the ubiquitous computing are heterogeneous in nature .', u'To be pervasive , these services should be defined in terms of their functionality and capabilities rather than the meaningless Universally Unique IDentifiers ( UUIDs ) or types of services .', u'With that , clients can access the proper service based on semantic requests , rather then a pre-configured profile .', u'In this paper , we study the requirements for semantic query to be feasible in service discovery processes .', u'Current discovery protocols and the concept of semantics are brought together to construct a framework to realize the semantic service discovery for ubiquitous computing .', u'Many issues are discussed in relation to service discovery topologies , ontology languages , and semantic query languages .']

sentences: [u'Software test is a technique to obtain information about software systems quality .', u'Performance test is a type of software test that aims at evaluating software performance at a given load scenario , but it requires specialized knowledge about tools , activities and metrics of the domain .', u'Since ontology is a promising knowledge representation technique , this paper presents a literature review to identify trends and compare researches of ontologies in the fields of software testing and software performance .', u'Also , to investigate this issue from a practical perspective , it was developed an ontology for representing the core knowledge of performance testing .', u'This paper presents the ontology and compare it with related ones .', u'Then , semantic technologies are explored to demonstrate the practical feasibility of developing ontology-based applications for assisting testers with performance test planning and management .']

relations: [[(u'Context-aware computing', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'mobile computing paradigm')], [(u'resource-bounded devices', u'USED-FOR', u'they')], [], [(u'systematic framework', u'USED-FOR', u'resource-bounded multi-agent context-aware systems'), (u'Android devices', u'USED-FOR', u'resource-bounded multi-agent context-aware systems')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'framework'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'context modelling and reasoning'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'resource-bounded context-aware agents'), (u'Android powered smartphones', u'CONJUNCTION', u'declarative rule-based programming'), (u'communication model', u'CONJUNCTION', u'declarative rule-based programming')]]
sentences: [u'Context-aware computing is a mobile computing paradigm that helps designing and implementing next generation smart applications , where personalized devices interact with users in smart environments .', u'Development of such applications is inherently complex due to these applications adapt to changing contextual information and they often run on resource-bounded devices .', u'Most of the existing context-aware development frameworks are centralized , adopt clientserver architecture , and do not consider resource limitations of context-aware devices .', u'This paper presents a systematic framework to modelling and implementation of resource-bounded multi-agent context-aware systems on Android devices .', u'The proposed framework makes use of semantic technologies for context modelling and reasoning about resource-bounded context-aware agents , Android powered smartphones as development platform , a suitable communication model and declarative rule-based programming as a preferred development language .']

entities: [[(u'RDF data', u'Material'), (u'bulk-loading RDF graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'bulk-load scheme', u'Method'), (u'RDF graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'database', u'Generic')], [(u'empty RDF graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'non-empty RDF graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concurrent loads', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'bulk-load scheme', u'Method'), (u'Oracle database semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'RDF graphs', u'Material'), (u'synthesized data', u'Material'), (u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'bulk- loading of large RDF graphs', u'Task'), (u'bulk-load scheme', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'The growth of RDF data makes it imperative that an efficient mechanism for bulk-loading RDF graphs be supported .', u'Thus , the paper proposes a bulk-load scheme that allows fast loading of arbitrarily large RDF graphs into a database .', u'Specifically , three modes of load are supported : i ) loading into an empty RDF graph , ii ) appending to a non-empty RDF graph , and iii ) concurrent loads into multiple graphs .', u'The bulk-load scheme is implemented as part of Oracle database semantic technologies and the performance experiments conducted with a variety of RDF graphs ( from UniProt and synthesized data of Lehigh University Benchmark ) demonstrate the scalability of the approach .', u'The paper outlines the challenges involved in bulk- loading of large RDF graphs , describes the bulk-load scheme , discusses its implementation , and presents a performance study .']

entities: [[(u'database application usage', u'Task'), (u'Database Management Systems', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'replication mechanism.Replication mechanism', u'Method')], [(u'replication mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'physical , trigger-based and log- based schema', u'Method')], [(u'Log-based replication mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'heterogeneous systems', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'heterogeneity problems', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'replication problem', u'Task'), (u'heterogeneous environment', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'The growth of database application usage requires Database Management Systems ( DBMS ) that are accessible , reliable , and dependable .', u'One approach to handle these requirements is replication mechanism.Replication mechanism can be divided into various categories .', u'Some related works consider two categories for replication mechanisms : heterogeneous and homogenous however majority of them classify them in three groups : physical , trigger-based and log- based schema .', u'Log-based replication mechanisms are the most widely used category among DBMS vendors.Adapting such approach for heterogeneous systems is a complex task , because of lack of log understanding in the other end .', u'Semantic technologies provide a suitable framework to address heterogeneity problems in large scale and dynamic resources .', u'In this paper we introduce a new approach to tackle replication problem in a heterogeneous environment by utilizing ontologies .']

sentences: [u'This book examines recent developments in semantic systems that can respond to situations and environments and events .', u'Thecontributors to this bookcover how to design , implement and utilize disruptive technologies .', u'The editor discusses the two fundamental sets of disruptive technologies : the development of semantic technologies including description logics , ontologies and agent frameworks ; and the development of semantic information rendering and graphical forms of displays of high-density time-sensitive data to improve situational awareness .', u'Beyond practical illustrations of emerging technologies , the editor proposes to utilize an incremental development method called knowledge scaffolding a proven educational psychology technique for learning a subject matter thoroughly .', u'The goal of this book is to help readers learn about managing information resources , from the ground up and reinforcing the learning as they read on .']

entities: [[(u'ontology-driven software engineering approach', u'Method'), (u'industrial robotics control software', u'Task')], [(u'ReApp architecture', u'Method'), (u'model-driven engineering', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'ROS-based components', u'Method')], [(u'ReApp', u'Method'), (u'ontological classification systems', u'Method'), (u'hardware', u'Generic'), (u'software', u'Generic'), (u'software components', u'Generic'), (u'tasks', u'Generic'), (u'them', u'Generic')], [(u'model-driven tooling', u'Method'), (u'higher abstraction levels', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'automatic code generation', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'integrated development environment', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'ontology-driven software engineering approach', u'USED-FOR', u'industrial robotics control software')], [(u'ReApp architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'model-driven engineering'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'model-driven engineering')], [(u'ontological classification systems', u'USED-FOR', u'tasks'), (u'hardware', u'CONJUNCTION', u'software'), (u'software', u'CONJUNCTION', u'capabilities'), (u'software components', u'USED-FOR', u'tasks')], [(u'model-driven tooling', u'USED-FOR', u'automatic code generation')], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'It')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper presents a novel ontology-driven software engineering approach for the development of industrial robotics control software .', u'It introduces the ReApp architecture that synthesizes model-driven engineering with semantic technologies to facilitate the development and reuse of ROS-based components and applications .', u'In ReApp , we show how different ontological classification systems for hardware , software , and capabilities help developers in discovering suitable software components for their tasks and in applying them correctly .', u'The proposed model-driven tooling enables developers to work at higher abstraction levels and fosters automatic code generation .', u'It is underpinned by ontologies to minimize discontinuities in the development workflow , with an integrated development environment presenting a seamless interface to the user .', u'First results show the viability and synergy of the selected approach when searching for or developing software with reuse in mind .']

sentences: [u'Computer system log analysis should proactively support information security decisions of all types .', u'These security decisions will likely include whether to update configurations , close ports , block access , patch systems , maneuver the system elements , or to do nothing because the risk is acceptable .', u'In a world with Big Data , and a heterogeneous , distributed enterprise , log analysis can be difficult at best .', u'There is so much data from a multitude of logs ( e.g .', u'event , application , and security ) within the enterprise .', u'On top of that , enterprises have varying configurations based on hardware , software , current patch level , and operating systems .', u'Logs must track all of this data on all of these devices .', u'The authors suggest that semantic technologies hold one key to providing a capability for proactive , and more meaningful , log analysis .']

entities: [[(u'LCSH', u'Method'), (u'library catalog', u'Material'), (u'natural language processing', u'Method')], [(u'quality', u'Metric'), (u'conceptual search', u'Method'), (u'word-based search systems', u'Method')], [(u'digital publications', u'Material'), (u"OCLC 's WorldCat catalog", u'Material'), (u'Reports search system', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'conceptual search', u'CONJUNCTION', u'conceptual search')], []]
sentences: [u'This presentation will report on the results of a study of 245 publications and reports which were ( 1 ) classified to both LCSH for inclusion in a standard library catalog and classified and indexed to an economic development related topic classification scheme and institution specific thesaurus ; ( 2 ) both manually classified and automatically classified using natural language processing ( NLP ) semantic technologies .', u'The focus of the comparison is ( 1 ) a direct comparison of the quality and quantity of access points across schemes , and ( 2 ) the effect of variations on conceptual search ( meaning versus word-based search systems ) .', u"The research collection includes 245 digital publications and reports published by the World Bank which are accessible through OCLC 's WorldCat catalog and through the World Bank 's external web faceted Documents and Reports search system ."]

relations: [[(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'image analysis'), (u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'image analysis and retrieval'), (u'image analysis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'retrieval')], [(u'Semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'image retrieval'), (u'ontology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic technologies'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'image retrieval'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'low level image features'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'low level image features')], [(u'domain specific ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'Ontology based Image Retrieval ( OIR ) system'), (u'domain specific ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'image retrieval'), (u'domain specific ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'user query')], [], [], [(u'Mammals dataset', u'USED-FOR', u'OIR system')], [(u'accuracy', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'system')]]
sentences: [u'Image processing is one of the hottest research field and researchers from the last decade have proposed many efficient approaches for image analysis and retrieval .', u'Semantic technologies like ontology offers promising approach to image retrieval as it tries to map the low level image features to high level ontology concepts .', u'In this paper , we have proposed Ontology based Image Retrieval ( OIR ) system , which uses domain specific ontology for image retrieval relevant to the user query .', u'The user can give concept / keyword as text input or can input the image itself .', u'Mammals domain is chosen as a test case and its ontology is developed .', u'The OIR system is trained on Mammals dataset and tested on large number of test cases related to this domain .', u'Experimental results show the efficiency and accuracy of the proposed system .']

entities: [[(u'Antimalware applications', u'Task'), (u'information security threat', u'Task')], [(u'computer network issues', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'malwares', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'malwares', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'malicious actions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'malwares', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'imprecision', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'vagueness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data analysis tools', u'Method'), (u'computer safety applications', u'Task')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'computational intelligence methods', u'Method'), (u'Fuzzy Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Fuzzy Markup Language', u'Material'), (u'semantic decision making system', u'Method'), (u'malicious programs identification', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'systems', u'USED-FOR', u'malicious actions')], [(u'imprecision', u'CONJUNCTION', u'vagueness'), (u'data analysis tools', u'USED-FOR', u'computer safety applications')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'computational intelligence methods'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic decision making system'), (u'computational intelligence methods', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic decision making system'), (u'Fuzzy Ontologies', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'computational intelligence methods'), (u'Fuzzy Ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Fuzzy Markup Language')]]
sentences: [u'Antimalware applications represent one of the most important research topic in the area of information security threat .', u'Indeed , most computer network issues have malwares as their underlying cause .', u'As a consequence , enhanced systems for analyzing the behavior of malwares are needed in order to try to predict their malicious actions and minimize eventual computer damages .', u'However , because the environments where malwares operate are characterized by high levels of imprecision and vagueness , the conventional data analysis tools lack to deal with these computer safety applications .', u'This work tries to bridge this gap by integrating semantic technologies and computational intelligence methods , such as the Fuzzy Ontologies and Fuzzy Markup Language ( FML ) , in order to propose an advanced semantic decision making system that , as shown by experimental results , achieves good performances in terms of malicious programs identification .']

entities: [[(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'informal learning', u'Task'), (u'MATURE', u'Method')], [(u"agile and 'federated ' approach", u'Method')], [(u'Deep Learning Design', u'Task'), (u'technical and conceptual Design Studies', u'Method'), (u'Demonstrators', u'Method'), (u'technical and user requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Evaluation Framework', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'socio-technical systems', u'Method'), (u'TEL', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'informal learning'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'informal learning and knowledge'), (u'MATURE', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'large-scale EC project')], [], [], [(u'socio-technical systems', u'USED-FOR', u'TEL')]]
sentences: [u'This article presents an original approach to designing complex systems to realise informal learning and knowledge maturing that is being conducted as part of a large-scale EC project called MATURE .', u"In addressing the challenge of designing work integrated Technology Enhanced Learning ( TEL ) systems within the 'web 2.0 workplace ' , we have developed and tested an agile and 'federated ' approach to the design of complex social and semantic technologies .", u'This follows a paradigm of Deep Learning Design that incorporates : early technical and conceptual Design Studies ; Use Cases of envisaged scenarios ; Demonstrators which synthesise the technical and user requirements ; and , a flexible Evaluation Framework that coordinates the related activities .', u'After presenting this approach and how it is realised in an ongoing project , we offer some conclusions about designing complex socio-technical systems for TEL in the future .']

sentences: [u'A service-oriented platform dedicated to fusion processes has been implemented .', u'It is devoted particularly to high-level fusion but is not restricted to this .', u'Moreover , the implementation of this platform enables the use of semantic technologies .', u'The underlying common language for services is modeled through a set of ontologies that enable the representation and reasoning over distinct objects , situations , potential threats , etc .', u'These ontologies are structured using an upper and a core ontology that detail space , time , object , reporting information , etc .', u'In addition , a template semantic mapping service is provided to allow potential external semantic services to interoperate with our platform .', u'This platform has been instantiated with services that perform high-level fusion tasks within the maritime surveillance domain .', u'This application aims principally at detecting anomalies that are embodied in vessel behaviors .']

entities: [[(u'life sciences research', u'Task'), (u'biochemical information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'datasets', u'Generic'), (u'ontology-supported knowledge bases', u'Material')], [(u'OWLa W3C standard declarative language', u'Method'), (u'biochemical ontologies', u'Method'), (u'classification facilities of OWL-based tools', u'Method')], [(u'chemical domain', u'Material'), (u'ChEBI', u'Material'), (u'taxonomical information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'biologically relevant compounds', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ChEBI', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'OWLa W3C standard declarative language', u'USED-FOR', u'biochemical ontologies'), (u'classification facilities of OWL-based tools', u'USED-FOR', u'biochemical ontologies'), (u'OWL-based tools', u'USED-FOR', u'biochemical ontologies')], [(u'ChEBI', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'chemical domain'), (u'ChEBI', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'open-access dictionary of molecular entities')], []]
sentences: [u'Background # R # # N # A variety of key activities within life sciences research involves integrating and intelligently managing large amounts of biochemical information .', u'Semantic technologies provide an intuitive way to organise and sift through these rapidly growing datasets via the design and maintenance of ontology-supported knowledge bases .', u'To this end , OWLa W3C standard declarative language has been extensively used in the deployment of biochemical ontologies that can be conveniently organised using the classification facilities of OWL-based tools .', u'One of the most established ontologies for the chemical domain is ChEBI , an open-access dictionary of molecular entities that supplies high quality annotation and taxonomical information for biologically relevant compounds .', u'However , ChEBI is being manually expanded which hinders its potential to grow due to the limited availability of human resources .']

entities: [[(u'event-driven systems', u'Method'), (u'detecting complex events', u'Task'), (u'event notifications', u'Method')], [(u'actionable situations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'event streams', u'Material'), (u'syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantics of event algebra patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'event detection', u'Task'), (u'detection of complex events', u'Task')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'declarative rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'research and application areas', u'Task'), (u'event processing', u'Task')], [(u'semantic event processing', u'Task')], [(u'semantic rule-based complex events processing', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'One of the critical success factors of event-driven systems is the capability of detecting complex events from simple and ordinary event notifications .', u'Complex events which trigger or terminate actionable situations can be inferred from large event clouds or event streams based on their event instance sequence , their syntax and semantics .', u'Using semantics of event algebra patterns defined on top of event instance sequences for event detection is one of the promising approaches for detection of complex events .', u'The developments and successes in building standards and tools for semantic technologies such as declarative rules and ontologies are opening novel research and application areas in event processing .', u'One of these promising application areas is semantic event processing .', u'In this work we describe our research on semantic rule-based complex events processing .']

sentences: [u'Several branches of computer vision heavily rely ( but we could even say depend ) on the availability of large datasets of labelled images .', u'While such labeling is usually done by hand , a powerful help can be obtained from Internet and its related tools .', u'In this paper we address the problem of automatically generating a set of images representing an object class , given the name of the class .', u'We exploit semantic technologies , such as lexical resources and ontologies , in order to improve the search performances by using a standard web search engine .', u'We will also discuss an application to the automatic building of a training set for a classification framework .', u'Preliminary experiments are provided for 10 classes from the public CalTech256 dataset and results show an average increment in classification accuracy of about 10 % .']

sentences: [u'There is a huge amount of data spread across the web and stored in databases that we can use to build knowledge graphs .', u'However , exploiting this data to build knowledge graphs is difficult due to the heterogeneity of the sources , scale of the amount of data , and noise in the data .', u'In this paper we present an approach to building knowledge graphs by exploiting semantic technologies to reconcile the data continuously crawled from diverse sources , to scale to billions of triples extracted from the crawled content , and to support interactive queries on the data .', u'We applied our approach , implemented in the DIG system , to the problem of combating human trafficking and deployed it to six law enforcement agencies and several non-governmental organizations to assist them with finding traffickers and helping victims .']

sentences: [u'Broadly discussed in recent scientific papers , Mass Collaboration Systems ( MC ) , enlist users who explicitly or implicitly collaborate to build a long-lasting artifact that is beneficial to the community .', u"Wikis are systems that let users build artifacts and require users to edit and merge one another 's inputs .", u"Wiki 's is a semi-closed world and the use and re-use of wiki 's information by external non-humans agents are cumbersome tasks .", u'The step from unstructured data but strongly connected information to structured data and annotated information is brought by adopting Semantic technologies into wikis .', u'This paper presents a survey and comparative study of Semantic Wikis , with the emphasis on Semantic Media Wiki model and mechanisms and gives insight about the beneficial to use semantic wikis onto different scientific projects to share knowledge .']

sentences: [u'ABSTRACT The biomedical ontologies contain the complex distributed heterogeneous data , to analyze and process this data is the big challenge for biomedical communities .', u'The common goal of biomedical communities is to annotate this data .', u'These problems generated a need to use the services of grid on semantic web .', u'Semantic Grid is the integration of Grid with the Semantic web , which will play the vital role in future web .', u'The semantic grid architecture provides semantic and knowledge support .', u'In this paper we discuss two biomedical ontologies , Biological Viruses Community Ontology ( BVCO ) and the most mature Gene Ontology ( GO ) .', u'General Terms Biomedical data , Future Web .', u'Keywords Biomedical Ontology , Grid Computing , Semantic Grid , Semantic Web .', u'1 .', u'INTRODUCTION Biological sciences are facing the exponential growth of observational , experimental and theoretical data scattered in different laboratories and hospitals .', u'These are distributed heterogeneous datasets because of their source ( Imaging device , Sequencer etc . ) .', u'These laboratories and hospitals are generally not capable to archive , process and analyze these terabyte of dataset .', u'The bioinformatics research community is erg to analyze these distributed heterogeneous dataset in order to extract useful information and knowledge .', u'But these resources which are generating vast amount of biomedical data are widely distributed , highly heterogeneous , may follows heterogeneous protocols and made by different venders so applying appropriate computational technique in this kind of heterogeneous environment is not an easy task .', u'Now a day Grid Computing is playing an important role in obtaining , comparing and analyzing distributed heterogeneous scientific data .', u'Foster [ 1 ] defines the Grid concept as the controlled and coordinated resource sharing and problem solving in dynamic , multi institutional virtual organizations .', u'This sharing of resource , ranging from simple file transfer to complex and collaborative problem solving , is accomplished with in controlled and well-defined conditions and policies .', u'The dynamic grouping of individuals , groups , or organization that defined the conditions and rules for sharing are called virtual organization ( VO ) [ 2 ] .', u'The grid computing resources include computing power , data storage , hardware instruments , on-demand software and applications .', u'In this context , the real problems involved with resource sharing are resource discovery , event correlation , authentication , authorization and access mechanism .', u'These problems become proportionately more complicated when the grid computing solution is introduced as a solution for utility computing , where industrial applications and resources become available as sharable [ 3 ] .', u'According to Tom Gruber [ 4 ] , Ontology defines a set of representational primitives that are typically classes , attributes and relationships .', u'Ontology can be viewed as a controlled vocabulary of well-defined terms with specified relationships between them , capable of interpretation by both human and computers .', u'Many tools are also available to develop ontology like OBOEdit ( mainly used for Biological Ontologies ) , Protege ( developed by the Stanford University , USA ) and TODE [ 5 ] ( developed by the National University of Computer and Emerging Sciences , Karachi , Pakistan ) .', u'Biomedical research community sequencing more and more genomes day by day and they highly needed processing and analyzing with appropriate algorithms .', u'The integration of grid computing and ontology can play vital role in for biomedical communities [ 6 , 7 ] .', u'In this paper we are presenting an idea for exploration of huge amount of biomedical datasets by using semantic grids .']

sentences: [u'With the blooming of Web services , there are more and more available services on the Internet .', u'The services non-functional aspect , i.e .', u'quality of service ( QoS ) , is an important criteria for service matching , ranking and selection .', u'To enable semantic service discovery with the QoS support , a hierachical QoS semantics model is proposed in this article according to the QoS relations with applications.The model enables the service providers to provide different levels of QoS ensurance based on SLA under different scenarios.Based on this model , the paper details the algorithms for QoS matchmaking and service ranking .', u'Finally , the paper gives the framework for service discovery with QoS ontology .']

entities: [[(u'Pervasive environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneous and independent devices', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [], [(u'pervasive environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'online negotiations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'emergent semantics principles', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
sentences: [u'Pervasive environments are composed as spontaneous aggregation of heterogeneous and independent devices , which may seamlessly consume , but also provide , software resources over the network .', u'As result , applications emerge from the dynamic composition of the resources available within the environment .', u'This requires applications of being semantic-aware , to reason about and learn from the environment .', u"However , due to the inherent high degree of dynamism characterizing pervasive environments , semantics can not be established a-priori , rather it should `` emerge '' from online negotiations among involved parties .", u'This paper , formalizes emergent semantics principles into formal foundations , and shows , as proof of concept , how to engineer such foundations into a fully distributed semantic service discovery .']

entities: [[(u'news recommender system', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'on-line news recommendation services', u'Task')], [(u'News contents', u'Material'), (u'user preferences', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'item descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user profiles', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'se-mantic relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'content-based and collaborative recommendation models', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'news articles', u'Material'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'news items lists', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'models', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'News @ hand is a news recommender system that makes use of semantic technologies to provide several on-line news recommendation services .', u'News contents and user preferences are described in terms of concepts appearing in a set of domain ontologies .', u'Based on the similarities between item descriptions and user profiles , and the se-mantic relations between concepts , content-based and collaborative recommendation models are supported by the system .', u'In this paper , we evaluate a model that personalises the order in which news articles are shown to the user according to his long-term interest profile , and other model that reorders the news items lists taking into account the current semantic context of interest of the user .', u'The combination of those models is investigated showing significant improvements on the experimental tasks performed .']

entities: [[(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'structure of information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'software agents', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology builder', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'ontology', u'Generic')], [(u'ontology design', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In semantic technologies , the shared common understanding of the structure of information among artifacts ( people or software agents ) can be realized by building an ontology .', u'To do this , it is imperative for an ontology builder to answer several questions : a ) what are the main components of an ontology ?', u'b ) How an ontology look likes and how it works ?', u'c ) Verify if it is required to consider reusing existing ontologies or not ?', u'c ) What is the complexity of the ontology to be developed ?', u'd ) What are the principles of ontology design and development ?', u'e ) How to evaluate an ontology ?', u'This paper answers all the key questions above .', u'The aim of this paper is to present a set of guiding principles to help ontology developers and also inexperienced users to answer such questions .']

sentences: [u'Design of intelligent management systems ( IMS ) is an important task .', u'However , IMS design methods for lifecycle management of complex technical systems ( CTS ) have not been sufficiently developed .', u'The article considers an approach to building an intelligent lifecycle management system for CTS based on Open Semantic Technologies for Intelligent Systems ( OSTIS ) .', u'The knowledge base of such a system is based on a set of domain ontologies supporting the design management , as well as further CTS development .', u'The problem of intellectualization of the lifecycle management is considered in the context of developing the IMS as a system for managing knowledge circulating at all stages of the lifecycle .', u'The article presents methods for OSTIS component-based design , IMS architecture , fragments of the lifecycle domain ontology and of the project management domain in the SCn language .']

sentences: [u'Scientific data services are increasing in usage and scope , and with these increases comes growing need for access to provenance information .', u'Our goal is to design and implement an extensible provenance solution that is deployed at the science data ingest time .', u'In this paper , we describe our work in the setting of a particular set of data services in the area of solar coronal physics .', u'The paper focuses on one existing federated data service and one proposed observatory .', u'Our claim is both that the design and implementation are useful for the particular scientific image data services we designed for , but further that the design provides an operational specification for other scientific data applications .', u'We highlight the need for and usage of semantic technologies and tools in our design and implemented service .']

sentences: [u'Problem-based learning has been applied over the last three decades to a diverse range of learning environments .', u'In this educational approach , different problems are posed to the learners so that they can develop different solutions while learning about the problem domain .', u'When applied to conceptual modelling , and particularly to Qualitative Reasoning , the solutions to problems are models that represent the behaviour of a dynamic system .', u'The learner ? s task then is to bridge the gap between their initial model , as their first attempt to represent the system , and the target models that provide solutions to that problem .', u'We propose the use of semantic technologies and resources to help in bridging that gap by providing links to terminology and formal definitions , and matching techniques to allow learners to benefit from existing models .']

entities: [[(u'ontology-based platform', u'Method'), (u'automatic translation', u'Task'), (u'geographical formats', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data models', u'Method')], [(u'organizational motivations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'architecture and processing components', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'description logic reasoners', u'Method'), (u'large ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'platform', u'Generic'), (u'custom mapping algorithm', u'Method'), (u'translation', u'Task')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'large-scale integration', u'Task')], [(u'IGI Global', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'ontology-based platform', u'USED-FOR', u'automatic translation'), (u'geographical formats', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data models')], [], [(u'description logic reasoners', u'USED-FOR', u'large ontologies'), (u'custom mapping algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'translation')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'large-scale integration')], []]
sentences: [u'This chapter presents an ontology-based platform enabling automatic translation between a large number of geographical formats and data models .', u'It explains the organizational motivations for developing this system , the technologies used , how its architecture and processing components were developed , what it achieves and where it still needs improvement .', u'Since current off-the-shelf description logic reasoners are unable to process the large ontologies involved in this system , this platform uses a custom mapping algorithm that scales gracefully and still computes the required information to effect translation between supported data formats .', u'The authors believe that the lessons learned during this project and discussed in this chapter will prove especially useful to interoperability practitioners contemplating the use of semantic technologies for enabling large-scale integration across organizational boundaries .', u'2010 , IGI Global .']

relations: [[(u'Semantic Grid', u'USED-FOR', u'semantically rich information')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Grid is a recent initiative to expose semantically rich information associated with Grid resources to build more intelligent Grid services [ 2 ] .', u'Recently , several projects have embraced this vision and there are several successful applications that combine the strengths of the Grid and of semantic technologies [ 5,11,4 ] .', u'However , Semantic Grid still lacks a technology , which would provide the needed scalability and integration with existing infrastructure .', u'In this paper we present our on-going work on a semantic grid repository , which is capable of addressing complex schemas and answer queries over ontologies with large number of instances .', u'We present the details of our approach and describe the underlying architecture of the system .', u'We conclude with a performance evaluation , which compares the current state-of-the-art reasoners with our system .']

sentences: [u'In the last few years both scientists and practitioners have been discussing the issue of Service Oriented Computing ( SOC ) .', u'But facing the challenge of reconciling the business process requirements and the IT landscape especially in the design time of a SOA implementation , one needs to consider both methodological and technological aspects .', u'On the one hand , methodologies are needed for integrating the business driven view and the technology driven perspective in one consistent approach .', u'On the other hand , semantic technologies have recently emerged as a promising approach for reducing data and process heterogeneities and automating tasks within SOA and Business Process Management .', u'Coping with these two aspects , the proposed workshop will bring together academia and industry to discuss solutions towards bridging the gap between business requirements and IT implementations .']

entities: [[(u'architecture', u'Method'), (u'interactive graphical editor', u'Method'), (u'semantic description of services', u'Task'), (u'digital business ecosystem environments', u'Task')], [(u'semantic description of business services', u'Task'), (u'MOF metadata modelling approach', u'Method'), (u'meta-model', u'Method'), (u'modelling elements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'custom service description models', u'Method')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'service models', u'Method'), (u'business domains', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'business differentiation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'model variations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'UML-like interactive editor', u'Method'), (u'semantic service models', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'interactive graphical editor', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic description of services')], [(u'MOF metadata modelling approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic description of business services'), (u'meta-model', u'USED-FOR', u'custom service description models')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper we describe an architecture , a language and an interactive graphical editor for the semantic description of services in digital business ecosystem environments .', u'For the semantic description of business services , a MOF metadata modelling approach has been adopted where a meta-model provides the modelling elements needed to build custom service description models .', u'The architecture can utilize complex or simple structures from diverse domain ontologies in order to specialise service models to business domains and also to allow for business differentiation through model variations .', u'Finally we describe the implementation of the system as well as a UML-like interactive editor that facilitates the creation of the semantic service models .']

entities: [[(u'service-oriented architecture', u'Method'), (u'service orientation', u'Task'), (u'semantic modeling', u'Task'), (u'intelligent and automated integration', u'Task'), (u'cutting-edge technology', u'Method')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'global perspective', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web service modeling ontology', u'Method'), (u'semantic service model', u'Method'), (u'reference implementation', u'Task')], [(u'B2B integration scenario', u'Task'), (u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'community-agreed standard evaluation methodology', u'Method'), (u'semantic-based systems', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'service orientation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic modeling'), (u'semantic modeling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'intelligent and automated integration')], [], [(u'community-agreed standard evaluation methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic-based systems')]]
sentences: [u'Semantically enabled service-oriented architecture focused on principles of service orientation , semantic modeling , intelligent and automated integration defines grounds for a cutting-edge technology which enables new means to integration of services , more adaptive to changes in business requirements which occur over systems lifetime .', u'We define the architecture starting from a global perspective and through Web service modeling ontology as its semantic service model we narrow down to its services , processes and technology we use for the reference implementation .', u'On a B2B integration scenario we demonstrate several aspects of the architecture and further describe the evaluation of the implementation according to a community-agreed standard evaluation methodology for semantic-based systems .']

sentences: [u'UDDI is not suitable for handling semantic markups for Web services due to its flat data model and limited search capabilities .', u'In this paper , we introduce an approach to allow for support of semantic service descriptions and queries using registries that conforms to UDDI V3 specification .', u'Specifically , we discuss how to store complex semantic markups in the UDDI data model and use that information to perform semantic query processing .', u'Our approach does not require any modification to the existing UDDI registries .', u'The add-on modules reside only on clients who wish to take advantage of semantic capabilities .', u'This approach is completely backward compatible and can integrate seamlessly into existing infrastructure .']

entities: [[], [(u'B2C and B2B contracts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web services', u'Method')], [(u'Business protocols', u'Method'), (u'interaction-oriented approach', u'Method'), (u'modeling business processes', u'Task')], [(u'semantic service composition', u'Method')], [], [(u'formalization', u'Generic'), (u'complex and nested commitment conditions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'open business scenarios', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'Business protocols', u'USED-FOR', u'modeling business processes'), (u'interaction-oriented approach', u'USED-FOR', u'modeling business processes')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'A variety of business relationships in open settings can be understood in terms of the creation and manipulation of commitments among the participants .', u'These include B2C and B2B contracts and processes , as realized via Web services and other such technologies .', u'Business protocols , an interaction-oriented approach for modeling business processes , are formulated in terms of the commitments .', u'Commitments can support other forms of semantic service composition as well .', u'This paper shows how to represent and reason about commitments in a general manner .', u'Unlike previous formalizations , the proposed formalization accommodates complex and nested commitment conditions , and concurrent commitment operations .', u'In this manner , a rich variety of open business scenarios are enabled .']

sentences: [u'Services are developed separately and without knowledge of all possible use contexts .', u'They often mismatch or do not correspond exactly to the end-user needs , making direct composition without mediation impossible .', u'In such a case , software adaptation can support composition by producing semi-automatically new software pieces called adaptors .', u'Adaptation proposals have addressed the signature and behavioural service interface levels .', u'Yet , taking also into account the semantic level is mandatory to enable the fully-automatic retrieval of adaptors from service interfaces .', u'We propose a new adaptation technique that , compared to related work , supports both behavioural and semantic service interface levels , works system-wide , and generates automatically distributed adaptors .']

sentences: [u'Open Educational Resources ( OER ) have the potential to encourage self-learning and lifelong learning .', u'However , there are some barriers that make it difficult to find the suitable information .', u'The successful adoption of OER in processes of informal or self-directed learning will depend largely on what the learner is able to reach without a guide or a tutor .', u'However , the OERs quality and their particular features can positively influence into the motivation of the self-learner to achieve their goals .', u'In this paper , the authors present an approach to enhance the OER discovery by self-learners .', u'This is designed to leverage open knowledge sources , which are described by semantic technologies .', u"User 's data and OER encoded in formal languages can be linked and thus find paths for suggest the most appropriate resources ."]

sentences: [u"Digital Personal Environments ( DPE ) infrastructure is far from traditional end users ' devices and its associated management is a big challenge for both Service Providers and Users .", u'Due to the dynamic and heterogeneous nature of DPE , centralized management paradigms are no longer valid .', u'This paper presents a new distributed paradigm that is based on Autonomic Communications principles and concepts to build self-managed environments .', u'Semantic technologies are the cornerstone for the self-management paradigm .', u'So as to effectively control DPEs , methods of governance must also be provided .', u'Policies provide a high level language for users that can realize such governance .', u'A proof of concept shows the feasibility of the new paradigmalthough some aspects need to be further developed , related for instance tothe lack of standardization and agreement in the industry .']

sentences: [u'With rapid advances in the enabling technologies for pervasive computing and with the requirements for communication systems autonomy , ontology-based semantic approaches as applied to contextual application scenarios have recently received a great deal of attention from the research community .', u'However , service modelling using semantic knowledge sources and the available service semantic description languages can be a time and effort consuming process , which thus leads to the poor acceptance of semantic technologies .', u'The semantic support environment presented in this research addresses this shortcoming providing a more illustrative and understandable way to view ontology instances associated with complex contextual information .', u'It enables semantic modelling and the interactive simulation of physical real-world contextual environments of interest ( i.e .', u'devices , services , functional capabilities of service , contexts ) .', u'It provides support for the design of applications or middleware level services .']
