sentences: [u'The fascinations of Internet of Things ( IoT ) necessitate a large number of devices are to be integrated with the existing IoT .', u'These devices are very difficult to manage in a large distributed environment without a careful management design .', u'These location based devices generate data at fixed intervals of time and need configure these devices to software platform to analyze data and understand environment in better way .', u'So , learning capability should incorporate within the system as the environment of system changes dynamically .', u'As the Internet of Things continues to develop , further potential is estimated by a combination with related technology approaches and concepts such as Cloud Computing , Future Internet , Big Data , Robotics and Semantic Technologies .', u'The idea is becomes now evident as those related concepts have started to reveal synergies by combining them .']

sentences: [u'We describe our work exploring provenance within an open linked data ecosystem being developed in the travel/transport domain .', u'We discuss techniques to infer provenance of sensor data , maintain provenance of third party data , and reference sources not available as linked data within a provenance record .']

sentences: [u'Learning content management systems ( LCMS ) supports e-learning applications with storage and efficient access for e-learning objects ( LO ) s. ROSA is a LCMS built as a semantic layer on the top of an XML native DBMS .', u'In this paper , we present ROSA data model designed as an extension to RDF data model with ordered collections and relationship properties and cardinalities .', u'An algebra is proposed with operations supporting queries over LO metadata and navigation through LO conceptual maps .', u'Finally , the system implements Web semantic technology based on a formal data model tailored for an efficient storage and access of e-learning resources .']

relations: [[(u'software agent-based information retrieval', u'PART-OF', u'WebTheme'), (u'software agent-based information retrieval', u'CONJUNCTION', u'visual analytics'), (u'visual analytics', u'USED-FOR', u'WebTheme')], [], [(u'Software agents', u'USED-FOR', u'controlled harvesting of web material of interest')], [(u'Visualization and analysis tools', u'USED-FOR', u'document space')], [], [], [(u'WebTheme', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'user insight'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'web information collections')]]
sentences: [u'WebTheme combines the power of software agent-based information retrieval with visual analytics to provide users with a new tool for understanding web information .', u'WebTheme allows users to both quickly comprehend large collections of information from the Web and drill down into interesting portions of a collection .', u'Software agents work for users to perform controlled harvesting of web material of interest .', u'Visualization and analysis tools allow exploration of the resulting document space .', u'Information spaces are organized and presented according to their topical context .', u"Tools that display how documents were collected by the agents , where they were gathered , and how they are linked further enhance users ' understanding of information and its context .", u'WebTheme is a significant tool in the pursuit of the Semantic Web .', u'In particular , it supports enhanced user insight into semantics of large , prestructured or ad-hoc , web information collections .']

sentences: [u'Versioning schemes for RDF data can play an important role in the management of Semantic web based information .', u'The storage space and the version retrieval is one of the most significant aspects in version management .', u'However , the existing methods have limitations in that they are not efficient in constructing the version .', u'Therefore , there is a need for new and improved techniques that achieve better performance .', u'In this paper , we proposed a hypergraph-based storage policy for RDF version management , which exploits hyperedges and vertices to maintain the information of version .', u'This scheme enables us to reduce the space overhead and reconstruct a specific version efficiently .', u'In addition , we proposed an optimization technique , which results in considerable space saving .', u'An experimental study with RDF data sets shows the proposed storage policy achieved reduced storage space and efficiently reconstructed the version .']

entities: [[(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'SWRL rule bases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'Axiome', u'Method'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'English', u'Material'), (u'SWRL rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'syntactic structure', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'categorization approach', u'Method'), (u'rule templates', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rule elicitation', u'Task')], [(u'Axiome', u'Method'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'Protege-OWL plug-in', u'Method'), (u'SWRL rule bases', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'categorization approach', u'USED-FOR', u'rule templates'), (u'categorization approach', u'USED-FOR', u'rule elicitation'), (u'rule templates', u'USED-FOR', u'rule elicitation')], [], [(u'Protege-OWL plug-in', u'USED-FOR', u'tool')]]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) provides the means of specifying rules within OWL ontologies .', u'As the size and complexity of SWRL rule bases within ontologies increases , developers and end users need tools to help manage them .', u'We have developed a tool , called Axiome , that can paraphrase rules into a simple form in English and categorize SWRL rules based on their syntactic structure .', u'Our categorization approach supports rule templates that provide a mechanism to facilitate rule elicitation .', u'Axiome also allows users to visualize the structure of individual rules as well as graphically browse relationships among the bodies and heads of rules in a rule base .', u'We have implemented our tool as a Protege-OWL plug-in for which we will provide a demonstration of how users can rapidly explore content and patterns in SWRL rule bases .']

entities: [[(u'Cloud Computing interoperability challenge', u'Task'), (u'Intercloud Protocols', u'Method')], [(u'cloud provider', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Point-to-Point manner', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'n2 complexity problem', u'Task'), (u'Intercloud Directories', u'Method'), (u'Exchanges', u'Method')], [(u'Point to Point protocols', u'Method'), (u'HTTP', u'Method'), (u'1-to-1 models', u'Method'), (u'many-to-many mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'XMPP', u'Method')], [(u'XMPP mechanism', u'Method'), (u'mediation', u'Task')], [(u'resources catalog approach', u'Method'), (u'Ontology of Cloud Computing Resources', u'Method'), (u'heterogeneous cloud providers', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Intercloud Protocols', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Cloud Computing interoperability challenge')], [(u'Intercloud Directories', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Exchanges')], [(u'HTTP', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Point to Point protocols'), (u'XMPP', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'many-to-many mechanisms')], [(u'XMPP mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'mediation')], []]
sentences: [u'Working groups have proposed building a layered set of protocols to solve the Cloud Computing interoperability challenge called Intercloud Protocols .', u'Instead of each cloud provider establishing connectivity with another cloud provider in a Point-to-Point manner resulting in the n2 complexity problem , Intercloud Directories and Exchanges will act as mediators for enabling connectivity and collaboration among disparate cloud providers .', u'Point to Point protocols such as HTTP are not suitable beyond 1-to-1 models , therefore the discussions around many-to-many mechanisms have been proposed , including XMPP .', u'This paper details the use of an XMPP mechanism for such mediation .', u'On top of that , for the federation of the resources themselves , we define a resources catalog approach , using the Semantic Web Resource Definition Framework ( RDF ) along with a common Ontology of Cloud Computing Resources to work across a variety of heterogeneous cloud providers .']

sentences: [u'Temporal information retrieval tasks have a long history in information retrieval field and also have attracted neuroscientists working on memory system .', u'It becomes more important in Semantic Web where structured data in RDF triples , often with temporal information , are rapidly accumulated over time .', u'Existing triple stores already support loading RDF triples and answering a given SPARQL query with time interval constraints .', u'However , few triple stores has been optimized for processing time interval queries which are important for temporal information retrieval tasks .', u'In this paper , we propose xStore , a federated SPARQL engine running on a cloud environment , which supports a fast processing of temporal queries .', u'xStore is built on top of heterogeneous storages such as key-value stores and conventional triple stores .', u'Experiments over real-world temporal datasets showed that our approach is faster than a conventional SPARQL engine for processing temporal queries .']

entities: [[(u'RDF datasets', u'Material'), (u'web', u'Material'), (u'RDF querying', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'slow speeds of executions', u'Task'), (u'excess normalization', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [], [(u'Query optimization', u'Method'), (u'refining process', u'Method'), (u'database administration', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'execution Query optimization', u'Method'), (u'SQL queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query tree', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'optimization of queries', u'Task')], [(u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'SPARQL query', u'Task'), (u'ACO', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'As increasingly large RDF datasets are being published on the web , efficient RDF querying has become an essential factor in realizing the semantic web .', u'One of the reasons of slow speeds of executions could be excess normalization leading to single tables .', u'More the number of tables more are the complex nature of joins , and thus leading to more execution times .', u'So to retrieve data quickly , there is a need to optimize the query .', u'Query optimization is the refining process in database administration and it helps to bring down speed of execution Query optimization is performed translating the SQL queries in to query tree .', u'Then pick the best algorithm for optimization of queries .', u'In this paper we are used a meta heuristic technique Ant Colony Optimization ( ACO ) .The proposed technique is efficient and scalable for SPARQL query by using with ACO .']

entities: [[(u'multimedia algorithms', u'Method')], [(u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'Algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'domain-specific environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'algorithm collaboration', u'Task'), (u'interpretation task', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Web knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reasoning methods', u'Method'), (u'interacting agents', u'Generic')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'multimedia data', u'Material')], [(u'platform implementation', u'Method'), (u'interpretation scenarios', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'generic framework', u'USED-FOR', u'algorithm collaboration'), (u'generic framework', u'USED-FOR', u'interpretation task'), (u'algorithm collaboration', u'USED-FOR', u'interpretation task')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Despite numerous outstanding results , highly complex and specialized multimedia algorithms have not been able to fulfill the promise of fully automated multimedia interpretation .', u'An essential problem is that they are insufficiently aware of the context they operate in .', u'Algorithms that do take a form of context in consideration , often function in a domain-specific environment .', u'The generic framework proposed in this paper stimulates algorithm collaboration on an interpretation task by continuously actualizing the context of the multimedia item under interpretation .', u'Semantic Web knowledge , combined with reasoning methods , forms the corner stone of the integration of these various interacting agents .', u'We believe that this framework will enable an advanced interpretation of multimedia data that goes beyond the capabilities of individual algorithms .', u'A basic platform implementation already indicates the potential of the concept , clearing the path for even more complex interpretation scenarios .']

sentences: [u'The Semantic Web is a promising step toward improving virtual community information systems .', u'It gives information a clearer meaning , better enabling computers and people to cooperate .', u'However , still lacking is the purpose of the information : how is it going to be used and evolve ?', u'In a Pragmatic Web , the context of the information would be defined as well , as the community examines goal-based conditional inferences in its work in progress .', u'Scientific collaboratories could benefit substantially from such an approach .', u'The PORT collaboratory was established to provide a model for pragmatic collaboratory evolution .', u'In this paper , we outline a pragmatic community information systems development process by combining PORT with the Conceptual Graphs-based RENISYS method for the legitimate user-driven specification of community information systems .', u'Peircean pragmatism provides a self-critical approach for tool selection in virtual communities .']

entities: [[(u'service-oriented architecture', u'Method'), (u'multisensor surveillance', u'Task'), (u'integrated solution', u'Method'), (u'automatic deployment', u'Task'), (u'dynamic selection', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'composition of sensors', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Sensors', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web-connected devices', u'Method'), (u'uniform Web API', u'Method')], [(u'RESTdesc', u'Method'), (u'sensors', u'Generic'), (u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'Web APIs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web reasoners', u'Method')], [(u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'smart Kinect sensor', u'Method'), (u'IR', u'Task'), (u'person detection', u'Task'), (u'feedback', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pressure sensors', u'Method'), (u'detection of complex events', u'Task')], [(u'platform scales', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web APIs', u'Method'), (u'composition time', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'service-oriented architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'multisensor surveillance'), (u'service-oriented architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'multisensor surveillance in smart homes'), (u'service-oriented architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'smart homes'), (u'automatic deployment', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dynamic selection'), (u'dynamic selection', u'CONJUNCTION', u'composition of sensors')], [], [(u'RESTdesc', u'USED-FOR', u'sensors'), (u'RESTdesc', u'USED-FOR', u'Web APIs'), (u'Semantic Web reasoners', u'USED-FOR', u'Web APIs')], [(u'smart Kinect sensor', u'USED-FOR', u'optimizing person detection'), (u'smart Kinect sensor', u'USED-FOR', u'person detection'), (u'IR', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RGB'), (u'pressure sensors', u'USED-FOR', u'smart Kinect sensor')], [(u'platform scales', u'USED-FOR', u'Web APIs')]]
sentences: [u'The design of a service-oriented architecture for multisensor surveillance in smart homes is presented as an integrated solution enabling automatic deployment , dynamic selection , and composition of sensors .', u'Sensors are implemented as Web-connected devices , with a uniform Web API .', u'RESTdesc is used to describe the sensors and a novel solution is presented to automatically compose Web APIs that can be applied with existing Semantic Web reasoners .', u'We evaluated the solution by building a smart Kinect sensor that is able to dynamically switch between IR and RGB and optimizing person detection by incorporating feedback from pressure sensors , as such demonstrating the collaboration among sensors to enhance detection of complex events .', u'The performance results show that the platform scales for many Web APIs as composition time remains limited to a few hundred milliseconds in almost all cases .']

sentences: [u'The service oriented architecture ( SOA ) is gaining more momentum with the advent of network services on the Web .', u'A programmable and machine accessible Web is the vision of many , and might represent a step towards the semantic Web .', u'However , security is a crucial requirement for the serious usage and adoption of the Web services technology .', u'This paper enumerates design goals for an access control model for Web services .', u'It then introduces an abstract general model for Web services components , along with formal definitions and notation that can be used as a basis to design an access control processor independent of a particular Web service implementation .', u'It follows the design of a distributed access control processor built upon this general model for Web services , along with implementation guidelines and examples .', u'Main goals for a general authorization framework are identified , and design spaces enumerated .']

entities: [[(u'Serials and continuing resources', u'Material'), (u'bibliographic management', u'Task')], [(u'Easing catalogers', u'Method'), (u'Access transition', u'Task'), (u'FRAD conceptual models', u'Method'), (u'RDA', u'Method')], [(u'AACR2', u'Method'), (u'OCLC', u'Method'), (u'CONSER', u'Method'), (u'RDA records', u'Material'), (u'cataloging framework', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Serials and continuing resources present a variety of unique challenges in bibliographic management , from special issues and unnumbered supplements to recording the changes that a long-running periodical can experience over time .', u'Easing catalogers through the RDA : Resource Description and Access transition by showing the continuity with past practice , serials cataloging expert Jones frames the practice within the structure of the FRBR and FRAD conceptual models on which RDA is based .', u"With serials ' special considerations in mind , he Explains the familiarities and differences between AACR2 and RDA Demonstrates how serials catalogers ' work fits in the cooperative context of OCLC , CONSER and NACO Presents examples of how RDA records can ultimately engage with the Semantic Web Occasional serials catalogers and specialists alike will find useful advice here as they explore the structure of the new cataloging framework ."]

entities: [[(u'health information systems', u'Method'), (u'patient safety', u'Metric')], [(u'clinical information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'semantic interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'EHR standards', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OpenEHR', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'dual model approach', u'Method'), (u'this', u'Generic')], [(u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'OpenEHR archetypes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ISO EN 13606', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Model-driven Engineering technologies', u'Method')], [(u'software implementation', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'clinical practice', u'CONJUNCTION', u'patient safety')], [], [], [(u'OpenEHR', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic interoperability'), (u'OpenEHR', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'EHR standards'), (u'OpenEHR', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ISO EN 13606'), (u'ISO EN 13606', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'EHR standards')], [], [(u'Semantic Web and Model-driven Engineering technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Model-driven Engineering technologies')], []]
sentences: [u'The communication between health information systems of hospitals and primary care organizations is currently an important challenge to improve the quality of clinical practice and patient safety .', u'However , clinical information is usually distributed among several independent systems that may be syntactically or semantically incompatible .', u'This fact prevents healthcare professionals from accessing clinical information of patients in an understandable and normalized way .', u'In this work , we address the semantic interoperability of two EHR standards : OpenEHR and ISO EN 13606 .', u'Both standards follow the dual model approach which distinguishes information and knowledge , this being represented through archetypes .', u'The solution presented here is capable of transforming OpenEHR archetypes into ISO EN 13606 and vice versa by combining Semantic Web and Model-driven Engineering technologies .', u'The resulting software implementation has been tested using publicly available collections of archetypes for both standards .']

sentences: [u'Nowadays , most of information saved in companies are as unstructured models .', u'Retrieval and extraction of the information is essential works and importance in semantic web areas .', u'Many of these requirements will be depend on the storage efficiency and unstructured data analysis .', u'Merrill Lynch recently estimated that more than 80 % of all potentially useful business information is unstructured data .', u'The large number and complexity of unstructured data opens up many new possibilities for the analyst .', u'We analyze both structured and unstructured data individually and collectively .', u'Text mining and natural language processing are two techniques with their methods for knowledge discovery form textual context in documents .', u'In this study , text mining and natural language techniques will be illustrated .', u'The aim of this work comparison and evaluation the similarities and differences between text mining and natural language processing for extraction useful information via suitable themselves methods .']

entities: [[(u'Web Services', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'web service ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'mobile devices', u'Generic'), (u'PDAs', u'Method')], [(u'agent', u'Generic'), (u'mobile device', u'Material'), (u'web service ontology', u'Method'), (u'ontology sub-graph', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'empirical software engineering approach', u'Method'), (u'prediction model', u'Method'), (u'ontology sub-graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'sub-graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'metrics', u'Generic'), (u'sub-graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mobile device', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Web Services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'cell phones', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'mobile devices'), (u'PDAs', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'mobile devices')], [], [(u'empirical software engineering approach', u'USED-FOR', u'prediction model')], []]
sentences: [u'As Web Services and the Semantic Web become more important , enabling technologies such as web service ontologies will grow larger .', u'The ability of mobile devices , such as cell phones and PDAs , to download and reason across them will be severely limited .', u'Given that an agent on a mobile device only needs a subset of what is described in a web service ontology , an ontology sub-graph can be created .', u'In this paper , we develop a empirical software engineering approach to build a prediction model to measure the quality in terms of correct query handling of ontology sub-graphs relative to the original ontology mean average recall of the sub-graph compared to the original ontology is used as the quality standard .', u'Our metrics allow speedy selection of a sub-graph for use by a mobile device .']

entities: [[(u'Multiontologies environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic Web and knowledge representation applications', u'Task')], [(u'applications', u'Generic')], [(u'multiontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'bridge ontology', u'Task')], [(u'bridge ontology', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'four-layer structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multiontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic consistency', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic checking and refining methods', u'Method'), (u'bridge ontology', u'Method')], [(u'Bridge ontology', u'Method'), (u'multiontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'Web circumstance', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'unnecessary ontology', u'Task'), (u'ontology reuse', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Multiontologies environments', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic Web and knowledge representation applications')], [], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Multiontologies environments are common in semantic Web and knowledge representation applications .', u'The key problem of these applications is how to represent the complex relationships between ontologies .', u'For the purpose of solving the problem , This work analyzed and classified the relationships between multiontologies , then proposed the theory of bridge ontology .', u'The bridge ontology is a peculiar ontology , has four-layer structures , and is able to express the twelve kinds of relations between multiontologies .', u'Subsequently , on the premise of keeping the semantic consistency , the detailed discussions focused on the semantic checking and refining methods for the multiontologies with bridge ontology .', u'Bridge ontology can be created and maintained conveniently , and is effective in the applications based on multiontologies .', u'It has the advantages of low-cost , scalable , robust in the Web circumstance , avoiding the unnecessary ontology extending and integration , and promoting ontology reuse .']

entities: [[(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'data quality level', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'integration pipeline', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Continuous Integration pipelines', u'Method'), (u'software development', u'Method'), (u'DevOps', u'Method'), (u'continuous source code checks', u'Task')], [(u'RDF data sets', u'Material'), (u'integration pipeline', u'Method'), (u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'software-development', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic-web', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'tools', u'Generic'), (u'CI usage', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'real-world usage scenario', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pipeline', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'data quality level')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'continuous source code checks'), (u'Continuous Integration pipelines', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], [(u'software-development', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic-web')], [], []]
sentences: [u'One approach to continuously achieve a certain data quality level is to use an integration pipeline that continuously checks and monitors the quality of a data set according to defined metrics .', u'This approach is inspired by Continuous Integration pipelines , that have been introduced in the area of software development and DevOps to perform continuous source code checks .', u'By investigating in possible tools to use and discussing the specific requirements for RDF data sets , an integration pipeline is derived that joins current approaches of the areas of software-development and semantic-web as well as reuses existing tools .', u'As these tools have not been built explicitly for CI usage , we evaluate their usability and propose possible workarounds and improvements .', u'Furthermore , a real-world usage scenario is discussed , outlining the benefit of the usage of such a pipeline .']

sentences: [u'For the purpose of extending the Web that is able to understand and process information by machine , Semantic Web shared knowledge in the ontology form .', u'For exquisite query processing , this paper proposes a method to use semantic relations in the ontology as relevance feedback information to query expansion .', u'We made experiment on pharmacy domain .', u'And in order to verify the effectiveness of the semantic relation in the ontology , we compared a keyword based document retrieval system that gives weights by using the frequency information compared with an ontology based document retrieval system that uses relevant information existed in the ontology to a relevant feedback .', u'From the evaluation of the retrieval performance , we knew that search engine used the concepts and relations in ontology for improving precision effectively .', u'Also it used them for the basis of the inference for improvement the retrieval performance .']

entities: [[(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'semantic Web annotations of sound clips', u'Task'), (u'MPEG-7 audio descriptions', u'Material')], [(u'MPEG-7 standard', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneous sources', u'Material')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'adaptation techniques', u'Method')], [(u"`` normalized '' format", u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'uniform and semantically relevant vector spaces', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'computational intelligence techniques', u'Method')], [(u'these', u'Generic'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'MPEG-7 descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'framework', u'Generic')], [(u'classificators', u'Method'), (u'distributed audio resource sets', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic Web annotations of sound clips')], [], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'We present an architecture that provides semantic Web annotations of sound clips described by MPEG-7 audio descriptions .', u'The great flexibility of the MPEG-7 standard makes especially difficult to compare descriptions coming from heterogeneous sources .', u"To cope with this , the architecture would first obtain `` normalized '' versions of the audio descriptions using different adaptation techniques .", u"Once in a `` normalized '' format , descriptions can be then projected into uniform and semantically relevant vector spaces , ready to be processed by a variety of well known computational intelligence techniques .", u'As higher semantic results are then available , these can be exported as interoperable ( RDF ) annotations about the resource that was originally fed into the system .', u'As novel aspect , through the use and interchange of MPEG-7 descriptions , the framework allows building applications ( e.g .', u'classificators ) which can provide annotations on distributed audio resource sets .']

entities: [[(u'structured semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'topic maps', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic model', u'Method'), (u'Web information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'similarity algorithm', u'Method'), (u'conflict detection', u'Task'), (u'elimination', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'conflict detection', u'CONJUNCTION', u'elimination')]]
sentences: [u"Building a structured semantic Web on the layer of information resources , topic maps provide a good semantic model which can make up the existing semantic defects of Web 2.0.As one of the important researches , topic maps merging integrates the same field 's partial topic maps into a new topic map.Through the overall topic map , the effective organization , management , integration and sharing of Web information can be easily realized.In this paper , the general steps of topic maps merging and their functions were summarized.With emphasized on the analysis and judgment of similarity algorithm which is the difficulty of topic maps merging , merging principles and strategies were further highlighted , and topic merging process of high similarity was clarified.Furthermore , the overall scheme of conflict detection and elimination was proposed.Topic maps dynamic updating was compartmentalized into several reasonable phases and topic maps merging research directions were also discussed ."]

entities: [[(u'digital multimedia data', u'Material'), (u'computer scientists', u'Task'), (u'large-scale information management', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Web vision', u'Method'), (u'publishing of information', u'Task')], [(u'rich knowledge bases', u'Material')], [(u'Narratives', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'targeted knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Ontology definitions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multimedia resources', u'Material')], [(u'narrative generation systems', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Semantic Web vision', u'USED-FOR', u'publishing of information'), (u'semanticly accessible resources', u'USED-FOR', u'publishing of information')], [], [], [(u'Ontology definitions', u'USED-FOR', u'multimedia resources')], []]
sentences: [u'An increase in digital multimedia data , has presented computer scientists with the key problem of large-scale information management .', u'The Semantic Web vision proposes the publishing of information as semanticly accessible resources .', u'Current methods of querying and browsing such rich knowledge bases require an understanding of the domain at hand that can not be asked of end-users .', u'This progress report aims to present how Narratives , that are core to our method of conceptualising our environment , can be used to present targeted knowledge to an end-user .', u'Ontology definitions are promoted as the fundamental building blocks for annotating these multimedia resources and are presented as key to this research .', u'The main contribution of this paper is the identification of the shortcomings of existing narrative generation systems , followed by the identification of techniques that could be adopted to overcome these deficiencies .']

sentences: [u'The Semantic Web was designed to represent the enormous data that is existing on the World Wide Web in a machine readable format .', u'The research shows the long period of time that was spent on the Emails for communication and information exchange .', u'Adding the semantics to the existing Email systems could not only provide for the valuable usage of time and resources , but also refreshes the meaning of Email communication .', u'The presented research work examines the ontology extraction process from the Email systems adopting scalable pattern rules that is based on the extracted techniques .', u'The proposed architecture is designed to handle the unstructured Emails and the ontologies that are extracted from the Email which is divided into four main components as follows : the Ontology Learning Component , the Management Component , the Semantic Email Component and the Client Side Plugin .']

sentences: [u'The popularity of Social Networking Sites ( SNSs ) has revolutionized human interaction .', u'Social Networking Sites are meant for people to have a social connection with other people with similar interests .', u'A social networking site creates network communication among the user community .', u'It stores user information which can be used for reaching people of similar interest .', u'Though social networking site serves for communication purposes among special interest groups , they do not have a searching option where we can search people or group with certain features .', u'A person can be searched only if we know the name of the person .', u'Here we present a method using Semantic Web to represent and process social network information so that user queries can be better answered .', u'This paper addresses some of the current limitations of accessing social network data and the semantic approach to overcome those limitations .']

entities: [[(u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'ontology language', u'Material'), (u'W3C', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'OWL', u'Material'), (u'ontology development', u'Task')], [(u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'description logics', u'Method'), (u'specification', u'Generic'), (u'formal semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'OWL reasoners', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'OWL reasoners', u'Method'), (u'real-life ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'computed class hierarchy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SQL queries', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology language'), (u'W3C', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology language')], [(u'description logics', u'USED-FOR', u'OWL')], [], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'OWL reasoners'), (u'real-life ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'OWL reasoners')]]
sentences: [u'OWL is an ontology language developed by the W3C , and although initially developed for the Semantic Web , OWL has rapidly become a de facto standard for ontology development in general .', u'The design of OWL was heavily influenced by research in description logics , and the specification includes a formal semantics .', u'One of the goals of this formal approach was to provide interoperability : different OWL reasoners should provide the same results when processing the same ontologies .', u'In this paper we present a system that allows users : ( a ) to test and compare OWL reasoners using an extensible library of real-life ontologies ; ( b ) to check the correctness of the reasoners by comparing the computed class hierarchy ; ( c ) to compare the performance of the reasoners when performing this task ; and ( d ) to use SQL queries to analyse and present the results in any way they see fit .']

sentences: [u'Now many companies want to change their own e-learning methods .', u"According to Michael 's report , enterprise 2.0 and new paradigm is required for current systems .", u'Until now , many IT managers regard e-learning system and ERP system separately .', u'Due to emerging of web 2.0 and semantic web and collaborative learning , many IT managers begin to think that there are few differences between e-learning contents and working ERP knowledge .', u"There are many kinds of research for new e-learning Framework for collaborative learning environment by Korean Government 's Strategic Technology Development Project .", u'But there are a few serious problems .', u'Firstly , how to combine heterogeneous information into one combined result ?', u'Secondary , how to suggest which contents is optimal search result for each working context ?', u'We suggest URI based collaborative filtering to give optimal search result for business context includes e-learning contents .']

relations: [[(u'semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'metadata'), (u'metadata', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology')], [(u'RDF documents', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RDF Schema documents'), (u'metadata', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RDF Schema documents')], [(u'metadata', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology'), (u'metadata', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RDF'), (u'metadata', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RDF Schema'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RDF Schema')], [(u'information resources', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic associations')], [(u'graph model', u'USED-FOR', u'documents')], [(u'RDF Schema', u'USED-FOR', u'schematic information'), (u'path expressions', u'USED-FOR', u'schematic information')], [(u'query patterns', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF data'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RDF Schema')], [(u'path expressions', u'USED-FOR', u'indexing structures')]]
sentences: [u'In the semantic Web , metadata and ontology plays important roles for advanced information retrieval systems .', u'A large amount of RDF documents for describing metadata and RDF Schema documents for representing ontology is made available .', u'Therefore , many studies to store and query metadata and ontology in RDF and RDF Schema are required .', u'Unlike XML , RDF and RDF Schema express information resources and semantic associations between resources on the Web .', u'And these documents can be represented based on graph model .', u'To retrieve efficiently RDF data , the schematic information defined by RDF Schema and methods for querying by using path expressions are required .', u'For these necessities , we define query patterns to retrieve RDF data in RDF and RDF Schema .', u'Then for retrieving those query patterns efficiently , we extract path expressions in RDF and RDF Schema graph models and construct indexing structures based on path expressions']

entities: [[(u'vagueness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Proof layers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'probabilistic fuzzy description logic programs', u'Method'), (u'fuzzy description logics', u'Method'), (u'fuzzy logic programs', u'Method'), (u'stratified nonmonotonic negation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'probabilistic uncertainty', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'uniform framework', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'probabilistic uncertainty', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy vagueness', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'probabilistic fuzzy description logic programs', u'Method')], [(u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'query processing', u'Task'), (u'probabilistic fuzzy description logic programs', u'Task'), (u'query processing', u'Method'), (u'polynomial time', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data complexity', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[(u'uncertainty', u'CONJUNCTION', u'vagueness'), (u'Rules', u'CONJUNCTION', u'vagueness'), (u'fuzzy description logics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'fuzzy logic programs'), (u'fuzzy description logics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'stratified nonmonotonic negation'), (u'fuzzy logic programs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Proof layers'), (u'fuzzy logic programs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'probabilistic uncertainty'), (u'stratified nonmonotonic negation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'fuzzy logic programs'), (u'uniform framework', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'probabilistic uncertainty', u'CONJUNCTION', u'fuzzy vagueness')], [], [(u'algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'query processing'), (u'algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'probabilistic fuzzy description logic programs'), (u'polynomial time', u'USED-FOR', u'query processing')]]
sentences: [u'This paper is directed towards an infrastructure for handling both uncertainty and vagueness in the Rules , Logic , and Proof layers of the Semantic Web.More concretely , we present probabilistic fuzzy description logic programs , which combine fuzzy description logics , fuzzy logic programs ( with stratified nonmonotonic negation ) , and probabilistic uncertainty in a uniform framework for the Semantic Web .', u'We define important concepts dealing with both probabilistic uncertainty and fuzzy vagueness , such as the expected truth value of a crisp sentence and the probability of a vague sentence .', u'Furthermore , we describe a shopping agent example , which gives evidence of the usefulness of probabilistic fuzzy description logic programs in realistic web applications .', u'In the extended report , we also provide algorithms for query processing in probabilistic fuzzy description logic programs , and we delineate a special case where query processing can be done in polynomial time in the data complexity .']

entities: [[(u'healthcare systems', u'Task'), (u'treatment quality', u'Metric'), (u'domain experts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'IT people', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'rule-based healthcare system', u'Method')], [(u'classification algorithms', u'Method'), (u'decision rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rule engine', u'Method'), (u'generated decision rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'diagnostic message', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'treatment adaptation', u'Method')], [(u'treatment adaptation scheme', u'Method')], [(u'rule-based system', u'Method'), (u'diabetes', u'Task'), (u'RBHS system', u'Method')], [(u'diet ontology', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'domain experts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'IT people')], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'rule-based healthcare system')], [], [], [], [], [(u'rule-based system', u'USED-FOR', u'diabetes')], [(u'diet ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'diabetic and non-diabetic users')]]
sentences: [u'One of the main focuses on healthcare systems is to increase treatment quality and the development of a fully automated healthcare system , without intervention from domain experts and IT people .', u'In this paper , we propose a framework that performs rule-based healthcare system ( RBHS ) .', u'In the first step , with the use of classification algorithms the decision rules are generated .', u'Then the rule engine executes the generated decision rules and provides the proper diagnostic message .', u'In the next step , the system reason over the semantic web rule language ( SWRL ) -based rules and gives the treatment adaptation result based on the diagnosis .', u'During execution the treatment adaptation scheme is personalised .', u'We use a rule-based system for diabetes as an example to illustrate how the RBHS system works .', u'In addition to that we construct diet ontology for diabetic and non-diabetic users .']

entities: [[(u'graph-based Knowledge Representation formalism', u'Method'), (u'representation', u'Task'), (u'manipulation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dependency structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'linguistic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Explanatory and Combinatorial Dictionary', u'Material'), (u'Meaning-Text Theory framework', u'Method')], [(u'semantic web formalisms', u'Method'), (u'conceptual graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Unit Graphs framework', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'Unit Graphs', u'Method'), (u'actantial structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hierarchy of circumstantial symbols', u'Method'), (u'unit identifiers', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'model semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Unit Graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'representation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'manipulation'), (u'representation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'query'), (u'manipulation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'query'), (u'manipulation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dependency structures'), (u'query', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reasoning'), (u'dependency structures', u'CONJUNCTION', u'query'), (u'dependency structures', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dependency structures'), (u'dependency structures', u'CONJUNCTION', u'linguistic knowledge'), (u'Explanatory and Combinatorial Dictionary', u'USED-FOR', u'Meaning-Text Theory framework')], [(u'semantic web formalisms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'conceptual graphs'), (u'conceptual graphs', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web formalisms')], [], []]
sentences: [u'We are interested in a graph-based Knowledge Representation formalism that would allow for the representation , manipulation , query , and reasoning over dependency structures , and linguistic knowledge of the Explanatory and Combinatorial Dictionary in the Meaning-Text Theory framework .', u'Neither the semantic web formalisms nor the conceptual graphs appear to be suitable for this task , and this led to the introduction of the new Unit Graphs framework .', u'This paper first introduces the foundational concepts of this framework : Unit Graphs are defined over a support that contains : i ) a hierarchy of unit types which is strongly driven by their actantial structure , ii ) a hierarchy of circumstantial symbols , and iii ) a set of unit identifiers .', u'Then , this paper provides all of these objects with a model semantics that enables to define the notion of semantic consequence between Unit Graphs .']

entities: [[(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'implementation approach', u'Method'), (u'e-learning applications', u'Task')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'e-learning infrastructure', u'Method'), (u'Grid computing technology', u'Method'), (u'e-learning objects execution', u'Task')], [(u'e-learning object', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'structuring e-learning applications/courses', u'Task')], [(u'infrastructure', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'learning objects requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Grid resources description', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'E-learning standard LOM', u'Method'), (u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'E-learning applications', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'implementation approach', u'USED-FOR', u'e-learning applications')], [(u'e-learning infrastructure', u'USED-FOR', u'e-learning objects execution'), (u'Grid computing technology', u'USED-FOR', u'e-learning infrastructure'), (u'Grid computing technology', u'USED-FOR', u'e-learning objects execution')], [], [(u'infrastructure', u'USED-FOR', u'learning objects requirements'), (u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'infrastructure'), (u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'learning objects requirements')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper presents an architecture along with an implementation approach to build efficient e-learning applications .', u'In this architecture , e-learning infrastructure uses the Grid computing technology which chooses the best available resources for e-learning objects execution .', u'An e-learning object is defined as the unit for structuring e-learning applications/courses .', u'Furthermore , the infrastructure uses the Semantic Web to specify the learning objects requirements as well as the Grid resources description .', u'A broker entity is developed within the architecture as a mediator who receives performance requirements of the learning object specified using the E-learning standard LOM and the available resources on the Grid that are required to execute that object The proposed architecture is expected to guarantee the optimum allocation of available Grid resources to satisfy the performance requirements of E-learning applications .']

relations: [[(u'wireless networks', u'CONJUNCTION', u'portable devices')], [(u'environments service', u'CONJUNCTION', u'resource components')], [], [(u'solution', u'USED-FOR', u'ad hoc composition of pervasive computing components'), (u'Web services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web paradigms')], []]
sentences: [u'Due to the large success of wireless networks and portable devices , the pervasive computing paradigm is becoming a reality .', u'One of the most challenging objectives to be achieved in pervasive computing environments is to allow a user to perform a task by composing on the fly the environments service and resource components .', u'However , existing approaches commonly assume that networked components have been developed to integrate in terms of interfaces and conversations , which restricts the users ability to fully exploit the diversity of the pervasive computing components .', u'In order to overcome this constraint , we propose a solution for ad hoc composition of pervasive computing components , based on the Web services and Semantic Web paradigms .', u'The main feature of our solution is the ability to integrate on the fly a number of Web services conversation fragments to reconstruct a conversation enabling the target user task .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic-Web languages', u'Material'), (u'classical theories', u'Method'), (u'classical first-order logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'description logics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rule languages', u'Material'), (u'logic programming', u'Method')], [(u'Existing approaches', u'Generic'), (u'SWRL', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dl-programs', u'Method'), (u'DL+log', u'Method'), (u'( nonmonotonic ) rules bases', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'SWRL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Existing approaches'), (u'SWRL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dl-programs'), (u'dl-programs', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Existing approaches'), (u'dl-programs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'DL+log'), (u'DL+log', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Existing approaches')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'In the context of current efforts around Semantic-Web languages , the combination of classical theories in classical first-order logic ( and in particular of ontologies in various description logics ) with rule languages rooted in logic programming is receiving considerable attention .', u'Existing approaches such as SWRL , dl-programs , and DL+log , differ significantly in the way ontologies interact with ( nonmonotonic ) rules bases .', u'In this paper , we identify fundamental representational issues which need to be addressed by such combinations and formulate a number of formal principles which help to characterize and classify existing and possible future approaches to the combination of rules and classical theories .', u'We use the formal principles to explicate the underlying assumptions of current approaches .', u'Finally , we propose a number of settings , based on our analysis of the representational issues and the fundamental principles underlying current approaches .']

sentences: [u"As mobile technologies become widespread , new challenges are facing the research community to develop lightweight learning services adapted to the learner 's profile , context , and task at hand .", u'This paper attempts to solve some of these challenges by proposing a knowledge-driven recommender for mobile learning on the Semantic Web .', u"The contribution of this work is an approach for context integration and aggregation using an upper ontology space and a unified reasoning mechanism to adapt the learning sequence and the learning content based on the learner 's activity , background , used technology , and surrounding environment .", u'Whenever context change occurs , the system identifies the new contextual features and translates them into new adaptation constraints in the operating environment .', u'The proposed system has been implemented and tested on various mobile devices .', u'The experimental results show many learning scenarios to demonstrate the usefulness of the system in practice .']

sentences: [u'With the rapid development of the Semantic Web , the ontology technology has played an increasingly important role in collaborative System .', u'The concept relatedness measure of heterogeneous ontology can be used to support information retrieval and information sharing among different users .', u'Traditional method to solve the question of similarity between the concepts is based on the concept distance or information content between the two concepts of a single ontology concept tree .', u'This paper presents a hybrid method to calculate the concept relatedness of heterogeneous ontologies .', u"It is divided into two parts : The first is a fixed weighted measure based on the concept of the tree which was combined by multiple heterogeneous ontologies in a mapping way ; the other variable calculation is based on users ' communications .", u'We have applied this method in our experimental platform IPVita and been proved to be a good one .']

sentences: [u'Our world today is generating huge amounts of graph data such as social networks , biological networks , and the semantic web .', u'Many of these real-world graphs are edge-labeled graphs , i.e. , each edge has a label that denotes the relationship between the two vertices connected by the edge .', u'A fundamental research problem on these labeled graphs is how to handle the label-constraint reachability query : Can vertex u reach vertex v through a path whose edge labels are constrained by a set of labels ?', u'In this work , we introduce a novel tree-based index framework which utilizes the directed maximal weighted spanning tree algorithm and sampling techniques to maximally compress the generalized transitive closure for the labeled graphs .', u'An extensive experimental evaluation on both real and synthetic datasets demonstrates the efficiency of our approach in answering label-constraint reachability queries .']

sentences: [u'This article characterizes key weaknesses in the ability of current digital libraries to support scholarly inquiry , and as a way to address these , proposes computational services grounded in semiformal models of the naturalistic argumentation commonly found in research literatures .', u'It is argued that a design priority is to balance formal expressiveness with usability , making it critical to coevolve the modeling scheme with appropriate user interfaces for argument construction and analysis .', u'We specify the requirements for an argument modeling scheme for use by untrained researchers and describe the resulting ontology , contrasting it with other domain modeling and semantic web approaches , before discussing passive and intelligent user interfaces designed to support analysts in the construction , navigation , and analysis of scholarly argument structures in a Web-based environment .', u'2007 Wiley Periodicals , Inc. Int J Int Syst 22 : 1747 , 2007 .']

sentences: [u'Abstract Issues concerning tuning and temperament bear relevance to music research in areas such as historical musicology , performance and recording studies , and music perception .', u'We have recently demonstrated that it is possible to classify keyboard temperament automatically from audio recordings of standard musical works to the extent of accurately distinguishing between six different temperaments often used in harpsichord recordings .', u'The current paper extends this work by combining digital signal processing with semantic computing and demonstrates the use of the temperament classifier in a Semantic Web environment .', u'We present the Temperament Ontology which models the main concepts , relationships , and parameters of musical temperament , and facilitates the description and inference of various characteristics of specific temperaments .', u'We then describe TempEst , a web application for temperament estimation .', u'TempEst integrates the classifier with ontology-based information processing in order to provide an e ...']

sentences: [u'The World Wide Web serves as the primary source of many informa- tion requirements .', u'The Semantic Web and related technologies provide an in- frastructure to organise data based on its semantics .', u'Since the web has grown exponentially , it is difficult to keep track of all individual preferences .', u'The sys- tem proposed here , Boek , enables users to organise semantically a subset of web data .', u'Boek can store links to web pages and retrieve them later based on semantic information .', u'Boek also holds reserved space for its users to store their favourite data semantically .', u'The individual data models can then be combined to form a universal data store which can then act as a knowledge base for eve- ryone .', u'Future work will involve extending Boek to address a number of do- mains such as business , medicine , education and the creative industries .']

entities: [[(u'Pervasive computing environments', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'sensitive information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'environments', u'Generic')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'relationship-aware access control', u'Task'), (u'semantic Web rule engines', u'Method'), (u'centralized design', u'Method')], [(u'information relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'bundling-based', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pervasive computing', u'Method'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'distributed , certificate-based access control architecture', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'access control', u'Method'), (u'rule engines', u'Method')], [(u'design', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'relationship-aware access control'), (u'semantic Web rule engines', u'USED-FOR', u'approaches'), (u'centralized design', u'USED-FOR', u'approaches')], [(u'bundling-based', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'information relationships'), (u'granularity-based )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'information relationships'), (u'them', u'PART-OF', u'distributed , certificate-based access control architecture'), (u'distributed , certificate-based access control architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'them')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Pervasive computing environments offer a multitude of information services that provide potentially complex types of information .', u'Therefore , when running access control for sensitive information , these environments need to take relationships between information into account .', u'Other approaches to relationship-aware access control ( e.g. , based on semantic Web rule engines ) are often expensive and based on a centralized design .', u'In this paper , we identify three types of information relationships ( bundling-based , combination-based , and granularity-based ) that are common and important in pervasive computing , and we integrate support for them in distributed , certificate-based access control architecture .', u'In our approach , access control is fully distributed while sophisticated rule engines can still be used to deal with more complex access control cases .', u'To demonstrate the feasibility of our design , we give a complexity analysis of the architecture and a performance analysis of a prototype implementation']

entities: [[(u'controlled natural language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'interface language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'formal language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'non-specialists', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'CNL', u'Method'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'assertional statements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'terminological statements', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'CNL', u'Method'), (u'ecient reasoning', u'Task'), (u'assertional and terminological knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'model builder', u'Method')], [(u'RDF- based notation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'controlled natural language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'CNL', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'In this paper , I will show how a controlled natural language ( CNL ) can be used as an interface language to the Semantic Web .', u'Instead of working with a formal language based on RDF that is dicult to write and understand for non-specialists , I will argue that a CNL can be employed to describe resources on the Web ( via assertional statements ) and to construct ontologies ( via terminological statements ) .', u'I will present a complete rule set written in CNL that allows for ecient reasoning over the assertional and terminological knowledge with the help of a model builder .', u'There is no need to formally encode this knowledge in an RDF- based notation .', u'Everything can be described in a uniform way on the level of the controlled natural language provided that we support the user of the CNL with an intelligent writing tool .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'evolutionary algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'encodings'), (u'EA )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'evolutionary algorithm')], [], [], [(u'features', u'USED-FOR', u'document clustering tasks')]]
sentences: [u"Document analysis and its associated research underpins Web intelligence and the envisaged 'semantic Web ' .", u'A key issue is how to encode a document without losing salient information .', u'Current research almost always uses fixed-length vectors based on word ( term ) frequency ( TF ) and/or variants thereof .', u'We explore the question of alternative encodings , and we search for such encodings using an evolutionary algorithm ( EA ) .', u'These alternatives consider a variety of other features that can be extracted from a document , and the EA explores the space of weighted combinations of these .', u'Tests on the BankSearch dataset were able to find encodings which outperformed previous results using TF-based encodings .', u'Among several tentative findings it seems clear that the ideal encoding is highly task-dependent , and we can recommend certain features as useful for specific types of document clustering tasks .']

sentences: [u'Presents a new standard for doing electronic businessebXML.First , introduces the background of ebXML in electronic business by viewing the development of electronic data interchange.Describes the rationale for ebXML , lists some scenarios where ebXML can be used , and provides a brief tour of the technical architecture , design objectives and some significant components , in order to know ebXML for more.There are many similar standard , SOAP , semantic Web and Web service for example.People are easy to cause confusion when they compare ebXML with others , except when they make sure that who is governor.The goal of ebXML is not only to purchase in the streamline , transfer , compute price of goods and so on , but also to supply by law , to do insurance and so on.Stocking , transfers or pledge that produce is uninterrupted which both have relation with ebXML in nature .']

sentences: [u'This paper reports on the design , organisation and evaluation of a Semantic Web application designed to deliver a collaborative tagging and navigation system for a digital online museum .', u'The key technical features of our applicationcalled the Virtual Museum of the Pacificcentre on a browsing and retrieval interface based on formal concept analysis , query-extension for text search over a concept lattice , an extensible distributed data model to support collaborative tagging and its Web Services implementation .', u'The objective of the project was to provide a practical demonstrator of an formal concept analysis-based system for browsing museum content , while reporting on its impact to the organisational environment and its relevance among stakeholder groups .', u'This paper presents its key design features , an analysis of our collaboration with the Australian Museum and the results of two independent requirements gathering and usability evaluation sessions .']

entities: [[(u'ontology management', u'Task'), (u'methodological and evolutionary aspects of ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'these', u'Generic'), (u'distributed and collaborative worlds', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic agent system', u'Method')], [(u'knowledge-intensive and community-driven systems', u'Method'), (u'knowledge sharing and communication', u'Task')], [(u'ontological and methodological foundation', u'Method'), (u'community evolution processes', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Semantic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'distributed and collaborative worlds')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Research in ontology management has reached a certain level of maturity , however , there is still little understanding of , and technological support for , the methodological and evolutionary aspects of ontologies as resources .', u'Yet these are crucial in distributed and collaborative worlds such as the Semantic Web , where ontologies and their communities of use naturally and mutually co-evolve .', u'Through a deep understanding of the real-time , community-driven , evolution of so-called ontologies , a semantic agent system can be made operationally relevant and sustainable over long periods of time .', u'Such a paradigm shift in knowledge-intensive and community-driven systems would affect knowledge sharing and communication across diverse communities in business , industry , and society .', u'In this paper , we give an overview of the practical and theoretical challenges and limitations , and based on that introduce an ontological and methodological foundation for community evolution processes .']

sentences: [u'Currently information management in public administration is discussed under the aspects of information production , effective information provision and information logistics .', u'The authors point out why the provision of Open Government Data shall be seen as a core element of strategic information management in the public sector and why extensive literature on the subject will be needed in future .', u'The authors have designed an architectural model for Linked Open Government Data based on Good Practice Models in administration and economics .', u'The proposed model is based on current wide spread technologies of Semantic Web , using Tim Berners-Lee 5-star Model .', u'Simple APIs based on RESTful Services are necessary to take advantage of benefits of Peer Production and to guarantee compatibility with the growing market of mobile applications .', u'Issues concerning licencing and legal liability are discussed in the concluding section .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web browsers', u'Method'), (u'RDF data', u'Material'), (u'machine consumption', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'solutions', u'Generic'), (u'representation paradigm', u'Method'), (u'RDF models', u'Method'), (u'content selection', u'Method'), (u'content formatting', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'ad hoc mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'RDF presentation knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RDF content', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Fresnel', u'Method'), (u'browser-independent extensible vocabulary', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF display concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'content formatting', u'CONJUNCTION', u'styling')], [(u'ad hoc mechanisms', u'USED-FOR', u'tool')], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic Web browsers and other tools aimed at displaying RDF data to end users are all concerned with the same problem : presenting content primarily intended for machine consumption in a human-readable way .', u'Their solutions differ but in the end address the same two high-level issues , no matter the underlying representation paradigm : specifying ( i ) what information contained in RDF models should be presented ( content selection ) and ( ii ) how this information should be presented ( content formatting and styling ) .', u'However , each tool currently relies on its own ad hoc mechanisms and vocabulary for specifying RDF presentation knowledge , making it difficult to share and reuse such knowledge across applications .', u'Recognizing the general need for presenting RDF content to users and wanting to promote the exchange of presentation knowledge , we developed Fresnel as a browser-independent extensible vocabulary of core RDF display concepts .']

entities: [[(u'technology roadmapping issues', u'Task'), (u'disruptive technologies', u'Method')], [(u'technology watch techniques', u'Method')], [(u'database-supported process', u'Method')], [(u'ontology-based technology watch system', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'technology watch', u'Method')], [(u'technology watch function', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'This paper highlights technology roadmapping issues for advanced industries , in particular with regard to disruptive technologies .', u'It examines the currently available range of technology watch techniques and considers the potential offered by the emerging Semantic Web .', u"This paper introduces the technology watch research work of the University of Nottingham 's Responsive Manufacturing Group and describes a database-supported process that has been applied in the UK 's aerospace industry .", u'It also describes an ontology-based technology watch system that has been applied in prototype form at a major aerospace manufacturer .', u'A method has been developed to evaluate the level of potential threat that an emerging technology represents and to attach a value to a technology watch project that alleviates that threat level .', u'This paper concludes that an effective technology watch function can significantly mitigate the risks that high technology companies face .']

sentences: [u'The object of this paper is to make learners have study environment to study adaptively , anywhere , anyone , anytime and , just in time , not disturbed by time and place .', u'So , it helps learners find solutions to questions and problems which they can face in the process of learning .', u'This paper desires to find possibility of ontology which can solve problems after considering semantic web and theory of ontology by studying existing reference books .', u'As ontology has the structure that can guess the data which is not showed clearly , so it can make the result more accurate and be the knowledge every learner sympathize and trust .', u'I established the ontology frame about the electronic circuit which learners can solve their questions everywhere , anytime , and reconfirm what they studied , so I studied on application for e-learning based on ontology .']
