sentences: [u'Web 3.0 is an evolving extension of the web 2.0 scenario .', u'The perceptions regarding web 3.0 is different from person to person .', u'Web 3.0 Architecture supports ubiquitous connectivity , network computing , open identity , intelligent web , distributed databases and intelligent applications .', u'Some of the technologies which lead to the design and development of web 3.0 applications are Artificial intelligence , Automated reasoning , Cognitive architecture , Semantic web .', u'An attempt is made to capture the requirements of Students inline with web 3.0 so as to bridge the gap between the design and development of web 3.0 applications and requirements among Students .', u'Maximum Spanning Tree modeling of the requirements facilitate the identification of key areas and key attributes in the design and development of software products for Students in Web 3.0 using Discriminant analysis .', u'Keywords : Web 3.0 , Discriminant analysis , Design and Development , Model , Maximum Spanning Tree 1 .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'knowledge acquisition research', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'local knowledge base', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'knowledge-rich systems', u'Method'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'assumptions', u'Generic')], [(u'Knowledge-rich systems', u'Method')], [(u'interactive knowledge capture', u'Task'), (u'collaborative knowledge sharing', u'Task'), (u'Web volunteers', u'Material'), (u'knowledge provenance', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge acquisition research')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web has radically changed the landscape of knowledge acquisition research .', u'It used to be the case that a single user would edit a local knowledge base , that the user would have domain expertise to add to the system , and that the system would have a centralized knowledge base and reasoner .', u'The world surrounding knowledge-rich systems changed drastically with the advent of the Web , and many of the original assumptions were no longer a given .', u'Those assumptions had to be revisited and addressed in combination with new challenges that were put forward .', u'Knowledge-rich systems today are distributed , have many users with different degrees of expertise , and integrate many shared knowledge sources of varying quality .', u'Recent work in interactive knowledge capture includes new and exciting research on collaborative knowledge sharing , collecting knowledge from Web volunteers , and capturing knowledge provenance .']

entities: [[], [], [], [(u'questo contesto', u'OtherScientificTerm')], []]
sentences: [u'Il rapido percorso di evoluzione delle tecnologie Web ha portato alla sempre maggiore diffusione di applicazioni in grado di facilitare la nascita e lo sviluppo di estese reti sociali .', u'Da tempo il World Wide Web Consortium e differenti gruppi di ricerca lavorano alla integrazione di tali applicazioni con le tecnologie proprie del Semantic Web .', u'Di un simile sviluppo potra beneficiare anche il settore delle-learning e , piu in particolare , ne guadagneranno gli ambienti dedicati a supportare processi di apprendimento e di progettazione didattica .', u"In questo contesto , e in una prospettiva socio-costruttivista , gli autori presentano l'utilizzo dei Semantic Wiki come strumento per la progettazione collaborativa di contenuti didattici .", u'Se ne discuteranno le prospettive e le strategie di applicazione che facilitino lattivazione di processi di apprendimento significativo , senza trascurare gli aspetti legati alla strutturazione della conoscenza e al riuso delle risorse didattiche .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'Web of Trust', u'Method')], [], [(u'formal language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'well-defined semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'expressions', u'Generic')], [(u'treatment', u'Generic')], [(u'language and reasoning system', u'Method')], [(u'language and reasoning techniques', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'well-defined semantics', u'FEATURE-OF', u'formal language')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The newly envisioned Semantic Web contains as a component what may be called a Web of Trust , consisting of the trust relationships held between its participants .', u'In terms of this , the degree to which participant A believes what is believed by participant B depends on the degree to which A trusts B .', u'This paper presents a formal language with well-defined semantics within which such a participant ( or agent ) can express the relevant conditions of belief and trust , and outlines some key techniques for reasoning with these expressions .', u'Novel in this treatment is the use of linguistic , rather than numeric , measures of belief .', u'The aim in this is to make the language and reasoning system more intuitive for the human user .', u'Also novel is an explicit delineation of the context within which the language and reasoning techniques are to be applied .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web approach', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'Method')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'World Wide Web', u'Material'), (u'natural-language text', u'Material')], [(u'categorization', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology concept', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'search engine', u'Method'), (u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'user profiling', u'Method'), (u'searching process', u'Task')], [(u'searching time', u'Metric')], [(u'hybrid techniques', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'categorization', u'Task'), (u'user profiling concept', u'Method')], [(u'user profiling', u'Task'), (u'similarity measure', u'Metric')], [(u'WordNet', u'Material')], [(u'data arrangement', u'Metric'), (u'time usage', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'categorization', u'CONJUNCTION', u'user profiling concept')], [], [(u'WordNet', u'CONJUNCTION', u'UTHM Onto')], [(u'data arrangement', u'CONJUNCTION', u'time usage')]]
sentences: [u'Semantic Web approach with the assistance of ontology is widely used to give more reliable application in retrieving information and knowledge .', u'It is capable to discover the World Wide Web ( WWW ) that is presented in natural-language text .', u'Based on previous research , incorporating categorization with ontology concept has proven to give better results .', u'However , performing hybrid of the search engine using another technique that is user profiling has a promising potency in enhancing the searching process .', u'Utilizing searching time and giving relevant results are the contributions of this research .', u'The proposed hybrid techniques integrate ontologies , categorization and user profiling concept .', u'In user profiling , similarity measure is adopted in making comparison between two different ontologies .', u'WordNet and UTHM Onto are the independent ontologies used in this process .', u'The preliminary experimental results have given interesting results in terms of data arrangement and time usage .']

entities: [[(u'natural language text', u'Material'), (u'web', u'Material'), (u'informa- tion', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'artificial intelligence', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web knowl- edge bases', u'Task')], [(u'unrestricted natural language text', u'Material'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'RDF', u'Method')], [(u'com- mon sense knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'generic statements', u'Material'), (u'Coee', u'Method'), (u'automatically identifying generic statements', u'Task')], [(u'Wikipedia xml corpus', u'Material'), (u'common sense knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'annotation of generic entities and relations', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'Coee', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'generic statements')], [], []]
sentences: [u"Much of the natural language text found on the web contains various kinds of generic or `` common sense '' knowledge , and this informa- tion has long been recognized by artificial intelligence as an important supplement to more formal approaches to building Semantic Web knowl- edge bases .", u"Consequently , we are exploring the possibility of automati- cally identifying `` common sense '' statements from unrestricted natural language text and mapping them to RDF .", u'Our hypothesis is that com- mon sense knowledge is often expressed in the form of generic statements such as Coee is a popular beverage , and thus our work has focussed on the challenge of automatically identifying generic statements .', u'We have been using the Wikipedia xml corpus as a rich source of common sense knowledge .', u'For evaluation , we have been using the existing annotation of generic entities and relations in the ace 2005 corpus .']

entities: [[(u'Semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ecommerce', u'Task')], [(u'Web contents', u'Material'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web resources', u'Material')], [(u'Business process customization', u'Task'), (u'knowledge based semantic web', u'Method'), (u'consumer centric methodology', u'Method')], [(u'Business processes contents', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'repugnancies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'web services', u'Method'), (u'business process execution', u'Task')], [(u'mapped producer centric process', u'Method'), (u'business process services', u'Task'), (u'consumer centric process', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantics', u'PART-OF', u'ecommerce')], [], [(u'knowledge based semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'Business process customization')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Semantics plays a major role in modern world of ecommerce .', u'Web contents are systematized by adding semantics to current web resources .', u'Business process customization constitutes knowledge based semantic web that provides a shift from producer centric to consumer centric methodology .', u'Business processes contents need customization in order to eliminate the repugnancies and make business process in web more promiscuous for customers .', u'Ontology based dynamic customization of web services divides up with the customization of web services , which are capable of machinating contents of business processes and solves discrepancies on the runtime context of business process execution .', u'The mapped producer centric process is accessed by the consumer centric after the business process is instantiated by grouping and also maps the contents of various web services relevant to business process services in relation to the consumer centric process .']

entities: [[(u'SPARQL query language', u'Material'), (u'semantic web and web intelligence', u'Task')], [(u'large data query execution', u'Task'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL query optimizer', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL query engine', u'Method'), (u'query execution', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'query planning and optimization', u'Task'), (u'extended query pattern graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heuristics', u'Method')], [(u'SPARQL query statement representation', u'Method'), (u'query triple patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'heuristics', u'Method')], [(u'query planning methods', u'Method'), (u'Corese query engine', u'Method'), (u'BSBM benchmark', u'Method')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'SPARQL query engine', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'SPARQL query language', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web and web intelligence')], [(u'SPARQL query optimizer', u'PART-OF', u'SPARQL query engine'), (u'SPARQL query optimizer', u'USED-FOR', u'query execution'), (u'SPARQL query engine', u'USED-FOR', u'query execution')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'query planning and optimization'), (u'extended query pattern graph', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], [], [], [(u'BSBM benchmark', u'USED-FOR', u'query planning methods')], [(u'query execution time', u'FEATURE-OF', u'SPARQL query engine')]]
sentences: [u'SPARQL query language plays a significant role in developing semantic web and web intelligence .', u'In order to deal with large data query execution over RDF , SPARQL query optimizer is an essential component in the SPARQL query engine for improving query execution performance .', u'This paper proposes an approach for performing query planning and optimization based on an extended query pattern graph and heuristics .', u'First , this paper generalizes SPARQL query statement representation by taking other expressions into account , aiming at overcoming the limitations of only using basic query triple patterns .', u'Second , this paper presents the heuristics for estimating the cost of executing query triple pattern .', u'The proposed query planning methods are implemented within Corese query engine and are evaluated using BSBM benchmark .', u'The results suggest that the proposed methods can optimize effectively the query execution time of SPARQL query engine .']

entities: [[(u'sketch theory', u'Method'), (u'knowledge management framework', u'Method'), (u'logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'relational algebra', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Sketch theory', u'Method'), (u'modularity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'instance data', u'Material')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'constraint-preserving map', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Q-trees', u'Method'), (u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'inference', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'logical deduction', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Ideas', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'alignment problem', u'Task'), (u'sketches', u'Material')], [(u'Sketch theory', u'Method'), (u'contextual view', u'Task')], [(u'program', u'Generic'), (u'sketch theory', u'Method'), (u'knowledge management technologies', u'Method'), (u'models', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'knowledge management framework', u'USED-FOR', u'sketch theory'), (u'logic', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web'), (u'semantic web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'relational algebra')], [(u'instance data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'uncertainty')], [(u'It', u'USED-FOR', u'constraint-preserving map')], [(u'Q-trees', u'USED-FOR', u'inference'), (u'technique', u'USED-FOR', u'inference'), (u'it', u'COMPARE', u'logical deduction')], [], [], [(u'Sketch theory', u'USED-FOR', u'contextual view')], [(u'program', u'USED-FOR', u'sketch theory')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we give an overview of sketch theory as a knowledge management framework and discuss its strengths relative to logic , the semantic web and relational algebra .', u'Sketch theory , for example , supports modularity among meta-data , instance data and uncertainty .', u'It also provides a notion of constraint-preserving map .', u'We explore Q-trees as a technique for inference with sketches and compare it to logical deduction .', u'Ideas can be formulated in distinct ways even within a fixed formalism .', u'We illustrate solution of this alignment problem using sketches and the notion of Morita equivalence of logical theories .', u'Sketch theory provides rich notions of contextual view with which we compute illustrative examples .', u'Finally , we outline a program for advancing sketch theory as a complement to other knowledge management technologies and discuss transformations between sketches and other models .']

entities: [[(u'interactive 3D content elements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web pages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'Semantic Web approach', u'Method'), (u'web resources', u'Material')], [(u'semantic concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'designing content', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'interactive 3D content', u'Task')], [(u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'semantic representation of 3D content', u'Task'), (u'3D content', u'Material')], [(u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'3D content', u'Material'), (u'semantic description standards', u'Method'), (u'application domains', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'interactive 3D content')], [(u'solution', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic representation of 3D content')], [(u'3D content', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic description standards'), (u'web', u'FEATURE-OF', u'application domains')]]
sentences: [u'Dependencies between interactive 3D content elements are typically more complex than dependencies between standard web pages as they may relate to different aspects of the content-spatial , temporal , structural , logical and behavioural .', u'The Semantic Web approach helps in making data understandable and processable for both humans and computers by providing common concepts for describing web resources .', u'However , semantic concepts may be also used to improve the process of designing content .', u'In this paper , a new approach to semantic multi-layered design of interactive 3D content is presented .', u'The proposed solution provides a semantic representation of 3D content in multiple layers reflecting diverse aspects of 3D content .', u'The presented solution conforms to well-established 3D content and semantic description standards and-therefore-may facilitate creation , dissemination and reuse of 3D content in a variety of application domains on the web .']

entities: [[(u'sharing and distribution of case bases', u'Task'), (u'case based reasoning', u'Task'), (u'biology', u'Material'), (u'medicine', u'Material')], [(u'seman- tics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'biomedical case based reasoning systems', u'Method'), (u'semantic approach', u'Method'), (u'semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'case based reasoning', u'Task'), (u'biology', u'Material'), (u'medicine', u'Material')], [(u'case based reasoning systems', u'Method'), (u'CBR systems', u'Method'), (u'interchange language', u'Material')], [(u'Memoire', u'Method'), (u'case structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'biology', u'Material'), (u'medicine', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'ap- plication domains', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'CBR', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'sharing and distribution of case bases', u'CONJUNCTION', u'case based reasoning'), (u'biology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'medicine')], [(u'biology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'medicine')], [], [(u'Memoire', u'USED-FOR', u'case structure'), (u'biology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'medicine')], []]
sentences: [u'Memoire is a framework for the sharing and distribution of case bases and case based reasoning in biology and medicine .', u'Based on the fact that seman- tics account for the success of biomedical case based reasoning systems , this paper defends the suitability of a semantic approach similar to the semantic Web for sharing and distributing case bases and case based reasoning in biology and medicine .', u'Memoire will permit to bridge the gap between the multiple case based reasoning systems dedicated to a single domain , and make available to agents and Web services on the Web the case based competency of the CBR systems adopting its interchange language .', u'This paper presents the components of Memoire for the representation of cases , case structure , and case based on- tologies in biology and medicine .', u'The approach could be extended to other ap- plication domains of CBR .']

relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'solution', u'USED-FOR', u'SWS')], [(u'SWS', u'USED-FOR', u'ebXML Registry'), (u'SAWSDL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'open source framework freebXML')]]
sentences: [u"While the `` Universal Description , Discovery and Integra- tion '' ( UDDI ) service registry standard has drawn great attention by the research community , it has not been widely adopted by the software industry .", u'Objections towards UDDI include technical as well as concep- tional arguments .', u"Being an ocial ISO standard and providing a num- ber of features UDDI is missing , `` Electronic Business using Extensible Markup Language '' ( ebXML ) Registry could be an adequate alternative for the implementation of service registries and/or repositories .", u'However , little work has been done regarding the integration of Semantic Web Ser- vices ( SWS ) into ebXML Registry .', u'In this paper , we present a solution extending the ebXML Registry by capabilities to handle and provide SWS .', u'This includes a concept for the integration of SWS into ebXML Registry as well as a prototypical imple- mentation using SAWSDL and the open source framework freebXML .']

sentences: [u'The distance query , which asks the length of the shortest path from a vertex $ u $ to another vertex v , has applications ranging from link analysis , semantic web and other ontology processing , to social network operations .', u'Here , we propose a novel labeling scheme , referred to as Highway-Centric Labeling , for answering distance queries in a large sparse graph .', u'It empowers the distance labeling with a highway structure and leverages a novel bipartite set cover framework/algorithm .', u'Highway-centric labeling provides better labeling size than the state-of-the-art $ 2 $ -hop labeling , theoretically and empirically .', u'It also offers both exact distance and approximate distance with bounded accuracy .', u'A detailed experimental evaluation on both synthetic and real datasets demonstrates that highway-centric labeling can outperform the state-of-the-art distance computation approaches in terms of both index size and query time .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'W3C', u'Method')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'XML encoding', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'triples', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'querying and reasoning services', u'Method')], [(u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'logic programming evaluation techniques', u'Method'), (u'SQL extensions', u'Method')], [(u'RDF statements', u'Material'), (u'problem', u'Generic'), (u'OSF', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'isomorphic representation', u'Method'), (u'RDF statements', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'answering mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'RDF', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'logic programming evaluation techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF'), (u'logic programming evaluation techniques', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SQL extensions')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The interest of representing data for the Semantic Web has generated standards for expressing knowledge on the Web .', u'RDF , as one of those standards , has become a recommendation of the W3C .', u'Even if it was designed to be human and machine readable ( XML encoding , triples , labeled graphs ) , RDF was not provided with querying and reasoning services .', u'Most work on querying RDF has concentrated on the use of logic programming evaluation techniques and SQL extensions .', u'We take a new look at the problem of querying and reasoning on RDF statements and find that order-sorted feature ( OSF ) terms apply to this problem because OSF have been tailored for efficiency and their semantics is compatible with the isomorphic representation ( triples ) of RDF statements .', u'This transformation allows to compute an ordering on resources and thus provide better answering mechanisms when querying RDF .']

sentences: [u'In order to discover the useful information from semantic Web usage records , we present an approach for mining the frequent Web access patterns from log ontologies.This method adopts application access-rules to represent the dynamic semantics rules of user-access and adopts observations to represent the usage facts.With the restriction of DL-safety , it combines log ontologies and application user-access rules into a decidable hybrid knowledge base.The transaction mode of access-pattern learning can be extracted form the semantics of the part-whole relations between events in log ontologies.A frequent Web access-pattern tree can be generated by an ILP method from the hybrid knowledge base.This method also solves the problem of reasoning the Web access-patterns with non-DL atoms.The experimental results show that this method is effective and it is quite feasible to solve practical problems .']

sentences: [u'The sharing of medical data between different healthcare organizations in Europe must comply with the legislation of the Member State where the data were originally collected .', u'These legal requirements may differ from one state to another .', u'Privacy requirements such as patient consent may be subject to conflicting conditions between different national frameworks as well as between different legal and ethical frameworks within a single Member State .', u'These circumstances have made the compliance management process in European healthgrids very challenging .', u'In this paper , we present an approach to tackle these issues by relying on several technologies in the semantic Web stack .', u'Our work suggests a direct mapping from high-level legislation on privacy and data protection to operational-level privacy-aware controls .', u'Additionally , we suggest an architecture for the enforcement of these controls on access control models adopted in healthgrid security infrastructures .']

sentences: [u'management is a process which comprises knowledge discovery , knowledge collection , knowledge organization and knowledge process .', u'Among these four process knowledge discovery is integrated with semantic web for enhanced information retrivel .', u'Knowledge discovery is the process of automatically searching large volume of data for patterns that can be considered knowledge about the data .', u'This is described as deriving knowledge from the input data .', u"Knowledge discovery is defined as `` the non-trivial extraction of implicit , unknown , and potentially useful information from the data '' .", u'Knowledge discovery is one of the key component of knowledge management system .', u"Today 's World Wide Web has large volume of data - billions of document .", u'So it is a time consuming process to discover effective knowledge from the input data .', u'Here define knowledge discovery meta model ( KDM ) which defines an ontology for the software and their relationships for the purpose of']

sentences: [u'As Web Services becomes mature and popular , they are always integrated together , forming systems to carry out coherent tasks .', u"The distributed application of Web Services involves many standard protocols and various runtime behaviors and thus makes the systems ' automated testing more difficult .", u'In this paper we propose a series of applicable automated testing methods for Web Services system .', u'First , deduce abstract test cases from interaction requirement properties of Web Services system .', u'Second , specify test cases according to SWRL ( Semantic Web Rule Language ) properties and abstract test cases .', u'Finally , generate mutants under AOP ( Aspect-Oriented Programming ) technology support , drive them by specific test cases using improved Fit ( Framework for Integrated Test ) , and then kill mutants based on business logic .', u'Experiments have shown that our algorithms meet the applied demands and perform well as an automated testing tool for Web Services system .']

entities: [[(u'Description Logics', u'Method'), (u'knowledge representation formalisms', u'Method'), (u'terminological reasoning', u'Task')], [(u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'medical knowledge-bases', u'Material'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'DLs', u'Method'), (u'sound and complete inference algorithms', u'Method'), (u'expressive DLs', u'Material')], [(u'Non-standard inferences', u'Method'), (u'inference services', u'Method'), (u'DL knowledge-bases', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'non-standard inferences', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'expressive DLs', u'Material')], [(u'non-standard inferences', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DLs', u'Method'), (u'transitive roles', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'structural characterization of subsumption', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DLs', u'Method'), (u'existential and value restrictions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'transitive roles', u'OtherScientificTerm')], []]

sentences: [u'Description Logics ( DLs ) are a family of knowledge representation formalisms used for terminological reasoning .', u'They have a wide range of applications such as medical knowledge-bases , or the semantic web .', u'Research on DLs has been focused on the development of sound and complete inference algorithms to decide satisfiability and subsumption for increasingly expressive DLs .', u'Non-standard inferences are a group of relatively new inference services which provide reasoning support for the building , maintaining , and deployment of DL knowledge-bases .', u'So far , non-standard inferences are not available for very expressive DLs .', u'In this paper we present first results on non-standard inferences for DLs with transitive roles .', u'As a basis , we give a structural characterization of subsumption for DLs where existential and value restrictions can be imposed on transitive roles .', u'We propose sound and complete algorithms to compute the least common subsumer ( lcs ) .']

sentences: [u'This paper proposes a novel method to learn light-weight domain ontology from the Web .', u'To create ontology ( semi- ) automatically has been a challenging and critical problem to make Semantic Web come true .', u'Many methods have been reported on ontology learning from the Web by analyzing the page contents .', u'However , they are not applicable for learning ontology from organization websites , where the description of a concept or an individual is distributed across multiple web pages , and the ontological information can only be discovered by considering website structure .', u'We propose a website structure based method to extract organizational ontology from organization websites .', u'Multiple organizational ontology of the same domain can be merged into domain ontology .', u'This method employs both the intra-page and inter-page hierarchical relations hidden in website structure for ontology learning .', u'The empirical experiments show the effectiveness of this approach .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'RDF data model', u'Method'), (u'RDF statements', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'contextual relevancy', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SPARQL query language', u'Material'), (u'RDF dataset', u'Material')], [(u'contextual metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'design pattern', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'contextual metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RDF entailment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'contextual graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'subStateOf relation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'context hierarchies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SPARQL queries', u'Material')], [(u'slight syntactic extension', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'query of context hierarchies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rewriting rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'RDF data model', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [], [(u'design pattern', u'USED-FOR', u'contextual metadata')], [], [(u'RDF', u'USED-FOR', u'subStateOf relation')], [(u'slight syntactic extension', u'USED-FOR', u'query of context hierarchies')]]
sentences: [u'The basic principle of the Semantic Web carried by the RDF data model is that a collection of RDF statements coexist all together and are universally true .', u'However some case study imply contextual relevancy and truth .', u'The SPARQL query language is provided with patterns enabling to choose the RDF dataset against which a query is executed .', u'This is a first step to handle contextual metadata .', u'Based on it , we present in this paper a design pattern to handle contextual metadata hierarchically organized .', u'This is done by means of a subStateOf property reifying RDF entailment between contextual graphs .', u'The subStateOf relation is modelled within RDF and therefore context hierarchies can be described and queried by means of SPARQL queries .', u'We propose a slight syntactic extension to SPARQL to facilitate the query of context hierarchies , together with rewriting rules to return to standard SPARQL .']

sentences: [u'As the semantic web is picking up fame , issues of incorporation of information from diverse sources to ontologies are likewise picking up investment of analysts .', u'Social Databases are basically utilized for saving a lot of web information ; in this way we mean to advance an immediate instrument or tool for Relational Databases to ontology transformation .', u'Existing methodologies for RDB to ontology transformation have a few drawbacks .', u'A portion of the methodologies are manual and require a ton of exertion for transformation .', u'Some are programmed however they perform mappings at an extremely essential level .', u'A percentage of the tools advanced thus are of exceptionally fundamental level , out-dated or not open .', u'We give a study of some existing methodologies ; assess them on some arrangement standard , and near the finale we infer future look into bearings in this area .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'information organization', u'Task'), (u'search', u'Task')], [(u'intelligent search engine', u'Method'), (u'educational semantic support service', u'Method'), (u'Educational Information Intelligent Search EIIS framework', u'Task'), (u'web-based resources', u'Material'), (u'local e-resources', u'Material')], [(u'EIISReasoning', u'Method'), (u'semantic concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic factor', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'response time factor', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'EIISRanking algorithm', u'Method'), (u'two-level ranking', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic similarity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'EIIS engine', u'Method'), (u'semantic services', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'precision rate', u'Metric'), (u'ranking', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'The semantic web brings a new opportunity for efficient information organization and search .', u'To meet the special requirements of the educational field , this paper proposes an intelligent search engine enabled by educational semantic support service , where three kinds of searches are integrated into Educational Information Intelligent Search EIIS framework , and web-based resources and local e-resources are both identically semantically processed .', u'During the design , the EIISReasoning and its relevant rule sets are constructed to automatically reason semantic concepts to diverse levels by a semantic factor and a response time factor .', u"Furthermore , the EIISRanking algorithm applies two-level ranking by a factor of semantic similarity , and the same relevance is differentiated in terms of the educational field 's needs .", u'The experiments show that the EIIS engine with semantic services has a better precision rate and improved ranking performance .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic-Web languages', u'Material'), (u'classical theories', u'Method'), (u'classical first-order logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'description logics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rule languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'logic programming', u'Method')], [(u'Exist- ing approaches', u'Method'), (u'SWRL', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dl-programs', u'Method'), (u'DL+log', u'Method'), (u'( nonmonotonic ) rules bases', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'approaches', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'SWRL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Exist- ing approaches'), (u'SWRL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dl-programs'), (u'dl-programs', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Exist- ing approaches'), (u'dl-programs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'DL+log'), (u'DL+log', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Exist- ing approaches')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'In the context of current efforts around Semantic-Web languages , the combination of classical theories in classical first-order logic ( and in pa rticular of ontologies in various description logics ) with rule languages rooted in logic programming is receiving considerable attention .', u'Exist- ing approaches such as SWRL , dl-programs , and DL+log , differ significantly in the way ontologies interact with ( nonmonotonic ) rules bases .', u'In this paper , we identify fundamental representational is- sues which need to be addressed by such combinations and formulate a number of formal principles which help to characterize and classify existing and possible future approaches to the combination of rules and classical theories .', u'We use the formal principle s to explicate the underlying assump- tions of current approaches .', u'Finally , we propose a number of settings , based on our analysis of the representational issues and the fundamental principles underlying current approaches .']

entities: [[(u'Scientific discourse', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web technologies', u'Method')], [(u'semantic enriched publication', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'online articles', u'Material'), (u'linear structured papers', u'Material'), (u'shallow metadata descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'elementary modules', u'Method'), (u'Scientific Knowledge Objects ( SKO ) framework', u'Method'), (u'structural knowledge- SKO Types', u'Method'), (u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'scientific discourse representation- SKO Patterns', u'Method'), (u'semantic authoring', u'Task'), (u'annotation- SKO TeX', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic authoring')]]
sentences: [u'Scientific discourse , as the basic unit of dissemination and exploitation of research results , has steadily enhanced their accessibility and reusability in response to the advancement of web technologies .', u'A highly semantic enriched publication always makes its information and data much easier to search , navigate , disseminate and reuse , whereas most online articles today are still electronic facsimiles of linear structured papers , with shallow metadata descriptions , lacking in semantic knowledge and interlinked relationships between elementary modules of content. # R # # N # # R # # N # In this dissertation , we propose a Scientific Knowledge Objects ( SKO ) framework in terms of a theory of structural knowledge- SKO Types , a methodology for scientific discourse representation- SKO Patterns , a tool for semantic authoring and annotation- SKO TeX , and an application of SKO management- the Conference of the Future , in the context of the emerging Social Web and Semantic Web .']

sentences: [u'We present recent developments on the syntax of Real , a library for interfacing two Prolog systems to the statistical language R. We focus on the changes in Prolog syntax within SWI-Prolog that accommodate greater syntactic integration , enhanced user experience and improved features for web-services .', u'We recount the full syntax and functionality of Real as well as presenting a full application and sister packages which include Prolog code interfacing a number of common and useful tasks that can be delegated to R. We argue that Real is a powerful extension to logic programming , providing access to a popular statistical system that has complementary strengths in areas such as machine learning , statistical inference and visualisation .', u'Furthermore , Real has a central role to play in the uptake of semantic web , computational biology and bioinformatics as application areas for research in logic programming .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'Pervasive computing environments'), (u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'framework'), (u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'Pervasive computing environments'), (u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'Ubiquitous computing environment')], [(u'Integrated Global Pervasive Computing Framework', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Ubiquitous computing environment')], [(u'prototype system', u'USED-FOR', u'Ubiquitous environment'), (u'prototype system', u'USED-FOR', u'medical emergency scenario'), (u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'medical emergency scenario')]]
sentences: [u'Ubiquitous computing refers to building a global computing environment where seamless and invisible access to computing resources is provided to the user .', u'Pervasive computing deals with acquiring context knowledge from the environment and providing dynamic , proactive and context-aware services to the user .', u'A Ubiquitous computing environment is created by sharing knowledge and information between Pervasive computing environments .', u'In this paper we propose a framework that uses the potential of the Semantic Web to weave Pervasive computing environments into a Ubiquitous computing environment .', u'We discuss how the collaboration of these Pervasive environments can create an effective Ubiquitous computing environment referred herein as the Integrated Global Pervasive Computing Framework ( IGPF ) .', u'We test the effectiveness of the Ubiquitous environment through a small scenario from a prototype system that we have implemented over this framework to handle medical emergency scenario .']

sentences: [u'As the role of ontology in a multilingual setting becomes important to Semantic Web development , it becomes necessary to understand and model how an original conceptual meaning of a Source Language word is conveyed into a Target Language translation .', u'Terminological ontology [ 1 ] is a tool used for knowledge sharing and domain-specific translation , and could potentially be suitable for simulating the cognitive models explaining real-world inter-cultural communication scenarios .', u'In this paper , a framework referred to as the Relevance Theory of Communication [ 2 ] is contrasted to an empirical study applying Tverskys contrast model [ 3 ] to data-sets obtained from the terminological ontology .', u'The results indicate that the alignment of two language-dependent terminological ontologies is a potential method for optimizing the relevance required in inter-cultural communication , in other words , for identifying corresponding concepts existing in two remote cultures .']

sentences: [u'The Web is evolving from a repository for text and images to a provider of services - both information-providing services , and services that have some effect on the world .', u"Today 's Web was designed primarily for human use .", u'To enable reliable , large-scale automated interoperation of services by computer programs or agents , the properties , capabilities , interfaces and effects of Web services must be understandable to computers .', u'In this paper we propose a vision and a partial realization of precisely this .', u'We propose markup of Web services in the DAML family of semantic Web markup languages .', u'Our markup of Web services enables a wide variety of agent technologies for automated Web service discovery , execution , composition and interoperation .', u'We present one logic-based agent technology for service composition , predicated on the use of reusable , task-specific , high-level generic procedures and user-specific customizing constraints .']

entities: [[(u'SVG', u'Method'), (u'X3D', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'visualizing information', u'Task')], [(u'SVG and X3D fundamentals', u'Method')], [(u'SVG', u'Method'), (u'network visualization', u'Task'), (u'next-generation computer graphics', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'This is the first book devoted to both SVG and X3D as a new and universal means of visualizing information .', u'It presents the state-of-the-art research emerging in this novel area and introduces SVG and X3D fundamentals and leading authoring tools .', u'The key topics covered include : - The foundations of SVG and X3D - Data , information , knowledge and network visualization - Advanced and distributed user interfaces - Visualizing metadata and the Semantic Web - Visual interfaces to Web services - New trends and paradigms in publishing and Interactive TV - Displaying geographically referenced data and chemical structures - Advanced use of Adobe Illustrator and X3D-Edit authoring tools This book will be essential reading not only for researchers , Web developers and graduate students but also for undergraduates and everyone who is interested in using the next-generation computer graphics on their websites .']

entities: [[(u'RDF knowledge bases', u'Material')], [(u'incompleteness', u'Metric')], [(u'KB', u'Material')], [(u'KB', u'Material')], [(u'completeness information management', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'RDF storage engine', u'Method'), (u'completeness statements', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'completeness constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'completeness-aware RDF querying', u'Task')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'RDF knowledge bases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'completeness information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SPARQL queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'extension', u'Generic'), (u'SPARQL language', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'completeness statements', u'FEATURE-OF', u'RDF storage engine')], [], [], [(u'completeness information', u'USED-FOR', u'SPARQL queries'), (u'SPARQL language', u'USED-FOR', u'extension')]]
sentences: [u'Current RDF knowledge bases ( KBs ) are highly incomplete .', u'This incompleteness is a serious problem both for data users and producers .', u'Users do not have guarantees that queries that are run on a KB deliver complete results .', u'Data producers , on the other hand , are blind about the parts of the KB that are incomplete .', u'Yet , completeness information management is poorly supported in the Semantic Web .', u'No RDF storage engine supports reasoning with completeness statements .', u'Moreover , SPARQL can not express completeness constraints for queries .', u'Motivated by these observations , this paper offers a vision on completeness-aware RDF querying .', u'Our vision includes ( 1 ) the sketch of a method to reason about completeness in RDF knowledge bases , ( 2 ) two approaches to represent completeness information for SPARQL queries , and ( 3 ) an extension for the SPARQL language to express completeness constraints in queries .']

sentences: [u'Concern for scalability & # x2014 ; both in computational terms and in terms of human effort needed to develop semantic models and background knowledge & # x2014 ; has hampered the adoption of semantic techniques and the Semantic Web .', u'This concern is misplaced given the extensive progress the past decade has seen on standards , methods , and technologies for developing semantic models or ontologies , semantic annotations , and techniques for semantic integration , analysis , and reasoning .', u'Such progress is complemented by myriad recent success stories that use semantics in broad-based applications such as Web search , as well as in a growing number of vertical domains .', u'As the future of computing expands beyond cyberspace to cyber-physical-social computing , with extensive growth in social and sensor data , semantics will play an even larger and more pervasive role in exploiting larger amounts of increasingly heterogeneous and multimodal data .']

sentences: [u'caGrid has accumulated a repository of biomedical services , however , how a cancer researcher can find proper services in the caGrid when needed remains a big challenge .', u'This research aims to enhance the cyber infrastructure of caGrid , by developing a mechanism that turns caGrid services into semantic-aware interoperable services .', u'We proposed a service semantics model , and developed a technique that automatically extracts semantic metadata from static WSDL service descriptions .', u'Such semantic information is stored as loosely coupled annotations that can be queried using semantic Web techniques , to enhance services discovery and composition .', u'We also proposed a two-phase discovery technique that helps users quickly identify interested service operations .', u'This paper also reports our examinations over available techniques and recommends a feasible infrastructure for biomedical service reuse .', u'A prototyping system is developed as a proof of concept .']

sentences: [u'Open Journal of Big Data ( OJBD ) ( www.ronpub.com/ojbd ) is an open access journal , which addresses the aspects of Big Data , including new methodologies , processes , case studies , poofs-of-concept , scientific demonstrations , industrial applications and adoption .', u'This editorial presents two articles published in the first issue of the second volume of OJBD .', u'The first article is about the investigation of social media for the public engagement .', u'The second article looks into large-scale semantic web indices for six RDF collation orders .', u'OJBD has an increasingly improved reputation thanks to the support of research communities .', u'We will set up the Second International Conference on Internet of Things , Big Data and Security ( IoTBDS 2017 ) , in Porto , Portugal , between 24 and 26 April 2017 .', u'OJBD is published by RonPub ( www.ronpub.com ) , which is an academic publisher of online , open access , peer-reviewed journals .']

sentences: [u'This paper describes an approach to enterprise application integration ( EAI ) using extensible Web services .', u'The approach is demonstrated by building a real-world application for EAI in the financial services domain .', u'Business drivers for and approaches to EAI are presented first .', u'The manifestation of Web services in general and their role in EAI are discussed next .', u'Financial services domain characteristics are presented .', u'Business drivers that entail a strong need for functional extensibility in the financial services domain are described .', u'Our proposed architecture for EAI which addresses functional extensibility is described .', u'This architecture is based on the notion of extensible Web services .', u'We then present our implementation of the architecture and practical challenges encountered in EAI .', u'A brief discussion of how our work relates to the current research in service-oriented computing ( SOC ) and semantic Web concludes the paper .']

sentences: [u'Linked data portals need to be able to advertise and describe the structure of their content .', u'A sufficiently expressive and intuitive schema language will allow portals to communicate these structures .', u'Validation tools will aid in the publication and maintenance of linked data and increase their quality .', u'# R # # N # Two schema language proposals have recently emerged for describing the structures of RDF graphs : Shape Expressions ( ShEx ) and Shapes Constraint Language ( SHACL ) .', u'In this paper we describe how these formalisms can be used in the development of a linked data portal to describe and validate its contents .', u'As a use case , we specify a data model inspired by the WebIndex data model , a medium size linked data portal , using both ShEx and SHACL , and we propose a benchmark that can generate compliant test data structures of any size .', u'We then perform some preliminary experiments showing performance of one validation engine based on ShEx .']

sentences: [u'Treatment plan selection is a complex process because it sometimes needs sufficient experience and clinical information .', u'Nowadays it is even harder for doctors to select an appropriate treatment plan for certain patients since doctors might encounter difficulties in obtaining the right information and analyzing the diverse clinical data .', u'In order to improve the effectiveness of clinical decision making in complicated information system environments , we first propose a linked data-based approach for treatment plan selection .', u"The approach integrates the patients ' clinical records in hospitals with open linked data sources out of hospitals .", u'Then , based on the linked data net , treatment plan selection is carried on aided by similar historical therapy cases .', u'Finally , we reorganize the electronic medical records of 97 colon cancer patients using the linked data model and count the similarity of these records to help treatment selecting .', u'The experiment shows the usability of our method in supporting clinical dec ...']

sentences: [u'This research proposes a context-aware framework that automatically adapts learning content designed for personal computers for mobile learners .', u"The framework is a web application plug-in that captures access patterns and uses the patterns with trained configurations , learner preferences and device profiles to tailor learning content to the learners ' needs .", u'Learners can switch devices without losing learning context , and the framework would use Semantic technology to search and make content learners may eventually need available to them .', u'The framework is in line with the surveys recently conducted on mobile learning and uses only proven technologies to guarantee a successful implementation .']

sentences: [u'Topic Maps is a semantic technology for the integration of heterogeneous data and the convenient deployment of domain specific and semantically enriched web portals .', u'Topic Maps is already widely in productive usage in industry and administration .', u'We demonstrate with six projects the current usage and the opportunities of Topic Maps in the eHumanities .', u'The projects are CeDECA from University of Pavia , RAMLine from the London Royal Academy of Music , Pansori Retrieval System from the Sungkyunkwan University Seoul , Musica migrans from the University of Leipzig , Collection of the Finnish National Gallery , and Text and Semantic from Signum in Pisa .']

relations: [[(u'Software engineering processes', u'USED-FOR', u'workflow engines')], [], [(u'declarative workflow modeling approach', u'USED-FOR', u'workflows'), (u'semantic technology', u'USED-FOR', u'declarative workflow modeling approach'), (u'semantic technology', u'USED-FOR', u'workflows')], [(u'automated process guidance', u'USED-FOR', u'dynamic environments')]]
sentences: [u'Software engineering processes are a challenging domain for the application of workflow engines due to their high dynamicity , often evolutionary nature , abstract process models , and the informational and environmental dependencies of their activities .', u'In order to offer automated and relevant process guidance to software developers , the operational-level guidance must be capable of situational adaptation as processes evolve .', u'A declarative workflow modeling approach driven by semantic technology is described that contextually constructs workflows on-the-fly from candidate activities .', u'Thus , automated process guidance in dynamic environments is facilitated while retaining correctness properties , simplifying modeling , and fostering reuse .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Technology', u'Method'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'Clinical Data Standards', u'Task')], [(u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'browser', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'search functionality', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web services', u'Method'), (u'study workflow automation', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic')], [], [], [(u'RDF curator', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Technology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RDF'), (u'Semantic Technology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Clinical Data Standards'), (u'Clinical Trials', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Clinical Data Standards')], [], [(u'browser', u'CONJUNCTION', u'search functionality'), (u'browser', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web services'), (u'search functionality', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web services')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic Technology and RDF have become additional tools for use in Clinical Trials and Clinical Data Standards in particular .', u'At Roche we have one of the first production status RDF based Clinical Data Standards Metadata Registries and have been operating it for 2 years now .', u'We have real end users , a browser , search functionality , web services , and big plans for study workflow automation .', u'But what does it really mean to set up and run a system like this ?', u'What resources and skills do you need ?', u'What problems do you encounter day by day ?', u'This talk is about real life as an RDF curator']

entities: [[(u'Photo collections', u'Material')], [(u'semantic annotations', u'Method')], [(u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'semantic technology', u'Method'), (u'annotation template', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'personal information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'notion of landmarks', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'navigation', u'Task'), (u'lifetime photo-space', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'semantic technology', u'USED-FOR', u'complexity'), (u'annotation template', u'USED-FOR', u'complexity'), (u'annotation template', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic technology')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Photo collections are one of the promising sources to tell story of life in this digital era .', u'In this paper we present our work on organizing photos of a lifetime by exploiting semantic annotations .', u'The complexity in using semantic technology is managed by introducing an annotation template corresponding to who , when , where , and what .', u'Semantics of each dimension are semi-automatically annotated following the ontology for personal information .', u'The story telling is done by exploiting these semantics to form trails of the photos .', u'The notion of landmarks is used for this purpose which also ensures effective navigation in the lifetime photo-space .']

entities: [[(u'computer-based media', u'Material'), (u'understanding of phenomena', u'Task')], [(u'DynaLearn', u'Method'), (u'Intelligent Learning Environment', u'Method'), (u'conceptual knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'qualitative models', u'Method'), (u'systems', u'Generic')], [(u'DynaLearn', u'Method'), (u'diagrammatic representations', u'Method')], [(u'environment', u'Generic'), (u'semantic technology components', u'Method'), (u'knowledge-based feedback', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'virtual characters', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'DynaLearn system', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'DynaLearn', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Intelligent Learning Environment'), (u'DynaLearn', u'USED-FOR', u'conceptual knowledge'), (u'Intelligent Learning Environment', u'USED-FOR', u'conceptual knowledge')], [(u'diagrammatic representations', u'USED-FOR', u'DynaLearn')], [(u'knowledge-based feedback', u'CONJUNCTION', u'virtual characters')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Articulating thought in computer-based media is a powerful means for humans to develop their understanding of phenomena .', u'We have created DynaLearn , an Intelligent Learning Environment that allows learners to acquire conceptual knowledge by constructing and simulating qualitative models of how systems behave .', u'DynaLearn uses diagrammatic representations for learners to express their ideas .', u'The environment is equipped with semantic technology components capable of generating knowledge-based feedback , and virtual characters enhancing the interaction with learners .', u'Teachers have created course material , and successful evaluation studies have been performed .', u'This article presents an overview of the DynaLearn system .']

entities: [[], [], [(u'process execution', u'Task'), (u'knowledge management', u'Task'), (u'automated systems', u'Method'), (u'software engineering', u'Task'), (u'concrete utilization', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'automated workflow governance support', u'Task'), (u'knowledge management', u'Method'), (u'semantic technology', u'Method')], [(u'contextually relevant SE knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'software development workflow execution', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'process execution', u'CONJUNCTION', u'knowledge management')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'automated workflow governance support'), (u'automated workflow governance support', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic technology'), (u'knowledge management', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic technology')], []]
sentences: [u'Software development projects have historically been challenged with respect to producing a quality product .', u'To some extent , this can be attributed to the complex , dynamic , and highly intellectual process of creating software .', u'While efforts have been made to support both process execution and knowledge management with automated systems in software engineering ( SE ) , the effective dissemination of knowledge and its concrete utilization in the development process remain problematic .', u'This paper contributes an approach that associates automated workflow governance support with knowledge management and semantic technology .', u'This enables the dynamic injection of contextually relevant SE knowledge into software development workflow execution .']

relations: [[(u'WikiProteins', u'USED-FOR', u'community annotation')], [], [], [(u'Semantic technology', u'USED-FOR', u'factual statements')], [], [], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'beta testing')]]
sentences: [u'WikiProteins enables community annotation in a Wiki-based system .', u'Extracts of major data sources have been fused into an editable environment that links out to the original sources .', u'Data from community edits create automatic copies of the original data .', u'Semantic technology captures concepts co-occurring in one sentence and thus potential factual statements .', u'In addition , indirect associations between concepts have been calculated .', u"We call on a 'million minds ' to annotate a 'million concepts ' and to collect facts from the literature with the reward of collaborative knowledge discovery .", u'The system is available for beta testing at http : //www.wikiprofessional.org .']

entities: [[(u'learning activities', u'Task'), (u'thematic Web resources', u'Material'), (u'linked-data repository', u'Material')], [], [(u'Learning Activity Management System', u'Method')], [(u'thematic resource repository', u'Material'), (u'linked-data extension', u'Method'), (u'WordPress blog engine', u'Method')], [(u'extension', u'Generic'), (u'text-based and video information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'blog entries', u'Material'), (u'RDF triples', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'external linked data sets', u'Material'), (u'blog contents', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'linked-data', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'conceptual model', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'linked-data repository', u'USED-FOR', u'thematic Web resources')], [], [], [(u'linked-data extension', u'USED-FOR', u'thematic resource repository')], [(u'text-based and video information', u'USED-FOR', u'extension'), (u'blog entries', u'FEATURE-OF', u'text-based and video information'), (u'RDF triples', u'FEATURE-OF', u'blog entries')], [(u'external linked data sets', u'USED-FOR', u'learning resources'), (u'linked-data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'linked-data')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we describe how to design learning activities that dynamically provide thematic Web resources from a linked-data repository .', u'The aim is to enable teachers to share a variable set of resources related to a given subject and postpone the actual resource delivery to the deployment or enactment of the course .', u'We have proposed a Learning Activity Management System ( LAMS ) tool that provides an interface to automatically select the related resources to be delivered to the students who are running a learning activity .', u'The thematic resource repository was a linked-data extension of the WordPress blog engine .', u'This extension allows enriching text-based and video information contained in blog entries with RDF triples that can be externally managed and exploited .', u'Our approach allows discovering learning resources from external linked data sets and enrich blog contents with linked-data , independently of the underlying conceptual model .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Web', u'Material'), (u'heterogeneous , complex and distributed datasets', u'Material')], [(u'query mechanism', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'representation of data', u'Task')], [(u'vocabulary independent natural language query mechanism', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'entity search', u'Method'), (u'Wikipedia-based semantic relatedness measure', u'Metric'), (u'spreading activation', u'Method')], [(u'Wikipedia-based semantic relatedness measures', u'Metric'), (u'similarity measures/term expansion', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'WordNet', u'Material')], [(u'query mechanism', u'Method'), (u'natural language queries', u'Material'), (u'DBpedia', u'Material'), (u'mean reciprocal rank', u'Metric'), (u'average precision', u'Metric'), (u'average recall', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'query mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data')], [(u'vocabulary independent natural language query mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data'), (u'Wikipedia-based semantic relatedness measure', u'USED-FOR', u'approach'), (u'Wikipedia-based semantic relatedness measure', u'CONJUNCTION', u'spreading activation')], [(u'WordNet', u'USED-FOR', u'similarity measures/term expansion')], [(u'query mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'natural language queries'), (u'average precision', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'query mechanism'), (u'average recall', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'query mechanism')]]
sentences: [u'Linked Data brings inherent challenges in the way users and applications consume the available data .', u'Users consuming Linked Data on the Web , should be able to search and query data spread over potentially large numbers of heterogeneous , complex and distributed datasets .', u'Ideally , a query mechanism for Linked Data should abstract users from the representation of data .', u'This work focuses on the investigation of a vocabulary independent natural language query mechanism for Linked Data , using an approach based on the combination of entity search , a Wikipedia-based semantic relatedness measure and spreading activation .', u'Wikipedia-based semantic relatedness measures address existing limitations of existing works which are based on similarity measures/term expansion based on WordNet .', u'Experimental results using the query mechanism to answer 50 natural language queries over DBpedia achieved a mean reciprocal rank of 61.4 % , an average precision of 48.7 % and average recall of 57.2 % .']

entities: [[(u'Link traversal', u'Task'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'Knowledge Discovery process', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'patterns of data', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data mining process', u'Method'), (u'clustering', u'Method')], [(u'strategy', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Data traversal', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'patterns of data'), (u'data mining process', u'USED-FOR', u'patterns of data'), (u'clustering', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'data mining process')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Link traversal is one of the biggest advantages of Linked Data , as it allows the serendipitous discovery of new knowledge thanks to the natural connections between data of different sources .', u'Our general problem is to understand how such a property can benefit the Knowledge Discovery process : in particular , we aim at using Linked Data to explain the patterns of data that have been extracted from a typical data mining process such as clustering .', u"The strategy we propose here is Linked Data traversal , in which we explore and build on-the-fly an unknown Linked Data graph by simply deferencing entities ' URIs until we find , by following the links between entities , a valid explanation to our clusters .", u'The experiments section gives an insight into the performance of such an approach , in terms of time and scalability , and show how the links easily gather knowledge from different data sources .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data cloud', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'linked data', u'Material')], [(u'online service', u'Material'), (u'specifications', u'Generic'), (u'models', u'Generic'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic models of services', u'Method'), (u'interactive web-based interface', u'Task')], [(u'service request URLs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'service model', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'service specification', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'expressive vocabulary', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'lifting rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'linked data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SPARQL')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic models of services')], [], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'service model')], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'service specification'), (u'expressive vocabulary', u'USED-FOR', u'system'), (u'expressive vocabulary', u'USED-FOR', u'service specification')], [(u'them', u'USED-FOR', u'linked data')]]
sentences: [u'The amount of data available in the Linked Data cloud continues to grow .', u'Yet , few services consume and produce linked data .', u'There is recent work that allows a user to define a linked service from an online service , which includes the specifications for consuming and producing linked data , but building such models is time consuming and requires specialized knowledge of RDF and SPARQL .', u'This paper presents a new approach that allows domain experts to rapidly create semantic models of services by demonstration in an interactive web-based interface .', u'First , the user provides examples of the service request URLs .', u'Then , the system automatically proposes a service model the user can refine interactively .', u'Finally , the system saves a service specification using a new expressive vocabulary that includes lowering and lifting rules .', u'This approach empowers end users to rapidly model existing services and immediately use them to consume and produce linked data .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'data level', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'semantic query processing', u'Task')], [(u'warehousing based query processing', u'Task'), (u'distributed datasets of Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Frequent crawling', u'Method'), (u'dynamic data', u'Material'), (u'real time applications', u'Task')], [(u'Crawling large datasets', u'Task')], [(u'Ontology Property-based Adaptive Crawler', u'Method')], [(u'Linked data', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'overhead costs', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[(u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'data level')], [(u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic query processing')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'warehousing based query processing'), (u'crawling of all data', u'USED-FOR', u'warehousing based query processing')], [(u'Frequent crawling', u'USED-FOR', u'dynamic data')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Linked Data is expected to play an important role for interoperability at the data level for the future internet .', u'One of the main applications of Linked Data might be semantic query processing .', u'The current method of warehousing based query processing requires the crawling of all data periodically and also frequent crawling of data from distributed datasets of Linked Data to make the data as up-to-date as possible .', u'Frequent crawling is required for dynamic data to meet the high freshness requirement of real time applications .', u'Crawling large datasets may cause serious scalability problems .', u'In this paper , we propose an Ontology Property-based Adaptive Crawler to alleviate this problem .', u'Linked data are crawled adaptively based on the Change Frequency of the Documents and the Properties .', u'Performance evaluation shows that this system can reduce overhead costs by more than 70 % while maintaining a high freshness of data .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [], [(u'Alignment', u'Task'), (u'usable Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'URIs', u'Method'), (u'RDF basic biographical data', u'Material'), (u'disambiguation', u'Task'), (u'alignment information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'musicological data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'URIs', u'USED-FOR', u'disambiguation')]]
sentences: [u'As more resources are published as Linked Data , data from multiple heterogeneous sources should be more rapidly discoverable and automatically integrable , enabling it to be reused in contexts beyond those originally envisaged .', u'But Linked Data is not of itself a complete solution .', u'One of the key challenges of Linked Data is that its strength is also a weakness : anyone can publish anything .', u'So in music , for instance , 17 sources may independently publish data about Schubert , but there is no de facto way to know that any of these Schuberts are the same , because the sources are not aligned .', u'Alignment is a prerequisite for usable Linked Data , without which resources are effectively be stranded rather than integrated .', u'To begin to address this , the MusicNet project has minted URIs for composers and exposed as RDF basic biographical data to aid disambiguation , and , crucially , alignment information for several leading providers of musicological data .']

entities: [[(u'adaptive hypermedia systems', u'Method'), (u'adaptation functionality', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'closed corpus', u'Material'), (u'Web search interfaces', u'Task'), (u'de- livered non-personalized information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'closed corpus adaptation', u'Task'), (u'global context provision', u'Task'), (u'Personal Reader environment', u'Method')], [(u'local context', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'global context', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'FAQs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'student exercises', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'adaptive local context', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'learning resource', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'adaptive educational hypermedia', u'Method'), (u'semantic web setting', u'Method')], [(u'adaptive global context', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'user profile information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'querying process', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'adaptive hypermedia systems', u'USED-FOR', u'adaptation functionality'), (u'closed corpus', u'USED-FOR', u'adaptive hypermedia systems'), (u'de- livered non-personalized information', u'FEATURE-OF', u'Web search interfaces')], [(u'closed corpus adaptation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'global context provision')], [(u'FAQs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'student exercises'), (u'student exercises', u'CONJUNCTION', u'simulations')], [(u'adaptive educational hypermedia', u'USED-FOR', u'adaptive local context'), (u'adaptive educational hypermedia', u'USED-FOR', u'learning resource')], [(u'user profile information', u'USED-FOR', u'adaptive global context')]]
sentences: [u'Traditional adaptive hypermedia systems have focused on providing adaptation functionality on a closed corpus , while Web search interfaces have de- livered non-personalized information to users .', u'In this paper , we show how we integrate closed corpus adaptation and global context provision in a Personal Reader environment .', u'The local context consists of individually optimized recom- mendations to learning materials within the given corpus ; the global context pro- vides individually optimized recommendations to resources found on the Web , e. g. , FAQs , student exercises , simulations , etc .', u'The adaptive local context of a learning resource is generated by applying methods from adaptive educational hypermedia in a semantic web setting .', u'The adaptive global context is generated by constructing appropriate queries , enrich them based on available user profile information , and , if necessary , relax them during the querying process according to available metadata .']

entities: [[(u'Web services', u'Task')], [(u'user centric paradigm', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'user centric WS-mediator', u'Method'), (u'dynamic service composition', u'Method')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'composition engine', u'Method'), (u'WS knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'context adaptation', u'Method'), (u'WS-mediator', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'user centric WS-mediator')], [], [(u'WS-mediator', u'USED-FOR', u'context adaptation'), (u'WS-mediator', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web')]]
sentences: [u'Nowadays , the effective and adaptive dynamic Web service composition is a major challenge towards the success of Web services .', u'From the viewpoint of user centric paradigm , existing work has limitation on their agility to create a composed service on the fly according to the desire/need of an end-user at a given time/place .', u'This article presents our approach which consists in providing a comprehensive framework for a user centric WS-mediator which is capable of dynamic service composition .', u"It is based on a composition engine which follows user 's specific needs and which yields a composed service through a WS knowledge base .", u'Users can mash up the services at run time with their own logic and have a fully dynamic composition with context adaptation through WS-mediator which is also capable of supporting the semantic web .']

entities: [[(u'game world logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'computer games', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'interactive entities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Game engine practitioners', u'Method'), (u'scripting technology', u'Method'), (u'soft computing capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'engine modules', u'Method')], [(u'unified approach', u'Generic'), (u'neural parallel language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'scripting engine', u'Method')], [(u'NPL', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'3D game engine', u'Method')], [(u'programming language methodology', u'Method'), (u'released game demo', u'Material')], [(u'Web', u'Material'), (u'neural network based programming paradigm', u'Method'), (u'distributed software applications', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'networked virtual game worlds', u'CONJUNCTION', u'game world logic')], [], [(u'Game engine practitioners', u'USED-FOR', u'soft computing capabilities'), (u'scripting technology', u'USED-FOR', u'Game engine practitioners'), (u'scripting technology', u'USED-FOR', u'soft computing capabilities'), (u'scripting technology', u'USED-FOR', u'engine modules')], [(u'neural parallel language', u'USED-FOR', u'unified approach')], [(u'NPL', u'COMPARE', u'3D game engine')], [(u'released game demo', u'USED-FOR', u'programming language methodology')], [(u'neural network based programming paradigm', u'USED-FOR', u'distributed software applications')]]
sentences: [u'Bringing networked virtual game worlds and game world logic to the open Internet spawns new types of computer games .', u'It usually deals with thousands of interactive entities among its Web servers .', u'Game engine practitioners have used scripting technology to add soft computing capabilities to a variety of their engine modules .', u"This article proposes a unified approach of using neural parallel language ( NPL ) in a computer game 's scripting engine .", u'We have implemented a reduced version of NPL and our own 3D game engine in a pair .', u'We show the effectiveness of such a programming language methodology by means of our released game demo .', u'As the Web is becoming more and more computable ( the semantic Web ) and intelligent ( agent technology ) , neural network based programming paradigm as described in this article is likely to become the solution to general purpose distributed software applications .']
