relations: [[], [], [], [(u'onomasiologic perspective', u'USED-FOR', u'methodology')], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'hypothetical competency question')], [(u'FRBR', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'conceptual models'), (u'FRBR', u'CONJUNCTION', u'CIDOC CRM'), (u'FRBR', u'CONJUNCTION', u'EDM'), (u'CIDOC CRM', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'conceptual models'), (u'CIDOC CRM', u'CONJUNCTION', u'EDM'), (u'EDM', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'conceptual models')]]
sentences: [u'The emergence of Semantic Web and LOD - Linked Open Data - technologies enable that digital objects representing the holdings of archives , libraries and museums collections be semantically interlinked throughout the Web .', u'What are the different types of cultural relevant relationships that may exists between digital objects of collections in archives , libraries and museums throughout the Web ?', u'How discover , organize and formalize these relationships to be used by curators in LOD applications ?', u'A methodology to analyze the holdings of archives , libraries and museums is proposed based on onomasiologic perspective .', u'Such methodology is applied to a hypothetical competency question that might be proposed by a digital curator .', u'Results indicated that conceptual models such as FRBR , CIDOC CRM and EDM may provide a rich repertoire of semantic relationships that may be used in LOD applications to interlink collections in heritage institutions .']

sentences: [u'Ontology has essential role in Semantic Web realization .', u'Ontology development can be categorized as manual , semi-automatic and automatic .', u'In this paper , we are going to investigate which category is the best approach in the ontology development .', u'Therefore we compared between the ontology structures produce by manual ontology development with automatic ontology development .', u'The comparison is done based on the concept and instance of the ontology structure .', u'During the experiment , we use DuriO which constructed previously by using manual approach .', u'Meanwhile for automatic approach , we use Text2Onto .', u'Then from both approaches , the structures were extracted and bar charts are presented to show the difference .', u'As the result , the ontology structure produced by using manual approach is aligned as expected with domain knowledge .', u'Whereas , the ontology structure produced by using automatic ontology development contain excessive unrelated terms .']

sentences: [u'The complexity of 3D content makes its creation accessible to profes- sional IT developers equipped with specific software tools and hardware devices , but it is generally inaccessible to non-expert users .', u'The Semantic Web approach enables description of web resources with commonly used concepts .', u'However , the use of semantic concepts may also facilitate creation of interactive 3D con- tent .', u'In this paper , a new approach to conceptual semantic representation of 3D content is proposed .', u'The presented solution permits modelling of 3D content at an arbitrarily high level of semantic abstraction with the use of domain-specific on- tologies .', u'Thanks to the compliance with well-established solutions for semantics and 3D content representation , the proposed approach can facilitate widespread creation , dissemination and reuse of 3D content by non IT-professionals in a va- riety of application domains .']

relations: [[], [(u"`` collaborative annotating '' approach", u'USED-FOR', u'Wikipedia article')], [(u'incoming link', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic features'), (u'incoming link', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Wikipedia'), (u'incoming link', u'CONJUNCTION', u'outgoing link'), (u'incoming link', u'CONJUNCTION', u'section heading'), (u'outgoing link', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic features'), (u'outgoing link', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Wikipedia'), (u'outgoing link', u'CONJUNCTION', u'section heading'), (u'section heading', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic features'), (u'section heading', u'CONJUNCTION', u'template item'), (u'template item', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic features')], [(u'semantic features', u'USED-FOR', u'missing annotations'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'missing annotations')]]
sentences: [u"Compared with plain-text resources , the ones in `` semi-semantic '' web sites , such asWikipedia , contain high-level semantic information which will benefit various automatically annotating tasks on themself .", u"In this paper , we propose a `` collaborative annotating '' approach to automatically recommend categories for a Wikipedia article by reusing category annotations from its most similar articles and ranking these annotations by their confidence .", u'In this approach , four typical semantic features in Wikipedia , namely incoming link , outgoing link , section heading and template item , are investigated and exploited as the representation of articles to feed the similarity calculation .', u'The experiment results have not only proven that these semantic features improve the performance of category annotating , with comparison to the plain text feature ; but also demonstrated the strength of our approach in discovering missing annotations and proper level ones for Wikipedia articles .']

entities: [[(u'interlinking datasets', u'Material'), (u'Linked Open Data cloud', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'interlinking', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'Uniform Resource Identifier', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Open Data cloud', u'Material')], [(u'variable weights', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dataset', u'Generic')]]
sentences: [u'The problem of interlinking datasets in , and with the Linked Open Data cloud has been one of major challenges and an important research subject in the Semantic Web .', u'The interlinking is frequently addressed on existing data .', u'The proposed approach , however , suggests a system to verify in first place the existence of the Uniform Resource Identifier of the resource being published in the cloud in order to establish links with it .', u'The overall aim of the research is designing a system to facilitate the follow of the best practices and recommendation in publishing data into the Linked Open Data cloud .', u'The main contribution of the presented paper is the use of the domain to allocate variable weights in measuring the similarity of the instances , according to the significance of their properties in defining the identity of the dataset .']

entities: [[(u'unstructured nature', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic web', u'Method')], [(u'OWL files', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'software agents', u'Task')], [(u'inference', u'Task')], [(u'Conference Ontology', u'Method')], [(u'architectural point of view', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'three-layer architecture', u'Method')], [(u'web applications', u'Task')]]
sentences: [u'Traditional websites no longer meet the needs of todays software agents because of their unstructured nature in terms of the semantics they convey .', u'One of the primary objectives of semantic web is to enable software agents infer facts and knowledge out of different websites .', u'The primary aim of this project is to develop an application to manipulate OWL files , browse ontologies and enable software agents infer information semantically .', u'Needless to say such inference is not feasible in current conventional applications .', u'We have considered the Conference Ontology , extracted from the Ontology Repository of the University of Manchester as our sample ontology .', u'From architectural point of view , we used a three-layer architecture .', u'Due to the similarity of current web applications with the architecture we used , we were able to have an actual comparison made between the two approaches .']

sentences: [u"In recent years , Recommender System 's models and techniques , have been applied in e-Learning and main efforts are been centered in learners , their guide and their success when using Learning Management Systems and other Web-based and virtual artifacts .", u'Several techniques were adapted or even developed for this purposes .', u'Our current project is concerned to the need to develop a Recommender System Architecture that may assist teachers in their e-Learning design practices .', u'Instructional Design Methods , Learning Theories , Efficient Searching Methods and Tools and Meta-data Managing , are examples of the necessary knowledge and abilities .', u'In this document we are centered in presenting the overall system architecture and describing their main parts .', u'We are also reporting actual results .', u"Due to it 's wide conception , this project involves Knowledge Engineering , Software Engineering , Machine Learning , Semantic Web Searching , and Data Mining models and tools ."]

relations: [[(u'service provisioning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'integration'), (u'integration', u'CONJUNCTION', u'composition')], [], [], [(u'knowledge representation formalism', u'USED-FOR', u'hybrid programs')], [], [(u'hybrid system', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology reasoning'), (u'XSB Prolog', u'USED-FOR', u'hybrid system'), (u'XSB Prolog', u'USED-FOR', u'rule reasoning'), (u'rule reasoning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology reasoning')], []]
sentences: [u'In business process management , it has become necessary to semantically annotate business processes with ontology for better service provisioning , integration and composition .', u'The OASIS has introduced Universal Business Languages ( UBL ) as a common format for standardizing common business documents as well as business processes .', u'We propose a method for capturing and managing the information stored in business transactions based on the widely used UBL .', u'We use hybrid programs as the knowledge representation formalism .', u'The formalism of hybrid programs integrates normal clauses ( using the parlance of logic programming ) with ontology specified in OWL-DL ( semantic web standard ) .', u'This hybrid system uses XSB Prolog for rule reasoning and Pellet for ontology reasoning .', u'We have built a tool that takes a description of a UBL process as input and produces the corresponding hybrid program as output knowledge base on which suitable queries can be fired .']

sentences: [u'Web services is a distributed technology and have developed in recent years , paid more and more attention to researchers.As the increasing number of information systems in the network described by Web services technology , the combination of existing business processes to meet the more complex ones has become the main trend of development.In addition , because of the complexity and dynamic nature of the Web services environment , Web service composition makes it a very difficult task.So Web service composition has become a hot and difficulty in the field of semantic Web services.This paper describes a Web service composition framework based on OWL-S and HTN and details the algorithm idea of how to use HTN planning to solve the problem of Web service composition.Finally , the course selection service of students is implemented to demonstrate the feasibility of the method .']

entities: [[(u'unifying logic', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web Architecture', u'Method')], [(u'ALCpu', u'Method'), (u'description logic', u'Method'), (u'names assumption', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'general rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Datalog Programs', u'Method'), (u'default negation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ALCpu knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'ABox A of assertions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL roles', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'open answer set semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'extended Herbrand structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL roles', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'open answer sets', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'general rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'decidability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'weak safeness condition', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'DL tableaux-based algorithms', u'Method'), (u'decision procedures', u'Method'), (u'KB satisfiability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query entailment problems', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'unifying logic'), (u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rules'), (u'rules', u'USED-FOR', u'unifying logic')], [(u'ALCpu', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'description logic')], [(u'DL concepts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'DL roles')], [(u'DL concepts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'DL roles')], [], [(u'DL tableaux-based algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'decision procedures'), (u'DL tableaux-based algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'query entailment problems')]]
sentences: [u'A unifying logic is built on top of ontologies and rules for the revised Semantic Web Architecture .', u'This paper proposes ALCpu , which integrates a description logic ( DL ) that makes a unique names assumption with general rules that have the form of Datalog Programs permitting default negation in the body .', u'An ALCpu knowledge base ( KB ) consists of a TBox T of subsumptions , an ABox A of assertions , and a novel PBox P of general rules that share predicates with DL concepts and DL roles .', u'To model open answer set semantics , extended Herbrand structures are used for interpreting DL concepts and DL roles , while open answer sets hold for general rules .', u'To retain decidability , a well-known weak safeness condition is employed .', u'We develop DL tableaux-based algorithms for decision procedures of the KB satisfiability and the query entailment problems .']

entities: [[(u'crisis management', u'Task'), (u'financial institutions', u'Task'), (u'crisis contagion', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'systemic risk', u'Material')], [], [(u'crisis contagion', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge sharing', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'crisis contagion management', u'Task')], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'static ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dynamic ontology', u'Task'), (u'social ontology', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Ontology Web Language', u'Material')], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'financial institutions', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'crisis contagion', u'CONJUNCTION', u'systemic risk')], [], [], [(u'static ontology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontologies'), (u'static ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dynamic ontology'), (u'dynamic ontology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontologies'), (u'dynamic ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'social ontology'), (u'social ontology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontologies')], [(u'Ontology Web Language', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web Rules Languages ( SWRL ) framework'), (u'Semantic Web Rules Languages ( SWRL ) framework', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology')], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'financial institutions')]]
sentences: [u'What makes crisis management in financial institutions fairly unique and particularly complex is the accompanying crisis contagion or systemic risk .', u'The subprime mortgage crisis currently happening in the USA is a typical example .', u'In order to further deepen our understanding of how crisis contagion occurs and enhance information interchange and knowledge sharing among related entities , ontologies for crisis contagion management in financial institutions are proposed in this study .', u'Three categories of ontologies , which include static ontology , dynamic ontology , and social ontology , are developed to deal with different perspectives in this domain .', u'The three types of ontology are then united in the Ontology Web Language ( OWL ) and the Semantic Web Rules Languages ( SWRL ) framework , both of which are machine readable .', u'Finally , the case of Long-Term Capital Management ( LTCM ) is offered to demonstrate how the proposed ontologies are used in financial institutions .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'intelligent agents', u'Task')], [(u'ontology-based metadata', u'Material'), (u'rule-based reasoning', u'Method')], [(u'SW proof layer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'interchanged information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'multi-agent framework', u'Method')], [(u'rule paradigm', u'Method')], [(u'external reasoning', u'Method'), (u'receiving agent', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'intelligent agents')], [(u'ontology-based metadata', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rule-based reasoning')], [], [], [], [(u'external reasoning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'proofing services'), (u'receiving agent', u'USED-FOR', u'semantics')]]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web aims to offer an interoperable environment that will allow users to safely delegate complex actions to intelligent agents .', u"Much work has been done for agents ' interoperability ; especially in the areas of ontology-based metadata and rule-based reasoning .", u'Nevertheless , the SW proof layer has been neglected so far , although it is vital for agents and humans to understand how a result came about , in order to increase the trust in the interchanged information .', u'This paper focuses on the implementation of third party SW reasoning and proofing services wrapped as agents in a multi-agent framework .', u'This way , agents can exchange and justify their arguments without the need to conform to a common rule paradigm .', u'Via external reasoning and proofing services , the receiving agent can grasp the semantics of the received rule set and check the validity of the inferred results .']

sentences: [u"Within the traditional model of scholarly communications , `` invisible colleges '' facilitate a process of social diffusion that fuels the growth of scientific specialties .", u'This diffusion of ideas operates not through published journal articles but rather through informal communications between researchers .', u'In recent years , researchers have availed themselves of collaborative Web 2.0 forums such as blogs , wikis , and social networking sites to meet their need for increasingly sophisticated vehicles of informal communication .', u'Examinations of the database Faculty of 1000 and the semantic web application VIVO help to illustrate how invisible colleges have migrated to a networked environment where they can play an even stronger role within scholarly communications .', u'This paper will argue that the enhanced social diffusion enabled by such collaborative online venues offers an opportunity for researchers globally to accelerate the pace of innovation in an increasingly open era of team science .']

sentences: [u'WARNING : you may come away with ideas not only for enriching your library system , but for your web site and other web-based library applications as well ! # R # # N # # R # # N # Microdata enables search engines and other automated processes to make sense of the data on a web page like identifying the title , author , and identification number of a book from all of the other content on a given page .', u'Web pages enhanced with microdata contribute to the semantic web , and in turn are more likely to be incorporated into search engines and advanced web applications .', u'If it sounds like we should publish microdata from Evergreens catalogue , you will be pleased to know that Evergreen was ( naturally ) the first library system to incorporate microdata in its default public catalogue with the 2.2.0 release in June 2012 .']

sentences: [u'The aim of personalized medicine is for patients to receive the right drug at the right time and at the right dose .', u'To achieve this aim , traditionally separate data sets , in drug discovery , hypothesis management , formulation , clinical trials and clinical research need to be integrated , queried and analyzed collectively to identify biomarkers necessary to tailor pharmaceuticals .', u'Ontologies , a formal representation of domain knowledge , can drive data integration ; however , at present few ontologies exist that bridge genomics , chemistry and medicine .', u'We present a high-level , patient-centric ontology to facilitate integration of data relating to translational medicine and describe prototype applications within both pharmaceutical research and clinical practice .', u'The ontology has been developed by participants in the World Wide Web Consortiums Semantic Web for Health Care and Life Sciences Interest Group and members of the National Center for Biomedical Ontology .']

sentences: [u'Ontology has become a very vital issue to solve important issues regarding human diseases through data integration of chemical and biological data .', u'Mining such data discovers highly important knowledge about diseases can give an important insight to arrive to new drug targets and assist in personalized medicine .', u'In the current paper , a mining technique for diseases is developed based on integrated ontology and association rule mining algorithm .', u'To perform mining , the semantic web , as a knowledge representation methodology is used to integrate data .', u'In addition , an Ontology Association Rule Mining algorithm ( OARM ) is developed since existing algorithms can not be applied because of the ontology nature of data containing several types of relations .', u'To test our performance , prostate cancer data is obtained from NCI , which is related to 279 genes and 89 genes ( from prostate cancer pathway ) .']

entities: [[(u'Automation of service composition', u'Task')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic')], [(u'formal representations', u'Method'), (u'semantic links', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'inferring data flow', u'Task')], [(u'Description Logic reasoning', u'Method'), (u'data flow', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'data flow', u'Material')]]
sentences: [u'Automation of service composition is one of the most interesting challenges facing the Semantic Web and the Web of services today .', u'Despite approaches which are able to infer a partial order of services , its data flow remains implicit and difficult to be automatically generated .', u'Enhanced with formal representations , the semantic links between output and input parameters of services can be then exploited to infer their data flow .', u'This work addresses the problem of effectively inferring data flow between services based on their representations .', u"To this end , we introduce the non standard Description Logic reasoning join , aiming to provide a `` constructive evidence '' of why services can be connected and how non trivial links ( many to many parameters ) can be inferred in data flow .", u'The preliminary evaluation provides evidence in favor of our approach regarding the completeness of data flow .']

entities: [[(u'SPARQL query language', u'Material'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'W3C', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'RDF data', u'Material'), (u'query graph patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'filters', u'Method'), (u'graph pattern matching', u'Task')], [(u'expression language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'W3C recommendation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'function calls', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SPARQL builtin functions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'extension functions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'extension functions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SPARQL query', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL filter language', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'FunSPARQL', u'Method'), (u'Functional SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'functional language', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'W3C', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'query graph patterns', u'USED-FOR', u'It'), (u'filters', u'USED-FOR', u'It')], [], [], [(u'extension functions', u'PART-OF', u'SPARQL filter language')], []]
sentences: [u'The SPARQL query language for RDF is the standard recommended by the W3C to query the Semantic Web .', u'It enables to query and search RDF data by using query graph patterns and filters restricting the solutions produced by graph pattern matching according to the constraints they express .', u'# R # # N # Constraints are either expressions defined according to the expression language specified in the W3C recommendation or function calls to SPARQL builtin functions or to extension functions .', u'# R # # N # The use of extension functions in a SPARQL query , although compliant to the recommendation , limits the interoperability of the query .', u'# R # # N # In this report we propose a lightweight extension of SPARQL to enable the \\textit { definition } of extension functions in the SPARQL filter language .', u'We call it FunSPARQL , standing for Functional SPARQL , as it consists in providing SPARQL with a functional language for expressing constraints .']

sentences: [u"Semantic information is necessary for Semantic Web processing and is useful to Web adaptation services such as personalization of users ' browsing activities on small screen devices .", u'However , semantic information is always implicitly encoded in most existing HTML documents .', u'This paper describes a page segmentation method to parse Web pages into rectangular segments containing some semantic information , namely blocks .', u'Existing page segmentation techniques are mainly built on HTML DOM structure or purely vision based , not accurate enough either in visual presentation or in semantic sense .', u'Our approach is automatic , and based on a refined typing system which tightly couples type analysis with indispensable visual cues to generate blocks into the tree structure , aiming to achieve high degree of coherence in both semantic and visual views .', u'Experimental results show better accuracy and completeness of our method over existing ones .']

sentences: [u'The Internet harbours a vast amount of information that does not cease to grow exponentially .', u'To avoid arriving to a situation of collapse , the actual model of Web needs to incorporate tools capable to handle and manage efficiently this huge quantity of resources .', u'The solutions that exist nowadays are shown little efficient since they oblige users to lose great part of their time in deciding which docu-ments are relevant and which not .', u'Therefore it is becoming necessary to develop systems for searching and mining the Web that allow to improve the access to the information in an efficient way .', u'At this moment , some of the more recurrent tech-nologies to face this problem deal with the development of intelligent software agents , the application of techniques of information filtering , and the development of the Semantic Web project .']

sentences: [u'Semantic coordination , namely the problem of finding an agreement on the meaning of heterogeneous schemas , is one of the key issues in the development of the Semantic Web .', u'In this paper , we propose a method for discovering semantic mappings across hierarchical classifications with attributes based on a new approach , which shifts the problem of semantic coordination from the problem of computing linguistic or structural similarities ( what most other proposed approaches do ) to the problem of deducing relations between sets of logical formulae that represent the meaning of concepts belonging to different schema .', u'We show how to apply the approach and the algorithm to an interesting family of schemas , namely hierarchical classifications , and present the results of preliminary tests on two types of hierarchical classifications , web directories and catalogs .', u'Finally , we argue why this is a significant improvement on previous approaches .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'classical field theory', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology area'), (u'semantic field model', u'USED-FOR', u'ontolog y characteristics'), (u'concept interaction', u'CONJUNCTION', u'hierarchical clustering')], [], [], [], [], [(u'clustering execution time', u'PART-OF', u'semantic field model'), (u'clustering execution time', u'CONJUNCTION', u'approximate linear relationship'), (u'concept scale', u'CONJUNCTION', u'approximate linear relationship')]]
sentences: [u'With the development of semantic web , more and more ontologies are developed for various purposes .', u'In order to evaluate these ontologies , there have emerged numerous ontology analysis approaches .', u'This paper introduces the classical field theory to ontology area , and puts forward a semantic field model to analyze ontolog y characteristics from the perspective of concept interaction and hierarchical clustering .', u'In semantic field , the equipotential lines pres ent a natural nesting structure .', u"The equipotential lines ' distribution corresponds with the semantics ' distribution resulting from the inte raction and association of ontology concepts .", u'Based on equipotential line distribution , we can analyze concept hierarchical clu stering characteristics .', u'Experiments showed that the semantic field does well in ontology concept hierarchical clustering analysis .', u'The semantic field model has good scalability , and clustering execution time follows an approximate linear relationship with concept scale .']

sentences: [u'Our world today is generating huge amounts of graph data such as social networks , biological networks , and the semantic web .', u'Many of these real-world graphs are edge-labeled graphs , i.e. , each edge has a label that denotes the relationship between the two vertices connected by the edge .', u'A fundamental research problem on these labeled graphs is how to handle the label-constraint reachability query : Can vertex u reach vertex v through a path whose edge labels are constrained by a set of labels ?', u'In this work , we introduce a novel tree-based index framework which utilizes the directed maximal weighted spanning tree algorithm and sampling techniques to maximally compress the generalized transitive closure for the labeled graphs .', u'An extensive experimental evaluation on both real and synthetic datasets demonstrates the efficiency of our approach in answering label-constraint reachability queries .']

sentences: [u'Knowledge management-based Web systems ( KMbWS ) are a novel class of Web information systems whose main goal is to adapt contents and presentations with respect to user needs and backgrounds through the execution of knowledge management processes .', u'KMbWS involve complex issues such as knowledge representation , classification and clustering , reasoning , and , more recently , ontologies and semantic Web .', u'In this paper we present a methodology for the designing and developing of KM-bWS , starting from the application domain analysis .', u'We also provide a reference multi-layer architecture for KM-bWS .', u"In our opinion , a KM-bWS can be considered as an `` intelligent knowledge hub '' because it makes distributed Web resources available by means of knowledge management techniques such as classification and clustering .", u'Finally , we present a reference model for developing a KM-bMS authoring tool able to support our methodology .']

entities: [[(u'solidarity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'social dimension', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'e-learning', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [], [], [(u'Online forums', u'Material')], [], [(u'meaning rich historical information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], []]
relations: [[(u'social dimension', u'PART-OF', u'e-learning'), (u'e-learning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'This chapter explores solidarity as a social dimension in the context of e-learning and the Semantic Web .', u'Its aim is to explore where the students show more solidarity with each otherin online learning environments or in offline settings ?', u'In the context of this chapter , the term solidarity between students means the sharing of useful resources between group members .', u'Online forums are the major Web service that we shall use to support solidarity online .', u'In online forums , we can ask complex semantic questions knowing that someone will understand the meaning of the question and hopefully will give us a good answer to it .', u'Add to forums the possibility of annotation with metadata and we can also depend on them to retrieve meaning rich historical information .', u'The research is based on case studies with focus groups conducted with Portuguese higher education health students .']

entities: [[(u'SW tools', u'Method')], [(u'RDFS schema generator', u'Method'), (u'PoweRGen', u'Method'), (u'morphological features', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RDFS schema', u'Method')], [(u'total-degree distribution', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'former', u'Generic'), (u'out-degree distribution', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Transitive Closure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'latter', u'Generic'), (u'power-law', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'PoweRGen', u'Method'), (u'synthetic property and subsumption graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'power-law exponents', u'OtherScientificTerm')], []]
relations: [[(u'query language interpreters', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'SW tools')], [(u'PoweRGen', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'RDFS schema generator')], [], [], [(u'PoweRGen', u'USED-FOR', u'synthetic property and subsumption graphs')], []]
sentences: [u'In order to cope with the expected size of the Semantic Web ( SW ) in the coming years , we need to benchmark existing SW tools ( e.g. , query language interpreters ) in a credible manner .', u'In this paper we present the first RDFS schema generator , termed PoweRGen , which takes into account the morphological features that schemas frequently exhibit in reality .', u'In particular , we are interested in generating synthetically the two core components of an RDFS schema , namely the property ( relationships between classes or attributes ) and the subsumption ( subsumption relationships among classes ) graph .', u'The total-degree distribution of the former , as well as the out-degree distribution of the Transitive Closure ( TC ) of the latter , usually follow a power-law .', u'PoweRGen produces synthetic property and subsumption graphs whose distributions respect the power-law exponents given as input with a confidence ranging between 90 ?', u'98 % .']

entities: [[(u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'data quality features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'drug databases', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'controlled terminologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'drug domain', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'terminologies', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web compliant Description Logics', u'Method'), (u'OWL DL', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'inductive reasoning', u'Method'), (u'drug databases', u'Material'), (u'OWL ontologies', u'Method'), (u'health care professionals', u'Method'), (u'drug databases', u'Material')], [(u'ontology concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'self-medication application', u'Task'), (u'Anatomical Therapeutical Chemical terminologies', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'This paper proposes a solution to enhance data quality features in drug databases .', u'The method we are using is based on the integration of controlled terminologies for the drug domain .', u'This approach requires several steps : ( 1 ) transforming the terminologies into a Semantic Web compliant Description Logics , namely OWL DL , ( 2 ) associating new axioms to concepts of these ontologies based on inductive reasoning on drug databases , and ( 3 ) assisting , using these OWL ontologies , our team of health care professionals in detecting and repairing data quality violations of selected features in drug databases .', u'This last step aggregates drug products using ontology concepts and checks the characteristics of the products with the concepts properties .', u'We present a concrete example of this solution on a self-medication application using the European Pharmaceutical Market Research Association and Anatomical Therapeutical Chemical terminologies .']

entities: [[(u'Web-search engines', u'Method'), (u'temporal dimension', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query formulation', u'Task'), (u'information extraction processes', u'Task')], [(u'temporal expressions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic embedded meta-information concerning time', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Temporal Web searching', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'Spanish', u'Material'), (u'Web-search engine prototype', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'user queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'search collections', u'Material')], [(u'temporal information management aptitudes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web searching', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'query formulation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'information extraction processes')], [], [], [], [], [(u'temporal information management aptitudes', u'USED-FOR', u'Web searching')]]
sentences: [u'Current Web-search engines can be improved through techniques that consider a temporal dimension in both query formulation and information extraction processes .', u'An accurate recognition of temporal expressions in data sources is required , as well as extracting semantic embedded meta-information concerning time in a standard format that allows reasoning without ambiguity .', u'Temporal Web searching entails an interesting advance on the way to the Semantic Web .', u'We propose a temporal expressions recognition and normalization ( TERN ) system for contents in Spanish , which has been integrated into a Web-search engine prototype .', u'The contribution of this system lies in its capability of taking into account the semantics of time in the user queries as well as in the search collections , independently of its representation .', u'Evaluation figures show that the inclusion of temporal information management aptitudes to Web searching means considerable improvements in its performance .']

relations: [[(u'XML', u'USED-FOR', u'Web technologies')], [], [(u'query evaluation algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'XML-based data models')], [], [], [], [(u'algorithmic design', u'USED-FOR', u'XML queries evaluation system'), (u'Object-Z', u'USED-FOR', u'algorithmic design'), (u'Object-Z', u'USED-FOR', u'XML queries evaluation system')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Web technologies based on XML , e.g .', u'Semantic Web and Web Services , facilitate Web automation and universally accessible content .', u'One of the key factors for the success of XML-based technologies is of finding an efficient query evaluation algorithm for XML-based data models .', u'An XML twig query is a complex selection predicate on both structure and content of a labelled XML document .', u'Several novel twig query evaluation algorithms have been proposed recently .', u'However , these algorithms are difficult to understand and hence implement due to high complexity .', u'In this work , we present an algorithmic design for XML queries evaluation system using Object-Z .', u'An Object-Z specification is developed to give a concise and logical description of the XML data model and the twig queries .', u'It makes the twig query evaluation straight-forward , and allows different evaluation algorithms to be constructed easily and independently .']

relations: [[(u'XML', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RDF')], [(u'RDF', u'USED-FOR', u'interoperation'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'data model'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology representation techniques')], [(u'ontologies', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'XML', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic interoperability')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology representation languages')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'extension method'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology representation'), (u'ontology representation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'inference language')]]
sentences: [u'XML and RDF are the current standards for establishing semantic interoperability on the Web , but XML addresses only document structure .', u'RDF better facilitates interoperation because it provides a data model that can be extended to address sophisticated ontology representation techniques .', u'We explain the role of ontologies in the architecture of the Semantic Web .', u'We then briefly summarize key elements of XML and RDF , showing why using XML as a tool for semantic interoperability will be ineffective in the long run .', u"We argue that a further representation and inference layer is needed on top of the Web 's current layers , and to establish such a layer , we propose a general method for encoding ontology representation languages into RDF/RDF schema .", u'We illustrate the extension method by applying it to Ontology Interchange Language , an ontology representation and inference language .']

sentences: [u'A social network is a set of people ( or organizations or other social entities ) connected by a set of social relationships , such as friendship , co-working or information exchange .', u'Social network analysis focuses on the analysis of patterns of relationships among people , organizations , states and such social entities .', u'Social network analysis provides both a visual and a mathematical analysis of human relationships .', u'Web can also be considered as a social network .', u'Social networks are formed between Web pages by hyperlinking to other Web pages .', u'In this paper a state of the art survey of the works done on social network analysis ranging from pure mathematical analyses in graphs to analyzing the social networks in Semantic Web is given .', u'The main goal is to provide a road map for researchers working on different aspects of Social Network Analysis .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'semantic awareness of computers', u'Task')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'software environment', u'Method'), (u'OntoLearn tool', u'Method'), (u'domain ontology', u'Task'), (u'intelligent information integration', u'Task')], [(u'OntoLearn', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantic interoperability platform', u'Method'), (u'small- and medium-sized tourism enterprises', u'Material')], [(u'OntoLearn', u'Method'), (u'general-purpose ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Developing the Semantic Web , seeking to improve the semantic awareness of computers connected via the Internet , requires a systematic , computer-oriented world representation .', u'Researchers often refer to such a model as an ontology .', u'Despite the work done on them in recent years , ontologies have yet to be widely applied and used .', u"Research has devoted only limited attention to such practical issues as techniques and tools aimed at an ontology 's actual construction and content .", u'The authors have built a software environment , centered around the OntoLearn tool , which can build and assess a domain ontology for intelligent information integration within a virtual user community .', u'OntoLearn has already been tested in two European projects , where it functioned as the basis for a semantic interoperability platform used by small- and medium-sized tourism enterprises .', u'Further , developers can easily adapt OntoLearn to work with other general-purpose ontologies .']

entities: [[(u'distributed SWS publication and discovery', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'distributed ontology publication approach', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'P2P network', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Web Service', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'ontology publication', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'distributed ontology publication approach', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology'), (u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'P2P network')], [], [], [(u'approach', u'COMPARE', u'approach'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology publication'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology publication')]]
sentences: [u'In previous work , we propose several mechanisms for distributed SWS publication and discovery .', u'As same as some other applications of Semantic Web , they require users to provide concepts which are defined in domain ontology .', u'However , users usually can not give an exact concept defined in ontology for a word in an open environment .', u"For the reason , we propose a distributed ontology publication approach , through which we can publish ontology to P2P network , so that for a `` word '' user can find the ontologies that the `` word '' is defined in .", u"Accordingly , a user can easily select an appropriate ontology to represent a concept for the `` word '' .", u'Then we apply the approach to our previous work to aid users to discover Web Service .', u'With the testing work , the approach proves to be practical and effective approach to ontology publication and discovery .']

entities: [[(u'e-Science', u'Method'), (u'scientific data', u'Material'), (u'scientific method', u'Method'), (u'silico', u'Material')], [(u'bioinformatics domain', u'Material'), (u'silico biology', u'Material'), (u'web based resources', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Web ( SW ) vision', u'Method'), (u'mechanization', u'Task')], [(u'myGrid', u'Method'), (u'SW technologies', u'Method'), (u'activities', u'Generic'), (u'resource discovery', u'Task'), (u'provenance', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'SW technology', u'Method'), (u'bioinformatics', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'The vision of e-Science is progressively being realized as diverse computational resources are being used to collect , store , process and integrate scientific data and to execute the scientific method in silico .', u'The myGrid project , which operates in the bioinformatics domain , has so far delivered the basic middleware for second generation in silico biology , which previously was undertaken via adhoc integration of web based resources .', u'The Semantic Web ( SW ) vision on the other hand is a promise to enable increased mechanization by giving information a well-defined meaning .', u'In myGrid we have applied certain SW technologies for two activities , namely resource discovery and provenance .', u'Here we discuss our experiences in these two cases .', u'We believe that our findings on utility of SW technology to bioinformatics can be generalized to the larger context Life Sciences and even e-Science']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'semantic applications', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic')], [(u'Construction of enterprise ontologies', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineers', u'Method')], [(u'knowledge reuse', u'Task'), (u'ontology construction process', u'Task')], [(u'semi-automatic method', u'Method'), (u'case-based reasoning', u'Method'), (u'semi-automatic ontology construction process', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'automatic selection', u'Task'), (u'ontology evaluation', u'Task'), (u'revision', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pattern candidate discovery', u'Task')], [(u'OntoCase', u'Method'), (u'retrieval and reuse phases', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'knowledge reuse', u'PART-OF', u'ontology construction process')], [(u'case-based reasoning', u'USED-FOR', u'semi-automatic method')], [(u'automatic selection', u'USED-FOR', u'approach'), (u'ontology evaluation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'revision')], []]
sentences: [u'As the technologies facilitating the Semantic Web become more and more mature they are also adopted by the business world .', u'When developing semantic applications , constructing the underlying ontologies is a crucial part .', u'Construction of enterprise ontologies need to be semi-automatic in order to reduce the effort required and the need for expert ontology engineers .', u'Another important issue is to introduce knowledge reuse in the ontology construction process .', u'By basing our semi-automatic method on the principles of case-based reasoning we envision a novel semi-automatic ontology construction process .', u'The approach is based on automatic selection and application of patterns but also includes ontology evaluation and revision , as well as pattern candidate discovery .', u'The development of OntoCase is still ongoing work , in this paper we report mainly on the initial realisation and first experiments concerning the retrieval and reuse phases .']

entities: [[(u'Crowdsourcing', u'Method')], [(u'crowd workers', u'Method'), (u'expert-based judgments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'link prediction', u'Task'), (u'schema mapping', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'schema level', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'automated approaches', u'Method'), (u'tasks', u'Generic')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'link prediction task', u'Task')], [(u'Wikipedia-based mechanism', u'Method'), (u'concept familiarity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'high quality link prediction', u'Task')], [(u'link prediction', u'Task'), (u'specificity', u'Metric')]]

sentences: [u'Crowdsourcing has been widely adopted in research and practice over the last decade .', u'In this work , we first investigate the extent to which crowd workers can substitute expert-based judgments in the task of link prediction and schema mapping , which is the creation of explicit links between resources on the Semantic Web at the instance and schema level .', u'This is important since human input is required to evaluate and improve automated approaches for these tasks .', u'We present a novel method to assess the inherent specificity of the link prediction task , and the impact of task specificity on quality of the results .', u'We propose a Wikipedia-based mechanism to estimate specificity and show the influence of concept familiarity in producing high quality link prediction .', u'Our findings indicate that the effectiveness of crowdsourcing the task of link prediction can improve by estimating the specificity .']

sentences: [u'We consider the setting of a Semantic Web database , containing both explicit data encoded in RDF triples , and implicit data , implied by the RDF semantics .', u'Based on a query workload , we address the problem of selecting a set of views to be materialized in the database , minimizing a combination of query processing , view storage , and view maintenance costs .', u'Starting from an existing relational view selection method , we devise new algorithms for recommending view sets , and show that they scale significantly beyond the existing relational ones when adapted to the RDF context .', u'To account for implicit triples in query answers , we propose a novel RDF query reformulation algorithm and an innovative way of incorporating it into view selection in order to avoid a combinatorial explosion in the complexity of the selection process .', u'The interest of our techniques is demonstrated through a set of experiments .']

sentences: [u'Purpose This paper seeks to establish a design for crossorganizational workflow based on logical channels of communication .', u'A set of scenarios is established which can be used to test the effectiveness of future architectures.Design/methodology/approach Starting with scenarios based on crossorganizational business transactions , designs a set of sequence diagrams , analyzes these diagrams , and then deduces the need for certain system capabilities.Findings Current approaches to web services focus on just one channel that of invocation .', u'In order to handle the full gamut of crossorganizational workflow , channels devoted to flow , monitoring , negotiation , and interpersonal interaction are also necessary.Research limitations/implications Extensions to this research might include designs for integrating these multiple channels .', u'Such designs can be tested against the scenarios discussed in the paper .', u'In particular , research related to the semantic web might extend the ideas raised here.Practical implic ...']

sentences: [u'This volume considers the web architectures and recent developments that make net-centric approaches for intelligence and national security possible.The development of net-centric approaches for intelligence , national and homelandsecurity applications has become a major concern in many areas such as defense intelligence and national and international law enforcement agencies , especially sincethe terrorist attacks of 9/11 .', u'Net-Centric Approaches to Intelligence and National Security presents developments in information integration and recent advances in web services including the concept of the semantic web .', u'Discovery analysis and management of web-available data poses a number of interesting challenges for research in web-based management systems .', u'Intelligent agents and data mining are among the techniques employed .', u'A number of specific systems that are net-centric based in various areas of military applications , intelligence and law enforcement are presented utilizing one or more of such techniques .']

relations: [[(u'volunteered geographic information', u'USED-FOR', u'geospatial domain')], [(u'`` geographic information retrieval', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'topical research areas')], [(u'GEOCROWD workshop', u'USED-FOR', u'open research problems')]]
sentences: [u"Following last year 's successful event , it is a real pleasure to welcome you to the proceedings of the second edition of the ACM SIGSPATIAL International Workshop on Crowdsourced and Volunteered Geographic Information ( GEOCROWD ) , which include work presented at the workshop in Orlando , Florida. # R # # N # # R # # N # As user-generated content explodes in size , the geospatial domain is especially affected by these large amounts of volunteered geographic information ( VGI ) .", u"Researchers have been quick to realize the importance of these developments and have started working on the relevant research problems , giving rise to new topical research areas such as `` geographic information retrieval '' , `` crowdsourcing '' , `` geospatial ( semantic ) Web '' , `` linked geospatial data '' , `` GeoWeb 2.0 '' etc .", u'The GEOCROWD workshop was designed to bring together researchers and practitioners from the above areas to discuss open research problems and to develop a research agenda for the future .']

sentences: [u'The maintenance of OWL-S ontology syntactic consistency is very important in the evolution of semantic web services.In this paper , the differences between OWL-S and domain ontology are analyzed , and a maintenance framework is proposed to guide engineers to maintain the syntactic consistency of OWL-S.After the elementary changes of OWL-S are defined and abstracted , the change relation matrix is given to define the dependency between them , then , an algorithm to generate potential changes based on relation matrix is shown , and the time complexity of this algorithm is also analyzed.The syntactic consistency rules of OWL-S are divided into two types : mandate rules and optional rules while the descriptions and formal definitions of these rules are also given .', u'In so doing , the agent can check these rules automatically , and help engineers to maintain the syntactic consistency of OWL-S ontology .']

relations: [[], [(u'Fuzzy ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'uncertainty problems'), (u'domain ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'uncertainty problems')], [(u'set relation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic relationships of fuzzy concepts'), (u'set relation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'order relation'), (u'order relation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic relationships of fuzzy concepts'), (u'order relation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'equiva- lence relation'), (u'order relation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic association relation'), (u'equiva- lence relation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic relationships of fuzzy concepts'), (u'equiva- lence relation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic association relation'), (u'semantic association relation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic relationships of fuzzy concepts')], [(u'semantic query expansion', u'USED-FOR', u'fuzzy semantic retrieval'), (u'fuzzy concepts', u'PART-OF', u'linguistic variable fuzzy ontology'), (u'linguistic variable fuzzy ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic relations')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic retrieval')]]
sentences: [u'Ontology is the basis of sharing and reusing knowledge on the Se- mantic Web , and ontology-based semantic retrieval is a hotspot of current research .', u'Fuzzy ontology is an extension of domain ontology for solving the uncertainty problems .', u'To represent fuzzy knowledge more effectively , this pa- per presents fuzzy ontology models of linguistic variable , considering semantic relationships of fuzzy concepts , including set relation , order relation , equiva- lence relation and semantic association relation etc .', u'To achieve fuzzy semantic retrieval , the semantic query expansion in SPARQL query language is con- structed by semantic relations between fuzzy concepts defined in linguistic variable fuzzy ontology .', u'The application shows that the extended query can re- turn all results which satisfy research requirement at semantic level without up- grading current main search algorithm , and this research facilitates the semantic retrieval through fuzzy concepts on the Semantic Web .']

entities: [[(u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'shared item concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'# N # content-based recommender', u'Method')], [(u'perceived competence', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'recall', u'Metric')], [(u'system', u'Generic')]]
sentences: [u'htmlabstractPerceptions of a systems competence influence acceptance # N # of that system [ 31 ] .', u'Ideally , users perception of # N # competence matches the actual competence of a system. # N # This paper investigates the relation between actual and # N # perceived competence of transparent Semantic Web # N # recommender systems that explain recommendations in # N # terms of shared item concepts .', u'We report an experiment # N # comparing non-transparent and transparent versions of a # N # content-based recommender .', u'Results indicate that in the # N # transparent condition , perceived competence and actual # N # competence ( in specific recall ) were related , while in the # N # non-transparent condition they were not .', u'Providing insight # N # in what aspects of items triggered their recommendation , by # N # showing the concepts that were the basis for a # N # recommendation , gave users a better assessment of how # N # well the system worked .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web popularity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF stores', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RDF stores', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'resource utilization', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data manipulation operations of RDF stores', u'Task')], [(u'semantic stores', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'evaluation metric', u'Metric'), (u'CRUD operations', u'Task')], [(u'evaluation methodology', u'Generic'), (u'semantic stores', u'Material'), (u'Barton Library dataset', u'Material')], [], [(u'evaluation metric', u'Metric'), (u'benchmarks', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic web popularity', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF stores')], [], [], [], [], [(u'Barton Library dataset', u'USED-FOR', u'evaluation methodology'), (u'Barton Library dataset', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic stores')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The semantic web popularity is basis for the development of RDF stores .', u'Benchmarks are being used to validate the performance claim of RDF stores .', u"The existing studies measure the stores ' performance only in terms of time and do not cover resource utilization , particularly the main memory , for data manipulation operations of RDF stores .", u'Therefore , their provided information on semantic stores is limited .', u'To cope with the deficiencies of the existing benchmarks , we have proposed an evaluation metric that considers both time and main memory to judge the performance of semantic stores on CRUD operations .', u'The evaluation methodology has been applied on the existing semantic stores using the Barton Library dataset .', u'We deduce that time and memory required for any operation , are interdependent .', u'The evaluation results show that the proposed evaluation metric provides better cost estimation than the existing benchmarks .']

entities: [[(u'renvois', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hyperlinked text', u'Material'), (u"Denis Diderot 's Encyclopedie", u'Material')], [(u'semantic web', u'Method')], [(u'renvois', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pre-organized information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge structures and hierarchies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
sentences: [u"This article provides a 'long history ' of the renvois , an 18th century antecedent of hyperlinked text featured prominently in Denis Diderot 's Encyclopedie ( 1791 ) .", u'It describes the emergence of renvois in the encyclopedias of early modern Europe , traces its expansion over the course of the 20th century through the work of such pioneers as Vannevar Bush , Ted Nelson and Tim Berners-Lee , and looks forward to the potential of renvois as a key component of the semantic web and the growing use of folksonomies online .', u'The article reveals how the use of renvois both in the 18th century and today leads to unsettling juxtapositions , contradictions and unexpected meanings , allowing readers to relinquish their position as passive receivers of pre-organized information , to subvert traditional knowledge structures and hierarchies , and to become active and integral participants in the production of knowledge .']

sentences: [u'Ontologies play an important role in the Semantic Web as well as in digital library and knowledge portal applications .', u'This project seeks to develop an automatic method to enrich existing ontologies , especially in the identification of semantic relations between concepts in the ontology .', u'The initial study investigates an approach of identifying pairs of related concepts in a medical domain using association rule induction and inferring the type of semantic relation using the UMLS ( Unified Medical Language System ) semantic net .', u'This is evaluated by comparing the result with manually assigned semantic relations based on an analysis of medical abstracts containing each pair of concepts .', u'Our initial finding shows that the automatic process is promising , achieving a 68 % coverage compared to manually tagging .', u'However , natural language processing of medical abstracts is likely to improve the identification of semantic relations .']

sentences: [u'The Semantic Web relies on two layers : XML and RDF .', u'XML documents are merely trees representing structured data or documents and accessed using XPath .', u'RDF is used for a Web of data and to provide metadata about data or documents ; it is organized as graphs made of collections of elementary triples and can be queried using SPARQL .', u'Based on these two paradigms , there exist tools and platforms that produce and process both XML and RDF .', u'When doing information integration and mash-up applications , there are scenarios where we need to query , compare and integrate data coming from both worlds .', u'In this report we present a seamless way of mixing both paradigms in SPARQL .', u'Generic extensions to SPARQL are explained , and then we provide use cases and an application in semantic annotation of textual documents using NLP techniques .']

sentences: [u'Identity relations are at the foundation of many logic-based knowledge representations .', u'We argue that the traditional notion of equality , is unsuited for many realistic knowledge representation settings .', u'The classical interpretation of equality is too strong when the equality statements are re-used outside their original context .', u'On the Semantic Web , equality statements are used to interlink multiple descriptions of the same object , using owl : sameAs assertions .', u'And indeed , many practical uses of owl : sameAs are known to violate the formal Leibniz-style semantics .', u'We provide a more flexible semantics to identity by assigning meaning to the subrelations of an identity relation in terms of the predicates that are used in a knowledge-base .', u'Using those indiscernability-predicates , we define upper and lower approximations of equality in the style of rought-set theory , resulting in a quality-measure for identity relations .']

sentences: [u'Based on a brief analysis of the emerging challenges and development strategies for digital libraries facing the convergence of the cyberinfrastructure , Semantic Web , and Web Services , the author advocates a new paradigm of digital libraries that encompass knowledge content , context , and communities , using as an example the three-tiered Digital Library Framework of the Chinese Science Digital Library strategic plan .', u'Within this framework , an Ontological Service Layer ( OSL ) plays the central role as a semantic glue for knowledge-based integration of digital resources , services , and processes .', u'Further analysis is given to the functional requirements of the OSL and a high level architecture of the OSL is presented .', u'An exploration of the structure , faceted ontology components , and possible construction tools of the underline Integrate Ontology System of the OSL is then made to illustrate approaches to implement the OSL .']

sentences: [u'Making distributed teams more efficient is one main goal of Collaborative Software Development ( CSD ) research .', u'To this end , ontologies , which are models that capture a shared understanding of a specific domain , provide key benefits .', u'Ontologies have formal , machine-interpretable semantics that allow to define semantic mappings for heterogeneous data and to infer implicit knowledge at run-time .', u'Extending development infrastructures and software architectures with ontologies ( of problem and solution domains ) will address coordination and knowl- edge sharing challenges in activities such as documentation , requirements specifi- cation , component reuse , error handling , and test case management .', u"The purpose of this article is to provide systematic account of how ontologies can be applied in CSD , and to describe benefits of both existing applications such as `` semantic wikis '' as well as visionary scenarios such as a `` Software Engineering Semantic Web '' ."]

relations: [[(u'Multi-Entity Bayesian Networks', u'USED-FOR', u'probabilistic ontology language PR-OWL'), (u'Multi-Entity Bayesian Networks', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Bayesian networks')], [(u'PR-OWL 2', u'USED-FOR', u'construction of hybrid ontologies')], [], [(u'Maritime Domain Awareness', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'real domains'), (u'Maritime Domain Awareness ( MDA )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'real domains'), (u'MDA )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'real domains')], [(u'RDF triplestores', u'USED-FOR', u'PR-OWL extension'), (u'OWL 2 RL profile', u'USED-FOR', u'PR-OWL extension')], []]
sentences: [u'The probabilistic ontology language PR-OWL ( Probabilistic OWL ) uses Multi-Entity Bayesian Networks ( MEBN ) , an extension of Bayesian networks with first-order logic , to add the ability to deal with uncertainty to OWL , the main language of the Semantic Web .', u'A second version , PR-OWL 2 , was proposed to allow the construction of hybrid ontologies , containing deterministic and probabilistic parts .', u'Existing PROWL implementations can not deal with very large assertive databases .', u'This limitation is a main obstacle for applying the language in real domains , such as Maritime Domain Awareness ( MDA ) .', u'This paper proposes a PR-OWL extension using RDF triplestores and the OWL 2 RL profile , based on rules , in order to allow dealing with uncertainty in ontologies with millions of assertions .', u'We illustrate our ideas with an MDA ontology built for the PROGNOS ( PRobabilistic OntoloGies for Net-centric Operation Systems ) project .']

entities: [[(u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'XML based Web services specifications', u'Method'), (u'toolkits', u'Method'), (u'query based invocation system', u'Method')], [(u'Web services based tools', u'Method')], [(u'Web services execution process', u'Task'), (u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'optimizations', u'Method'), (u'user queries', u'Material'), (u'Web services', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'automating Web services invocation', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Web services based tools', u'USED-FOR', u'application developers')], [(u'algorithms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'optimizations'), (u'algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'user queries')], []]
sentences: [u'There is a critical need to design and develop tools that abstract away the fundamental complexity of XML based Web services specifications and toolkits , and provide an elegant , intuitive , simple , and powerful query based invocation system to end users .', u'Web services based tools and standards have been designed to facilitate seamless integration and development for application developers .', u'As a result , current implementations require the end user to have intimate knowledge of Web services and related toolkits , and users often play an informed role in the overall Web services execution process We employ a set of algorithms and optimizations to match user queries with corresponding operations in Web services , invoke the operations with the correct set of parameters , and present the results to the end user .', u'Our system uses the Semantic Web and Ontologies in the process of automating Web services invocation and execution .']

sentences: [u'Visiting museums is an increasingly popular pastime .', u'Studies have shown that visitors can draw on their museum experience , long after their visit , to learn new things in practical situations .', u'Rather than viewing a visit as a single learning event , we are interested in ways of extending the experience to allow visitors to access online resources tailored to their interests .', u"Museums typically have extensive archives that can be made available online , the challenge is to match these resources to the visitor 's interests and present them in a manner that facilitates exploration and engages the visitor .", u'We propose the use of knowledge level resource descriptions to identify relevant resources and create structured presentations .', u'A system that embodies this approach , which is in use in a UK museum , is presented and the applicability of the approach to the broader semantic web is discussed .']

sentences: [u'In the field of law the most prominent tasks are legal assessment and qualification .', u'These tasks aim at determining whether a legal case is allowed and which legal categories does it fulfil given an appropriate body of legal norms .', u'We have developed a legal modelling framework called Emerald , which builds on Semantic Web standards and is able to solve these legal problems even providing means for information collection .', u'Our proposed formal modelling approach of Emerald uses OWL 2 description logic combined with SWRL rules to answer legal qualification problems .', u'In this paper we present an algorithm to collect input case specification from end users by conducting an interactive dialogue .', u'A backward chaining algorithm generates relevant questions with respect to the qualification problem , taking into consideration any partial case description available and other constraints in description logic .']

sentences: [u'Different types of covert illicit networks in cyberspace hold the potential to become actors in cyber conflicts .', u'Current literature on structures of covert networks in cyberspace is often constrained by the lack of quantitative data and researchers mostly focus on networks operating outside the cyberspace .', u'The purpose of this paper is to review the current state of research into illicit networks in cyberspace and to apply the terminology and concepts of Social Network Analysis on criminal organisations operating online .', u'Social Network Analysis is a quantitative data analysis method , which can identify hierarchies , subgroups , individuals and their relative importance in covert illicit networks , by using data from multiple sources ( academic research , law enforcement , black market trading , semantic web analysis etc . ) .', u'Here I explore how Social Network Analysis offers methods to discover hidden structures of covert networks in cyberspace .']

sentences: [u'The Web has come a long way since its invention by Berners-Lee , when it focused essentially on visualization and presentation of content for human consumption ( Syntactic Web ) , to a Web providing meaningful content , facilitating the integration between people and machines ( Semantic Web ) .', u'This paper presents a survey of different tools that provide the enrichment of the Web with understandable annotation , in order to make its content available and interoperable between systems .', u'We can group Semantic Annotation tools into the diverse dimensions : dynamicity , storage , information extraction process , scalability and customization .', u"The analysis of the different annotation tools shows that ( semi- ) automatic and automatic systems are n't as efficient as needed without human intervention and will continue to evolve to solve the challenge .", u'Microdata , RDFa and the new HTML5 standard will certainly bring new contributions to this issue .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'it', u'CONJUNCTION', u'in-house systems')], [], [(u'Semantic Web ( SW ) technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'meaning representation')], [], [(u'ordering scenario', u'USED-FOR', u'SW techniques')]]
sentences: [u'Libraries and library professionals have tried to keep up with technological advances that impact information services .', u'With the increase of resources on the web , librarians are exploring methods of integrating bibliographic resources found when searching or browsing the web .', u'For instance there are currently some tools like citation managers , that librarians can collect some bibliographic data and canintegrate it into in-house systems .', u'So far libraries used technology but often those that needed human intervention to interpret .', u'This paper aims discuss various a Semantic Web ( SW ) technologies that can be exploited for better and efficient management of resources enabling meaning representation so that data can be manipulated with meaning and context by agents .', u'SWTs offer a wide range of possible applications to meaningfully managing information resources .', u'A typical ordering scenario is used to demonstrate the deployment of SW techniques .']

sentences: [u'Publisher Summary # R # # N # The chapter presents a semantic Web-based architecture used to discover Web resources within the Intranet of an enterprise .', u'This platform for hypermedia resource is called ITW and is based on Web services and agents , exploiting the spatial/temporal relations related to Web resources .', u'This system consists of a collection of Web services , software agents and other components .', u'ITW uses a RDF/XML model for semantic representation of metadata and spatial and temporal relations between Web resources .', u'All involved information within the system is XML-based and uses special languages for expressing metadata and temporal relationships between Web hypermedia documents .', u'For further development , to increase the processing speed , for the next version it is intended to store the XML/RDF constructs within an XML native database and to implement simple reasoning services regarding the search .']

relations: [[(u'Methods', u'CONJUNCTION', u'systems'), (u'Methods', u'USED-FOR', u'start and stop properties'), (u'systems', u'USED-FOR', u'start and stop properties'), (u'systems', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web structured resources'), (u'systems', u'USED-FOR', u'statements')], [], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Methods and systems for providing start and stop properties to Semantic Web structured resources and statements are disclosed .', u'The start and stop properties can specify a lifetime during which a resource or statement can be valid .', u'A call or query to one or more resources can return statement data including the start and stop properties for the resources and/or statements .', u'Dates can be specified with the call or query such that the returned resources and statements have lifetimes including the specified dates .', u'Screen images of the data can display subject and object nodes and predicate arcs for the selected dates .', u'A sequence of screen images can display a timeline of nodes and arcs by adding or hiding nodes and arcs to correspond with the start and stop properties of the statements .', u'Tools are provided for the user to navigate through the sequence .']

sentences: [u'The paper illustrates the design and implementation of a highly flexible , electronic market-place for learning resources called UNIVERSAL .', u'Integrating learning resource related data in a ( semi- ) automated way demands a flexible data model .', u'The paper elaborates on components of an educational market-place model such as learning resources , agents , rights and delivery systems .', u'The central data formats of UNIVERSAL are based on RDF .', u'We argue that the flexibility of RDF provides a high level of adaptability to future changes in the data model and a maximum level of openness .', u'UNIVERSAL aims at contributing to the idea of a semantic Web of universities , pursuing the vision of having data on the Web defined and linked in such a way that it can be used by machines not just for display purposes , but for automation , integration and reuse of data across various applications .']

sentences: [u'Ranking models are used by Web search engines to answer user queries based on key words .', u'Traditionally ranking models are based on a static snapshot of the Web graph , which is basically the link structure of the Web documents .', u"The visitor 's browsing activities is directly related to importance of the document .", u'However in this traditional static model the document importance on account of interactive browsing is neglected .', u'Thus this model lacks the ability of taking advantage of user interaction for document ranking .', u'In this paper we propose a model based on semantic web to improve the local ranking of the Web documents .', u'This model works on Ant Colony algorithm to enable the Web servers to interact with Web surfers and thus improve the local ranking of Web documents .', u'The local ranking then can be used to generate the global Web ranking .']
