sentences: [u'data environments are not well served by current styles of search results presentation .', u'One example of this is large-scale archival , library or museum collections .', u'The range of user goals and interaction needs can be quite broad , and the information itself is highly structured yet very heterogeneous - it spans many subject areas , information types , and presentation/media .', u'Based on the use of semantic web formats for metadata , we believe it is possible to leverage the semantic relationships to drive aspects of results presentation - to change elements of the UI itself in response to the results data .', u"We present these concepts as a catalyst for discussion with the HCIR research community , exploring how semantic structures can support arrangement and components available for refining search results sets , and thus make the interface more responsive to user 's goals and needs ."]

sentences: [u"Categorization in the decision making classifies decision makers ' experiences about the world and provides a guide to reach a goal .", u'This implies that dynamically providing categories reflecting the given decision context gives a great enhancement in decision quality .', u'This study discusses the dynamic category selection under the Semantic Web environment , focusing on an implementation of a decision support system , the dynamic facet navigation system working with an ontology .', u'Predefined fixed categories are provided to refine search results to evade use of complex queries and tedious review of search results , but they often output insensible information because of never reflecting the difference in search results .', u'This paper proposes a dynamic category selection mechanism by using the total gain ratio under a given ontology , and a reordering scheme for resulted categories .', u'It proves the validity of the proposed approach with a statistical analysis lastly .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'regression learner', u'USED-FOR', u'transformed data'), (u'transformed data', u'USED-FOR', u'regression learner')], [], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'classification'), (u'ordinal classification trees', u'CONJUNCTION', u'classification trees'), (u'classification trees', u'CONJUNCTION', u'multi-relational classification trees'), (u'monotonicity constraints', u'CONJUNCTION', u'classification trees'), (u'monotonicity constraints', u'CONJUNCTION', u'multi-relational classification trees')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'non-linear ordering'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'class and attribute values')], []]
sentences: [u'Classification methods commonly assume unordered class values .', u'In many practical applications for example grading there is a natural ordering between class values .', u'Furthermore , some attribute values of classified objects can be ordered , too .', u'The standard approach in this case is to convert the ordered values into a numeric quantity and apply a regression learner to the transformed data .', u'This approach can be used just in case of linear ordering .', u'The proposed method for such a classification lies on the boundary between ordinal classification trees , classification trees with monotonicity constraints and multi-relational classification trees .', u'The advantage of the proposed method is that it is able to handle non-linear ordering on the class and attribute values .', u"For the better understanding , we use a toy example from the semantic web environment prediction of rules for the user 's evaluation of hotels ."]

sentences: [u'Given the astounding amount of data stored in spreadsheets and relational databases , a critical requirement for the evolution of the Semantic Web ( SW ) is the ability to convert data to SW compatible formats , such as RDF and OWL .', u'The process by which data is transformed into RDF is known as triplification .', u'This paper introduces Xcel2RDF , an MS Excel plug-in to support the triplification of spreadsheets , which minimizes the learning curve , as it is integrated into a widely used spreadsheet software tool .', u'The plug-in is user-friendly , does not depend on the installation of additional software and does not require the user to leave his familiar environment , thereby avoiding problems reported as the major drawbacks of existing spreadsheet to RDF conversion tools .', u'Finally , as a proof of concept , the paper illustrates how to use the tool to triplify statistical data .']

sentences: [u'SudocAD is a system concerning the author linkage problem in a bibliographic database context .', u"Having a bibliographic database E and a ( new ) bibliographic notice d , r being an identifier of an author in E and r ' being an identifier of an author in d : is that r and r ' refer to the same author ?", u'The system , which is a prototype , has been evaluated in a real situation .', u'Compared to results given by expert librarians , the results of SudocAD are interesting enough to plan a transformation of the prototype into a production system .', u'SudocAD is based on a method combining numerical and knowledge based techniques .', u'This method is abstractly defined and even though SudocAD is devoted to the author linkage problem the method could be adapted for other kinds of linkage problems especially in the semantic web context .']

entities: [[(u'semantic richness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'classic relational databases', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'RDB', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'one', u'Generic'), (u'reverse engineering', u'Method'), (u'RDB schema', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'ontology model', u'Method')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDB', u'Method'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'foreign keys', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic of integrity constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'reverse engineering', u'USED-FOR', u'one')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The lack of semantic richness is one of the biggest drawbacks of the data stored in the classic relational databases ( RDB ) .', u'This paper provides a method that gives a meaning to these data to serve the semantic web .', u'This method allows a direct and automatic conversion of RDB to ontology , it operates on two levels : The first one is based on the principle of reverse engineering ; its purpose is to extract the RDB schema and convert it directly to an ontology model ( TBOX ) .', u'The second level aims to populate the ontology by individuals ( ABOX ) using data of different records of the RDB and basing on the model of the ontology .', u'Our approach takes into account the relationships established via foreign keys between tables , and the semantic of integrity constraints during the conversion , which allows keeping the consistency and integrity of data .']

sentences: [u'Semantic web is utilized to construct advanced information service by using semantic relationships between entities .', u'Text mining can be applied to generate semantic relationships from unstructured data resources .', u'In this study , ontology schema guideline , ontology instance generation , disambiguation of same name by text mining and advanced historical people finding service by reasoning have been proposed .', u'Various relationships between historical event , organization , people , which are created by domain experts , are linked to literatures of National Institute of Korean History ( NIKH ) .', u'It improves the effectiveness of user access and proposes advanced people finding service based on relationships .', u'In order to distinguish between people with the same name , we compares the structure and edge , nodes of personal social network .', u'To provide additional i nformation , external resources including thesaurus and web are linked to all of internal related resources as well .']

sentences: [u'Richly interlinked , machine-understandable data constitute the basis for the Semantic Web .', u'We provide a framework , CREAM , that allows for creation of metadata .', u'While the annotation mode of CREAM allows to create metadata for existing web pages , the authoring mode lets authors create metadata -- - almost for free -- - while putting together the content of a page.As a particularity of our framework , CREAM allows to create relational metadata , i.e .', u'metadata that instantiate interrelated definitions of classes in a domain ontology rather than a comparatively rigid template-like schema asm Dublin Core .', u'We discuss some of the requirements one has to meet when developing such an ontology-based framework , e.g .', u'the integration of a metadata crawler , inference services , document management and a meta-ontology , and describe its implementation , viz .', u'Ont-O-Mat , a component-based , ontology-driven Web page authoring and annotation tool .']

sentences: [u'Semantic annotation is the fundament for the progress and realization of semantic web , meanwhile , provides formatted description for the knowledge in web pages and its semantic meaning in the field .', u'A method for semantic annotation to webpage was presented under the instruction of domain ontology in this paper .', u'By Edit distance and Wordnet distance and from the two aspects the semantic meaning of the word , the semantic correlation degree was measured , then the mapping relation of webpage and ontology was built .', u'Moreover , after the semantic annotating to the WebPages , the ontology was expanded effectively by the annotation results , to domanialize the ontology .', u'At the end , experimental results show the tagging method bases on the weight coefficient acquired form Edit distance , wordnet distance and extended ontology concept is provided with the best performance and the method is effective and applicable .']

sentences: [u'The synthesis of existing Persistent Organic Pollutants # N # pollution monitoring databases with epidemiological data is # N # considered for identifying some impacts of Persistent Organic # N # Pollutants on human health .', u'This task requires new rich data , # N # services , and model discovery capabilities from a multitude of # N # monitoring networks and web resources .', u'The FP7 project TaToo # N # ( Tagging Tool based on a Semantic Discovery Framework ) is # N # setting up a semantic web solution to close the discovery gap # N # that prevents full and easy access to web resources .', u'The use of # N # TaToo tools together with the Global Environmental Assessment # N # and Information System and the System for the Visualizing of # N # Oncological Data is discussed as a TaToo validation scenario # N # for anthropogenic impact and global climate change influence on # N # the trajectory of Persistent Organic Pollutants .']

sentences: [u"Many personalized Services that provide users with adaptive information according to users ' requirements and preferences have been researched and developed .", u"However , existing approaches are difficult to share a user 's information among heterogeneous services because these approaches manage users ' preferences in a single system .", u'In this paper , we propose a user preference sharing model based on the Semantic Web as a solution to resolve the problem .', u'Our model enables user preferences to be described and shared over service-specific ontologies which are affected by the feature of each service .', u'Our model is analyzed and evaluated with an implementation of the middleware that supports our model .', u"Our approach has the advantage of providing more efficient personalized services than existing approaches because it can describe users ' preferences centering around each service and share these information among heterogeneous personalized services ."]

sentences: [u'This book comprises a collection of chapters concerning novel research on Human-Computer Interaction .', u'Chapters correspond to high-quality selected papers from Interaccion 2007 , the 8th annual conference on Human-Computer Interaction held in Zaragoza , Spain , as part of the II CEDI ; the second edition of the Spanish Conference on Informatics , the biggest and most important in Spain .', u'This book is particularly aimed at researchers , advanced HCI students and practitioners .', u'It includes promising works that range from cutting edge paradigms such as Semantic Web Interfaces , Natural Language Processing and Mobile Interaction to new trends and interface-engineering techniques such as User-Centred Design , Usability , Accessibility , Development Methodologies and Emotional User Interfaces .', u'It also provides a specialized learning reference for advanced lectures , involving topics such as Human Factors , Collaborative User Interfaces and Model-based User Interface Design .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'ontology schema', u'Method'), (u'class', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'similarity measure', u'Metric'), (u'similarity of restricted ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'Method'), (u'2-grade ontology similarity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'2-grade ontology similarity technique', u'Method'), (u'circularities', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'similarity measure', u'USED-FOR', u'similarity of restricted ontologies'), (u'2-grade ontology similarity technique', u'USED-FOR', u'similarity definition')]]
sentences: [u'Resources integrated from heterogeneous resources of the Semantic Web are usually transformed to ontologies which based on the same ontology schema and can be used for analysis and data mining.These ontologies are different from each others in the part of instances of classes and properties.A variety of methods can be used for the similarity of these ontologies.Basically they apply pair-wise comparison of entities from each of the ontologies and select the most similar pair.These entities include class , property , instance , data type and so on.However , this task can be restricted in the comparison of instances and relations.A similarity measure is introduced for the similarity of restricted ontologies , which makes use of the specialty of inference in ontology and is a 2-grade ontology similarity technique.Moreover , the 2-grade ontology similarity technique can resolve the problem of circularities in similarity definition .']

entities: [[(u'model', u'Generic')], [(u'It', u'Generic')], [(u'centralized social platforms', u'Method'), (u'dynamic topology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'professional networks', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'privacy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data exchanges', u'Material'), (u'ownership', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SmartKeepers', u'Method'), (u'decentralized and secure environment', u'Method'), (u'coworking activities', u'Task')], [(u'node', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'collaborative space', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'network topologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'W3C compliant solutions', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'data ownership process', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Coworking style of work that involves a shared working environment and networking has emerged as an attractive model for organizations .', u'It relies on a highly dynamic collaboration among different partners .', u'Traditional centralized social platforms lack fundamental requirements for such a collaboration that are the management of the dynamic topology of such professional networks , privacy , data exchanges and ownership .', u'In this paper , we present SmartKeepers , a decentralized and secure environment for coworking activities .', u'Each user physically owns his node that he plugs in and out as he moves from one collaborative space to another .', u'The system supports a large variety of network topologies and is fully interoperable with W3C compliant solutions .', u'We showcase the cogency of the Semantic Web for building decentralized and secure services while keeping every user at the core of the data ownership process .']

sentences: [u'Description Logics have been widely applied for its strong abilities of description and mature algorithms in reasoning .', u'However , classical Description Logics are limited in dealing with the crisp concepts and roles , which makes it difficult to analyze imprecise information in Semantic Web or other ontology systems .', u'To some extent , type-1 fuzzy sets can reduce the effect of uncertainties .', u'But it is still not enough .', u'Comparing with type-1 fuzzy theory , system based on type-2 fuzzy sets can describe imprecise knowledge more exactly by using membership degree interval .', u'We present a type-2 fuzzy version of ALC and show the representation and reasoning capabilities of type-2 fuzzy ALC in this paper .', u'Then we use the membership degree interval that is proposed by type-2 fuzzy sets to build the fuzzy ontology system named F-OntoTM for trust management .']

sentences: [u'The Virtual Museum of the Pacific was developed by the authors and launched by the Australian Museum in November 2009 .', u"A digital ecosystem implemented as Web 2.0 application , the VMP is an experimental platform with information and knowledge acquisition for the Australian Museum 's Pacific collection .", u'Importantly , the VMP facilitates a number of social media interfaces that enable content to be added and tagged , the control vocabulary to be extended , user perspectives to be defined and narratives added via wiki .', u'It is therefore extensible .', u'This paper concentrates on technical issues involving several search methods : attribute search based on a control vocabulary , query refinement and query-by-example .', u'In doing so , the paper illustrates the issues involved in abstracting a generic collection management framework that can be re-used for developing other semantic Web digital ecosystems for other collection content .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web resources', u'Material')], [(u'RDFS', u'Method'), (u'non-class resources', u'Material')], [(u'Non-class resources', u'Material')], [(u'subjectivity score', u'Metric')], [(u'objectivity score', u'Metric'), (u'RDF triples', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'subjectivity score', u'Metric'), (u'objectivity score', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'subjectivity score', u'CONJUNCTION', u'objectivity score')]]
sentences: [u'The importance of semantic web resources is determined .', u'Some resources are classes ( of the type RDFS : Class ) ; others are non-class resources .', u'Non-class resources belong to one or more classes while class resources are subclasses of one or more parent classes .', u'A subjectivity score is determined for each resource of a set of resources based on the number of Resource Description Format ( RDF ) triples of which the resource is the subject and predefined weights of properties of the triples .', u'An objectivity score is determined for each resource based on the number of RDF triples of which the resource is the object and predefined weights of the properties of the triples .', u"The importance of a class is determined from the respective subjectivity score and objectivity score , and a factor relating to the importance of the class 's parents ."]

entities: [[(u'ontology management', u'Task'), (u'methodological and evolutionary aspects of ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'these', u'Generic'), (u'distributed and collaborative worlds', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic agent system', u'Method')], [(u'knowledge-intensive and community-driven systems', u'Method'), (u'knowledge sharing and communication', u'Task')], [(u'ontological and methodological foundation', u'Method'), (u'community evolution processes', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Semantic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'distributed and collaborative worlds')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Research in ontology management has reached a certain level of maturity , however , there is still little understanding of , and technological support for , the methodological and evolutionary aspects of ontologies as resources .', u'Yet these are crucial in distributed and collaborative worlds such as the Semantic Web , where ontologies and their communities of use naturally and mutually co-evolve .', u'Through a deep understanding of the real-time , community-driven , evolution of so-called ontologies , a semantic agent system can be made operationally relevant and sustainable over long periods of time .', u'Such a paradigm shift in knowledge-intensive and community-driven systems would affect knowledge sharing and communication across diverse communities in business , industry , and society .', u'In this paper , we give an overview of the practical and theoretical challenges and limitations , and based on that introduce an ontological and methodological foundation for community evolution processes .']

entities: [[], [(u'Digital Humanities', u'Material')], [(u'use-case study', u'Method'), (u'knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'phonetic symbolism', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'aural patterns in text', u'Material')], [(u'OpenMary', u'Method'), (u'base analytic', u'Method'), (u'MEANDRE', u'Method'), (u'semantic-web-driven data-intensive flow execution environment', u'Method'), (u'predictive modeling', u'Task'), (u'ProseVis', u'Method'), (u'comparisons', u'Generic'), (u'text collections', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'knowledge representation', u'USED-FOR', u'use-case study'), (u'phonetic symbolism', u'USED-FOR', u'use-case study'), (u'analytics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'visualizations')], []]
sentences: [u'Increased access to large-scale repositories of text begs questions about how scholars can use such repositories in their research .', u'It is essential that iSchools are aware of tools being created in the Digital Humanities since the processes and tools that are being developed by this transdisciplinary community are changing the preservation and curation of humanities data .', u'This paper will discuss a use-case study that uses theories of knowledge representation and research on phonetic symbolism to develop analytics and visualizations that help users examine aural patterns in text .', u'This work includes ( 1 ) identifying OpenMary as a base analytic ; ( 2 ) creating a routine in MEANDRE ( a semantic-web-driven data-intensive flow execution environment ) that produces a tabular representation of the data for predictive modeling ; and ( 4 ) developing an interface ( ProseVis ) for seeing these comparisons across text collections .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'Product libraries', u'USED-FOR', u'conceptual product information'), (u'domain terminologies', u'USED-FOR', u'conceptual product information')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'semantics of data')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The approach of computer-based concurrent engineering of products , denoted as virtual engineering ( VE ) , has been emerged to meet the requirements in product development due to increasing competition .', u'To enhance the information transfer between engineering groups , a domain- independent component structure is preferred .', u'Product libraries as well as conceptual product information can be automatically derived and exchanged by domain terminologies .', u'The ontology approach , as a concept of the Semantic Web to explicitly represent the semantics of data , promises a superior view .', u'In order to enable information exchange ontologies as a neutral description form are necessary , to bind different attribute labels with equivalent content to the given concepts .', u'Furthermore an integration of new domains and libraries becomes possible .', u'This paper aims to identify and analyze application areas for the usage of formal ontologies and introduces solutions for the integration of heterogeneous libraries .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web data', u'Material'), (u'third-party , ontological structures', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'publication paradigm', u'Method'), (u'local context', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneous data', u'Material'), (u'posteriori', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'decentralized processes', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'publication of semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'local data', u'Material'), (u'global schemas', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'third-party structures', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'publication of semantic information'), (u'global schemas', u'CONJUNCTION', u'third-party structures')], []]
sentences: [u'Best practices for the publication of Semantic Web data currently place an unacceptably high burden on the end-user , who is supposed to locate and embrace third-party , ontological structures prior to publishing any information .', u'This paper argues for a different publication paradigm where end-users are encouraged to publish potentially incomplete or conflicting information according to their own local context , and where heterogeneous data is consolidated a posteriori through bottomup , decentralized processes .', u'This approach has two key advantages : first , it greatly simplifies the publication of semantic information by allowing users to contribute purely local data , without any consideration for global schemas or third-party structures .', u'Second , it takes advantage of expressive , semantic links to relate both schemas and instances , creating complex webs of knowledge where cultural or social differences can flourish and be confronted one another .']

entities: [[(u'Information integration', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'Method'), (u'schema level', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data level', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'schema level', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mapping/matching concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'data level integration', u'Task'), (u'decentralized Semantic Web environment', u'Task')], [(u'ontology data', u'Material'), (u'matching method', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'Method'), (u'machine learning approach', u'Method')], [(u'ontology features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'method', u'Generic')], [(u'matching method', u'Method'), (u'ontology data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'schema level', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data level')], [], [], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'matching method')], [(u'method', u'COMPARE', u'general methods')], []]
sentences: [u'Information integration with the aid of ontology can roughly be divided into two levels : schema level and data level .', u'Most research has been focused on the schema level , i.e. , mapping/matching concepts and properties in different ontologies with each other .', u'However , the data level integration is equally important , especially in the decentralized Semantic Web environment .', u'Noticing that ontology data ( in the form of instances of concepts ) from different sources often have different perspectives and may overlap with each other , we develop a matching method that utilizes the features of ontology and employs the machine learning approach to integrate those instances .', u'By exploring ontology features , this method performs better than other general methods , which is revealed in our experiments .', u'Through the process that implements the matching method , ontology data can be integrated together to offer more sophisticated services .']

sentences: [u'DBpedia is a Semantic Web project aiming to extract structured data from Wikipedia articles .', u'Due to the increasing number of resources linked to it , DBpedia plays a central role in the Linked Open Data community .', u'Currently , the information contained in DBpedia is mainly collected from Wikipedia infoboxes , a set of subject-attribute-value triples that represents a summary of the Wikipedia page .', u'These infoboxes are manually compiled by the Wikipedia contributors , and in more than 50 % of the Wikipedia articles the infobox is missing .', u'In this article , we use the distant supervision paradigm to extract the missing information directly from the Wikipedia article , using a Relation Extraction tool trained on the information already present in DBpedia .', u'We evaluate our system on a data set consisting of seven DBpedia properties , demonstrating the suitability of the approach in extending the DBpedia coverage .']

sentences: [u'Managing a large scale RDF is a challenging problem in Semantic Web research domain since achieving efficiency and scalability is hard with keeping its intelligent level .', u'Various approaches including indexing and keyword querying have been applied to manage RDF successfully .', u'However , none of them address the problem from the higher level and support a massive scale RDF and a large scale user request at the same time .', u'In this paper , we present our hybrid approach with cache and ranking to achieve efficiency , scalability , and intelligence .', u'In our approach , a query is able to be answered quickly from the cache which holds results from the previous queries .', u'The entity-based cache structure is designed as distributed to serve a large scale user requests .', u'A ranking system is added to improve accuracy of returned results from the cache .', u'We present empirical evaluations of our approach .']

entities: [[(u'Web browsing', u'Task'), (u'web page', u'Material')], [(u'finding web resources', u'Task'), (u'information retrieval mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'semantics-enhanced search', u'Method')], [], [(u'Magpie', u'Method'), (u'interpretation of web pages', u'Task')], [(u'Magpie', u'Method'), (u'background knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web resource', u'Material')], [(u'Magpie', u'Method'), (u'ontology-based semantic layer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web resources', u'Material'), (u'web browser', u'Method')], [(u'Magpie', u'Method'), (u'semantic web browser', u'Method')], [(u'Magpie', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u"lab 's web resources", u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'Web browsing involves two tasks : finding the right web page and then making sense of its content .', u"So far , research has focused on supporting the task of finding web resources through 'standard ' information retrieval mechanisms , or semantics-enhanced search .", u'Much less attention has been paid to the second problem .', u'In this paper we describe Magpie , a tool which supports the interpretation of web pages .', u'Magpie offers complementary knowledge sources , which a reader can call upon to quickly gain access to any background knowledge relevant to a web resource .', u'Magpie automatically associates an ontology-based semantic layer to web resources , allowing relevant services to be invoked within a standard web browser .', u'Hence , Magpie may be seen as a step towards a semantic web browser .', u"The functionality of Magpie is illustrated using examples of how it has been integrated with our lab 's web resources ."]

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web ( SW )', u'Method'), (u'question answering', u'Task')], [(u'distributed semantic markup', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'QA systems', u'Method'), (u'semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'QA system', u'Method'), (u'PowerAqua', u'Method'), (u'semantic markup', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web', u'Material')], [(u'PowerAqua', u'Method'), (u'semantic resources', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'natural language query', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'heterogeneous semantic sources', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'distributed semantic markup', u'USED-FOR', u'QA systems')], [], [(u'PowerAqua', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'QA system'), (u'PowerAqua', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic markup')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web ( SW ) offers an opportunity to develop novel , sophisticated forms of question answering ( QA ) .', u'Specifically , the availability of distributed semantic markup on a large scale opens the way to QA systems which can make use of such semantic information to provide precise , formally derived answers to questions .', u'At the same time the distributed , heterogeneous , large-scale nature of the semantic information introduces significant challenges .', u'In this paper we describe the design of a QA system , PowerAqua , designed to exploit semantic markup on the web to provide answers to questions posed in natural language .', u'PowerAqua does not assume that the user has any prior information about the semantic resources .', u'The system takes as input a natural language query , translates it into a set of logical queries , which are then answered by consulting and aggregating information derived from multiple heterogeneous semantic sources .']

sentences: [u'Due to the increasing amount of information in the World Wide W eb , there is a need to develop an efficient approach which can process wide collection of data and convert those data into meaningful knowledge to the user .', u'With this in mind , the researchers have focused on improving the feature extraction method in natural language texts that are available in the Web in various forms such as news , articles , journals , design documents , etc.Over the past few years , the problem has been identified from many areas , in many domains and is solved giving some satisfactory result , which gives us future direction for our research .', u'In this paper , we review some existing approaches , issues and advantages of it to support the future research in the related areas of text mining , information retrieval , semantic web , web mining and natural language processing .']

entities: [[(u'Folksonomy', u'Method'), (u'user-generated taxonomy', u'Method')], [(u'Triadic datas', u'Material'), (u'tags', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'collaborative tagging', u'Method'), (u'folksonomy-based system', u'Method')], [(u'folksonomy data', u'Material'), (u'semantic web', u'Material'), (u'web resources', u'Material')], [(u'FCA-based folksonomy data mining approach', u'Method'), (u'folksonomy data', u'Material')], [(u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'FMT', u'Method'), (u'folksonomy-based bookmarking system', u'Method')], []]

sentences: [u'Folksonomy is a user-generated taxonomy to organize information by which a user assigns tags to resources published on the web .', u'Triadic datas that indicate relations of between users , tags , and resources , are created by collaborative tagging from many users in folksonomy-based system .', u'Such the folksonomy data has been utilized in the field of the semantic web and web2.0 as metadata about web resources .', u'In this paper , we propose FCA-based folksonomy data mining approach in order to extract the useful information from folksonomy data with various points of view .', u'And we developed tool for supporting our approach .', u'In order to verify the usefulness of our proposed approach and FMT , we have done some experiments for data of del.icio.us , which is a popular folksonomy-based bookmarking system .', u'And we report about result of our experiments .']

entities: [[(u'Recommender systems', u'Method'), (u'information overload', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'syntactic similarity metrics', u'Metric'), (u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'overspecialized recommendations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'strategy', u'Generic'), (u'overspecialization', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reasoning techniques', u'Method'), (u'semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'strategy', u'Generic'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'syntactic metrics', u'Metric')], [(u'reasoning-based strategy', u'Method'), (u'recommender system', u'Method'), (u'interactive digital television', u'Task'), (u'technique', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'reasoning techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'strategy'), (u'reasoning techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'overspecialization'), (u'semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning techniques')], [(u'strategy', u'COMPARE', u'syntactic metrics'), (u'them', u'COMPARE', u'syntactic metrics')], [(u'reasoning-based strategy', u'USED-FOR', u'interactive digital television'), (u'recommender system', u'USED-FOR', u'interactive digital television'), (u'technique', u'COMPARE', u'approaches')]]
sentences: [u'Recommender systems arose in view of the information overload present in numerous domains .', u'The so-called content-based recommenders offer products similar to those the users liked in the past .', u'However , due to the use of syntactic similarity metrics , these systems elaborate overspecialized recommendations including products very similar to those the user already knows .', u'In this paper , we present a strategy that overcomes overspecialization by applying reasoning techniques borrowed from the semantic Web .', u"Thanks to the reasoning , our strategy discovers a huge amount of knowledge about the user 's preferences , and compares them with available products in a more flexible way , beyond the conventional syntactic metrics .", u'Our reasoning-based strategy has been implemented in a recommender system for interactive digital television , with which we checked that the proposed technique offers accurate enhanced suggestions that would go unnoticed in the traditional approaches .']

entities: [[(u'grid technique', u'Method'), (u'open framework', u'Method'), (u'general criterion', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'middleware technology', u'Method'), (u'remote structural-state-evaluation system', u'Method'), (u'bridge based grid', u'Task'), (u'structural state evaluation', u'Task'), (u'grid services', u'Method'), (u'grid service model based semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'GT4 ) middleware', u'Method'), (u'grid service manage module', u'Method'), (u'registry', u'Task'), (u'grid task manage module', u'Method'), (u'GTMM ) based agent technique', u'Method'), (u'structural-state-evaluation task disassembling', u'Task'), (u'scheduling', u'Task'), (u'structural health monitoring', u'Task'), (u'Dongting Lake Bridge', u'Method'), (u'application background', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'prototype system.Practice', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'structural health monitoring', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'grid technique', u'CONJUNCTION', u'middleware technology'), (u'grid technique', u'USED-FOR', u'remote structural-state-evaluation system'), (u'grid technique', u'USED-FOR', u'bridge based grid'), (u'grid technique', u'USED-FOR', u'structural-state-evaluation task disassembling'), (u'open framework', u'CONJUNCTION', u'general criterion'), (u'general criterion', u'CONJUNCTION', u'middleware technology'), (u'remote structural-state-evaluation system', u'USED-FOR', u'bridge based grid'), (u'remote structural-state-evaluation system', u'USED-FOR', u'structural-state-evaluation task disassembling'), (u'grid service model based semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'Dongting Lake Bridge'), (u'registry', u'CONJUNCTION', u'scheduling'), (u'GTMM ) based agent technique', u'USED-FOR', u'structural health monitoring'), (u'GTMM ) based agent technique', u'USED-FOR', u'Dongting Lake Bridge'), (u'structural health monitoring', u'USED-FOR', u'Dongting Lake Bridge'), (u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'structural health monitoring')]]
sentences: [u'Taking advantage of the grid technique in open framework , general criterion , and standard middleware technology and so on , this paper proposed remote structural-state-evaluation system for bridge based grid , in which the distributing resources of structural state evaluation were defined as grid services , and under the management and control to evaluate the status of bridge.It designed grid service model based semantic Web to support formal modeling of grid service.By integrating Globus Toolkit 4 ( GT4 ) middleware , also developed grid service manage module ( GSMM ) to provide functions for registry , discovery and so on.Furthermore , developed grid task manage module ( GTMM ) based agent technique to performs structural-state-evaluation task disassembling , scheduling and so on.Taking structural health monitoring for the Dongting Lake Bridge as application background , developed a prototype system.Practice shows that the system is able to offer effective way to apply the structural health monitoring .']

entities: [[(u'communicative agents', u'Method'), (u'global society', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'electronic services', u'Task')], [(u'entrance of agents', u'Task'), (u'semi-open society', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'admission criteria', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'communicative skills', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'controller agent', u'Method')], [(u'knowledge representation framework', u'Method'), (u'games', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'extended logic programs', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'semi-open societies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'global vision', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'games', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge representation framework'), (u'extended logic programs', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge representation framework')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'global vision')]]
sentences: [u'We study the problem of checking the competence of communicative agents operating in a global society in order to receive and offer electronic services .', u'Such a society will be composed of local sub-societies that will often be semi-open , viz. , entrance of agents in a semi-open society is conditional to specific admission criteria .', u'Assuming that a candidate agent provides an abstract description of their communicative skills , we present a test that a controller agent could perform in order to decide if a candidate agent should be admitted .', u'We formulate this test by revisiting an existing knowledge representation framework based on games specified as extended logic programs .', u'The resulting framework finds useful application in complex and inter-operable web-services construed as semi-open societies in support of the global vision known as the Semantic Web .']

entities: [[(u'e-services approach', u'Method'), (u'electronic commerce', u'Material'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'message content', u'Material'), (u'message protocols', u'Task')], [(u'business-to-business ( B2B ) e-commerce interaction', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'service description language', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'DAML+OIL', u'Method'), (u'matchmaking queries', u'Material'), (u'negotiation proposals', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'agreements', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'description language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'B2B lifecycle', u'Material')], [(u'operators', u'Generic'), (u'interaction protocols', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'e-services approach', u'USED-FOR', u'electronic commerce'), (u'message content', u'CONJUNCTION', u'message protocols')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'service description language')], [(u'matchmaking queries', u'CONJUNCTION', u'negotiation proposals'), (u'negotiation proposals', u'CONJUNCTION', u'agreements')], [], [(u'operators', u'USED-FOR', u'interaction protocols')]]
sentences: [u'If an e-services approach to electronic commerce is to become widespread , standardisation of ontologies , message content and message protocols will be necessary .', u'In this paper , we present a lifecycle of a business-to-business ( B2B ) e-commerce interaction , and show how the Semantic Web can support a service description language that can be used throughout this lifecycle .', u'DAML+OIL is a sufficiently expressive and flexible service description language to be used not only in advertisements , but also in matchmaking queries , negotiation proposals and agreements .', u'We also identify which operations must be carried out on this description language if the B2B lifecycle is to be fully supported .', u'We do not propose specific standard protocols , but instead argue that our operators are able to support a wide variety of interaction protocols , and so will be fundamental irrespective of which protocols are finally adopted .']

entities: [[(u'RDF triple store benchmarks', u'Method'), (u'storage solution', u'Method')], [(u'real-world data', u'Material')], [], [(u'benchmark setup', u'Generic'), (u'store configuration', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'real-world datasets', u'Material'), (u'anomalies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], []]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'store configuration', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'benchmark setup'), (u'store configuration', u'CONJUNCTION', u'datasets'), (u'datasets', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'benchmark setup')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Although quite a number of RDF triple store benchmarks have already been conducted and published , it appears to be not that easy to find the right storage solution for your particular Semantic Web project .', u'A basic reason is the lack of comprehensive performance tests with real-world data .', u'Confronted with this problem , we setup and ran our own tests with a selection of four up-to-date triple store implementations - and came to interesting findings .', u'In this paper , we briefly present the benchmark setup including the store configuration , the datasets , and the test queries .', u'Based on a set of metrics , our results demonstrate the importance of real-world datasets in identifying anomalies or differences in reasoning .', u'Finally , we must state that it is indeed difficult to give a general recommendation as no store wins in every field .']

sentences: [u'The emerging heterogeneity of data management , programming models and operating platforms in sensor nodes are making the seamless interoperation of devices a challenge .', u'We consider this problem and leverage on the concepts of semantic web and service-oriented design to propose a model that adds a semantics and service-oriented layer to existing network models .', u'This added layer hides the hardware as well as software implementation details from the application layer and thus allows seamless data management between nodes whose capabilities may even be unknown .', u'The proposed model builds on top of well established standards OWL and OWL-S to encapsulate sensor data and services as hierarchical ontology and provides interfaces for service advertisement and discovery .', u'A case study has been discussed whereby the proposed model is used for service-oriented data management ( acquisition , archival , processing ) .']

relations: [[(u'Rule based systems', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web constructs'), (u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web constructs'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web constructs'), (u'OWL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SWRL'), (u'SWRL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web constructs')], [(u'ontology generation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'utilization')], [(u'rule ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'rule acquisition framework')], [], [(u'rule component identification', u'PART-OF', u'ontology-based rule acquisition'), (u'rule component identification', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rule composition'), (u'rule composition', u'PART-OF', u'ontology-based rule acquisition')], [(u'stemming', u'USED-FOR', u'former'), (u'stemming', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic similarity'), (u'semantic similarity', u'USED-FOR', u'former')]]
sentences: [u'Rule based systems and agents are important applications of the Semantic Web constructs such as RDF , OWL , and SWRL .', u'While there are plenty of utilities that support ontology generation and utilization , rule acquisition is still a bottleneck as an obstacle to wide propagation of rule based systems .', u'To automatically acquire rules from unstructured texts , we develop a rule acquisition framework that uses a rule ontology .', u'The ontology can be acquired from the rule base of a similar site , and then is used for rule acquisition in the other sites of the same domain .', u'The procedure of ontology-based rule acquisition consists of rule component identification and rule composition .', u'The former uses stemming and semantic similarity to extract variables and values from the Web page and the latter uses the best-first search method in composing the variables and values into rules .']

relations: [[(u'Web Services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Agent Technologies'), (u'Agent Technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Mobility')], [(u'knowledge asset', u'USED-FOR', u'intellectual capital'), (u'Web resource', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'knowledge asset')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Next generation of knowledge management systems will utilize different methods and techniques from the following communities to achieve the vision of ubiquitous knowledge : Semantic Web and Web Services , Agent Technologies , Mobility .', u'A knowledge asset ( Web resource or service ) to become an intellectual capital must be shared ; it increases in value while being used .', u'XML is the ideal format for the exchange of statistical metadata between applications , because it is simple to transmit over standard protocols , and because it is well supported by manipulation APIs at the application level .', u'This paper outlines the state of XML Web services today .', u'It demonstrates the need for a set of additional capabilities as companies deploy XML Web services to support increasingly sophisticated business processes .', u'Finally , it addresses how to begin to address the need for additional capabilities with a XML Web Services Architecture and its supporting specifications .']

entities: [[], [(u'modularization', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'modularization tools', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'evaluation criteria', u'Metric'), (u'ontology modularization tools', u'Method')], [(u'tool evaluation', u'Task'), (u'usability', u'Metric')], [(u'modularization tools', u'Method')], [(u'evaluation criteria', u'Metric'), (u'ontology modularization tools', u'Method')], [(u'evaluation method', u'Generic'), (u'ontology modularization', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineers', u'Method'), (u'modularization tools', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'quality ontology modules', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'evaluation criteria', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology modularization tools')], [], [], [(u'evaluation criteria', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'ontology modularization tools')], [(u'evaluation method', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology modularization'), (u'evaluation method', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology engineers'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'quality ontology modules')]]
sentences: [u'Semantic Web and ontology have received increased attention in recent years .', u'Various tools on modularization have been developed .', u'However , selecting an appropriate ontology to fit a given context is difficult because assumptions for the approaches vary greatly .', u'Therefore , a method that can compare modularization tools and help screen the most suitable approach is highly desired .', u'In this research , a new set of evaluation criteria for selecting appropriate ontology modularization tools is proposed .', u'Three aspects of tool evaluation , namely , tool performance , data performance , and usability are presented .', u'This study is an empirical analysis of a number of modularization tools .', u'Experimental results indicate that the proposed evaluation criteria for ontology modularization tools are valid and effective .', u'It provides an evaluation method for ontology modularization , enabling ontology engineers to compare different modularization tools and easily choose the appropriate approach to produce quality ontology modules .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'printed documents', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'smartFIX', u'Method'), (u'document analysis and understanding system', u'Method'), (u'DFKI spin-off insiders', u'Method')], [(u'adaptive Read', u'Method'), (u'BMBF', u'Method'), (u'smartFIX', u'Method'), (u'adaptivity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'fixed format forms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'unstructured letters', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'smartFIX', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'system smartFIX', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'document analysis and understanding system'), (u'smartFIX', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'document analysis and understanding system')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The internet is certainly a wide-spread platform for information interchange today and the semantic web actually seems to become more and more real .', u'However , day-to-day work in companies still necessitates the laborious , manual processing of huge amounts of printed documents .', u'This article presents the system smartFIX , a document analysis and understanding system developed by the DFKI spin-off insiders .', u'During the research project adaptive Read , funded by the German ministry for research , BMBF , smartFIX was fundamentally developed to a higher maturity level , with a focus on adaptivity .', u'The system is able to extract information from documents - documents ranging from fixed format forms to unstructured letters of many formats .', u'Apart from the architecture , the main components and the system characteristics , we also show some results from the application of smartFIX to representative samples of medical bills and prescriptions .']

relations: [[(u'Semantic Web infrastructure', u'USED-FOR', u'framework'), (u'Semantic Web infrastructure', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic interoperability'), (u'Semantic Web infrastructure', u'USED-FOR', u'relational database systems'), (u'large-scale environments', u'FEATURE-OF', u'relational database systems')], [(u'formal algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'relational database system'), (u'formal algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'OWL ontology'), (u'relational database Rs meta-data', u'USED-FOR', u'formal algorithm'), (u'structural constraints', u'USED-FOR', u'formal algorithm'), (u'structural constraints', u'PART-OF', u'relational database system')], [(u'vocabularies', u'USED-FOR', u'relational database systems'), (u'web', u'FEATURE-OF', u'relational database systems')], [], [(u'semantic conflicts', u'USED-FOR', u'relational database systems'), (u'generated ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic conflicts'), (u'generated ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'relational database systems')]]
sentences: [u'This paper describes a framework that uses the Semantic Web infrastructure to address semantic interoperability between relational database systems in large-scale environments and at multiple levels of granularities .', u'Given a relational database system , we describe a formal algorithm to use the relational database Rs meta-data and structural constraints to construct its OWL ontology while preserving the structural constraints of the underlying relational database system .', u'The generated ontology is described using and conforming to a set of vocabularies defined in an ontology that describes relational database systems on the web .', u'Using this set of vocabularies guarantee that applications on the web can work with data instances that conformed to a set of known vocabularies and structures .', u'Finally , we describe our prototype and how semantic conflicts are resolved between multiple relational database systems using the generated ontologies .']

entities: [[(u'Knowledge representation formalisms', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'strict open world assumption', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'nonmonotonic reasoning techniques', u'Method')], [(u'closed world view', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rules extensions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'negation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'scoped negation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'formal semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'logic programs', u'Method'), (u'scoped negation', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'logic programs', u'Method'), (u'rule extension', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'Knowledge representation formalisms')], [], [], [(u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'rules extensions'), (u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'languages'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'rules extensions'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'languages')], [], [], [(u'rule extension', u'USED-FOR', u'logic programs')]]
sentences: [u'Knowledge representation formalisms used on the Semantic Web adhere to a strict open world assumption .', u'Therefore , nonmonotonic reasoning techniques are often viewed with scepticism .', u'Especially negation as failure , which intuitively adopts a closed world view , is often claimed to be unsuitable for the Web where knowledge is notoriously incomplete .', u'Nonetheless , it was suggested in the ongoing discussions around rules extensions for languages like RDF ( S ) or OWL to allow at least restricted forms of negation as failure , as long as negation has an explicitly defined , finite scope .', u'Yet clear definitions of such scoped negation as well as formal semantics thereof are missing .', u'We propose logic programs with contexts and scoped negation and discuss two possible semantics with desirable properties .', u'We also argue that this class of logic programs can be viewed as a rule extension to a subset of RDF ( S ) .']

entities: [[(u'data sources', u'Material'), (u'back-end data sources', u'Material'), (u'semantic level', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Grid', u'Method'), (u'semantic interconnection environment', u'Method'), (u'globally distributed versatile resources', u'Material')], [(u'SGII', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Grid vision', u'Method'), (u'adaptive and intelligence information sharing', u'Task')], [(u'existent solutions', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Grid', u'Material'), (u'enterprise information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SGII', u'Method'), (u'semantic information integration', u'Task'), (u'grid', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic level', u'FEATURE-OF', u'back-end data sources')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'To fully leverage the information from different data sources and applications , an enterprise needs a generic , interoperable and flexible infrastructure to integrate and coordinate information across back-end data sources on semantic level .', u'Through undertaking research at the intersection of the Semantic Web and Grid , the Semantic Grid expects to establish a semantic interconnection environment to effectively organize , share , cluster , fuse , and manage globally distributed versatile resources .', u'In this context , we introduce SGII , an EII ( Enterprise Information Integration ) infrastructure based on Semantic Grid vision to achieve adaptive and intelligence information sharing .', u'A survey of existent solutions is made to provide evidence of the benefits from Semantic Grid in the context of integration and interoperation of enterprise information .', u'A primary architecture for SGII is introduced based on the analysis of realizing the vision of an infrastructure for semantic information integration on grid .']

entities: [[(u'Time modeling', u'Method')], [(u'temporal information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'histori- cal information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'historical accounts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'uncertain temporal information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'temporal modeling', u'Task'), (u'crisp representation of time', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'modeling tasks', u'Task')], [(u'fuzzy interval-based temporal model', u'Method'), (u'imprecise temporal knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'crisp temporal models', u'Method')], [(u'crisp temporal relation- ships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'fuzzy temporal model', u'Method'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'ontology model', u'Method'), (u'annotating ontology definitions', u'Task'), (u'time specifications', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'temporal modeling'), (u'crisp representation of time', u'USED-FOR', u'approaches')], [(u'imprecise temporal knowledge', u'USED-FOR', u'fuzzy interval-based temporal model')], [], [], [(u'model', u'USED-FOR', u'annotating ontology definitions'), (u'ontology model', u'USED-FOR', u'annotating ontology definitions')]]
sentences: [u'Time modeling is a crucial feature in many application do- mains .', u'However , temporal information often is not crisp , but is uncertain , subjective and vague .', u'This is particularly true when representing histori- cal information , as historical accounts are inherently imprecise .', u'Similarly , we conjecture that in the Semantic Web representing uncertain temporal information will be a common requirement .', u'Hence , existing approaches for temporal modeling based on crisp representation of time can not be applied to these advanced modeling tasks .', u'To overcome these difficulties , in this paper we present fuzzy interval-based temporal model capable of representing imprecise temporal knowledge .', u'Our approach naturally subsumes existing crisp temporal models , i.e .', u'crisp temporal relation- ships are intuitively represented in our system .', u'Apart from presenting the fuzzy temporal model , we discuss how this model is integrated with the ontology model to allow annotating ontology definitions with time specifications .']

relations: [[(u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rules')], [(u'hyper-predicate hierarchies', u'FEATURE-OF', u'order-sorted logic programming')], [(u'predicates', u'CONJUNCTION', u'meta-predicates'), (u'hyper-predicate hierarchy', u'USED-FOR', u'meta-predicates'), (u'hyper-predicate hierarchy', u'USED-FOR', u'them')], [(u'query-answering system', u'USED-FOR', u'queries'), (u'atoms', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'queries'), (u'atoms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'hyper-atoms'), (u'hyper-atoms', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'queries')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In the Semantic Web context , the meta-modeling of concepts in ontologies and rules is required for defining the meanings of upper-level data and vocabularies .', u'For this purpose , we propose a decidable fragment of order-sorted logic programming with hyper-predicate hierarchies .', u'In the sorted language , we can employ simple- and hyper-predicates to express the concepts of sorts , predicates , and meta-predicates by unifying and enhancing them in a hyper-predicate hierarchy .', u'The sorted Horn-clause calculus is extended to develop a query-answering system that can answer queries such as atoms and hyper-atoms generalized to contain predicate variables .', u'We show that each query is computable in NEXPTIME if knowledge bases are function-free and safe .', u'Furthermore , the computation can be reduced to EXPTIME if additional arguments in super-predicates and multiple predicate declarations are restricted .']

sentences: [u'Regular Contributions.- Digitisation , Representation , and Formalisation Digital Libraries of Mathematics.- MKM from Book to Computer : A Case Study.- From Proof-Assistants to Distributed Libraries of Mathematics : Tips and Pitfalls.- Managing Digital Mathematical Discourse.- NAG Library Documentation.- On the Roles of LATEX and MathML in Encoding and Processing Mathematical Expressions.- Problems and Solutions for Markup for Mathematical Examples and Exercises.- An Annotated Corpus and a Grammar Model of Theorem Description.- A Query Language for a Metadata Framework about Mathematical Resources.- Information Retrieval in MML.- An Expert System for the Flexible Processing of XML -Based Mathematical Knowledge in a PROLOG-Environment.- Towards Collaborative Content Management and Version Control for Structured Mathematical Knowledge.- On the Integrity of a Repository of Formalized Mathematics.- A Theoretical Analysis of Hierarchical Proofs.- Comparing Mathematical Provers.- Translating Mizar for First Order Theorem Provers.- Invited Talk.- The Mathematical Semantic Web .']

entities: [[(u'formal representation', u'Method'), (u'BPMN', u'Method')], [(u'Cloud Computing solutions', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'mapping of Business requirements', u'Task'), (u'BPMN diagrams', u'Method'), (u'Cloud services', u'Task')], [(u'semantic-web technologiessuch', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'mapping process', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'BPMN', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'formal representation')], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'mapping of Business requirements'), (u'BPMN diagrams', u'USED-FOR', u'mapping of Business requirements'), (u'BPMN diagrams', u'USED-FOR', u'Cloud services')], [(u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic-web technologiessuch')]]
sentences: [u'In the recent years great interest has been shown by both private organizations and independent researchers on Business Processes definition and management , which resulted in the development of several tools for their design and execution , and in proposals of standards for their formal representation , such as BPMN .', u'At the same time , Cloud Computing solutions have reached a good level of maturity , with a high number of services and offers currently available to customers who , in turn , would benefit from a tool suggesting the most suitable Cloud services to leverage according to their specific requirements .', u'In this paper a tentative approach for the mapping of Business requirements ( expressed through BPMN diagrams ) to Cloud services is proposed .', u'In particular , semantic-web technologiessuch as OWL are proposed to ease the mapping process and to suggest users the best suitable Cloud services to leverage and compose .']

entities: [[(u'software systems', u'Method')], [(u'software development process', u'Method')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'reuse', u'Task')], [(u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'structures', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge management system', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge domain', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'Semantic Reuse System', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge representation languages', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'software development knowledge reuse', u'Task')], [(u'reasoning mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'reuse', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'knowledge representation languages', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], [(u'reasoning mechanisms', u'USED-FOR', u'reuse')]]
sentences: [u'As software systems become bigger and more complex , software developers need to cope with a growing amount of information and knowledge .', u'The knowledge generated during the software development process can be a valuable asset for a software company .', u'But in order to take advantage of this knowledge , the company must store and manage it for reuse .', u'Ontologies are a powerful mechanism for representing knowledge and encoding its meaning .', u'These structures can be used to model and represent the knowledge , stored in a knowledge management system , and classify it according to the knowledge domain that the system supports .', u'This paper describes the Semantic Reuse System ( SRS ) , which takes advantage of ontologies , represented using the knowledge representation languages of the Semantic Web , for software development knowledge reuse .', u'We describe how this knowledge is stored and the reasoning mechanisms that support the reuse .']

entities: [[(u'software agents', u'Method'), (u'search engines', u'Method'), (u'systems clustering processes', u'Method')], [], [(u'format obfuscation', u'Task'), (u'XML schemas', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'stylesheets', u'Material'), (u'unambiguous structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'presentation semantics interpretation', u'Task'), (u'PCDATA text', u'Material')], [(u'article citations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'proper nouns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'people organisations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'post-hoc extraction processes', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic Web environment', u'Task'), (u'knowledge services', u'Task')], [(u'document representation', u'Method'), (u'step', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'Web standards', u'USED-FOR', u'format obfuscation'), (u'XML schemas', u'USED-FOR', u'Web standards'), (u'XML schemas', u'USED-FOR', u'format obfuscation'), (u'XML schemas', u'CONJUNCTION', u'stylesheets'), (u'stylesheets', u'USED-FOR', u'format obfuscation'), (u'unambiguous structure', u'CONJUNCTION', u'presentation semantics interpretation')], [(u'article citations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'proper nouns')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The Web is full of documents which must be interpreted by human readers and by software agents ( search engines recommender systems clustering processes etc .', u') .', u'Although Web standards have addressed format obfuscation by using XML schemas and stylesheets to specify unambiguous structure and presentation semantics interpretation is still hampered by the fundamental ambiguity of information in PCDATA text .', u'Even the most easily distinguishable kinds of knowledge such as article citations and proper nouns ( referring to people organisations projects products technical concepts ) have to be identified by fallible post-hoc extraction processes .', u'The WiCK project has investigated the writing process in a Semantic Web environment where knowledge services exist and actively assist the author .', u'In this paper we discuss the need to make knowledge an explicit part of the document representation and the advantages and disadvantages of this step .']

entities: [[(u'Web intelligence generation', u'Task')], [(u'abstract resources', u'Material')], [(u'Grid services', u'Task'), (u'agents', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'databases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data-mining', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'distributed cooperative scenario', u'Method'), (u'Web information systems', u'Method')], [(u'grid components', u'Method'), (u'digital archive semantic integrated architecture', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'agents', u'CONJUNCTION', u'databases'), (u'databases', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data-mining'), (u'data-mining', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontologies')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic Web and grid computing are critical factors in the next Web intelligence generation .', u'A fundamental aspect inside this challenge is the provision of a wide disseminated platform of abstract resources that permit us to get the right information at the right time .', u'Grid services could be understood as proper requesting resources ( agents , databases , data-mining , ontologies , etc .', u') , but also as the kind of the organization that a concise domain needs in order to offer its capabilities to other specific domains .', u'In this sense , the goal of getting the best distributed cooperative scenario , starting from many pre-existing Web information systems , is a fundamental part of this important challenge .', u'This paper proposes how to achieve a flexible cooperative assembly of grid components and resources applied to a digital archive semantic integrated architecture , we are researching since 2002 .']

sentences: [u'Metadata serves several purposes .', u'It supports resource discovery , locates the actual digital resource by inclusion of a digital identifier , organizes electronic resources bringing similar resources together and distinguishing dissimilar resources , provides administrative information for controlling the digital library , and provides technical , preservation and rights management information needed to support immediate and long-term permanent access .', u'There are a variety of metadata schemes that serve different purposes for different object types , subjects and audiences .', u'With disparate metadata schemes , ensuring that information collected in a specific scheme by one organization for a particular purpose can be exchanged , transferred or used by another organization for a different purpose becomes an issue .', u'Metadata frameworks , crosswalks , and registries are ways to achieve interoperability .', u'Controlled terminologies add more precise meaning to metadata .', u'The integration of controlled terminologies and metadata schemes is key to the development of the Semantic Web .']

entities: [[(u'applications', u'Generic')], [(u'techniques', u'Generic'), (u'performance model', u'Generic'), (u'annotations of performance measurements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'software descriptive syntactical languages', u'Material')], [(u'inference rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'performance ontology', u'Method'), (u'system performance analysis technique', u'Method'), (u'intelligent applications', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Method')], [(u'performance rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'QoS knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'execution', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'applications', u'USED-FOR', u'decision taking process')], [(u'annotations of performance measurements', u'USED-FOR', u'systems')], [], [], [], [(u'system performance analysis technique', u'USED-FOR', u'intelligent applications'), (u'framework building', u'USED-FOR', u'intelligent applications')], []]
sentences: [u'Several techniques and applications have been proposed to aid the decision taking process in the system performance domain .', u'Most of these techniques have depicted the performance model of systems through annotations of performance measurements coming from specific software descriptive syntactical languages .', u'However , the semantic representation of performance information provides the possibility of its ulterior machine-processable logical interpretation and therefore the applicability of inference rules about a particular domain .', u'Moreover , ontologies ease the interchange and reuse of knowledge of particular domains , e.g .', u'system performance .', u'In this work , we propose a performance ontology together with the system performance analysis technique as an example of framework building for intelligent applications based on semantic web .', u'The paper also shows the construction of performance rules through OWL to automatically infer new performance constraints and QoS knowledge about the system on execution .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method')], [], [(u'query process', u'Method'), (u'Buchi automata', u'Method'), (u'computation model', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'infinite computation of SPARQL queries', u'Task'), (u'Web of Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Buchi automata', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'Buchi automata', u'USED-FOR', u'query process'), (u'Buchi automata', u'USED-FOR', u'computation model')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'infinite computation of SPARQL queries')]]
sentences: [u'Linked Data is a field with ongoing development showing not only practical applications but also elegant theoretical results .', u'Parts of these works concern the query process of Linked Data using SPARQL .', u'Our work examines the querying of such data sources which are characterized by eventual computability , rather than finite .', u'This infinite character of the data and the query process stimulated the use of Buchi automata in order to properly verify this computation model .', u'In brief , our work contributes by presenting a novel approach to describe the infinite computation of SPARQL queries on a Web of Linked Data using Buchi automata .']

entities: [[(u'library sphere', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'bibliographic data', u'Material')], [(u'hbz library network', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'The topic Linked Open Data is pushing more and more into the library sphere .', u'While Open Data is all about the legal status of any kind of data , Linked Data aims at augmenting the interoperability of data by consistently applying ( web- ) standards. # N # This article begins with an illustration of why Linked Data is relevant to the library world .', u'This is followed by a short introduction to the most important Linked Data standards and some thoughts on how to migrate bibliographic data to these standards .', u'Finally the current activities of the hbz library network concerning this matter are presented .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data Cloud', u'Method'), (u'exploration and visualization techniques', u'Method')], [(u'aggregation and abstraction techniques', u'Method'), (u'thematic clustering', u'Task')], [(u'techniques', u'Generic'), (u'messy linked data', u'Material'), (u'search target', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'high-level , thematic view', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'inCloud', u'Material')], [(u'thematic exploration', u'Task'), (u'search target', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reciprocal proximity relations', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Now that a huge amount of data is available in the Linked Data Cloud , the need of effective exploration and visualization techniques is becoming more and more important .', u'In this paper , we propose aggregation and abstraction techniques for thematic clustering and exploration of linked data .', u'These techniques transform a basic , flat view of a potentially large set of messy linked data for a given search target , into a high-level , thematic view called inCloud .', u'In an inCloud , thematic exploration is guided by few essentials auto-describing their prominence for the search target and by their reciprocal proximity relations .']

sentences: [u'The amount of sensors publishing data on the Web is increasing as a result of the online availability of Sensor Web platforms that provide support for this task .', u'With such increase in sensor data publication , new challenges arise for the identification , discovery and access to this data .', u'Following the set of best practices to publish and link structured data on the web proposed by the Linked Data community , in this paper we introduce the concept of Linked Stream Data , a way in which the Linked Data principles can be applied to stream data and be part of the Web of Linked Data .']

entities: [[(u'linked data', u'Material'), (u'rail domain', u'Material')], [(u'linked data', u'Material'), (u'ontology', u'Material')], [(u'data integration', u'Task'), (u'British rail domain', u'Material')], [(u'broader transport domain', u'Material'), (u'rail domain', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'rail domain', u'FEATURE-OF', u'linked data')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'This paper presents early findings from a larger study , into the use of linked data in the rail domain .', u'The study and other literature has shown there to be benefits from improved integration of data in this domain and proposes that linked data in general and ontology in particular will address this .', u'The paper will set out the current state of data integration in the British rail domain , highlighting issues found there .', u'The manner in which linked data is employed in the broader transport domain will then be examined along with previous work pertaining to the rail domain .']
