sentences: [u'Service oriented access in a multi-application , multi-access network environment poses interesting research challenges .', u'One of these challenges refers to cross-layer interoperability among technologies .', u'In this paper we introduce a knowledge base ( KB ) which contains local ( user terminal specific ) knowledge that enables pro-active network selection .', u'We implemented a prototype which makes use of semantic technology ( namely ResearchCyc ) for creating the elements of the KB : the ontology , the concepts , facts and rules .', u'We show on a case study how this system can be exploited by the Media Independent Information System ( MIIS ) of the IEEE 802.21 protocol .']

entities: [[(u'web service discovery framework', u'Method'), (u'Petri net', u'Method'), (u'semantic technology', u'Method'), (u'web services discovery', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dynamic behavior of service system', u'Task')], [(u'client query', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'accuracy', u'Metric'), (u'service discovery', u'Task')], [(u'web service discovery framework', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Petri net', u'USED-FOR', u'web service discovery framework'), (u'Petri net', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic technology'), (u'semantic technology', u'USED-FOR', u'web service discovery framework')], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'service compositions')], [], []]
sentences: [u'A new web service discovery framework based on Petri net and semantic technology is proposed , according to the shortcomings of current research on web services discovery .', u'This framework can discover service compositions capable of satisfying a client request by making use of semantic information provided by OWL-S ontology and vertification ability of Petri net in dynamic behavior of service system .', u'The discovered service compositions not only satisfy a client query functionally , but also execute correctly without deadlock , which improves the accuracy of service discovery .', u'Finally , an example is given to illustrate the effectiveness of the web service discovery framework .']

entities: [[(u'P2P system', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'keyword search', u'Method'), (u'semantics.With Vector Space Model', u'Method'), (u'multi-keywords search', u'Task'), (u'segmentation of identifier space', u'Method'), (u'semantic idea', u'Method'), (u'P2P system', u'Method'), (u'multi-keywords query', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query process', u'Method'), (u'semantic technology', u'Method'), (u'load balance', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'segmentation of identifier space', u'USED-FOR', u'P2P system'), (u'semantic technology', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic idea'), (u'semantic technology', u'USED-FOR', u'P2P system'), (u'semantic technology', u'USED-FOR', u'query process'), (u'semantic technology', u'USED-FOR', u'load balance')]]
sentences: [u'The conventional P2P system has its limitations in that it is based on single keyword search and does not support semantics.With Vector Space Model , this paper attempts to realize the multi-keywords search ; the segmentation of identifier space helps to gather the similar files at adjacent nodes , thus can speed up search process.In addition , semantic idea assists P2P system better understanding the search and improving its performance , especially recall rate.The simulation experiments have indicated : multi-keywords query is realized ; query process is accelerated ; search performance is improved by using semantic technology ; a better load balance is achieved .']

entities: [[(u'Photo collections', u'Material')], [(u'semantic annotations', u'Method')], [(u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'semantic technology', u'Method'), (u'annotation template', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'personal information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'notion of landmarks', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'navigation', u'Task'), (u'lifetime photo-space', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'semantic technology', u'USED-FOR', u'complexity'), (u'annotation template', u'USED-FOR', u'complexity'), (u'annotation template', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic technology')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Photo collections are one of the promising sources to tell story of life in this digital era .', u'In this paper we present our work on organizing photos of a lifetime by exploiting semantic annotations .', u'The complexity in using semantic technology is managed by introducing an annotation template corresponding to who , when , where , and what .', u'Semantics of each dimension are semi-automatically annotated following the ontology for personal information .', u'The story telling is done by exploiting these semantics to form trails of the photos .', u'The notion of landmarks is used for this purpose which also ensures effective navigation in the lifetime photo-space .']

entities: [[(u'knowledge-acquisition research', u'Task'), (u'knowledge-based systems', u'Method'), (u'AI Winter', u'Task')], [], [(u'viewpoints', u'Generic'), (u'situated nature of human expertise', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge acquisition', u'Task'), (u'problem solving', u'Method'), (u'problem solving', u'Task'), (u'domain descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'modeling', u'Task')], []]
relations: [[], [], [(u'knowledge acquisition', u'USED-FOR', u'modeling of problem solving'), (u'reusable patterns', u'USED-FOR', u'problem solving'), (u'modeling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'system implementation')], []]
sentences: [u'Intense interest in knowledge-acquisition research began 25 years ago , stimulated by the excitement about knowledge-based systems that emerged in the 1970s followed by the realities of the AI Winter that arrived in the 1980s .', u'The knowledge-acquisition workshops that responded to this interest led to the formation of a vibrant research community that has achieved remarkable consensus on a number of issues .', u'These viewpoints include ( 1 ) the rejection of the notion of knowledge as a commodity to be transferred from one locus to another , ( 2 ) an acceptance of the situated nature of human expertise , ( 3 ) emphasis on knowledge acquisition as the modeling of problem solving , and ( 4 ) the pursuit of reusable patterns in problem solving and in domain descriptions that can facilitate both modeling and system implementation .', u'The Semantic Web community will benefit greatly by incorporating these perspectives in its work .']

sentences: [u'For the purpose of extending the Web that is able to understand and process information by machine , Semantic Web shared knowledge in the ontology form .', u'For exquisite query processing , this paper proposes a method to use semantic relations in the ontology as relevance feedback information to query expansion .', u'We made experiment on pharmacy domain .', u'And in order to verify the effectiveness of the semantic relation in the ontology , we compared a keyword based document retrieval system that gives weights by using the frequency information compared with an ontology based document retrieval system that uses relevant information existed in the ontology to a relevant feedback .', u'From the evaluation of the retrieval performance .', u'we knew that search engine used the concepts and relations in ontology for improving precision effectively .', u'Also it used them for the basis of the inference for improvement the retrieval performance .']

sentences: [u'Robots interacting with other agents in rich information landscapes and complex dynamic physical environments require sophisticated and robust concept and knowledge management capabilities if they are to solve problems , communicate , learn and exhibit intelligent behaviours .', u'In this paper we describe how conceptual spaces provide a powerful substrate upon which to build effective concept and knowledge management capabilities that integrate information from multiple sensory and symbolic sources .', u'We use SONY AIBO robots and the robot soccer domain to illustrate our framework and approach .', u'The conceptual spaces framework allows robots to build rich and grounded world models from a wide variety of internal and external knowledge resources , e.g .', u'sensors , ontologies , databases , knowledge bases , the semantic Web , Web services , and other agents .', u'Conceptual spaces provide an important and effective bridge between the perceptual level and the symbolic level by grounding sensory information to objects']

entities: [[(u'machine-understandable data', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'CREAM', u'Method'), (u'creation of metadata', u'Task')], [(u'CREAM', u'Method'), (u'Web pages', u'Material'), (u'authoring mode', u'Method'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'CREAM', u'Method'), (u'relational metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rigid template-like schema', u'Method'), (u'Dublin Core', u'Material')], [(u'ontology-based framework', u'Method'), (u'metadata crawler', u'Method'), (u'inference services', u'Method'), (u'document management', u'Task'), (u'meta-ontology', u'Method')], [(u'OntoMat', u'Method'), (u'annotation tool', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Richly interlinked , machine-understandable data constitute the basis for the Semantic Web .', u'We provide a framework , CREAM , that allows for creation of metadata .', u'While the annotation mode of CREAM allows creation of metadata for existing Web pages , the authoring mode lets authors create metadata -- almost for free -- while putting together the content of a page.As a feature of our framework , CREAM allows creating relational metadata , i.e. , metadata that instantiate interrelated definitions of classes in a domain ontology rather than a comparatively rigid template-like schema such as Dublin Core .', u'We discuss some of the requirements one has to meet when developing such an ontology-based framework , e.g. , the integration of a metadata crawler , inference services , document management and a meta-ontology , and describe its implementation , viz .', u'OntoMat , a component-based , ontology-driven Web-page authoring and annotation tool .']

entities: [[(u'Tourism', u'Material'), (u'leisure and recreational purposes', u'Task')], [], [], [(u'software', u'Generic')], [(u'Smart Travel Service Advisor ( STSA )', u'Method'), (u'Agent technology', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web environment', u'Method')], []]
relations: [[(u'Tourism', u'USED-FOR', u'leisure and recreational purposes')], [], [], [], [(u'Agent technology', u'USED-FOR', u'Smart Travel Service Advisor ( STSA )')], []]
sentences: [u'Tourism is travel for leisure and recreational purposes ; however , it becomes difficult for tourists to pick the right destination and the right tour company from the wide variety on offer .', u'Tour companies promise to provide better services than their competitors and show that their clients are fully content with their services .', u'It is also difficult for the new user to inquire on and validate a companys reputation and past experience with that company .', u'This paper discusses software that has been developed to tackle this problem .', u'The Smart Travel Service Advisor ( STSA ) uses Agent technology with the Semantic Web environment , and provides results with which to scrutinize the travel companies reputations .', u'STSAs main purpose is to help clients by providing them with up-to-date information about travel companies performance and help them choose the right company according to their requirements and preferences .']

sentences: [u'ABSTRACT Ontologies are presently considered one of the semantic web columns due to the benefits they provide in representing formal knowledge .', u'At the same time , while the ontologies field develops so does the amount of non-experts users in tag languages .', u'Thus , emerges the need of tools to allow simple interaction with the user , in order to facilitate the creation and design of specified domain ontologies .', u'OntoACTION is presenting in this work which is a software that allows the users to define active ontologies by means of graph and tag languages , translating them into axioms that a reazoner engine of ACTION ontologies can process .', u'To test OntoACTION the climate phenomenal ontologies of the Servicio de Meteorologia de la Aviacion Militar Bolivariana de Venezuela was specify .', u'Keywords : ontologies translator , ontologies editor , RDF/RDFS ontologies , active ontologies , ACTION ontologies .']

entities: [[(u'View maintenance of RDF structures', u'Task'), (u'data sizes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Jena', u'Material')], [(u'Methods/Statistical Analysis', u'Method'), (u'insert and deletion operations', u'Task'), (u'operations', u'Generic')], [], [(u'Insert operation', u'Method'), (u'delete operations', u'Task'), (u'RDF data', u'Material')], [], [(u'Semantic Web Content', u'Method'), (u'web', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Jena', u'USED-FOR', u'View maintenance of RDF structures')], [], [], [], [], [(u'web', u'FEATURE-OF', u'Semantic Web Content')]]
sentences: [u'Objectives : This work provides an analysis of View maintenance of RDF structures for various data sizes using Jena .', u'Methods/Statistical Analysis : We perform insert and deletion operations in files of three sizes and investigate how these operations are effected by the size of the file which is being worked upon .', u'Five different experiments were conducted on the data files to provide a thorough analysis .', u'Findings : The results from the experiments indicate that time taken for Insert operation increased proportionally however time remained the same for delete operations performed on the RDF data .', u'It was also determined that first runs of any code in Jena took the longest time while time for operations reduced as more runs of the operations were made .', u'Application/Improvements : The work provides a qualitative analysis of the updating of Semantic Web Content on the web .']

entities: [[(u'migration of agents research', u'Task'), (u'Internet technologies', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'Material'), (u'web services', u'Task')], [(u'service oriented Grid architectures', u'Method'), (u'dynamic cooperation', u'Task'), (u'web services', u'Method'), (u'Grid resources', u'Material'), (u'task allocation', u'Task')], [(u'Grid', u'Material'), (u'agent communication', u'Task'), (u'life-cycle management', u'Task')], [(u'insurance sector', u'Task'), (u'multi-agent systems techniques', u'Method'), (u'detecting fraudulent cases', u'Task')], [(u'dynamic and adaptive negotiation', u'Task'), (u'web and grid services', u'Task')], [(u'deployed approach', u'Method'), (u'InsuranceGrid', u'Method'), (u'car damage claims', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Internet technologies'), (u'semantic web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Grid'), (u'Grid', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Internet technologies'), (u'Grid', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web services'), (u'web services', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Internet technologies')], [(u'service oriented Grid architectures', u'USED-FOR', u'dynamic cooperation'), (u'task allocation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'execution')], [(u'agent communication', u'CONJUNCTION', u'life-cycle management')], [(u'multi-agent systems techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'detecting fraudulent cases')], [], [(u'deployed approach', u'USED-FOR', u'InsuranceGrid')]]
sentences: [u'There are an increasing number of initiatives for the migration of agents research towards new Internet technologies such as the semantic web , Grid , and web services .', u'On the one hand , service oriented Grid architectures need to support dynamic cooperation , negotiation and coordination between web services controlling Grid resources , for efficient resource and task allocation and execution .', u'On the other hand , the Grid can facilitate agent communication , life-cycle management , and access to resources for agents .', u'The insurance sector is one such area that would benefit from the automation brought by multi-agent systems techniques in handling claims and detecting fraudulent cases .', u'In this paper , we discuss our work on facilitating dynamic and adaptive negotiation between web and grid services .', u'We describe our deployed approach in an InsuranceGrid , which manages businesses involved in dealing with car damage claims for a number of insurance companies .']

entities: [[(u'Self-governing systems', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'formal theoretic model', u'Method'), (u'automated reasoning', u'Task')], [(u'ontology-based knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'information models', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'autonomous , self-governing components', u'Method')], [(u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'OMG', u'Method'), (u'managed entities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'entities', u'Generic')], [(u'UML2', u'Method'), (u'MOF', u'Method'), (u'NGOSS Shared Information and Data model', u'Method')], [(u'information models', u'Method'), (u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'Self-governing systems'), (u'semantics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'formal theoretic model'), (u'formal theoretic model', u'USED-FOR', u'Self-governing systems'), (u'formal theoretic model', u'USED-FOR', u'automated reasoning')], [(u'data', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology-based knowledge representation'), (u'information models', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology-based knowledge representation')], [], [], [], [(u'information models', u'CONJUNCTION', u'domain ontologies')]]
sentences: [u'Self-governing systems need a reliable set of semantics and a formal theoretic model in order to facilitate automated reasoning .', u'We present an ontology-based knowledge representation that will use data from information models while preserving the semantics and the taxonomy of existing systems .', u'This will facilitate the decomposition and validation of high level goals by autonomous , self-governing components .', u'Our solution reuses principles and standards from the Semantic Web and the OMG to precisely describe the managed entities and the shared objectives that these entities are trying to achieve by autonomously correlating their behavior .', u'We describe how we created UML2 , MOF , OCL and QVT ontologies , and we give a case study using the NGOSS Shared Information and Data model .', u'We also set the requirements for integrating existing information models and domain ontologies into a unique knowledge base .']

entities: [[(u'semantic Web and description logics', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'fuzzy information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'axiom system', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'theorems', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'fuzzy information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'F-SHIQ.Finally', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'definitions', u'CONJUNCTION', u'axioms'), (u'axioms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'theorems')]]
sentences: [u'With the swift development of computer and Internet , semantic Web and description logics play more and more important roles in intelligent technologies.But in our lives , more and more uncertain and incomplete knowledge needs to be resolved , and the vocabularies supplied by OWL only represent certain and complete concepts and roles.In order to be able to represent and reason with fuzzy information , this paper presents a new fuzzy description logic axiom systemF-SHIQ axiom system based on the description logic.And based on this axiom system , the authors extend OWL by combining new style of F-SHIQ axiom system.This paper first presents the definitions , axioms , theorems and proofs in the system , and then details the ways to represent and reason fuzzy information by FSRLthe extension of OWL by F-SHIQ.Finally , illustrate a fuzzy inference question in extended language and obtain a satisfactory result .']

sentences: [u'The emergence of Semantic Web and LOD - Linked Open Data - technologies enable that digital objects representing the holdings of archives , libraries and museums collections be semantically interlinked throughout the Web .', u'What are the different types of cultural relevant relationships that may exists between digital objects of collections in archives , libraries and museums throughout the Web ?', u'How discover , organize and formalize these relationships to be used by curators in LOD applications ?', u'A methodology to analyze the holdings of archives , libraries and museums is proposed based on onomasiologic perspective .', u'Such methodology is applied to a hypothetical competency question that might be proposed by a digital curator. # R # # N # Results indicated that conceptual models such as FRBR , CIDOC CRM and EDM may provide a rich repertoire of semantic relationships that may be used in LOD applications to interlink collections in heritage institutions .']

sentences: [u'The evolution of the Semantic Web promises infrastructures for the semantic interoperability of Web Services .', u"Hindrances in the service discovery , composition and execution are often of syntactic nature : the difficulty in the interpretation of inputs , outputs or other nontrivial statements does not favor to find eligible advertised services which appropriately meet the consumer 's demand .", u'This paper deals with the semantic matchmaking focusing on the ontology mismatch problem : concepts appearing in the services description are compared at semantic level in order to profit by the semantic similarity existing among entity classes ( i.e .', u'concepts ) .', u'The approach is based on a multi-agent architecture and exploits fuzzy techniques to represent the multi-granular capabilities of a web service .', u'The semantic similarity among concepts supports the clustering of the advertised services and improves the quality of the retrieved results , given a request .']

sentences: [u'In this article we introduce HyCo ( Hypertext Composer ) , an authoring tool devoted to create semantic learning objects .', u'This authoring tool uses learning technology standards or specifications to save these semantic objects , which will be delivered in Web e-learning environments as encapsulated packages in order to ensure their reusability , interoperability , durability and accessibility .', u'These learning objects are closed to the Semantic Web field because they combine hypermedia and semantic capabilities .', u'Our research work is directed to use these semantic learning objects in order to define learning domains for an Adaptive Learning Environment .', u"The aim of this system is to provide an e-learning environment where teachers have tools to create didactic materials and students carry out their knowledge acquisition through the most suitable adaptive learning technique giving the student 's characteristics , the learning activities provided , and the learning objects ' features ."]

sentences: [u'To meet the end-users dynamically changed requirements for software and achieve the on-demand changes of operational process in time , based on the Goal model and the Process model , the users personalized operations of the related work were simplified and integrated , and rules for the cooperation between Goal and Process which fit for software engineers were proposed and formalized .', u'The users personalized operations of the related work were analyzed to conclude the pattern of Goal modification .', u'By the direct drive of Goal modification , the corresponding changes of Process were induced and specified .', u'Then rules for the cooperation between Goal and Process were concluded and the formalization was achieved in Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) .', u'In this paper , reasoning support was provided for the model modification based on ontology and the dynamic evolution of Process model .']

sentences: [u'With the development of Web service and cloud computing , it needs for even closer coordination and interaction among various separate security domains to complete the complex tasks that can not be performed in a single security domain environment.The traditional access control approaches is difficult to meet the needs of these complex open environment.This paper leverages Semantic Web concepts and technology into existing policy-based and attribute-based access control method , for the need to participate in cross-domain access to all security domains security domain set up between the cross-domain ontology and ontology , constitutes cross-domain access control , distributed ontology system , and then to the body system as the knowledge base of knowledge when the cross-domain access reasoning to solve cross-domain access control problems encountered in heterogeneous syntax for access to heterogeneous environments control provides a new way of thinking .']

entities: [[(u'Seeker', u'Method'), (u'large-scale text analytics', u'Task'), (u'SemTag', u'Method'), (u'automated semantic tagging of large corpora', u'Task')], [(u'SemTag', u'Method'), (u'web pages', u'Material')], [], [(u'Seeker platform', u'Method'), (u'SemTag application', u'Task'), (u'disambiguation algorithm', u'Method'), (u'ontological disambiguation of large-scale data', u'Task'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'semantic tags', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ambiguous content', u'Material'), (u'semantic web', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Seeker', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'large-scale text analytics')], [(u'SemTag', u'USED-FOR', u'web pages')], [], [(u'disambiguation algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'ontological disambiguation of large-scale data')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper describes Seeker , a platform for large-scale text analytics , and SemTag , an application written on the platform to perform automated semantic tagging of large corpora .', u'We apply SemTag to a collection of approximately 264 million web pages , and generate approximately 434 million automatically disambiguated semantic tags , published to the web as a label bureau providing metadata regarding the 434 million annotations .', u'To our knowledge , this is the largest scale semantic tagging effort to date .', u'We describe the Seeker platform , discuss the architecture of the SemTag application , describe a new disambiguation algorithm specialized to support ontological disambiguation of large-scale data , evaluate the algorithm , and present our final results with information about acquiring and making use of the semantic tags .', u'We argue that automated large scale semantic tagging of ambiguous content can bootstrap and accelerate the creation of the semantic web .']

entities: [[(u'pervasive devices', u'Method')], [(u'rich multimedia content', u'Material'), (u'mobile client devices', u'Method'), (u'limited communication', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'processing', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'multimedia content', u'Material'), (u'Web Services', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web concepts', u'Method')], [(u'semantic-based personalized delivery concept', u'Method'), (u'classical multimedia transcoding ideas', u'Method')], [(u'monolithic portal applications', u'Task'), (u'multi-purpose adaptation', u'Task'), (u'single-source delivery', u'Task'), (u'multimedia adaptation functionality', u'Task')], [(u'Web Services', u'Method'), (u'application-independent adaptation', u'Task'), (u'multimedia service provisioning', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Growing numbers of pervasive devices are gaining access to the Internet .', u'However , much of the existing rich multimedia content can not be handled by mobile client devices with limited communication , processing , storage and display capabilities .', u'In this paper , we propose new ways to enhance the universal access to multimedia content through Web Services and Semantic Web concepts .', u'A semantic-based personalized delivery concept is drafted that makes use of these emerging technologies together with rather classical multimedia transcoding ideas .', u'Instead of large , monolithic portal applications designed for multi-purpose adaptation and a single-source delivery , we propose to shift multimedia adaptation functionality to a portfolio of adequately selected Web Services .', u'Web Services accessible through standard interfaces that allow for multimedia format conversion and composition can allow for a more flexible , application-independent adaptation and thus ease multimedia service provisioning essentially .']

sentences: [u'The Semantic Web would enable new ways of doing business on the Web that require development of advanced business document integration technologies performing intelligent document transformation .', u'The documents use different vocabularies that consist of large hierarchies of terms .', u'Accordingly , vocabulary mapping and transformation becomes an important task in the whole business document transformation process .', u'It includes several subtasks : map discovery , map representation , and map execution that must be seamlessly integrated into the document integration process .', u'In this paper we discuss the process of discovering the maps between two vocabularies assuming availability of two sets of documents , each using one of the vocabularies .', u'We take the vocabularies of product classification codes as a playground and propose a reusable map discovery technique based on Bayesian text classification approach .', u'We show how the discovered maps can be integrated into the document transformation process .']

entities: [[(u'structured data sources', u'Material'), (u'Linked Open Data initiative', u'Material'), (u'unstructured form', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'structured and unstructured contents', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'seamless integration', u'Task')], [(u'Knowledge Store', u'Method'), (u'interlinking structured and unstructured data', u'Material')], [(u'content and application scenarios', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'economical-financial data', u'Material')]]
sentences: [u'Despite the widespread diffusion of structured data sources and the public acclaim of the Linked Open Data initiative , a preponderant amount of information remains nowadays available only in unstructured form , both on the Web and within organizations .', u'While different in form , structured and unstructured contents speak about the very same entities of the world , their properties and relations , still , frameworks for their seamless integration are lacking .', u'In this paper we describe the design of the Knowledge Store , a scalable , fault-tolerant , and Semantic Web grounded storage system for interlinking structured and unstructured data .', u'We discuss its capability to adapt to new types of content and application scenarios , and to provide reasoning and semantic queries services on top of stored contents .', u'We also comment on its envisaged use in the News Reader EU project to manage large amounts of economical-financial data .']

entities: [[(u'semantic Web environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'conceptual backbone', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Web information integration', u'Task'), (u'semantic conflicts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic heterogeneity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information incompleteness', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology engineers', u'Method'), (u'Web information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic heterogeneity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'conflicts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic conflicts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rule reasoning', u'Method'), (u'RDF model theory', u'Method'), (u'semantic conflicts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'conflict points of ontology information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Bayesian network method', u'Method'), (u'semantic conflicts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'computing semantic overlap', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'posterior probabilities of concept nodes', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic based query', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'interaction interface', u'Method'), (u'information sharing', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'semantic heterogeneity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'information incompleteness')], [(u'ontology engineers', u'USED-FOR', u'Web information'), (u'semantic heterogeneity', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Web information'), (u'semantic heterogeneity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'conflicts')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic conflicts'), (u'ontology information', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], [(u'RDF model theory', u'USED-FOR', u'rule reasoning')], [(u'computing semantic overlap', u'CONJUNCTION', u'posterior probabilities of concept nodes')], [(u'interaction interface', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic based query')]]
sentences: [u'Within semantic Web environments , ontologies have been adopted as their conceptual backbone .', u'An important task for Web information integration and sharing is to resolve semantic conflicts because of semantic heterogeneity and information incompleteness .', u'But it is rather difficult for ontology engineers to integrate Web information including semantic heterogeneity and conflicts .', u'In this paper , a combined approach is proposed for detecting and handling semantic conflicts from ontology information .', u'Using rule reasoning based on RDF model theory , we can automatically check where semantic conflicts probably exist , and further locate so called conflict points of ontology information .', u'Then based on Bayesian network method , semantic conflicts can be controlled and avoided by computing semantic overlap and its posterior probabilities of concept nodes from conflict points .', u'Users can issue semantic based query by interaction interface and achieve information sharing with conflicts and uncertainty .']

entities: [[(u'discipline knowledge modeling', u'Method'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'retrieval', u'Task'), (u'conceptual models', u'Method'), (u'semantic and knowledge levels', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'Natural Language Processing', u'Task'), (u'Resource Sharing', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'OWL DL-based ontology modeling method', u'Method'), (u'OWL DLbased knowledge ontology', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Natural Language Processing'), (u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Resource Sharing'), (u'Natural Language Processing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Resource Sharing')]]
sentences: [u"The discipline knowledge modeling is a complicated engineering.The major problems at present are that the knowledge base does not be shared and reused and hardly fulfilling inference and retrieval at the semantic level.As a description tool of conceptual models on describing concepts and relations among concepts on the semantic and knowledge levels , ontology has been applied to the areas such as the Semantic Web , Natural Language Processing , Resource Sharing and Reuse.At same time , it is also popular by model makers of the discipline knowledge.This paper takes the course '' Principles of Database Systems '' as an example to introduce in detail a meta-model of the course knowledge and an OWL DL-based ontology modeling method for the course knowledge.Finally , a part of the OWL DLbased knowledge ontology is given as a reference for other researchers in this area ."]

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'insufficient vocabulary selection rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'folksonomy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'open services', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'location information tags', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'folksonomy-based metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'location information analyses', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'spatial relationships among tags', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'self-correcting location information domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'folksonomy', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'folksonomy', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'disciplines'), (u'folksonomy', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology'), (u'ontology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'disciplines')], [(u'open services', u'USED-FOR', u'system')], []]
sentences: [u'As the semantic web receives higher concern with an intensified necessity in these days , the research on the ontology as its core technology has been carried out in various fields .', u'The ontology has been adopted as an alternative to work out lots of problematic issues resulted from the insufficient vocabulary selection rules in folksonomy , widely accepted under Web 2.0 .', u'Therefore the importance of research to complementarily consolidate the two disciplines , the folksonomy and the ontology , has been increased .', u'Based on this idea this research proposes a system , which pulls out , using open services , the location information tags from folksonomy-based metadata , ultimately extracts , following location information analyses , spatial relationships among tags , and in turn automatically constructs self-correcting location information domain ontology .', u'The system devised in this study will associate data derived from easily accessible folksonomy with meaningful and technological information from ontology .']

entities: [[(u'text retrieval', u'Task'), (u'text processing', u'Task'), (u'information chain', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'retrieval techniques', u'Method'), (u'information overload', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'interdepartmental search', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'text retrieval', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'interdepartmental search')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The current state of the art of text retrieval , and indications of radical developments to come , should be of concern to all involved in text processing in the information chain from author to end-user .', u'This brief overview , slanted towards the interests of publishers , looks at the recent history of retrieval techniques , and present attempts to deal with information overload and the relative inability of many to conduct effective searches .', u"As networks proliferate , the problem of 'mapping ' between databases increases in complexity , and mention is made of attempts by the UK government to establish a system to support interdepartmental search and 'open government ' .", u'The Semantic Web is seen as the next big development , but will require enormous effort .', u'It is concluded that text retrieval is less often a separate facility as it is increasingly embedded , as a required tool , in larger systems .']

entities: [[(u'coreferences', u'Task'), (u'textual content', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web techniques', u'Method')], [(u'noun phrases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'coreference resolution', u'Task'), (u'semantic annotations', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'SANAPHOR', u'Method'), (u'techniques', u'Generic'), (u'entities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'noun phrases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'candidate coreferences', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'noun phrases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'inverted index', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Knowledge Graph', u'Method'), (u'DBpedia', u'Material')], [(u'state-of-the-art techniques', u'Generic'), (u'coreference clusters', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SANAPHOR', u'Method'), (u'CoNLL datasets', u'Material'), (u'techniques', u'Generic'), (u'coreference resolution', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'coreferences', u'FEATURE-OF', u'textual content'), (u'Semantic Web techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'coreferences'), (u'Semantic Web techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'textual content')], [], [(u'techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'entities'), (u'techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'noun phrases'), (u'entities', u'CONJUNCTION', u'noun phrases'), (u'noun phrases', u'CONJUNCTION', u'candidate coreferences')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'noun phrases'), (u'inverted index', u'USED-FOR', u'approach'), (u'DBpedia', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Knowledge Graph')], [], [(u'CoNLL datasets', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'SANAPHOR'), (u'CoNLL datasets', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'techniques')]]
sentences: [u'We tackle the problem of resolving coreferences in textual content by leveraging Semantic Web techniques .', u'Specifically , we focus on noun phrases that coreference identifiable entities that appear in the text ; the challenge in this context is to improve the coreference resolution by leveraging potential semantic annotations that can be added to the identified mentions .', u'Our system , SANAPHOR , first applies state-of-the-art techniques to extract entities , noun phrases , and candidate coreferences .', u'Then , we propose an approach to type noun phrases using an inverted index built on top of a Knowledge Graph e.g. , DBpedia .', u'Finally , we use the semantic relatedness of the introduced types to improve the state-of-the-art techniques by splitting and merging coreference clusters .', u'We evaluate SANAPHOR on CoNLL datasets , and show how our techniques consistently improve the state of the art in coreference resolution .']

sentences: [u'As Web Services and the Semantic Web become more important , enabling technologies such as web service ontologies will grow larger .', u'At the same time , use of mobile devices to access web services has doubled in the last year .', u'The ability of these resource constrained devices to download and reason across these ontologies to support service discovery will be severely limited .', u'Since concrete agents typically only needs a subset of what is described in a web service ontology to complete their task , a reduced ontology can be created .', u'# R # # N # In this research , we define computable measures of quality and performance with respect to reduced ontologies .', u'Using these measures , we developed a dynamic algorithm to generate a reduced ontology that contains the necessary knowledge content and performance speedup to be used by a mobile device for service discovery .']

relations: [[], [(u'usability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'scalability'), (u'scalability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'imprecise information needs'), (u'imprecise information needs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data change')], [(u'Semplore', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'IR-based system')], [(u'Semplore', u'USED-FOR', u'faceted search')], [(u'keyword search', u'PART-OF', u'It'), (u'keyword search', u'CONJUNCTION', u'precise structured query'), (u'precise structured query', u'USED-FOR', u'It'), (u'unified ranking scheme', u'USED-FOR', u'It')], [(u'inverted indexes', u'USED-FOR', u'Scalable query processing'), (u'inverted indexes', u'USED-FOR', u'IR systems')], [(u'block-based index structure', u'USED-FOR', u'index update')], [(u'Semplore', u'USED-FOR', u'Web of Data'), (u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'Web of Data')]]
sentences: [u'The Web of Data keeps growing rapidly .', u'However , the full exploitation of this large amount of structured data faces numerous challenges like usability , scalability , imprecise information needs and data change .', u'We present Semplore , an IR-based system that aims at addressing these issues .', u'Semplore supports intuitive faceted search and complex queries both on text and structured data .', u'It combines imprecise keyword search and precise structured query in a unified ranking scheme .', u'Scalable query processing is supported by leveraging inverted indexes traditionally used in IR systems .', u'This is combined with a novel block-based index structure to support efficient index update when data changes .', u'The experimental results show that Semplore is an efficient and effective system for searching the Web of Data and can be used as a basic infrastructure for Web-scale Semantic Web search engines .']

relations: [[], [(u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'SW languages'), (u'relational databases', u'USED-FOR', u'legacy sources'), (u'relational databases RDB', u'USED-FOR', u'legacy sources')], [(u'Datalog framework', u'USED-FOR', u'high level queries'), (u'community ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'Datalog framework'), (u'community ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'community ontologies'), (u'RDF/S', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'SW language')], [(u'SWIM', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'SW integration middleware')]]
sentences: [u'Semantic Web ( SW ) technology aims to facilitate the integration of legacy data sources spread worldwide .', u'Despite the plethora of SW languages e.g. , RDF/S , OWL recently proposed for # R # # N # supporting large scale information interoperation , the vast majority of legacy sources still rely on relational databases RDB published on the # R # # N # Web or corporate intranets as virtual XML .', u'In this paper , we advocate a Datalog framework for mediating high level queries to relational and or # R # # N # XML sources using community ontologies expressed in a SW language such as RDF/S .', u'We describe the architecture and the reasoning services # R # # N # of our SW integration middleware , called SWIM , and we present the main design choices and techniques for supporting powerful mappings between different data models , as well as reformulation and optimization of queries expressed against mediation schemas and views .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'web service selection', u'Task'), (u'discovery', u'Task'), (u'composition', u'Task'), (u'invocation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'facilitating automation of web service composition', u'Task'), (u'semantic matchmaking', u'Method'), (u'web service parameters', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'matchmaking functions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic compatibilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web service descriptions', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'intersection', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concept abduction', u'Task')], [(u'web service compositions', u'Method')], [(u'hard constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'composition process', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'web services', u'Method'), (u'France Telecom scenario', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'automation'), (u'semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'web service selection'), (u'web service selection', u'CONJUNCTION', u'discovery'), (u'discovery', u'CONJUNCTION', u'composition'), (u'composition', u'CONJUNCTION', u'invocation')], [], [(u'matchmaking functions', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic compatibilities'), (u'matchmaking functions', u'USED-FOR', u'web service descriptions')], [(u'concept abduction', u'USED-FOR', u'web services')], [], [], [(u'France Telecom scenario', u'USED-FOR', u'system'), (u'France Telecom scenario', u'USED-FOR', u'web services')]]
sentences: [u'The semantic web promises to bring automation to the areas of web service selection , discovery , composition , invocation .', u'In this paper we introduce a means of facilitating automation of web service composition by exploiting semantic matchmaking between web service parameters ( i.e. , outputs and inputs ) to enable their connections and interactions .', u'The idea is that matchmaking functions are key components to find semantic compatibilities among independently web service descriptions .', u'To this end , our approach extends existing methods ( exact , plug-in , subsume , intersection and fail ) with concept abduction to provide explanations of misconnections between web services .', u'From this we generate web service compositions that realize the goal , discovering and satisfying semantic connections between Web services .', u'Moreover a process of relaxing the hard constraints is introduced in case the composition process failed .', u'Our system is implemented and interacting with web services dedicated on a France Telecom scenario .']

relations: [[], [(u'ECA rules', u'USED-FOR', u'event-based behavioral , reactive logic')], [(u'derivation rules', u'PART-OF', u'homogeneous integration approach'), (u'derivation rules', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reaction rules'), (u'derivation rules', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ECA rules'), (u'reaction rules', u'USED-FOR', u'homogeneous integration approach'), (u'ECA rules', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'homogeneous integration approach'), (u'integrity constraint', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'rule types'), (u'integrity constraint', u'PART-OF', u'logic programming')], [(u'ID-based updates', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'expressive features'), (u'integrity testing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'transac-tions'), (u'integrity testing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'event algebra')]]
sentences: [u'Event-driven reactive functionalities are an urgent need in nowadays distributed service-oriented applications and ( Semantic ) Web-based environments .', u'An important problem to be addressed is how to correctly and efficiently capture and process the event-based behavioral , reactive logic represented as ECA rules in combination with other conditional decision logic which is represented as derivation rules .', u'In this paper we elaborate on a homogeneous integration approach which combines derivation rules , reaction rules ( ECA rules ) and other rule types such as integrity constraint into the general framework of logic programming .', u'The developed ECA-LP language provides expressive features such as ID-based updates with support for external and self-updates of the intensional and extensional knowledge , transac-tions including integrity testing and an event algebra to define and process complex events and actions based on a novel interval-based Event Calculus variant .']

entities: [[(u'notification', u'Metric')], [(u'signal processing', u'Task'), (u'context parameters', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fusion of context parameters', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'traffic situation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web Rule Language', u'Material')], [(u'fission component', u'Method'), (u'traffic situation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'prevention of vehicular traffic accident', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge representation'), (u'rules', u'USED-FOR', u'fusion of context parameters'), (u'Semantic Web Rule Language', u'USED-FOR', u'traffic situation')], [(u'fission component', u'USED-FOR', u'traffic situation')], [(u'Ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'driving model and road environment')], []]
sentences: [u'In this work , given the context of the driver , of the vehicle and of the environment , our objective is to correctly recognize the traffic situation and provide the driver with the corresponding assistance by providing notification or alert about the situation or the infraction that was committed , or acting directly on the vehicle .', u'To do so , we need to consider the signal processing related to these context parameters .', u'We built knowledge representation using ontology , built rules related to the fusion of context parameters and the deduction corresponding to the traffic situation using Semantic Web Rule Language .', u'We built fission component that deals with traffic situation and the corresponding action directed towards the driver or the vehicle .', u'Ontology is used to represent driving model and road environment .', u'This work is our contribution in the ongoing research for the prevention of vehicular traffic accident .']

sentences: [u'Ontologies are applied to many applications in recent years , especially on the semantic web , information retrieval , information extraction , and question answering .', u'The purpose of domain-specific ontology is to get rid of conceptual and terminological confusion .', u'It accomplishes this by specifying a set of generic concepts that characterizes the domain as well as their definitions and interrelationships .', u'There are some languages in order to represent ontologies , such as RDF , OWL .', u'However , these languages are only suitable with ontologies having small data .', u'For representing ontologies having big data , database is usually used .', u'Many techniques and tools have been proposed over the last years .', u'In this paper , we introduce an improved approach for mapping RDF or OWL to relational database based on the algorithm proposed by Kaunas University of Technology .', u'This approach can be applied to ontologies having many classes and big data .']

sentences: [u'Based on rules and ontologies , this paper proposes a framework for predicting types of arrhythmia from electro-cardiogram ( ECG ) signals acquired using a BSN node .', u'Using terms in an ECG signal ontology , ECG signals are annotated by locating the positions of elementary waves , including their onset , offset , and peak positions .', u'Rules are used for extracting features , e.g. , heart rate , PR intervals , RR intervals , and QRS intervals , from annotated signals .', u'An arrhythmia indicator ontology is constructed in order to define concepts representing different characteristics of ECG waveforms , which are then used for defining necessary and sufficient conditions for arrhythmia classification of signal portions .', u'Using standard semantic web ontology and rule languages , i.e. , OWL and SWRL , for rule and ontology representation , knowledge content in this framework can be integrated with other existing knowledge sources for retrieval of related information , e.g. , recommended treatment .']

entities: [[(u'genomic science', u'Task'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'retrieving information', u'Task'), (u'documents', u'Generic'), (u'Medical Subject Headings', u'Material'), (u'terminologies', u'Generic'), (u'folksonomies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'general language', u'Material'), (u'acronyms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'apocopes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'genomics field', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'indexing', u'Task'), (u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'structure of controlled vocabularies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'content interpretation', u'Task'), (u'search horizons of thesauri', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'social cataloging', u'Method'), (u'algorithmic domain analyses', u'Method'), (u'contrast indicators', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'markers of meaningful semantic lexicons', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'digitized text', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'genomic science', u'CONJUNCTION', u'medicine'), (u'methods', u'USED-FOR', u'retrieving information'), (u'documents', u'USED-FOR', u'methods'), (u'terminologies', u'COMPARE', u'medical-genomic terms'), (u'those', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'terminologies'), (u'acronyms', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'terminologies'), (u'acronyms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'apocopes'), (u'genomics field', u'USED-FOR', u'apocopes')], [], [(u'social cataloging', u'CONJUNCTION', u'algorithmic domain analyses'), (u'algorithmic domain analyses', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web'), (u'contrast indicators', u'CONJUNCTION', u'algorithmic domain analyses'), (u'digitized text', u'USED-FOR', u'markers of meaningful semantic lexicons')]]
sentences: [u'In the field of genomic science and medicine in general , there are two methods of retrieving information from documents , namely : 1 ) through the combined use of associations determined by the Medical Subject Headings , and 2 ) by employing specific terminologies , such as those in folksonomies , alternative medical-genomic terms in use in the general language , or acronyms or apocopes from the genomics field .', u'To some extent , many thinkers in matters of indexing hold that the combination of two methods may be the best approach .', u'While few authors advocate for keeping the structure of controlled vocabularies , built up over many years of content interpretation , unchanged , there are numerous proposals for expanding the search horizons of thesauri , whether through social cataloging , algorithmic domain analyses that contrast indicators or the semantic web , using markers of meaningful semantic lexicons contained in digitized text .']

entities: [[(u'Description Logic approach', u'Method'), (u'Semantic web vision', u'Method'), (u'semantic-enabled Electronic Marketplace', u'Method'), (u'demand/supply descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'non-standard Description Logic inference services', u'Method'), (u'Concept Contraction', u'Method'), (u'Concept Abduction', u'Task'), (u'subsumption', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'negotiation spaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'semantic-based approach', u'Method'), (u'logic-based discovery and negotiation stages', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'satisfiability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Concept Abduction')], [(u'algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'negotiation spaces')], [(u'algorithms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic-based approach'), (u'algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'logic-based discovery and negotiation stages')], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we present a Description Logic approach - fully compliant with the Semantic web vision and technologies - to extended matchmaking between demands and supplies in a semantic-enabled Electronic Marketplace , which allows the semantic-based treatment of negotiable and strict requirements in the demand/supply descriptions .', u'To this aim , we exploit two novel non-standard Description Logic inference services , Concept Contraction - which extends satisfiability - and Concept Abduction - which extends subsumption .', u'Based on these services , we devise algorithms , which allow to find negotiation spaces and to determine the quality of a possible match , also in the presence of a distinction between strictly required and optional elements .', u'Both the algorithms and the semantic-based approach are novel , and enable a mechanism to boost logic-based discovery and negotiation stages within an e-marketplace .', u'A set of simple experiments confirm the validity of the approach .']

entities: [[(u'Peer-To-Peer ( P2P )', u'Method'), (u'technological system', u'Method')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'devolved distributed Network nodes', u'Method'), (u'central supervision', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'IP-phone', u'Method'), (u'divided computing', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'P2P', u'Method'), (u'base communication systems', u'Method')], [(u'P2P', u'Method')], [(u'P2P intrinsic nature', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'network', u'Generic')], [(u'smart based architecture', u'Method'), (u'paradigm mobile agent', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'resource location', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Peer-To-Peer', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'technological system'), (u'Peer-To-Peer ( P2P )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'technological system')], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'paradigm mobile agent', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web')]]
sentences: [u'A Peer-To-Peer ( P2P ) is a new technological system .', u'It contains a number of devolved distributed Network nodes that are capable of sharing resources without central supervision .', u'The IP-phone as one distinguished application as well as divided computing and others have taken up the P2P into their base communication systems .', u'One of the most noticeable roles of the P2P is the location of resources .', u'This later however , is not easy to attain due to the P2P intrinsic nature , i.e .', u'dynamic reconfiguration of the network .', u'With a particular focus on the importance of the concept of the resource discovery , this article will attempt to describe and highlight our proposal which is about a smart based architecture that is concerned with the linkage of paradigm mobile agent and semantic web while ensuring the resource location in a context of pure P2P system .']

entities: [[(u'Information integration', u'Task'), (u'railway domain', u'Material')], [(u'InteGRail', u'Method'), (u'integration approach', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'logic-based reasoning mechanisms', u'Method')], [(u'heterogeneous monitoring data', u'Material'), (u'European railways', u'Material'), (u'rolling stock', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'infrastructure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'operations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'traffic management', u'Method')], [(u'distributed reasoning mechanism decentralised data', u'Material'), (u'inferred knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'techniques', u'Generic'), (u'distributed observation data', u'Material'), (u'railway domain', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Information integration is a key for further growth of efficiency in management decisions for the railway domain .', u'In the context of the EU project InteGRail ( funded in the 6th framework programme ) an integration approach leveraged by ontologies known from the semantic web and logic-based reasoning mechanisms has been successfully demonstrated .', u'To this effect existing heterogeneous monitoring data acquired across the European railways ( in the context of rolling stock , infrastructure , operations and traffic management ) is logically integrated according to a formal information model .', u'Based on distributed reasoning mechanism decentralised data and inferred knowledge does not have to be aggregated in a central repository but can be transparently accessed by applications independently from where it is acquired .', u'We explain how the proposed techniques facilitate integration , analysis and interpretation of distributed observation data in the railway domain .', u'In addition , the implementation of the presented approach ...']

entities: [[(u'Registries', u'Material'), (u'diversified metadata systems', u'Method'), (u'application profiles', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'automated analysis', u'Task'), (u'translation of metadata procedures', u'Task')], [(u'metadata registries', u'Material')], [(u'metadata schemes', u'Method'), (u'machine-readable structures', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'task', u'Generic'), (u'registries', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'automated analysis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'translation of metadata procedures')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Registries were established as tools of reference in association with Dublin Core metadata.In the future , complex and diversified metadata systems will be employed like the application profiles that are being developed at an increasing rate .', u'At the same time , the visions expressed in the term semantic web are leading to a growing need for automated analysis and the translation of metadata procedures .', u'These are to be accomplished through metadata registries .', u'This will place higher demands on registries as far as implementing and administrating the metadata schemes is concerned , on the one hand , and the implementation of machine-readable structures on the other hand .', u'This task can build upon existing registries and will lead to divided structures , which will ease the evaluation of metadata and thus generally contribute to raising the acceptance of the concept of metadata .']

sentences: [u'Description Logic is the logical basis of Semantic Web knowledge representation and reasoning , it has strong capacity of expression , but it is not applicable to uncertain knowledge representation and reasoning .', u'Horn rule is a proper subset of first-order predicate logic , which can be determined , its implication expression makes the description closer to a natural description of the problem , but it can not fully express the abundant and hierarchical knowledge in application fields .', u'Therefore the combination of Description Logic and Horn rule , and utilization of Resolution Principle for Constrained Logics , will effectively solve the problem of Uncertain Reasoning .', u'For the subsistent uncertainty of fact and rules in the reasoning system , credibility can be expressed by the interval between 0 and 1 , and Confidence Interval calculation for the querying results can be summarized as a process of solving homologous linear optimization equation .']

entities: [[(u'Rule-based systems', u'Method'), (u'business process modelling', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Task'), (u'sensor networks', u'Task')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'system behaviour', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'distributed rule-based systems', u'Method')], [(u'distributed problem-solving', u'Method'), (u'communicating rule-based systems', u'Task'), (u'rule firings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'message exchanges', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'model-checking technology', u'Method'), (u'resource requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'time and communication bounds', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Rule-based systems', u'USED-FOR', u'business process modelling'), (u'business process modelling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web'), (u'semantic web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'sensor networks')], [], [], [(u'distributed problem-solving', u'USED-FOR', u'communicating rule-based systems')], [(u'model-checking technology', u'USED-FOR', u'resource requirements')]]
sentences: [u"Rule-based systems are rapidly becoming an important component of ` mainstream ' computing technologies , for example in business process modelling , the semantic web , sensor networks etc .", u'However , while rules provide a flexible way of implementing such systems , the resulting system behaviour and the resources required to realise it can be difficult to predict .', u'In this paper we consider the verification of system behaviour and resource requirements for distributed rule-based systems .', u'More specifically , we consider distributed problem-solving in systems of communicating rule-based systems , and ask how much time ( measured as the number of rule firings ) and message exchanges does it take the system to find a solution .', u'We show how standard model-checking technology can be used to verify resource requirements for such systems , and present preliminary results which highlight complex tradeoffs between time and communication bounds .']

entities: [[(u'Web', u'Material'), (u'information space', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'human-human communication', u'Task'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web approach', u'Method'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'intelligent search engine', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'artificial intelligence problem', u'USED-FOR', u'human-human communication'), (u'model', u'USED-FOR', u'intelligent search engine')]]
sentences: [u"The Web was designed as an information space , with the goal that it should be useful not only for human-human communication , but also that machines would be able to participate and help.One of the major obstacles to this has been the fact that most information on the Web is designed for human consumption , and even if it was derived from a database with well defined meanings ( in at least some terms ) for its columns , that the structure of the data is not evident to a robot browsing the web.Leaving aside the artificial intelligence problem of training machines to behave like people , the Semantic Web approach instead develops languages for expressing information in a machine processable form.And it 's undoubtedly giving today 's search engines a new chance.In this case , I put forward the simple model of intelligent search engine ."]

sentences: [u'In the last years , authoring based on e-learning standards has been consolidated as a core factor of industry and development of interoperable and effective virtual learning environments .', u'However , there is a need for further research on abstraction to provide a more instructional view in the context of authoring tools in a variety of ways , in order to avoid being driven by Learning Technology ( LT ) specifications , facilitate instructional knowledge aggregation , and to provide an appropriate level of clarity and semantics in the design of collaborative activities .', u'We propose a combination of techniques to provide this instructional abstraction in the context of the new European educational model , combining instructional layers and collaborative scripts in authoring tools , and semantic web techniques for extending e-learning material in order to harness the wealth of existing web content and semantically labeled repositories .']

sentences: [u'Summary This contribution focuses on domain-specific multilingual structured content ( including terminology ) .', u'In eApplications , such as eBusiness , eHealth , eLearning , etc. , terminology today is mostly embedded in or combined with other kinds of content ( most frequently occurring in specialized texts ) increasingly , however , occurring in combination with other kinds of structured content .', u'In order to make the development of structured content less expensive ( because of its labour-intensiveness ) , new methods for web-based , distributed , cooperative creation of structured content ( and the respective workflow management ) are needed .', u'This adds a new dimension to technical and other kinds of interoperability : content interoperability , a fundamental requirement for achieving the aims of the semantic web .', u'ISO/TC 37 Terminology and other language and content resources is gradually moving into this area , bringing in its competence and experience with the data modelling of multilingual terminological data and othe ...']

entities: [[(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'personalized retrieval', u'Task'), (u'e-learning platform', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic Web standards', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'learning content', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user/learner profiles', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'search results/lectures', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'colleges', u'Material'), (u'data driven extraction', u'Task'), (u'clustering', u'Method'), (u'learning platforms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'document/lecture collection', u'Material')], [(u"learner 's context", u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'precision', u'Metric'), (u'recall', u'Metric'), (u'e-learning content retrieval', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'personalized retrieval'), (u'e-learning platform', u'USED-FOR', u'personalized retrieval')], [], [(u"learner 's context", u'USED-FOR', u'e-learning content retrieval'), (u'precision', u'CONJUNCTION', u'recall')]]
sentences: [u'We present an approach for personalized retrieval in an e-learning platform , that takes advantage of semantic Web standards to represent the learning content and the user/learner profiles as ontologies , and that re-ranks search results/lectures based on how the contained terms map to these ontologies .', u'One important aspect of our approach is the combination of an authoritatively supplied taxonomy by the colleges , with the data driven extraction ( via clustering ) of a taxonomy from the documents themselves , thus making it easier to adapt to different learning platforms , and making it easier to evolve with the document/lecture collection .', u"Our experimental results show that the learner 's context can be effectively used for improving the precision and recall in e-learning content retrieval , particularly by re-ranking the search results based on the learner 's past activities ."]

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'knowledge representations', u'Method'), (u'accessibility of knowledge', u'Metric'), (u'retrieval capabilities', u'Task')], [(u'knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'semantic structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web search engines', u'Method'), (u'contextualized conceptual retrieval', u'Task')], [], [(u'ad-hoc knowledge representations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'metadata vocabularies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'web system', u'Method'), (u'heterogeneous semantic schemas', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multilevel ontological structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reference ontology', u'Method'), (u'conceptual retrieval', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'knowledge representations', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [(u'ad-hoc knowledge representations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'metadata vocabularies')], [(u'web system', u'USED-FOR', u'heterogeneous semantic schemas')]]
sentences: [u'The development of the Semantic Web depends on agreed and unambiguous knowledge representations , on the availability and accessibility of knowledge , as well as on retrieval capabilities .', u'The scarce agreement on knowledge representation and the lack of techniques to process semantic structures in web search engines makes it impossible a contextualized conceptual retrieval .', u'These limitations imply that users must previously know the existence and location of this knowledge to be able to retrieve it .', u'In consequence , different ad-hoc knowledge representations and metadata vocabularies , scarcely formalized and agreed on , have been published , which makes it difficult reuse and interoperability .', u'The proposal has as its main goal the elaboration of web system to manage and retrieve heterogeneous semantic schemas by means of a multilevel ontological structure and the alignment with a reference ontology that makes it possible the conceptual retrieval and reuse of knowledge .']

entities: [[(u'Domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'real-world phenomena', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'specific-domain applications', u'Task'), (u'real-world entity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneous organisation', u'Task'), (u'viewpoints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'terminologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'Multi-Viewpoints Ontology', u'Method'), (u'heterogeneity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneous organisation', u'Task')], [(u'Multi-Viewpoints Ontology Web Language', u'Method'), (u'OWL-DL language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multi-viewpoints ontologies representation', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'real-world entity', u'USED-FOR', u'specific-domain applications')], [], [], [(u'multi-viewpoints ontologies representation', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')]]
sentences: [u'Domain ontologies are intended to provide a commonly shared understanding among several user communities .', u'Concepts and their relationships are used to explicitly model the real-world phenomena that are of interest to users of specific domain .', u'In practice , a set of a specific-domain applications use different representations of the same real-world entity due to various viewpoints , context and specific interest .', u'In this paper , we are interested in the problem of representing an ontology in heterogeneous organisation by taking into account different viewpoints and different terminologies of various users , groups or even communities in the organisation .', u'Such ontology , called Multi-Viewpoints Ontology , allows heterogeneity and consensus in a heterogeneous organisation .', u'So , our goal is to propose a Multi-Viewpoints Ontology Web Language , which is an extension of OWL-DL language , to allow the multi-viewpoints ontologies representation for the Semantic Web .']

sentences: [u'Abstract Ontologies are the backbone of the Semantic Web , a semantic-aware version of the World Wide Web .', u'To the end of making available large-scale domain ontologies , effective and usable methodologies are needed to facilitate the process of Ontology Building .', u'Many of the methods proposed so far only in part refer to well-known and widely used standards from other areas , like software engineering and knowledge representation .', u'In this paper we present UPON , a methodology based on the adaptation to Ontology Building of the Unified Software Development Process developed by the Object Management Group .', u'The approach provides interesting insights from both software engineering and ontology construction .', u'A comparative evaluation with other methodologies , as well as the results of its adoption in the context of the European Interop Network of Excellence and Athena Integrated Project , are also discussed .']

relations: [[], [(u'authentication', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'entity-centered issues'), (u'authentication', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reputation'), (u'reputation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'entity-centered issues')], [], [], [], [(u'user input', u'USED-FOR', u'they')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Trust is an integral part of the Semantic Web architecture .', u'While most prior work focuses on entity-centered issues such as authentication and reputation , it does not model the content , i.e .', u'the nature and use of the information being exchanged .', u'This paper discusses content trust as an aggregate of other trust measures that have been previously studied .', u'The paper introduces several factors that users consider in deciding whether to trust the content provided by a Web resource .', u'Many of these factors are hard to capture in practice , since they would require a large amount of user input .', u"Our goal is to discern which of these factors could be captured in practice with minimal user interaction in order to maximize the system 's trust estimates .", u'The paper also describes a simulation environment that we have designed to study alternative models of content trust .']
