sentences: [u'We introduce Venn diagrams for multisets and showhow they simplify the analysis of multisets .', u'Venn diagrams arevery useful in proofs involving multisets and multiset orders , especially considering the complications introduced by the multiplicity of elements in multisets .', u'We compare the Venn diagramsfor multisets with the corresponding ones for sets .', u'Thus , wepresent two types of Venn diagrams for multisets , a simple onethat looks like a diagram for sets , but with areas that are notnecessarily disjoint , and a complex one ( compared to sets ) , butwith certain delimited disjoint areas .', u'We determine the numberof non-composite areas ( disjoint or not ) in a Venn diagram formultisets , for which we give two sequences of integers .', u'We compare several properties of Venn diagrams for sets and multisets , like symmetry and Hamiltonicity .', u'Venn diagrams for multisetscan also be used for databases , knowledge representation systems , in artificial intelligence , Semantic Web .']

entities: [[(u'social context', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'social relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mobile phones', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'mobile system', u'Method'), (u'social context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'prototype', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web ontologies', u'Method')], [(u'experience sampling', u'Method'), (u'communicated content', u'Material'), (u'relationship types', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mood', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'usage of mobile devices', u'Task')], [(u'social context', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'Semantic Web ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'prototype')], [(u'communicated content', u'CONJUNCTION', u'relationship types'), (u'relationship types', u'CONJUNCTION', u'mood')], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper we examine the role of social context -- - for example social relationships or mood -- - in the use of mobile phones .', u'A mobile system that uses information on social context can provide a less obtrusive and a more natural way of interaction : it could play a cheery and joyful tone when a friend calls , or divert the call for the mother-in-law .', u'We present a model of social context , along with its implementation in a prototype based on Semantic Web ontologies .', u'The empirical evaluation , based on experience sampling , with participants during a field trial shows that communicated content , relationship types , and mood have an impact on the usage of mobile devices .', u'Based on the findings , we argue that the design of future mobile services needs to be informed by social context to a greater extent .']

sentences: [u'Background : Increasingly , effective drug discovery involves the searching and data mining of large volumes of information from many sources covering the domains of chemistry , biology and pharmacology amongst others .', u'This has led to a proliferation of databases and data sources relevant to drug discovery .', u'Objective : This paper provides a review of the publicly-available large-scale databases relevant to drug discovery , describes the kinds of data mining approaches that can be applied to them and discusses recent work in integrative data mining that looks for associations that pan multiple sources , including the use of Semantic Web techniques .', u'Conclusion : The future of mining large data sets for drug discovery requires intelligent , semantic aggregation of information from all of the data sources described in this review , along with the application of advanced methods such as intelligent agents and inference engines in client applications .']

entities: [[(u'Cloud Manufacturing ( CMfg )', u'Method'), (u'cloud computing', u'Method'), (u'Capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'MR/Cs', u'Method')], [(u'manufacturing cloud', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'aggregated MR/Cs', u'Method'), (u'MCs', u'Method'), (u'natural evolution', u'Task')], [(u'integration framework', u'Method'), (u'MCs', u'Method'), (u'peak user demands', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'MR/Cs', u'Method')], [(u'functional modules', u'Method'), (u'business model', u'Method'), (u'framework', u'Generic')], [(u'enabling technologies', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'intelligent agents', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'service oriented architecture', u'Method'), (u'material handling', u'Task'), (u'logistics technologies', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Cloud Manufacturing ( CMfg ) adopts and extends the concept of cloud computing to make mass Manufacturing Resources and Capabilities ( MR/Cs ) more widely integrated and accessible to users through the Internet .', u'However , a single manufacturing cloud ( MC ) only has relatively limited scalability and elasticity .', u'Using the aggregated MR/Cs from multiple MCs is a natural evolution .', u'To address this requirement , we propose an integration framework for multiple MCs , so that MCs can collaboratively cope with peak user demands for MR/Cs .', u'The key functional modules and the business model of the proposed framework are presented to guide future integration of multiple MCs .', u'The enabling technologies , such as semantic web and ontologies , intelligent agents , service oriented architecture , and material handling and logistics technologies are also discussed .', u'An application example is given , showing the feasibility and rationality of the proposed approach .']

entities: [[(u'Spatial and temporal data', u'Material')], [(u'analytical domains', u'Material'), (u'national security', u'Task'), (u'criminal investigation', u'Task')], [], [(u'query operators', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web data models', u'Method'), (u'semantic associations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'analysis mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'thematic relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'RDF metadata model', u'Method')], [(u'semantic query operators', u'Method')], [(u'Oracle DBMS', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'synthetic dataset', u'Material'), (u'national security domain', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'Spatial and temporal data are critical components in many applications .', u'This is especially true in analytical domains such as national security and criminal investigation .', u'Often , the analytical process requires uncovering and analyzing complex thematic relationships between disparate people , places and events .', u'Fundamentally new query operators based on the graph structure of Semantic Web data models , such as semantic associations , are proving useful for this purpose .', u'However , these analysis mechanisms are primarily intended for thematic relationships .', u'In this paper , we describe a framework built around the RDF metadata model for analysis of thematic , spatial and temporal relationships between named entities .', u'We discuss modeling issues and present a set of semantic query operators .', u'We also describe an efficient implementation in Oracle DBMS and demonstrate the scalability of our approach with a performance study using a large synthetic dataset from the national security domain .']

sentences: [u"Since EA includes huge information of a company , it takes long time and high cost for company 's employees to search for what they need .", u'We try to make the foundation to solve this problem by using ontology technology based on semantic web .', u'In this paper , we try to verify efficiency of EA ontology by developing ontology for Business Enterprise Architecture ( BEA ) .', u'The purpose of this paper is to develop BEA ontology to provide new information by reasoner and to discover new relations between matadata by using extracted information and data .', u'The EA ontology we developed will provide the new way of access and use for companies .', u'The experience of ontology development will help EA ontology development in various domains .', u'In the future , the development of other EAs which has more information resources will help to solve problems for interoperability between different EAs .']

entities: [[(u'Information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'traffic information service', u'Task'), (u'intelligent transportation systems', u'Task')], [(u'Ontology-based semantic information retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'fuzzy semantic retrieval', u'Task'), (u'fuzzy ontology framework', u'Method'), (u'information retrieval system', u'Task'), (u'ITS', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'linguistic values', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'fuzzy concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic query expansion', u'Task'), (u'order relation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'equivalence relation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'inclusion relation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy linguistic variable ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'traffic accident information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'fuzzy ontology models', u'Method'), (u'semantic retrieval of traffic information', u'Task'), (u'fuzzy concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ITS', u'Method'), (u'semantic Web', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'Information retrieval is the important work for traffic information service in intelligent transportation systems ( ITS ) .', u'Ontology-based semantic information retrieval is a hotspot of current research .', u'In order to achieve fuzzy semantic retrieval , this paper applies a fuzzy ontology framework to information retrieval system for ITS .', u"The framework includes three parts : concepts , properties of concepts and values of properties , in which property 's value can be either standard data type or linguistic values ( i.e .", u'fuzzy concepts ) .', u'The semantic query expansion is constructed by order relation , equivalence relation , inclusion relation and complement relation between fuzzy concepts defined in fuzzy linguistic variable ontologies .', u'The application to retrieve traffic accident information shows that the framework can overcome the localization of other fuzzy ontology models , and this research facilitates the semantic retrieval of traffic information through fuzzy concepts in ITS on the semantic Web .']

entities: [[(u'devel- opment infrastructure', u'Method'), (u'architec- ture', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [], [(u'con- cept', u'Method'), (u"`` networked forge ''", u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'libre software development', u'Task')], [(u'pro- posal', u'Method'), (u'distributed components', u'Method'), (u'web 2.0', u'Method'), (u'mashup technologies', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Libre ( free , open source ) software forges ( sites hosting the devel- opment infrastructure for a collection of projects ) have been stable in architec- ture , services and concept since they become popular during the late 1990s .', u'During this time several problems that can not be solved without dramatic de- sign changes have become evident .', u"To overcome them , we propose a new con- cept , the `` networked forge '' , focused on addressing the core characteristics of libre software development and the needs of developers .", u'The key of this pro- posal is to re-engineer forges as a net of distributed components which can be composed and configured according to the needs of users , using a combination of web 2.0 , semantic web and mashup technologies .', u'This approach is flexible enough to accommodate different development processes , while at the same time interoperates with current facilities .']

sentences: [u'The fundamental issue of imprecise search results arises owing to the misrepresentation of data on the web .', u'Although a large number of theoretical models have been reported in literature , their implementation in the real world is still at an initial stage .', u'This research is a systematic investigation on the underlying basis of ontologies , intelligent agents and semantic mechanisms .', u"A solution is to put into action , the envisioned , 'Semantic web ' , by annotating/manipulating web pages using XML-based technologies , creating ontology for providing an RDF vocabulary in a hierarchical class structure and developing an intelligent agent , which would be capable of database access , comparison and inference .", u"The system designed here is to enable a machine to 'understand ' the information it holds , which in turn would greatly facilitate smart searching .", u'This paper presents that the system has been successfully implemented and achieves accurate search results .']

sentences: [u'The ever-growing availability of large-scale open data and its maturation is having a significant impact on industrial drug-discovery , as well as on academic and non-profit research .', u'As industry is changing to an open innovation business concept , precompetitive initiatives and strong public-private partnerships including academic research cooperation partners are gaining more and more importance .', u'Now , the bioinformatics and cheminformatics communities are seeking for web tools which allow the integration of this large volume of life science datasets available in the public domain .', u'Such a data exploitation tool would ideally be able to answer complex biological questions by formulating only one search query .', u'In this short review/perspective , we outline the use of semantic web approaches for data and knowledge integration .', u'Further , we discuss strengths and current limitations of public available data retrieval tools and integrated platforms .']

sentences: [u"In mobile geoinformation services , most intelligent systems ignore the users states and roles and only include the user 's location .", u'However , different user profiles need customized visualization styles in order to provide relevant spatial data .', u'With the availability of a variety of data sources and the ability for continuous data updates , the service is able to perceive and react to instant changes .', u'The aim of this research is to describe contextual ontological model which provides visualization on mobile devices .', u'Therefore , intelligent visualization explained in this study is defined by a complete semantic model of the Ontology Web Language Description Logic ( OWL-DL ) and Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) .', u'Consequently , a mobile visualization service sensitive to the instant changes of the users situation has been proposed .', u'Egocentric design of a map-based service has been tested on a scenario-based application of a mobile emulator .']

sentences: [u'A dramatic increase of demand for provided treatment quality has occurred during last decades .', u'The main challenge to be confronted , so as to increase treatment quality , is the personalization of treatment , since each patient constitutes a unique case .', u'Healthcare provision encloses a complex environment since healthcare provision organizations are highly multidisciplinary .', u'In this paper , we present the conceptualization of the domain of clinical pathways ( CP ) .', u'The SEMPATH ( SEMantic PATHways ) Oontology comprises three main parts : 1 ) the CP part ; 2 ) the business and finance part ; and 3 ) the quality assurance part .', u'Our implementation achieves the conceptualization of the multidisciplinary domain of healthcare provision , in order to be further utilized for the implementation of a Semantic Web Rules ( SWRL rules ) repository .', u'Finally , SEMPATH Ontology is utilized for the definition of a set of SWRL rules for the human papillomavirus ) disease and its treatment scheme .']

sentences: [u'With the evolution of Web 2.0 , ICT has become the primary need of human beings .', u'There is a gap between the farmers and the knowledge of agricultural experts .', u'ICT can fill the gap between farmers and the experts .', u'In this paper , we have proposed a semantic web based architecture to generate agricultural recommendations , using spatial data and agricultural knowledge bases .', u'Our knowledge base acts as a domain expert and will send recommendations to the farmers based on climate conditions and geographic data .', u'We have shown experimental results as a part of implementation of our proposed architecture .', u'A farmer sends a query to the query engine , in order to get information for a specific crop .', u'Query may be related to GIS data , crop knowledge base or both .', u'The result of the query is displayed on a mobile device .']

entities: [[(u'Location-Based Services', u'Task'), (u'LBS )', u'Method'), (u'information and entertainment services', u'Task'), (u'mobile devices', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'LBS', u'Method'), (u'severai services', u'Method')], [(u'Inter-LBS collaboration', u'Task'), (u'service orchestration languages', u'Material'), (u'WS-BPEL 2.0', u'Material')], [(u'LBS', u'Method')], [(u'dynamism', u'Generic'), (u'manual composition scenario update', u'Task')], [(u'TransportML', u'Method'), (u'middleware', u'Generic'), (u'inter-LBS collaboration', u'Task')], [(u'TransportML', u'Material'), (u'technologies', u'Generic'), (u'Web services', u'Material'), (u'semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'platform', u'Generic'), (u'collaboration scenarios', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'platform', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'WS-BPEL 2.0', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'service orchestration languages')], [], [], [(u'TransportML', u'USED-FOR', u'inter-LBS collaboration'), (u'middleware', u'USED-FOR', u'inter-LBS collaboration')], [(u'Web services', u'USED-FOR', u'TransportML'), (u'Web services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic Web'), (u'semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'TransportML')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Location-Based Services ( LBS ) are information and entertainment services , accessible with mobile devices and making use of the position of the mobile device .', u'Although LBS are now widely used , better results could be obtained by merging information issued by severai services .', u'Inter-LBS collaboration is still uncommon althongh a lot of work is done on service orchestration languages such as WS-BPEL 2.0 .', u'One of the obstacles is that LBS are created and updated on the fly .', u'This dynamism makes manual composition scenario update difficult .', u'To tackle this problem , we introduce TransportML , a middleware for inter-LBS collaboration , in an automatic fashion .', u'TransportML relies on technologies such as Web services and semantic Web .', u'In this platform , services are discovered and collaboration scenarios are elaborated on the fly .', u'As a consequence , the platform is auto-adaptive and composition scenario maintenance is no longer required .']

entities: [[], [], [(u'semantic multi-agent systems', u'Method'), (u'ontology support', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'one-level approach', u'Method')], [(u'compromise', u'Generic'), (u'two-level approach', u'Method'), (u'ontology servers', u'Method'), (u'systems', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'ontology support', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic multi-agent systems')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The work presented in this paper is an attempt to bridge two co-existing realities : semantic Web and multi-agent systems .', u'Agents should be enhanced with tools and mechanisms in order to autonomously achieve this strategic and ambitious objective .', u'In this paper , we focus on what we consider the central issue when moving towards the vision of semantic multi-agent systems : the ontology support .', u'Due to the heterogeneity of resources available and roles played by different agents of a system , a one-level approach with the aim of being omni-comprehensive seems not to be feasible .', u'In our opinion , a good compromise is represented by a two-level approach : a light ontology support embedded in each agent and one or more ontology servers providing a more expressive and powerful ontology support to the agents of the systems .']

sentences: [u'Surveillance applications to monitor health-related data have matured rapidly over the last several years .', u'A newly emerging development is an emphasis on harvesting and evaluating the timely but potentially inaccurate information present in unstructured sources such as Internet news feeds and sites .', u'An important development for the surveillance on both structured and unstructured datasets is the exchange not of the primary datasets that feed these systems , but of the evaluated results of such analysis .', u'This paper introduces recent work addressing a model for the recording and tracking of events and for the dissemination of information about these events to other agencies .', u'It will introduce a structured relational database model for events , an ontology for infectious disease events , and a semantic web representation .', u'The strengths and weaknesses of the three approaches and future directions will be discussed .']

entities: [[(u'World Wide Web', u'Material'), (u'document repository', u'Method'), (u'services', u'Task'), (u'interaction', u'Task'), (u'communication', u'Task')], [(u'3D Internet', u'Task')], [], [(u'networking', u'Task'), (u'security', u'Task'), (u'distributed computing', u'Task'), (u'machine learning communities', u'Task')], [(u'3D Internet', u'Task')], [(u'3D Internet', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'The World Wide Web , which has started as a document repository , is rapidly transforming to a full fledged virtual environment that facilitates services , interaction , and communication .', u'Under this light , the Semantic Web and Web 2.0 movements can be seen as intermediate steps of a natural evolution towards a new paradigm , the 3D Internet .', u'We provide an overview of the concept 3D Internet and discuss why it is a goal worth pursuing , what it does entail , and how one can realize it .', u'Our goal in this paper is to discuss a research agenda and raise interest in networking , security , distributed computing , and machine learning communities .', u'We explore first the motivation for the 3D Internet and the possibilities it brings .', u'Subsequently , we investigate the specific system level and research challenges that need to be addressed in order to make the 3D Internet a reality .']

entities: [[(u'Context & motivation ] Stakeholders participation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'collaborative working tools', u'Method')], [(u'tools', u'Generic'), (u'requirement elicitation', u'Task')], [(u'information overload', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'requirements analysis', u'Task'), (u'selection', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concept lattices', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'collaborative software development environment', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'requirements analysis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'selection')], [(u'semantic web languages', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], [], []]
sentences: [u'[ Context & motivation ] Stakeholders participation is recognized as a key issue in the development of useful and usable systems .', u'The Web has given rise to a growing number of collaborative working tools that facilitated the participation of stakeholders ( and especially end-users ) .', u'These tools create new opportunities of practice regarding requirement elicitation .', u'[ Question/problem ] Nevertheless , they result in an information overload lacking structure and semantics .', u'Consequently , requirements analysis and selection becomes more challenging .', u'[ Principal ideas/results ] In this paper , we propose an approach based on semantic web languages as well as concept lattices to identify relevant groups of stakeholders depending on their past participation .', u'[ Contribution ] These groups can be used to enable facilitated decision-making and handling of requirements .', u'We detail the different steps and the possible configurations , using an example inspired by a collaborative software development environment .']

entities: [[(u'Data dictionary', u'Material'), (u'meta-data', u'Material'), (u'business processes', u'Method')], [(u'Data dictionary', u'Material'), (u'business process standardization', u'Task'), (u'automation', u'Task'), (u'ERP application management', u'Task'), (u'customization', u'Task')], [(u'data dictionary', u'Material'), (u'B2B processes', u'Task')], [(u'SEA', u'Method'), (u'ERP system', u'Method'), (u'ETRI', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'business information system', u'Method')], [(u'data dictionary', u'Material'), (u'semantic', u'Method')], [(u'business data dictionary', u'Material'), (u'business knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web based enterprise infra-structure', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Data dictionary', u'USED-FOR', u'business process standardization'), (u'business process standardization', u'CONJUNCTION', u'automation'), (u'business process standardization', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ERP application management'), (u'automation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'customization'), (u'ERP application management', u'CONJUNCTION', u'customization')], [(u'data dictionary', u'USED-FOR', u'B2B processes')], [(u'it', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'business information system')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Data dictionary is a collection of meta-data , which describes data produced and consumed while performing business processes .', u'Data dictionary is an essential element for business process standardization and automation , and has a fundamental role in ERP application management and customization .', u'Also , data dictionary facilitates B2B processes by enabling painless integration of business processes between various enterprises .', u"We implemented data dictionary support in SEA , a component- based scalable ERP system developed in ETRI , and found out that it 's a plausible feature of business information system .", u'We discovered that data dictionary promotes semantic , not syntactic , data management , which can make it possible to leverage viability of the tool in the coming age of more meta-data oriented computing world .', u'We envision that business data dictionary is a firm foundation of adapting business knowledge , applications and processes into the semantic web based enterprise infra-structure .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Task'), (u'web revolution', u'Task'), (u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'query languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SPARQL', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDQL', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic')], [(u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'query language', u'Material')], [(u'vocabulary gap problem', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u"translating user 's search words", u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic similarity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user created search words', u'Material'), (u'ontology resource names', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Ontologies', u'PART-OF', u'semantic web')], [(u'SPARQL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'query languages'), (u'SPARQL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RDQL'), (u'RDQL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'query languages')], [], [], [], [(u'success rate', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'vocabulary gap problem')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u"translating user 's search words")], [(u'semantic similarity', u'USED-FOR', u'approach'), (u'ontology resource names', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic similarity')]]
sentences: [u'Ontologies are playing an important role in semantic web which is emerging as a next stage of the web revolution because various kinds of metadata are described in ontologies .', u'Correspondingly , many query languages like SPARQL , RDQL etc .', u'have been proposed for querying these ontologies .', u'But users have to know the structures and resource names of ontologies completely to get search results even if they have expertise on complex formal logic and syntax of the query languages .', u'Especially , casual users do not know the resource names and may use different words from resource names when they write their query language .', u'This vocabulary gap problem have to be solved to raise the success rate .', u"In this paper , an approach for translating user 's search words to corresponding resource names has been proposed .", u'This approach uses semantic similarity between user created search words and ontology resource names .']

relations: [[], [(u'minimum human effort', u'FEATURE-OF', u'global schema')], [], [(u'domain reference ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'solution'), (u'mediation support', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reasoning techniques'), (u'reasoning techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'solution'), (u'reasoning techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'human intervention')], []]
sentences: [u'Data integration involves combining data residing in different sources and providing users with a unified view of these data through what is called a global schema .', u'The authors address here the problem of the construction of this global schema , with a minimum human effort , in the semantic Web context where data sources are annotated with ontologies .', u'The authors aim to facilitate the task of building a common vocabulary ( ontology ) that will serve as a shared conceptual level for several heterogeneous data sources needing to share their data in a specific application domain .', u'The authors propose a solution based on the use of a domain reference ontology ( or background knowledge ) as a mediation support and some reasoning techniques in order to minimize human intervention .', u'The work presented here is implemented as a prototype for Semi Automatic Global Ontology Building ( SAGOB ) .']

sentences: [u'As by far the most famous bio-ontology , Gene Ontology is widely used for annotations of gene products coming from different organisms .', u'However , there exist some shortcomings in RDF file provided by GO consortium : ( 1 ) GO term-centric view of annotation data .', u'The requirements are intractable when attempting to retrieve GO annotations based on big volume dataset .', u'( 2 ) Lack of richer semantic relationships between the pairs of terms coming from three independent GO subontologies .', u'( 3 ) Not supporting GOSlim .', u'By encoding heterogeneous original data with uniform RDF format , creating additional ontology mappings , and introducing a set of reasoning rulebases , we proposed a Semantic Web model GORouter .', u'Furthermore , we chose Oracle NDM as native RDF repository and used table function RDFMATCH to combine the result of RDF query with traditional relational data , seamlessly .', u'Finally , we attempt to provide a mixture semantic query and reasoning solution .']

entities: [[(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'identification of agents', u'Task'), (u'scenario', u'Generic'), (u'criminal justice', u'Task')], [(u'identification', u'Generic'), (u'id-case', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'judgment of agent identity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'resource situations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'notion of situations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u"Barwise and Perry 's situation theory", u'Method'), (u'semantic web notation', u'Method')], [(u'justification-based mass function', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mass functions', u'Method'), (u'Dempster-Shafer theory', u'Method')], [(u'similarity measures', u'Method'), (u'initial mass function', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mass function', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'identification of agents')], [(u'id-case', u'USED-FOR', u'identification')], [], [(u"Barwise and Perry 's situation theory", u'USED-FOR', u'notion of situations'), (u'semantic web notation', u'USED-FOR', u'notion of situations')], [(u'Dempster-Shafer theory', u'USED-FOR', u'mass functions')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper presents an expanded framework for identification of agents in a given scenario , particularly in relation to criminal justice .', u'This identification is centered around an id-case , a set of situations leading up to a judgment of agent identity .', u'The id-case consists of an id-situation , where the actual judgment is made , and a number of resource situations , which support the id-situation .', u"The notion of situations used is based on Barwise and Perry 's situation theory and expressed using semantic web notation .", u'Each id-case corresponds to a justification-based mass function , which can be combined with other mass functions using Dempster-Shafer theory .', u'This paper explores the relation between the id-situations , which provide similarity measures that serve as a basis for an initial mass function , and resource situations , which can modify that mass function in a number of ways .']

entities: [[(u'Linguistic and semantic annotations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'text-based applications', u'Task')], [(u'annotations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ad hoc approaches', u'Method'), (u'annotations', u'Generic')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'linguistic and domain information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'annotations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge representation issues', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'prototype', u'Generic'), (u'logic', u'Generic'), (u'classical description logics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'cutting-edge Semantic Web reasoners', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'reasoning', u'Task'), (u'annotations of texts', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'Linguistic and semantic annotations are important features for text-based applications .', u'However , achieving and maintaining a good quality of a set of annotations is known to be a complex task .', u'Many ad hoc approaches have been developed to produce various types of annotations , while comparing those annotations to improve their quality is still rare .', u'In this paper , we propose a framework in which both linguistic and domain information can cooperate to reason with annotations .', u'The underlying knowledge representation issues are carefully analyzed and solved by studying a higher order logic , which accounts for the cooperation of different sorts of knowledge .', u'Our prototype implements this logic based on a reduction to classical description logics by preserving the semantics , allowing us to benefit from cutting-edge Semantic Web reasoners .', u'An application scenario shows interesting merits of this framework on reasoning with annotations of texts .']

sentences: [u'Fuzzy ontologies are efficient tools to handle fuzzy and uncertain knowledge on the semantic web ; but there are heterogeneity problems when gaining interoperability among different fuzzy ontologies .', u'This paper uses concept approximation between fuzzy ontologies based on instances to solve the heterogeneity problems .', u'It firstly proposes an instance selection technology based on instance clustering and weighting to unify the fuzzy interpretation of different ontologies and reduce the number of instances to increase the efficiency .', u'Then the paper resolves the problem of computing the approximations of concepts into the problem of computing the least upper approximations of atom concepts .', u'It optimizes the search strategies by extending atom concept sets and defining the least upper bounds of concepts to reduce the searching space of the problem .', u'An efficient algorithm for searching the least upper bounds of concept is given .']

entities: [[(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'poor data structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'legacy data formats', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fragmented databases', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Web ( SW ) technology', u'Method'), (u'distributed data sources', u'Material')], [(u'information policy', u'Task'), (u'Public Sector Information', u'Task'), (u're-use of public sector information', u'Task')], [], [(u'SW technology', u'Method'), (u'dissemination', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Governments often hold very rich data and whilst much of this information is published and available for re-use by others , it is often trapped by poor data structures , locked up in legacy data formats or in fragmented databases .', u'One of the great benefits that Semantic Web ( SW ) technology offers is facilitating the large scale integration and sharing of distributed data sources .', u'At the heart of information policy in the UK , the Office of Public Sector Information ( OPSI ) is the part of the UK government charged with enabling the greater re-use of public sector information .', u'This paper describes the actions , findings , and lessons learnt from a pilot study , involving several parts of government and the public sector .', u'The aim was to show to government how they can adopt SW technology for the dissemination , sharing and use of its data .']

sentences: [u'As the study on the semantic Web actively progresses , many domain ontologies are being built .', u'However , most engineers are building the ontologies based on their academic background and research interests .', u'Consequently , ontologies on the same subject are different because the ontology engineers have different view point .', u'Furthermore , there is no standard method for building ontologies , and there are many ontology tools using different ontology languages .', u'Because of these reasons , interoperability between the ontologies is very low .', u'And , current ontology tools mostly concentrate on the functions to create , edit , inference the ontology .', u'Methods for merging heterogeneous domain ontologies are not in most tools .', u'This paper presents a study on a merging method for building a more complete ontology .', u'The method was based on WordNet .', u'The study tried to merge heterogeneous domain ontologies about the same subject throughout specific steps .']

sentences: [u'Many articles have been written about what digital resources represent - or could represent - for improving the performance of memory institutions .', u'But the majority of them refer to digital resources as things to be consumed and made available to users , but rarely as something to be produced and later made available to them .', u'Starting with the functions of archives , the article proposes the creation of digital resources according to standards ( metadata structures , OAI-PMH - Open Archives Initiative-Protocol for Metadata Harvesting - , semantic Web , etc . )', u'in order to enhance resource discovery and information visibility , for specialists as well as for other types of users .', u'Europe must give top priority to the development of new information retrieval systems and new products based on emerging standards and protocols in order for European countries to achieve a more competitive standing within the information society .']

sentences: [u'To develop an intelligent search engine to help users retrieve information effectively , various methods , such as Semantic Web , have been used , An effective retrieval method of such methods uses ontology technology .', u'In this paper , we built National R & D ontology after analyzing National R & D Information in NTIS and then implemented National R & D Knowledge Map to represent and retrieve information of the relationship between object and subject ( project , human information , organization , research result ) in R & D Ontology .', u"In the National R & D Knowledge Map , center-node is the object selected by users , node is subject , subject 's sub-node is user 's favorite query in National R & D ontology after analyzing the relationship between object and subject .", u'When a user selects sub-node , the system displays the results from inference engine after making query by SPARQL in National R & D ontology .']

sentences: [u'During last 30 years , due to the interest in sustainable development and ecology , different systems of sustainability indicators have been developed .', u'These systems are increasingly complex , varying their scope both for territorial and thematic areas .', u'A key point developing sustainable policies is the accessibility of good indicators .', u'Developing a knowledge model about them can facilitate their management and interpretation .', u'Due to the complexity of diverse set of indicators developed for 29 areas in 9 countries , we were taken to develop a conceptual model of these indicators , which associate to the different indicators their validity scope , specific interpretation and use .', u'We have integrated the different indicators using conceptual maps ( using CMap-Tool ) and associating to them semantic labels .', u'The web developed to manage the different projects includes these labels ( it is a semantic web ) and all the referenced texts have been labeled using them .']

sentences: [u'Enormous amount of semantic data is still being encoded in HTML documents .', u'Identifying and annotating the semantic concepts implicit in such documents makes them directly amenable for semantic Web processing .', u'In this paper we describe a highly automated technique for annotating HTML documents , especially template-based content-rich documents , containing many different semantic concepts per document .', u'Starting with a ( small ) seed of hand-labeled instances of semantic concepts in a set of HTML documents we bootstrap an annotation process that automatically identifies unlabeled concept instances present in other documents .', u'The bootstrapping technique exploits the observation that semantically related items in content-rich documents exhibit consistency in presentation style and spatial locality to learn a statistical model for accurately identifying different semantic concepts in HTML documents drawn from a variety of Web sources .', u'We also present experimental results on the effectiveness of the technique .']

sentences: [u'The hierarchy of task-computing and the decomposition strategy of complex task are analyzed according to the characteristics of task-computing in pervasive environment .', u'The architecture relies on the semantic representation of service and content , however , the semantic representation is based on shared ontology .', u'It can not only improve the accuracy and recall , but also realize the functions such as knowledge sharing , capability-based search , autonomous reasoning and semantic matchmaking .', u'Thus , a dynamic semantic Web-based context aware service selection mechanism is proposed to filter and rank the matching services according to their dynamic context in order to optimize the discovery process and save the time and effort of users .', u'In addition , the selection mechanism can be used to discover the useful static and dynamic context information to provide the most suitable and relative services for users .']

sentences: [u'Description Logics ( DLs ) are a family of logic based knowledge representation formalisms .', u'Although they have a range of applications ( e.g. , configuration and information integration ) , they are perhaps best known as the basis for widely used ontology languages such as OWL ( now a W3C recommendation ) .', u'This decision was motivated by a requirement that key inference problems be decidable , and that it should be possible to provide reasoning services to support ontology design and deployment .', u'Such reasoning services are typically provided by highly optimised implementations of tableaux decision procedures ; these have proved to be effective in applications in spite of the high worst case complexity of key inference problems .', u'The increasing use of DL based ontologies in areas such as e-Science and the Semantic Web is , however , already stretching the capabilities of existing DL systems , and brings with it a range of research challenges .']

sentences: [u'Commercial-off-the-shelf ( COTS ) Simulation Packages ( CSP ) are widely used in industry primarily due to economic factors associated with developing proprietary software platforms .', u'Regardless of their widespread use , CSPs have yet to operate across organizational boundaries .', u'The limited reuse of CSPs is affected by the same semantic issues that restrict the inter-organizational use of software components and Web services .', u'The current representations of Web components are predominantly syntactic in nature lacking the fundamental semantic underpinning required to support discovery on the emerging Semantic Web .', u'We present new research that partially alleviates the problem of limited semantic interoperability and reuse of simulation components in CSPs .', u'Semantic models , in the form of ontologies , utilized by Web service discovery and deployment architecture provide one approach to support simulation model reuse .', u'Although specific to CSPs this work has wider implications for the simulation community .']

entities: [[(u'Context-aware systems', u'Method')], [(u'context information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web ontologies', u'Method')], [(u'formal vocabulary', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'automatic knowledge manipulation', u'Task'), (u'reasoning processes', u'Method'), (u'formal features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic')], [(u'context information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'context-reasoning system', u'Method'), (u'CWE architecture', u'Method'), (u'context-awareness', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Semantic Web ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'context information')], [], [(u'automatic knowledge manipulation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reasoning processes')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Context-aware systems are intended for providing services adapted to the needs of people , by taking into account their state and the information related to their environment .', u'One alternative to represent this context information resides in the use of Semantic Web ontologies .', u'They provide a formal vocabulary which allows to easily express and share knowledge .', u'Additionally , several types of automatic knowledge manipulation and reasoning processes become available thanks to the formal features of such ontologies .', u"The inclusion of context information through ontologies in Collaborative Working Environments ( CWEs ) may bring important benefits to team work inside an organization , such as an automatic selection between different collaborative services according to the team members ' preferences and their current state .", u'This paper describes the design and implementation of a context-reasoning system which has been integrated into a CWE architecture to take advantage of context-awareness .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'one-to-one mappings', u'USED-FOR', u'document representation formalisms')], [], [(u'Ontolingua', u'USED-FOR', u'encoding formalisms')], []]
sentences: [u'The semantic Web entails the standardization of representation mechanisms so that the knowledge contained in a Web document can be retrieved and processed on a semantic level .', u'RDF seems to be the emerging encoding scheme for that purpose .', u'However , there are many different sorts of documents on theWeb that do not use RDF as their primary coding scheme .', u'It is expected that many one-to-one mappings between pairs of document representation formalisms will eventually arise .', u'This would create a situation where a young standard such as RDF would generate update problems for all these mappings as it evolves , which is inevitable .', u'Rather , we advocate the use of a common Ontolingua for all these encoding formalisms .', u'Though there may be many knowledge representation formalisms suited for that task , we advocate the use of the conceptual graph formalism .']

sentences: [u"Aiming at the characteristics of the design resource such as distributed , heterogeneous and service-oriented under cloud design environment and the requirement of small and medium manufacturing enterprises for external design resource and design capabilities , a semantic Web based cloud design service platform was designed which could realize design resource integration sharing and support small and medium enterprises ' resource integration and industrial cooperation.The hierarchical architecture and the operation mechanism of cloud platform were given.The construction methods of resource virtualization and cloud resource pool based on Web service and ontology was discussed.Resource dynamic capabilities and customer demand expression model oriented to product information model was built.Semantic reasoning based resource retrieval and matching algorithm was studied.Through Flex and Java , a cloud platform prototype system was developed.The feasibility and effectiveness of the proposed platform was verified by using UG software to design a landing gear cylinder ."]

sentences: [u'We define a new methodology , aesthetic computing , for customizing discrete structures found in mathematics , programming , and computer simulation .', u'The methodology is presented as a procedure , defined within the context of the semantic web , involving a successive chain of model transformations from a source model to a target model , with the source model being the discrete structure to represent and the target model being the geometric model .', u'We also present an implementation based on this methodology , and a class where empirical studies were performed to assess student perceptions on how customized model structures affected their understanding and preferences regarding visual and interactive model representations .', u'Students appear to prefer the methodology as a way to inject creativity into model building , and to allow them to explore alternative , analogical representations influenced by the fields of aesthetics and the arts .']

sentences: [u'An ontology provides a mechanism to formally represent a body of knowledge .', u'Ontologies are one of the key technologies supporting the Semantic Web and the desire to add meaning to the information available on the World Wide Web .', u'They provide the mechanism to describe a set of concepts , their properties and their relations to give a shared representation of knowledge .', u'The MALog project are developing an ontology to support the development of high-quality learning materials in the general area of mathematical logic .', u'This ontology of mathematical logic will form the basis of the semantic architecture allowing us to relate different learning objects and recommend appropriate learning paths .', u'This paper reviews the technologies used to construct the ontology , the use of the ontology to support learning object development and explores the potential future use of the ontology .']

sentences: [u'In the last decade , ontology matching and mapping research has shown a measurable progress .', u'This topic draws substantial attention within the research community , though it is not fully researched so far and new complex and effective solutions are needed .', u'Current works are limited in finding alignments or mappings between concepts of heterogeneous ontologies .', u'But , once ontology mappings are found , then how they ( or their class expressions ) are to be integrated automatically is left open for the ontology merging research .', u'This paper elaborates the mapping of class expressions of concepts and contributes an algorithm for their merging in an automatic ontology merging process without any human intervention .', u'However , the challenge of mapping axiomatic definitions is the most difficult task for merging concept definitions of the source ontologies , but it reveals significant increase in precision and recall values .', u'In addition , with the study of these algorithms , we conclude that ontology merging facilitates when one wants to get ontology with the better quality as the combined rich axioms are added in the merged ontology .', u'We also discuss the results of our first successful participation in the Conference , OA4QA and Anatomy track of OAEI 2015 .']

sentences: [u"Exposing library bibliographic data as linked data means publishing bibliographic data in form of linked data.People can locate the record though HTTP/URI by using URI as names for bibliographic records.What 's more , it provides linkable URI of correlation data so that people can find more objects.The paper firstly analyses the definition , core problem and significance of exposing library bibliographic data as linked data ; then discusses its present situation at home and abroad , and introduces the procedure , purpose and method of bibliographic linked data processing in the German National Library ; at last , puts forward the reference for Chinese library ."]

sentences: [u'Chapter 1 of Library Technology Reports ( vol .', u'52 , no .', u'1 ) Library Linked Data : Early Activity and Development .', u'The evolution of linked data ( LD ) in libraries , archives , and museums ( LAM ) has continued at great speed in the past few years .', u'While the large LD publishers who were in the field in 2013 remain active in new projects , use cases and issues are emerging to help shape the migration of metadata and the creation of new information systems .', u'Drawing from a 2014 OCLC survey , reports from large research libraries , and journal articles , this chapter reviews library linked data projects .']

sentences: [u'Dengan menciptakan bibliografi dalam bentuk linked data memungkinkan data yang diunggah menjadi useable dan setiap data bisa saling terkait dengan sumber data external atau mesin satu dengan lainnya guna memperkaya akses pengetahuan data pustaka .', u'Linked data merupakan sekumpulan langkah/metode untuk mempublikasikan sekaligus menghubungkan data terstruktur pada web dengan menggunakan beberapa aturan , RDF dan HTTP .', u'Beberapa keuntungan dapat dicapai dengan menerapkan Linked Data dalam pengembangan sistem informasi perpustakaan digital .', u'Oleh karena itu , model ini dapat digunakan sebagai alternatif oleh pepustakaan dalam hal interpobilitas , resource sharing antar perpustakaan dan memperkaya akses pengetahuan bibiliografi dengan memanfatkan ekseternal resource data set lain .']

sentences: [u'There is already a vast amount of Linked Data on the web .', u'What is missing is a convenient way of analyzing and visualizing the data that would benefit from the Linked Data principles .', u'In our previous work we introduced the Linked Data Visualization Model ( LDVM ) .', u'It is a formal base that exploits the principles to ensure interoperability and compatibility of compliant components .', u'In this paper we introduce a vocabulary for description of the components and an analytic and visualization pipeline composed of them .', u'We demonstrate its viability on an example from the Czech Linked Open Data cloud .']

sentences: [u'The availability of large collections of linked data that can be accessed through public services and search endpoints requires methods and techniques for reducing the data complexity and providing high-level views of data contents defined according to users specific needs .', u'To this end , a crucial step is the definition of data classification methods and techniques for the thematic aggregation of linked data .', u'In this paper , we propose matching and clustering techniques specifically conceived for linked data classification , by focusing on the high level of heterogeneity of data descriptions in terms of the number and kind of their descriptive features .']

sentences: [u'A method , system and computer program product for preventing sensitive pattern disclosures from Linked Data graphs .', u'The proposed method ( i ) receives as input a Linked Data graph and a set of query patterns that correspond to sensitive knowledge that needs to be concealed , and ( b ) minimally distorts the Linked Data graph to generate a sanitized counterpart ( graph ) in which only the non-sensitive patterns can be discovered .', u'The method supports a variety of utility functions , which it optimizes during the graph sanitization process .', u'The resulting , sanitized graph can be subsequently used for publishing and/or querying purposes .']

sentences: [u'Linked data has dominated the recent discourse in cataloging and metadata .', u'The daily work of the cataloger , however , remains mostly unchanged .', u'This tension is investigated , with a view to reconciling cataloging practice with a linked data future .', u'Aspects of linked data are outlined and a shift in focus in cataloging practice is recommended .', u'Authorities , controlled access points , vocabularies , differentiated values , and local data should be emphasized , and focus should shift from free text fields , keystrokes , punctuation , and aspects of local practice .', u'Through these recommendations , it is argued that catalogers can help prepare the way for the emerging information environment .']

sentences: [u'This paper introduces OpenCSDB , a linked data application in the scientific database of the Chinese Academy of Sciences ( CSDB ) project .', u'The background , applicability , implementation principles , software architecture , and application effects are discussed in detail .', u'Linked data meets the needs of scientific databases as a low-cost , inclusive , adaptive , open access mechanism .', u'Although there are new challenges , linked data can still be considered the best choice for scientific data .', u'As proved by the achievement of OpenCSDB in the Eleventh Five-Year program , OpenCSDB will promote the sharing of scientific data and play a greater role in the Twelfth Five-Year program .']

sentences: [u'Acquisition and representation of semantic concepts is a necessary requirement for the understanding of natural languages by cognitive systems .', u'Word games provide an interesting opportunity for semantic knowledge acquisition that may be used to construct semantic memory .', u'A task-dependent architecture of the knowledge base inspired by psycholinguistic theories of human cognition process is introduced .', u'The core of the system is an algorithm for semantic search using a simplified vector representation of concepts .', u'Based on this algorithm a 20 questions game has been implemented .', u'This implementation provides an example of an application of the semantic memory , but also allows for testing the linguistic competence of the system .', u'A web portal with Haptek-based talking head interface facilitates acquisition of a new knowledge while playing the game and engaging in dialogs with users .']

sentences: [u'With the increasing trend of reading Urdu e-novels , the retrieval of specific information regarding a particular novel is also important .', u'This paper presents a new semantic search engine for Urdu novels named Novel Mania .', u'The search engine is primarily composed of three layers namely ontology modeling , information retrieval and dynamic ontology updations .', u'The ontology modeling is primarily responsible to represent the knowledge area via domain ontology .', u'Then , a number of semantic queries retrieve the necessary information inside the ontology .', u'Further , the engine has the flexibility to dynamically incorporate the modifications in domain ontology .', u'By exploiting the engine user can extract the novel related parameters without going into the details and inefficient way .', u'Also , the engine provides a single platform to the publisher community in order to represent their work in a coherent manner .']

entities: [[(u'NeuroLOG middleware data management layer', u'Method'), (u'heterogeneous and distributed neuroimaging data', u'Material'), (u'federated approach', u'Method')], [(u'shared information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multi-layer application ontology', u'Method'), (u'Federated Schema', u'Method'), (u'heterogeneous database schemata', u'Method'), (u'legacy repositories', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'relational data', u'Material'), (u'semantic representation', u'Method'), (u'semantic search engine', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'distributed approach', u'Method'), (u'neurosciences data management', u'Task')], [(u'centralized approach', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'multi-centric neurosciences studies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'This paper describes the design of the NeuroLOG middleware data management layer , which provides a platform to share heterogeneous and distributed neuroimaging data using a federated approach .', u'The semantics of shared information is captured through a multi-layer application ontology and a derived Federated Schema used to align the heterogeneous database schemata from different legacy repositories .', u'The system also provides a facility to translate the relational data into a semantic representation that can be queried using a semantic search engine thus enabling the exploitation of knowledge embedded in the ontology .', u'This work shows the relevance of the distributed approach for neurosciences data management .', u'Although more complex than a centralized approach , it is also more realistic when considering the federation of large data sets , and open strong perspectives to implement multi-centric neurosciences studies .']

sentences: [u'In this poster , a Hungarian ethnographic database containing linguistic annotation is presented .', u'The corpus contains texts from three domains , namely , folk beliefs , t altos texts and tales .', u'All the possible morphosyntactic analyses assigned to each word and the appropriate one selected from them ( based on contextual information ) are also marked .', u'Syntactic ( dependency ) annotation is added semi-automatically to the corpus texts at a second phase of the processing .', u'With the help of these enriched linguistic attributes , the texts can be semantically analyzed and clustered .', u'The research and development team is working on a semantic search tool enabling to browse the texts on the basis of their semantic meaning .', u'The proposed technology may result in a new approach to the ethnographic research and may open a new type of access to the databases .']

sentences: [u'Traditional topic-specific search is difficult to meet the needs of a wide range of vertical intelligent search.Topic-specific search and semantic search technologies are applied to the data collection and intelligent inquiry process respectively.Specifically , this paper uses the domain data collection robot based on hierarchical classification model to gather the domain information.Besides , based on Chinese Encyclopedia Resource , a domain-ontology is built automatically , and is applied into semantic inference and query expansion of search engine , so a domain-oriented intelligent search engine is proposed in order to achieve professional and intelligent search.The results show that , the hierarchical classification for domain has a more high precision and recall rate , and this system has many advantages compared with other search engines , such as highly specialized domain , easy to transplant , more intelligent and so on .']

entities: [[(u'information retrieval ( IR ) approaches', u'Method'), (u'keyword query', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Ontology-based approaches', u'Method'), (u'query syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'keyword queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL conjunctive queries', u'Task'), (u'background knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics-based declarative query answering process', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'approach', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Current information retrieval ( IR ) approaches do not formally capture the explicit meaning of a keyword query but provide a comfortable way for the user to specify information needs on the basis of keywords .', u'Ontology-based approaches allow for sophisticated semantic search but impose a query syntax more difficult to handle .', u'In this paper , we present an approach for translating keyword queries to DL conjunctive queries using background knowledge available in ontologies .', u'We present an implementation which shows that this interpretation of keywords can then be used for both exploration of asserted knowledge and for a semantics-based declarative query answering process .', u'We also present an evaluation of our system and a discussion of the limitations of the approach with respect to our underlying assumptions which directly points to issues for future work .']

entities: [[(u'data dependency path calculator', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic search engine', u'Method')], [(u'semantically related data', u'Material'), (u'semantic data model', u'Method')], [(u'data elements', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'database', u'Generic')], [(u'data dependency paths', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'data permission', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'restricted data elements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pass-through data element', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'non-restricted data', u'Material')], [(u'restricted data', u'Material'), (u'data dependency paths', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'meaningful data', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'A data dependency path calculator for a semantic search engine is provided .', u'A body of semantically related data is modeled according to a semantic data model .', u'A user is presented a list of data elements from which they may select desired data elements .', u'The system automatically calculates all of the possible paths through the database that may be used to retrieve meaningful data based on the selected data elements .', u'The available data dependency paths are returned to the user for selection .', u'The system further provides a type of data permission that allows restricted data elements to be used as a pass-through data element for relating , connecting and retrieving non-restricted data .', u'Thus , a user can use restricted data to create data dependency paths to retrieve meaningful data .']

entities: [[(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'belief culture', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'intangible and tangible cultural heritage', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge domain', u'Material'), (u'cultural context', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'GMS', u'Method')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'semantic search application', u'Method')], [(u'evaluation processes', u'Generic')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'hierarchical structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'intermediate concept layers', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper , the development of an ontology that represents the knowledge of belief culture in the Greater Mekong subregion ( GMS ) is presented .', u'The ontology was carefully designed to specify the concepts relevant to intangible and tangible cultural heritage and the relations among them .', u'The knowledge domain in this work focuses on the cultural context and implicit attributes of the GMS as an initial case study .', u'To further illustrate the potential of the developed ontology , a semantic search application was implemented and then evaluated by experts .', u'On the evaluation processes , several complicated queries were designed in order to fully utilize the relations among ontological classes , and the results were returned accurately .', u'The evaluation proved that the ontology was well defined in aspects of its hierarchical structure and relations from intermediate concept layers .']

sentences: [u'This paper shows how an explicit representation of units and quantities can improve the experience of semantically published documents , and provides a first authoring method in this respect .', u'To exemplify the potential and practical advantages of encoding explicit semantics regarding units w.r.t .', u'user experience , we demonstrate a unit system preference service , which enables the user to choose the system of units for the displayed paper .', u'By semantically publishing units , we obtain a basis for a wide range of applications and services such as unknown unit lookup , unit and quantity semantic search and unit and quantity manipulation .', u'Enabling semantic publishing for units is also presented in the context of a large collection of legacy scientific documents ( the arXMliv corpus ) , where our approach allows to non-invasively enrich legacy publications .']

sentences: [u'We consider a knowledge management scenario in which members of an academic community collaboratively construct and share a common archive of news items .', u'Given this scenario , a number of knowledge management challenges arise : how to organize a speedy , low overhead publication process which can nevertheless yield high quality results ; how to provide semantic search and knowledge retrieval facilities in an effective and sustainable way ; how best to provide individualized presentations and news alerts .', u'To address these questions we have drawn on a number of technologies , including knowledge modelling , autonomous agents , software visualization , knowledge acquisition and distributed computing .', u'In the paper we describe the resulting Planet-Onto architecture , which provides an integrated set of tools to support news publishing , ontology-driven document formalization , story identification and personalized news feeds and alerts .']

sentences: [u'The semi-structured nature of Semantic Web data and its use of multiple vocabularies make it challenging to describe the structure of some RDF dataset .', u"When trying to understand the content behind some SPARQL endpoint , users usually need to write a number of SPARQL queries to `` mine '' the types contained in the dataset and their relations .", u'We argue that this is a tedious , error-prone and time consuming task to be carried out manually .', u'SPARQture , the tool described in this paper , automates this process and renders the structure of a particular RDF data available behind some SPARQL endpoint using a number of visually rich components .', u'Moreover , SPARQture supports user interaction to further explore the data .', u'We describe SPARQture and discuss its fit to the IESD Challenge .', u'The reader is encouraged to view the demo at : http : //sparqture.appspot.com']

sentences: [u'Many modern applications of description logics ( DLs , for short ) , such as biomedical ontologies and semantic web policies , provide fresh motivations for extending DLs with nonmonotonic inferencesa topic that has attracted a significant amount of attention along the years .', u'Despite this , nonmonotonic inferences are not yet supported by DL technology due to a number of issues related to expressiveness , computational complexity , and optimizations .', u'This paper contributes to the practical support of nonmonotonic inferences in description logics by introducing a new semantics expressly designed to address knowledge engineering needs .', u'This formalism has appealing expressiveness , enjoys nice computational properties , and constitutes an interesting solution to an ample class of application needs .', u'The formalism is validated through extensive comparison with the other nonmonotonic DLs , and systematic scalability tests .', u'The test case generator and its novel validation methodology constitute a further contribution of this paper .']

sentences: [u'Many methods had been developed to improve the accuracy of extracting information from a vast amount of data .', u'This paper combined a number of natural language processing methods such as NER ( named entity recognition ) , sentence extraction , and part of speech tagging to carry out text analysis .', u'The data source is comprised of texts obtained from the web using a domain-specific data extraction agent .', u'A framework for the extraction of inform ation from unstructured data was developed using the aforementioned natural language processing methods .', u'We simulated the performanceof our work in the extraction and analysis of texts for the detection of organizational structures .', u'Simulation shows that our study outperformed other NER classifiers such as MUC and CoNLL on information extraction .', u'keyword : Semantic Web ( ) , Social Network Analysis ( ) , Natural Language Processing ( ) , Machine Learning ( )']

entities: [[(u'Public procurement', u'Task'), (u'administra- tions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'data models', u'Method'), (u'management of public contracts', u'Task')], [(u'monitoring of public contracts', u'Task')], [(u'PPROC ontology', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'legal institution of public contracting', u'Task'), (u'procedure', u'Generic')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Spanish administrations', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'data models'), (u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'management of public contracts')], [], [(u'procedure', u'USED-FOR', u'preparation of contracts')], []]
sentences: [u'Public procurement is an activity that is common to all administra- tions , with a major impact on their functioning and that also affects the economy as a whole .', u'This paper presents an experience that shows how the Semantic Web provides appropriate resources to develop data models that can be used both for the management of public contracts and for the publication of information about them .', u'And within that , with a dual objective of improving efficiency by facili- tating competitive tendering , and of making easy the monitoring of public contracts by citizens .', u'Firstly , we developed the PPROC ontology in said experience , with the domain of the ontology being the legal institution of public contracting , which includes the procedure for the preparation of contracts .', u'Next , we used the ontology as a basis for the integration and publication of data from various Spanish administrations .']

entities: [[(u'soft- ware engineering', u'Task'), (u'software patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'structuring solutions', u'Method'), (u'software development problems', u'Task')], [(u'tools', u'Generic'), (u'auto- matic organisation', u'Task'), (u'explanation of software patterns', u'Task')], [(u'software devel- opment process', u'Task')], [(u'pattern representations', u'Method'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'automation', u'Task')], [(u'semantic web', u'Task'), (u'solutions', u'Generic'), (u'ontological representations', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'software patterns', u'USED-FOR', u'software development problems'), (u'structuring solutions', u'USED-FOR', u'software development problems')], [], [], [], [(u'ontological representations', u'USED-FOR', u'solutions')]]
sentences: [u'This paper 1 is based on and advocates the trend in soft- ware engineering of extending the use of software patterns as means of structuring solutions to software development problems ( be they moti- vated by best practice or by company interests and policies ) .', u'The paper argues that , on the one hand , this development requires tools for auto- matic organisation , retrieval and explanation of software patterns .', u'On the other hand , that the existence of such tools itself will facilitate the further development and employment of patterns in the software devel- opment process .', u'The paper analyses existing pattern representations and concludes that they are inadequate for the kind of automation intended here .', u'Adopting a standpoint similar to that taken in the semantic web , the paper proposes that feasible solutions can be built on the basis of ontological representations .']

entities: [[(u'Reasoning', u'Method'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'Web adaption', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'functionalities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reasoning capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Reasoning', u'Method'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'data processing', u'Task'), (u'data conversion', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web formats', u'Material')], [(u'XML', u'Material')], [(u'classical logic terms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [], [(u'Web', u'Material')], [], [(u'entailment', u'Generic'), (u'logic programming', u'Method'), (u'reasoning', u'Task'), (u'Web', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Web adaption', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'entailment', u'USED-FOR', u'logic programming'), (u'entailment', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning'), (u'logic programming', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning')]]
sentences: [u'Reasoning on the Web is receiving an increasing attention because of emerging fields such as Web adaption and Semantic Web .', u'Indeed , the advanced functionalities striven for in these fields call for reasoning capabilities .', u'Reasoning on the Web , however , is usually done using existing techniques rarely fitting the Web .', u'As a consequence , additional data processing like data conversion from Web formats ( e.g .', u'XML or HTML ) into some other formats ( e.g .', u'classical logic terms and formulas ) is often needed and aspects of the Web ( e.g .', u'its inherent inconsistency ) are neglected .', u'This article first gives requirements for an entailment tuned to reasoning on the Web .', u"Then , it describes how classical logic 's entailment can be modified so as to enforce these requirements .", u'Finally , it discusses how the proposed entailment can be used in applying logic programming to reasoning on the Web .']

entities: [[(u'RDF triples scalability issues', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'wide scale reasoning', u'Method')], [(u'global reasoning engines', u'Method'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'knowledge representation model', u'Method'), (u'triple space computing model', u'Method'), (u'Active Triple Spaces', u'Method')], [(u'active queries', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Active triples', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'subscription mechanisms', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'As the Semantic Web ( SW ) is being automatically populated with large number of RDF triples scalability issues related to wide scale reasoning occur .', u'We believe these difficulties are due to the use of global reasoning engines , which carry all the load of collecting and handling all relevant triples , and they can be alleviated by distributing the load of the reasoning amongst the meaningful entities represented by the triples themselves .', u'Therefore , as an application of a knowledge representation model based on Differences and on top of the triple space computing model , we introduce Active Triple Spaces , triple spaces managing triples acting as differences , i.e .', u'processes subscribing to active queries and presenting their result as a new triple .', u'Active triples allow the caching of the result of each new query , as well as its rapid update by subscription mechanisms .']

entities: [[(u'Web', u'Material'), (u'HTML pages', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge discovery', u'Task')], [(u'Web', u'Material'), (u'deep Web', u'Material'), (u'database records', u'Material'), (u'Web pages', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'data exchange formats', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'XML', u'Method'), (u'lingua franca', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web data exchange', u'Task'), (u'domain-specific markup languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'XML syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Web technology', u'Method'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'data mining', u'Task')], [(u'knowledge discovery', u'Task'), (u'Web', u'Material')]]
