sentences: [u'The Web is a steadily evolving resource comprising much more than mere HTML pages .', u'With its ever-growing data sources in a variety of formats , it provides great potential for knowledge discovery .', u'In this article , we shed light on some interesting phenomena of the Web : the deep Web , which surfaces database records as Web pages ; the Semantic Web , which defines meaningful data exchange formats ; XML , which has established itself as a lingua franca for Web data exchange ; and domain-specific markup languages , which are designed based on XML syntax with the goal of preserving semantics in targeted domains .', u'We detail these four developments in Web technology , and explain how they can be used for data mining .', u'Our goal is to show that all these areas can be as useful for knowledge discovery as the HTML-based part of the Web .']

sentences: [u'Scalability of reasoning systems is one of the main criteria which will determine the success of Semantic Web systems in the future The focus of recent work is either on ( a ) systems which rely on in-memory structures or ( b ) not so expressive ontology languages , which can be dealt with by using database technologies. # R # # N # # R # # N # In this paper we introduce a method to perform query answering for semi-expressive ontologies without the limit of in-memory structures Our main idea is to compute small and characteristic representations of the assertional part of the input ontology Query answering is then more efficiently performed over a reduced set of these small represenations We show that query answering can be distributed in a network of description logic reasoning systems to scale for reasoning Our initial results are encouraging .']

sentences: [u'Ontology represents explicit specification of knowledge in a specific domain of interest in the form of concepts and relations among them .', u'This paper represents a Human Family Tree Ontology that is designed in two main stages .', u"The first stage covers the domain of the human biological family tree that includes personal information of each person such as name , address , phone number , date of birth etc. , and each person 's health history which includes lifestyle habits , blood group , diseases that they have been or are suffering from .", u'The second stage includes SWRL ( Semantic Web Rule Language ) Rules that are helpful in expressing the rich semantic knowledge encoded in the ontology .', u'For this various rules are designed .', u'The ontology is developed using Ontology Web Language and Protege editing tool .', u'Several inputs are given for the testing of well execution of ontology .']

entities: [[(u'video processing algorithms', u'Method'), (u'distributed and collaborative vision-based applications', u'Task')], [(u'systems', u'Generic')], [(u'content analysis components upgrade', u'Method'), (u'system reuse', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'video analysis', u'Task')], [(u'data schema-independent data warehouse', u'Material'), (u'multiagent system', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web knowledge representation format', u'Method'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'schema transformation', u'Task'), (u'knowledge retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'storage system', u'Method'), (u'data warehouse', u'Material'), (u'knowledge management', u'Method'), (u'monitoring system', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Scientific advances in the development of video processing algorithms now allow various distributed and collaborative vision-based applications .', u'However , the lack of recognised standard in this area drives system developers to build specific systems , preventing from e.g .', u'content analysis components upgrade or system reuse in different environments .', u'As a result , the need for a generic , context-independent and adaptive system for storing and managing video analysis results comes out as conspicuous .', u'In order to address this issue , we propose a data schema-independent data warehouse backed by a multiagent system .', u'This system relies on the semantic web knowledge representation format , namely the RDF , to guarantee maximum adaptability and flexibility regarding schema transformation and knowledge retrieval .', u'The storage system itself , namely data warehouse , comes from the state-of-the-art technologies of knowledge management , providing efficient analysis and reporting capabilities within the monitoring system .']

sentences: [u'XML has become the standard platform for structured data exchange on the Web .', u'Next concern of semantic Web is the exchange of rules in markup language form .', u'The rules should be represented in such a way as to allow software agents to process and browse them for human comprehension .', u'For this purpose , we propose a language eXtensible Rule Markup Language ( XRML ) .', u'XRML is composed of rule identification , rule structure , and rule triggering markup languages .', u'In XRML , a critical concern is how to extract the structured rules implicitly embedded in the Web pages and keep consistency between the two .', u'By using the XRML , the Web based knowledge management systems ( KMS ) can be integrated with rule-based expert systems .', u'The advanced architecture with XRML can extend the application of KMS to automated form processing , preventive auditing , rule exchange and integration , and agent-based e-commerce .']

entities: [[(u'COMPASS location system', u'Method')], [(u'process', u'Generic'), (u'geo-coordinates', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'extension', u'Generic'), (u'COMPASS', u'Method'), (u'Translator', u'Method'), (u'city name', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'address', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'room number', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'application', u'Generic')], [(u'facts', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web RDF/XML language', u'Material'), (u'distributed Geo RDF Servers', u'Method')], [(u'location-based service discovery mechanism', u'Method'), (u'node', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'structured Peer-to-Peer system', u'Method'), (u'distributed hash table', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'In our previous work , we have described the COMPASS location system that uses multiple information sources to determine the current position of a node .', u'The raw output of this process is a location in geo-coordinates , which is not suitable for many applications .', u'In this paper we present an extension to COMPASS , the so called Translator , that can provide facts about the location like city name , address , room number , etc .', u'to the application .', u'These facts are represented in the Semantic Web RDF/XML language and stored on distributed Geo RDF Servers .', u'The main focus of this paper is a location-based service discovery mechanism which allows a node to find all services that can provide facts about its current location .', u'This discovery service is built upon a structured Peer-to-Peer system implementing a distributed hash table .']

sentences: [u'In spite of various current research and investigations the development of advenced information technology is not the key issue .', u'The different information technologies available now days but the major issue is how to got more advantages and utilization of these technologies for academic purpose in distributed environment where faculty and students communicate with software technology rather than with individual .', u'Knowledge Based Grid was introduced for publishing , managing , sharing and utilizing different amount of knowledge base resources on the semantic web in distributed environment .', u'The Knowledge discovery from heterogeneous information sources available on knowledge Grid environment is a major challenging research and development issue .', u'This paper mainly concerns all aspects of the knowledge discovery , sharing process and integrates grid data resource by ontology server for educational institutes and university in distributed environment to address these issues and challenge .']

entities: [[(u'Knowledge Representation questions', u'Material'), (u'rule languages', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'Description Logics', u'Method')], [(u'Logic Programming', u'Task')], [(u'first-order logic', u'Method'), (u'rule-based representation', u'Method'), (u'inductive definitions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'first-order logic', u'Method'), (u'Logic Programs', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'DL', u'Method'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'expressive FO ( ID )', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Knowledge Representation questions surrounding rule languages', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web'), (u'rule languages', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [(u'rule-based representation', u'USED-FOR', u'first-order logic'), (u'rule-based representation', u'USED-FOR', u'inductive definitions')], [(u'first-order logic', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Logic Programs')], []]
sentences: [u'There are many interesting Knowledge Representation questions surrounding rule languages for the Semantic Web .', u'The most basic one is of course : which kind of rules should be used and how do they integrate with existing Description Logics ?', u'Similar questions have already been addressed in the field of Logic Programming , where one particular answer has been provided by the language of FO ( ID ) .', u'FO ( ID ) is an extension of first-order logic with a rule-based representation for inductive definitions .', u'By offering a general integration of first-order logic and Logic Programs , it also induces a particular way of extending Description Logics with rules .', u'The goal of this paper is to investigate this integration and discover whether there are interesting extensions of DL with rules that can be arrived at by imposing appropriate restrictions on the highly expressive FO ( ID ) .']

sentences: [u'This paper presents an approach to ontology construction pursued through the induction of concept descriptions expressed in Description Logics .', u'The author surveys the theoretical foundations of the standard representations for formal ontologies in the Semantic Web .', u'After stating the learning problem in this peculiar context , a FOIL-like algorithm is presented that can be applied to learn DL concept descriptions .', u'The algorithm performs a search through a space of candidate concept definitions by means of refinement operators .', u'This process is guided by heuristics that are based on the available examples .', u'The author discusses related theoretical aspects of learning with the inherent incompleteness underlying the semantics of this representation .', u'The experimental evaluation of the system DL-Foil , which implements the learning algorithm , was carried out in two series of sessions on real ontologies from standard repositories for different domains expressed in diverse description logics .']

sentences: [u'The two volumes set LNCS 7653 and 7654 constitutes the refereed proceedings of the 4th International Conference on Computational Collective Intelligence , ICCCI , held in Ho Chi Minh City , Vietnam , in November 2012 .', u'The 113 revised full papers presented were carefully reviewed and selected from 397 submissions .', u'The papers are organized in topical sections on ( Part I ) knowledge integration ; data mining for collective processing ; fuzzy , modal , and collective systems ; nature inspired systems ; language processing systems ; social networks and semantic web ; agent and multi-agent systems ; classification and clustering methods ; modeling and optimization techniques for business intelligence ; ( Part II ) multi-dimensional data processing ; web systems ; intelligent decision making ; methods for scheduling ; collective intelligence in web systems web systems analysis ; advanced data mining techniques and applications ; cooperative problem solving ; computational swarm intelligence ; and semantic methods for knowledge discovery and communication']

entities: [[(u'expressive ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'ontology reasoning techniques', u'Method')], [(u'approximate reasoning solutions', u'Method'), (u'inctreased reasoning speed', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology reasoning tools', u'Method')], [(u'Screech approach', u'Method'), (u'approximate reasoning', u'Task'), (u'OWL ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'KAON2 algorithms', u'Method'), (u'OWL DL TBoxes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Datalog', u'Method'), (u'data complexity', u'Metric')], [(u'Screech approach', u'Method'), (u'reasoning process', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'expressive ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'approximate reasoning solutions', u'USED-FOR', u'application domains'), (u'approximate reasoning solutions', u'USED-FOR', u'inctreased reasoning speed')], [(u'Screech approach', u'USED-FOR', u'approximate reasoning')], []]
sentences: [u'With the increasing interest in expressive ontologies for the Semantic Web , it is critical to develop scalable and efficient ontology reasoning techniques that can properly cope with very high data volumes .', u'For certain application domains , approximate reasoning solutions , which trade soundness or completeness for inctreased reasoning speed , will help to deal with the high computational complexities which state of the art ontology reasoning tools have to face .', u'In this paper , we present a comprehensive overview of the Screech approach to approximate reasoning with OWL ontologies , which is based on the KAON2 algorithms , facilitating a compilation of OWL DL TBoxes into Datalog , which is tractable in terms of data complexity .', u'We present three different instantiations of the Screech approach , and report on experiments which show that the gain in efficiency outweighs the number of introduced mistakes in the reasoning process .']

entities: [[(u'controlled natural language', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'first-order logic', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ACE', u'Method'), (u'formal language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'first-order logic language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'English syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ACE', u'Method')], [(u'ACE', u'Method'), (u'software', u'Generic'), (u'application domains', u'Material'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'ACE', u'Method'), (u'Attempto Parsing Engine', u'Method'), (u'ACE texts', u'Material'), (u'Discourse Representation Structures', u'Method'), (u'first-order logic', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Attempto Reasoner RACE', u'Method'), (u'AceRules system', u'Method'), (u'ACE View plug-in', u'Method'), (u'Protege ontology editor', u'Material'), (u'AceWiki', u'Material'), (u'OWL verbaliser', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'English syntax', u'FEATURE-OF', u'first-order logic language')], [], [], [], [(u'Attempto Reasoner RACE', u'CONJUNCTION', u'AceRules system'), (u'Attempto Reasoner RACE', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ACE View plug-in'), (u'Protege ontology editor', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ACE View plug-in'), (u'AceWiki', u'CONJUNCTION', u'AceWiki'), (u'AceWiki', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL verbaliser')]]
sentences: [u'Attempto Controlled English ( ACE ) is a controlled natural language , i.e .', u'a precisely defined subset of English that can automatically and unambiguously be translated into first-order logic .', u'ACE may seem to be completely natural , but is actually a formal language , concretely it is a first-order logic language with an English syntax .', u'Thus ACE is human and machine understandable .', u'ACE was originally intended to specify software , but has since been used as a general knowledge representation language in several application domains , most recently for the semantic web .', u'ACE is supported by a number of tools , predominantly by the Attempto Parsing Engine ( APE ) that translates ACE texts into Discourse Representation Structures ( DRS ) , a variant of first-order logic .', u'Other tools include the Attempto Reasoner RACE , the AceRules system , the ACE View plug-in for the Protege ontology editor , AceWiki , and the OWL verbaliser .']

relations: [[], [(u'predicted behavioural pattern', u'USED-FOR', u'personalized recommendation system'), (u'behavioural pattern', u'USED-FOR', u'personalized recommendation system'), (u'weblog', u'USED-FOR', u'personalized recommendation system'), (u'personalized recommendation system', u'USED-FOR', u'website engineers')], [(u'search space.Ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'web usage mining')], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'domain of interest'), (u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'machine understandable data')], [(u'methodologies', u'USED-FOR', u'domain ontologies'), (u'methodologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic enhanced web usage mining techniques')], [(u'Enhanced Recommendation Model', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web Usage Mining')]]
sentences: [u'Ms.R.RoobaM.Sc ( CT ) . , M.Phil. , Dr.V.VallimayilPh.D Abstract : Web Usage Mining is the process of extracting useful knowledge such as browsing pattern from weblog .', u'The predicted behavioural pattern from the weblog is used to construct personalized recommendation system for website engineers .', u'Integration of semantic information into web usage miningphases will support intelligent process in the web so as to prune the search space.Ontology plays a pivotal role in integrating semantic information into web usage mining .', u'The deployment of ontology captures the domain of interest which deals machine understandable data on the current human-readable web .', u'This paper discusses various methodologies to create domain ontologies and semantic enhanced web usage mining techniques which add semantic information into weblog data .', u'The paper also discusses the framework of Enhanced Recommendation Model for Semantic Web Usage Mining which includes semantic metadata of web pages .']

entities: [[(u'web page result personalization', u'Task')], [(u'URL mode', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic web search', u'Task')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'BookShelf Data Structure', u'Method'), (u'clusters', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'one', u'Generic')], [(u'Vector space', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'similarity propagation', u'Method')], [(u'Cosine similarity measure', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'BookShelf Data Structure', u'USED-FOR', u'method')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'In the current scenario , web page result personalization is playing a vital role .', u'Nearly 80 % of the users expect the best results in the first page itself without having any persistence to browse longer in URL mode .', u'This research work focuses on two main themes : Semantic web search through online and Domain based search through offline .', u'The first part is to find an effective method which allows grouping similar results together using BookShelf Data Structure and organizing the various clusters .', u'The second one is focused on the academic domain based search through offline .', u'This paper focuses on finding documents which are similar and how Vector space can be used to solve it .', u'So more weightage is given for the principles and working methodology of similarity propagation .', u'Cosine similarity measure is used for finding the relevancy among the documents .']

entities: [[(u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'context-awareness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'modeling social / human affairs', u'Task')], [(u'personal preferences', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'incomplete information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'managing uncertainty of sensor data', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic-Web-style reasoning', u'Method'), (u'context-based Web', u'Task')], [(u'context representation', u'Method'), (u'sensor-enabled Web services', u'Task')], [(u'representation', u'Generic'), (u'syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Business Rules', u'Method'), (u'annotations', u'Generic'), (u'prioritized modality', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'context/ambient-aware applications', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'context representation', u'USED-FOR', u'sensor-enabled Web services')], [(u'syntax', u'USED-FOR', u'representation')], []]
sentences: [u'Bringing sensor- and context-awareness to the Web promises to open new , tremendous business opportunities .', u'However , context-awareness involves difficult problems such as modeling social / human affairs ( e.g .', u'law , personal preferences , etc .', u') , handling incomplete information , and managing uncertainty of sensor data .', u'We argue that fully-fledged , Semantic-Web-style reasoning in presence of uncertainty is neither always feasible , nor always necessary for a context-based Web .', u'As an alternative , this paper proposes a highly expressive , simple , and efficient context representation for sensor-enabled Web services .', u'Our representation is based on a syntax inspired by standard Semantics of Business Vocabulary and Business Rules ( SBVR ) , enriched by annotations expressing prioritized modality and trust values .', u'The feasibility of our approach is demonstrated via a case study for developing context/ambient-aware applications that adapt to changes in the environment .']

entities: [[(u'information sharing', u'Task'), (u'distributed computing', u'Method'), (u'P2P systems', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web vision', u'Task'), (u'Peer Data Management Systems', u'Method')], [(u'PDMS scenario', u'Task'), (u'query routing', u'Task')], [(u'semantically relevant peers', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SRI-based query execution models', u'Method'), (u'network', u'Generic')], [(u'models', u'Generic'), (u'SRI-enabled routing policies', u'Method'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'ad-hoc PDMS simulation environments', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'distributed computing', u'USED-FOR', u'information sharing'), (u'P2P systems', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'distributed computing'), (u'Peer Data Management Systems', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web vision')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'In recent years , information sharing has gained much benefit by the large diffusion of distributed computing , namely through P2P systems and , in line with the Semantic Web vision , through Peer Data Management Systems ( PDMSs ) .', u'In a PDMS scenario one of the most difficult challenges is query routing , i.e .', u'the capability of selecting small subsets of semantically relevant peers to forward a query to. # R # # N # # R # # N # In this paper , we put the Semantic Routing Index ( SRI ) distributed mechanism we proposed in [ 6 ] at work .', u'In particular , we present general SRI-based query execution models , designed around different performance priorities and minimizing the information spanning over the network .', u'Starting from these models , we devise several SRI-enabled routing policies , characterized by different effectiveness and efficiency targets , and we deeply test them in ad-hoc PDMS simulation environments .']

entities: [[(u'personal interests', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'concept label', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user defined relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'information structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Method')], [(u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'automatic tools', u'Method')], [(u'Miology', u'Method'), (u'Web-based application', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'domain ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'information structure')], [], [], [], [(u'Miology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Web-based application')]]
sentences: [u'One common way for users to organize personal interests is to categorize information by topics .', u'Each area of interest could be represented either by a simple concept label or by more complex information structures that include concepts linked to each other by user defined relationships .', u'We believe that this type of information structure could be easily represented by domain ontologies .', u'The increasing interest in the Semantic Web has been producing a growing number of publicly available ontologies .', u'This is a rich source of information that could be very helpful during the process of engineering other domain ontologies .', u'Still , we need automatic tools that help non-expert users build and maintain their own ontologies .', u'To make this process more accessible , we introduce Miology , a Web-based application that helps users automatically select and adapt existing ontologies to represent their personal interests .']

entities: [[], [(u'Deci- sion support', u'Method'), (u'clinical information system', u'Task'), (u'chronic care', u'Task')], [(u'healthcare knowledge management', u'Task')], [(u'Ontology-based knowledge acquisition', u'Task'), (u'knowledge engineering approach', u'Method'), (u'clinical practice guidelines', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Web framework', u'Method'), (u'knowledge management platform', u'Method'), (u'patient databases', u'Material'), (u'supported publications', u'Material')], [(u'healthcare knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'healthcare provider environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'aug- menting decision making', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Improving quality of healthcare for people with chronic conditions requires informed and knowledgeable healthcare providers and patients .', u'Deci- sion support and clinical information system are two of the main components to support improving chronic care .', u'In this paper , we describe an ongoing initiative that emphasizes the need for healthcare knowledge management to support both components .', u'Ontology-based knowledge acquisition and modeling based on knowledge engineering approach provides an effective mechanism in capturing expert opinion in form of clinical practice guidelines .', u'The Semantic Web framework is adopted in building a knowledge management platform that al- lows integration between the knowledge with patient databases and supported publications .', u'We discuss one of the challenges , which is to apply the healthcare knowledge into existing healthcare provider environments by focusing on aug- menting decision making and improving quality of patient care services .']

entities: [[(u'software systems', u'Method')], [(u'software development process', u'Method')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'reuse', u'Task')], [(u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'structures', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge management system', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge domain', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'Semantic Reuse System', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge representation languages', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'software development knowledge reuse', u'Task')], [(u'reasoning mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'reuse', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'knowledge representation languages', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], [(u'reasoning mechanisms', u'USED-FOR', u'reuse')]]
sentences: [u'As software systems become bigger and more complex , software developers need to cope with a growing amount of information and knowledge .', u'The knowledge generated during the software development process can be a valuable asset for a software company .', u'But in order to take advantage of this knowledge , the company must store and manage it for reuse .', u'Ontologies are a powerful mechanism for representing knowledge and encoding its meaning .', u'These structures can be used to model and represent the knowledge , stored in a knowledge management system and classify it according to the knowledge domain that the system supports .', u'This paper describes the Semantic Reuse System ( SRS ) , which takes advantage of ontologies , represented using the knowledge representation languages of the Semantic Web , for software development knowledge reuse .', u'We describe how this knowledge is stored and the reasoning mechanisms that support the reuse .']

entities: [[(u'semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'represen- tation mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'Web document', u'Material'), (u'semantic level', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RDF', u'Method')], [(u'Web', u'Material'), (u'RDF', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pri- mary coding scheme', u'Method')], [(u'document representation formalisms', u'Method')], [(u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Ontolingua', u'Method'), (u'encoding formalisms', u'Method')], [(u'knowledge rep- resentation formalisms', u'Method'), (u'conceptual graph formalism', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'RDF', u'USED-FOR', u'pri- mary coding scheme')], [], [], [(u'Ontolingua', u'USED-FOR', u'encoding formalisms')], []]
sentences: [u'The semantic Web entails the standardization of represen- tation mechanisms so that the knowledge contained in a Web document can be retrieved and processed on a semantic level .', u'RDF seems to be the emerging encoding scheme for that purpose .', u'However , there are many dierent sorts of documents on the Web that do not use RDF as their pri- mary coding scheme .', u'It is expected that many one-to-one mappings be- tween pairs of document representation formalisms will eventually arise .', u'This would create a situation where a young standard such as RDF would generate update problems for all these mappings as it evolves , which is inevitable .', u'Rather , we advocate the use of a common Ontolingua for all these encoding formalisms .', u'Though there may be many knowledge rep- resentation formalisms suited for that task , we advocate the use of the conceptual graph formalism .']

entities: [[(u'mechanism of meteorological disaster', u'Task'), (u'meteorological disaster system', u'Method'), (u'semantic relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'pre-assessment of influences of disastrous weather/climate events', u'Task'), (u'level of emergency management', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'occurrence regulations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'meteorological disasters', u'Task'), (u'meta-action', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Ontology modelling method', u'Method'), (u'meteorological disaster system', u'Method'), (u'semantic web rule language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'implicit relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology model', u'Method')], [(u'risk assessment of disastrous weather/climat', u'Task')]]
sentences: [u'Purpose The purpose of this paper is to make research on causing mechanism of meteorological disaster as well as the components of meteorological disaster system and their semantic relationships .', u'It has important practical significance due to the urgent need of further providing support for pre-assessment of influences of disastrous weather/climate events and promoting the level of emergency management .', u'Design/methodology/approach This paper analyses the occurrence regulations and components of meteorological disasters and proposes the concept of meta-action .', u'Ontology modelling method is adopted to describe the components and relationships among different parts comprising meteorological disaster system , and semantic web rule language is selected to identify the implicit relationships among the domain knowledge explicitly defined in ontology model .', u'Besides , a case is studied to elaborate how to provide logic and semantic information support for comprehensive risk assessment of disastrous weather/climat ...']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'information sources', u'Material'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic integration', u'Method'), (u'global ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'global ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'local ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'mapping', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'query processing', u'Task'), (u'ontology integration systems', u'Method'), (u'view-based query answering', u'Task'), (u'data integration', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web')], [(u'information sources', u'USED-FOR', u'web')], [(u'global ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'local ontologies')], [], [(u'query processing', u'USED-FOR', u'view-based query answering'), (u'query processing', u'USED-FOR', u'data integration')]]
sentences: [u'One of the basic problems in the development of techniques for the semantic web is the integration of ontologies .', u'Indeed , the web is constituted by a variety of information sources , each expressed over a certain ontology , and in order to extract information from such sources , their semantic integration and reconciliation in terms of a global ontology is required .', u'In this paper , we address the fundamental problem of how to specify the mapping between the global ontology and the local ontologies .', u'We argue that for capturing such mapping in an appropriate way , the notion of query is a crucial one , since it is very likely that a concept in one ontology corresponds to a view ( i.e. , a query ) over the other ontologies .', u'As a result query processing in ontology integration systems is strongly related to view-based query answering in data integration .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'ontology evolution', u'Task'), (u'automatic generation of concepts', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'Method'), (u'web services', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'WSDL descriptions', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'machine learning', u'Task'), (u'web service descriptor', u'Method'), (u'free text descriptors', u'Material')], [(u'WSDL descriptor', u'Method'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'inverse document frequency', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'TF/IDF )', u'Method'), (u'web context generation methods', u'Method')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'ontology hierarchy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'TreeGenerator function', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'WSDL descriptions', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], [(u'information retrieval', u'CONJUNCTION', u'machine learning'), (u'information retrieval', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web service'), (u'components', u'PART-OF', u'web service'), (u'web service descriptor', u'CONJUNCTION', u'machine learning'), (u'web service descriptor', u'CONJUNCTION', u'free text descriptors')], [(u'inverse document frequency', u'USED-FOR', u'WSDL descriptor'), (u'inverse document frequency', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web context generation methods'), (u'TF/IDF )', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web context generation methods')], [(u'It', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology hierarchy'), (u'TreeGenerator function', u'USED-FOR', u'It'), (u'TreeGenerator function', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology hierarchy')]]
sentences: [u'Ontologies have become the effective modeling for various applications and significantly in the semantic web .', u'One of the latest methods for construction of Ontology is ontology evolution which focuses on automatic generation of concepts and their relations in a given area .', u'The difficulty with numerous , largely dissimilar concepts must be handled by the construction of ontology which depends on the collection of already defined textual sources like web services .', u'In this paper we propose a new approach that bootstraps domain ontologies from WSDL descriptions .', u'The approach uses the technique of information retrieval and machine learning The web service consists of two components the web service descriptor and the free text descriptors .', u'The WSDL descriptor is evaluated using two methods basically term frequency and inverse document frequency ( TF/IDF ) and web context generation methods .', u'It also develops the ontology hierarchy by using TreeGenerator function .']

entities: [[(u'Web Information Systems', u'Task'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'heterogeneous sources', u'Material')], [(u'Hera methodology', u'Method'), (u'WIS', u'Method')], [(u'Hera methodology', u'Method'), (u'hypermedia presentation adaptation', u'Method'), (u'profile storing device capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user preferences', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'adaptivity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user model', u'Method'), (u'user browsing history', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'adaptability', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'adaptivity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'models', u'Generic'), (u'Hera', u'Method'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'flexible Web metadata language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Web Information Systems ( WIS ) present up-to-date information on the Web based on data coming from heterogeneous sources .', u'In previous work the Hera methodology was developed to support the design of a WIS .', u'In this paper we target the design of an intelligent WIS. For this reason the Hera methodology is extended with two kinds of hypermedia presentation adaptation : adaptability based on a profile storing device capabilities and user preferences , and adaptivity based on a user model storing the user browsing history .', u'While adaptability is considered to be static , i.e .', u'the presentation is fixed before the browsing starts , adaptivity is dynamic , i.e .', u'the presentation changes while the user is browsing it .', u'The models used in Hera and their adaptation aspects are specified in RDF ( S ) , a flexible Web metadata language designed to support the Semantic Web .']

sentences: [u'Purpose The purpose of this paper is to develop and implement a faceted classification structure to improve web information organization , access and navigability.Design/methodology/approach Some case studies of commercial web sites using faceted metadata were analyzed to develop the classification approach .', u'The proposed framework adapts the facet analysis theory from Faceted Classification System ( FCS ) to use semantic web tools especially XML and RDF store , and ontology , and is designed to be integrated within a Content Management System ( CMS ) .', u'A detailed example of a faceted classification system for an academic information system is used to demonstrate the construction of an FCS from metadata.Findings Detailed examples show how classifying and organizing information in multidimensional hierarchies is more accessible than simple onedimensional taxonomic hierarchies.Research limitations/implications A prototype , based on the proposed framework , is being developed using the web site of an academic ...']

entities: [[(u'visual semantic web', u'Method'), (u'virtual expeditions', u'Task'), (u'cultural heritage preservation', u'Task')], [(u'interactive platform', u'Method'), (u'virtual expedition ( VE ) methodology', u'Method')], [(u'VE methodology', u'Method'), (u'flash mockup', u'Method')], [(u'gender equity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'positive views', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'VE platform', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'visual semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'virtual expeditions')], [(u'virtual expedition ( VE ) methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'interactive platform')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The current paper demonstrates application of visual semantic web for designing virtual expeditions in the framework of cultural heritage preservation .', u"The objective of our project was twofold : 1 ) to design an interactive platform based on the virtual expedition ( VE ) methodology , and ; 2 ) to assess its usability and impact on users ' critical thinking and open-mindedness .", u'Based on the VE methodology , a flash mockup on the life story of two women scientists and their cultural heritage was developed and tested among 107 university students .', u"Findings indicated increase in students ' disposition towards open-mindedness , especially related to gender equity .", u"Findings also indicated positive views related to operative , cognitive , and affective aspects of the platform 's usability .", u'Students were highly motivated to explore the VE platform and were inclined to discuss issues related to the preservation of their own cultural heritage .']

sentences: [u'Large information spaces and complex functionality of contemporary systems together with the advent of the Semantic Web are big challenges for the design of simple yet powerful user interfaces .', u'The complex nature of systems thus requires the use of several presentation , personalization and user modeling methods and techniques to address the growing needs and requirements of both users and systems .', u'We present a design of an architecture for the personalized presentation layer of a web-based information system that employs a set of interconnected software components implemented as autonomous software tools for presentation , personalization and user modeling to support features such as navigation support and different views on the presented data , acquisition and evaluation of user characteristics and user adaptation and personalization .', u'The feasibility of our design is evaluated by its realization in the labor market application domain .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'Wikipedia', u'Material')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'English Wikipedia', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge bases', u'Material')], [(u'socio-cultural knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'Wikipedia versions', u'Material')], [(u'heuristics', u'Method'), (u'extraction of large sets of hyponymy relations', u'Task'), (u'Wikipedia versions', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Wikipedia versions', u'Material'), (u'GermaNet', u'Material'), (u'German', u'Material'), (u'WordNet', u'Material'), (u'English', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'In the last years , the vision of the Semantic Web has led to many approaches that aim to automatically derive knowledge bases from Wikipedia .', u'These approaches rely mostly on the English Wikipedia as it is the largest Wikipedia version and have lead to valuable knowledge bases .', u'However , each Wikipedia version contains socio-cultural knowledge , i.e .', u'knowledge with specific relevance for a culture or language .', u'One difficulty of the application of existing approaches to multiple Wikipedia versions is the use of additional corpora .', u'In this paper , we describe the adaptation of existing heuristics that make the extraction of large sets of hyponymy relations from multiple Wikipedia versions with little information about each language possible .', u'Further , we evaluate our approach with Wikipedia versions in four different languages and compare results with GermaNet for German and WordNet for English .']

entities: [[(u'Reasoning', u'Method'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'Web adaption', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'functionalities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reasoning capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Reasoning', u'Method'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'data processing', u'Task'), (u'data conversion', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web formats', u'Material')], [(u'XML', u'Material')], [(u'classical logic terms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [], [(u'Web', u'Material')], [], [(u'entailment', u'Generic'), (u'logic programming', u'Method'), (u'reasoning', u'Task'), (u'Web', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'Reasoning on the Web is receiving an increasing attention because of emerging fields such as Web adaption and Semantic Web .', u'Indeed , the advanced functionalities striven for in these fields call for reasoning capabilities .', u'Reasoning on the Web , however , is usually done using existing techniques rarely fitting the Web .', u'As a consequence , additional data processing like data conversion from Web formats ( e.g .', u'XML or HTML ) into some other formats ( e.g .', u'classical logic terms and formulas ) is often needed and aspects of the Web ( e.g .', u'its inherent inconsistency ) are neglected .', u'This article first gives requirements for an entailment tuned to reasoning on the Web .', u"Then , it describes how classical logic 's entailment can be modified so as to enforce these requirements .", u'Finally , it discusses how the proposed entailment can be used in applying logic programming to reasoning on the Web .']

entities: [[(u'Web Science', u'Material')], [(u'Web Science cycle', u'Method'), (u'Computer Science', u'Task'), (u'HCI', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic Web / Web 2.0 applications', u'Task'), (u'Web Science', u'Task'), (u'Web technologies', u'Method')], []]
relations: [[], [(u'Sociology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Computer Science'), (u'Sociology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'HCI'), (u'Computer Science', u'CONJUNCTION', u'HCI')], [], []]
sentences: [u"The question `` What is Web Science '' is still frequently asked - even by authors of papers about Web Science .", u"In this position paper we consider what part of the Web Science cycle makes this cycle emblematically `` Web Science '' rather than another form of either Law and Technology or Sociology and Technology or Computer Science and HCI .", u'Based on our research developing and evaluating Semantic Web / Web 2.0 applications , and observations of current practice , we suggest that the particularity of Web Science is strongly correlated to a focus on human repurposing of particular Web technologies to support ever more rapid types of increased social contact .', u'Based on this analysis , we ask how Web Science may help understand and shape this phenomenon , and what the implications may be for embracing this focus as a necessary criteria for assessing Web Science relevance of research work .']

entities: [[(u'versioning services', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web ( SW ) repositories', u'Method')], [(u'storage index', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'partial orders )', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'POI', u'Method'), (u'RDF Knowledge Bases', u'Material'), (u'KB', u'Material'), (u'serialization', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'POI', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'storage space', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'efficiency', u'Metric'), (u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'change-based approach', u'Method')], [(u'synthetic data sets', u'Material')], [(u'POI', u'Method'), (u'space saving', u'Task'), (u'cross version operations', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'version insertion algorithm', u'Method'), (u'KBs', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'POI', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'storage index')], [], [(u'approach', u'COMPARE', u'approaches')], [], [(u'POI', u'USED-FOR', u'space saving')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper concerns versioning services over Semantic Web ( SW ) repositories .', u'We propose a novel storage index ( based on partial orders ) , called POI , that exploits the fact that RDF Knowledge Bases ( KB ) have not a unique serialization ( as it happens with texts ) .', u'POI can be used for storing several ( version-related or not ) SW KBs .', u'We discuss the benefits and drawbacks of this approach in terms of storage space and efficiency both analytically and experimentally in comparison with the existing approaches ( including the change-based approach ) .', u'For the latter case we report experimental results over synthetic data sets .', u'POI offers notable space saving as well as efficiency in various cross version operations .', u'It is equipped with an efficient version insertion algorithm and could be also exploited in cases where the set of KBs does not fit in main memory .']

entities: [[(u'speed', u'Metric'), (u'manageability', u'Metric'), (u'schema-less databases', u'Material'), (u'horizontal scalability', u'Metric'), (u'MySql', u'Method'), (u'Oracle', u'Method'), (u'generation databases', u'Method'), (u'NoSQL', u'Method')], [(u'web-scale databases', u'Material'), (u'social network analysis', u'Task'), (u'bioinformatics network analysis', u'Task'), (u'semantic Web analysis', u'Task')], [], [(u'NoSQL databases', u'Material'), (u'database', u'Generic'), (u'Oracle', u'Method'), (u'information management system', u'Method'), (u'database system', u'Method'), (u'MongoDB', u'Material'), (u'Redis', u'Method'), (u'schema', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Abstract : Demand for speed , manageability , distributed , open-source , agile development with schema-less databases , easier horizontal scalability leads to fixing of broken parts in MySql or Oracle by introducing next generation databases also termed as NoSQL .', u'These are modern web-scale databases which are introduced to handle emerging applications such as social network analysis , bioinformatics network analysis and semantic Web analysis where a wide variety of data is to be processed which needs continuous witness with a quick increase .', u'A critical challenge these days is to have an effective management and analysis of data at a large-scale .', u'This paper makes an effort to use a combination of NoSQL databases to replace traditional database like Oracle applied to information management system , comparing the traditional database system with combination of MongoDB and Redis and presents the performance comparison of these two schema .']

entities: [[(u'Quoting', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'online conversations', u'Material'), (u'email discussions', u'Material'), (u'bulletin boards', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'Semantic Web models', u'Method'), (u'SIOC', u'Method'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'SIOC', u'Method'), (u'automated quotes extraction', u'Task'), (u'email archives', u'Material')], [(u'formal representation', u'Method'), (u'querying email archives', u'Task'), (u'finer-grained queries', u'Material'), (u'mining social networks', u'Task'), (u'argumentative structure of email conversations', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'email discussions', u'CONJUNCTION', u'bulletin boards')], [], [(u'SIOC', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web models')], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'automated quotes extraction')], [(u'formal representation', u'USED-FOR', u'querying email archives'), (u'formal representation', u'USED-FOR', u'email archives'), (u'formal representation', u'USED-FOR', u'mining social networks'), (u'querying email archives', u'CONJUNCTION', u'mining social networks'), (u'argumentative structure of email conversations', u'USED-FOR', u'mining social networks')]]
sentences: [u'Quoting is a common practice in online conversations , notably in email discussions and bulletin boards .', u'Despite many applications that offer special functionalities to handle them , there is no agreement on how to semantically represent these quotes , so that they could be queried and analysed uniformly whatever the original application is .', u'While various Semantic Web models , notably SIOC , have become popular for interlinking , exporting and exchanging information about online communities and their conversations , they do not provide means to model such quotes .', u'In this paper , we present ( i ) an OWL2 extension of SIOC for representing quotes and ( ii ) a framework for automated quotes extraction from email archives .', u'In addition , we demonstrate the utility of such formal representation for querying email archives with finer-grained queries and for mining social networks based on the argumentative structure of email conversations .']

entities: [[(u'PALLAS', u'Method'), (u'PALm Logic-based Algebraic Search', u'Method'), (u'prototype architecture', u'Method'), (u'search interface', u'Task')], [(u'PALLAS', u'Method'), (u'UbAgent', u'Method'), (u'middleware infrastructure', u'Method'), (u'back-end processing of Pervasive Computing', u'Task'), (u'distributed databases', u'Material'), (u'computation processing', u'Task'), (u'location specific services', u'Task')], [(u"PALLAS ' design", u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'PALLAS', u'Method'), (u'PALM OS', u'Method')], [(u'UbAgent infrastructure', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'PALLAS', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'prototype architecture'), (u'PALLAS', u'USED-FOR', u'search interface')], [(u'PALLAS', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'middleware infrastructure'), (u'UbAgent', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'middleware infrastructure'), (u'distributed databases', u'CONJUNCTION', u'computation processing'), (u'computation processing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'location specific services')], [], [(u'PALLAS', u'USED-FOR', u'PALM OS')], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper we describe PALLAS ( PALm Logic-based Algebraic Search ) , a prototype architecture , design and implementation for a search interface on a portable digital assistant .', u'PALLAS is part of the UbAgent , a middleware infrastructure that provides an efficient way of handling the back-end processing of Pervasive Computing : accessing information from distributed databases , computation processing , and location specific services .', u"The goal of the PALLAS ' design is to offer the flexibility of advanced searches by exploiting the metadata and inferencing capabilities of the semantic web , whilst maintaining ease-of-use to a level such that it would be accessible to an end-user without expansive technical knowledge , much like the typical users of the world-wide web today .", u'A prototype of PALLAS have been developed and tested for the PALM OS .', u'The pervasive computing test bed used was the UbAgent infrastructure .']

sentences: [u'The next phase envisioned for the World Wide Web is automated ad-hoc interaction between intelligent agents , web services , databases and semantic web enabled applications .', u'Although at present this appears to be a distant objective , there are practical steps that can be taken to advance the vision .', u'We propose an extension to classical conceptual models to allow the definition of application components in terms of public standards and explicit semantics , thus building into web-based applications , the foundation for shared understanding and interoperability .', u'The use of external definitions and the need to store outsourced type information internally , brings to light the issue of object identity in a global environment , where object instances may be identified by multiple externally controlled identification schemes .', u'We illustrate how traditional conceptual models may be augmented to recognise and deal with multiple identities .']

sentences: [u'Social network analysis ( SNA ) has become one of the main themes in the Semantic Web agenda .', u'The use of web is steadily gaining ground in the study of social networks .', u'Few researchers have shown the possibility of extracting social network from the Web via search engine .', u'However to get a rich and trusted social network from such an approach proved to be difficult .', u'In this paper we proposed an Information Retrieval ( IR ) driven method for dealing with the heterogeneity of features in the Web .', u'We demontrate the possibility of exploiting features in Web snippets returned by search engines for disambiguating entities and building relations among entities during the process of extracting social networks .', u'Our approach has shown the capacity to extract underlying strength relations which are beyond recognition using the standard co-occurrence analysis employed by many research .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic coordination', u'Task'), (u'heterogeneous schemas', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'semantic mappings', u'Method'), (u'hierarchical classifications', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic coordination', u'Task'), (u'computing linguistic or structural similarities', u'Task'), (u'deducing relations', u'Task'), (u'logical formulae', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'schemas', u'Generic'), (u'hierarchical classifications', u'Task'), (u'hierarchical classifications', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web directories', u'Material'), (u'catalogs', u'Material')], []]
relations: [[], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic mappings'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic mappings'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic coordination'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'computing linguistic or structural similarities')], [(u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'schemas'), (u'hierarchical classifications', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web directories'), (u'web directories', u'CONJUNCTION', u'catalogs')], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic coordination , namely the problem of finding an agreement on the meaning of heterogeneous schemas , is one of the key issues in the development of the Semantic Web .', u'In this paper , we propose a method for discovering semantic mappings across hierarchical classifications ( HCs ) based on a new approach , which shifts the problem of semantic coordination from the problem of computing linguistic or structural similarities ( what most other proposed approaches do ) to the problem of deducing relations between sets of logical formulae that represent the meaning of concepts belonging to different schema .', u'We show how to apply the approach and the algorithm to an interesting family of schemas , namely hierarchical classifications , and present the results of preliminary tests on two types of hierarchical classifications , web directories and catalogs .', u'Finally , we argue why this is a significant improvement on previous approaches .']

entities: [[(u'ontology auto-extension', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'technology', u'Generic'), (u'information processing', u'Task'), (u'free text', u'Material')], [(u'tasks', u'Generic'), (u'ontology auto-extension', u'Task')], [(u'binary tree', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'BT )', u'Method'), (u'ontology taxonomy', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'training and learning strategy', u'Method'), (u'SVM ) classifier', u'Method')], [(u'Onto-BT-SVM model', u'Method')], [], [(u'multi-class classification strategies', u'Method'), (u'classification effects', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'recall rate', u'Metric'), (u'Onto-BT-SVM model', u'Method'), (u'accuracy rate', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[], [(u'technology', u'USED-FOR', u'information processing'), (u'technology', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology instances'), (u'information processing', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology instances'), (u'free text', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology instances')], [], [(u'ontology taxonomy', u'USED-FOR', u'binary tree')], [], [], [(u'multi-class classification strategies', u'USED-FOR', u'classification effects')], [(u'recall rate', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'Onto-BT-SVM model'), (u'accuracy rate', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'Onto-BT-SVM model')]]
sentences: [u'This paper researches on ontology auto-extension , which is a hot issue of semantic web .', u'In this paper , technology related to information processing is used to automatically extend ontology instances from free text .', u'Firstly , three tasks are identified after analyzing on ontology auto-extension .', u'Secondly , a new binary tree ( BT ) is constructed based on the ontology taxonomy , and then it is used as the training and learning strategy of support vector machine ( SVM ) classifier .', u'And the full strategy is regarded as Onto-BT-SVM model .', u'The main advantage of this strategy is that the semantic of ontology is made full use of .', u'Finally , Different multi-class classification strategies are compared to verify their impacts on classification effects .', u'Experiment results show that the recall rate of Onto-BT-SVM model is 90.5 % and the accuracy rate is 93.5 % , which is satisfactory .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'enterprise infrastructure', u'Task'), (u'Knowledge Management', u'Task'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'relational database models', u'Method'), (u'transactional processing of operational data', u'Task')], [(u'information economy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge economy', u'Method')], [(u'Information Systems', u'Method'), (u'technological infrastructures', u'Method'), (u'relational transaction systems', u'Method'), (u'schemas', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'mapping relational data systems', u'Task'), (u'ontology-driven information system', u'Method')], [(u'ontologydriven information systems', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'enterprise infrastructure'), (u'Knowledge Management', u'CONJUNCTION', u'information retrieval')], [(u'relational database models', u'USED-FOR', u'transactional processing of operational data')], [], [(u'technological infrastructures', u'USED-FOR', u'Information Systems'), (u'technological infrastructures', u'USED-FOR', u'relational transaction systems')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The eventuality of the Semantic Web offers multiple attractive features to the enterprise infrastructure in the area of improved Knowledge Management and information retrieval .', u'Current relational database models adequately perform in the transactional processing of operational data , but do little toward the advancement of knowledge foundations for innovation .', u'The movement from an information economy to a knowledge economy mandates that successful organizations must innovate at a faster rate than their competitors .', u'To this end , Information Systems must extend technological infrastructures away from relational transaction systems toward higher order semantic models that can accommodate schemas based on Ontologies .', u'This report details a methodology for mapping relational data systems to a higher order semantic model that can implement an ontology-driven information system .', u'Additionally , this report provides conclusions about the application of ontologydriven information systems to the corporate environment .']

relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'knowledge-based applications'), (u'autonomous knowledge sources', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge-based applications')], [(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'filtering'), (u'modeling of knowledge heterogeneity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'homogenization of inconsistent and dynamic knowledge'), (u'modeling of knowledge heterogeneity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dynamics itsetf')], [], [(u'communication-oriented paradigm', u'USED-FOR', u'Open Ontologies'), (u'reification', u'USED-FOR', u'semantically heterogeneous conceptual knowledge')], []]
sentences: [u'In the context of open environments like the Semantic Web , knowledge-based applications with autonomous knowledge sources have recently gained increased interest .', u'For such sources , neither the consistency nor the reliability or the definiteness of the input knowledge can be ensured Whereas there already exist promising approaches to the filtering , integration and homogenization of inconsistent and dynamic knowledge , the modeling of knowledge heterogeneity and dynamics itsetf has been largely neglected so far .', u'In this work we propose Open Ontologies as an approach to this issue .', u'Open Ontologies are based on a distinct communication-oriented paradigm as they emerge from and evolve with communication processes , and allow the modeling and processing of semantically heterogeneous conceptual knowledge by means of its reification according to its social ( i.e .', u'communicational ) meaning and relevance , and the probabilistic weighting of inconsistent knowledge facets .']

sentences: [u'The paper analyzes LD-CAST , a business cooperation framework for automated or semi-automated business services , realized by various processes that orchestrate late bound Web services .', u'The 4+1 Views Architecture proves to be appropriate for the analysis and design of systems with complex objectives , like : user friendliness for multiple actors ; maintainability and extensibility under business evolution conditions ; flexibility for dynamic retrieval of service providers ; performance traceability for software and users .', u'The paper presents the correspondences established between use-case , process , logical , implementation and deployment views , such as to attain these objectives , and to hide the back-stage complexity for the business domain users .', u'The solution is based on three pillars : Service Oriented Architecture ( SOA ) , Business Process Modeling ( BPM ) and semantic Web .', u'The three of them are also used for comparing our system with other similar works .']

entities: [[(u'Internet semantic evolution', u'Task'), (u'informatic ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'knowledge representation archaeology', u'Method'), (u'cultural transmission', u'Material')], [(u'explanation model', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'sciences of education', u'Task')], [], [(u'ontological approach', u'Method'), (u'e-learning environments', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge representation archaeology'), (u'cultural transmission', u'CONJUNCTION', u'educational mediation perspectives')], [], [], [(u'ontological approach', u'USED-FOR', u'e-learning environments')]]
sentences: [u'The work highlights the mutual implications between technologies and education : the two worlds have interest in common matters such as Internet semantic evolution through the implementation of informatic ontologies and the connections we can draw between knowledge representation and didactics. # N # The historical reconstruction of the relationships among didactics , technologies and cultural resources leads us to the Semantic Web as a stage in the knowledge representation archaeology , regarded from cultural transmission and educational mediation perspectives .', u'The work provides an explanation model for the intersections we can see between ontologies and sciences of education .', u'With regard to the international research panorama about these themes , we point out and describe some significant experiences , which put the theory in practice .', u'# N # We analyze tools and applications involving the ontological approach in the development of e-learning environments and systems .']

entities: [[(u'Mobile health m-Health scenarios', u'Material'), (u'Internet of Things IoT technologies', u'Method'), (u'medical systems', u'Task'), (u'Ambient Assisted Living AAL', u'Task')], [(u"patient 's health data", u'Material'), (u'mobile network', u'Method'), (u'resource-constrained assumptions', u'Method'), (u'emergency situations', u'Task'), (u'personal data', u'Material'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'delivery', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'smart space based architectural model', u'Method'), (u'IoT technologies', u'Method'), (u'personal mobile data', u'Material'), (u'intelligent utilization', u'Task'), (u'health services', u'Task')], [(u'smart spaces approach', u'Method')], [(u'intelligence and security solutions', u'Task'), (u'security level', u'Metric'), (u'system', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Mobile health m-Health scenarios and Internet of Things IoT technologies form an important direction for enhancing medical systems for Ambient Assisted Living AAL .', u"Yet current development meets with two challenges : 1 use of patient 's health data with strong security guarantees in mobile network and resource-constrained assumptions and in emergency situations , 2 inclusion of personal data to the entire system for `` smart '' service construction and delivery .", u'This paper presents a smart space based architectural model that adopts emerging IoT technologies to enable security of personal mobile data and their intelligent utilization in health services .', u'To support the service intelligence , the authors employ the smart spaces approach with its prominent technologies adopted from IoT and Semantic Web .', u'The intelligence and security solutions are considered symbiotic to present better user-experience , security level , and utility of a system .']

sentences: [u'Personal name variants are a common problem in digital libraries , reducing the precision of searches and complicating browsing-based interaction .', u'The book-centric approach of name authority control has not scaled to match the growth and diversity of digital repositories .', u'In this paper , we present a novel system for user-driven integration of name variants when interacting with web-based information -- in particular digital library -- systems .', u'We approach these issues via a client-side JavaScript browser extension that can reorganize web content and also integrate remote data sources .', u'Designed to be agnostic towards the web sites it is applied to , we illustrate the developed proof-of-concept system through worked examples using three different digital libraries .', u'We discuss the extensibility of the approach in the context of other user-driven information systems and the growth of the Semantic Web .']

sentences: [u'This book constitutes the thoroughly refereed post-conference proceedings of the Second International Workshop on Graph Structures for Knowledge Representation and Reasoning , GKR 2011 , held in Barcelona , Spain , in July 2011 as satellite event of IJCAI 2011 , the 22nd International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence .', u'The 7 revised full papers presented together with 1 invited paper were carefully reviewed and selected from 12 submissions .', u'The papers feature current research involved in the development and application of graph-based knowledge representation formalisms and reasoning techniques and investigate further developments of knowledge representation and reasoning graph based techniques .', u'Topics addressed are such as : bayesian networks , semantic networks , conceptual graphs , formal concept analysis , cp-nets , gai-nets , euler diagrams , existential graphs all of which have been successfully used in a number of applications ( semantic Web , recommender systems , bioinformatics etc .', u') .']
