relations: [[], [], [(u'structured queries', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge bases'), (u'graph-pattern languages', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge bases'), (u'SPARQL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'structured queries'), (u'SPARQL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'graph-pattern languages')], [], [], [(u'retrieval model', u'USED-FOR', u'keyword queries')], [], [(u'retrieval model', u'COMPARE', u'IR and DB models'), (u'retrieval model', u'USED-FOR', u'keyword search'), (u'IR and DB models', u'USED-FOR', u'keyword search'), (u'structured data', u'USED-FOR', u'IR and DB models'), (u'structured data', u'USED-FOR', u'keyword search')]]
sentences: [u'Large knowledge bases consisting of entities and relationships between them have become vital sources of information for many applications .', u'Most of these knowledge bases adopt the Semantic-Web data model RDF as a representation model .', u'Querying these knowledge bases is typically done using structured queries utilizing graph-pattern languages such as SPARQL .', u'However , such structured queries require some expertise from users which limits the accessibility to such data sources .', u'To overcome this , keyword search must be supported .', u'In this paper , we propose a retrieval model for keyword queries over RDF graphs .', u'Our model retrieves a set of subgraphs that match the query keywords , and ranks them based on statistical language models .', u'We show that our retrieval model outperforms the-state-of-the-art IR and DB models for keyword search over structured data using experiments over two real-world datasets .']

entities: [[(u'Seeker', u'Method'), (u'large-scale text analytics', u'Task'), (u'SemTag', u'Method'), (u'automated semantic tagging of large corpora', u'Task')], [(u'SemTag', u'Method'), (u'web pages', u'Material')], [(u'Seeker platform', u'Method'), (u'SemTag application', u'Task'), (u'disambiguation algorithm', u'Method'), (u'ontological disambiguation of large-scale data', u'Task'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'semantic tags', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ambiguous content', u'Material'), (u'semantic web', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Seeker', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'large-scale text analytics')], [(u'SemTag', u'USED-FOR', u'web pages')], [(u'disambiguation algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'ontological disambiguation of large-scale data')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper describes Seeker , a platform for large-scale text analytics , and SemTag , an application written on the platform to perform automated semantic tagging of large corpora .', u'We apply SemTag to a collection of approximately 264 million web pages , and generate approximately 434 million automatically disambiguated semantic tags , published to the web as a label bureau providing metadata regarding the 434 million annotations .', u'To our knowledge , this is the largest scale semantic tagging effort to date.We describe the Seeker platform , discuss the architecture of the SemTag application , describe a new disambiguation algorithm specialized to support ontological disambiguation of large-scale data , evaluate the algorithm , and present our final results with information about acquiring and making use of the semantic tags .', u'We argue that automated large scale semantic tagging of ambiguous content can bootstrap and accelerate the creation of the semantic web .']

entities: [[(u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'context-awareness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'modeling social / human affairs', u'Task')], [(u'personal preferences', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'incomplete information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'managing uncertainty of sensor data', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic-Web-style reasoning', u'Method'), (u'context-based Web', u'Task')], [(u'context representation', u'Method'), (u'sensor-enabled Web services', u'Task')], [(u'representation', u'Generic'), (u'syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Business Rules', u'Method'), (u'annotations', u'Generic'), (u'prioritized modality', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'context/ambient-aware applications', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'context representation', u'USED-FOR', u'sensor-enabled Web services')], [(u'syntax', u'USED-FOR', u'representation')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'context/ambient-aware applications')]]
sentences: [u'Bringing sensor- and context-awareness to the Web promises to open new , tremendous business opportunities .', u'However , context-awareness involves difficult problems such as modeling social / human affairs ( e.g .', u'law , personal preferences , etc .', u') , handling incomplete information , and managing uncertainty of sensor data .', u'We argue that fully-fledged , Semantic-Web-style reasoning in presence of uncertainty is neither always feasible , nor always necessary for a context-based Web .', u'As an alternative , this paper proposes a highly expressive , simple , and efficient context representation for sensor-enabled Web services .', u'Our representation is based on a syntax inspired by standard Semantics of Business Vocabulary and Business Rules ( SBVR ) , enriched by annotations expressing prioritized modality and trust values .', u'Using a simple example , we explain the feasibility of this approach for developing context/ambient-aware applications that adapt to changes in the environment .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web ( SW )', u'Method'), (u'question answering', u'Task')], [(u'distributed semantic markup', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'QA systems', u'Method'), (u'semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'QA system', u'Method'), (u'PowerAqua', u'Method'), (u'semantic markup', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web', u'Material')], [(u'PowerAqua', u'Method'), (u'semantic resources', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'natural language query', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'heterogeneous semantic sources', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'distributed semantic markup', u'USED-FOR', u'QA systems')], [], [(u'PowerAqua', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'QA system'), (u'PowerAqua', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic markup')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web ( SW ) offers an opportunity to develop novel , sophisticated forms of question answering ( QA ) .', u'Specifically , the availability of distributed semantic markup on a large scale opens the way to QA systems which can make use of such semantic information to provide precise , formally derived answers to questions .', u'At the same time the distributed , heterogeneous , large-scale nature of the semantic information introduces significant challenges .', u'In this paper we describe the design of a QA system , PowerAqua , designed to exploit semantic markup on the web to provide answers to questions posed in natural language .', u'PowerAqua does not assume that the user has any prior information about the semantic resources .', u'The system takes as input a natural language query , translates it into a set of logical queries , which are then answered by consulting and aggregating information derived from multiple heterogeneous semantic sources .']

entities: [[(u'Knowledge Representation questions', u'Material'), (u'rule languages', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'Description Logics', u'Method')], [(u'Logic Programming', u'Task')], [(u'first-order logic', u'Method'), (u'rule-based representation', u'Method'), (u'inductive definitions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'first-order logic', u'Method'), (u'Logic Programs', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'DL', u'Method'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'expressive FO ( ID )', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Knowledge Representation questions surrounding rule languages', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web'), (u'rule languages', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [(u'rule-based representation', u'USED-FOR', u'first-order logic'), (u'rule-based representation', u'USED-FOR', u'inductive definitions')], [(u'first-order logic', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Logic Programs')], []]
sentences: [u'There are many interesting Knowledge Representation questions surrounding rule languages for the Semantic Web .', u'The most basic one is of course : which kind of rules should be used and how do they integrate with existing Description Logics ?', u'Similar questions have already been addressed in the field of Logic Programming , where one particular answer has been provided by the language of FO ( ID ) .', u'FO ( ID ) is an extension of first-order logic with a rule-based representation for inductive definitions .', u'By offering a general integration of first-order logic and Logic Programs , it also induces a particular way of extending Description Logics with rules .', u'The goal of this paper is to investigate this integration and discover whether there are interesting extensions of DL with rules that can be arrived at by imposing appropriate restrictions on the highly expressive FO ( ID ) .']

entities: [[(u'websites', u'Material')], [], [(u'Web Ontology', u'Method')], [(u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Method')], [(u'detecting and recovering relevant ontologies', u'Task'), (u'similarity between ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'degree similarity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic')]]
sentences: [u'The Internet comprises of a variety of websites , which both individually and in clusters generate large amounts of information .', u'In order to make web pages machine-understandable we need a formal , explicit specification .', u'This is provided by a Web Ontology .', u'The importance of domain ontologies is widely recognized , particularly in its relation to the expected advent of the Semantic Web .', u'For the task of detecting and recovering relevant ontologies , a means to measure the similarity between ontologies becomes a binding necessity on a vary large scale .', u'The purpose of this paper is to describe a method that will effectively recognize and categorize different ontologies of the same domain and find the degree similarity between them to provide a framework for a research that can effectively provide a scope for merging the ontologies that relate to a similar concept in a domain .']

entities: [[(u'Information management', u'Method'), (u'product family planning strategies', u'Method')], [(u'Product platforms', u'Method')], [(u'knowledge management', u'Task')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'product platform knowledge management', u'Method'), (u'semantic web paradigm', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'modular playground component', u'Method'), (u'methodologys user adoptability', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'Information management', u'USED-FOR', u'product family planning strategies')], [(u'modules', u'USED-FOR', u'Product platforms'), (u'modules', u'CONJUNCTION', u'processes')], [], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'product platform knowledge management')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Information management has been recognized as an essential ingredient for effective product family planning strategies through the utilization of product platforms .', u'Product platforms utilize commonality of parts , modules , and processes during design and manufacture .', u'This commonality must be well documented for its effective use , and ontologies are one way to organize this information to promote knowledge management .', u'The following provides a case study to verify a proposed methodology for product platform knowledge management that uses the semantic web paradigm by applying it to a component from a major modular playground equipment producer .', u'Our objective is to verify the developed methodology using a case study of a modular playground component and to evaluate the methodologys user adoptability .', u'It will be shown that the methodology is successful and valid to apply to other applications , with some improvements , in the future.Copyright 2007 by ASME']

relations: [[(u'terms e-learning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'distance learning'), (u'e-learning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'distance learning')], [], [(u'students data', u'USED-FOR', u'data mining')], [(u'semantic web mining', u'CONJUNCTION', u'learning')]]
sentences: [u'As the internet and mobile applications are getting an important role in our lives , usage of mobile services also took place in educational field since the internet is widespread , which is usually called by the terms e-learning or distance learning .', u'A known issue on e-learning is all the contents being online and less face-to-face communication than traditional learning ; this brings the problem of chasing students success , and advising and managing students way of studying .', u'Hence , a recent hot topic , data mining , can be applied on students data left on e-learning portals to guide the instructor and advisors to help students being more successful .', u'Recent researches done on this topic showed that e-learning combined with data mining can decrease the gap between itself and traditional learning referred as semantic web mining in general .']

sentences: [u"In this paper we report , first , the conceptualization and initial design of a system that creates a structured subset of data , concerning the most relevant facts about a patient 's healthcare , organized and transportable , in order to be employed during the post-discharge homecare period , enabling simultaneously the planning and the optimal documentation of the provided homecare .", u'Second , we present the actual development and implementation of the system according to the ASTM Continuity of Care Record ( CCR ) Specification .', u'Finally , we present the implementation of a semantic-web-based system , which aims to facilitate the exchange of Clinical Information among various points of care , and we also present a solution that provides for the shared understanding of Medical Data between diverge information systems , and overcomes , both , the problems of incompatible formats in messages and of the use of diverse vocabularies .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'problem', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'subproblems', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneity resolution', u'Task')], [(u'it', u'Generic')], [], []]
relations: [[(u'Ontologies', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web')], [], [(u'heterogeneity resolution', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'subproblems')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Ontologies play a key role in the advent of the Semantic Web .', u'An important problem when dealing with ontologies is the modification of an existing ontology in response to a certain need for change .', u'This problem is a complex and multifaceted one , because it can take several different forms and includes several related subproblems , like heterogeneity resolution or keeping track of ontology versions .', u'As a result , it is being addressed by several different , but closely related and often overlapping research disciplines .', u'Unfortunately , the boundaries of each such discipline are not clear , as the same term is often used with different meanings in the relevant literature , creating a certain amount of confusion .', u'The purpose of this paper is to identify the exact relationships between these research areas and to determine the boundaries of each field , by performing a broad review of the relevant literature .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web architecture', u'Method')], [(u'entity-centered issues', u'Task'), (u'authentication', u'Task'), (u'reputation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'trust measures', u'Metric')], [(u'Web resource', u'Material')], [(u'minimal user interaction', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'simulation environment', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'authentication', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'entity-centered issues'), (u'authentication', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reputation'), (u'reputation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'entity-centered issues')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Trust is an integral part of the Semantic Web architecture .', u'Most prior work on trusts focuses on entity-centered issues such as authentication and reputation and does not take into account the content , i.e. , the nature and use of the information being exchanged .', u'This paper defines content trust and discusses it in the context of other trust measures that have been previously studied .', u'We introduce several factors that users consider in deciding whether to trust the content provided by a Web resource .', u"Our goal is to discern which of these factors could be captured in practice with minimal user interaction in order to maximize the quality of the system 's trust estimates .", u'We present results on a study to determine which factors were more important to capture , and describe a simulation environment that we have designed to study alternative models of content trust .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'analytical activities', u'Task')], [(u'storage systems', u'Method'), (u'storage and retrieval of information', u'Task'), (u'RDF ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'they', u'Generic'), (u'semantic association discovery', u'Task')], [(u'BRAHMS', u'Method'), (u'RDF storage system', u'Method'), (u'fast semantic association discovery', u'Task')], [(u'BRAHMS', u'Method'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'Jena', u'Material'), (u'Redland', u'Material'), (u'RDF storage systems', u'Method')], [(u'BRAHMS', u'Method'), (u'RDF query languages', u'Material'), (u'low-level APIs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'semantic association discovery algorithms', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'they', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic association discovery')], [(u'BRAHMS', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'RDF storage system'), (u'RDF storage system', u'USED-FOR', u'fast semantic association discovery'), (u'large RDF bases', u'FEATURE-OF', u'fast semantic association discovery')], [(u'Jena', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Sesame'), (u'Jena', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Redland'), (u'Sesame', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Redland')], [(u'RDF query languages', u'CONJUNCTION', u'low-level APIs')]]
sentences: [u'Discovery of semantic associations in Semantic Web ontologies is an important task in various analytical activities .', u'Several query languages and storage systems have been designed and implemented for storage and retrieval of information in RDF ontologies .', u'However , they are inadequate for semantic association discovery .', u'In this paper we present the design and implementation of BRAHMS , an efficient RDF storage system , specifically designed to support fast semantic association discovery in large RDF bases .', u'We present memory usage and timing results of several tests performed with BRAHMS and compare them to similar tests performed using Jena , Sesame , and Redland , three of the well-known RDF storage systems .', u'Our results show that BRAHMS handles basic association discovery well , while the RDF query languages and even the low-level APIs in the other three tested systems are not suitable for the implementation of semantic association discovery algorithms .']

entities: [[(u'semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'RDF', u'Method')], [(u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'W3C', u'Method'), (u'RDF query languages', u'Material')], [(u'processing SPARQL queries', u'Task'), (u'RDF data', u'Material'), (u'RDF data', u'Material'), (u'SPARQL queries', u'Material')], [(u'engines', u'Generic'), (u'streaming RDF data', u'Material')], [(u'Streaming query engines', u'Method')], [(u'streaming SPARQL engine', u'Method'), (u'streaming SPARQL engine', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'RDF data', u'USED-FOR', u'processing SPARQL queries')], [], [(u'streams of data', u'USED-FOR', u'Streaming query engines')], []]
sentences: [u'The basic data format of the semantic Web is RDF .', u'SPARQL , which has been developed by the W3C , is the upcoming standard for RDF query languages .', u'Typical engines for processing SPARQL queries on RDF data first read all RDF data , may build indices of the complete read data and afterwards evaluate SPARQL queries .', u'Such engines can not operate on streaming RDF data .', u'Streaming query engines operating on streams of data can ( a ) discard irrelevant input as early as possible , and thus save processing costs and space costs , ( b ) build indices only on those parts of the data , which are needed for the evaluation of the query , and ( c ) determine partial results of a query as early as possible , and thus evaluate queries more efficiently .', u'We propose such a streaming SPARQL engine , which is the first streaming SPARQL engine to the best of our knowledge .']

entities: [[(u'computational framework', u'Generic'), (u'identity', u'Task'), (u'Barwise and Devlins situation theory', u'Method')], [(u'id-situations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'id-actions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Web standards', u'Method')], [(u'id-situation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Dempster-Shafer theory of evidence', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'DempsterShafer theory', u'Method')], [(u'argument schemes', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'We present a computational framework for identity based on Barwise and Devlins situation theory .', u'We present an example with constellations of situations identifying an individual to create what we call id-situations , where id-actions are performed , along with supporting situations .', u'We use Semantic Web standards to represent and reason about the situations in our example .', u'We show how to represent the strength of the evidence , within the situations , as a measure of the support for judgments reached in the id-situation .', u'To measure evidence of an identity from the supporting situations , we use the Dempster-Shafer theory of evidence .', u'We enhance DempsterShafer theory in two ways to leverage the information available in a constellation of situations .', u'One way exploits the structure within the situations , and the other way interprets the information-relationships in terms of argument schemes .']

entities: [[(u'online services', u'Task'), (u'updated and on-time information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'eAdministration or eGovernment services', u'Task'), (u'online services', u'Material')], [], [], [(u'proposal', u'Generic'), (u'Public Administrations', u'Material'), (u'semantic-web functionalities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'document discovery and classification', u'Task'), (u'peer-to-peer solutions', u'Method')], [(u'technologies', u'Generic'), (u'document distribution', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'service providers', u'CONJUNCTION', u'associated documents')], [(u'document discovery and classification', u'CONJUNCTION', u'peer-to-peer solutions')], []]
sentences: [u'Any modern administration must provide to the citizen a comprehensive portfolio of online services , together with updated and on-time information about them .', u'However , the deployment of eAdministration or eGovernment services requires a reasonable level of availability and accessibility , as citizens have to perceive that online services indeed improve their relations with Public Administrations .', u'This poses some challenges due to the size of the target user base , i.e .', u'the entire population ; and the wide variety of services , service providers , and associated documents .', u'We discuss a proposal to easily locate , distribute and download documents generated by Public Administrations that integrates semantic-web functionalities for document discovery and classification , and peer-to-peer solutions to facilitate access and download .', u'The combination of these technologies has several advantages in so far document distribution is concerned , and enables the development of scalable and cost-effective solutions .']

sentences: [u'The purpose of this paper is to report on a new system-theoretic based methodology and corresponding model for Enterprise Architecture development .', u'This model captures the essence of the strategic , conceptual , doctrinal layer of the organization .', u'Reusable Quality Technical Architectures ( RQ-Tech ) graphically reveals a comprehensive array of enterprise decision alternatives in easily understandable views ; all while maintaining the hyperlinks to its provenance in strategic authoritative documentation .', u'The RQ-Tech method has combined the practice of Enterprise Architectures with a modern perspective grounded in Systems Theory and the theory regarding the computer science-oriented Semantic Web .', u'This recombination results in a distinctive methodology for developing models .', u'This new methodology supports the conclusion that system-specific solutions produce islands of technology and can be prevented by employing better enterprise change planning .', u'A review of the literature in three major areas illustrates the ov ...']

entities: [[(u'content-based processing of data', u'Task'), (u'application semantic interoperability', u'Task')], [(u'W3C standardisation proposals', u'Method'), (u'rdf', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rdfschema', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'owl', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic similarity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'content-based annotation', u'Task'), (u'textual documents', u'Material')], [(u'labelled trees', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'nodes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'reasoning process', u'Method')], [(u'semantic similarity measure', u'Metric')], [(u'semantic measure', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'rdf', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'W3C standardisation proposals'), (u'rdf', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rdfschema'), (u'rdfschema', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'W3C standardisation proposals'), (u'rdfschema', u'CONJUNCTION', u'owl'), (u'owl', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'W3C standardisation proposals')], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic similarity')], [(u'content-based annotation of textual documents', u'USED-FOR', u'It'), (u'textual documents', u'USED-FOR', u'It')], [], [(u'reasoning process', u'USED-FOR', u'labelled trees representing documents')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In the framework of the Semantic Web , content-based processing of data is considered as an essential component for application semantic interoperability .', u'In order to enable such a processing , many W3C standardisation proposals ( rdf , rdfschema , owl , etc . )', u'were done .', u'In this paper , we present an approach for semantic similarity .', u'It is based on content-based annotation of textual documents .', u'The contents of documents are represented by labelled trees where nodes are represented by concepts in an ontology which represents the knowledge of the domain of data .', u'Then , a reasoning process is carried out for comparing the labelled trees representing documents and thus comparing the documents .', u'This comparison process , once completed , allows to calculate a semantic similarity measure between documents .', u'Finally , we show how this semantic measure can be used to classify documents according to their content .']

sentences: [u'Ontologies represent a method of sharing and reusing knowledge on the semantic web .', u'A fuzzy ontology is an extension of domain ontologies for solving the problems of uncertainty .', u'This paper shows how a Fuzzy Ontology based approach can represent user profiles in e-learning environments .', u'The ontological representation of the user profile enhances the performance in tasks such as filtering and information retrieval .', u'An algorithm that allows automatically creating the construction of the ontology is also introduced .', u'This approach has been integrated into a management tool for Learning Objects , in which each user profile is built from Learning Objects published by the user himself .', u"The initial experiments confirm that the automatically obtained fuzzy ontology is a good representation of the user 's preferences .", u'The experiment results also indicate that the approach is useful and warrants further research .']

entities: [[(u'ontology data', u'Material'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'generation of ontology data', u'Task'), (u'peer-to-peer environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'structured data', u'Material'), (u'ontology data', u'Material'), (u'ontology schemas', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology data', u'Material')], [(u'ontology data generation', u'Task'), (u'ontology data matching', u'Task'), (u'framework', u'Generic')], [(u'interlinked ontology data', u'Material'), (u'ontology data', u'Material')], [(u'matching accuracy', u'Metric'), (u'ontology related features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'matching process', u'Task')], [(u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'structured data', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology data')], [], [(u'interlinked ontology data', u'COMPARE', u'ontology data')], [(u'ontology related features', u'PART-OF', u'matching process')], []]
sentences: [u'The abundance of ontology data is very crucial to the emerging semantic web .', u'This paper proposes a framework that supports the generation of ontology data in a peer-to-peer environment .', u'It not only enables users to convert existing structured data to ontology data aligned with given ontology schemas , but also allows them to publish new ontology data with ease .', u'Besides ontology data generation , the common issue of data overlapping over the peers is addressed by the process of ontology data matching in the framework .', u'This process helps turn the implicitly related data among the peers caused by overlapping into explicitly interlinked ontology data , which increases the overall quality of the ontology data .', u'To improve matching accuracy , we explore ontology related features in the matching process .', u'Experiments show that adding these features achieves better overall performance than using traditional features only .']

entities: [[(u'Cloud technology', u'Method'), (u'healthcare information systems', u'Task')], [(u'cloud computing', u'Task'), (u'multitenancy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'privacy and security issues', u'Task'), (u'personal health information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontological models', u'Method'), (u'healthcare workflow', u'Task'), (u'multi-tenancy', u'Task'), (u'HIPAA requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'models', u'Generic'), (u'HIPAA-compliant access control policies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'access control policies', u'Method'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL-DL reasoner', u'Method')], [(u'HIPAA security rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'access control policies', u'Method'), (u'cloud-based simulated healthcare environment', u'Method')], [(u'access control policy specification', u'Method'), (u'cloud based healthcare information systems', u'Task'), (u'open source cloud platform', u'Method'), (u'OpenStack', u'Method')], [(u'authorization policies', u'Method'), (u'multi-tenancy', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Cloud technology', u'USED-FOR', u'healthcare information systems')], [], [(u'ontological models', u'USED-FOR', u'healthcare workflow'), (u'ontological models', u'USED-FOR', u'healthcare workflow and multi-tenancy'), (u'ontological models', u'USED-FOR', u'multi-tenancy'), (u'healthcare workflow', u'CONJUNCTION', u'multi-tenancy'), (u'HIPAA requirements', u'USED-FOR', u'models'), (u'HIPAA requirements', u'USED-FOR', u'HIPAA-compliant access control policies'), (u'models', u'USED-FOR', u'HIPAA-compliant access control policies')], [], [(u'access control policies', u'USED-FOR', u'HIPAA security rules')], [(u'access control policy specification', u'USED-FOR', u'cloud based healthcare information systems'), (u'open source cloud platform', u'USED-FOR', u'cloud based healthcare information systems')], [(u'authorization policies', u'USED-FOR', u'HIPAA compliance')]]
sentences: [u'Cloud technology can be used to support costeffective , scalable , and well-managed healthcare information systems .', u'However , cloud computing , particularly multitenancy , introduces privacy and security issues related to personal health information ( PHI ) .', u'In this paper , we designed ontological models for healthcare workflow and multi-tenancy , and then applied HIPAA requirements on the models to generate HIPAA-compliant access control policies .', u'We used Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) to represent access control policies as rules , and we verified the rules with an OWL-DL reasoner .', u'Additionally , we implemented HIPAA security rules through access control policies in a cloud-based simulated healthcare environment .', u'More specifically , we investigated access control policy specification and enforcement for cloud based healthcare information systems using an open source cloud platform , OpenStack .', u'The results manifest HIPAA compliance through authorization policies that are capable of addressing vulnerabilities of multi-tenancy .']

entities: [[(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'bootstrapping relation extraction', u'Task'), (u'unstructured text', u'Material'), (u'GATE', u'Method'), (u'KIM semantic annotation platform', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'named entity recognizer', u'Method')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'ANNIE system', u'Method'), (u'default information extraction module', u'Method')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'lexical resources', u'Material'), (u'relation extraction approach', u'Method')], [(u'information extraction', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'semantic repository', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'bootstrapping relation extraction'), (u'unstructured text', u'USED-FOR', u'bootstrapping relation extraction')], [], [(u'ANNIE system', u'CONJUNCTION', u'default information extraction module')], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'lexical resources')], [(u'information extraction', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')]]
sentences: [u'The paper describes a methodology for bootstrapping relation extraction from unstructured text in the context of GATE , but also applied to the KIM semantic annotation platform .', u'The focus is on identifying a set of relations between entities previously found by named entity recognizer .', u'The methodology is developed and applied to three kinds of relations and evaluated both with the ANNIE system and the default information extraction module of KIM .', u'The methodology covers the problem of identifying the task , the target domain , the development of training and testing corpora , and useful lexical resources , the choice of a particular relation extraction approach .', u'The application of information extraction for the Semantic Web also brings a new interesting dimension of not merely recognizing the entity type , but going into instantiation of entity references and linking them to an entity instance in a semantic repository .']

entities: [[], [(u'them', u'Generic'), (u'RIF', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL-Update', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'transactional properties', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'solution', u'Generic')], [(u'logic', u'Generic'), (u'Transaction Logic', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'RIF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SPARQL-Update')], [], [], [(u'Transaction Logic', u'USED-FOR', u'logic')]]
sentences: [u'The success of the Semantic Web project has triggered the emergence of new challenges for the research community .', u'Among them , relies the ability of evolving the web by means of actions and updates in accordance with some standard proposals as RIF or SPARQL-Update .', u'However , from the moment that actions and updates are possible , the need to ensure properties regarding the outcome of performing such actions emerges .', u'Moreover , this need also leaves open the specification of such properties and requirements that an intended solution should comply to. # R # # N # # R # # N # In this paper we motivate the need for employing transactional properties in this new Web and delineate a proposal for the requirements that such solution should provide .', u'Afterwards , we develop a logic , based on the well-known Transaction Logic , that partially achieves such requirements , as a first step of an ongoing work .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Method')], [], [(u'OntoQA', u'Method'), (u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'global criteria', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OntoQA', u'Method'), (u'ranking', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'OntoQA', u'Method'), (u'ranking ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ranking', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'OntoQA', u'USED-FOR', u'ranking')], [(u'OntoQA', u'USED-FOR', u'ranking ontologies')]]
sentences: [u'Ontologies form the cornerstone of the Semantic Web and are intended to help researchers to analyze and share knowledge , and as more ontologies are being introduced , it is difficult for users to find good ontologies related to their work .', u'Therefore , tools for evaluating and ranking the ontologies are needed .', u'In this paper , we present OntoQA , a tool that evaluates ontologies related to a certain set of terms and then ranks them according a set of metrics that captures different aspects of ontologies .', u'Since there are no global criteria defining how a good ontology should be , OntoQA allows users to tune the ranking towards certain features of ontologies to suit the need of their applications .', u'We also show the effectiveness of OntoQA in ranking ontologies by comparing its results to the ranking of other comparable approaches as well as expert users .']

entities: [[(u'retrieval aspect', u'Task'), (u'adaptive hypermedia ( AH )', u'Task')], [(u'AH research', u'Method'), (u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'information retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'IR', u'Task'), (u'IR', u'Task'), (u'AH', u'Task')], [(u'abstract reference model', u'Method'), (u'concrete implementation framework', u'Method'), (u'AHA', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'AH', u'Method'), (u'extended IR functionality', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'SW paradigm', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'abstract reference model', u'CONJUNCTION', u'concrete implementation framework'), (u'AHA', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'concrete implementation framework')], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'AH')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper concentrates on the retrieval aspect in adaptive hypermedia ( AH ) .', u"Traditionally , AH research concentrates on applications that are 'closed ' , in the sense that they assume fixed content elements .", u'Certain applications ask for an extension of the contents considered , with data obtained through information retrieval ( IR ) .', u"This paper addresses this issue of 'opening up ' AH applications , and gives insight into research that applies techniques from IR and from the Semantic Web ( SW ) for the embedding of IR in AH .", u'We look at this issue in the context of an abstract reference model ( AHAM ) and a concrete implementation framework ( AHA ! ) .', u'The goal of this research is to define a framework for AH with extended IR functionality .', u'We address the relevant issues for this framework , characterized by the application of concepts from the SW paradigm leading to an enriched notion of concept relevancy .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Material')], [(u'paradigm', u'Generic'), (u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'application programming interfaces', u'Method'), (u'web services', u'Task')], [], [(u'ontology of animal and plant kingdom', u'Method'), (u'search engine', u'Method'), (u'topic based searching', u'Task'), (u'XML file', u'Material')], [(u'images of plants and animals', u'Material')], [], [(u'image filtering tool', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'API )', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web services')], [], [(u'ontology of animal and plant kingdom', u'USED-FOR', u'search engine'), (u'search engine', u'USED-FOR', u'topic based searching')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Topic -- based search provides a promising paradigm for formulating complex semantic queries and representing results on the semantic web .', u'A challenge for the application of the paradigm is the complexity of providing topic -- based search services through application programming interfaces ( API ) and web services .', u'In this paper topic specific search is done on domain like plants and animals .', u'Using the ontology of animal and plant kingdom , the search engine is trained for topic based searching by constructing XML file for various plants and animals .', u'Several images of plants and animals are crawled and classified into the various categories of animals and plants .', u'The search results include the detail information of animal or plant searched along with the image of that category .', u'An additional image filtering tool is designed to narrow down search results according to the user need .']

entities: [[(u'knowledge management', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Task'), (u'exchange of electronic information', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology construction', u'Task')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'semi-automatic construction of ontologies', u'Task'), (u'extraction of concepts and relations', u'Task')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'knowledge management', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web')], [], [], [], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'semi-automatic construction of ontologies')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')]]
sentences: [u'The recent developments related to knowledge management , the semantic web and the exchange of electronic information through the use of agents have increased the need for ontologies to describe in a formal way shared understanding of a given domain .', u'For computers and people to work in cooperation it is necessary that information have well defined and shared definitions .', u'Ontologies are enablers of that cooperation .', u'However , ontology construction remains a very complex and costly process , which has hindered its use in a wider scale .', u'This article presents a method for the semi-automatic construction of ontologies using texts of any domain for the extraction of concepts and relations .', u'By comparing the relative frequency of terms in the text with their typical , expected use , the method identifies concepts and relations and specifies the corresponding ontology using OWL for use by other applications .']

entities: [[(u'Well-designed pattern trees', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'wdPTs )', u'Method'), (u'conjunctive queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'partial matching', u'Task'), (u'semantic web query language SPARQL', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'computational problems', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'wdPTs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'evaluation problem', u'Task'), (u'counting problem', u'Task'), (u'static analysis tasks', u'Task'), (u'equivalence problems', u'Task')], [(u'tasks', u'Generic')], [(u'wdPT', u'Method')], [(u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'wdPTs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'problem', u'Generic'), (u'classical complexity point of view', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'parameterized complexity point of view', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Well-designed pattern trees', u'USED-FOR', u'partial matching')], [], [], [], [], [(u'classical complexity point of view', u'FEATURE-OF', u'problem'), (u'classical complexity point of view', u'CONJUNCTION', u'parameterized complexity point of view')]]
sentences: [u'Well-designed pattern trees ( wdPTs ) have been introduced as an extension of conjunctive queries to allow for partial matching - analogously to the OPTIONAL operator of the semantic web query language SPARQL .', u'Several computational problems of wdPTs have been studied in recent years , such as the evaluation problem in various settings , the counting problem , as well as static analysis tasks including the containment and equivalence problems .', u'Also restrictions needed to achieve tractability of these tasks have been proposed .', u'In contrast , the problem of enumerating the answers to a wdPT has been largely ignored so far .', u'In this work , we embark on a systematic study of the complexity of the enumeration problem of wdPTs .', u'As our main result , we identify several tractable and intractable cases of this problem both from a classical complexity point of view and from a parameterized complexity point of view .']

entities: [[(u'Designing applications', u'Task'), (u'person-aware environment', u'Task'), (u'person-aware applications', u'Task')], [(u'devices', u'Generic')], [(u'person-aware applications', u'Task')], [(u'middleware', u'Generic'), (u'flexible composition of applications', u'Task'), (u'FCAP', u'Method')], [(u'FCAP', u'Method'), (u'heterogeneous functionalities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'automation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'end-user control', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'service-oriented architecture', u'Method'), (u'multi-agent systems', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Designing applications', u'USED-FOR', u'person-aware environment'), (u'person-aware applications', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'person-aware environment')], [], [], [(u'middleware', u'USED-FOR', u'flexible composition of applications')], [(u'FCAP', u'USED-FOR', u'heterogeneous functionalities'), (u'automation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'end-user control')], []]
sentences: [u'Designing applications for a person-aware environment ( called person-aware applications ) raises numerous challenges .', u'Especially , devices are heterogeneous , environments are unstable and evolving , and users needs are variable and imprecise .', u'In order to facilitate the design of person-aware applications , we focus on the notion of flexible composite applications ( FCAP ) : applications working continuously in the background of our attention with the goal of aggregating functionalities in order to support our activities .', u'We thus investigate a middleware for flexible composition of applications , called FCAP .', u'FCAP provides a generic support for integrating heterogeneous functionalities , adapting applications to an unstable environment and adjusting the balance between automation and end-user control .', u'Our approach builds on principles derived from the fields of service-oriented architecture , semantic Web and multi-agent systems , all of which have relevant properties for our environments .']

entities: [[(u'Knowledge representation formalisms', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'strict open world assumption', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'nonmonotonic reasoning techniques', u'Method')], [(u'closed world view', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rules extensions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'negation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'scoped negation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'formal semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'logic programs', u'Method'), (u'scoped negation', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'logic programs', u'Method'), (u'rule extension', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'Knowledge representation formalisms')], [], [], [(u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'rules extensions'), (u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'languages'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'rules extensions'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'languages')], [], [], [(u'rule extension', u'USED-FOR', u'logic programs')]]
sentences: [u'Knowledge representation formalisms used on the Semantic Web adhere to a strict open world assumption .', u'Therefore , nonmonotonic reasoning techniques are often viewed with scepticism .', u'Especially negation as failure , which intuitively adopts a closed world view , is often claimed to be unsuitable for the Web where knowledge is notoriously incomplete .', u'Nonetheless , it was suggested in the ongoing discussions around rules extensions for languages like RDF ( S ) or OWL to allow at least restricted forms of negation as failure , as long as negation has an explicitly defined , finite scope .', u'Yet clear definitions of such scoped negation as well as formal semantics thereof are missing .', u'We propose logic programs with contexts and scoped negation and discuss two possible semantics with desirable properties .', u'We also argue that this class of logic programs can be viewed as a rule extension to a subset of RDF ( S ) .']

entities: [[(u'real-time stream processing applications', u'Task')], [(u'Data Stream Management Systems', u'Method'), (u'DSMS', u'Method'), (u'dynamic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'real-time processing of streaming data', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'SensorStream prototype', u'Method'), (u'solutions', u'Generic'), (u'real-time information processing', u'Task'), (u'distributed and heterogeneous data sources', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'DSMS', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Data Stream Management Systems'), (u'dynamic knowledge', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web community')], [], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'real-time processing of streaming data')], [(u'distributed and heterogeneous data sources', u'USED-FOR', u'solutions'), (u'distributed and heterogeneous data sources', u'USED-FOR', u'real-time information processing')]]
sentences: [u'As data proliferates at increasing rates , the need for real-time stream processing applications increases as well .', u'In the same way that Data Stream Management Systems ( DSMS ) have emerged from the database community , there is now a similar concern in managing dynamic knowledge among the Semantic Web community .', u'Unfortunately , early relevant approaches are , to a large extent , theoretical and do not present convincing evidence of their efficiency in real dynamic environments .', u'In this paper , we present a framework for the effective , real-time processing of streaming data and we define and analyse in depth its key components .', u'Our framework serves as a basis for the implementation of the SensorStream prototype , on which we run numerous performance and scalability measurements that outline its behaviour and demonstrate its suitability and scalability for solutions that require real-time information processing from distributed and heterogeneous data sources .']

entities: [[(u'Web service technology', u'Method'), (u'topics', u'Generic'), (u'software reuse', u'Task')], [(u'Web service discovery and composition', u'Task'), (u'online Web service repositories', u'Material'), (u'them', u'Generic')], [(u'repositories', u'Generic'), (u'software libraries', u'Method'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'service discovery', u'Task')], [(u'automatically deriving metadata', u'Task'), (u'Web service collections', u'Material')], [(u'Web service repositories', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'ontology learning', u'Method'), (u'service annotation tools', u'Method'), (u'automatic classifiers', u'Task'), (u'metadata based presentation', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'software reuse', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'topics'), (u'software reuse', u'CONJUNCTION', u'discovery')], [], [], [], [(u'ontology learning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'service annotation tools'), (u'ontology learning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'automatic classifiers'), (u'service annotation tools', u'CONJUNCTION', u'automatic classifiers'), (u'service annotation tools', u'CONJUNCTION', u'metadata based presentation'), (u'automatic classifiers', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web'), (u'automatic classifiers', u'CONJUNCTION', u'metadata based presentation')]]
sentences: [u'The success of the Web service technology has brought topics such as software reuse and discovery once again on the agenda of software engineers .', u'While there are several efforts towards automating Web service discovery and composition , many developers still search for services via online Web service repositories and then combine them manually .', u'However , from our analysis of these repositories , it yields that , unlike traditional software libraries , they rely on little metadata to support service discovery .', u'We believe that the major cause is the difficulty of automatically deriving metadata that would describe rapidly changing Web service collections .', u'In this paper , we discuss the major shortcomings of current Web service repositories and , as a solution , we report on how to use techniques developed in the context of the Semantic Web ( ontology learning , service annotation tools , automatic classifiers , metadata based presentation ) to improve the current situation']

sentences: [u'Retrieve information resources made by the machine processing may refer to multiple sources .', u'A # R # # N # personal web as part of information resources in the Internet requires a feature that can be understood by # R # # N # computer machines .', u'Therefore , in this paper an ontology semantic web approach is used to map the resources # R # # N # in a meaningful scheme .', u'In the design of concept , resources on the web are viewed as documents that have # R # # N # some property and ownership .', u'Domain interest or web scope is used to describe a classification of resources # R # # N # that navigate into relevant documents .', u'If instances are completed to the concept , then the ontology file can be # R # # N # loaded and shared as annotation on personal web .', u'This allows computer machine to query multiple ontology # R # # N # from different personal webs that use it .']

sentences: [u'The use of ontologies lies at the very heart of the newly emerging era of semantic web .', u'As information on the web increases significantly in size , web ontologies also tend to grow bigger , to such an extent that they become too large to be used in their entirety by any single application .', u'Moreover , because of the size of the original ontology , the process of maintenance , reuse , reasoning and integration becomes very computationally extensive .', u'Accordingly , the research community is increasing its effort towards the specification of frameworks and techniques that may help in downsizing ontology .', u'Modularization is one of the approaches to achieve such a result .', u"In this paper , we propose an algorithm of module extraction based on user 's semantic query and realize it to a component of the framework for knowledge management system .", u'Experiment shows that this approach is very useful in practice .']

relations: [[(u'Rules', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Ontologies')], [(u'R2RIF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'rule integration plugin'), (u'rule integration plugin', u'USED-FOR', u'Protege OWL'), (u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rules'), (u'rules', u'USED-FOR', u'conceptual models'), (u'conceptual models', u'USED-FOR', u'domain of interest')], [(u'semantic compatible RIF rules', u'CONJUNCTION', u'them')], [(u'Subsumption reasoning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'consistency checks'), (u'consistency checks', u'USED-FOR', u'expressive domain models'), (u'ontology/rule models', u'USED-FOR', u'expressive domain models')], [(u'R2RIF', u'USED-FOR', u'generic algorithms'), (u'R2RIF', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology and rule languages'), (u'generic algorithms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'workflows'), (u'generic algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology and rule languages'), (u'workflows', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology and rule languages')]]
sentences: [u'Rules and Ontologies are two parts of the Semantic Web which considerably afford highly adaptable and generic approaches according to their interoperability and unified application .', u'Within this paper we present a proposal and conceptualization of R2RIF , a rule integration plugin for Protege OWL , aiming to combine ontologies and rules to build appropriate conceptual models for a domain of interest .', u'Hence , this task comes up with several specific topics regarding transformation of different rule languages into one common interoperable W3C Rule-Interchange-Format ( RIF ) , converting domain knowledge within ontologies into Horn Logic axioms and terms , and merging them with semantic compatible RIF rules .', u'Subsumption reasoning and consistency checks of such ontology/rule models deliver expressive domain models .', u'According to transformation and conversion tasks , R2RIF delivers generic algorithms and workflows to be adaptable for different ontology and rule languages .']

entities: [[(u'OAEI Benchmark test set', u'Material'), (u'ontology matching systems', u'Method')], [], [(u'flexible test generator', u'Method'), (u'alterators', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'seed ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'alteration modalities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'seed ontology', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic')], [(u'seed ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Benchmark', u'Method')], [(u'generator', u'Generic'), (u'test sets', u'Generic'), (u'Benchmark', u'Method')], [], [(u'discriminability', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'OAEI Benchmark test set', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'ontology matching systems')], [], [(u'alterators', u'USED-FOR', u'flexible test generator')], [(u'seed ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'It')], [], [], [(u'generator', u'USED-FOR', u'test sets')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The OAEI Benchmark test set has been used for many years as a main reference to evaluate and compare ontology matching systems .', u'However , this test set has barely varied since 2004 and has become a relatively easy task for matchers .', u'In this paper , we present the design of a flexible test generator based on an extensible set of alterators which may be used programmatically for generating different test sets from different seed ontologies and different alteration modalities .', u'It has been used for reproducing Benchmark both with the original seed ontology and with other ontologies .', u'This highlights the remarkable stability of results over different generations and the preservation of difficulty across seed ontologies , as well as a systematic bias towards the initial Benchmark test set and the inability of such tests to identify an overall winning matcher .', u'These were exactly the properties for which Benchmark had been designed .', u'Furthermore , the generator has been used for providing new test sets aiming at increasing the difficulty and discriminability of Benchmark .', u'Although difficulty may be easily increased with the generator , attempts to increase discriminability proved unfruitful .', u'However , efforts towards this goal raise questions about the very nature of discriminability .']

sentences: [u'This paper introduces a new similarity measure based on edge counting in a taxonomy like WorldNet or Ontology .', u'Measurement of similarity between text segments or concepts is very useful for many applications like information retrieval , ontology matching , text mining , and question answering and so on .', u'Several measures have been developed for measuring similarity between two concepts : out of these we see that the measure given by Wu and Palmer [ 1 ] is simple , and gives good performance .', u'Our measure is # R # # N # based on their measure but strengthens it .', u'Wu and Palmer [ 1 ] measure has a disadvantage that it does not # R # # N # consider how far the concepts are semantically .', u'In our measure we include the shortest path between the # R # # N # concepts and the depth of whole taxonomy together with the distances used in Wu and Palmer [ 1 ] .', u'Also the # R # # N # measure has following disadvantage i.e .', u'in some situations , the similarity of two elements of an IS-A ontology contained in the neighbourhood exceeds the similarity value of two elements contained in the same hierarchy .', u'Our measure introduces a penalization factor for this case based upon shortest length between the concepts and depth of whole taxonomy .']

entities: [[(u'biomedical terminologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information sharing', u'Task')], [(u'automated methods', u'Method'), (u'mapping process', u'Task')], [(u'automated approach', u'Method'), (u'mapping external terminologies', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'sequential combination', u'Method'), (u'ontology matching', u'Task')], [(u'lexical technique', u'Method'), (u'external terminology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'UMLS', u'Method')], [(u'structure-based technique', u'Method'), (u'lexical alignmentby computing paths', u'Method'), (u'top-level concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'top-level concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'external terminology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'UMLS', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'large-scale biomedical thesaurus EMTREE', u'Material'), (u'UMLS Metathesaurus', u'Material')], [(u'EMTREE terms', u'Metric'), (u'EMTREE concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic')], [(u'total lexical alignment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'lexical mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'global precision', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[], [(u'automated methods', u'USED-FOR', u'mapping process')], [(u'automated approach', u'USED-FOR', u'mapping external terminologies')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology matching'), (u'sequential combination', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology matching')], [], [(u'structure-based technique', u'USED-FOR', u'top-level concepts')], [(u'large-scale biomedical thesaurus EMTREE', u'USED-FOR', u'UMLS Metathesaurus')], [], [], [], [(u'global precision', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'method')]]
sentences: [u'Nowadays , providing interoperability between different biomedical terminologies is a critical issue for efficient information sharing .', u'One problem making interoperability difficult is the lack of automated methods simplifying the mapping process .', u'In this study , we propose an automated approach to mapping external terminologies to the Unified Medical Language System ( UMLS ) .', u'Our approach applies a sequential combination of two basic matching methods classically used in ontology matching .', u'First , a lexical technique identifies similar strings between the external terminology and the UMLS .', u'Second , a structure-based technique validates , in part , the lexical alignmentby computing paths to top-level concepts and checking the compatibility of these top-level concepts across the external terminology and the UMLS .', u'The method was applied to the mapping of the large-scale biomedical thesaurus EMTREE to the complete UMLS Metathesaurus .', u'In total , 47.9 % coverage of EMTREE terms was reached , leading to 80 % coverage of EMTREE concepts .', u'Our method has revealed a high compatibility in 6 out of 15 top-level categories across terminologies .', u'The validation of lexical mappings ranges over 75.8 % of the total lexical alignment .', u'Overall , the method rules out a total of 6927 ( 7.9 % ) lexical mappings , with a global precision of 78 % .']

sentences: [u'Products generate a large amount of information during their lifecycle .', u'Small and medium enterprises often lack an efficient management of such an amount of information .', u'Several tools of product lifecycle management have been developed in the last years to address this issue , but they are rarely exploited by companies , especially SMEs .', u'The aim of our work is to present a semantic platform to integrate data along the whole product lifecycle to allow semantic search and knowledge reuse .', u'The integration of data is realised with a reference PLM ontology , containing the main concepts and relations to describe a PLM .', u'This ontology has a modular structure , so that it can be easily extended to describe concrete product lifecycles .', u'An example of a real application of the semantic platform in an industrial case is reported .']

entities: [[(u'semantic searching', u'Task'), (u'semantic similarity calculation model', u'Method'), (u'semantic similarity calculation model', u'Method'), (u'PHSS', u'Method'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'semantic search system', u'Method'), (u'CDPPIRS', u'Method'), (u'semantic reasoning', u'Method'), (u'query information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'CDPPIRS', u'Method'), (u'PHSS model', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic similarity calculation model', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic searching'), (u'semantic search system', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic reasoning')]]
sentences: [u'In the semantic searching , the semantic similarity calculation model is crucial to ensure the searching results being all-sided and exact.A new semantic similarity calculation model , PHSS , was proposed based on improving the traditional models.Both the hierarchy and the property restrictions of the concepts were taken into consideration in this new model.The semantic distance between two concepts was described more accurately.Based on this model , a semantic search system , CDPPIRS , for preventing and curing plant disease and insect pests of corn was also constructed.This system can carry out semantic reasoning based on query information and the repository , and provide accurate bibliographies to the users according to their different kinds of enquiries.This system satisfies the enquiries of different level agricultural professionals.Experiment results in CDPPIRS show that the PHSS model is better than traditional models .']

sentences: [u'This paper presents a novel approach of the semantic similarity measure that support the image retrieval systems .', u'The approach is composed of five stages : ( 1 ) data collection , ( 2 ) image annotation , ( 3 ) conceptual graph representation , ( 4 ) similarity matching , and ( 5 ) shows a semantic search result .', u'First stage is collecting the contents into database archive .', u'Label Me tool is used to annotate images .', u'Next stage is representing an image into the conceptual graph .', u'Third stage is finding the similarity matching between the conceptual graph and representative graph .', u'Last stage is showing the set semantic of image results .', u'The results are compared to the classification methods .', u'The experimental results indicate that our proposed approach offers significant performance improvements in the interpretation of semantic images , compared , with the maximum of 88.8 % accuracy .']

sentences: [u'The main aim of this research is to deal with semantic search based on personalized facets in linked open data .', u'User profile is learned from his/her activities and preferences in social networks using tf-idf feature vector model .', u'A faceted graph visualization for result collaborative filtering is proposed .', u'The facets are vertices representing ontological concepts .', u'Other vertices represent instances belonging to the concepts , which are known as facets values .', u'The vertices are highlighted by matching between facets and user profile in order to individually produce search interfaces .', u'The ties between vertices are ontological relations or properties considering as variables/attributes of facets .', u'An algorithm to construct the faceted graph visualization and collaboratively filter search result is also provided .', u'The faceted search method presented here is implemented to demonstrate these ideas .']

entities: [[(u'Peer-to-Peer systems', u'Method')], [(u'semantic approach', u'Method'), (u'data objects', u'Task'), (u'E-Commerce Peer-to-Peer applications', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'global predefined ontology', u'Method'), (u'UNSO approach', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'data objects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'multi-layered hypercube graph topology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic search', u'Task')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'Peer-to-Peer data management applications', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Weakly organized structure of Peer-to-Peer systems may cause severe data management problems and high communication overheads .', u'We partially resolve these problems by developing a novel semantic approach to efficiently create , search and organize data objects in E-Commerce Peer-to-Peer applications .', u'The approach is based on the notion of Unspecified Ontology ( UNSO ) .', u'Unlike many existing systems using a global predefined ontology , UNSO approach assumes that the ontology is not fully defined , leaving some parts of it to be dynamically specified by the users .', u'The data objects inserted to the system organize a multi-layered hypercube graph topology , providing a stable infrastructure for efficient semantic search and routing operations .', u'The proposed method has a potential of becoming a practical infrastructure for Peer-to-Peer data management applications .']

entities: [[(u'Distributed and collaborative software development', u'Method'), (u'source code repositories', u'Method'), (u'GitHub', u'Material')], [(u'code repositories', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'domain', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'code repository', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'latent co-development network', u'Method')], [(u'clusters', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'prototype', u'Generic'), (u'semantic search', u'Task'), (u'source code repositories', u'Material')], [(u'model', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'GitHub', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'source code repositories')], [], [], [(u'latent co-development network', u'USED-FOR', u'model')], [], [(u'prototype', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search')], []]
sentences: [u'Distributed and collaborative software development has increased the popularity of source code repositories like GitHub .', u'With the number of projects in such code repositories exceeding millions , it is important to identify the domains to which the projects belong .', u'A domain is a concept or a hierarchy of concepts used to categorize a project .', u'We have proposed a model to cluster projects in a code repository by mining the latent co-development network .', u'These identified clusters are mapped to domains with the help of a taxonomy which we constructed using the metadata from an online Question and Answer ( Q & A ) website .', u'To demonstrate the validity of the model , we built a prototype for semantic search on source code repositories .', u'In this paper , we outline the proposed model and present the early results .']

sentences: [u'A cascading learning system as a normalized semantic search is described .', u'The cascading learning system has a request analyzer , a request dispatcher and classifier , a search module , a terminology manager , and a cluster manager .', u'The request analyzer receives a request for search terms from a client application .', u'The request analyzer has a normalization manager , a semantic parser , and a context builder .', u'The normalization manager normalizes the search terms and generates a normalized semantic request based on a context .', u'The request dispatcher and classifier classifies and dispatches the normalized semantic request to a corresponding domain-specific module that generates a prediction with a trained probability of an expected output .', u'The terminology manager receives the normalized semantic request from the request dispatcher and classifier , and manages terminology stored in a contextual network .']

entities: [[(u'groupware solutions', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'inter-enterprise collabora- tion', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'legacy applications', u'Task'), (u'management of shared collaboration spaces', u'Task'), (u'email', u'Metric'), (u"SME 's side", u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information extraction', u'Task'), (u'semantic search', u'Task'), (u'inter-enterprise collaborations', u'Task'), (u'automatic tagging of documents', u'Task'), (u'business process models', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'software development supply chain', u'Task'), (u'SMEs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'LEs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'cooperation situations', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'inter-enterprise collabora- tion')], [(u'email', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search'), (u'email', u'USED-FOR', u'automatic tagging of documents'), (u'information extraction', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search'), (u'information extraction', u'USED-FOR', u'inter-enterprise collaborations'), (u'information extraction', u'CONJUNCTION', u'automatic tagging of documents'), (u'inter-enterprise collaborations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'automatic tagging of documents'), (u'automatic tagging of documents', u'CONJUNCTION', u'business process models')], [(u'application cases', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'approach'), (u'product development', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'application cases'), (u'product development', u'CONJUNCTION', u'software development supply chain'), (u'software development supply chain', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'approach'), (u'software development supply chain', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'application cases'), (u'software development supply chain', u'CONJUNCTION', u'supply chain collaboration'), (u'software development supply chain', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SMEs'), (u'supply chain collaboration', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'application cases'), (u'SMEs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'LEs')], []]
sentences: [u'Collaboration between large and small & medium-sized enterprises is still not adequately supported by current groupware solutions .', u'In this paper , we present a novel approach that addresses the challenges of inter-enterprise collabora- tion .', u"Key elements of our approach are : interoperability to legacy applications to retain current working styles , basic services for sharing and management of shared collaboration spaces , use of email for collaboration especially on the SME 's side , information extraction to enable semantic search in inter-enterprise collaborations and automatic tagging of documents , and integration of business process models .", u'We evaluated the approach on three application cases in the workplace : new product development , software development supply chain , and supply chain collaboration between SMEs and LEs .', u'Our results suggest that the implemented services are bene- ficial in typical cooperation situations between enterprises .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic search engines', u'Method'), (u'semantic connections', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'folksonomies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'controlled ontological vocabularies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'clustering', u'Method')], [(u'FolksEngine', u'Method'), (u'parametric search engine', u'Method'), (u'folksonomies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'clustering algorithm', u'Method'), (u'users query', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'plain folksonomy search engine', u'Method'), (u'semantic rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'folksonomic tags', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic connections', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic search engines')], [], [], [(u'FolksEngine', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'parametric search engine'), (u'FolksEngine', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'clustering algorithm'), (u'parametric search engine', u'USED-FOR', u'folksonomies')]]
sentences: [u'Semantic search engines rely on the existence of a rich set of semantic connections between the concepts associated to documents and those used for the queries .', u'With folksonomies , this is not always guaranteed .', u'Creating clusters of folksonomic tags around terms of controlled ontological vocabularies is a potentially sophisticated approach , but algorithms abound for this clustering and no clear cut winner exists .', u'In this paper we introduce FolksEngine , a parametric search engine for folksonomies allowing to specify any clustering algorithm as a three step process : the users query is expanded according to semantic rules associated to the terms of the query , the new query is then executed on the plain folksonomy search engine , and the results are ranked according to semantic rules associated to the folksonomic tags actually used for the documents .']

sentences: [u'Frame Analysis has come to play an increasingly stronger role in the study of social movements in Sociology and Political Science .', u'While significant steps have been made in providing a theory of frames and framing , a systematic characterization of the frame concept is still largely lacking and there are no rec-ognized criteria and methods that can be used to identify and marshal frame evi-dence reliably and in a time and cost effective manner .', u'Consequently , current Frame Analysis work is still too reliant on manual annotation and subjective inter-pretation .', u'The goal of this paper is to present an approach to the representation , acquisition and analysis of frame evidence which leverages Content Analysis , In-formation Extraction and Semantic Search methods to provide a systematic treat-ment of a Frame Analysis and automate frame annotation .']

sentences: [u'A data dependency path calculator for a semantic search engine is provided .', u'A body of semantically related data is modeled according to a semantic data model .', u'A user is presented a list of data elements from which they may select desired data elements .', u'The system automatically calculates all of the possible paths through the database that may be used to retrieve meaningful data based on the selected data elements .', u'The available data dependency paths are returned to the user for selection .', u'The system further provides a type of data permission that allows restricted data elements to be used as a pass-through data element for relating , connecting and retrieving non-restricted data .', u'Thus , a user can use restricted data to create data dependency paths to retrieve meaningful data .']
