relations: [[(u'Technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'word senses'), (u'word senses', u'CONJUNCTION', u'hypernyms')], [(u'weights', u'USED-FOR', u'natural language processing applications'), (u'information indexing', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'natural language processing applications'), (u'information indexing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'querying'), (u'querying', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'natural language processing applications')], [], [(u'WHW scores', u'USED-FOR', u'indexing'), (u'information indexing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'querying')], [(u'WHW scores', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search technique')], []]
sentences: [u'Technologies are described herein for probabilistically assigning weights to word senses and hypernyms of a word .', u'The weights can be used in natural language processing applications such as information indexing and querying .', u'A word hypernym weight ( WHW ) score can be determined by summing word sense probabilities of word senses from which the hypernym is inherited .', u'WHW scores can be used to prune away hypernyms prior to indexing , to rank query results , and for other functions related to information indexing and querying .', u'A semantic search technique can use WHW scores to retrieve an entry related to a word from an index in response to matching an indexed hypernym of the word with a query term applied to the index .', u'More refined and accurate query results may be provided based on reduced user inputs .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Search Engine', u'Task'), (u'Lexical Functions', u'Method'), (u'Meaning-Text Criteria', u'Method'), (u'semantic matching process', u'Method'), (u'natural language query', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic matching degree', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'tokenized words', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic representations', u'Method'), (u'Meaning Text Theory', u'Method'), (u'Lexical Functions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic category', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u"Semantic Search Engine using Lexical Functions and Meaning-Text Criteria , that outputs a response ( R ) as the result of a semantic matching process consisting in comparing a natural language query ( Q ) with a plurality of contents ( C ) , formed of phrases or expressions obtained from a contents ' database ( 6 ) , and selecting the response ( R ) as being the contents corresponding to the comparison having a best semantic matching degree .", u'It involves the transformation of the contents ( C ) and the query in individual words or groups of tokenized words ( W1 , W2 ) , which are transformed in its turn into semantic representations ( LSC1 , LSC2 ) thereof , by applying the rules of Meaning Text Theory and through Lexical Functions , the said semantic representations ( LSC1 , LSC2 ) consisting each of a couple formed of a lemma ( L ) plus a semantic category ( SC ) .']

sentences: [u'Terminology extraction resources are needed for a wide range of human language technology applications , including # R # # N # knowledge management , information extraction , semantic search , cross-language information retrieval and automatic and # R # # N # assisted translation .', u'We report a low cost method for creating terminology extraction resources for 21 non-English EU # R # # N # languages .', u'Using parallel corpora and a projection method , we create a General POS Tagger for these languages .', u'We also # R # # N # investigate the use of EuroVoc terms and Wikipedia to automatically create a term grammar for each language .', u'Our results # R # # N # show that these automatically generated resources can assist the term extraction process , achieving similar performance to # R # # N # manually generated resources .', u'All POS tagger and term grammar resources resulting from this work are freely available # R # # N # for download .']

entities: [[(u'information revolution', u'Task'), (u'digital contents', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'personal smart devices', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'search engines', u'Method')], [], [(u'insensible information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'dynamic generation of refining categories', u'Task'), (u'ontology-based semantic search systems', u'Method')], [(u'measure', u'Generic'), (u'dynamic selection of categories', u'Task'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'appro- priate order', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'evaluative measures', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'dynamic generation of refining categories')], [(u'measure', u'CONJUNCTION', u'algorithm'), (u'measure', u'USED-FOR', u'them'), (u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'them')], [(u'evaluative measures', u'USED-FOR', u'it'), (u'evaluative measures', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')]]
sentences: [u'In the era of information revolution , the amount of digital contents is growing explosively with the advent of personal smart devices .', u'The consump- tion of the digital contents makes users depend heavily on search engines to search what they want .', u'Search requires tedious review of search results from users currently , and so alleviates it ; predefined and fixed categories are pro- vided to refine results .', u'Since fixed categories never reflect the difference of queries and search results , they often contain insensible information .', u'This paper proposes a method for the dynamic generation of refining categories under the ontology-based semantic search systems .', u'It specifically suggests a measure for dynamic selection of categories and an algorithm to arrange them in an appro- priate order .', u'Finally , it proves the validity of the proposed approach by using some evaluative measures .']

sentences: [u'To perform a semantic search on a large dataset of images , we need to be able to transform the visual content of images ( colors , textures , shapes ) into semantic information .', u'This transformation , called image annotation , assigns a caption or keywords to the visual content in a digital image .', u'In this paper we try to resolve partially the region homogeneity problem in image annotation , we propose an approach to annotate image based on grouping adjacent regions , we use the k-means algorithm as the segmentation algorithm while the texture and GIST descriptors are used as features to represent image content .', u'The Bayesian networks were been used as classifiers in order to find and allocate the appropriate keywords to this content .', u'The experimental results were been obtained from the ETH-80 image database .']

entities: [[(u'semantic searching', u'Task'), (u'web scale', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'semantic repositories', u'Method'), (u'relational databases', u'Material'), (u'latter', u'Generic'), (u'occurrence statistics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'inference', u'Task'), (u'formal knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'tasks', u'Generic'), (u'search engines', u'Method')], [(u'chapter', u'Generic'), (u'indexing schema', u'Method'), (u'semantic search', u'Task'), (u'entity occurrence', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'indexing', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'faceted search interface', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'co-occurrence', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'This chapter focuses on semantic searching at web scale .', u'The solution presented takes advantage of the specific strengths of semantic repositories and the raw power of relational databases , the latter having been developed over decades and capable of handling efficiently large volumes of data with fixed structure ( which is the case with the occurrence statistics ) and the former allowing for inference and querying on top of formal knowledge .', u'The interactive faceted search capability described is a demonstration how an approach based on these two technologies is more powerful and efficient for certain tasks as compared to traditional search engines .', u'The contributions of the chapter can be summarized as follows : novel indexing schema for semantic search , based on entity occurrence ; description of a scalable implementation of such indexing ; advanced faceted search interface , based on co-occurrence .']

entities: [[(u'raw un-edited audio visual content', u'Material')], [(u'multimedia indexing', u'Task'), (u'annotation', u'Task'), (u'search and retrieval', u'Task'), (u'RUSHES', u'Method'), (u'automatic semantic annotation', u'Task'), (u'indexing', u'Task'), (u'retrieval of raw and un-edited audio-visual content', u'Task')], [], [(u'automatic annotation', u'Task'), (u'RUSHES search engine', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'multimedia indexing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'annotation'), (u'automatic semantic annotation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'indexing')], [(u'technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search')], []]
sentences: [u'Multimedia analysis and reuse of raw un-edited audio visual content known as rushes is gaining acceptance by a large number of research labs and companies .', u'A set of research projects are considering multimedia indexing , annotation , search and retrieval in the context of European funded research , but only the FP6 project RUSHES is focusing on automatic semantic annotation , indexing and retrieval of raw and un-edited audio-visual content .', u'Even professional content creators and providers as well as home-users are dealing with this type of content and therefore novel technologies for semantic search and retrieval are required .', u'In this paper , we present a summary of the most relevant achievements of the RUSHES project , focusing on specific approaches for automatic annotation as well as the main features of the final RUSHES search engine .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Search Engine', u'Task'), (u'Lexical Functions', u'Method'), (u'Meaning-Text Criteria', u'Method'), (u'semantic matching process', u'Method'), (u'natural language query', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic matching degree', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'tokenized words', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic representations', u'Method'), (u'Meaning Text Theory', u'Method'), (u'Lexical Functions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic category', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Lexical Functions', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Search Engine'), (u'Lexical Functions', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Meaning-Text Criteria'), (u'Meaning-Text Criteria', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Search Engine')], []]
sentences: [u"Semantic Search Engine using Lexical Functions and Meaning-Text Criteria , that outputs a response ( R ) as the result of a semantic matching process consisting in comparing a natural language query ( Q ) with a plurality of contents ( C ) , formed of phrases or expressions obtained from a contents ' database ( 6 ) , and selecting the response ( R ) as being the contents corresponding to the comparison having a best semantic matching degree .", u'It involves the transformation of the contents ( C ) and the query in individual words or groups of tokenized words ( W1 , W2 ) , which are transformed in its turn into semantic representations ( LSC1 , LSC2 ) thereof , by applying the rules of Meaning Text Theory and through Lexical Functions , the said semantic representations ( LSC1 , LSC2 ) consisting each of a couple formed of a lemma ( L ) plus a semantic category ( SC ) .']

sentences: [u'Entity ranking is a recent paradigm that refers to retrieving and ranking related objects and entities from different structured sources in various scenarios .', u'Entities typically have associated categories and relationships with other entities .', u'In this work , we present an extensive analysis of Web-scale entity ranking , based on machine learned ranking models using an ensemble of pairwise preference models .', u'Our proposed system for entity ranking uses structured knowledge bases , entity relationship graphs and user data to derive useful features to facilitate semantic search with entities directly within the learning to rank framework .', u'The experimental results are validated on a large-scale graph containing millions of entities and hundreds of millions of entity relationships .', u'We show that our proposed ranking solution clearly improves a simple user behavior based ranking model .']

entities: [[(u'APIs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Enterprise Services ESs', u'Method'), (u'enterprise Service-Oriented Architecture eSOA', u'Method')], [(u'WebAPIs', u'Method'), (u'API operations', u'Task')], [(u'Information Retrieval IR methods', u'Method'), (u'API descriptions', u'Material'), (u'semantic search technologies', u'Method'), (u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'formal queries', u'Material')], [(u'iterative keyword search', u'Method')], [(u'knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'model-driven engineering', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'user study', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'domain ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search technologies'), (u'domain ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'formal queries'), (u'formal queries', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search technologies')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The consumption of APIs , such as Enterprise Services ESs in an enterprise Service-Oriented Architecture eSOA , has largely been a task for experienced developers .', u'With the rapidly growing number of such WebAPIs , users with little or no experience in a given API face the problem of finding relevant API operations -- - e.g. , mashups developers .', u'However , building an effective search has been a challenge : Information Retrieval IR methods struggle with the brevity of text in API descriptions , whereas semantic search technologies require domain ontologies and formal queries .', u'Motivated by the search behavior of users , we propose an iterative keyword search based on entities .', u'The entities are part of a knowledge base , whose content stems from model-driven engineering .', u'We implemented our approach and conducted a user study showing significant improvements in search effectiveness .']

entities: [[(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'learning materials', u'Material')], [(u'Metametadata', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'learning objects', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'metametadata taxonomy', u'Method'), (u'semantic search engine', u'Method')], [(u'ontological views', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pedagogical content of metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'learning objects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pedagogical attributes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'metametadata taxonomy', u'Method')], [(u'ontological approach', u'Method'), (u'metametadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'metametadata taxonomy', u'Method'), (u'semantic searching mechanism', u'Method')], [(u'taxonomy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontological views', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'search algorithm', u'Method'), (u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'OMESCOD )', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'metametadata taxonomy', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search engine')], [(u'ontological views', u'USED-FOR', u'pedagogical content of metadata')], [(u'ontological approach', u'CONJUNCTION', u'metametadata')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper focuses on a novel method for semantic searching and retrieval of information about learning materials .', u'Metametadata encapsulate metadata instances by using the properties and attributes provided by ontologies rather than describing learning objects .', u'A novel metametadata taxonomy has been developed which provides the basis for a semantic search engine to extract , match and map queries to retrieve relevant results .', u'The use of ontological views is a foundation for viewing the pedagogical content of metadata extracted from learning objects by using the pedagogical attributes from the metametadata taxonomy .', u'Using the ontological approach and metametadata ( based on the metametadata taxonomy ) we present a novel semantic searching mechanism .', u'These three strands the taxonomy , the ontological views , and the search algorithm are incorporated into a novel architecture ( OMESCOD ) which has been implemented .']

sentences: [u'Spoken interaction with machines is not yet commonplace , despite extensive research and some commercial successes .', u'Systems that allow unlimited conversation with arbitrary speakers are still to be seen .', u'In addition to computational difficulties , environmental noise , social issues , multiple languages , and the general ambiguity of human dialogue , one fundamental aspect behind the problem is the generic difficulty of determining the space of discourse .', u'To limit this semantic search space , we hope to get a little help from the contextual info available in ubiquitous computing environments .', u'We discuss some developments in the areas of user profiling , context awareness , sensor networks , social clues , and semantic networks , together with some expectations of how the gained additional information can enhance spoken interaction .', u'We then look at some applications made possible by these developments and suggest topics for further research .']

sentences: [u'Nowadays , there are a lot of IT Careers ( ITC ) which are not stored in a hierarchical structure of ITC specification and matching search based on keyword have widely use search which can not acquire satisfactory search results .', u'The essential reason is that traditional ITC search lacks semantic .', u'In this paper , we propose searching ITC concepts based on ontology which is associated specification with semantic annotation .', u'IT Careers Ontology ( ITCO ) defined structure consists of three main parts : IT Career Category , IT Skill and IT Education which are described with announcing the recruitment on web jobs ads that are instances of a models .', u'The experimental results show that semantic search ITC can overcome limitations of search by comparison with traditional keyword search mode , and achieve higher recall ration and precision ratio .']

entities: [[(u'Information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'web retrieval system', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic search', u'Method'), (u'topic detection techniques', u'Method')], [(u'prototype system', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'web retrieval system')], [(u'semantic search', u'CONJUNCTION', u'topic detection techniques')], []]
sentences: [u'Information retrieval is moving beyond the stage where users simply type one or more keywords and retrieve a ranked list of documents .', u'In such a scenario users have to go through the returned documents in order to find what they are actually looking for .', u'More often they would like to get targeted answers to their queries without extraneous information , even if their requirements are not well specified .', u'In this paper we propose an approach for designing a web retrieval system able to find the desired information through several interactions with the users .', u'The proposed approach allows to overcome the problems deriving from ambiguous or too vague queries , using semantic search and topic detection techniques .', u'The results of the very first experiments on a prototype system are also reported .']

sentences: [u"In recent years , more and more users hope the search results can meet human 's demand when they use a search engine .", u'On the basis of analysis and study on the open source Lucene system architecture , a semantic search system is designed based on the special XML data sources in this paper .', u"What 's more , we use the word item location and word semantic to improve the Lucene 's search results and conduct experiments to test and verify the retrieval performance , the accuracy of similarity search , the space efficiency of index and the time-efficiency of supporting inquiry : And finally by deploying the Tomcat server to implement our implement system .", u'The experiment results prove that compared with the original Lucene indexing system , our system can improve the indexing efficiency , query efficiency and accuracy .']

sentences: [u'With the growing number of web services , there arise issues of finding relevant services .', u'But , a web service is typically published by registering its WSDL file and a brief description in UDDI business registries .', u'This limits the search mechanism for web services to keyword based searches .', u'In order to overcome shortcomings of keyword based search , there are several attempts to use clustering or ontology for web services search .', u'However , many weaknesses are remained in these approaches .', u'In this paper , we propose a semantic search engine of web services that can improve the recall and the precision using both the clustering approach and the ontology approach .', u'To this purpose , The experimental results show that our system has higher performances both in the rate of recall and precision compared to the existing method .']

sentences: [u': # R # # N # TripleMap [ 1 ] is a web-based semantic search and knowledge collaboration application for the biomedical research community .', u'Users can register for free and login from anywhere in the world using a standard web browser .', u'TripleMap allows users to search through and analyze the connections in a massive interconnected network of publicly available data being continuously compiled from Linking Open Drug Data [ 2 ] sources , the entire corpus of PubMed abstracts and full text articles , more than 10 000 biomedical research relevant RSS feeds , and continuously updating patent literature .', u"TripleMap represents everything in its data network as 'master entities ' that integrate all information for any given entity .", u"By searching for , and saving sets of entities , users build , share , and analyze 'dynamic knowledge maps ' of entities and their associations ."]

sentences: [u'The semantic methodologies attempt to understand the meaning of data and associate data in meaningful ways .', u'After almost a decade of vivid research , we now have a number of practical semantic applications that are in use .', u'A few commercial semantic search systems like Powerset have been launched commercially , and specialized semantic applications are now used for travel planning , user profiling , Name Extraction , Filtering Data , Mounting Data among other functions .', u'Ontologies are to some extent used for integrating large-scale applications and reporting data from heterogeneous systems .', u'In this paper different ontology languages are discussed .', u'The very important task is to find out the methods of integrating web engineering and Ontology for upgrading the solutions of real life problems and it helps to resolve the task easier and in more automated way .']

sentences: [u'The knowledge about pressure equipment failure modes and rates is essential for the risk management .', u'In the Seventies an incomparable effort was made by National Authorities , which at that time controlled the pressure equipment , aiming at providing the industry with trustable reliability parameters , which are still in us , even though repeatedly amended by experts .', u'In order to revive and update the knowledge on this matter , the judgment of the experts is not enough and much more data on the field must be gathered .', u'Experimental studies on a large scale are now impossible , thus the only way is to exploit potential of semantic search and the huge data in the public domain .', u'The information scattered in the web , tied together , may provide industry and authorities with the knowledge they need to make the right decisions .']

sentences: [u'Purpose : We aimed to identify pathways involved in experimental right ventricular failure ( RVF ) due to chronic pressure overload. # N # # N # Methods : Wistar rats were subjected to pulmonary artery banding ( PAB ) ( 1.1mm , n=12 ) or sham surgery ( CON , n=7 ) and then daily checked for clinical signs of RVF ( inactivity , ruffled fur , dyspnea , ascites ) .', u'At the onset of clinical RVF ( necessitating termination ) pressure-volume analysis was performed in the rats with RVF and in randomly selected PAB rats without clinical signs of RVF ( RVDysfunction , RVD ) at the same time points .', u'Gene micro array was performed on RV tissue using GeneChip Rat Gene 1.1 ST ( Affymetrics ) .', u'Quality control and normalization ( RMA ) were performed according to international standards .', u'False discovery rate was set to 1.3 in RVF vs. RVD .', u'Micro array data were analyzed using gene-set enrichment analysis ( GSEA ) , gene ontology mapping ( biological processes ) ( ErmineJ ) and pathway analysis ( DAVID ) . # N # # N # Results : All rats with PAB had RV dysfunction , but clinical RVF ensued in only 5 rats , after a period of 525 days .', u'RVF rats had pericardial effusion , liver congestion , and widely dilated right atria , in contrast to RVD rats .', u'RVF rats also had significantly lower cardiac index ( 0.100.04 vs. 0.190.04 mL/min/g , RVF vs. RVD , p < 0.05 ) .', u'In RVF contractility was preserved ( end systolic elastance 269173 vs. 10144mmHg/mL , ns ) , but diastolic function deteriorated ( end diastolic elastance 3221 vs. 114mmHg/mL ; end diastolic pressure 63 vs. 31mmHg , RVF vs. RVD , p < 0.05 ) . # N # # N # We identified 9 pathways that were differentially regulated in RVF vs. RVD .', u'Among these , the dilated cardiomyopathy ( DCM ) KEGG-pathway was negatively enriched in RVF compared to RVD ( normalized enrichment score= -1.94 , p < 0.05 ) .', u'Gene ontology mapping supported the dysregulation of the DCM pathway in RVF ; 10 ontology categories overlapping with the DCM pathway were strongly decreased in RVF vs. RVD ( p < 1.00E-10 for all categories ) .', u'Further pathway analysis and comparison to CON , revealed that within the DCM pathway , the dysregulation involved transforming growth factor beta ( TGF ) 2 ( Rank Metric Score : -4.316 RVF vs. RVD ) , TGF 3 ( RMS : -3.840 ) and specific calcium channel-subunits : CACNA2D2 ( RMS : -2.429 ) , CACNA2D3 ( RMS : -1.754 ) , CACNA1D ( RMS : -1.730 ) and CACNB3 ( RMS : -2.429 ) . # N # # N # Conclusions : We identified novel pathways involved in experimental RVF .', u'RVF is associated with dysregulation of specific parts of the dilated cardiomyopathy pathway .', u'New studies should explore whether an imbalance in TGF activation or alterations in calcium cycling are central in the pathobiology of RVF .']

sentences: [u"Today 's search engines are still very sensitive to the way queries are constructed .", u'In some occasions , equivalent but slightly different forms of a query lead to completely different results .', u'However , popular queries with only one right answer seem to be generally well served by search engines , which generally return the correct answer among their top 10 search results .', u"Internet 's redundancy of information and the recent proliferation of user generated content helps search engines to remain almost entirely keyword oriented and still robustly handle equivalent versions of queries .", u'In this paper we propose a family of metrics to evaluate the semantical invariance of a given search engine , and we report experimental results for well-known engines such as Google , Yahoo ! , Live and Ask.com , as well as for new semantic search engines like Hakia and Cuil .']

sentences: [u"Information relevant for patent officers as well as research staff is hidden in huge amounts of patents -- - both , patents ' text and images being valuable knowledge sources .", u'The retrieval process to discover this knowledge is time consuming and therefore costly .', u'Missing the relevant information may even be mission critical .', u'This industry paper presents key functionality of a search and analysis solution built on top of the m2n Knowledge Discovery Suite and its use as retrieval , exploration and collaboration platform in the norm and patent domain .', u'Semantic data harmonization , knowledge extraction and disambiguation , semantic search and graphical analysis are key features in order to support the patent officer as well as the research staff .', u'A newly built module for semantic image analysis and exploration , linking semantically enriched metadata and figures to -- - before -- - unstructured text , is introduced .']

sentences: [u'This system proposes Indian-logic ontology based Context-aware Query Refinement model to support context-sensitive semantic search in keyword based search engine .', u'This is by formulating effective query using Indian logic based Ontology for Context identification to overcome ambiguous query terms and increase the relevancy of documents retrieved .', u'Here we propose Indian-Logic based Context Ontology for Context representation of ambiguous keywords along with Domain Ontology for complete domain knowledge .', u'This system effectively uses these ontologies to identify the context and iteratively refine the query .', u'This system visualizes results based on ontology to easily obtain an overall picture of the types of results obtained and also gives indication of relationships and subcategories within the refined results .', u'The experiment result shows that our proposed method shows better precision compared over normal search engine results .']

sentences: [u'We describe here a system and method for creating , maintaining and using a semantic search engine environment for precise retrieval of curated answers to questions where the answers may be drawn from an authoritative document collection .', u"The invention combines processing by human developers and software : semantic editing tools for creating , storing , maintaining queries and variants of queries , and query and document passage categories ; links from queries to text passages that provide answers to these queries ; a document retrieval store ; means for matching user queries against stored queries ; means for creating , storing , maintaining , and retrieving semantic and management metadata and categories about queries and documents and using these data for navigating the document collection ; and means for finding information related to the user 's information need by text and semantic similarity retrieval ."]

sentences: [u'Systems and methods for semantic search are provided .', u'A corpus of information grouped into passages are indexed by semantic key terms generated from packed knowledge representations that document the semantic relationships of information within those passages .', u'When a search is conducted , a query is similarly transformed into a packed knowledge representation that documents the semantic relationships from which semantic key terms are also generated .', u'An inverted index relating the semantic key terms associated to the passages is searched using the semantic key terms generated from the query .', u'A set of candidate passages is selected and refined by analysis of the semantic key terms and other information .', u'The semantic representations associated with the set of candidate passages are then matched to the semantic representation of the query to determine a search result set .']

sentences: [u'This paper aims to contribute to the debate on OPAC enhancement , and in particular it concerns the use of ranking queries results considering the supposed relevance for users , mainly based on the terms frequency and inverse document frequency ( TF/IDF ) , until now used by search engines and on line bookstores , and recently applied to OPAC .', u'Some notable example of new generation OPAC ( NCSU Libraries , LIBRIS , AQUABROWSER Library Platform ) are described .', u'The critical examination of the use of relevance ranking gives the opportunity to analyse the concepts of relevance and pertinence from a theoretical point of view .', u'Pertinence perspective , in particular , that considers the level of knowledge of users , offers the chance to enhance semantic search functions in OPAC , following indexing strategies which allow to put in evidence topic variety and different levels of topic examination .']

sentences: [u'We describe a large coreference annotation task performed on a corpus of 266 papers from the ACL Anthology , a publicly , electronically available collection of scientific papers in the domain of computational linguistics and language technology .', u'The annotation comprises mainly noun phrase coreference of the full textual content of each paper in the Anthology subset .', u'It has been performed carefully and at least twice for each paper ( initial annotation and secondary correction phase ) .', u'The purpose of this paper is to summarize the comprehensive annotation schema and release the corpus publicly , along with this paper .', u'The corpus is by far larger than the ACE coreference corpora .', u'It can be used to train coreference resolution systems in the Computational Linguistics and Language Technology domain for semantic search , taxonomy extraction , question answering , citation analysis , scientific discourse analysis , etc .']

sentences: [u'This paper presents the Semantic Multimedia Explorer ( SEMEX ) a seman- tic search engine that supports exploratory video retrieval .', u'SEMEX combines entities and content-based suggestions to support semantic search .', u"The SEMEX interface pro- vides facet filters , entity recommendations , a pagination and browsable search results ; all of these elements are interconnected by instant `` linking and brushing '' .", u'Hence SEMEX enables instantaneous visual feedback on how a selected search facet will affect the displayed result set .', u'This unique feature facilitates a quicker and clearer search process compared to other systems that need to perform new search queries to achieve a similar result .', u'By making the subsequent results available at fingertips , the SEMEX interface allows users to pursue related exploratory search strategies that lead to a genuinely responsive and quick browsing experience .']

sentences: [u'For the 5th time , the International Conference Information and Knowledge Management ( CIKM ) hosts a workshop for PhD students : The PIKM 2012 .', u'The goal of this workshop is two-fold : First , a PhD workshop gives doctoral students an opportunity to present their work in an early stage to a global audience .', u'This allows the students not only to crystallize their ideas into a scientific article , and to practice scientific presentation , but also to receive feedback from reviewers , from fellow students and from the general CIKM audience .', u'Second , we believe that the research community , too , benefits from such a workshop : PhD dissertations are the grassroots of research .', u'They point out new research avenues and indicate current promising topics .', u'They provide fresh viewpoints from the researchers of tomorrow .', u'Also , we hope that the interaction with other researchers at the workshop itself , across all levels of seniority , will help propel science forward. # R # # N # # R # # N # The PIKM workshop covers topics in all core areas of the general CIKM conference : information retrieval ( IR ) , databases ( DB ) , and knowledge management ( DB ) .', u'This includes subjects as diverse as link prediction , semantic search , query languages , and data mining. # R # # N # # R # # N # This diversity of topics got reflected in the submissions we received .', u'The call for papers attracted 25 submissions from nearly all continents of the world .', u'Out of these , 10 papers got accepted as full papers .', u'In addition , 4 papers got accepted as poster papers .', u'The papers cover proposals at various stages of the dissertation , from early outlines of research plans , to in depth investigations of acute questions and mid-term reports of work in progress .', u'The dissertations touch all three main areas of the PIKM , including , e.g. , work on community discovery in Twitter , linked data , process modeling , advertising in social networks , and event detection .', u"The best submission will receive a special best paper award. # R # # N # # R # # N # As a special highlight , this year 's PIKM features a keynote talk by Dr. Ingmar Weber from Yahoo !", u'Research Barcelona .', u"Dr. Weber said he will give `` Advice for Young Jedi Knights and PhD Students '' .", u'May the force be with us .']

entities: [[(u'Grid technologies', u'Method'), (u'collaborative and personalized learning frameworks', u'Method')], [(u'learning frameworks', u'Method'), (u'distributed learning services', u'Method'), (u'learning Grid environment', u'Task')], [(u'low-level learning services', u'Method')], [(u'Grid learning services', u'Method'), (u'learning services', u'Task'), (u'systempsilas semantic capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'learning framework', u'Method'), (u'functional parameters', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'parameters', u'Generic'), (u'learning Grid environment', u'Task')], [(u'schema and ontology matching methods', u'Method'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'Grid based learning tools', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Grid technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'collaborative and personalized learning frameworks')], [(u'distributed learning services', u'USED-FOR', u'learning frameworks')], [(u'low-level learning services', u'USED-FOR', u'high-level services')], [], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'learning services')], [(u'parameters', u'PART-OF', u'learning Grid environment')], []]
sentences: [u'Due to their potential advantages , the use of Grid technologies toward the development of collaborative and personalized learning frameworks has been considerably increased .', u'These learning frameworks can be constructed based on the distributed learning services and resources available in a learning Grid environment .', u'A problem still unsolved is how to use and integrate low-level learning services to compose more complex high-level services or tools that can be useful to both tutors and learners .', u'In that sense , on the one hand , semantic description of Grid learning services appears to be a powerful tool that can be used to discover suitable learning services depending on the systempsilas semantic capabilities .', u'On the other hand , it can be employed to carry out a matching process among the learning services located in a learning framework to obtain the best fit according to specific functional parameters .', u'These parameters represent significant characteristics of a learning Grid environment .', u'This paper presents an initial effort that integrates schema and ontology matching methods that aim to develop a model to cope with the complex problem of automatic composition of Grid based learning tools and their portals .']

sentences: [u'T he OAEI Benchmark test set has been used for many years as a main reference to evaluate and compare ontology matching systems .', u'However , this test set has barely varied since 2004 and has become a relatively easy task for matchers .', u'In this paper , we present the design of a flexible test generator based on an extensible set of alterators which may be used programmatically for generating different test sets from different seed ontologies and different alteration modalities .', u'It has been used for reproducing Benchmark both with the original seed ontology and with other ontologies .', u'This highlights the remarkable stability of results over different generations and the preservation of difficulty across seed ontologies , as well as a systematic bias towards the initial Benchmark test set and the inability of such tests to identify an overall winning matcher .', u'These were exactly the properties for which Benchmark had been designed .', u'Furthermore , the generator has been used for providing new test sets aiming at increasing the difficulty and discriminability of Benchmark .', u'Although difficulty may be easily increased with the generator , attempts to increase discriminability proved unfruitful .', u'However , efforts towards this goal raise questions about the very nature of discriminability .']

sentences: [u'The most common matching applications , e.g. , ontology matching , focus on the computation of the correspondences holding between the nodes of graph structures ( e.g. , concepts in two ontologies ) .', u'However there are applications , such as matching of web service descriptions , where matching may need to compute the correspondences holding between the full graph structures and to preserve certain structural properties of the graphs being considered .', u'The goal of this paper is to provide a new matching operator , that we call structure preserving match .', u'This operator takes two graph-like structures and produces a mapping between those nodes of the structures that correspond semantically to each other , ( i ) still preserving a set of structural properties of the graphs being matched , ( ii ) only in the case that the graphs globally correspond semantically to each other .', u'We present an exact and an approximate structure matching algorithm .', u'The latter is based on a formal theory of abstraction and builds upon the well known tree edit distance measures .', u'We have implemented the algorithms and applied them to the web service matchmaking scenario .', u'The evaluation results , though preliminary , show the efficiency and effectiveness of our approach .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Interoperability', u'Task'), (u'Cultural Heritage domain', u'Material'), (u'solutions', u'Generic'), (u'instance-based , ontology matching methods', u'Method')], [(u'scenarios', u'Generic'), (u'interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'one', u'Generic'), (u'homogeneous collections', u'Material'), (u'one', u'Generic'), (u'heterogeneous collections', u'Material'), (u'one', u'Generic'), (u'multi-lingual collections', u'Material')], [(u'one', u'Generic'), (u're-indexing', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'one', u'Generic'), (u'reference alignment', u'Method')], [(u'scenarios', u'Generic'), (u'extensional matching', u'Method'), (u'similarity measures', u'Metric'), (u'matching approach', u'Method')], [(u'Cultural Heritage context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Interoperability', u'Task'), (u'Cultural Heritage domain', u'Material'), (u'extensional methods', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'This paper gives a comprehensive overview over the problem of Semantic Interoperability in the Cultural Heritage domain , with a particular tbcus on solutions centered around extensional , i.e. , instance-based , ontology matching methods .', u'It presents three typical scenarios requiring interoperability , one with homogeneous collections , one with heterogeneous collections , and one with multi-lingual collections .', u'It discusses two different ways to evaluate potential alignments , one based on the application of re-indexing , one using a reference alignment .', u'To these scenarios we apply extensional matching with different similarity measures , which gives interesting insight into the applicability of this matching approach .', u'Finally , we firmly position our work in the Cultural Heritage context through an extensive discussion of the relevance for , and isstles related to this specific field .', u'The findings are as unspectacular as expected , but nevertheless important : the provided methods can really improve interoperability in a number of important cases , but they are not universal solutions to all related problems. # R # # N # # R # # N # This paper provides a solid foundation for any future work on Semantic Interoperability in the Cultural Heritage domain , in particular tbr anybody intending to apply extensional methods .']

relations: [[], [(u'information systems', u'USED-FOR', u'they'), (u'models', u'USED-FOR', u'data representation')], [(u'Ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology matching')], [], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'query execution time', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'approach')]]
sentences: [u"Data interoperability represents a great challenge for today 's enterprises .", u'Indeed , they use various information systems , each relying on several different models for data representation .', u'Ontologies and notably ontology matching have been recognized as interesting approaches for solving the data interoperability problem .', u'In this paper , we focus on improving the performance of queries addressed over ontology alignments expressed through SWRL rules .', u'Indeed , when considering the context of executing queries over complex and numerous alignments , the number of SWRL rules highly impacts the query execution time .', u'Moreover , when hybrid or backward-chaining reasoning is applied , the query execution time may grow exponentially .', u'Still , the reasoners involved deliver performant results ( in terms of execution time ) when applied over reduced and simpler rule sets .', u'Based on this statement , and to address the issue of improving the query execution time , we describe a novel approach that allows , for a given query , to ignore unnecessary rules .', u'The proposed Rule Selector ( RS ) is a middleware between the considered systems and the reasoner present on the triple store side .', u'Through the benchmarks realized we prove that our approach allows considerably minimizing query execution time .']

entities: [[(u'well-engineered methodology', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'on- tology development life cycle', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Melting Point ( MP )', u'Method'), (u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'decentralized settings', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'MP', u'Method'), (u'methodologies', u'Generic'), (u'MP', u'Method')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'biological communities of practice', u'Task')], [(u'Melting Point', u'Method'), (u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'de- centralised communities of practice', u'Task')], [(u'MP', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'well-engineered methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], [], [], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], [], [], [(u'Melting Point', u'USED-FOR', u'de- centralised communities of practice'), (u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'de- centralised communities of practice')], []]
sentences: [u"This paper addresses two research questions : `` How should a well-engineered methodology facilitate the development of ontologies within communities of practice ? ''", u"and `` What methodology should be used ? ''", u'If ontologies are to be developed by communities then the on- tology development life cycle should be better understood within this context .', u'This paper presents the Melting Point ( MP ) , a proposed new methodology for developing ontologies within decentralized settings .', u'It describes how MP was developed by taking best practices from other methodologies , provides details on recommended steps and recommended processes , and compares MP with alternatives .', u'The methodology pre- sented here is the product of direct first-hand experience and observation of biological communities of practice in which some of the authors have been involved .', u'The Melting Point is a methodology engineered for de- centralised communities of practice for which the designers of technology and the users may be the same group .', u'As such , MP provides a poten- tial foundation for the establishment of standard practices for ontology engineering .']

relations: [[(u'Knowledge resource reuse', u'PART-OF', u'ontology engineering field'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology development process')], [], [], [(u'reuse cost', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'conflicting objectives'), (u'reuse cost', u'CONJUNCTION', u'understandability'), (u'reuse cost', u'CONJUNCTION', u'integration workload'), (u'understandability', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'conflicting objectives'), (u'understandability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'integration workload'), (u'understandability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reliability'), (u'integration workload', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'conflicting objectives'), (u'integration workload', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reliability')], [(u'GMAA', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'PC-based decision support system'), (u'additive multi-attribute utility model', u'USED-FOR', u'PC-based decision support system')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'multimedia ontologies'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology'), (u'multimedia ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology'), (u'multimedia domain', u'FEATURE-OF', u'ontology')], [(u'GMAA', u'USED-FOR', u'sensitivity analyses')]]
sentences: [u'Knowledge resource reuse has become a popular approach within the ontology engineering field , mainly because it can speed up the ontology development process , saving time and money and promoting the application of good practices .', u'The NeOn Methodology provides guidelines for reuse .', u'These guidelines include the selection of the most appropriate knowledge resources for reuse in ontology development .', u'This is a complex decision-making problem where different conflicting objectives , like the reuse cost , understandability , integration workload and reliability , have to be taken into account simultaneously .', u'GMAA is a PC-based decision support system based on an additive multi-attribute utility model that is intended to allay the operational difficulties involved in the Decision Analysis methodology .', u'The paper illustrates how it can be applied to select multimedia ontologies for reuse to develop a new ontology in the multimedia domain .', u'It also demonstrates that the sensitivity analyses provided by GMAA are useful tools for making a final recommendation .']

entities: [[(u'ambient intelligence architectures systems', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Method')], [(u'description methods', u'Method'), (u'distributed intelligent applications', u'Task')], [(u'system characterization', u'Method'), (u'software performance engineering techniques', u'Method'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'performance annotations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'annotations', u'Generic'), (u'software architecture', u'Method')], [(u'performance assessment tools', u'Method'), (u'ambient intelligent systems', u'Task'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'architectural description', u'Task'), (u'intelligent distributed applications', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'performance-related information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'off-line procedure', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'ontology engineering', u'FEATURE-OF', u'ambient intelligence architectures systems')], [(u'description methods', u'USED-FOR', u'distributed intelligent applications')], [(u'augmented description', u'USED-FOR', u'software performance engineering techniques')], [], [(u'performance assessment tools', u'USED-FOR', u'ambient intelligent systems')], [], []]
sentences: [u'This paper brings together the performance assessment of ambient intelligence architectures systems with ontology engineering .', u'Thus , firstly appropriate description methods for distributed intelligent applications are summarized .', u'Derived from the system characterization , typical software performance engineering techniques are based on the augmented description of the model regarding performance annotations .', u'However , these annotations are only related with the syntactical view of the software architecture .', u'In the next generation of performance assessment tools for ambient intelligent systems , the description of the system would be capable of reasoning and acquiring knowledge about performance .', u'Having an appropriate architectural description including performance aspects , any possible design options for intelligent distributed applications can be evaluated according to their performance impact .', u'Therefore , we propose the use of an ontology with performance-related information not only to possible evaluate the architecture through the common off-line procedure but also the first step to build a broker that assesses the performance of the system during its execution .']

relations: [[(u'Ontology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'formalization of common information')], [], [(u'text mining methods', u'USED-FOR', u'automatic or semi-automatic discovery of crisp ontologies'), (u'robustness', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'methods'), (u'accuracy', u'CONJUNCTION', u'computational efficiency'), (u'accuracy', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'methods'), (u'computational efficiency', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'methods')], [(u'fuzzy domain ontology mining algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'real-world ontology engineering')], [(u'contextual information', u'USED-FOR', u'extraction of high quality domain ontologies'), (u'knowledge sources', u'USED-FOR', u'extraction of high quality domain ontologies')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'fuzzy domain ontology'), (u'information retrieval', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'method')]]
sentences: [u'Ontology plays an essential role in the formalization of common information ( e.g. , products , services , relationships of businesses ) for effective human-computer interactions .', u'However , engineering of these ontologies turns out to be very labor intensive and time consuming .', u'Although some text mining methods have been proposed for automatic or semi-automatic discovery of crisp ontologies , the robustness , accuracy , and computational efficiency of these methods need to be improved to support large scale ontology construction for real-world applications .', u'This paper illustrates a novel fuzzy domain ontology mining algorithm for supporting real-world ontology engineering .', u'In particular , contextual information of the knowledge sources is exploited for the extraction of high quality domain ontologies and the uncertainty embedded in the knowledge sources is modeled based on the notion of fuzzy sets .', u'Empirical studies have confirmed that the proposed method can discover high quality fuzzy domain ontology which leads to significant improvement in information retrieval performance .']

entities: [[(u'content retrieval', u'Task'), (u'digital object repositories', u'Material')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic markup', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge domain', u'Material'), (u'literature analysis', u'Task'), (u'learning objects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'LOs ) ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rigorous ontological analysis', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'incongruous models', u'Method'), (u'logical reasoning processes', u'Method')], [(u'ontological identity of learning objects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'well-founded LO definition', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'LO ontology engineering process', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic markup'), (u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge domain'), (u'semantic markup', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge domain')], [(u'incongruous models', u'USED-FOR', u'logical reasoning processes')], []]
sentences: [u'In the recent years , several semantic-based educational projects have been carried out , focusing on improving content retrieval within digital object repositories .', u'Usually these projects are founded on the use of ontologies and semantic markup to represent the knowledge domain , as well as technical and pedagogical content features. # R # # N # However , from a literature analysis , learning objects ( LOs ) ontologies appear frequently to be designed more on the basis of the pragmatic convenience of the specific application frame and the developers personal intuition than on a rigorous ontological analysis .', u'This approach has as main disadvantage the development of incongruous models which can not support logical reasoning processes and can not be easily reused in a different context from that in which they have been designed .', u'# R # # N # Therefore a preliminary analysis on the ontological identity of learning objects is here proposed in order to support the formulation of a well-founded LO definition , which should be provided before any LO ontology engineering process .']

relations: [[(u'Ontological metamodeling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'multilevel-modeling')], [], [(u'conceptual modeling', u'USED-FOR', u'ontological metamodeling'), (u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'ontological metamodeling'), (u'materialization', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'approaches'), (u'materialization', u'CONJUNCTION', u'potency-based deep instantiation'), (u'potency-based deep instantiation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'approaches'), (u'potency-based deep instantiation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'm-objects/m-relationships'), (u'm-objects/m-relationships', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'approaches')], [(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'domain concepts')], [(u'conceptual modeling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology engineering')], [(u'closed world', u'CONJUNCTION', u'open world reasoning')], []]
sentences: [u'Ontological metamodeling or multilevel-modeling refers to describing complex domains at multiple levels of abstraction , especially in domains where the borderline between individuals and classes is not clear cut .', u'Punning in OWL2 provides decideable metamodeling support by allowing to use one symbol both as identifier of a class as well as of an individual .', u'In conceptual modeling more powerful approaches to ontological metamodeling exist : materialization , potency-based deep instantiation , and m-objects/m-relationships .', u'These approaches not only support to treat classes as individuals but also to describe domain concepts with members at multiple levels of abstraction .', u'Based on a mapping from m-objects/m-relationships to OWL we show how to transfer these ideas from conceptual modeling to ontology engineering .', u'Therefore we have to combine closed world and open world reasoning .', u'We provide semantic-preserving mappings from m-objects and m-relationships to the decideable fragment of OWL , extended by integrity constraints , and sketch basic tool support for applying this approach .']

entities: [[(u'identification mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'Description Logics', u'Method'), (u'modeling features', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'identification constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'roles', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'inverses', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'paths', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'real-world applications', u'Task')], [(u'path-based identification constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'constraints', u'Generic'), (u'concept identifier', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'restriction', u'Generic'), (u'local path-based identification constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'complexity of reasoning', u'Metric'), (u'expressive Description Logics', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'identification mechanisms', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology engineering'), (u'modeling features', u'USED-FOR', u'identification constraints')], [(u'roles', u'CONJUNCTION', u'inverses'), (u'inverses', u'CONJUNCTION', u'paths')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'In spite of the importance of identification mechanisms in ontology engineering , the Description Logics at the basis of current reasoners do not include modeling features for expressing identification constraints .', u'In this paper , we consider a powerful class of identification constraints , which allow for using roles , inverses , and paths , thus capturing sophisticated forms of identifications often needed in real-world applications .', u'We show that , when used with no limitations , such path-based identification constraints are problematic with respect to effectiveness/efficiency of reasoning .', u'We then propose a restricted form of these constraints , called local , requiring that at least one of the component paths of the concept identifier is a direct property of the concept .', u'We argue that such a restriction is not a severe limitation in practice , and we show that local path-based identification constraints do not increase the complexity of reasoning both in very expressive Description Logics and in the tractable DL-Lite family .']

entities: [[], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'computer science', u'Task'), (u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task')], [(u'connectionist approach', u'Method'), (u'semantic relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'free-from text documents', u'Material'), (u'domain', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'word co-occurrences', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'relatedness of words', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u"numeric representations of the words ' contexts", u'Task')], [(u'self-organizing map', u'Method'), (u'neural network model', u'Method'), (u'unsupervised learning function', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'high-dimensional data', u'Material'), (u'two-dimensional representation', u'Method'), (u'convenient browsing', u'Task')], [(u'domain vocabulary', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'construction and enrichment of domain ontologies', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'tourism domain', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'computer science'), (u'algorithms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'methods'), (u'algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology engineering'), (u'methods', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology engineering')], [(u'connectionist approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic relations')], [(u'word co-occurrences', u'USED-FOR', u'relatedness of words')], [(u'unsupervised learning function', u'USED-FOR', u'neural network model'), (u'high-dimensional data', u'USED-FOR', u'two-dimensional representation'), (u'two-dimensional representation', u'USED-FOR', u'convenient browsing')], [(u'domain vocabulary', u'USED-FOR', u'construction and enrichment of domain ontologies')], [(u'tourism domain', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'approach')]]
sentences: [u'The creation and maintenance of domain ontologies is a costly and time-consuming task .', u'With the advent of ontologies being used in many different fields of computer science , developing appropriate algorithms and methods to support or automatize ontology engineering have become an increasingly important goal .', u'Hence , we present a connectionist approach to visualize semantic relations inherent in free-from text documents related to a specific domain .', u"In particular , we exploit word co-occurrences to capture relatedness of words in order to generate numeric representations of the words ' contexts .", u'We use the self-organizing map , a well-known neural network model with unsupervised learning function , to map the high-dimensional data onto a two-dimensional representation for convenient browsing .', u'This intuitive view on the domain vocabulary supports the construction and enrichment of domain ontologies by making relevant concepts and their relations evident .', u'We underline this approach with an example from the tourism domain .']

entities: [[(u'ontology engineering', u'Task')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge and information systems', u'Task')], [(u'ontology evolution systems', u'Method')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'process model', u'Method')], [(u'ontology evolution process model', u'Method'), (u'ontology change rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'change rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SWRL rule representation language', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'ontology evolution', u'Task'), (u'ontology evolution process', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology evolution process', u'Task')], [(u'taxonomy of ontology changes', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'process model', u'Method'), (u'OntoEvol system', u'Method')], [(u'It', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'ontology change rules', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology evolution process model')], [(u'SWRL rule representation language', u'USED-FOR', u'change rules')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology evolution'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology evolution process'), (u'ontology evolution', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology evolution process'), (u'ontology', u'PART-OF', u'ontology evolution process')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'In recent years , ontology engineering has received a great amount of attention and has advanced greatly .', u'Today , ontologies are finding their role in knowledge and information systems .', u'To keep up with the dynamic aspect of knowledge , the need for ontology evolution systems has emerged .', u'Such systems help facilitate the management of changes on the ontology in a systematic way .', u'To define a systematic way of facilitating management of changes , a process model is needed .', u'Therefore in this paper , we present our novel ontology evolution process model which uses ontology change rules to achieve this goal .', u'These change rules are defined via the SWRL rule representation language .', u'This new approach to ontology evolution helps the ontology evolution process by preserving the consistency of the ontology throughout the ontology evolution process .', u'To classify ontology changes , we will also present our novel taxonomy of ontology changes .', u'To test the feasibility of our presented process model , we have implemented the OntoEvol system .', u'It is also presented in this paper .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'Material'), (u'semantic interoperability', u'Task')], [(u'natural language', u'Material')], [(u'fact-oriented formalism', u'Method'), (u'construction of so-called hybrid ontologies', u'Task')], [(u'hybrid ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'agreements', u'Generic'), (u'community interactions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'GOSPL', u'Method'), (u'collaborative ontology engineering method', u'Method'), (u'extension', u'Generic'), (u'formal and informal descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology construction process', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'application', u'Generic'), (u'agreement processes', u'Task')], []]
relations: [[(u'Ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic interoperability')], [], [(u'fact-oriented formalism', u'USED-FOR', u'construction of so-called hybrid ontologies')], [], [(u'GOSPL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'collaborative ontology engineering method')], [(u'informal descriptions', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology construction process'), (u'application', u'USED-FOR', u'agreement processes')], []]
sentences: [u'Ontologies for enabling semantic interoperability is one of the branches in which agreement between a heterogeneous group of stakeholders is of vital importance .', u'As agreements are the result of interactions , appropriate methods should take into account the natural language used by the community during those interactions .', u'In this article , we first extend a fact-oriented formalism for the construction of so-called hybrid ontologies .', u'In hybrid ontologies , concepts are described both formally and informally and the agreements are being grounded in community interactions .', u'We furthermore present GOSPL , a collaborative ontology engineering method on top of this extension and describe how agreements on formal and informal descriptions are complementary and interplay .', u'We show how the informal descriptions can drive the ontology construction process and how commitments from the ontology to the application are exploited to steer the agreement processes .', u'All of the ideas presented in this article have been implemented in a tool and used in an experiment involving 40+ users , of which a discussion is presented .']

relations: [[(u'Data inconsistency', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mismatch')], [(u'seamless data integration', u'CONJUNCTION', u'exchange')], [(u'methodologies', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology development')], [(u'pre-development', u'CONJUNCTION', u'development'), (u'pre-development', u'CONJUNCTION', u'post-development'), (u'development', u'CONJUNCTION', u'post-development')], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology engineering'), (u'knowledge sharing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reuse')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'real life applications'), (u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'real life applications')], [(u'fault diagnosis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'root cause investigation'), (u'root cause investigation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'spare parts maintenance')]]
sentences: [u'Data inconsistency and data mismatch are critical problems that limit data interoperability and hinder smooth operation of a distributed business .', u'An ontology represents a semantic model that explicitly describes various entities and their properties of a domain of discourse and acts as a vehicle for seamless data integration and exchange .', u'The existing methodologies for ontology development fail to provide a comprehensive coverage for different steps , e.g .', u'pre-development , development and post-development , which are necessary for successfully developing ontologies .', u'We propose a generic and comprehensive methodology that puts ontology engineering on a firm scientific foundation and at the same time provides a collaborative environment for effective knowledge sharing and reuse .', u'Furthermore , our approach also provides a way for automatically extracting frequent terms from the data to construct an ontology in a bottom-up fashion .', u'The performance of our methodology has been evaluated by developing different ontologies to solve the real life applications , e.g .', u'fault diagnosis and root cause investigation and spare parts maintenance .']

entities: [[(u'Ontology learning', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task')], [(u'taxonomic relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology learning', u'Task')], [(u'domain', u'Generic')], [(u'ontology learning tools', u'Method')], [(u'supervised approach', u'Method'), (u'taxonomic relationship learning', u'Task')], [(u'Chinese unstructured text', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'corpus', u'Generic'), (u'domain application', u'Task'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'multi-strategy', u'Method'), (u'shallow syntactic analysis', u'Method'), (u'statistical measures', u'Method'), (u'is-a relations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'domain ontology taxonomic relations learning', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Ontology learning has become a major area of research within the current ontology engineering .', u'The acquisition of concepts and taxonomic relations is one of the key issues of ontology learning .', u'There are various taxonomic ways for the same domain and the related concepts .', u'However , current ontology learning tools have not considered how to generate the most suitable taxonomy for the specific application .', u'In this article , we present a new supervised approach for taxonomic relationship learning .', u'Taking the Chinese unstructured text on the Web as the corpus and a certain particular domain application as the guide , this method uses a given branch of the target ontology and integrates multi-strategy which includes shallow syntactic analysis and kinds of statistical measures to extract concepts and to determine the concepts hierarchy numbers and is-a relations .', u'The experiments using a working prototype of the system revealed the improved performance of domain ontology taxonomic relations learning .']

entities: [[(u'change', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'evolution', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'temporal reasoning', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task')], [(u'ontology ALLEN+', u'Method'), (u'imperfect temporal information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rule-set SWRL', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'temporal reasoning', u'Method')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'quantitative , qualitative or hybrid information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'temporal points', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'imperfect temporal information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u"Allen 's interval algebra", u'Method'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'composition-in-context operation', u'Task')], [(u'decision-making', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Aspects of time , change , evolution , temporal reasoning and decision-making remain in the focus of metadata and ontology engineering because many related challenges are yet to be fully addressed .', u'In this paper , we present ontology ALLEN+ as a tool to reason with imperfect temporal information .', u'We created a rule-set SWRL on top of OWL capable of temporal reasoning with partially incomplete and heterogeneous information .', u'The ontology allows to have either quantitative , qualitative or hybrid information about temporal points and intervals , and the rules are capable of both ways transitions between different representations .', u"We show how to use context of available imperfect temporal information to improve results of the composition operation of Allen 's interval algebra , and we design rules for composition-in-context operation .", u'We discover that additional context reduces the overall uncertainty of the composition and enables about 20 % progress in overall quality of the composition and therefore in potential reasoning and decision-making .']

entities: [[(u'ontology engineering methodologies', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'system requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'software development process', u'Method')], [(u'Tropos methodology', u'Method')], [(u'Tropos process', u'Method')], [(u'competency question', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'goal modeling process', u'Method')], [(u'ontology engineer', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
