sentences: [u'Most of the available ontology engineering methodologies presuppose the existence of a set of questions which provide the objective and scope of the ontology under development .', u'However , these so-called competency questions are not always clear from start .', u'In this sense , such competency questions are comparable to system requirements , elicited and modeled during the requirements engineering stage of a software development process .', u'Having this in mind , this work proposes the use of the Tropos methodology to help the ontology engineer reason and model competency questions .', u'For that , he should follow the traditional Tropos process , starting with the early requirements activity to analyze the objectives of an organization .', u'This initial stage is followed by the late requirements activity , in which the competency question are captured and linked to the organizations goals , following the goal modeling process .', u'In this way , we aim at providing a methodology which will consistently drive the ontology engineer in developing an ontology from scratch .']

entities: [[(u'sourcing and logistics strategies', u'Method'), (u'dynamic logistics solutions', u'Method')], [(u'wireless sensor networks', u'Method')], [(u'integrated knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'service innovation', u'Task'), (u'business models', u'Method')], [(u'business models', u'Method'), (u'knowledge representation techniques', u'Method'), (u'selforganization', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge architecture', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology construction process', u'Task'), (u'realworld scenario', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology engineering approach', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'knowledge representation techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'selforganization')], [], [(u'realworld scenario', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology construction process')]]
sentences: [u'Many industries experienced a shift in sourcing and logistics strategies , the industrial demand for more dynamic logistics solutions with adequate IT support is increasing .', u'Due to advances in wireless sensor networks and technologies , the transportation area in logistics industry is the most promising application field for new types of innovative services .', u'The emerging applications in this field require an integrated knowledge base to provide enhanced customer services .', u'The aforementioned trends will lead to service innovation if the adaptation of business models is ensured .', u'Our earlier work focused on adaptable business models [ 1 ] and argued that knowledge representation techniques are suitable concepts to improve selforganization [ 2 ] .', u'In this paper we introduce the core component of the knowledge architecture represented as ontologies and report experiences from the development process .', u'The contributions of this paper are ( a ) a detailed description of the ontology construction process based on a realworld scenario , ( b ) experiences from the development process and , ( c ) proposed adaptations of an established ontology engineering approach .']

entities: [[(u'ontology engineering processes', u'Method'), (u'L & C', u'Method'), (u'intelligent medical applications', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'ontology-focused management practices', u'Method'), (u'ontology product', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology processes', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'natural language applications', u'Task'), (u"ontology 's formal structure", u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'OntoClean', u'Method'), (u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'ontological properties', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology technology', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'L & C', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'medical applications')], [(u'ontology-focused management practices', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')], [], [(u'OntoClean', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'automated supports'), (u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'ontological properties')], [(u'ontology technology', u'USED-FOR', u"`` enterprise standard '' ontology environments")]]
sentences: [u'We describe the ontology engineering processes and their supporting technologies at L & C , a company developing intelligent medical applications based on ontologies .', u'We describe the principal tasks that the modellers of our ontology have to execute , how they are supported and guided by some specifically ontology-focused management practices , and how ( semi- ) automated technology can also aid in their support and guidance , so as to produce a higher quality and quantity of ontology product .', u"The ontology processes include the development of new structures of concepts and relations , the integration of other ontologies and terminologies , the integration of the ontology to natural language applications , and the reforming of the current ontology 's formal structure .", u'The automated supports we talk about include OntoClean , a principled methodology for analyzing ontological properties and their constraints .', u"We finally note how far we think our ontology technology comes to some proposed desiderata recently given for `` enterprise standard '' ontology environments ."]

entities: [[(u'Diagrammatic logics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Venn diagrams', u'Material')], [(u'symbolic notations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'logical axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'semantic properties', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'axiomatization', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'diagrammatic patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'diagrammatic devices', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'patterns', u'Generic'), (u'explicit quantification', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'diagrammatic logics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'explicit quantification', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'diagrammatic devices', u'USED-FOR', u'semantics')], [], []]
sentences: [u"Diagrammatic logics have been widely studied since Shin'sseminal work on Venn diagrams in the 1990s .", u'There have been significant theoretical advances alongside empirical work investigating their efficacy with respect to symbolic notations .', u'However , we have little understanding about how to choose between syntactically different diagrams whenformulating logical axioms .', u'This paper sets out to provide insight into such choices .', u'By appealing to ontology engineering , we identify commonly required semantic properties that require axiomatization .', u'We systematically identify three different ways of axiomatizing these properties using diagrammatic patterns .', u'One way does not use explicit quantification.The other ways both use explicit quantification but employ different diagrammatic devices to capture the required semantics .', u'We evaluated these competing patterns by conducting an empirical study , collectingperformance data.We conclude that avoiding explicit quantification , and representing the information purely diagrammatically , best supports task performance .', u'As a result , users and designers of diagrammatic logics are guided towards avoiding explicit quantification where possible .']

entities: [[(u'data mining', u'Task'), (u'formalized representation of outcomes of research', u'Task'), (u'ontology of data mining', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'OntoDM', u'Method'), (u'data mining', u'Task'), (u'datatype', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dataset', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data mining task', u'Task'), (u'data mining algorithm', u'Method'), (u'distance function', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'constraint-based data mining', u'Task'), (u'constraints', u'Generic'), (u'inductive queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data mining scenarios', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'constructing ontologies of data mining', u'Task'), (u'OntoDM', u'Method'), (u'deep/heavy-weight ontology', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'top level ontology', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'datatype', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'definitions of basic data mining entities'), (u'datatype', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dataset'), (u'datatype', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mining task'), (u'dataset', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mining task'), (u'dataset', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mining algorithm'), (u'data mining task', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'definitions of basic data mining entities'), (u'data mining task', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mining algorithm'), (u'data mining algorithm', u'CONJUNCTION', u'components thereof'), (u'distance function', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'components thereof')], [(u'inductive queries', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'constraints'), (u'inductive queries', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mining scenarios'), (u'data mining scenarios', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'constraints')], [(u'OntoDM', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'deep/heavy-weight ontology')]]
sentences: [u'Motivated by the need for unification of the field of data mining and the growing demand for formalized representation of outcomes of research , we address the task of constructing an ontology of data mining .', u'The proposed ontology , named OntoDM , is based on a recent proposal of a general framework for data mining , and includes definitions of basic data mining entities , such as datatype and dataset , data mining task , data mining algorithm and components thereof ( e.g. , distance function ) , etc .', u'It also allows for the definition of more complex entities , e.g. , constraints in constraint-based data mining , sets of such constraints ( inductive queries ) and data mining scenarios ( sequences of inductive queries ) .', u'Unlike most existing approaches to constructing ontologies of data mining , OntoDM is a deep/heavy-weight ontology and follows best practices in ontology engineering , such as not allowing multiple inheritance of classes , using a predefined set of relations and using a top level ontology .']

sentences: [u'Knowledge resource reuse has become a popular approach within the ontology engineering field , mainly because it can speed up the ontology development process , saving time and money and promoting the application of good practices .', u'The NeOn Methodology provides guidelines for reuse .', u'These guidelines include the selection of the most appropriate knowledge resources for reuse in ontology development .', u'This is a complex decision-making problem where different conflicting objectives , like the reuse cost , understandability , integration workload and reliability , have to be taken into account simultaneously .', u'GMAA is a PC-based decision support system based on an additive multi-attribute utility model that is intended to allay the operational difficulties involved in the Decision Analysis methodology .', u'The paper illustrates how it can be applied to select multimedia ontologies for reuse to develop a new ontology in the multimedia domain .', u'It also demonstrates that the sensitivity analyses provided by GMAA are useful tools for making a final recommendation .']

entities: [[], [(u'Integrated Agriculture Information Framework', u'Method'), (u'knowledge extraction', u'Task'), (u'multiple domain related repositories', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'IAIF', u'Method'), (u'knowledge repositories', u'Material'), (u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'domain ontology', u'Method'), (u'domain knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantics based approach', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'Generic')], [(u'Ontology engineering methodology', u'Method')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge resources', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Integrated Agriculture Information Framework', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge extraction'), (u'Integrated Agriculture Information Framework ( IAIF )', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge extraction'), (u'multiple domain related repositories', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge extraction')], [(u'metadata', u'CONJUNCTION', u'domain ontologies')], [], [], [(u'Ontology engineering methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'domain')], []]
sentences: [u'Information Technology in agriculture is intended to provide knowledge to the farmers in order to make more informed and valuable decisions .', u'In this paper we present an Integrated Agriculture Information Framework ( IAIF ) to enable knowledge extraction from multiple domain related repositories .', u'IAIF has been designed and developed with the core aim of meaningfully representing combining , merging and aggregating the data present in existing knowledge repositories through the use of metadata and domain ontologies .', u'The domain ontology serves to link the resources with the domain knowledge with the help of respective metadata .', u'A key feature of the semantics based approach adopted is that ontology also serves as the basis for capturing the needed information for accessing different types of data sources .', u'We also present an Ontology engineering methodology for the domain that allows for formalized modeling of domain schema and resource knowledge .', u'In addition , we discuss the methodology for linking multiple types of knowledge resources .']

sentences: [u'Knowledge portals provide views onto domainspecific information on the World Wide Web , thus facilitating their users to find relevant , domainspecific information .', u'The construction of intelligent access and the provisioning of information to knowledge portals , however , remained an ad hoc task requiring extensive manual editing and maintenance by the knowledge portal providers .', u'In order to diminish these efforts we use ontologies as a conceptual backbone for providing , accessing and structuring information in a comprehensive approach for building and maintaining knowledge portals .', u'We have built several experimental and one commercial knowledge portal for knowledge management tasks such as skill management and corporate history analysis that show how our approach is used in practice .', u'This practice , however , has exhibited a number bottlenecks , many of which could be avoided or at least diminished by Human Language Technology .', u'We have used HLT in order to reduce the costs of ontology engineering and in order to narrow the gap between finding knowledge in texts and providing it to the portal .']

entities: [[(u'adaptation of knowledge resources', u'Task'), (u'knowledge-intensive internet systems', u'Method')], [(u'real-time , community-driven evolution of so-called ontologies', u'Task'), (u'knowledge-intensive system', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'DOGMA ontology framework', u'Method'), (u'community-grounded ontology engineering methodology DOGMA-MESS', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'Method'), (u'community concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'business rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'norms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'policies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'goals', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology evolution process', u'Method')], [(u'ontology evolution', u'Method')], [(u'real-world problem setting', u'Task')], []]
relations: [[], [], [(u'DOGMA ontology framework', u'USED-FOR', u'framework'), (u'business rules', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'community concepts'), (u'business rules', u'CONJUNCTION', u'norms'), (u'norms', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'community concepts'), (u'norms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'policies'), (u'policies', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'community concepts'), (u'policies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'goals'), (u'goals', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'community concepts')], [], [(u'viz', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'real-world problem setting')], []]
sentences: [u'This article wants to address the need for a research effort and framework that studies and embraces the novel , difficult but crucial issues of adaptation of knowledge resources to their respective user communities , and vice versa , as a fundamental property within knowledge-intensive internet systems .', u'Through a deep understanding of real-time , community-driven evolution of so-called ontologies , a knowledge-intensive system can be made operationally relevant and sustainable over longer periods of time .', u'To bootstrap our framework , we adopt and extend the DOGMA ontology framework , and its community-grounded ontology engineering methodology DOGMA-MESS , with an ontology that models community concepts such as business rules , norms , policies , and goals as firstclass citizens of the ontology evolution process .', u'Doing so ontology evolution can be tailored to the needs of a particular community .', u'Finally , we illustrate with an example from an actual real-world problem setting , viz .', u'interorganisational exchange of HR-related knowledge .']

entities: [[(u'ontology-based knowledge management', u'Method'), (u'life sciences', u'Task'), (u'biological ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology design', u'Method')], [(u'GENIA ontology', u'Method'), (u'biological continuants', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'corpus annotation', u'Task'), (u'text mining context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'BIOTOP', u'Method'), (u'upper ontology of physical continuants', u'Task'), (u'biology', u'Material'), (u'GENIA ontology', u'Method')], [(u'modeling decisions', u'Task'), (u'BIOTOP', u'Method'), (u'formal ontology principles', u'Method')], [], [], [(u'OWL-DL', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'formal knowledge representation language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'terminological reasoner', u'Method'), (u'classification', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineering phase', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'ontology-based knowledge management', u'USED-FOR', u'life sciences')], [], [], [(u'design specifications', u'CONJUNCTION', u'modeling decisions'), (u'formal ontology principles', u'USED-FOR', u'modeling decisions')], [], [], [(u'OWL-DL', u'USED-FOR', u'formal knowledge representation language'), (u'terminological reasoner', u'USED-FOR', u'classification'), (u'terminological reasoner', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology engineering phase')]]
sentences: [u'The increasing need for advanced ontology-based knowledge management in the life sciences is generally being acknowledged but , up until now , the development of biological ontologies lacks adherence to foundational principles of ontology design .', u'This is particularly true of so-called upper-level ontologies such as the GENIA ontology which covers biological continuants and has mainly been devised for corpus annotation in a text mining context .', u'As an alternative , we introduce BIOTOP , an upper ontology of physical continuants in the domain of biology , with a coverage similar to the GENIA ontology .', u'We report on design specifications and modeling decisions for BIOTOP which are based upon formal ontology principles .', u'As a major desideratum , these continuants are described in terms of necessary and sufficient conditions .', u'We accomplished this goal for 85 out of the 146 existing GENIA classes .', u'We use OWL-DL as a formal knowledge representation language and may thus use a terminological reasoner for classification in order to check and maintain consistency during the ontology engineering phase .']

entities: [[(u'meta-modeling', u'Method'), (u'classification levels', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Eclipse', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Melanee', u'Material'), (u'linguistic and an ontological dimension', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Melanee', u'Method'), (u'Eclipse Modeling Framework', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'OCL implementation', u'Method'), (u'multi-level modeling features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontological and linguistic classification', u'Method')], [(u'OCL implementation', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'multi-level aware', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'deep OCL dialect', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'deep modeling features', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'interactive level-agnostic OCL Console', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'meta-modeling', u'USED-FOR', u'Eclipse'), (u'classification levels', u'FEATURE-OF', u'Eclipse')], [(u'linguistic and an ontological dimension', u'FEATURE-OF', u'Melanee')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'multi-level modeling features'), (u'ontological and linguistic classification', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'multi-level modeling features')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The deep modeling tool Multi-level Modeling and Ontology Engineering Environment ( Melanee ) developed by the Software Engineering Group of the University of Mannheim allows clean and strict meta-modeling across multiple classification levels within Eclipse .', u'Modeling with Melanee comprises two dimensions , a linguistic and an ontological dimension .', u'As Melanee is fully embedded in the Eclipse Modeling Framework , it is usable with the Object Constraint Language ( OCL ) . # R # # N # However , the current OCL implementation is not aware of multi-level modeling features like the distinction between ontological and linguistic classification and the existence of multiple ontological levels .', u'The aim of this thesis is to extend the current OCL implementation so that it is multi-level aware .', u'First , a deep OCL dialect is elaborated which takes deep modeling features into consideration .', u'Based on this dialect , an implementation of an interactive level-agnostic OCL Console will enable queries of different values of different model elements .']

entities: [[(u'formal meta-properties', u'Method'), (u'conceptual modeling and ontology engineering literature', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'finer-grained distinctions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'distinctions', u'Generic'), (u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'ontology-driven conceptual modeling language OntoUML', u'Method'), (u'ontology and taxonomy evaluation methodology OntoClean', u'Method')], [(u'Derived Object Types', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Object Types', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Derivation Rules', u'Method')], [(u'modal meta-properties of Derived Types', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'derivation rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'model construction', u'Task'), (u'OntoUML', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'ontology-driven conceptual modeling language OntoUML', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'approaches'), (u'ontology-driven conceptual modeling language OntoUML', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology and taxonomy evaluation methodology OntoClean')], [(u'Object Types', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Derived Object Types'), (u'Derivation Rules', u'USED-FOR', u'Object Types')], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we revisit a number of classical formal meta-properties that have been used in the conceptual modeling and ontology engineering literature to provide finer-grained distinctions among the category of Object Types .', u'These distinctions constitute an essential part of relevant existing approaches , in particular , the ontology-driven conceptual modeling language OntoUML , and the ontology and taxonomy evaluation methodology OntoClean .', u'The idea in this paper is to investigate the interaction between these meta-properties and Derived Object Types , i.e. , Object Types which extensions are dynamically inferred via Derivation Rules .', u'The contributions here are two-fold : firstly , we revisit two classical Derivation Patterns and prove a number of results that can be used to infer the modal meta-properties of Derived Types from those of the types participating in the associated derivation rules ; secondly , we demonstrate how these results can be applied in the automated support for model construction in OntoUML .']

entities: [[(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'ontology evaluation', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineering and evaluating process', u'Task')], [(u'ontology evaluation methodology', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'structural domains', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic relations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'structural domains', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge organizations', u'Material'), (u"Kant 's Epistemology", u'Material')], [(u'OntoAbsolute', u'Method'), (u'quantitative evaluation method', u'Method'), (u'simplicity and unity concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'OntoAbsolute', u'Method')], [(u'OntoAbsolute', u'Method'), (u'OntoClean', u'Method'), (u'domain-independent feature and meta-properties usage', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OntoAbsolute', u'Method'), (u'multi-level framework', u'Method'), (u'OntoMetric', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology evaluation')], [], [], [(u'quantitative evaluation method', u'USED-FOR', u'OntoAbsolute'), (u'quantitative evaluation method', u'USED-FOR', u'simplicity and unity concepts')], [], [(u'OntoAbsolute', u'COMPARE', u'OntoClean'), (u'multi-level framework', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'characteristics'), (u'OntoMetric', u'USED-FOR', u'multi-level framework')]]
sentences: [u'Ontology researchers struggle to propose various methods and methodology in ontology evaluation as reference sources for ontology engineering and evaluating process .', u'In this paper , we intend to explain a new ontology evaluation methodology ( i.e. , OntoAbsolute ) which it is proposed to evaluate structural domains in semantic relations and concepts in upper , middle and lower ontologies .', u"In 2007 , a modern method was proposed in quantitative evaluation of the structural domains in knowledge organizations based on Kant 's Epistemology .", u'OntoAbsolute relies on the modern quantitative evaluation method to evaluate simplicity and unity concepts ( i.e. , meta-properties ) in the structural domains in concepts and their relations via proposed criteria and related measures .', u'OntoAbsolute has a capacity to develop new criteria and measures to access cognitive results in ontology as a whole .', u'OntoAbsolute is similar to OntoClean in terms of domain-independent feature and meta-properties usage and also OntoAbsolute consists of the same structure to classify the characteristics ( i.e. , multi-level framework ) with OntoMetric .']

entities: [[(u'Multimedia reasoning', u'Task'), (u'multimedia content analysis', u'Task'), (u'high-level video scene interpretation', u'Task'), (u'represented knowledge domain', u'Material')], [(u'multimedia ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'role definitions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'role inclusions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'role interdependencies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'multimedia ontologies', u'Material'), (u'logical constructors', u'Method')], [(u'multimedia reasoning', u'Task')], [(u'VidOnt', u'Method'), (u'multimedia ontology', u'Method'), (u'SROIQ ( D ) expressivity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL-safe ruleset', u'Method'), (u'next-generation multimedia reasoning', u'Task')], [(u'formal grounding', u'Task'), (u'expressive description logics', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'industry-leading reasoners', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'HermiT', u'Method'), (u'FaCT++', u'Method')], [(u'multimedia ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology engineering approach', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'multimedia content analysis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'high-level video scene interpretation')], [(u'role inclusions', u'CONJUNCTION', u'role interdependencies')], [], [], [(u'VidOnt', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'multimedia ontology'), (u'SROIQ ( D ) expressivity', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'multimedia ontology'), (u'SROIQ ( D ) expressivity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'DL-safe ruleset'), (u'DL-safe ruleset', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'multimedia ontology')], [(u'ontology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'expressive description logics'), (u'industry-leading reasoners', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology'), (u'industry-leading reasoners', u'CONJUNCTION', u'industry-leading reasoners'), (u'HermiT', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'industry-leading reasoners'), (u'HermiT', u'CONJUNCTION', u'FaCT++'), (u'FaCT++', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'industry-leading reasoners')], []]
sentences: [u'Multimedia reasoning , which is suitable for , among others , multimedia content analysis and high-level video scene interpretation , relies on the formal and comprehensive conceptualization of the represented knowledge domain .', u'However , most multimedia ontologies are not exhaustive in terms of role definitions , and do not incorporate complex role inclusions and role interdependencies .', u'In fact , most multimedia ontologies do not have a role box at all , and implement only a basic subset of the available logical constructors .', u'Consequently , their application in multimedia reasoning is limited .', u'To address the above issues , VidOnt , the very first multimedia ontology with SROIQ ( D ) expressivity and a DL-safe ruleset has been introduced for next-generation multimedia reasoning .', u'In contrast to the common practice , the formal grounding has been set in one of the most expressive description logics , and the ontology validated with industry-leading reasoners , namely HermiT and FaCT++ .', u'This paper also presents best practices for developing multimedia ontologies , based on my ontology engineering approach .']

entities: [[(u'Emerging ontology authoring methods', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'validation bottleneck', u'Task')], [(u'ontology authoring', u'Task')], [(u'test-driven development', u'Method'), (u'ontology authoring', u'Task')], [(u'TBox axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u"` open box'-way", u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL 2 DL language features', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Protege plugin', u'Method'), (u'TDD test', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'TBox queries', u'Material'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'TDD process', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'TDD methodology', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'test-driven development', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology authoring')], [(u'TBox queries', u'CONJUNCTION', u'TBox axioms')], [], [], [], [(u'TDD process', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology engineering')]]
sentences: [u'Emerging ontology authoring methods to add knowledge to an ontology focus on ameliorating the validation bottleneck .', u'The verification of the newly added axiom is still one of trying and seeing what the reasoner says , because a systematic testbed for ontology authoring is missing .', u'We sought to address this by introducing the approach of test-driven development for ontology authoring .', u"We specify 36 generic tests , as TBox queries and TBox axioms tested through individuals , and structure their inner workings in an ` open box'-way , which cover the OWL 2 DL language features .", u'This is implemented as a Protege plugin so that one can perform a TDD test as a black box test .', u'We evaluated the two test approaches on their performance .', u'The TBox queries were faster , and that effect is more pronounced the larger the ontology is .', u'We provide a general sequence of a TDD process for ontology engineering as a foundation for a TDD methodology .']

entities: [[(u'Ontology modularization', u'Task'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'constituent parts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology partitioning', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'module extraction', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'ontology partitioning', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Pato', u'Method'), (u'partitioning', u'Task')], [], [(u'reasoning', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'self contained ontology', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Ontology modularization', u'PART-OF', u'ontology engineering'), (u'ontology partitioning', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'constituent parts')], [(u'ontology partitioning', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], [(u'Pato', u'USED-FOR', u'partitioning')], [], [], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')]]
sentences: [u'Ontology modularization is an important part of ontology engineering for which the reduction of complexity and size of ontology , either breaks an ontology down to all the constituent parts ( ontology partitioning ) or extracts only a small part of the ontology ( module extraction ) .', u'The presented approach in this essay is concentrated on ontology partitioning .', u'To have complete segments , we initially do the reasoning on ontology and then render the result of reasoning to Pato , a tool for partitioning .', u'So , the generated modules are complete with appropriate size .', u'Although reasoning on large ontologies is time consuming , it happens just one time and instead brings a lot of advantages which can not be provided by other methods .', u'For guaranteeing this claim , we assess the presented and former methods theoretically and practically and show that the proposed method causes the ontology to be parted properly and the resulted modules can be utilized by different tools like a self contained ontology .']

entities: [[(u'Wikipedia', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'RDF', u'Method')], [(u'Data Web', u'Material')], [(u'heavy-weight extraction process', u'Method')], [], [(u'DBpedia', u'Method'), (u'live extraction framework', u'Method'), (u'Wikipedia updates', u'Material')], [(u'knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'DBpedia', u'Material')], [(u'DBpedia ontology engineering process', u'Task'), (u'interactive round-trip engineering', u'Method'), (u'Wikipedia', u'Material'), (u'DBpedia', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'Wikipedia', u'CONJUNCTION', u'DBpedia')]]
sentences: [u'The DBpedia project extracts information from Wikipedia , interlinks it with other knowledge bases , and makes this data available as RDF .', u'So far the DBpedia project has succeeded in creating one of the largest knowledge bases on the Data Web , which is used in many applications and research prototypes .', u'However , the heavy-weight extraction process has been a drawback .', u'It requires manual effort to produce a new release and the extracted information is not up-to-date .', u'We extended DBpedia with a live extraction framework , which is capable of processing tens of thousands of changes per day in order to consume the constant stream of Wikipedia updates .', u'This allows direct modifications of the knowledge base and closer interaction of users with DBpedia .', u'We also show how the Wikipedia community itself is now able to take part in the DBpedia ontology engineering process and that an interactive round-trip engineering between Wikipedia and DBpedia is made possible .']

entities: [[(u'semantic argumentation approach', u'Method'), (u'collaborative ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'systematic and dynamic ontology deliberation', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic')], [(u'ontology deliberation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SAM Schema', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'community knowledge-based', u'Method')], [(u'ontology quality', u'Metric'), (u'group preference', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'collective ontology', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'online collective intelligence explorer', u'Method'), (u'SAMOnto', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Argumentation Model', u'Method'), (u'collective intelligence', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic argumentation approach', u'USED-FOR', u'collaborative ontology engineering'), (u'semantic argumentation approach', u'USED-FOR', u'systematic and dynamic ontology deliberation')], [], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'community knowledge-based')], [(u'ontology quality', u'CONJUNCTION', u'group preference')], [], [(u'SAMOnto', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'online collective intelligence explorer'), (u'Semantic Argumentation Model', u'USED-FOR', u'online collective intelligence explorer')]]
sentences: [u'This paper presents a semantic argumentation approach to collaborative ontology engineering which enables systematic and dynamic ontology deliberation to a community .', u"It encourages members to collaboratively express ideas or solutions regarding an ontology development issue , and to submit arguments which support or oppose other members ' ideas .", u'To allow sophisticated deliberation analysis , the ontology deliberation is formally and semantically captured and described into SAM Schema and maintained it as a community knowledge-based .', u'Moreover , a number of useful measures are proposed in order to evaluate the deliberation by considering both ontology quality and group preference which can be used to calculate the acceptance level of each position .', u'A position accepted by most members will be selectively integrated as collective ontology , which is collaboratively developed until achieving the final ontology .', u'Furthermore , an online collective intelligence explorer , namely SAMOnto , is developed based on Semantic Argumentation Model ( SAM ) for harnessing collective intelligence and automatically driving the community towards a consensus .']

entities: [[(u'description logic based ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'inconsistent ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'problem', u'Generic'), (u'inconsistent ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'consistent sub-ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'consistent query answering', u'Task'), (u'conjunctive queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL-Lite ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'four-valued semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL-Lite', u'Method')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'PTime', u'Method'), (u'TBox', u'Method'), (u'LOGSPACE', u'Method'), (u'ABox', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'description logic based ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology engineering'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'inconsistent ontologies')], [(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'problem')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'consistent query answering'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'conjunctive queries'), (u'consistent query answering', u'USED-FOR', u'conjunctive queries')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Consistent query answering over description logic based ontologies is an important topic in ontology engineering as it can provide meaningful answers to queries posed over inconsistent ontologies .', u'Current approaches for dealing with this problem usually consist of two steps : the first one is to extract some consistent sub-ontologies of an inconsistent ontology , and then the second one is to pose the query over these consistent sub-ontologies .', u'In this paper , we propose an alternative approach to consistent query answering for conjunctive queries over DL-Lite ontologies based on four-valued semantics , where DL-Lite is a family of tractable Description Logics DLs .', u'We give an algorithm to compute answers to a query over an inconsistent DL-Lite ontology and show that it is tractable .', u'In particular , we show that it is in PTime with respect to the size of the TBox , and is LOGSPACE with respect to the size of the ABox .']

entities: [[(u'Conceptual modeling', u'Method'), (u'code automation', u'Method'), (u'reduction of error propagation', u'Method'), (u'software development teams', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methodologies', u'Generic'), (u'guidelines', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'development software', u'Method'), (u'software quality', u'Metric')], [(u'agile process', u'Generic'), (u'ontology based software', u'Method'), (u'OntoSoft Process', u'Method'), (u'practices', u'Generic'), (u'Software Engineering', u'Task'), (u'Ontology Engineering', u'Task'), (u'Scrum', u'Material')], [(u'Agile practices', u'Method'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'ontology-based software', u'Method'), (u'software', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'Task')], [(u'ontology engineers', u'Method')], [(u'OntoSoft', u'Method'), (u'ontology-based application', u'Task'), (u'real estates', u'Material')], [(u'process', u'Generic'), (u'activities', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Conceptual modeling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'code automation'), (u'code automation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reduction of error propagation')], [(u'methodologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'guidelines')], [(u'agile process', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology based software'), (u'OntoSoft Process', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology based software'), (u'Software Engineering', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Ontology Engineering'), (u'Ontology Engineering', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Scrum')], [], [(u'software', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology')], [(u'software engineers', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology engineers')], [(u'OntoSoft', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology-based application'), (u'OntoSoft', u'USED-FOR', u'real estates'), (u'ontology-based application', u'USED-FOR', u'real estates')], [(u'process', u'USED-FOR', u'activities')]]
sentences: [u'Conceptual modeling , code automation and reduction of error propagation have motivated software development teams to use ontologies .', u'The lack of methodologies and guidelines to associate ontologies and development software can interfere in the development time , as well as in the software quality .', u'This paper proposes an agile process for ontology based software , called OntoSoft Process , bringing together practices from Software Engineering , Ontology Engineering and Scrum .', u'Agile practices were chosen as they can be adapted according to the context of each application .', u'The objective is to guide the development of ontology-based software by defining application scenarios and activities to develop the software and ontology .', u'Furthermore , the aim is also to improve the collaboration and communication between software engineers and ontology engineers .', u'OntoSoft has been applied to develop an ontology-based application to map and recommend real estates .', u'Preliminary results suggest that the proposed process is effective in associating tasks , activities and in creating development scenarios .']

sentences: [u'Biomedical ontologies are often large and complex , making ontology development and maintenance a challenge .', u'To address this challenge , scientists use automated techniques to alleviate the difficulty of ontology development .', u'However , for many ontology-engineering tasks , human judgment is still necessary .', u'Microtask crowdsourcing , wherein human workers receive remuneration to complete simple , short tasks , is one method to obtain contributions by humans at a large scale .', u'Previously , we developed and refined an effective method to verify ontology hierarchy using microtask crowdsourcing .', u'In this work , we report on applying this method to find errors in the SNOMED CT CORE subset .', u'By using crowdsourcing via Amazon Mechanical Turk with a Bayesian inference model , we correctly verified 86 % of the relations from the CORE subset of SNOMED CT in which Rector and colleagues previously identified errors via manual inspection .', u'Our results demonstrate that an ontology developer could deploy this method in order to audit large-scale ontologies quickly and relatively cheaply .']

relations: [[(u'data interrelationships', u'FEATURE-OF', u'meaning of data')], [(u'semantic models', u'USED-FOR', u'geometric features of corporal tissues')], [], [], [], [], [(u'DOGMA ontology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology engineering approaches')], [(u'ontology base', u'PART-OF', u'It')], [(u'DOGMA ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'formal representation of geometric features of corporal tissues')]]
sentences: [u'The mission of semantic data modelling lies in definition of the meaning of data within a context of data interrelationships .', u'In our previous work , we created semantic models for geometric features of corporal tissues , and then developed an automatic tissue classification system .', u'However , people who are not familiar with related background knowledge may not understand these highly specialized models .', u'Consequently , these models can not be shared and reused in other applications .', u'Unlike semantic data modelling , ontology is a formal representation of a set of concepts within a domain and the relationships between those concepts .', u'It is independent of specific applications .', u'One of the ontology engineering approaches is DOGMA ontology .', u'It consists of an ontology base which holds sets of conceptual relations and a layer of ontological commitments which holds the domain rules .', u'In this paper , we propose to apply DOGMA ontology for formal representation of geometric features of corporal tissues , for the purpose of knowledge reusability .']

entities: [[(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'water-energy-food ( WEF ) nexus', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary research approaches', u'Task')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'interdisciplinary research approaches', u'Method'), (u'system of interest', u'Method')], [(u'Qualitative methods', u'Method'), (u'primary research methods', u'Method'), (u'Questionnaire Surveys', u'Task'), (u'secondary research methods', u'Method'), (u'Ontology Engineering', u'Task'), (u'Integrated Maps', u'Method')], [(u'nexus', u'Generic'), (u'Physical Models', u'Method'), (u'Benefit-Cost Analysis', u'Method'), (u'BCA )', u'Method'), (u'Integrated Indices', u'Method'), (u'Optimization Management Models', u'Method')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'Philippines', u'Material')], []]
relations: [[(u'methods', u'USED-FOR', u'water-energy-food ( WEF ) nexus')], [], [(u'methods', u'USED-FOR', u'interdisciplinary research approaches')], [(u'primary research methods', u'CONJUNCTION', u'secondary research methods'), (u'Questionnaire Surveys', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'primary research methods'), (u'Questionnaire Surveys', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'secondary research methods'), (u'Questionnaire Surveys', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Ontology Engineering'), (u'Ontology Engineering', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'primary research methods'), (u'Ontology Engineering', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'secondary research methods'), (u'Ontology Engineering', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Integrated Maps'), (u'Integrated Maps', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'secondary research methods')], [(u'Physical Models', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'nexus'), (u'Physical Models', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Benefit-Cost Analysis'), (u'Physical Models', u'CONJUNCTION', u'BCA )'), (u'Benefit-Cost Analysis', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'nexus'), (u'Benefit-Cost Analysis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Integrated Indices'), (u'BCA )', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Integrated Indices'), (u'Integrated Indices', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Optimization Management Models')], [], []]
sentences: [u'This paper focuses on a collection of methods that can be used to analyze the water-energy-food ( WEF ) nexus .', u'We classify these methods as qualitative or quantitative for interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary research approaches .', u'The methods for interdisciplinary research approaches can be used to unify a collection of related variables , visualize the research problem , evaluate the issue , and simulate the system of interest .', u'Qualitative methods are generally used to describe the nexus in the region of interest , and include primary research methods such as Questionnaire Surveys , as well as secondary research methods such as Ontology Engineering and Integrated Maps .', u'Quantitative methods for examining the nexus include Physical Models , Benefit-Cost Analysis ( BCA ) , Integrated Indices , and Optimization Management Models .', u'The authors discuss each of these methods in the following sections , along with accompanying case studies from research sites in Japan and the Philippines .', u'Although the case studies are specific to two regions , these methods could be applicable to other areas , with appropriate calibration .']

entities: [[(u'well-engineered methodology', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology development life cycle', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Melting Point ( MP )', u'Method'), (u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'decentralised settings', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'MP', u'Method'), (u'methodologies', u'Generic'), (u'MP', u'Method')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'biological communities of practice', u'Task')], [(u'Melting Point', u'Method'), (u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'decentralised communities of practice', u'Task')], [(u'MP', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'well-engineered methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], [], [], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies'), (u'decentralised settings', u'FEATURE-OF', u'ontologies')], [], [], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'decentralised communities of practice')], []]
sentences: [u'This chapter addresses two research questions : How should a well-engineered methodology facilitate the development of ontologies within communities of practice ?', u'and What methodology should be used ?', u'If ontologies are to be developed by communities then the ontology development life cycle should be better understood within this context .', u'This chapter presents the Melting Point ( MP ) , a proposed new methodology for developing ontologies within decentralised settings .', u'It describes how MP was developed by taking best practices from other methodologies , provides details on recommended steps and recommended processes , and compares MP with alternatives .', u'The methodology presented here is the product of direct first-hand experience and observation of biological communities of practice in which some of the authors have been involved .', u'The Melting Point is a methodology engineered for decentralised communities of practice for which the designers of technology and the users may be the same group .', u'As such , MP provides a potential foundation for the establishment of standard practices for ontology engineering .']

entities: [[(u'knowledge management', u'Task'), (u'ontology construction', u'Task')], [(u'ontology construction', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'codification', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'collaboration', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web 2.0 technology', u'Method')], [(u'ontology knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Wikipedia', u'Material')], [(u'Wikipedia', u'Material'), (u'socially constructed source', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'conceptual coverage', u'Metric'), (u'hand-crafted ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Cyc', u'Method')], [(u'folksonomy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'formal ontology', u'Method'), (u'social knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'In the context of knowledge management , ontology construction can be considered as a part of capturing of the body of knowledge of a particular problem domain .', u'Traditionally , ontology construction assumes a tedious codification of the domain experts knowledge .', u'In this paper , we describe a new approach to ontology engineering that has the potential of bridging the dichotomy between codification and collaboration turning to Web 2.0 technology .', u'We propose to shift the primary source of ontology knowledge from the expert to socially emergent bodies of knowledge such as Wikipedia .', u'Using Wikipedia as an example , we demonstrate how core terms and relationships of a domain ontology can be distilled from this socially constructed source .', u'As an illustration , we describe how our approach achieved over 90 % conceptual coverage compared with Gold standard hand-crafted ontologies , such as Cyc .', u'What emerges is not a folksonomy , but rather a formal ontology that has nonetheless found its roots in social knowledge .']

sentences: [u"AbstractAlthough there were some ontology-based learning researches , most of researches were off-line ontology knowledge base or without reasoning mechanism to assist user 's learning .", u'We integrated several APIs to create an ontology-based assistant learning system ( ORALS ) that provides online editing ontology and rules in web pages and it is compatible with these popular ontology editors .', u'To simplify users creating ontology processes , That provides users search concept and reasoning items , all searching or reasoning results will be listed and shown by visualize concept maps .', u"By three teachers ' experiences , they applied ontology engineering technology to extract knowledge to ontology and build course concept maps and reasoning rules .", u'There were three classes grade 7th of junior high school total 95 students joined our study with the nervous system course unit of Science and Technology .', u'We hope this paper not only can present applied ontology to assist learning scenarios , but also help the other fields to induced ontology technologies easily .']

entities: [[(u'ontology engineering field', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'glossary', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'glossary', u'Method'), (u'subtype', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'composition', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'methodological processes', u'Method'), (u'multilingual terminological products', u'Method'), (u'glossary', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain knowledge organization', u'Task')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'glossary', u'Material')], [(u'terminology', u'Generic'), (u'ontology building', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'glossary'), (u'subtype', u'CONJUNCTION', u'composition')], [(u'methodological processes', u'USED-FOR', u'multilingual terminological products')], [], []]
sentences: [u'This paper addresses the lack of an explicitly agreed and defined terminology in the ontology engineering field , and particularly , the need for a glossary , which consists of terms and definitions for actions when developing ontologies .', u'The novelty of this paper lies in the precise description of a methodology for building a glossary with the processes and activities involved in ontology development as well as the relations between them ( such as subtype , composition and synonym ) .', u'The methodology proposed in this paper takes its inspiration from ideas taken from earlier research on methodological processes for creating multilingual terminological products and for defining a glossary in a particular domain as well as on domain knowledge organization .', u'The description of our methodology includes the approach followed and the steps carried out , as well as the key issues that arise when the glossary was being created .', u'So far as we are aware , this is the first attempt to normalize the terminology ( denominations and definitions ) of process and activities in ontology building .']

entities: [[(u'Genome sequencing', u'Task')], [], [(u'biological ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'annotation', u'Task')], [(u'they', u'Generic'), (u'translational information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'genomic sequences', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'genome annotation processes', u'Task'), (u'orthologous genes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'genetic disorders', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontological infrastructure', u'Method'), (u'ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'biological ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Sequence Ontology', u'Material'), (u'Ontological Gene Orthology', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'translational information', u'USED-FOR', u'they')], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'genome annotation processes'), (u'orthologous genes', u'USED-FOR', u'system')], [(u'Sequence Ontology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'biological ontologies'), (u'Sequence Ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Ontological Gene Orthology'), (u'Ontological Gene Orthology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'biological ontologies')]]
sentences: [u'Genome sequencing projects generate vast amounts of data of a wide variety of types and complexities , and at a growing pace .', u'Traditionally , the annotation of such sequences was difficult to share with other researchers .', u'Despite the fact that this has improved with the development and application of biological ontologies , such annotation efforts remain isolated since the amount of information that can be used from other annotation projects is limited .', u'In addition to this , they do not benefit from the translational information available for the genomic sequences .', u'In this paper , we describe a system that supports genome annotation processes by providing useful information about orthologous genes and the genetic disorders which can be associated with a gene identified in a sequence .', u'The seamless integration of such data will be facilitated by an ontological infrastructure which , following best practices in ontology engineering , will reuse existing biological ontologies like Sequence Ontology or Ontological Gene Orthology .']

sentences: [u'UML is now widely accepted as the standard modeling language for software construction .', u'The Class Diagram is its core view , having well formed semantics and providing the backbone for any modeling effort .', u'Class diagrams are widely used for purposes such as software specification , database and ontology engineering , meta-modeling , and model transformation .', u"The central role played by class diagrams emphasizes the need for strengthening UML modeling tools with features such as recognition of erroneous models and the detection of errors ' sources .", u'Correctness of UML class diagrams refers to the capability of a diagram to denote a finite but not empty reality .', u'This is a natural , unquestionable requirement .', u'Nevertheless , incorrect diagrams are often designed , due to the interaction of contradicting constraints and the limitations of current tools .', u'In this paper , the authors clarify the notion of class diagram correctness , discuss various approaches for detecting correctness problems , and propose a pattern-based approach for identifying situations in which correctness problems occur , and for providing explanations and repair advices .']

entities: [[(u'Ontology-based information publishing', u'Task'), (u'retrieval', u'Task'), (u'reuse', u'Task')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge engineers', u'Method')], [(u'domain', u'Generic'), (u'geosciences', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methodologies', u'Generic')], [(u'two-step methodology', u'Method'), (u'collaborative ontology engineering', u'Task'), (u'geosciences', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'minimalistic core ontology acting', u'Method'), (u'virtual collaborative development cycle', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'environmental protection', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Abstract # R # # N # # R # # N # Ontology-based information publishing , retrieval , reuse , and integration have become popular research topics to address the challenges involved in exchanging data between heterogeneous sources .', u'However , in most cases ontologies are still developed in a centralized top-down manner by a few knowledge engineers .', u'Consequently , the role that developers play in conceptualizing a domain such as the geosciences is disproportional compared with the role of domain experts and especially potential end-users .', u'These and other drawbacks have stimulated the creation of new methodologies focusing around collaboration .', u'Based on a review of existing approaches , this article presents a two-step methodology and implementation to foster collaborative ontology engineering in the geosciences .', u'Our approach consists of the development of a minimalistic core ontology acting as a catalyst and the creation of a virtual collaborative development cycle .', u'Both methodology and prototypical implementation have been tested in the context of the EU-funded ForeStClim project which addresses environmental protection with respect to forests and climate change .']

entities: [[(u'Abstract Ontologies', u'Material'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'computational science applications', u'Task')], [(u'biomedical studies', u'Material')], [(u'maintenance of ontologies', u'Task'), (u'engineering process', u'Method')], [(u'ontology engineering processes', u'Method'), (u'ontology elements', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology metrics', u'Metric'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Open Biomedical Ontologies ( OBO ) repository', u'Material')], [(u'ontology metrics tool', u'Method'), (u'Ontometrics', u'Method')], [(u'metrics', u'Generic'), (u'ontology metric evaluation studies', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'Ontometrics', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology metrics tool')], [(u'metrics', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology metric evaluation studies')]]
sentences: [u'Abstract Ontologies are gaining popularity in many domains as a way of representing , dealing and reasoning with large volumes of information , and they are starting to play a major role in computational science applications , e.g .', u'in biomedical studies .', u'The creation and maintenance of ontologies has become an engineering process that needs to be managed and measured .', u'Therefore , as part of any ontology engineering processes , metrics can play a role helping in identifying possible problems or incorrect use of ontology elements .', u'However , empirical studies that measure existing ontologies and set standard values are required for metrics to be effectively used .', u'This paper reports a preliminary exploration of ontology metrics from a large set of ontologies extracted from the Open Biomedical Ontologies ( OBO ) repository .', u'In this paper , we also present an ontology metrics tool , called Ontometrics , used to collect the set of metrics presented .', u'Results show that such metrics can help identifying peculiarities of the ontologies that could be used as the basis for future ontology metric evaluation studies .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic network', u'Method'), (u'software technologies', u'Method'), (u'linked organisations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'enterprises', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic network', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic network', u'Method'), (u'meaning-laden network', u'Method')], [(u'Enterprise-strength Ontology Engineering', u'Task'), (u'EsOE', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SE', u'Task')], [(u'SE models', u'Method'), (u'commonalities', u'Generic'), (u'EsOE', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'maturity models', u'Method'), (u'high-level methodology', u'Method'), (u'realisation', u'Generic'), (u'process', u'Generic'), (u'Project-focus and Organisation-focus processes', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'software technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'linked organisations'), (u'enterprises', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'linked organisations')], [], [], [(u'EsOE', u'USED-FOR', u'SE')], [(u'commonalities', u'USED-FOR', u'EsOE')], [(u'Project-focus and Organisation-focus processes', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'process')]]
sentences: [u'Semantic network is a promising technological platform that uses the internet and intranet , and related software technologies to explicitly integrate disparate applications in linked organisations such as enterprises .', u'A primary element of the semantic network is ontology .', u'The adoption of semantic network in enterprises is impeded by the lack of enduring methodologies for engineering reliable ontologies to support the evolving enterprise applications on the envisaged meaning-laden network .', u'Consequently , the paper recognises the systematic and disciplined approach of Software Engineering ( SE ) as relevant course for Enterprise-strength Ontology Engineering ( EsOE ) , and sets out to reflect EsOE in the light of SE .', u'It identifies the common ground among the contemporary SE models , and suggests exploiting these commonalities to serve as a basis for EsOE .', u'Following the idea of maturity models , the proposed high-level methodology is structured into three levels of realisation , each described by a process , namely , Engineering , Project-focus and Organisation-focus processes .']

sentences: [u'Product sustainability approaches , such as life cycle assessment ( LCA ) and life cycle costing ( LCC ) , are becoming increasingly critical to influence product decisions for all lifecycle stages .', u'However , LCA and LCC methods must be integrated into the product lifecycle processes for sharing their data semantics with other applications in order to support decisions in the technical , ecological and economic aspects of products .', u'Semantics sharing has raised big challenges in understanding and interpreting the intended meaning of LCA , LCC and other product data .', u'This paper presents an ontology-driven , standard-based approach to the explicit capture and reuse of product data semantics for heterogeneous information sharing across lifecycle processes in computer aided design , quality assurance , LCA and LCC analysis , and product development process management .', u'The approach incorporates object-based product data modeling , interoperability standardization , and ontology engineering to address the product data semantics sharing issues .', u'A software implementation of the approach with a use scenario is also discussed in the paper .']

entities: [[(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'reasoning', u'Method'), (u'domain-specific vocabularies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'military Command & Control systems', u'Task'), (u'them', u'Generic')], [(u'artillery vocabularies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'hierarchical structuring of concepts', u'Task')], [], [(u'internal validity', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
sentences: [u'The article addresses the question of whether methods from ontology engineering and reasoning can help domain-experts ( as opposed to laymen ) when mapping concepts from domain-specific vocabularies to each other .', u'The overarching context is military Command & Control systems , and the prospects for fostering interoperability between them .', u'The main contribution of the article is an experiment conducted with senior military officers on mapping two artillery vocabularies to each other .', u'Overall , the evidence is stronger that ( i ) hierarchical structuring of concepts , ( ii ) definitions of concepts and ( iii ) mappings to a common reference vocabulary can help domain-experts to make sound matches than help them avoid unsound ones .', u'However , more research is needed before a verdict can be given .', u'Though the experiment exhibits high ecological validity , using subjects who are experts in the domain of the two vocabularies that are to be mapped to each other , internal validity suffers confounding effects of previous expertise , and reliability is low , due to the low number of subjects ( $ $ N=13 $ $ N = 13 ) .']

entities: [[(u'Chest pain', u'Task'), (u'heart and chest diseases', u'Task')], [(u'vague information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'consultation system', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'subsystems', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'fuzzy concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy OWL', u'Material'), (u'vague information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SWRL and Ontology engineering', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'sensitivity', u'Metric'), (u'specificity', u'Metric')], [(u'system', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Chest pain is considered to be one of the most important prognoses to diagnose several heart and chest diseases .', u'This domain of knowledge suffers from vague information especially when non specialist people interact with it .', u'This paper presents a consultation system to be used by patients with chest pain or discomfort in order to diagnose the cause of the pain and provide suitable recommendations .', u'The system consists of two subsystems .', u'Determining the caused of the pain is the first stage based on the fuzzy concepts and fuzzy OWL to deal with vague information .', u'Depending on the result of the first stage , the second stage provides recommendations to be accomplished by the patient to save their lives according to SWRL and Ontology engineering .', u'The system has been tested using 55 patients to validate its sensitivity and specificity .', u'The results were compared with the specialists opinion and the results emphasized the efficiency and the reliability of the system .']

sentences: [u'This paper focuses on a collection of methods that can be used to analyze the water-energy-food ( WEF ) nexus .', u'We classify these methods as qualitative or quantitative for interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary research approaches .', u'The methods for interdisciplinary research approaches can be used to unify a collection of related variables , visualize the research problem , evaluate the issue , and simulate the system of interest .', u'Qualitative methods are generally used to describe the nexus in the region of interest , and include primary research methods such as Questionnaire Surveys , as well as secondary research methods such as Ontology Engineering and Integrated Maps .', u'Quantitative methods for examining the nexus include Physical Models , Benefit-Cost Analysis ( BCA ) , Integrated Indices , and Optimization Management Models .', u'The authors discuss each of these methods in the following sections , along with accompanying case studies from research sites in Japan and the Philippines .', u'Although the case studies are specific to two regions , these methods could be applicable to other areas , with appropriate calibration .']

sentences: [u'Purpose : To develop a Radiation Treatment Guidelines Ontology ( RTGO ) that represents the concepts , knowledge , and guidelines in radiation therapy using a formal and computable framework .', u'This ontology will serve as the foundation of a decision support system for radiation oncologists .', u'Method and Materials : The ontology framework chosen to represent RTGO is the Web Ontology Language ( OWL ) ( www.w3.org/TR/owlguide ) .', u'The OWL is rooted in the rigorous foundation of Description Logic and represents the latest development in ontology languages .', u'The ProtegeOWL ontology editor and knowledgebase framework ( http : //protege.stanford.edu ) is used to build the ontology .', u'The ontology is developed in a multilayered , modular , and iterative fashion .', u'Upper ontologies are used to provide a sound structure .', u'Concepts from standard ontologies are adopted whenever possible .', u'Salient concepts and relationships are incorporated into the ontology through multiple iterations of extraction , modeling , implementation , and evaluation .', u'Each iteration examines increasingly detailed concepts and relationships .', u'The concepts are asserted in a strict subsumption hierarchy and are carefully formulated to be at a proper level of abstraction consistent with anticipated questions addressed by the ontology .', u"Major ontology resources used in this project include National Center Biomedical Ontology 's Bioportal ( bioportal.bioontology.org ) and National Library of Medicine 's Universal Medical Language System ( UMLS ) ( www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls ) .", u'Major ontologies consulted include FMA for anatomical concepts , SNOMED for clinical findings and symptoms , and Semantic Network for relationships .', u'Results : The initial focus is on modeling the concepts and knowledge summarized in the Quantitative Analysis of Normal Tissue Effects in the Clinic ( QUANTEC ) papers .', u'Starting with the organ specific papers on bladder and rectum , the ontology has so far captured 171 concepts , 80 relationships , and 21 individuals .', u'The development is proceeding to include other organs in the QUANTEC literature .', u'Conclusion : Early results demonstrate that major concepts in QUANTEC papers regarding dose volume effects can be successfully captured in an ontological framework .', u'Duke University has a Master Research Agreement with Varian Medical Systems , INC .']

sentences: [u'Background : Recent years have seen an explosion in the availability of data in the chemistry domain .', u'With this information explosion , however , retrieving relevant results from the available information , and organising those results , become even harder problems .', u'Computational processing is essential to filter and organise the available resources so as to better facilitate the work of scientists .', u'Ontologies encode expert domain knowledge in a hierarchically organised machine-processable format .', u'One such ontology for the chemical domain is ChEBI .', u'ChEBI provides a classification of chemicals based on their structural features and a role or activity-based classification .', u'An example of a structure-based class is pentacyclic compound ( compounds containing five-ring structures ) , while an example of a role-based class is analgesic , since many different chemicals can act as analgesics without sharing structural features .', u'Structure-based classification in chemistry exploits elegant regularities and symmetries in the underlying chemical domain .', u'As yet , there has been neither a systematic analysis of the types of structural classification in use in chemistry nor a comparison to the capabilities of available technologies .', u'Results : We analyze the different categories of structural classes in chemistry , presenting a list of patterns for features found in class definitions .', u'We compare these patterns of class definition to tools which allow for automation of hierarchy construction within cheminformatics and within logic-based ontology technology , going into detail in the latter case with respect to the expressive capabilities of the Web Ontology Language and recent extensions for modelling structured objects .', u'Finally we discuss the relationships and interactions between cheminformatics approaches and logic-based approaches .', u'Conclusion : Systems that perform intelligent reasoning tasks on chemistry data require a diverse set of underlying computational utilities including algorithmic , statistical and logic-based tools .', u'For the task of automatic structurebased classification of chemical entities , essential to managing the vast swathes of chemical data being brought online , systems which are capable of hybrid reasoning combining several different approaches are crucial .', u'We provide a thorough review of the available tools and methodologies , and identify areas of open research .']

sentences: [u'Semantic and traditional databases are vulnerable to Inconsistent or Incomplete Data ( IID ) .', u'A data set stored in a traditional or semantic database is queried to retrieve record ( s ) in a tabular format .', u'Such retrieved records can consist of many rows where each row contains an object and the associated fields ( columns ) .', u'However , a large set of records retrieved from a noisy data set may be wrongly analysed .', u'For example , a data analyst may ascribe inconsistent data as consistent or incomplete data as complete where he did not identify the inconsistency or incompleteness in the data .', u'Analysis on a large set of data can be undermined by the presence of IID in that data set .', u'Reliance as a result is placed on the data analyst to identify and visualise the IID in the data set. # R # # N # The IID issues are heightened in open world assumptions as evident in semantic or Resource Description Framework ( RDF ) databases .', u'Unlike the closed world assumption in traditional databases where data are assumed to be complete with its own issues , in the open world assumption the data might be assumed to be unknown and IID has to be tolerated at the outset .', u'Formal Concept Analysis ( FCA ) can be used to deal with IID in such databases .', u"That is because FCA is a mathematical method that uses a lattice structure to reveal the associations among objects and attributes in a data set. # R # # N # The existing FCA approaches that can be used in dealing with IID in RDF databases include fault tolerance , Dau 's approach , and CUBIST approaches .", u'The new FCA approaches include association rules , semi-automated and automated methods in FcaBedrock .', u'These new FCA approaches were developed in the course of this study .', u'To underpin this work , a series of empirical studies were carried out based on the single case study methodology .', u'The case study , namely the Edinburgh Mouse Atlas Gene Expression Database ( EMAGE ) provided the real-life context according to that methodology .', u'The existing and the new FCA approaches were used in identifying and visualising the IID in the EMAGE RDF data set. # R # # N # The empirical studies revealed that the existing approaches used in dealing with IID in EMAGE are tedious and do not allow the IID to be easily visualised in the database .', u'It also revealed that existing FCA approaches for dealing with IID do not exclusively visualise the IID in a data set .', u'This is unlike the new FCA approaches , notably the semi-automated and automated FcaBedrock that can separate out and thus exclusively visualise IID in objects associated with the many value attributes that characterise such data sets .', u"The exclusive visualisation of IID in a data set enables the data analyst to identify holistically the IID in his or her investigated data set thereby avoiding mistaken conclusions. # R # # N # The aim was to discover how effective each FCA approach is in identifying and visualising IID , answering the research question : `` How can FCA tools and techniques be used in identifying and visualising IID in RDF data ? ''", u'The automated FcaBedrock approach emerged to be the best means for visually identifying IID in an RDF data set .', u"The CUBIST approaches and the semi-automated approach were ranked as 2nd and 3rd , respectively , whilst Dau 's approach ranked as 4th .", u'Whilst the subject of IID in a semantic technology setting could be explored further , it can be concluded that the automated FcaBedrock approach best identifies and visualises the IID in an RDF thus semantic data set .']
