sentences: [u'Computational workflows are a powerful paradigm to represent and manage complex applications , particularly in large-scale distributed scientific data analysis .', u'Workflows represent application components that result in individual computations as well as their interdependences in terms of dataflow .', u'Workflow systems use these representations to manage various aspects of workflow creation and execution for users , such as the automatic assignment of execution resources .', u'This article describes an approach to automating a new aspect of the process : the selection of application components and data sources .', u'We present a novel approach that enables users to specify varying degrees of detail and amount of constraints in a workflow request , including the specification of constraints on input , intermediate or output data in the workflow , abstract workflow component classes rather than specific component implementations , and generic reusable workflow templates that express a pre-defined combination of components .', u'The algorithm elaborates the user request into a set of fully ground workflows with specific choices of data sources and codes to be used so that they can be submitted for mapping and execution .', u'The algorithm searches through the space of possible candidate workflows by creating increasingly more specialized versions of the original template and eliminating candidates that violate constraints cumulated in the candidate workflow as components and data sources are selected .', u'A novel feature of our approach is that it assumes a distributed architecture where data and component catalogues are separate from the workflow system .', u'The algorithm explicitly poses queries to external catalogues , and therefore any reasoning regarding data or component properties is not assumed to occur within the workflow system .', u'We describe our implementation of this approach in the Wings workflow system .', u'This implementation uses the W3C Web Ontology Language and associated reasoners to implement the workflow system as well as the data and component catalogues .', u'This research demonstrates the use of artificial intelligence techniques to support the kinds of automation envisioned by the scientific community for large-scale distributed scientific data analysis .']

sentences: [u'Background : Most biomedical ontologies are represented in the OBO Flatfile Format , which is an easy-to-use graph-based ontology language .', u'The semantics of the OBO Flatfile Format 1.2 enforces a strict predetermined interpretation of relationship statements between classes .', u'It does not allow flexible specifications that provide better approximations of the intuitive understanding of the considered relations .', u'If relations can not be accurately expressed then ontologies built upon them may contain false assertions and hence lead to false inferences .', u'Ontologies in the OBO Foundry must formalize the semantics of relations according to the OBO Relationship Ontology ( RO ) .', u'Therefore , being able to accurately express the intended meaning of relations is of crucial importance .', u'Since the Web Ontology Language ( OWL ) is an expressive language with a formal semantics , it is suitable to de ne the meaning of relations accurately .', u'Results : We developed a method to provide definition patterns for relations between classes using OWL and describe a novel implementation of the RO based on this method .', u'We implemented our extension in software that converts ontologies in the OBO Flatfile Format to OWL , and also provide a prototype to extract relational patterns from OWL ontologies using automated reasoning .', u'The conversion software is freely available at http : //bioonto.de/ obo2owl , and can be accessed via a web interface .', u'Conclusions : Explicitly defining relations permits their use in reasoning software and leads to a more flexible and powerful way of representing biomedical ontologies .', u'Using the extended langua0067e and semantics avoids several mistakes commonly made in formalizing biomedical ontologies , and can be used to automatically detect inconsistencies .', u'The use of our method enables the use of graph-based ontologies in OWL , and makes complex OWL ontologies accessible in a graph-based form .', u'Thereby , our method provides the means to gradually move the representation of biomedical ontologies into formal knowledge representation languages that incorporates an explicit semantics .', u'Our method facilitates the use of OWL-based software in the back-end while ontology curators may continue to develop ontologies with an OBO-style front-end .']

sentences: [u'Abstract # R # # N # # R # # N # Effective communication requires a common vocabulary .', u'An ontology provides a description of the terminology , concepts and relationships for a particular area of interest .', u'An ontology may be viewed as a declarative encoding of the meaning of the domain vocabulary terms , thus making it a key to enabling communication .', u'For systems that are used by people whose understanding of a domain is not necessarily consistent , an explicit description of the important terms can be extremely useful. # R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # Many commercial companies have successfully deployed applications with increasing use of semantics such as taxonomy-based search and navigation services .', u'Rule-based manufacturing , product configuration , and financial services systems have been relatively common in those industries for many years .', u'Fewer organizations have successfully deployed semantically rich systems that incorporate ontology-based metadata , sophisticated reasoning and explanation support .', u'The technology has been around for decades , though its use for web-based applications is relatively recent , and it remains difficult for some people to understand , let alone use effectively. # R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # This tutorial provides an overview of the knowledge representation landscape and attempts to demystify some of the black art of ontology development .', u"We will outline basic methodology steps developed from a combination of # R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # Domain analysis methodology from software engineering # R # # N # IDEF methods developed for the US Department of Defense # R # # N # Best practices developed through extensive experience and lessons learned , with a focus on problems in software and systems engineering # R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # Examples from systems engineering will be provided , with emphasis on ontology development in UML using the Ontology Definition Metamodel , applications that lend themselves to vocabulary development in the Web Ontology Language ( OWL ) , and use of the these technologies together with models developed using the OMG 's Systems Modeling Language ( SysML ) ."]

entities: [[(u'Meaning negotiation', u'Task')], [(u'Articial Intelligence scholars', u'Material'), (u'MN', u'Task'), (u'argumentations schemes', u'Method'), (u'information fusion operators', u'Method'), (u'ontology alignment', u'Method'), (u'approaches', u'Generic')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'MN', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [], [(u'agents', u'Generic')], [(u'MN', u'Method'), (u'bilateral or pairwise MN )', u'Material'), (u'game theoretic models', u'Method'), (u'models', u'Generic'), (u'bilateral MN and English Auction', u'Material'), (u'multiparty MN', u'Material')], [(u'agreement', u'Generic'), (u'deduction system', u'Method'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'MN', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Meaning negotiation ( MN ) is the general process with which agents reach an agreement about the meaning of a set of terms .', u'Articial Intelligence scholars have dealt with the problem of MN by means of argumentations schemes , beliefs merging and information fusion operators , and ontology alignment but the proposed approaches depend upon the number of participants .', u'In this paper , we give a general model of MN for an arbitrary number of agents , in which each participant discusses with the others her viewpoint by exhibiting it in an actual set of constraints on the meaning of the negotiated terms .', u'We call this presentation of individual viewpoints an angle .', u'The agents do not aim at forming a common viewpoint but , instead , at agreeing about an acceptable common angle .', u'We analyze separately the process of MN by two agents ( bilateral or pairwise MN ) and by more than two agents ( multiparty MN ) , and we use game theoretic models to understand how the process develops in both cases : the models are Bargaining Game for bilateral MN and English Auction for multiparty MN .', u'We formalize the process of reaching such an agreement by giving a deduction system that comprises of rules that are consistent and adequate for representing MN .']

sentences: [u'The alignment of separate ontologies by matching related concepts continues to attract great attention within the database and artificial intelligence communities , especially since semantic heterogeneity across data sources remains a widespread and relevant problem .', u'In particular , the Geographic Information System ( GIS ) domain presents unique forms of semantic heterogeneity that require a variety of matching approaches .', u'Our approach considers content-based techniques for aligning GIS ontologies .', u'We examine the associated instance data of the compared concepts and apply a content-matching strategy to measure similarity based on value types based on N-grams present in the data .', u'We focus special attention on a method applying the concepts of mutual information and N-grams by developing 2 separate variations and testing them over GIS dataset including multi-jurisdictions .', u'In order to align concepts , first we find the appropriate columns .', u'For this , we will exploit mutual information between two columns based on the type distribution of their content .', u'Intuitively , if two columns are semantically same , type distribution should be very similar .', u'We justify the conceptual validity of our ontology alignment technique with a series of experimental results that demonstrate the efficacy and utility of our algorithms on a wide-variety of authentic GIS data .']

sentences: [u'We describe a methodology for identifying characterizing terms from a source text or paper and automatically building an ontology around them , with the purpose of semantically categorizing a paper corpus where documents sharing similar subjects may be subsequently clustered together by means of ontology alignment .', u"We first employ a Natural Language Processing pipeline to extract relevant terms from the source text , and then use a combination of a pattern-based and machine-learning approach to establish semantic relationships among those terms , with some user 's feedback required in-between .", u'This methodology for discovering characterizing knowledge from textual sources finds its inception as an extension of PRAISED , our abbreviation discovery framework , in order to enhance its resolution capabilities .', u'By moving from a paper-by-paper , mainly syntactical process to a corpus-based , semantic approach , it was in fact possible to overcome earlier limits of the system related to abbreviations whose explanation could not be found within the same paper they were cited in .', u'At the same time , though , the methodology we present is not tied to this specific task , but is instead of relevance for a variety of contexts , and might therefore be used to build a stand-alone system for advanced knowledge extraction and semantic categorization .']

relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'PROMPT', u'USED-FOR', u'semi-automatic approach'), (u'algorithm', u'COMPARE', u'semi-automatic approach'), (u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology'), (u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology merging and alignment'), (u'semi-automatic approach', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology'), (u'ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'alignment')], [], [], [(u'knowledge model', u'USED-FOR', u'PROMPT')], []]
sentences: [u'Researchers in the ontology-design field have developed the content for ontologies in many domain areas .', u'Recently , ontologies have become increasingly common on the WorldWide Web where they provide semantics for annotations in Web pages .', u'This distributed nature of ontology development has led to a large number of ontologies covering overlapping domains .', u'In order for these ontologies to be reused , they first need to be merged or aligned to one another .', u'The processes of ontology alignment and merging are usually handled manually and often constitute a large and tedious portion of the sharing process .', u'We have developed and implemented PROMPT , an algorithm that provides a semi-automatic approach to ontology merging and alignment .', u'PROMPT performs some tasks automatically and guides the user in performing other tasks for which his intervention is required .', u'PROMPT also determines possible inconsistencies in the state of the ontology , which result from the users actions , and suggests ways to remedy these inconsistencies .', u'PROMPT is based on an extremely general knowledge model and therefore can be applied across various platforms .', u'Our formative evaluation showed that a human expert followed 90 % of the suggestions that PROMPT generated and that 74 % of the total knowledge-base operations invoked by the user were suggested by PROMPT .']

entities: [[(u'Gold standard mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'alignment evaluation', u'Task')], [(u'manual evaluation', u'Task')], [], [(u'manual evaluation', u'Task'), (u'mappings', u'Method')], [(u'alignments', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'think aloud method', u'Method')], [(u'inter-rater agreement', u'Metric')], [(u'level of agreement', u'Metric'), (u'mapping relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'evaluation guidelines', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ill-defined natural language concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'manual evaluation of ontology alignments', u'Task'), (u'reference alignments', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
sentences: [u'Gold standard mappings created by experts are at the core of alignment evaluation .', u'At the same time , the process of manual evaluation is rarely discussed .', u'While the practice of having multiple raters evaluate results is accepted , their level of agreement is often not measured .', u'In this paper we describe three experiments in manual evaluation and study the way different raters evaluate mappings .', u'We used alignments generated using different techniques and between vocabularies of different type .', u'In each experiment , five raters evaluated alignments and talked through their decisions using the think aloud method .', u'In all three experiments we found that inter-rater agreement was low and analyzed our data to find the reasons for it .', u'Our analysis shows which variables can be controlled to affect the level of agreement including the mapping relations , the evaluation guidelines and the background of the raters .', u'On the other hand , differences in the perception of raters , and the complexity of the relations between often ill-defined natural language concepts remain inherent sources of disagreement .', u'Our results indicate that the manual evaluation of ontology alignments is by no means an easy task and that the ontology alignment community should be careful in the construction and use of reference alignments .']

sentences: [u'Existing ontology-based knowledge representations systems have achieved considerable success in semantic querying on large biomedical text corpora over keyword-based systems .', u'However , their query expressivity is limited due to the lack of cross-ontology integration and semantic relations .', u'We present a System for Multiple-Ontology Knowledge Representation ( SMOKR ) to alleviate the problem .', u'The system first performs annotations of phrases and the semantic relations between them using different domain ontologies , before instantiating the ontologies with the annotated phrases .', u'It then integrates the ontologies by matching their instances using simple NLP techniques , and also by matching their concepts using the state-of-the-art Biomedical Ontology Alignment Tool ( BOAT ) .', u'SMOKR performs inconsistency detection to remove conflicting axioms in order to create a consistent ontology for querying .', u'We evaluate the performance of the system by testing it with a set of semantic queries , and the results are compared to a keyword-based search engine , Lucene , and a hybrid system , SSOKR_Luc , which combines a knowledge representation system using a single ontology and the keyword-based search engine , Lucene .', u'SMOKR shows the best performance of F-Measures 0.7 and 0.87 on the GRO Corpus and the GENIA Corpus , respectively , compared to that of SSOKR_Luc at 0.62 and 0.33 , and that of Lucene at 0.36 and 0.12 .']

sentences: [u'Knowledge sharing communities like Wikipedia and automated extraction like DBpedia enable a large construction of machine processing knowledge bases with relational fact of entities .', u'These options give a great opportunity for researcher to use it as a domain concept between low-level features and high-level concepts for image retrieval .', u'The collection of images attached to entities , such as on-line news articles with images , are abundant on the Internet .', u'Still , it is difficult to retrieve accurate information on these entities .', u'Using entity names in a search engine yields large lists , but often results in imprecise and unsatisfactory outcomes .', u'Our goal is to populate a knowledge base with on-line image news resources in the BBC sport domain .', u'This system will yield high precision , a high recall and include diverse sports photos for specific entities .', u'A multi-modality ontology retrieval system , with relational facts about entities for generating expanded queries , will be used to retrieve results .', u'DBpedia will be used as a domain sport ontology description , and will be integrated with a textual description and a visual description , both generated by hand .', u'To overcome semantic interoperability between ontologies , automated ontology alignment is used .', u'In addition , visual similarity measures based on MPEG7 descriptions and SIFT features , are used for higher diversity in the final rankings .']

sentences: [u'This article presents a bilingual ontology-based dialog system with multiple services .', u'An ontology-alignment algorithm is proposed to integrate ontologies of different languages for cross-language applications .', u'A domain-specific ontology is further extracted from the bilingual ontology using an island-driven algorithm and a domain corpus .', u'This study extracts the semantic words-concepts using latent semantic analysis ( LSA ) .', u'Based on the extracted semantic words and the domain ontology , a partial pattern tree is constructed to model the speech act of a spoken utterance .', u'The partial pattern tree is used to deal with the ill-formed sentence problem in a spoken-dialog system .', u'Concept expansion based on domain ontology is also adopted to improve system performance .', u'For performance evaluation , a medical dialog system with multiple services , including registration information , clinic information , and FAQ information , is implemented .', u'Four performance measures were used separately for evaluation .', u'The speech act identification rate was 86.2 % .', u'A task success rate of 77 % was obtained .', u'The contextual appropriateness of the system response was 78.5 % .', u'Finally , the rate for correct FAQ retrieval was 82 % , an improvement of 15 % over the keyword-based vector-space model .', u'The results show the proposed ontology-based speech-act identification is effective for dialog management .', u'2008 Wiley Periodicals , Inc .']

sentences: [u'Modern ontology debugging methods allow efficient identification and localization of faulty axioms defined by a user while developing an ontology .', u'The ontology development process in this case is characterized by rather frequent and regular calls to a reasoner resulting in an early user awareness of modeling errors .', u'In such a scenario an ontology usually includes only a small number of conflict sets , i.e .', u'sets of axioms preserving the faults .', u'This property allows efficient use of standard model-based diagnosis techniques based on the application of hitting set algorithms to a number of given conflict sets .', u'However , in many use cases such as ontology alignment the ontologies might include many more conflict sets than in usual ontology development settings , thus making precomputation of conflict sets and consequently ontology diagnosis infeasible .', u'In this paper we suggest a debugging approach based on a direct computation of diagnoses that omits calculation of conflict sets .', u'Embedded in an ontology debugger , the proposed algorithm is able to identify diagnoses for an ontology which includes a large number of faults and for which application of standard diagnosis methods fails .', u'The evaluation results show that the approach is practicable and is able to identify a fault in adequate time .']

sentences: [u'This paper outlines our long-term vision for integrating robust machine learning as an approach to the modern battlefield .', u'We will develop the architecture for an Integrated Learning System ( ILS ) that will enable representation tools to maximize the utility of data collected by distributed sensors .', u'This project will suggest a system for data capture , processing , retrieval and analysis and focus on the development of semantic interoperability for ontology alignment and the ability to learn from experiences , so that performance improves as it accumulates knowledge resulting in the ability to learn new object/event classes and improve its classification accuracy .', u'To illustrate the notion of robust learning from distinct representations of sensor data from a common source , we offer an application where a LCS addresses automatic target recognition ( ATR ) in extended operating conditions ( EOCs ) .', u'The LCS-based robust ATR system performed well , resulting in powerful ATR rules that generalize over multiple feature types , with accuracy over 99 % and robustness over 80 % .', u'To illustrate the notion of ontology enabling learning , we outline preliminary experiments with a network of LCSs integrating ATR via a simple vehicle ontology .', u'( 2006 ) COPYRIGHT SPIE -- The International Society for Optical Engineering .', u'Downloading of the abstract is permitted for personal use only .']

sentences: [u'In this paper we investigate the keyword based class retrieval problem , which we define as how to identify ontological classes that best match a keyword based query .', u'Most previous applications use simple syntactic matching approaches on the class labels and/or comments , or expand the keyword query by using lexicons such as Word Net , but fail to retrieve relevant resources in many scenarios .', u'Instead of relying on external sources , we investigate this problem by using the annotations of instances associated with classes in the knowledge base .', u'We propose a general framework of this approach , which consists of two phases : the keyword query is first used to locate relevant instances , then we induce the classes given this list of weighted matched instances .', u'If we identify sufficient text for the instances , then the first phase can be solved by a traditional information retrieval ( IR ) query , however the second phase might be cast in different ways : as an additive value function , as an IR problem with instance as queries , or as an instance-based ontology alignment problem .', u'With many applicable strategies initiated from different viewpoints , we find that some of them are mathematically equivalent or very similar .', u'In the experiments we compare our proposed framework to simple syntactic approaches and evaluate different strategies .']

sentences: [u'knowledge sharing communities like Wikipedia and automated extraction like DBpedia enable a large construction of machine processing knowledge bases with relational fact of entities .', u'These options give a great opportunity for researcher to use it as a domain concept between low-level features and high- level concepts for image retrieval .', u'The collection of images attached to entities , such as on-line news articles with images , are abundant on the Internet .', u'Still , it is difficult to retrieve accurate information on these entities .', u'Using entity names in a search engine yields large lists , but often results in imprecise and unsatisfactory outcomes .', u'Our goal is to populate a knowledge base with on-line image news resources in the BBC sport domain .', u'This system will yield high precision , a high recall and include diverse sports photos for specific entities .', u'A multi-modality ontology retrieval system , with relational facts about entities for generating expanded queries , will be used to retrieve results .', u'DBpedia will be used as a domain sport ontology description , and will be integrated with a textual description and a visual description , both generated by hand .', u'To overcome semantic interoperability between ontologies , automated ontology alignment is used .', u'In addition , visual similarity measures based on MPEG7 descriptions and SIFT features , are used for higher diversity in the final rankings .']

entities: [[(u'relational factor graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'first-order logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'inference problems', u'Task')], [(u'exponential blow-up', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'MCMC', u'Method')], [(u'jump function', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'sampling-based methods', u'Method'), (u'local minimathe system', u'Method'), (u'lower-scoring configurations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'MAP solution', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'reinforcement learning', u'Method')], [(u'factor graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'log-linear function approximator', u'Method'), (u'temporal difference', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'MAP inference', u'Method'), (u'policy', u'Generic')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'gradient updates', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'variables', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'ontology alignment', u'Task'), (u'domain', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'first-order logic', u'USED-FOR', u'relational factor graphs')], [], [], [(u'reinforcement learning', u'USED-FOR', u'method')], [(u'log-linear function approximator', u'USED-FOR', u'factor graph')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'gradient updates')], []]
sentences: [u'Large , relational factor graphs with structure defined by first-order logic or other languages give rise to notoriously difficult inference problems .', u'Because unrolling the structure necessary to represent distributions over all hypotheses has exponential blow-up , solutions are often derived from MCMC .', u'However , because of limitations in the design and parameterization of the jump function , these sampling-based methods suffer from local minimathe system must transition through lower-scoring configurations before arriving at a better MAP solution .', u'This paper presents a new method of explicitly selecting fruitful downward jumps by leveraging reinforcement learning ( RL ) .', u'Rather than setting parameters to maximize the likelihood of the training data , parameters of the factor graph are treated as a log-linear function approximator and learned with methods of temporal difference ( TD ) ; MAP inference is performed by executing the resulting policy on held out test data .', u'Our method allows efficient gradient updates since only factors in the neighborhood of variables affected by an action need to be computedwe bypass the need to compute marginals entirely .', u'Our method yields dramatic empirical success , producing new state-of-the-art results on a complex joint model of ontology alignment , with a 48 % reduction in error over state-of-the-art in that domain .']

relations: [[(u'AgreementMaker system', u'USED-FOR', u'matching real-world schemas and ontologies')], [], [(u'matching methods', u'PART-OF', u'system')], [(u'recall', u'CONJUNCTION', u'precision'), (u'precision', u'CONJUNCTION', u'runtime')], [(u'Ontology Alignment Evaluation Initiative ( OAEI ) competition', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'AgreementMaker')], [(u'matching methods', u'CONJUNCTION', u'evaluation strategies')]]
sentences: [u'We present the AgreementMaker system for matching real-world schemas and ontologies , which may consist of hundreds or even thousands of concepts .', u'The end users of the system are sophisticated domain experts whose needs have driven the design and implementation of the system : they require a responsive , powerful , and extensible framework to perform , evaluate , and compare matching methods .', u'The system comprises a wide range of matching methods addressing different levels of granularity of the components being matched ( conceptual vs. structural ) , the amount of user intervention that they require ( manual vs. automatic ) , their usage ( stand-alone vs. composed ) , and the types of components to consider ( schema only or schema and instances ) .', u'Performance measurements ( recall , precision , and runtime ) are supported by the system , along with the weighted combination of the results provided by those methods .', u'The AgreementMaker has been used and tested in practical applications and in the Ontology Alignment Evaluation Initiative ( OAEI ) competition .', u'We report here on some of its most advanced features , including its extensible architecture that facilitates the integration and performance tuning of a variety of matching methods , its capability to evaluate , compare , and combine matching results , and its user interface with a control panel that drives all the matching methods and evaluation strategies .']

entities: [[(u'ontology alignment framework', u'Method'), (u'background knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'vagueness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'matching process', u'Method'), (u'concept alignments', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'procedure', u'Generic'), (u'generic reference vocabulary', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'vocabulary', u'Generic'), (u'Wikipedia', u'Material'), (u'cross language matchings', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'domain concept', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reference concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'fuzzified domain concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'concept matches', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'merged fuzzy ontology', u'Method')], [(u'multimedia', u'Material'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'tagged images', u'Material'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'information retrieval setting', u'Task')], [(u'fuzzy approach', u'Method'), (u'human judgment', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'generic reference vocabulary', u'USED-FOR', u'procedure')], [], [], [], [(u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'merged fuzzy ontology')], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'multimedia'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'information retrieval setting')], []]
sentences: [u'We propose an ontology alignment framework with two core features : the use of background knowledge and the ability to handle vagueness in the matching process and the resulting concept alignments .', u'The procedure is based on the use of a generic reference vocabulary , which is used for fuzzifying the ontologies to be matched .', u'The choice of this vocabulary is problem-dependent in general , although Wikipedia represents a general-purpose source of knowledge that can be used in many cases , and even allows cross language matchings .', u'In the first step of our approach , each domain concept is represented as a fuzzy set of reference concepts .', u'In the next step , the fuzzified domain concepts are matched to one another , resulting in fuzzy descriptions of the matches of the original concepts .', u'Based on these concept matches , we propose an algorithm that produces a merged fuzzy ontology that captures what is common to the source ontologies .', u'The paper describes experiments in the domain of multimedia by using ontologies containing tagged images , as well as an evaluation of the approach in an information retrieval setting .', u'The undertaken fuzzy approach has been compared to a classical crisp alignment by the help of a ground truth that was created based on human judgment .']

sentences: [u'This paper describes a Linked Data service that supports the navigation and retrieval of geographical entities for the UK territory .', u'Geographical entities , in the extent of this paper , are linked data resources that describe objects that have a geographical extension .', u'The service presented in this paper allows the querying of resources that contain or are contained by a given entity URI .', u'The recent publication of UK Public Sector Information ( PSI ) data sets has brought to the attention of the community the redundant presence of location based context .', u'At the same time it stresses the inadequacy of current Linked Data services for exploiting the semantics of such contextual dimensions for easing entity retrieval and browsing .', u'We present an approach for a geography based service that helps in querying qualitative spatial relations for the UK geography ( proper containment so far ) .', u'We also provide an exploitation scenario based on a backlinking service and PSI Open Linked Data , published within the EnAKTing project .']

entities: [[(u'Dynamic Linked Data Observatory', u'Method'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'raw data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [], [(u'corpus', u'Generic'), (u'monitoring framework', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'We describe work-in-progress on the design and methodology of the Dynamic Linked Data Observatory : a framework to monitor Linked Data over an extended period of time .', u'The core goal of our work is to collect frequent , continuous snapshots of a subset of the Web of Data that is interesting for further study and experimentation , with an aim to capture raw data about the dynamics of Linked Data .', u'The resulting corpora will be made openly and continuously available to the Linked Data research community .', u"Herein , we ( 1 ) motivate the importance of such a corpus ; ( 2 ) outline some of the use-cases and requirements for the resulting snapshots ; ( 3 ) discuss dierent \\views '' of the Web of Data that aect how we dene a sample to monitor ; ( 4 ) detail how we select the scope of the monitoring experiment through sampling , ( 5 ) discuss the nal design of the monitoring framework that will gather regular snapshots of ( subsets of ) the Web of Data over the coming months and years ."]

relations: [[(u'complex structure', u'CONJUNCTION', u'multi-meaning')], [], [(u'linked data', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF triples')], [], [(u'DBpeida', u'CONJUNCTION', u'YAGO'), (u'DBpeida', u'CONJUNCTION', u'DBpedia'), (u'YAGO', u'CONJUNCTION', u'DBpedia'), (u'YAGO', u'CONJUNCTION', u'LinkedGeoData'), (u'DBpedia', u'CONJUNCTION', u'LinkedGeoData'), (u'LinkedGeoData', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'representative domains')], [], [(u'method', u'COMPARE', u'link statistical approach'), (u'entity co-reference links', u'COMPARE', u'link statistical approach')]]
sentences: [u'Owing to the complex structure and multi-meaning , property alignment is generally regarded as a challenging problem in the context of linked data .', u'In this paper , we propose a novel method to align properties between datasets of linked data .', u'Considering the role of properties in RDF triples , we regard all properties of linked data as property functions , and convert the problem of property alignment to the similarity evaluation between property functions , while the equivalent instances as inputs of property functions .', u'Based on the similarity of property functions , the property alignment process of linked data is introduced .', u'In order to prove the validity , we use the method to align properties in five representative domains between DBpeida and YAGO , DBpedia and LinkedGeoData respectively .', u'The experimental results show that our method is independent of the property naming rules and can retrieve some matching properties ignored by other methods .', u'In addition , our method requires fewer entity co-reference links than the link statistical approach .']

sentences: [u'Purpose Linked data is gaining great interest in the cultural heritage domain as a new way for publishing , sharing and consuming data .', u'The paper aims to provide a detailed method and MARiMbA a tool for publishing linked data out of library catalogues in the MARC 21 format , along with their application to the catalogue of the National Library of Spain in the datos.bne.es project .', u'Design/methodology/approach First , the background of the case study is introduced .', u'Second , the method and process of its application are described .', u'Third , each of the activities and tasks are defined and a discussion of their application to the case study is provided .', u'Findings The paper shows that the FRBR model can be applied to MARC 21 records following linked data best practices , librarians can successfully participate in the process of linked data generation following a systematic method , and data sources quality can be improved as a result of the process .', u'Originality/value The paper proposes a detailed method for publ ...']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'web', u'Material'), (u'web of data', u'Material')], [(u'It', u'Generic')], [(u'distributed querying', u'Method')], [(u'Local copies', u'Material'), (u'distributed queries', u'Material'), (u'scalability', u'Metric')], [(u'Linked Data producers', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data node', u'Method'), (u'social network of live updates', u'Method'), (u'Live Linked Data LLD', u'Material')], [], [(u'SU-Set', u'Method'), (u'Commutative Replicated Data Type CRDT', u'Method'), (u'RDF graph', u'Method')], [(u'semantic store', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SU-Set', u'Method'), (u'LLD', u'Method'), (u'communication', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'Live Linked Data LLD', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'social network of live updates')], [(u'concurrency', u'CONJUNCTION', u'consistency')], [(u'Commutative Replicated Data Type CRDT', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF graph')], [(u'SU-Set', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic store')]]
sentences: [u'Linked Data is currently interconnecting information on the web , creating the web of data .', u'It allows data consumers to combine different data sets and perform powerful queries .', u'However , this means either to copy data sets locally or perform distributed querying .', u'Local copies have problems of freshness , distributed queries , of scalability and performance .', u'Linked Data producers are currently going live by providing streams of data updates , opening a third way to query : synchronise and search .', u'Each Linked Data node can follow update streams of others , creating a social network of live updates : the Live Linked Data LLD .', u'Unfortunately , synchronising data among autonomous participants raises issues of concurrency and consistency .', u'In this paper , we propose SU-Set , a Commutative Replicated Data Type CRDT for RDF graph updated with SPARQL Update 1.1 .', u'We describe how a semantic store can use SU-Set to ensure eventual consistency in LLD , with a low overhead in time , space and communication .']

sentences: [u'Linked data stores house vetted content that can supplement the information available through online library catalogs , potentially mitigating failed author searches if information about the author exists in linked data formats .', u"In this case study , a total of 689 failed author index queries from a large Midwestern academic library 's online library catalog were re-run in seven linked data sources ( Open Library , DBpedia , Freebase , New York Times Linked Open Data , NNDB , Virtual International Authorities File , and the Library of Congress Name Authorities ) , with 534 ( 78 percent ) of the failed catalog queries yielding at least one hit in one of the repositories .", u'Over half of the failed online library catalog queries examined were incorrectly formulated ( n = 369 ) , implying that some searchers of online library catalogs are unclear about the mechanics of left-anchored searching in author indexes .', u'As a first step in becoming part of the linked data information ecosystem , librarians should consider providing access ...']

relations: [[(u'architecture', u'CONJUNCTION', u'engineering'), (u'engineering', u'CONJUNCTION', u'construction')], [], [(u'linked data approach', u'USED-FOR', u'interoperability challenge'), (u'linked data approach', u'USED-FOR', u'building life-cycle')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The interoperability challenge is a long-standing challenge in the domain of architecture , engineering and construction ( AEC ) .', u'Diverse approaches have already been presented for addressing this challenge .', u'This article will look into the possibility of addressing the interoperability challenge in the building life-cycle with a linked data approach .', u'An outline is given of how linked data technologies tend to be deployed , thereby working towards a more holistic perspective on the building , or towards a large-scale web of linked building data .', u'From this overview , and the associated use case scenarios , we conclude that the interoperability challenge can not be solved using linked data technologies , but that it can be addressed .', u'In other words , information exchange and management can be improved , but a pragmatic usage of technologies is still required in practice .', u'Finally , we give an initial outline of some anticipated use cases in the building life-cycle in which the usage of linked data technologies may generate advantages over existing technologies and methods .']

entities: [[(u'Web technologies', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'search indices', u'Material')], [(u'network communication overhead', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'latency', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [], [(u'Linked Data sources', u'Material'), (u'local copies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'outdated information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methods', u'Generic')], [(u'real world data', u'Material')]]
sentences: [u'Being based on Web technologies , Linked Data is distributed and decentralised in its nature .', u'Hence , for the purpose of finding relevant Linked Data on the Web , search indices play an important role .', u'Also for avoiding network communication overhead and latency , applications rely on indices or caches over Linked Data .', u'These indices and caches are based on local copies of the original data and , thereby , introduce redundancy .', u'Furthermore , as changes at the original Linked Data sources are not automatically propagated to the local copies , there is a risk of having inaccurate indices and caches due to outdated information .', u'In this paper I discuss and compare methods for measuring the accuracy of indices .', u'I will present different measures which have been used in related work and evaluate their advantages and disadvantages from a theoretic point of view as well as from a practical point of view by analysing their behaviour on real world data in an empirical experiment .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data initiative', u'Method'), (u'structured data', u'Material'), (u'World Wide Web', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantically codified data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Open Data cloud', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Open Data cloud', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data principles', u'Method'), (u'life sciences data', u'Material')], [(u'biological research', u'Task'), (u'Linked Open Data cloud', u'Material')], [(u'orthologs genes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'genetic diseases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hypothesis generation', u'Task')], [(u'OGOLOD system', u'Method'), (u'OGO Knowledge Base', u'Method'), (u'orthologs/diseases information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'structured information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'orthologs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'cloud', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Linked Open Data cloud', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantically codified data')], [], [], [], [(u'orthologs genes', u'CONJUNCTION', u'genetic diseases')], [(u'OGO Knowledge Base', u'USED-FOR', u'OGOLOD system'), (u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'orthologs/diseases information')], [(u'orthologs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'human diseases')]]
sentences: [u'The Linked Data initiative offers a straight method to publish structured data in the World Wide Web and link it to other data , resulting in a world wide network of semantically codified data known as the Linked Open Data cloud .', u'The size of the Linked Open Data cloud , i.e .', u'the amount of data published using Linked Data principles , is growing exponentially , including life sciences data .', u'However , key information for biological research is still missing in the Linked Open Data cloud .', u'For example , the relation between orthologs genes and genetic diseases is absent , even though such information can be used for hypothesis generation regarding human diseases .', u'The OGOLOD system , an extension of the OGO Knowledge Base , publishes orthologs/diseases information using Linked Data .', u'This gives the scientists the ability to query the structured information in connection with other Linked Data and to discover new information related to orthologs and human diseases in the cloud .']

entities: [[], [(u'EHEA', u'Method')], [(u'EHEA processes', u'Method'), (u'credit recognition', u'Task'), (u'datasets', u'Generic')], [(u'Linked Data principles', u'Method'), (u'global data space', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web of Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data-driven scenarios', u'Method'), (u'EHEA processes', u'Method')], [(u'EHEA landscape', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'credit recognition', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'EHEA processes')], [], [(u'EHEA processes', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data-driven scenarios')], []]
sentences: [u'The european higher education area ( EHEA ) aims to create a more comparable , compatible and coherent space of Higher Education in Europe .', u'After a decade of reforms , most of the required instruments are already in place , so the next years are key to complete the implementation and consolidation of the EHEA .', u'However , data challenges pose a threat to pivotal EHEA processes such as credit recognition that require institutions to cooperate and integrate their datasets scattered across diverse repositories in multiple data formats .', u'Linked Data principles and practices have the potential to address such difficulties , as demonstrated with the emergence of a global data space the Web of Data .', u'This paper first discusses the benefits of Linked Data for the emergent EHEA , devising a new set of Linked Data-driven scenarios that leverage current EHEA processes .', u'Further , a set of preliminary Linked Data deployments is examined to assess the advantages and identify the challenges ahead in the EHEA landscape .']

sentences: [u'Linked data have the potential to expose descriptive metadata about serials and serials relationships on the open Web and allow creative connections between library information about serials and the seemingly infinite elements of Web data .', u'Linked data may also hold the potential to solve some classic serials dilemmas including latest versus successive entry and single versus multiple records for print and online .', u'How do these possibilities mesh with the evolving current state of linked data projects in the commercial and library sector as well as with the Library of Congress Bibliographic Framework Initiative ( BIBFRAME ) ?', u'The three sections of this article will present different viewpoints about linked data and serials .', u'An early experimenter and member of the group modeling BIBFRAME serials will discuss her experiences and thoughts on future directions .', u'The head of the United States International Standard Serial Number ( ISSN ) Center will take an ISSN perspective , looking at ISSNs potential in the linke ...']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'struc- tured data', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'published data', u'Material'), (u'bar- rier', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'adoption', u'Task'), (u'Linked Data consumers', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Data quality assessment', u'Task'), (u'test-driven software development', u'Method')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'ontological support', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) area', u'Task')], [(u'NLP', u'Method'), (u'domains', u'Generic'), (u'biology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'late Linked Data adopter', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'creation of data and ontologies', u'Task')], [(u'NLP data quality assessment', u'Task'), (u'NLP datasets', u'Material')], [(u'lemon and NIF vocabularies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'bar- rier', u'USED-FOR', u'adoption')], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data quality assessment')], [(u'ontological support', u'USED-FOR', u'it'), (u'Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) area', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'method')], [(u'biology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'domains')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'creation of data and ontologies')], [(u'NLP data quality assessment', u'USED-FOR', u'NLP datasets')], []]
sentences: [u'Linked Data comprises of an unprecedented volume of struc- tured data on the Web and is adopted from an increasing number of domains .', u'However , the varying quality of published data forms a bar- rier for further adoption , especially for Linked Data consumers .', u'In this paper , we extend a previously developed methodology of Linked Data quality assessment , which is inspired by test-driven software development .', u'Specically , we enrich it with ontological support and dierent levels of result reporting and describe how the method is applied in the Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) area .', u'NLP is { compared to other domains , such as biology { a late Linked Data adopter .', u'However , it has seen a steep rise of activity in the creation of data and ontologies .', u'NLP data quality assessment has become an important need for NLP datasets .', u'In our study , we analysed 11 datasets using the lemon and NIF vocabularies in 277 test cases and point out common quality issues .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Web scale Information Extraction', u'Task'), (u'Wrapper Induction', u'Task')], [(u'knowledge based method', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'background knowledge source', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Web scale Information Extraction', u'Task')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'knowledge resource', u'Material'), (u'Information Extraction', u'Task')], [(u'unsupervised approach', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'This work explores the usage of Linked Data for Web scale Information Extraction and shows encouraging results on the task of Wrapper Induction .', u'We propose a simple knowledge based method which is ( i ) highly flexible with respect to different domains and ( ii ) does not require any training material , but exploits Linked Data as background knowledge source to build essential learning resources .', u'The major contribution of this work is a study of how Linked Data - an imprecise , redundant and large-scale knowledge resource - can be used to support Web scale Information Extraction in an effective and efficient way and identify the challenges involved .', u'We show that , for domains that are covered , Linked Data serve as a powerful knowledge resource for Information Extraction .', u'Experiments on a publicly available dataset demonstrate that , under certain conditions , this simple unsupervised approach can achieve competitive results against some complex state of the art that always depends on training data .']

entities: [[(u'Linked open government data', u'Material')], [], [(u'tourism-related applications', u'Task'), (u'software components', u'Method'), (u'open data enthusiasts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'legacy data', u'Material'), (u'linked data', u'Material')], [(u'linked data publishing methodology', u'Method')], [(u'publishing process', u'Method')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic')], []]
relations: [[(u'Linked open government data', u'USED-FOR', u'value-added services')], [], [(u'tourism-related applications', u'CONJUNCTION', u'software components')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Linked open government data ( LOGD ) can be a catalyst in the development of value-added services and products .', u'The vision of many Linked Open Data ( LOD ) projects is to make publishing and reuse of linked data as easy as possible for the end user thanks to a thriving marketplace with data publishers , developers , and consumers along the value chain .', u"In the large scale LOD project `` Fusepool P3 '' , tourism-related applications and software components were developed that support data owners and open data enthusiasts in transforming legacy data to linked data .", u'Based on experiences from this project , we present reflections and discuss pitfalls in drawing a linked data publishing methodology .', u'An integrated view on all phases of the publishing process has not been described so far , for the technical phases linked data life-cycles have been identified only .', u'The methodology developed enables stakeholders to transfer the lessons learned to other use cases and application contexts .', u'This allows for better estimation of efforts and skills for future LOD projects .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'structured and unstructured data', u'Material'), (u'network', u'Generic'), (u'open data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Enterprise Data', u'Material')], [(u'Shenzhen stock exchange', u'Material'), (u'China securities regulatory commission', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Chinese data', u'Material'), (u'open government data', u'Material'), (u'global data ecological system', u'Task'), (u'Shanghai-Hong Kong Stock Connect', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u"Linked Data can provide the data according to user 's demand , promote the availability of half structured and unstructured data on the network , improve the interoperability of open data .", u'With the development of Linked Data , Linked Enterprise Data becomes a research hotspot .', u'This article draw lessons from foreign investment Linked Data research of listed companies , selected the listed company information and XBRL reports from Shanghai stock exchange and Shenzhen stock exchange , industry information from the China securities regulatory commission and daily stock price from Flush as data source , built investment open data of Chinese listed companies based on Linked Data .', u'This work could promote the internationalization of the Chinese data and the commercial use of open government data , lay the foundation for the global data ecological system , at the same time prepare for the challenge of Shanghai-Hong Kong Stock Connect and Shenzhen-Hong Kong Stock Connect even the challenge of international investment .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data technologies', u'Method'), (u'libraries', u'Material')], [(u'library cataloguing', u'Task'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'indexing', u'Task'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'library data models', u'Method'), (u'descriptive standards', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Logainm.ie dataset', u'Material'), (u'online database', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Logainm dataset', u'Material'), (u'XML', u'Material'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'external geographic datasets', u'Material'), (u'DBpedia', u'Material'), (u'Faceted Application of Subject Terminology', u'Task')], [(u'dataset', u'Generic'), (u'Longfield maps collection', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Logainm dataset', u'Material'), (u'Irish heritage institutions', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Linked Data technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'cataloguing workflows')], [(u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'consistency in indexing'), (u'library data models', u'CONJUNCTION', u'descriptive standards')], [(u'Logainm.ie dataset', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'online database')], [(u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'external geographic datasets'), (u'DBpedia', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'external geographic datasets'), (u'Faceted Application of Subject Terminology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'external geographic datasets')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Linked Data technologies are increasingly being implemented to enhance cataloguing workflows in libraries , archives and museums .', u'We review current best practice in library cataloguing , how Linked Data is used to link collections and provide consistency in indexing , and briefly describe the relationship between Linked Data , library data models and descriptive standards .', u'As an example we look at the Logainm.ie dataset , an online database holding the authoritative hierarchical list of Irish and English language place names in Ireland .', u'This paper describes the process of creating the new Linked Logainm dataset , including the transformation of the data from XML to RDF and the generation of links to external geographic datasets like DBpedia and the Faceted Application of Subject Terminology .', u"This dataset was then used to enhance the National Library of Ireland 's metadata MARCXML metadata records for its Longfield maps collection .", u'We also describe the potential benefits of Linked Data for libraries , focusing on the use of the Linked Logainm dataset and its future potential for Irish heritage institutions .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'data deanonymisation', u'Task'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'them', u'Generic'), (u'Data Web vision', u'Task')], [(u'Interconnecting data', u'Material'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'heterogeneous resources', u'Material'), (u'machine-understandable forms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'deanonymisation attacks', u'Task'), (u'full automation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'research roadmap', u'Method'), (u'linked data', u'Material'), (u'de-anonymisation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u're-identification', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'them', u'USED-FOR', u'Data Web vision')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'deanonymisation attacks')], [], [(u'de-anonymisation', u'CONJUNCTION', u're-identification')]]
sentences: [u'The objective of this roadmap is to summarise the state-of-the-art and to identify critical challenges for privacy in Linked Data .', u'Our research particularly focuses on examining how the problem of data deanonymisation fits within the context of Linked Data .', u'This draws attention to the fact that publishing data and linking them with other data ( to achieve the Data Web vision ) is also a significant threat to privacy .', u'Interconnecting data with RDF from heterogeneous resources provides meaningful and valuable information in machine-understandable forms , but it may also offer fewer barriers for deanonymisation attacks to be achieved successfully , and potentially with full automation .', u'Therefore , it is vital to keep both points of view into consideration ; leveraging the Linked Data in the Web whilst also ensuring privacy when it is desired .', u'In this paper , we aim to draw a research roadmap that will help to identify areas of significant concern , where the affordances of linked data align with the requirements for de-anonymisation and re-identification .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Beakits technical specifications', u'Method'), (u'RDF/XML-templating', u'Method'), (u'JSON-LD', u'Method'), (u'automatic mapping', u'Task'), (u'Beakit', u'Method')], [(u'manual mapping', u'Task'), (u'RDF/XML-templates', u'Method'), (u'JSON-LD', u'Method'), (u'code refactoring', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Ruby on Rails content-negotiation capabilities', u'Material')], [(u'ontology', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'RDF/XML-templating', u'CONJUNCTION', u'JSON-LD'), (u'JSON-LD', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rTriplify')], [(u'RDF/XML-templates', u'USED-FOR', u'manual mapping'), (u'RDF/XML-templates', u'CONJUNCTION', u'JSON-LD'), (u'JSON-LD', u'USED-FOR', u'manual mapping'), (u'code refactoring', u'USED-FOR', u'manual mapping')], [(u'Ruby on Rails content-negotiation capabilities', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RESTfulness')], []]
sentences: [u'Jakob EngblomPublishing Linked Data in Ruby on RailsThrough a prospective case study , revolving around the specific application Beakit , this investigation tries to establish what solutions are available and what the optimal route is for publishing Linked Data through the web framework Ruby on Rails .', u'Based on Beakits technical specifications , three solutions were found fitting to test : RDF/XML-templating , JSON-LD , and rTriplify.With rTriplify discovered as non-functioning , no solution was found allowing automatic mapping to triples and also fitting the needs of Beakit .', u'Instead , manual mapping through either RDF/XML-templates or through JSON-LD was found to be the least intrusive , requiring little code refactoring , and simple way of publishing Linked Data .', u'This process was further aided by Ruby on Rails content-negotiation capabilities and RESTfulness .', u'Additionally , creating an ontology and adhering to some of the more peripheral principles of Linked Data was found to be time- consuming , and the former should be avoided unless absolutely necessary in favor of reliance on already existing ontologies .']

entities: [[(u'contemporary Web', u'Material'), (u'HTML formats', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hidden structured information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'automated agents', u'Method')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'solutions', u'Generic'), (u'relational databases', u'Material'), (u'XML technologies', u'Method'), (u'RDF triples', u'Method'), (u'graph data', u'Material'), (u'relational or tree data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data indexing', u'Task'), (u'querying', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'state-of-the-art solutions', u'Generic'), (u'querying framework', u'Method'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'distributed and highly dynamic data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'RDF data triples', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data')], [(u'graph data', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF triples'), (u'graph data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'relational or tree data'), (u'relational or tree data', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF triples')], [(u'Linked Data indexing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'querying')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Documents on the contemporary Web are based especially on HTML formats and , therefore , it is rather difficult to retrieve hidden structured information from them using automated agents .', u'The concept of Linked Data based primarily on RDF data triples seems to successfully solve this drawback .', u'However , we can not directly adopt the existing solutions from relational databases or XML technologies , because RDF triples are modelled as graph data and not relational or tree data .', u'Despite the research effort in recent years , several questions in the area of Linked Data indexing and querying remain open , not only since the amount of Linked Data globally available significantly increases each year .', u'This paper attempts to introduce advantages and disadvantages of the state-of-the-art solutions and discuss several issues related to our ongoing research effort - the proposal of an efficient querying framework over Linked Data .', u'In particular , our goal is to focus on large amounts of distributed and highly dynamic data .']

entities: [[(u'Library Linked Data Model', u'Method')], [(u'Ex Libris', u'Method')], [(u'profession', u'Generic'), (u'technology', u'Generic'), (u'Library Linked Data model', u'Method')], [(u'library linked data', u'Material')], [(u'this', u'Generic'), (u'Library Linked Data Modell', u'Material')]]
sentences: [u'Library Linked Data Model is an important topic for librarianship and it is equally of interest to the many organizations that provide products and services to that community .', u'Ex Libris , as one of those organizations , frequently gets asked : Where do we see it fitting into our plans ? .', u'In order to be able to answer questions like this , we need to ask : What exactly are the problems being solved for the profession by this technology that can only be solved with the Library Linked Data model ?', u'What most developers/providers of products analyzing the potential of library linked data would see is that at this stage , this technology is very much in the research stage .', u'The presentation talks about the research ExLibris is involved in and how this can be utilized by innovative libraries to help defining the actual use cases in which the potential of the Library Linked Data Modell is indeed exploited .']

sentences: [u'In the European CLARIN infrastructure a growing number of resources are described with Component Metadata .', u'In this paper we describe a transformation to make this metadata available as linked data .', u'After this first step it becomes possible to connect the CLARIN Component Metadata with other valuable knowledge sources in the Linked Data Cloud .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'social sciences', u'FEATURE-OF', u'Linked Data')], [(u'social science data', u'USED-FOR', u'external LOD sources')], [], [(u'Linked Data technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'scientific domain')], []]
sentences: [u'In recent years , Linked Open Data ( LOD ) has matured and gained acceptance across various communities and domains .', u'Large potential of Linked Data technologies is seen for an application in scientific disciplines .', u'In this article , we present use cases and applications for an application of Linked Data in the social sciences .', u'They focus on ( a ) interlinking domain-specific information , and ( b ) linking social science data to external LOD sources ( e.g .', u'authority data ) from other domains .', u'However , several technical and research challenges arise , when applying Linked Data technologies to a scientific domain with its specific data , information needs and use cases .', u'We discuss these challenges and show how they can be addressed .']

relations: [[], [(u'loose coupling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reusability'), (u'data-driven approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'Enterprise Application Integration')], [(u'open souce Java-based framework', u'USED-FOR', u'interoperable read-write Linked Data applications')]]
sentences: [u'Enterprises are increasingly using a wide range of heterogeneous information systems for executing and governing their business activities .', u'Even if the adoption of service orientation has improved loose coupling and reusability , applications are still isolated data silos whose integration requires complex transformations and mediations. # R # # N # # R # # N # However , by leveraging Linked Data principles those data silos can now be seamlessly integrated , and this opens the door to new data-driven approaches for Enterprise Application Integration ( EAI ) .', u'In this paper we present LDP4j , an open souce Java-based framework for the development of interoperable read-write Linked Data applications , based on the W3C Linked Data Platform ( LDP ) specification .']

sentences: [u'Provided are an apparatus and method for adding a variety of concepts to a default model by combining a linked model with the default model and linked data that is to be matched with the linked model .', u'The apparatus may generate first relationship information about a relationship between a concept included in the default model and a concept included in the linked model and second relationship information about a relationship between a concept included in the linked model and a concept included in the linked data .', u'The apparatus may combine the default model , the linked model , and the linked data , based on the first and second relationship information .']

sentences: [u'The purpose of this paper is to report and discuss the use of a linked data approach on existing related databases on forest fires , plant specimens , insect collections , forest dynamics plot censuses , and Taiwanese species checklists .', u'We adopted the linked data approach to connect together data intrinsically related from distributed databases .', u'The approach developed a workflow through 4 steps to integrate and publish human- and machine-readable ecological data as linked open data on the web .', u'Results from our work can be found at the web site http : //ecowlim.tfri.gov.tw .', u'We conclude that the linked data approach is a new way to improve and advance ecological data sharing .']

sentences: [u'This paper describes an approach to mediating accesses to multiple information sources in a multi-lingual application .', u'There are many information sources available on the Internet in different languages , and machine translation services are also available to allow multi-lingual access to information sources .', u'Domain-dependent translation dictionaries are often used to make translation more appropriate .', u'In the proposed approach , the domain-dependent translation dictionaries are represented as linked data .', u'Using the data available from the translation dictionaries , accesses to the information sources that are represented as linked data can be customized .', u'By applying the linked data concept , a multi-lingual application can be constructed in a flexible way .']

sentences: [u'More and more governments publish Open Government Data ( OGD ) for their citizens , which receives great interest ; because they are not only covering many domains , but also are meaningful and trustful .', u'Since the data are not ready to be linked to other sources , some governments have started to follow the Linked Open Data paradigm as a mean to improve data quality .', u'However , exploiting Linked Data is still a challenging task , which requires a profound understanding of underlying datasets , as well as considerable technical expertise .', u'In this paper , we present an approach to remove the barrier between end users and Linked Data generally , and Open Government Linked Data particularly .']

sentences: [u'Open data policies and linked data publication are powerful tools for increasing transparency , participatory governance , and accountability .', u'The linked data community proudly emphasizes the economic and societal impact such technology shows .', u"But a closer look proves that the design and deployment of these technologies leave out most of the world 's population .", u'The good news is that it will take small but fundamental changes to bridge this gap .', u'Research agendas should be upated to design systems for small infrastructure , provide multimodal interfaces to data , and account better for locally relevant , contextualized data .', u'Now is the time to act , because most linked data technologies are still in development .']

sentences: [u'Large linked data repositories have been built by leveraging semi-structured data in Wikipedia ( e.g. , DBpedia ) and through extracting information from natural language text ( e.g. , YAGO ) .', u'However , the Web contains many other vast sources of linked data , such as structured HTML tables and spreadsheets .', u'Often , the semantics in such tables is hidden , preventing one from extracting triples from them directly .', u'This paper describes a probabilistic method that augments an existing knowledge base with facts from tabular data by leveraging a Web text corpus and natural language patterns associated with relations in the knowledge base .', u'A preliminary evaluation shows high potential for this technique in augmenting linked data repositories .']

entities: [[(u'data source', u'Material'), (u'deduplication of entities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data fusion', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'data fusion', u'Task'), (u'Linked Data fusion tools', u'Method')], [(u'public procurement data fusion', u'Task'), (u'property dependencies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data fusion extensions', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'When consuming Linked Data from multiple sources , or from a data source after deduplication of entities , conflicting , missing or outdated values must be dealt with during data fusion in order to increase the usefulness and quality of the data .', u'In this poster , we argue that the nature of Linked Data in RDF requires a more sophisticated approach to data fusion than the current Linked Data fusion tools provide .', u'We demonstrate where they fall short on a real case of public procurement data fusion when dealing with property dependencies and fusion of structured values , and we propose new data fusion extensions to address these problems .']

entities: [[(u'information extraction methods', u'Method'), (u'manual dataset curation', u'Task'), (u'semi-structured and unstructured information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data sets', u'Material'), (u'information extraction systems', u'Task')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Information Extraction Challenge 2014', u'Task')], [], []]

sentences: [u'For making the web of linked data grow , information extraction methods are a good alternative to manual dataset curation , since there is an abundance of semi-structured and unstructured information which can be harvested that way .', u'At the same time , existing Linked Data sets can be used for training and evaluating such information extraction systems .', u'In this paper , we introduce the Linked Data for Information Extraction Challenge 2014 .', u'Using the example of person data in Microformats , we show how training and testing data can be curated at large scale .', u'Furthermore , we discuss results achieved in the challenge , as well as open problems and future directions for the challenge .']

relations: [[(u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'graph-based tasks')], [(u'graph-based algorithms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'engines')], [(u'linked datasets', u'CONJUNCTION', u'graph-based tasks')], []]
sentences: [u'Graphs naturally represent Linked Data and implementations of graph-based tasks are required not only for data consumption , but also for mining patterns among links .', u'Despite efficient graph-based algorithms and engines have been implemented , there is no clear understanding of how these solutions may behave on Linked Data .', u'We evaluate both general purpose graph database and state-of-the-art RDF engines , and our experimental results reveal characteristics of linked datasets and graph-based tasks that may affect their performance .', u'These results can be considered as a further step for solving the problem of choosing between graph databases to consume and mine Linked Data .']

entities: [[], [(u'mouse and human models', u'Method'), (u'Mouse Genome Informatics', u'Method')], [(u'anatomy resources', u'Material'), (u'Adult Mouse Anatomy ( MA ) ontology', u'Task'), (u'anatomy concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'NCI Thesaurus', u'Material')], [(u'software tools', u'Method'), (u'anatomy ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'mappings', u'Generic')], [(u'anatomy ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'those', u'Generic'), (u'anatomy ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mapping files', u'Material')]]
sentences: [u'.............................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................', u'The overall objective of the MouseHuman Anatomy Project ( MHAP ) was to facilitate the mapping and harmonization of anatomical terms used for mouse and human models by Mouse Genome Informatics ( MGI ) and the National Cancer Institute ( NCI ) .', u'The anatomy resources designated for this study were the Adult Mouse Anatomy ( MA ) ontology and the set of anatomy concepts contained in the NCI Thesaurus ( NCIt ) .', u'Several methods and software tools were identified and evaluated , then used to conduct an in-depth comparative analysis of the anatomy ontologies .', u'Matches between mouse and human anatomy terms were determined and validated , resulting in a highly curated set of mappings between the two ontologies that has been used by other resources .', u'These mappings will enable linking of data from mouse and human .', u'As the anatomy ontologies have been expanded and refined , the mappings have been updated accordingly .', u'Insights are presented into the overall process of comparing and mapping between ontologies , which may prove useful for further comparative analyses and ontology mapping efforts , especially those involving anatomy ontologies .', u'Finally , issues concerning further development of the ontologies , updates to the mapping files , and possible additional applications and significance were considered .']
