sentences: [u'Nowadays many department ( community ) are thinking how to get more knowledges and metadata by linking more systems from other community .', u'There are great challenges to make all systems organizing knowledge and sharing metadata to make it easy searched , indexed and used in different context .', u'In this paper we will focus on metadata in specific domain - Poverty2 .', u'Regardless of the various definitions of poverty , in this paper we will focus on managing metadata in Poverty with many different terms therein .', u'Ontology Mapping is the process of relating similar concepts or relations from different sources through some equivalence relation .', u'Mapping allows finding correspondences between the concepts of two ontologies .', u'If two concepts correspond , then they mean the same thing or closely related things .', u'Currently , the mapping process is regarded as a promise to solve the problem between ontologies since it attempts to find correspondences between semantically related entities that belong to different ontologies .', u'It takes as input two ontologies , each consisting of a set of components ( classes , instances , properties , rules and axioms ) .', u'Based on the presented reasons , we believe that ontologies with common terms and common concepts are very important in a metadata sharing process .']

entities: [[(u'ontology mapping method', u'Method'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'non-structured ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'fuzzy conceptual graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'source ontology', u'Method'), (u'fuzzy conceptual graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'projection operation', u'Method'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'mapping of ontologies', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'fuzzy conceptual graphs', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology mapping method'), (u'fuzzy conceptual graphs', u'USED-FOR', u'non-structured ontology'), (u'fuzzy conceptual graphs', u'USED-FOR', u'projection operation'), (u'projection operation', u'USED-FOR', u'mappings between translated objects')]]
sentences: [u'This paper presents a new ontology mapping method This method addresses the case in which a non-structured ontology is to be mapped with a structured one Both ontologies are composed of triplets of the form ( object , characteristic , value ) Structured means that the values describing the objects according to a given characteristic are hierarchically organized using the a kind of relation The proposed method uses fuzzy conceptual graphs [ 8 ] to represent and map objects from a source ontology to a target one First , we establish a correspondence between characteristics of the source ontology and characteristics of the target ontology based on the comparison of their associated values Then , we propose an original way of translating the description of an object of the source ontology using characteristics and values of the target ontology The description thus translated is represented as a fuzzy conceptual graph Finally , a new projection operation is used to find mappings between translated objects and actual objects of the target ontology This method has been implemented and the results of an experimentation concerning the mapping of ontologies in the field of risk in food are presented .']

sentences: [u'AbstractWireless sensors are used for monitoring environments such as climate change , water quality and disaster management .', u'The critical task is interpretation of the complex multidimensional data generated by sensors and interoperability among various system and handling of heterogeneous data .', u'There is also need to get a common understanding and decision making by various agencies and research institutions .', u'To handle these requirements importance is given to both syntactic and semantic nature of the data .', u'The syntactic part is responsible for the interoperability of the sensor data .', u'Interoperability is addressed by using Open Geospatial Consortium ( OGC ) Sensor Web Enablement ( SWE ) framework has developed a suite of specifications enable sensors to be accessible and controllable via the web .', u'Ontologies are widely used as a means for solving the information heterogeneity problems because of their capability to provide explicit meaning to the information .', u'In this paper we propose a Service Oriented Architecture ( SOA ) model for the interoperability of sensor networks data and semantics of the data .', u'The heterogeneities between various sensor networks are reduced through ontology mapping .', u'The service is available to the users through standard data formats like XML and protocol like SOAP .']

entities: [[(u'Brain atlases', u'Material')], [(u'Delineated structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'database systems', u'Method'), (u'hierarchically organized vocabularies', u'Material'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'volume-to-ontology mapping', u'Task'), (u'macroscopical brain structures', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Java tools', u'Method'), (u'retrieval of mapping and connectivity data', u'Task'), (u'macaque brain', u'Material'), (u'CoCoMac database', u'Material'), (u'Rhesus Monkey Brain', u'Material')], [(u'software', u'Generic'), (u'manually drawn monkey brain template', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'GNU General Public License', u'Material')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'printed atlas', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'annotated data', u'Material'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'3D registered stacks', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'tools', u'Generic'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'connectivity data', u'Material'), (u'volume and centre-of-mass estimates', u'Task'), (u'graphical manipulation of entire structures', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Brain atlases', u'USED-FOR', u'experimental neuroscience')], [(u'hierarchically organized vocabularies', u'USED-FOR', u'database systems')], [], [(u'Java tools', u'USED-FOR', u'retrieval of mapping and connectivity data')], [], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'3D registered stacks'), (u'them', u'USED-FOR', u'3D registered stacks')], [(u'volume and centre-of-mass estimates', u'USED-FOR', u'features'), (u'volume and centre-of-mass estimates', u'CONJUNCTION', u'graphical manipulation of entire structures')]]
sentences: [u'Brain atlases are widely used in experimental neuroscience as tools for locating and targeting specific brain structures .', u'Delineated structures in a given atlas , however , are often difficult to interpret and to interface with database systems that supply additional information using hierarchically organized vocabularies ( ontologies ) .', u'Here we discuss the concept of volume-to-ontology mapping in the context of macroscopical brain structures .', u'We present Java tools with which we have implemented this concept for retrieval of mapping and connectivity data on the macaque brain from the CoCoMac database in connection with an electronic version of The Rhesus Monkey Brain in Stereotaxic Coordinates authored by George Paxinos and colleagues .', u'The software , including our manually drawn monkey brain template , can be downloaded freely under the GNU General Public License .', u'It adds value to the printed atlas and has a wider ( neuro- ) informatics application since it can read appropriately annotated data from delineated sections of other species and organs , and turn them into 3D registered stacks .', u'The tools provide additional features , including visualization and analysis of connectivity data , volume and centre-of-mass estimates , and graphical manipulation of entire structures , which are potentially useful for a range of research and teaching applications .']

entities: [[(u'Ontology-based models', u'Method'), (u'product lifecycle systems', u'Method')], [(u'ontology-based models', u'Method')], [(u'ontology mapping/matching', u'Method'), (u'ontology-based models', u'Method'), (u'concept', u'Generic'), (u'formalization and verification of cross-model semantic correspondences', u'Task')], [(u'semantic reconciliation', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Manufacturing Interoperability Framework', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Common Logic-based underpinning', u'Method'), (u'evaluation and verification of cross-model correspondences', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'logic-based mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'knowledge models', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic reconciliation of important structures', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'ontology mapping/matching', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology-based models')], [(u'Semantic Manufacturing Interoperability Framework', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic reconciliation')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'evaluation and verification of cross-model correspondences'), (u'Common Logic-based underpinning', u'USED-FOR', u'approach'), (u'Common Logic-based underpinning', u'USED-FOR', u'evaluation and verification of cross-model correspondences')], [(u'logic-based mechanisms', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic reconciliation of important structures')]]
sentences: [u'Ontology-based models of product design and manufacture are becoming increasingly important in the effort towards achieving interoperability among various stakeholders within and across product lifecycle systems .', u'However , in the eventuality of having to interoperate between multiple ontology-based models , with the intention of sharing knowledge among them , the process still remains a difficult one .', u'Although the concept of ontology mapping/matching has been developed as a means to interoperate across ontology-based models , yet the concept has remained relatively weak in terms of its ability to enable the formalization and verification of cross-model semantic correspondences in design and manufacture .', u'In this paper , improved concepts to achieve semantic reconciliation are being investigated in the context of the Semantic Manufacturing Interoperability Framework ( SMIF ) .', u'The approach uses a Common Logic-based underpinning for enabling the evaluation and verification of cross-model correspondences .', u'The approach has been successfully tested by applying the relevant logic-based mechanisms , in order to show the reconciliation of two individually developed knowledge models .', u'Through this , it has been demonstrated that the approach enables semantic reconciliation of important structures within ontology-based models of design and manufacture .']

sentences: [u'The plurality and heterogeneity of linked data features require appropriate solutions for accurate matching and clustering .', u'In this paper , we propose a dimensional clustering approach to enforce ( i ) the capability to select the set of features to use for data matching and clustering , that are packaged into the so-called thematic dimension , and ( ii ) the capability to make explicit thecause of similarity that generates each cluster .', u'Ensem- ble techniques for combining different single-dimension cluster sets into a sort of multi-dimensional view of the considered linked data are also pre- sented as a further contribution of the paper .', u'Application to linked data summarization and exploration is finally discussed .']

sentences: [u'Linked Data is not always published with a license .', u'Sometimes a wrong license type is used , like a license for software , or it is not expressed in a standard , machine readable manner .', u'Yet , Linked Data resources may be subject to intellectual property and database laws , may contain personal data subject to privacy restrictions or may even contain important trade secrets .', u'The proper declaration of which rights are held , waived or licensed is a must for the lawful use of Linked Data at its different granularity levels , from the simple RDF statement to a dataset or a mapping .', u'After comparing the current practice with the actual needs , six research questions are posed .']

sentences: [u'With the growing interest in publishing data according to the Linked Data principles , it becomes more important to provide intuitive tools for users to view and interact with those resources .', u'The characteristics of Linked Data pose several challenges for user-friendly presentation of information .', u'In this work , we present the LD Viewer as a customizable framework that can easily be fitted for different datasets while addressing Linked Data presentation challenges .', u'With this framework , we aim to provide dataset maintainers with easy means to expose their RDF resources .', u'Moreover , we aim to make the interface intuitive and engaging for both expert users and lay users .']

relations: [[(u'relational databases', u'USED-FOR', u'ranking linked data'), (u'ranking framework', u'USED-FOR', u'ranking linked data'), (u'ranking framework', u'USED-FOR', u'relational databases')], [], [], [], [(u'table schemas', u'USED-FOR', u'mapping rules')]]
sentences: [u'This paper investigates the problem of ranking linked data from relational databases using a ranking framework .', u'The core idea is to group relationships by their types , then rank the types , and finally rank the instances attached to each type .', u'The ranking criteria for each step considers the mapping rules and heterogeneous graph structure of the data web .', u'Tests based on a social network dataset show that the linked data ranking is effective and easier for people to understand .', u'This approach benefits from utilizing relationships deduced from mapping rules based on table schemas and distinguishing the relationship types , which results in better ranking and visualization of the linked data .']

sentences: [u'Ontology has been emerged as a powerful way to share common understanding , due to its ability to chain limitless amount of knowledge .', u'In most cases , groups of domain expert design and standardize ontology model .', u'Unfortunately , in some cases , domain experts are not yet available to develop an ontology .', u'In this paper , we extend the possibilities of creating a shareable knowledge conceptualization terminology in uncommon domain knowledge where a standardized ontology developed by groups of experts is not yet available. # R # # N # # R # # N # Our aim is to capture knowledge and behaviour which is represented by data .', u'We propose a model of automatic data-driven dynamic ontology creation .', u'The created ontology model can be used as a standard to create the whole populated ontology in different remote locations in order to perform data exchange more seamlessly .', u'The dynamic ontology has a feature of a real-time propagation from the change in the data source structure .', u'A novel delta script is developed as the base of propagation .', u'In order to complete the model , we also present an information of application support in the form of Jena API mapping for propagation implementation .']

sentences: [u'Ontology has been emerged as a powerful way to share common un- derstanding , due to its ability to chain limitless amount of knowledge .', u'In most cases , groups of domain expert design and standardize ontology model .', u'Unfor- tunately , in some cases , domain experts are not yet available to develop an on- tology .', u'In this paper , we extend the possibilities of creating a shareable knowledge conceptualization terminology in uncommon domain knowledge where a standardized ontology developed by groups of experts is not yet available .', u'Our aim is to capture knowledge and behaviour which is represented by data .', u'We propose a model of automatic data-driven dynamic ontology creation .', u'The created ontology model can be used as a standard to create the whole populated ontology in different remote locations in order to perform data exchange more seamlessly .', u'The dynamic ontology has a feature of a real-time propagation from the change in the data source structure .', u'A novel delta script is developed as the base of propagation .', u'In order to complete the model , we also present an information of application support in the form of Jena API mapping for propagation implementation .']

sentences: [u'When dealing with a document collection , it is important to identify repeated information .', u'In multi-document summarization , for example , it is important to retain widely repeated content , even if the wording is not exactly the same .', u'Simplistic approaches simply look for the same strings , or the same syntactic structures ( including words ) , across documents .', u'Here we investigate semantic matching , applying background knowledge from a large , general knowledge base ( KB ) to identify such repeated information in texts .', u'Automatic document summarization is the problem of creating a surrogate for a document that adequately represents its full content .', u'Automatic ontology generation requires information about candidate types , roles and relationships gathered from across a document or document collection .', u'We aim at a summarization system that can replicate the quality of summaries created by humans and ontology creation systems that significantly reduce the human effort required for construction .', u'Both applications depend for their success on extracting the essence of a collection of text .', u'The work reported here demonstrates the utility of using deep knowledge from Cyc for effectively identifying redundant information in texts by using both semantic and syntactic information .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'short text semantic similarity measures', u'Metric')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'lexical database', u'Material'), (u'WordNet', u'Material'), (u'word similarity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic distance', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'WordNet', u'Material'), (u'hierarchy fuzzy words', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'fuzzy semantic similarity measures', u'Metric'), (u'ontological structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'quantification of words', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'human participations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'fuzzy ontology structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'human quantified scale', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology creation', u'Task'), (u'human participants', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy categories', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy words', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'fuzzy semantic similarity measure', u'Metric'), (u'benchmark fuzzy word datasets', u'Material')], [(u'human similarity ratings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontological structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'human perceptions of fuzzy words', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Ontologies are a fundamental part of the development of short text semantic similarity measures .', u'The most known ontology used within the field was developed from the lexical database known as WordNet which is used as a semantic resource for determining word similarity using the semantic distance between words .', u'The original WordNet does not include in its hierarchy fuzzy words those which are subjective to humans and often context dependent .', u'The recent development of fuzzy semantic similarity measures requires research into the development of different ontological structures which are suitable for the representation of fuzzy categories of words where quantification of words is undertaken by human participations .', u'This paper proposes two different fuzzy ontology structures which are based on a human quantified scale for a collection of fuzzy words across six fuzzy categories .', u'The methodology of ontology creation utilizes human participants to populate fuzzy categories and quantify fuzzy words .', u'Each ontology is evaluated within a known fuzzy semantic similarity measure and experiments are conducted using human participants and two benchmark fuzzy word datasets .', u'Correlations with human similarity ratings show only one ontological structure was naturally representative of human perceptions of fuzzy words .']

sentences: [u'Semantic Self Learning And Teaching Agent ( SESLATA ) is a self learning software which is capable of learning from a natural language source .', u'It identifies language complexity , ambiguity and influence of diverse writing styles to extract and decipher .', u'The specialty herein the system is , usage of its acquired knowledge to perform teaching and explaining activities to its end users .', u"The agent is capable of updating its own knowledge and it interacts with learner through intelligent response and using own experiences in the process of teaching according to learner 's knowledge .", u'Simply it learns somewhat like a human and teaches what it has learnt as a human does .', u'The software is endowed with inventions involving in Natural Language Processing , machine learning , explanation and knowledge representation and ontology , which are still under research .', u"Self learning from natural language ( acquiring the domain knowledge to model ontology ) , automate the ontology creation from natural language , the teaching and explaining capability of an agent , updating the knowledge via ontology , knowledge representation and sharing , a new methodology of online learning , teaching according to the depth of user 's knowledge are the major findings of the system ."]

sentences: [u'Personalized E-learning ( PEL ) has demonstrated its effectiveness in improving the quality of various searches on the Internet .', u"However , evidences show that users ' reluctance to disclose their private information during search has become a major barrier for the wide proliferation of PEL .", u"We propose a personalized E-learning engine , PEL that captures the users ' preferences in the form of concepts by mining their Ontologies data .", u'Due to the importance of location information in web search , PEL classifies these concepts into content concept and location concepts .', u'The user preferences are organized in an ontology-based , multi-facet user profile , which are used to adapt a personalized ranking function for rank adaptation of future search results .', u'We propose a framework for personalized E-learning based on aggregate usage profiles and domain ontology .', u'We have distinguished two stages in the whole process , one o offline tasks that includes data preparation ontology creation and usage mining and on of online tasks that concerns the production of recommendations .', u'We also provide an online predication mechanism for deciding whether personalizing a query is beneficial .', u'Extensive experiments demonstrate the effectiveness of our framework .']

entities: [[(u'Distributed Multi-Agent Intelligent Systems technology', u'Method'), (u'software systems', u'Task')], [(u'Communication', u'Task'), (u'multi-agent systems', u'Method')], [(u'Communication', u'Task')], [(u'Agent communication languages', u'Material'), (u'agent communication', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'standardization', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'communication between agents', u'Task'), (u'interoperability problem', u'Task')], [(u'semantic interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed multi-agent Systems', u'Method')], [(u'communication layers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'communication between agents', u'Task')], [(u'Multiplatform Communication System ( MPCS ) architecture', u'Method')], [(u'MPCS architecture', u'Method'), (u'Dynamic Ontology Mapping System', u'Method'), (u'Agent Communication', u'Task'), (u'mapping approaches', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'communication layers', u'USED-FOR', u'communication between agents')], [], [(u'Dynamic Ontology Mapping System', u'USED-FOR', u'Agent Communication'), (u'mapping approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'Dynamic Ontology Mapping System')]]
sentences: [u'Distributed Multi-Agent Intelligent Systems technology has generated lots of excitement in recent years because of its promise as a new paradigm for conceptualizing , designing , and implementing software systems .', u'Communication is the most important feature for meaningful interaction among agents in multi-agent systems .', u'Communication enables agents to interact and share information to perform tasks to achieve their goals .', u"Agent communication languages provide a standard in the protocol and language used in the agent communication , but ca n't provide a standard in ontology , because ontology depends on the subject and concept of the communication This lack of standardization , which impedes communication between agents , is known as the interoperability problem .", u'In order to obtain semantic interoperability in distributed multi-agent Systems , agents need to agree on the basis of different ontologies .', u'In this paper we propose a communication layers to outline the communication between agents .', u'In addition a Multiplatform Communication System ( MPCS ) architecture is proposed to provide a highly flexible and scalable system .', u'In MPCS architecture , a Dynamic Ontology Mapping System for Agent Communication ( DOMAC ) is proposed based on different mapping approaches in order to provide help in the conversation among different agents .']

sentences: [u'Semantic similarity calculation is an important step of ontology mapping that is an effective method to solve the problem of ontology heterogeneity .', u'However , current semantic similarity methods can be only adapted to crisp concepts , that is to say , they are not sufficient for handling fuzzy concepts whose instances belong to them with memberships .', u'Therefore , this paper proposes a novel semantic similarity method , ICFC ( Information Content of Fuzzy Concept ) , for fuzzy concepts in a fuzzy ontology .', u'In this method , a semantic similarity between two fuzzy concepts is computed by their information content values .', u'But , it is difficult to obtain information content values for fuzzy concepts .', u'That is because a fuzzy concept is considered as a fuzzy set , and all the elements ( i.e. , instances ) belong to it with memberships .', u'For this purpose , ICFC achieves two tasks : ( i ) determines whether or not an instance belongs to a fuzzy concept ; ( ii ) provides a method for computing the membership of instance to fuzzy concept , which exploits the degrees that the attribute domains of fuzzy concept include the attribute values of instance .', u'Experimental results with a fuzzy ontology from the real world indicate that ICFC performs encouragingly well .']

sentences: [u'Ontology has rich internal structure .', u'There are relations and constraints between the concepts that is why Ontology has a richer internal structure .', u'Ontology can be used for information retrieval .', u'Ontology is a halfway determination of a conceptual vocabulary to be utilized for formulating knowledge-level hypothesis around a domain of discourse .', u'The key part of ontology is to help knowledge sharing and reuse .', u'The process of allotting descriptions to documents in an IRS is called indexing .', u'In this paper a technique is proposed which improves results .', u'In this technique web pages are stored in xml database .', u"WordNet is used as dictionary for finding synonyms of user 's query .", u'The technique is based on context of word .', u'Using context of words helps improvise the search results .', u'The technique is called ontological indexing .', u'This technique is compared with text based search .', u'The words on the web pages are mapped to concepts in ontology .', u'Mapping score is generated for each word .', u'Results of search depend on value of mapping score .', u'Moreover the issue of word sense disambiguation is solved up to some extent using parts of speech tagger .']

sentences: [u'Owing to development of ICT , knowledge representation and possibilities of its usage , sharing , storing and reusing , increasingly rely on ontologies as formal representation of ( knowledge ) conceptualization in different domain .', u'Economics being the widest area of human personal and organizational activity as well as countless ( structured and unstructured ) data has no unified upper ontology and taxonomy .', u'Economic curricula on faculties of economic in the Republic of Croatia reflect the problem of taxonomic shortcomings in economics as academic discipline .', u'Numerous courses in economic curricula show the trends to specialization of economic knowledge but that also point out on decreasing capabilities of complex problem solving .', u'The main idea in this paper is to research and define appropriate approach to ontology development useful for : -representing the institutional economic curricula which can serve to potential students in making the choice of their desirable courses , -representing academic discipline , -documenting the data , -creating meta data about learning and management systems .', u'The approch will will be based on multiphase process of ontology creation and multilevel approach to common vocabulary creation and it will be tested on faculties of economics at universities in Croatia .']

entities: [[(u'Classical Description Logic', u'Method'), (u'ontology creation and reasoning', u'Task')], [(u'Legal AI', u'Method')], [(u'legal ontologies', u'Material')], [(u'normative feature', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'coherence', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'legal ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Negation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'subsumption', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology coherence', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'intuitionistic semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'legal domain', u'Material'), (u'legal ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'legal coherence', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'conflict of laws', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Private International Law analysis', u'Method')], [(u'Intuitionistic Description Logic', u'Method'), (u'IALC', u'Method'), (u'Intuitionistic ALC', u'Method'), (u'canonical classical description logic system', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'Conflict of Laws in Space', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'IALC', u'Method')], [(u'logical negation', u'Method'), (u'legal ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'AI', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Classical Description Logic', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology creation and reasoning')], [], [], [], [(u'Negation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'subsumption')], [(u'intuitionistic semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'negation'), (u'intuitionistic semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'legal domain')], [(u'conflict of laws', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'legal coherence')], [(u'IALC', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Intuitionistic Description Logic'), (u'IALC', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'canonical classical description logic system'), (u'IALC', u'USED-FOR', u'Conflict of Laws in Space')], [(u'legal ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'AI')]]
sentences: [u'Classical Description Logic has been widely used as a basis for ontology creation and reasoning in many knowledge specific domains .', u'These specific domains naturally include Legal AI .', u'As in any other domain , consistency is an important issue for legal ontologies .', u'However , due to its inherently normative feature , coherence ( consistency ) in legal ontologies is more subtle than in most other domains .', u'Negation and subsumption play a central role in ontology coherence .', u'An adequate intuitionistic semantics for negation in a legal domain comes to the fore when we take legally valid individual statements as the inhabitants of our legal ontology .', u'This allows us to elegantly deal with particular situations of legal coherence , such as conflict of laws , as those solved by Private International Law analysis .', u'This paper : ( 1 ) Briefly presents our version of Intuitionistic Description Logic , called IALC for Intuitionistic ALC ( ALC being the canonical classical description logic system ) ( 2 ) Discuss the jurisprudence foundation of our system , and ( 3 ) Shows how we can perform a coherence analysis of Conflict of Laws in Space by means of IALC .', u'This paper reports work-in-progress on using this alternative definition of logical negation for building and testing legal ontologies and reasoning in AI .']

entities: [[(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information management', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Ontology creation', u'Task')], [(u'alignment', u'Task'), (u'trust based approach', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ranking reasoning', u'Task')], [], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'evolutionary trust model', u'Method')], [(u'semantic agreement', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'information management', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], [], [], [], [(u'alignment', u'CONJUNCTION', u'integration')], [], [], [], [(u'semantic agreement', u'USED-FOR', u"recalculation of the author 's trust")]]
sentences: [u'As ontologies become more prevalent for information management the need to manage the ontologies increases .', u'In the community services sector multiple organisations often combine to tender for funding .', u'When separate organisations come together to generate reports for funding bodies an alignment of terminology and semantics is required .', u'Ontology creation is privatised for these individual organisations to represent their view of the domain .', u'This creates problems with alignment and integration , making it necessary to consider how much each ontology should influence the current decision to be made. # R # # N # # R # # N # To assist with determining influence a trust based approach on author and the ontologies provides a mechanism for ranking reasoning results .', u'A representation of authors and the individual resources they provide for the merged ontology becomes necessary .', u'The authors are then weighted by trust and trust for the resources the author provides to the ontology is calculated .', u'This is then used to assist the integration process allowing for an evolutionary trust model to calculate the level of belief in the resources .', u"Once the integration is complete the semantic agreement between the ontologies allows for the recalculation of the author 's trust ."]

sentences: [u'Recent research has demonstrated the important of ontology and its applications .', u'For example , while designing adaptive learning materials , designers need to refer to the ontology of a subject domain .', u'Moreover , ontology can show the whole picture and core knowledge about a subject domain .', u'Research from literature also suggested that graphical representation of ontology can reduce the problems of information overload and learning disorientation for learners .', u'However , ontology constructions used to rely on domain experts in the past ; it is a time consuming and high cost task .', u'Ontology creation for emerging new domains like e-Learning is even more challenging .', u'The aim of this paper is to construct e-Learning domain concept maps , an alternative form of ontology , from academic articles .', u'We adopt some relevant journal articles and conferences papers in e-Learning domain as data sources , and apply text-mining techniques to automatically construct concept maps for e-Learning domain .', u'The constructed concept maps can provide a useful reference for researchers , who are new to e- Leaning field , to study related issues , for teachers to design adaptive courses , and for learners to understand the whole picture of e-Learning domain knowledge .']

sentences: [u'Ontological engineering has been widely used for diverse purposes in different communities and a number of approaches have been reported for developing ontologies ; however , few works address issues of specific ontology construction for local communities , especially when taking into account the specificity of academic knowledge creation .', u'This Chapter summarizes efforts done in two cooperating communities in Japan and in Poland , including attempts to clarify the concept and the field of knowledge science , to create an ontology characterizing a research program in this field , then to apply related results in another field - contemporary telecommunications .', u'The distinctive approach to ontology creation is based on a combination of bottom-up and top-down approaches with the purpose of combining explicit knowledge with tacit , intuitive and experiential knowledge for constructing an ontology .', u'Other possible views on constructing ontology are also presented and discussed ; lessons from an ongoing application of this approach to a local research community working on contemporary telecommunication issues in Poland are also discussed .', u'The combination of explicit and tacit , intuitive and experiential knowledge has led to a development of a software system named adaptive hermeneutic agent ( AHA ) , a toolkit for documents gathering , keywords extracting , keywords clustering , and ontology visualization .']

relations: [[(u'information retrieval', u'USED-FOR', u'keyword search')], [], [], [], [(u'AGRIX', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology based agricultural expertise retrieval framework'), (u'expert profiles', u'CONJUNCTION', u'publications')], [], [(u'inference rules', u'USED-FOR', u'expertise retrieval task')], [(u'AGRIX', u'USED-FOR', u'agricultural expertise retrieval'), (u'rice', u'CONJUNCTION', u'sugar canes'), (u'sugar canes', u'CONJUNCTION', u'problem solving'), (u'sugar canes', u'CONJUNCTION', u'plant diseases'), (u'plant diseases', u'CONJUNCTION', u'problem solving')]]
sentences: [u'Generally , information retrieval ( IR ) performs keyword search based on the user query to find a set of relevant documents .', u'In the domain of agricultural expertise retrieval , the goal is to find a group of experts who has knowledge in agriculture ( by using publications as the evidence ) specified by the input query .', u'Typical publication IR systems could sometimes return the search result sets , which consist of a huge amount of publications .', u'Some of the returned publications are not relevant to the individual users information need .', u'In this paper , an ontology based agricultural expertise retrieval framework called AGRIX is proposed with the focus on the ontology creation to cover three following aspects : ( 1 ) expert profiles and publications , ( 2 ) type of plants and ( 3 ) problem solving .', u'To build the ontology model , we used a set of publications ( 1,249 records ) which was collected from the Thai national AGRIS center , Bureau of Library Kasetsart University .', u'In addition , a set of inference rules is created to support the expertise retrieval task .', u'By using AGRIX to implement an agricultural expertise retrieval , users can search for experts in two perspectives , plant ( e.g. , rice , sugar canes ) and problem solving ( e.g. , plant diseases , fertilizers ) .']

entities: [[(u'Agent communication languages', u'Material'), (u'agent communication', u'Task'), (u'semantic vocabulary', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneous private vocabulary', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'private ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'standardization', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'communication between agents', u'Task'), (u'interoperability problem', u'Task')], [(u'semantic interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed multi- agent Systems', u'Method')], [(u'communication layers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'communication between agents', u'Task'), (u'multiplatform communication system architecture', u'Method'), (u'KQML standard', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Dialogues', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Dynamic Ontology Mapping System', u'Method'), (u'Agent Communication', u'Task'), (u'mapping approaches', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'communication layers', u'USED-FOR', u'communication between agents')], [(u'Dynamic Ontology Mapping System', u'USED-FOR', u'Agent Communication'), (u'mapping approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'Dynamic Ontology Mapping System'), (u'mapping approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'Agent Communication'), (u'mapping approaches', u'CONJUNCTION', u'mapping approaches')]]
sentences: [u"Agent communication languages provide a standard in the protocol and language used in the agent communication , but ca n't provide a standard in ontology , because ontology depends on the subject and concept of the communication and it is almost impossible for two agents can share a same semantic vocabulary , they usually have a heterogeneous private vocabulary defined in their own private ontology .", u'The development of generally accepted standards will take a long time .', u'This lack of standardization , which impedes communication between agents , is known as the interoperability problem .', u'In order to obtain semantic interoperability in distributed multi- agent Systems , agents need to agree on the basis of different ontologies .', u'In this paper a communication layers is proposed to outline the communication between agents , a multiplatform communication system architecture is proposed to provide a highly flexible and scalable system that allows agents written in different languages to send and receive messages using the KQML standard , as well as it allow agents to maintain several Dialogues at a time .', u'In addition a Dynamic Ontology Mapping System for Agent Communication ( DOMAC ) is proposed based on different mapping approaches ( lexical , semantic and structural ) , in order to provide help in the conversation among different agents']

sentences: [u'The benefits of the use of modeling and simulation in engineering are acknowledged widely .', u'It has proven its advantages e.g. , in virtual prototyping i.e. , simulation aided design and testing as well as in training and R & D .', u'It is recognized to be a tool for modern decision making .', u'However , there are still reasons that slow down the wider utilization of modeling and simulation in companies .', u'Modeling and simulation tools are separate and are not an integrated part of the other engineering information management in the company networks .', u'They do not integrate well enough into the used CAD , PLM/PDM and control systems .', u'The co-use of the simulation tools themselves is poor and the whole modeling process is considered often to be too laborious .', u'In this article we introduce an integration solution for modeling and simulation based on the semantic data modeling approach .', u'Semantic data modeling and ontology mapping techniques have been used in database system integration , but the novelty of this work is in utilizing these techniques in the domain of modeling and simulation .', u'The benefits and drawbacks of the chosen approach are discussed .', u'Furthermore , we describe real industrial project cases where this new approach has been applied .']

relations: [[(u'groupware', u'USED-FOR', u'Groupanizer'), (u'user-centric information', u'USED-FOR', u'groupware applications')], [(u'User-centric context', u'USED-FOR', u'collaborative manner'), (u'User-centric context', u'USED-FOR', u'group member idiosyncrasies'), (u'collaborative manner', u'USED-FOR', u'group member idiosyncrasies')], [], [(u'user-centric element', u'USED-FOR', u'bias transactions')], [], [(u'time period', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'context elements'), (u'time period', u'CONJUNCTION', u'activity'), (u'activity', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'context elements')], [(u'position mapping', u'USED-FOR', u'definition')], [], [(u'ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'mapping locations'), (u'hidden Markov model', u'USED-FOR', u'location patterns')], []]
sentences: [u'Groupanizer is an extension of groupware and constitutes a development platform to integrate user-centric information for the benefit of groupware applications .', u'User-centric context is used in a collaborative manner to positively link and reinforce group member idiosyncrasies .', u"In order to do so , monitoring of the user 's daily context is essential , and thus , one aspect we aim at integrating is user physical position .", u'We believe that common visited places and trajectories constitute one user-centric element that should be used to bias transactions - namely tasks or scheduling - in groupware .', u'Although physical location could by itself be integrated in a model , we believe that motion behaviors are intrinsically linked to moments of daily life .', u'We define those moments using three context elements - a time period , an activity and the current day .', u'This definition leverages position mapping to include its implicit nature .', u"Essentially , the aim is for our model to ideally reflect a group 's ecology , namely relations between multiple users given their current and future locations .", u'This paper defines the ontology , mapping locations and moments among users , and the hidden Markov model used to derive location patterns .', u'Finally , it describes the experimentation phase and its results .']

entities: [[(u'skeletal-plan refinement', u'Method'), (u'problem-solving method', u'Method')], [(u'planning literature', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'planning systems', u'Method'), (u'domain-derived considerations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'architectural framework', u'Method'), (u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'reformulations', u'Generic')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge-based applications', u'Task'), (u'data-management system', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'temporal-data mediators', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Common Object Request Broker Architecture', u'Method')], [(u'skeletal-plan refinement method', u'Method'), (u'cooperating CORBA objects', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method ontology', u'Method'), (u'mapping relations and control structure', u'Task'), (u'skeletal-planning problem-solving method', u'Method'), (u'framework', u'Generic')], [(u'problem-solving methods', u'Method'), (u'application environments', u'Task'), (u'flexible configuration environment', u'Method'), (u'expressive mapping formalisms', u'Method'), (u'application environments', u'Task')], [(u'requirements', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'domain-derived considerations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'architectural framework')], [], [(u'Common Object Request Broker Architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'temporal-data mediators')], [], [(u'mapping relations', u'PART-OF', u'framework')], [(u'flexible configuration environment', u'CONJUNCTION', u'expressive mapping formalisms'), (u'expressive mapping formalisms', u'USED-FOR', u'application environments')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper describes successive reformulations of skeletal-plan refinement as a problem-solving method .', u'We argue that , whereas ideas derived from planning literature helped to determine the overall structure of the planning systems , domain-derived considerations and architectural framework in which the systems were implemented played important roles in these reformulations .', u'We illustrate the argument by describing a new framework that integrates knowledge-based applications with a temporal data-abstraction and data-management system .', u'In this framework , both applications and temporal-data mediators are encapsulated as Common Object Request Broker Architecture ( CORBA ) objects .', u'The skeletal-plan refinement method itself is formulated as a collection of cooperating CORBA objects .', u'We have found that we needed to reformulate the method ontology , mapping relations and control structure of the skeletal-planning problem-solving method in this framework .', u'Our experience suggests that problem-solving methods are not necessarily fixed structures that can be plugged into arbitrary application environments , and that we need to develop a flexible configuration environment and expressive mapping formalisms to accommodate the requirements of application environments .', u'These requirements include the ways data are made available and the ways software components interact with one another .']

relations: [[(u'distributed ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge sharing'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge sharing'), (u'ontology context immigration', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], [(u'ontology integration', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'approaches'), (u'ontology integration', u'CONJUNCTION', u'mapping'), (u'mapping', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'approaches')], [(u'ontology terms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology semantic similarity computation'), (u'ontology terms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology context immigration')], [(u'distributed ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'local semantic term')], [(u'ontology context', u'USED-FOR', u'source ontology')], [(u'distributed knowledge sharing system', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'system')], [(u'multi-agent technology', u'USED-FOR', u'system'), (u'multi-agent technology', u'USED-FOR', u'communication')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'distributed ontology knowledge sharing')], [(u'scalability', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'it')]]
sentences: [u'In order to better achieve knowledge sharing based on distributed ontologies , an approach based on ontology context immigration ( OCI ) is proposed .', u'Compared with traditional approaches such as ontology integration and mapping , the proposed approach can reduce the implementation complexity .', u'This approach can be mainly divided into three phases : ontology context determination for a given term , ontology semantic similarity computation between ontology terms , and ontology context immigration .', u'As for a local semantic term based on distributed ontologies , an appropriate ontology context of the term is determined and extracted from a local ontology most associated with the term by using semantic similarity computation .', u'Then , the ontology context is dynamically immigrated to the source ontology for enriching semantic information related to the term .', u'A system called distributed knowledge sharing system ( DKSS ) is developed to illustrate this approach .', u'The system adopts multi-agent technology for better communication and coordination between different ontology information sources .', u'The experimental results show that it is efficient for distributed ontology knowledge sharing .', u'The proposed approach does not require the support of a global ontology or the maintenance of complex ontology mapping relations , and thus it has better maintainability and scalability .']

relations: [[(u'membrane proteome', u'USED-FOR', u'biology of multipotent stromal cells'), (u'differentiation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'maturation')], [], [(u'pressure-assisted membrane protein extraction', u'PART-OF', u'approach'), (u'pressure-assisted membrane protein extraction', u'CONJUNCTION', u'protein fractionation'), (u'pressure-assisted membrane protein extraction', u'CONJUNCTION', u'gel-eluted liquid fraction entrapment electrophoresis'), (u'protein fractionation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'approach'), (u'gel-eluted liquid fraction entrapment electrophoresis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'protein fractionation'), (u'gel-eluted liquid fraction entrapment electrophoresis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'GELFREE )'), (u'liquid chromatography MALDI', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ESI tandem mass spectrometry')], [], [(u'Ingenuity Pathway Analysis', u'USED-FOR', u'Gene ontology mapping'), (u'Ingenuity Pathway Analysis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'DAVID programs'), (u'DAVID programs', u'USED-FOR', u'Gene ontology mapping')], [(u'workflow', u'USED-FOR', u'hBM-MSC')], [], []]
sentences: [u'A comprehensive analysis of the membrane proteome is essential to explain the biology of multipotent stromal cells and identify reliable protein biomarkers for the isolation as well as tracking of cells during differentiation and maturation .', u'However , proteomic analysis of membrane proteins is challenging and they are noticeably under-represented in numerous proteomic studies .', u'Here we introduce new approach , which includes high pressure-assisted membrane protein extraction , protein fractionation by gel-eluted liquid fraction entrapment electrophoresis ( GELFREE ) , and combined use of liquid chromatography MALDI and ESI tandem mass spectrometry .', u'This report presents the first comprehensive proteomic analysis of membrane proteome of undifferentiated and culture-expanded human bone marrow multipotent stromal cells ( hBM-MSC ) obtained from different human donors .', u'Gene ontology mapping using the Ingenuity Pathway Analysis and DAVID programs revealed the largest membrane proteomic dataset for hBM-MSC reported to date .', u'Collectively , the new workflow enabled us to identify at least two-fold more membrane proteins compared to published results on hBM-MSC .', u'A total of 84 CDs were identified including 14 CDs identified for the first time .', u'This dataset can serve as a basis for further exploration of self-renewal , differentiation and characterization of hBM-MSC .']

sentences: [u'The public safety community in the United States consists of thousands of local , state , and federal agencies , each with its own information system .', u'In the past few years , there has been a thrust on the seamless interoperability of systems in these agencies .', u'Ontology-based interoperability approaches in the public safety domain need to rely on mapping between ontologies as each agency has its own representation of information .', u'However , there has been little study of ontology mapping techniques in this domain .', u'We evaluate current mapping techniques with real-world data representations from law-enforcement and public safety data sources .', u'In addition , we implement an information theory based tool called MIMapper that uses WordNet and mutual information between data instances to map ontologies .', u'We find that three tools : PROMPT , Chimaera , and LOM , have average F-measures of 0.46 , 0.49 , and 0.68 when matching pairs of ontologies with the number of classes ranging from 13-73 .', u'MIMapper performs better with an average F-measure of 0.84 in performing the same task .', u'We conclude that the tools that use secondary sources ( like WordNet ) and data instances to establish mappings between ontologies are likely to perform better in this application domain .']

sentences: [u'With the increasing of global competition , it is important to make the product design process as fast and efficient as possible .', u'One way to achieve improvements in efficiency and innovation is through better collaboration of designers working on a common design task and interacting in the design process , so that unnecessary backtracking and delays are avoided .', u'In an integrated and concurrent design environment , designers interact and reach agreement by sharing common information .', u'But it is not an easy task due to the heterogeneity of information resources .', u"We have to solve semantic interoperability first in order to implement `` cooperation '' between different information systems .", u'There are many legacy systems based on conflicting ontologies which hinder the communications among them and become the obstacle of software reuse and system interoperability .', u'By analyzing relations between agents and ontologies , a semantic interoperability algorithm based on ontology mapping is proposed in the paper .', u'And the DCDP framework presented here provides a software architecture for synchronous groupware applications to deal with heterogeneity .', u"The framework 's main characteristic is data centricity .", u'The users collaborate on and exchange data , and the data is dynamically transformed to adapt to the particular computing platform .']

entities: [[(u'semantic conflicts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data heterogeneity problems', u'Task'), (u'heterogeneous information sources', u'Material')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information heterogeneity problems', u'Task')], [(u'domain specific ontlolgies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic ambiguities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain specific representations', u'Task')], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic')], [(u'heterogeneous ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology mapping', u'Method'), (u'semantic interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic heterogeneities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'coastal information sources', u'Material'), (u'syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Ontological modeling', u'Method')], [(u'data mining approach', u'Method'), (u'land cover ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'standardized information services', u'Method'), (u'middleware', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'It is well recognized that semantic conflicts are responsible for the most serious data heterogeneity problems hindering the efficient interoperability between heterogeneous information sources .', u'In recent years , ontologies are widely used as a means for solving the information heterogeneity problems because of their capability to provide explicit meaning to the information .', u'Several organizations are undertaking the development of domain specific ontlolgies to resolve the semantic ambiguities between various domain specific representations .', u'These ontologies designed for a particular task could be a unique representation of their project needs .', u'Hence , there arises a need to align heterogeneous ontologies to facilitate meaningful knowledge interchange between various sources .', u'Thus , ontology mapping has emerged as an important requirement to enable semantic interoperability between different representations within a domain .', u'In this paper we focus on the semantic heterogeneities present in the coastal information sources whose data are highly heterogeneous in syntax , structure and semantics .', u'Ontological modeling was carried out for the various information sources .', u'A data mining approach was adopted to align the concepts belonging to various land cover ontologies .', u'We present a set of standardized information services and middleware for seamless access to information from various networks .']

relations: [[(u'EIS )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Enterprise information systems')], [], [], [(u'pragmatic level', u'FEATURE-OF', u'Enterprise Isomorphic Mapping Mechanism')], [(u'ontology hierarchy', u'USED-FOR', u'mechanism')], [(u'EIMM', u'USED-FOR', u'concept structure')], [(u'Semantic Analysis', u'USED-FOR', u'EIMM'), (u'Semantic Analysis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Norm Analysis')], [(u'EIS', u'USED-FOR', u'problem')], []]
sentences: [u'Enterprise information systems ( EIS ) are the core to support an enterprise to cope with changing requirement and service .', u'However , dynamic is hard to tackle in EIS .', u'Enterprise Isomorphic Architecture ( EIA ) which has been studied in our earlier work with models and methods is to provide structural and semantic interoperability of EIS on the three levels of syntactic , semantic and pragmatic .', u'Enterprise Isomorphic Mapping Mechanism ( EIMM ) is on the pragmatic level as the core of EIA .', u'EIMM deals with changing requirement and transform it from business to IT systems through a mechanism based on ontology hierarchy and keeps the transformation isomorphic .', u'EIMM is aimed to keep the coherence of concept structure in order to prevent the transaction loss among domains and to facilitate business changes with simultaneous evolution of the IT infrastructure .', u'In this paper , the definition and construction of EIMM based on Semantic Analysis and Norm Analysis is introduced .', u'The mechanism for ontology mapping is to assist with the problem through connecting different aspects of EIS with a precise and coherent representation .', u'Components and their relationships in each domain are endowed with correlated semantic interpretation .']

relations: [[(u'Ontology mapping systems', u'USED-FOR', u'applications')], [], [], [(u'parallel algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'linguistic similarity matrix')], [], [], [], [(u'module', u'USED-FOR', u'similarity matrix computing'), (u'Falcon-AO', u'USED-FOR', u'similarity matrix computing'), (u'systems', u'USED-FOR', u'medium size ontology'), (u'execution time', u'FEATURE-OF', u'systems')]]
sentences: [u'Ontology mapping systems are used in different areas of applications , including the real time ones .', u'In order to increase their performance various approaches have been proposed and a large number of mapping systems were developed , but their performance fails when it comes to large ontologies .', u'In the ontotogy mapping process the similarity matrix calculus takes about 50 % of the entire execution time .', u'We focused on this calculus and we proposed a parallel algorithm for computing the linguistic similarity matrix of two ontologies .', u'This algorithm has been tested in different configurations : one or more computing nodes , different number of running processes .', u'Different specializations of running processes were taken into consideration : either all for computing , or one for distributing and managing the results of the tasks and the rest for computing .', u'For implementation we took into account the Java MPI , the MPJExpress project was used as middleware for messaging communication in Java , and we evaluated the time of message passing .', u'The resulted module for similarity matrix computing was inserted in Falcon-AO , one of the systems with the best execution time for medium size ontology , in order to improve its overall mapping performance .']

sentences: [u'An increasing number of Web applications are allowing users to play more active roles for enriching the source content .', u'The enriched data can be used for various applications such as text summarization , opinion mining and ontology creation .', u'In this paper , we propose a novel Web content summarization method that creates a text summary by exploiting user feedback ( comments and tags ) in a social bookmarking service .', u'We had manually analyzed user feedback in several representative social services including del.icio.us , Digg , YouTube , and Amazon.com .', u'We found that ( 1 ) user comments in each social service have its own characteristics with respect to summarization , and ( 2 ) a tag frequency rank does not necessarily represent its usefulness for summarization .', u'Based on these observations , we conjecture that user feedback in social bookmarking services is more suitable for summarization than other type of social services .', u'We implemented prototype system called SSNote that analyzes tags and user comments in del.icio.us , and extracts summaries .', u'Performance evaluations of the system were conducted by comparing its output summary with manual summaries generated by human evaluators .', u'Experimental results show that our approach highlights the potential benefits of user feedback in social bookmarking services .']

sentences: [u'Jednim z klicovm prvkem za Linked Data je pouiti slovnik , ktere umouji datasety sdilet spolecn jazyk k popisu podobne pojmy a vztahy a vyesit nejasnosti mezi nimi .', u'Rozvoj slovnik je casto pohann procesu shody mezi realizator datasety , ve ktere je kriterium interoperability povaovana za dostatecnou .', u'To me vest ke zkresleni realnch entit Linked Data slovniky .', u'Tyto nedostatky lze odstranit pouitim formalni metodiky pro modelovani Linked Data slovnik a identifikaci ontologicke rozdily .', u'Osvdcene pikladem je OntoClean metodika pro vytvrzovani taxonomii .', u'V teto praci se pedstavila softwarov nastroj , kter implementuje PURO pistup k ontologicke rozlisovani modelovani .', u'PURO modeluje slovniky jako ontologick foreground modely ( OFM ) a struktura ontologickch rozdil jako ontologicke background modely ( OBM ) , vyrobena s pouitim meta-vlastnosti pipojene k entitam slovnik v procesu znamem jako anotace slovnik .', u'Softwarov nastroj s nazvem Background Annotation plugin , napsan v Jav a integrovan do editoru ontologii Protege , umouje uivateli graficky anotaci entit slovnik prostednictvim anotace workflow , ktera implementuje , mimo jine , vytrvalosti anotaci a jejich nacitani .', u'Dva druhy pracovnich reim jsou podporovany : obecne a dataset specificke , aby se odlisily slovnik pouiti , pokud jde o PURO OBM , s ohledem na dan Linked Data dataset .', u'Workflow je zvsen pouitim statistickch ukazatel Linked Data dataset ziskanch prostednictvim sluby Sindice , u vzorku vybranch dataset , jako je pocet entit pitomnch v datasetu a relativni cetnosti entit slovniku v tomto datasetu .', u'Dalsi posileni poskytuje pehled dataset , kter nabizeji pehled nejbnjsich cest nachazejici v datasetu .', u'Pedpokladane vyuiti pluginu pozadi Anotace pati : 1 ) kontrola mapovani dohody mezi rznmi datasety , jako vyrobene ramci R2R a 2 ) Anotace zavislch zdroj v Concise Bouded Descriptions entit , ktere se pouivaji pi vzorkovani dat ze Linked Data dataset pro ucel dolovani dat .']

sentences: [u'Linked data indicate a manner of publishing and interlinking structured data on the web .', u'The basic hypothesis behind the concept of linked data is that the value and importance of data increases more when it is interlinked with different data sources .', u'This interlinked web of data is termed as the Linked data .', u'Searching data and providing the most relevant information in linked data is a big challenge .', u"A search engine 's utility depends upon the relevance of the search results it returns .", u'Traditional search engines are made to search data on the World Wide Web , where the data are not interlinked .', u'On the other hand , Linked Data based search engine will have to operate over an interlinked web of data .', u'Yet another challenge is to rank the search results .', u'The searched term or phrase can be present in numerous web pages .', u'The usefulness of information present in some pages may be greater than others .', u'So in order to provide the most relevant data , Search engines need to apply various ranking methods on their search results .', u'However the methodology used for ranking data can not be used in the same manner as it is used in traditional search engines , because the probability of a random user to visit a particular link is not equally likely .', u'In this manuscript a methodology for ranking linked data has been proposed .', u'Also , we have categorized the search into two basic types as Forward search and Backward search .', u'The aim of this bifurcation is to minimize search delays and to provide the end user the data that he or she is most probably looking for .']

sentences: [u'Traditionally , data published on the Web are available in HTML tables or CSV files , sacrificing much of its structure and semantics .', u'As a result , Linked Data was proposed to publish and connect structured data on the Web .', u'Linked Data enable individual entities which have selfdescribed feature in a particular format to be connected to related entities .', u'Therefore , Linked Data applications are able to be connected within in global space and different domains without bounding .', u'The practices of Linked Data has led to the extension of the Web with a global data space connecting data from diverse domains such as people , companies , books , scientific publications , music , genes , proteins , scientific data , location data , place names , point of interest , etc .', u'Following the trend of publishing data on the Web as Linked Data , a number of researchers are working on the best practices of publishing sensor data as Linked Sensor Data [ 1 , 2 , 3 ] .', u'The existing works use the XML serialization format of RDF and RDF/XML while it has been around for over a decade , there is very little uptake .', u'In this paper , we are going to present a RESTful framework that publishes sensor data as Linked Sensor Data .', u'We use the OGC Sensor Web for Internet of Things API as the fundamental framework , and extend it with the W3C JSON-Linked Data .', u'We will demonstrate that the proposed framework is machine-readable , structured , lightweight , efficient to transmit over the network , with smaller memory footprint , and most importantly compatible to the Web principles .', u'In this talk , we will also perform a live demonstration of the prototype system .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'query performance predictions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query execution history', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'machine learning approach', u'Method')], [], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Data scenario', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'provenance-based query result explanations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'non-annotation-based approach', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL query', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'query processor', u'Method'), (u'data model', u'Method'), (u'query language', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SPARQL 1.1 constructs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'user study', u'Method'), (u'query result explanations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Explanations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'explanation metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'explanation metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'extension', u'Generic'), (u'W3C PROV ontology', u'Method'), (u'explanation metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'derivation', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Our goal is to assist users in understanding SPARQL query performance , query results , and derivations on Linked Data .', u'To help users in understanding query performance , we provide query performance predictions based on the query execution history .', u'We present a machine learning approach to predict query performances .', u'We do not use statistics about the underlying data for our predictions .', u'This makes our approach suitable for the Linked Data scenario where statistics about the underlying data is often missing such as when the data is controlled by external parties .', u'To help users in understanding query results , we provide provenance-based query result explanations .', u'We present a non-annotation-based approach to generate why-provenance for SPARQL query results .', u'Our approach does not require any re-engineering of the query processor , the data model , or the query language .', u'We use the existing SPARQL 1.1 constructs to generate provenance by querying the data .', u'This makes our approach suitable for Linked Data .', u'We also present a user study to examine the impact of query result explanations .', u'Finally to help users in understanding derivations on Linked Data , we introduce the concept of Linked Explanations .', u'We publish explanation metadata as Linked Data .', u'This allows explaining derived data in Linked Data by following the links of the data used in the derivation and the links of their explanation metadata .', u'We present an extension of the W3C PROV ontology to describe explanation metadata .', u'We also present an approach to summarize these explanations to help users filter information in the explanation , and have an understanding of what important information was used in the derivation .']

entities: [[(u'collaborative learning environment', u'Method'), (u'computer science education', u'Task')], [(u'computer science', u'Task'), (u'web technologies', u'Method')], [(u'problem', u'Generic'), (u'instructional theories', u'Method'), (u'computer science education', u'Task'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'semantic-wiki-based framework', u'Method')], [(u'on- going research', u'Method'), (u'Semantic-WikiSUN', u'Method'), (u'computer science', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'semantic-wiki', u'Method'), (u'knowledge domain', u'Material'), (u'pedagogical principles', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'This paper discusses the use of a collaborative learning environment , specifically designed for computer science education .', u'In particular , we investigate how students ( may ) meaningfully learn computer science and how web technologies ( may ) support them in this process .', u'For a comprehensive view of the problem , different instructional theories are considered , as well as specific requirements for computer science education , driving the research to the adoption of semantic technologies and to the definition of a specific semantic-wiki-based framework .', u'In this scenario , the authors present an on- going research project , named Semantic-WikiSUN , which aims to investigate innovative strategies for learning and teaching computer science in the context of higher education .', u'It is based on the use of semantic-wiki to support the sharing and acquiring of knowledge in this specific knowledge domain , enabling the application of basic pedagogical principles .']

entities: [[(u'Single Information Space', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'environmental resources', u'Material'), (u'data', u'Generic')], [(u'Environmental information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'thematic domains', u'Material')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'environmental information resources', u'Material'), (u'domain knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'open interfaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'data', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'environmental resources'), (u'data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'models'), (u'models', u'CONJUNCTION', u'services')], [], [(u'architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'environmental information resources')], []]
sentences: [u'The vision of a Single Information Space in Europe for the Environment ( SISE ) requires seamless access to environmental resources , including data , models and services .', u'Environmental information must be discoverable , and it must be understandable in different contexts in order to be used effectively by parties of various thematic domains .', u'In this paper we introduce an architecture , developed in the FP7 project TaToo ( 247893 ) , which tries to overcome the obstacles by providing the possibility to easily annotate and rate environmental information resources , even by parties which do not own the resource , and transparently equipping this information with domain knowledge and thus enhancing discoverability and usability of resources with semantic technologies .', u'The objective of the architecture is to seamlessly blend in with existing infrastructures by making use of de facto standards while offering support for discovery , annotation and validation of environmental resources through open interfaces .']

entities: [[(u'semantic Grid', u'Method'), (u'semantically rich information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Grid resources', u'Material'), (u'intelligent Grid services', u'Task')], [(u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'Grid', u'Method')], [(u'semantic Grid', u'Material')], [(u'semantic Grid repository', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'performance evaluation', u'Metric'), (u'state-of-the-art reasoners', u'Generic'), (u'system', u'Generic')], []]
sentences: [u'Abstract # R # # N # The semantic Grid is a recent initiative to expose semantically rich information associated with Grid resources to build more intelligent Grid services .', u'Recently , several projects have embraced this vision and there are several successful applications that combine the strengths of the Grid and of semantic technologies .', u'However , semantic Grid still lacks a technology , which would provide the needed scalability and integration with existing infrastructure .', u'In this paper we present our on-going work on a semantic Grid repository , which is capable of addressing complex schemas and answer queries over ontologies with a large number of instances .', u'We present the details of our approach and describe the underlying architecture of the system .', u'We conclude with a performance evaluation , which compares the current state-of-the-art reasoners with our system .', u'Copyright 2008 John Wiley & Sons , Ltd .']

sentences: [u'Semantic technologies appear as a step on the way to creating systems capable of representing the physical world as real time computational processes .', u'In this context , the paper presents a toolchain for an ontology based knowledge management system .', u'It consists of the ontology editor , FluentEditor and the distributed knowledge representation system , Ontorion .', u'FluentEditor is a comprehensive tool for editing and manipulating complex ontologies that uses Controlled Natural Language ( CNL ) .', u'Its main feature is the usage of Controlled English as a knowledge modelling language .', u'Ontorion is a Distributed Knowledge Management System with Natural Language interfaces ( CNL ) and a built-in rules engine .', u'The Ontorion system is equipped with plugins for connection with other software environments , for example rOntorion using an R language package to access ontologies .', u'It is exemplified with the semantic extension of On Line Analytical Processing ( OLAP ) using R language .']

sentences: [u'In this part of the book we provide results from an online survey targeting companies of Content Management Systems ( CMSs ) .', u"The objective of this survey is to provide an overview of the capabilities of today 's CMSs , in particular with regard to the adoption of semantic technologies .", u'The survey has been promoted as part of the European Project Interactive Knowledge Stack ( IKS , iks-project.eu ) .', u'It was available online from June to November 2010 .', u'Overall , 27 CMS companies have been selected for publication in the current book .', u'Accordingly , detailed profiles are available for each CMS provider company .', u'These profiles are now available for IT executives of potential CMS customers to make decisions on which CMS providers fit best to their business .', u'This chapter provides an overview of the survey methodology and descriptive statistics before each profile is presented .']
