sentences: [u'The environment surrounding organisations is characterised by an increasing necessity of competent personnel that need to be assessed .', u'Moreover , personnel factors are capital for software development projects .', u'Given the importance of people in certain sectors , this paper introduces SemCASS , a tool based on semantic technologies to feed competence evaluation with competence evidences within software development projects .', u'These evidences are taken from two different sources .', u'On the one hand competence facts derived from the analysis of project repositories using natural language processing techniques .', u'On the other hand , standard competence evidences collected using mobile technologies .', u'SemCASS benefits from the standardisation of personnel performance metrics related to software development teams as well as the capital importance of competence ontologies and semantic reasoning as basic support of new knowledge management efforts .', u'Due to these set of features , the reliability and precision of the competence ...']

entities: [[(u'Grid technologies', u'Method'), (u'distributed resources', u'Material')], [(u'Resource Management systems', u'Method')], [(u'Resource Management system', u'Method'), (u'resource discovery', u'Task')], [(u'Grid environment', u'Task'), (u'heterogeneous resources', u'Material'), (u'Automatic Grid Resource Discovery approach', u'Method')], [(u'machine understandable resource description', u'Method'), (u'correlation mechanism', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'automatic resource brokerage', u'Task')], [(u'Resource Discovery approaches', u'Method'), (u'Syntax based Resource Discovery', u'Method'), (u'Semantics based Resource Discovery', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic Resource Discovery Architecture', u'Method'), (u'Ontology based framework', u'Method'), (u'Grid environment', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Grid technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'distributed resources')], [], [(u'Resource Management system', u'USED-FOR', u'resource discovery')], [(u'Automatic Grid Resource Discovery approach', u'USED-FOR', u'heterogeneous resources')], [(u'machine understandable resource description', u'CONJUNCTION', u'correlation mechanism')], [], [], [(u'Ontology based framework', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Resource Discovery Architecture')]]
sentences: [u'Grid technologies enable the sharing of a wide variety of distributed resources .', u'To utilize these resources , effective Resource Management systems are needed .', u'Resource Management system performs resource discovery to obtain information about the available resources .', u'The most challenging task in Grid environment is to manage the heterogeneous resources which needs an Automatic Grid Resource Discovery approach .', u'Realizing this revelation requires a machine understandable resource description and powerful correlation mechanism .', u'Semantic technologies provide vocabularies with explicitly defined , unambiguously understandable and automatically machine-interpretable meanings , which make the process of automatic resource brokerage possible .', u'In this paper , we have discussed various Resource Discovery approaches and exhaustive comparison of Syntax based Resource Discovery with Semantics based Resource Discovery is presented .', u'Besides this Semantic Resource Discovery Architecture is discussed that uses Ontology based framework to discover resources in Grid environment .']

entities: [[(u'SOA environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'discovery service', u'Metric')], [(u'P2P-based infrastructure', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'service discovery process', u'Task')], [(u'overlay network', u'Method'), (u'semantic groups of peers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'applicative domains', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'semantic query routing mechanism', u'Method')], [(u'solution', u'Generic')], [(u'system prototype', u'Generic'), (u'PlanetLab testbed', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'P2P-based infrastructure', u'USED-FOR', u'service discovery process'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'P2P-based infrastructure'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'service discovery process')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'In SOA environments , as the number of published Web Services grows , the provision of a robust , scalable and efficient discovery service is still an unresolved issue .', u'In this paper we present a P2P-based infrastructure that leverages the semantic technologies to support a scalable and accurate service discovery process .', u'The key concept of the presented idea is the creation of an overlay network organized in several semantic groups of peers , each specialized in answering queries pertaining to specific applicative domains .', u'Groups are formed by clustering together peers offering services that are semantically related .', u"A semantic query routing mechanism ensures the delivery of queries to the groups that are semantically `` worth '' to respond .", u'In this paper the architecture details of the proposed solution is presented .', u'A system prototype has also been implemented and validated through a case study deployed on the PlanetLab testbed .']

sentences: [u'The SIMDAT project aims at developing generic grid technology for the solution of complex application problems and using this new technology in several industrial application sectors .', u'Semantic technologies are expected to offer a significant added value to other technologies with respect to the management of resources on the process level and on the data level .', u'The strategic objectives of SIMDAT are ( i ) to test and enhance data grid technology for product development and production process design , ( ii ) to develop federated versions of problem-solving environments ( PSEs ) by leveraging enhanced grid services , ( iii ) to exploit data grids as a basis for distributed knowledge discovery , ( iv ) to promote de facto standards for these enhanced grid technologies across a range of disciplines and sectors as well as ( v ) to raise awareness for the advantages of data grids in important industrial sectors .']

relations: [[], [(u'large displacements', u'CONJUNCTION', u'occlusions'), (u'large displacements', u'CONJUNCTION', u'image noise'), (u'occlusions', u'CONJUNCTION', u'image noise'), (u'occlusions', u'CONJUNCTION', u'illumination'), (u'image noise', u'CONJUNCTION', u'illumination'), (u'image noise', u'CONJUNCTION', u'pose changes'), (u'illumination', u'CONJUNCTION', u'pose changes'), (u'illumination', u'CONJUNCTION', u'image blur'), (u'pose changes', u'CONJUNCTION', u'image blur')], [], [], [(u'tracking methods', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic technologies'), (u'tracking methods', u'USED-FOR', u'object labeling gap'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'object labeling gap')]]
sentences: [u'Visual object tracking with unmanned aerial vehicles ( UAVs ) plays a central role in the aerial surveillance .', u'Reliable object detection depends on many factors such as large displacements , occlusions , image noise , illumination and pose changes or image blur that may compromise the object labeling .', u'The paper presents a proposal for a hybrid solution that adds semantic information to the video tracking processing : along with the tracked objects , the scene is completely depicted by data from places , natural features , or in general Points of Interest ( POIs ) .', u'Each scene from a video sequence is semantically described by ontological statements which , by inference , support the object identification which often suffers from some weakness in the object tracking methods .', u'The synergy between the tracking methods and semantic technologies seems to bridge the object labeling gap , enhance the understanding of the situation awareness , as well as critical alarming situations .']

entities: [[], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'structured research data', u'Material'), (u'Web collaboration tools', u'Material'), (u'social media', u'Material'), (u'Linked Open Data', u'Material')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'platform', u'Generic')], [(u'social media accounts', u'Material'), (u'collaboration tools', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'personalized exploration of research repositories', u'Task'), (u'real world scholar profiles', u'Material'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'reference profile', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'model', u'USED-FOR', u'structured research data'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'model'), (u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'structured research data'), (u'Web collaboration tools', u'CONJUNCTION', u'social media'), (u'social media', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Linked Open Data')], [], [(u'social media accounts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'collaboration tools')], []]
sentences: [u'Resources for research are not always easy to explore , and rarely come with strong support for identifying , linking and selecting those that can be of interest to scholars .', u'In this work we introduce a model that uses state-of-the-art semantic technologies to interlink structured research data and data from Web collaboration tools , social media and Linked Open Data .', u'We use this model to build a platform that connects scholars , using their profiles as a starting point to explore novel and relevant content for their research .', u'Scholars can easily adapt to evolving trends by synchronizing new social media accounts or collaboration tools and integrate then with new datasets .', u'We evaluate our approach by a scenario of personalized exploration of research repositories where we analyze real world scholar profiles and compare them to a reference profile .']

sentences: [u'Cybercrime tackling is a major challenge for Law Enforcement Agencies ( LEAs ) .', u'Traditional digital forensics and investigation procedures are not coping with the sheer amount of data to analyse , which is stored in multiple devices seized from distinct , possibly-related cases .', u'Moreover , inefficient information representation and exchange hampers evidence recovery and relationship discovery .', u'Aiming at a better balance between human reasoning skills and computer processing capabilities , this paper discusses how semantic technologies could make cybercrime investigation more efficient .', u'It takes the example of online banking fraud to propose an ontology aimed at mapping criminal organisations and identifying malware developers .', u'Although still on early stage of development , it reviews concepts to extend from well-established ontologies and proposes novel abstractions that could enhance relationship discovery .', u'Finally , it suggests inference rules based on empirical knowledge which could better address the needs of the human analyst .']

sentences: [u'Nowadays , one of the main issues discussed at the Community level is rep- resented by the mobility of students and workers across Europe .', u'During the last years , in order to deal with the above picture , several initiatives have been carried out : one of them is the definition of the European Qualification Framework ( EQF ) , a common architecture for the description of qualifications .', u'At the same time , several research activities were established with the aim of finding how semantic technologies could be exploited for qualifications comparison in the field of human resources acquisition .', u'In this paper , the EQF specifications are taken into account and they are applied in a practical scenario to develop a ranking algorithm for the comparison of qualifications expressed in terms of knowledge , skill and competence concepts , potentially aimed at supporting European employers during the recruiting phase .']

sentences: [u'Comprehensive data models and standardised terminologies are required across tools and their developers to rapidly design and prototype digitised virtual factories .', u'Also , various types of software are required to be integrated for cost-effective modelling exercises .', u'To meet this requirement , semantic modelling technologies involving ontologies have featured prominently in many manufacturing applications .', u'This paper considers , extensively , the current semantic requirements for digitised virtual factory design and prototyping and compares them with the capabilities of existing semantic technologies .', u'As a result , a review of methodologies , tools and languages for creating ontologies has been reported .', u'The review concludes with the next generation requirements for methodologies , tools and languages for creating ontologies suitable for the virtual factory design process , and further explains ongoing work associated with the creation of ontologies and reasoning mechanisms through the integrated use of ObjectLog ...']

sentences: [u'Data mining is the process of extracting hidden knowledge from data .', u'As more data is gathered , data mining is becoming an increasingly important tool to transform this data into information .', u'Visualization is central to data mining .', u'Information visualization is the process of turning abstract data into a visual shape easily understood by the user , making it possible for him/her to generate new knowledge about the relations between the data .', u'Ontologies represent a shared meaning of a domain and they can be used to describe almost any kind of domain concepts explicitly including their terms , attributes , values and relationships facilitating the communication between people and application systems .', u'Leveraging the power of semantic technologies , ontology based data mining and recent trends in information visualization , this work presents the approach towards the management of multi-dimensional often temporal heterogeneous home data .']

entities: [[(u'Stakeholders', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'automotive production process', u'Method'), (u'data management systems', u'Method')], [(u'Project management', u'Method'), (u'engineering objects', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'collaboration tasks', u'Task')], [(u'semantic technologies RDF', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'domain related ontology PROTARES', u'Method'), (u'PROject TAsks RESources )', u'Method'), (u'domain knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'software prototype', u'Method'), (u'domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'production process', u'Method')], [(u'decision making', u'Task'), (u'automotive product lifecycle', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'semantic technologies RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'domain related ontology PROTARES'), (u'OWL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SPARQL')], [], [(u'customized views', u'USED-FOR', u'decision making')]]
sentences: [u'Stakeholders in specific disciplines , departments , companies and at different locations within the automotive production process save their results in different data management systems .', u'Project management is currently done separately and does not interact with engineering objects .', u'Our work aims on providing flexible data insights on collaboration tasks between participants within the product lifecycle .', u'We applied semantic technologies RDF , OWL and SPARQL with a specific domain related ontology PROTARES ( PROject TAsks RESources ) to interlink , describe and query domain knowledge about the product .', u'As proof of concept a software prototype is introduced , which resides on the domain ontology and allows knowledge based browsing and visualisation of specific aspects within the production process .', u'With this example we want to demonstrate , how semantically driven customized views can support monitoring and reflection of engineering tasks and decision making within the early phases of the automotive product lifecycle .']

sentences: [u'Supply chain management and business-to-business procurement present several drawbacks in terms of knowledge management .', u'Every stage of a supply chain lacks an effective approach to integrate data workflows for knowledge acquisition .', u'Thus , semantic technologies such as the simple knowledge organization system ( SKOS ) are being adapted to the requirements of the knowledge management systems of companies .', u'The literature is focused on assets , data , and information elements of exchange among supply chain partners , even though improved integration and collaboration require more complex features of know-how and knowledge .', u'This article proposes a new software architecture named SKOSCM to offer a brokerage service for e-procurement in supply chains .', u'The approach uses ontologies and a Web-based platform that improves collaboration among supply chain partners .', u'A case study is proposed in order to validate the software architectures development .']

entities: [[], [(u'cutting-edge approach', u'Method'), (u'web-enabled embedded devices', u'Method'), (u'sensor and actuator technologies', u'Method')], [(u'Internet-oriented approach', u'Method'), (u'sensorial platforms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method')], [(u'Resource-Oriented and Ontology-Driven Development ( ROOD ) methodology', u'Method'), (u'Model Driven Architecture ( MDA )', u'Method'), (u'Smart Spaces', u'Method')], [(u'ROOD methodology', u'Method'), (u'Smart Hotel', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'sensorial platforms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic technologies')], [(u'Model Driven Architecture ( MDA )', u'USED-FOR', u'Resource-Oriented and Ontology-Driven Development ( ROOD ) methodology')], [(u'Smart Hotel', u'USED-FOR', u'ROOD methodology')]]
sentences: [u'How to create or integrate large Smart Spaces ( considered as mash-ups of sensors and actuators ) into the paradigm of Web of Things has been the motivation of many recent works .', u'A cutting-edge approach deals with developing and deploying web-enabled embedded devices with two major objectives : 1 ) to integrate sensor and actuator technologies into everyday objects , and 2 ) to allow a diversity of devices to plug to Internet .', u'Currently , developers who want to use this Internet-oriented approach need have solid understanding about sensorial platforms and semantic technologies .', u'In this paper we propose a Resource-Oriented and Ontology-Driven Development ( ROOD ) methodology , based on Model Driven Architecture ( MDA ) , to facilitate to any developer the development and deployment of Smart Spaces .', u'Early evaluations of the ROOD methodology have been successfully accomplished through a partial deployment of a Smart Hotel .']

entities: [[(u'Web 2.0', u'Task'), (u'RESTful web services', u'Method')], [(u'RESTful web services', u'Method')], [(u'keyword based retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'retrieval method', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'RESTful web services', u'Method')], [(u'system structure', u'Generic'), (u'description style', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'integrated search system', u'Method'), (u'OpenAPIs', u'Method'), (u'semantic markup', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'tagging', u'Task'), (u'semantic annotation', u'Task'), (u'HTML description pages', u'Material')], [(u'RDF document', u'Material'), (u'HTML', u'Material'), (u'service repository', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'similarity based keyword searching systems', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'RESTful web services', u'USED-FOR', u'web')], [], [], [(u'semantic technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'retrieval method'), (u'RESTful web services', u'USED-FOR', u'retrieval method'), (u'RESTful web services', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic technologies')], [], [], [(u'system', u'COMPARE', u'similarity based keyword searching systems')]]
sentences: [u'With the advent of Web 2.0 , RESTful web services are becoming increasingly popular to emphasize the web as platform .', u'There are already many RESTful web services and the number of services is increasing rapidly .', u'Thus , it can be difficult to find specific services using keyword based retrieval .', u'To solve this problem , a retrieval method was developed using semantic technologies based on RESTful web services .', u'In order to accomplish this , first the system structure was defined and the description style was modeled based on the integrated search system for OpenAPIs ; then semantic markup ( tagging , semantic annotation ) was added to the HTML description pages .', u'Next , the RDF document was extracted from the HTML and stored in a service repository .', u'Based on the keywords that are extended through ontology , the developed system provides more filtered and extended results than similarity based keyword searching systems .']

sentences: [u'In the APPRIS project an Early-Warning-System ( EWS ) is developed applying semantic technologies , namely an enterprise ontology and an inference engine , for the assessment of procurement risks .', u'Our approach allows for analyz- ing internal resources ( e.g .', u'ERP and CRM data ) and external sources ( e.g .', u"entries in the Commercial Register and newspaper reports ) to assess known risks , but also for identifying 'black swans ' , which hit enterprises with no warning but po- tentially large impact .", u'For proof of concept we developed a prototype that allows for integrating data from various information sources , of various information types ( structured and unstructured ) , and information quality ( assured facts , news ) ; automatic identification , validation and quantification of risks and aggregation of assessment results on several granularity levels .', u"The motivating scenario is de- rived from three business project partners ' real requirements for an EWS ."]

sentences: [u'It is envisioned that future architectures will maximize the use of Semantic Technologies and information sharing to improve efficiency and automation , support multi-source information aggregation for advanced analysis , eliminate needless data duplication , and improve adaptability of data sources to new dissemination requirements .', u'In this paper , the authors present a semantic-level solution for enforcing flexible , role-based access and editing policies in support of ontologies , as well as , the underlying data content .', u'The authors describe an implementation method for a security policy with distinctive user roles .', u'A repository of semantically-rich information is used to simultaneously permit access by users with differet security clearances and deny access to unauthorized users .', u'Finally , in the context of a real world example , the authors demonstrate how the application of the security scheme seamlessly integrates with third party semantic applications and visualization tools .']

sentences: [u'Social networks are having a huge impact on how people socialise , gather information , stay informed and solve problems .', u'As could be expected , this trend is influencing the area of software engineering at different levels .', u'In software development , the amount of data available is becoming prohibitively overwhelming for analysis purposes with traditional techniques .', u'As semantic technologies mature , they provide a consistent and reliable basis to handle large amounts of data .', u'Besides , they enable added value , reasoning-based functionality to access such data in an automatic fashion .', u'The authors present a system for supporting the design of teams for software development projects , which combines the benefits of semantics and social networks .', u'The authors also propose a full-fledged solution backed with a proof-of-concept implementation that has been tested in the scope of small and medium enterprises ( SME ) .']

sentences: [u'In the past few years , M2M ( Machine-to-Machine ) applications have become a hot topic in the wireless industry .', u'While M2M applications can be used for many purposes ( smart homes , smart metering/electricity meter reading , fleet management , mobile workforce , automobile insurance , vending machines , etc ) , and in many sectors ( healthcare , agriculture , commercial , industrial , retail , utility , etc .', u') , smart metering applications or smart grids present the biggest growth potential in the M2M market today .', u'M2M platform is the future ubiquitous network technologies which provide the integrated service with the networks and devices .', u'The promising technologies to tackle these problems are the Semantic technologies , for interoperability , and the Agent technologies for management of complex systems .', u"In this paper the information communication technique based on the disaster prevention system 's for the M2M , concepts and its requirement technology and application are studied ."]

sentences: [u'Being center of both public and hazardous material transport system , railway is one of the most important critical infrastructures .', u'This research is aiming to support secure access to information , dependable and reliable operation , efficient management and maintenance of the railway infrastructure .', u'In this regard , this paper proposes a framework where sensors retrieve the contextual data from the infrastructure and a middleware processes these data and the semantics of data to derive decisions .', u'These decisions allow monitoring of information and generate alarms for faults .', u'The decisions may recommend actions to deal with the faults and provide secure access to information only to authorized personnel .', u'The semantic technologies such as ontology language , rule language and reasoning process are used to design the middleware .', u'The paper includes detailed description of the middleware and an overview of its implementation steps .']

sentences: [u'This paper proposes to apply semantic technologies in a new domain , Field research .', u"It is said that if `` raw data '' is openly available on the Web , it will be used by other people to do wonderful things .", u'But , it would be better to show a use case together with that data , especially in the dawn of LOD .', u'Therefore , we are proceeding with both of LOD content generation and its application for a specific domain .', u'The application addresses an issue of information retrieval in the field , and the mechanism of LOD generation from the Web might be applied to the other domain .', u"Firstly , we demonstrate the use of our mobile application , which searches a plant fitting the environmental conditions obtained by the smartphone 's sensors .", u'Then , we introduce our approach of the LOD generation , and present an evaluation showing its practical effectiveness .']

entities: [[(u'Linked Open Data', u'Material')], [(u'online execution of Linked Data queries', u'Task'), (u'declarative queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data publishing principles', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'The publication of Linked Open Data on the Web has gained tremendous momentum over the last six years .', u'As a consequence , we currently witness the emergence of a new research area that focuses on an online execution of Linked Data queries ; i.e. , declarative queries that range over Web data that is made available using the Linked Data publishing principles .']

entities: [[(u'Data collection', u'Material'), (u'collaborative research', u'Task')], [(u'E-Health', u'Method'), (u'organisational boundaries', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'contexts', u'Generic'), (u'security and access control', u'Task')], [(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'organisation boundaries', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'e-Health security processes', u'Method'), (u'policies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'ontology-based policy specification', u'Method'), (u'security challenges', u'Task'), (u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'access control', u'Task'), (u'security information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'clinical collaborators', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'access', u'CONJUNCTION', u'usage')], [], [], [], [(u'e-Health security processes', u'CONJUNCTION', u'policies')], [(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'access control'), (u'ontology-based policy specification', u'USED-FOR', u'approaches'), (u'security information', u'USED-FOR', u'approaches')]]
sentences: [u'Data collection , access and usage are essential for many forms of collaborative research .', u'E-Health represents one area with much to gain by sharing of data across organisational boundaries .', u'In such contexts , security and access control are essential to protect the often complex , privacy and information governance concerns of associated stakeholders .', u'In this paper we argue that semantic technologies have unique benefits for specification and enforcement of security policies that cross organisation boundaries .', u'We illustrate this through a case study based around the International Niemann-Pick Disease ( NPD ) Registry ( www.inpdr.org ) - which typifies many current e-Health security processes and policies .', u'We show how approaches based upon ontology-based policy specification overcome many of the current security challenges facing the development of such systems and enhance access control by leveraging existing security information associated with clinical collaborators .']

entities: [[(u'contextual information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'social networking applications framework', u'Method')], [(u'contextual information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'analysis systems', u'Method'), (u'context-aware systems', u'Method'), (u'contextual semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'mining', u'Task'), (u'intelligent information access', u'Task'), (u'social media', u'Material')], [(u'context definition and modeling methods', u'Method'), (u'multimedia computing applications', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'The importance of contextual information is widely acknowledged and has become a major topic of interest , investigation , and experimentation for quite some time , generating numerous papers and many scientific works .', u'In this position paper we attempt to present the role of context , tackling it from the humanistic scope of its utilization within the modern social networking applications framework .', u'Three major types of relevant contextual information may be identified in the literature , namely multimedia content retrieval and analysis systems that utilize the notion of context towards improved results , context-aware systems , and contextual semantics , i.e. , works that utilize semantic technologies for mining and intelligent information access to social media .', u'For each type we shall present a brief review of its context definition and modeling methods , as well as identify and discriminate its useful types focusing on multimedia computing applications .']

sentences: [u'smartFIX is a product portfolio for knowledge-based extraction of data from any document format .', u'smartFIX automatically determines the document type and extracts all relevant data for the respective business process .', u'Data that is uncertainly recognized is forwarded to a verification workplace for manual checking .', u'In general , users have no difficulties to interpret the document data and wonder why the system needs additional input .', u'For that reason , we will integrate an explanation component that will be used to justify uncertain extraction results , thus , increasing confidence of users .', u'The component will be based on semantic technologies in general and on a semantic log in particular .', u'The log will contain all process relevant information enabling the explanation facility to generate customized and understandable explanations .', u'In this paper , we will discuss the benefits of that kind of technology with reference to DAS .']

entities: [[], [(u'connected entities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'devices', u'Generic'), (u'physical objects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'people', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'physical environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic modeling', u'Method'), (u'IoT application developers', u'Method')], [(u'IoT applications', u'Task'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method')], [(u'FI-WARE platform enablers', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'The development of IoT ( Internet of Things ) applications poses a number of scientific and technological challenges which stem from the characteristics of the IoT domain itself .', u'These include the huge and increasing number of connected entities ( devices , physical objects , people , ) populating the physical environment , the variety of their types which leads to heterogeneity of the data produced or consumed by those connected entities .', u'In this paper we argue that semantic modeling takes up many of these challenges and explain how the core platform developed by the FI-WARE project supports IoT application developers .', u'After a short introduction of the characteristics and requirements of IoT applications we identify the contribution of semantic technologies to address some of them .', u'We describe the FI-WARE platform enablers which support these technologies and illustrate through a real application how these enablers help developers satisfy these requirements .']

entities: [[(u'cloud services', u'Task'), (u'cloud service selection', u'Task')], [(u'web services', u'Method'), (u'WSDL description', u'Method'), (u'cloud services', u'Method'), (u'cloud services', u'Method')], [(u'cloud service recommendation system', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'cloud service description documents', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'natural language processing method', u'Method'), (u'cloud service', u'Method'), (u'fuzzy service ontology clusters', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'user query', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'natural language processing methods', u'Method'), (u'fuzzy connectives', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'first-order Horn clause logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'disjunctive normal form', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'In view of the diverse nature of cloud services , cloud service selection is still an open issue .', u'Unlike web services , which are selected based on WSDL description , cloud services can not be selected ; there is no standard representation of cloud services , since most of these services are described in natural language .', u'In this paper , we propose a cloud service recommendation system which is built upon semantic technologies .', u'This system parses the cloud service description documents using a natural language processing method ; the primary concept of the cloud service is identified and the fuzzy service ontology clusters are then updated .', u'The user query is processed using natural language processing methods , and fuzzy connectives are used to refine the query based on first-order Horn clause logic and disjunctive normal form ( DNF ) .', u'A performance evaluation shows that this system provides better results than other methods .']

sentences: [u'How to create or integrate large Smart Spaces ( considered as mash-ups of sensors and actuators ) into the paradigm of ? Web of Things ?', u'has been the motivation of many recent works .', u'A cutting-edge approach deals with developing and deploying web-enabled embedded devices with two major objectives : 1 ) to integrate sensor and actuator technologies into everyday objects , and 2 ) to allow a diversity of devices to plug to Internet .', u'Currently , developers who want to use this Internet-oriented approach need have solid understanding about sensorial platforms and semantic technologies .', u'In this paper we propose a Resource-Oriented and Ontology-Driven Development ( ROOD ) methodology , based on Model Driven Architecture ( MDA ) , to facilitate to any developer the development and deployment of Smart Spaces .', u'Early evaluations of the ROOD methodology have been successfully accomplished through a partial deployment of a Smart Hotel .']

sentences: [u'In this paper , the author considers how semantic technologies may impact # R # # N # the design of future archives , which require both very secure approaches # R # # N # to maintaining data , metadata , and their provenance , as well as the most # R # # N # cost effective operation possible .', u"One potential application for semantic # R # # N # technologies may be improving the automation of system configuration , allowing # R # # N # an archive to be `` self-replicating '' or `` viral '' -- meaning that the archive # R # # N # infrastructure as well as its data could automatically pack itself into a # R # # N # self-contained structure that could be transmitted to a new site and automatically unpack itself .", u"A more challenging problem is likely to be dealing with the evolution of the semantics of the collection and of the archive 's user # R # # N # communities over an extended period of time ."]

sentences: [u'Purpose This paper sets out to discuss the use of information extraction ( IE ) , a natural languageprocessing ( NLP ) technique to assist rich semantic indexing of diverse archaeological text resources .', u'The focus of the research is to direct a semanticaware rich indexing of diverse natural language resources with properties capable of satisfying information retrieval from online publications and datasets associated with the Semantic Technologies for Archaeological Resources ( STAR ) project.Design/methodology/approach The paper proposes use of the English Heritage extension ( CRMEH ) of the standard core ontology in cultural heritage , CIDOC CRM , and exploitation of domain thesauri resources for driving and enhancing an OntologyOriented Information Extraction process .', u'The process of semantic indexing is based on a rulebased Information Extraction technique , which is facilitated by the General Architecture of Text Engineering ( GATE ) toolkit and expressed by Java Annotation Pattern Engine ( JAPE ) rules.F ...']

entities: [[(u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'TEL domain', u'Material')], [(u'domain ontology', u'Method')], [(u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'not-tech-savvy users', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Tools', u'Generic'), (u'ontology extraction', u'Task')], [(u'non-IT domains', u'Material'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'ontology extraction tools', u'Method'), (u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology extraction tools', u'Method'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'TEL domain', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'Recent research in Technology-Enhanced Learning ( TEL ) demonstrated several important benefits that semantic technologies can bring to the TEL domain .', u'An underlying assumption for most of these research efforts is the existence of a domain ontology .', u'The second unspoken assumption follows that educators will build domain ontologies for their courses .', u'However , ontologies are hard to build , especially for not-tech-savvy users .', u'Tools for ontology extraction from text aim to overcome this problem .', u'We have conducted an empirical study with educators , both from Information Technology ( IT ) and non-IT domains , where they used current ontology extraction tools to build domain ontologies for their courses from their existing course material .', u'Based on the obtained study results we have drawn conclusions about the existing ontology extraction tools and provided recommendations for their future development so that they can be beneficial for the TEL domain .']

entities: [[(u'com puters', u'Method'), (u'health education', u'Task')], [(u'computer-tailoring health education systems', u'Method'), (u'health education', u'Task')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'health problem', u'Task'), (u'educational resources', u'Material')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'educational resources', u'Material')], [], [(u'information overload', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'recommender systems', u'Method')], [(u'personalized health education', u'Method')], [(u'social networks', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'The use of com puters in health education started more than a decade ago , mainly for tailoring health educational resources .', u'Nowadays , many of the computer-tailoring health education systems are using the Internet for delivering different types of health education .', u'Traditionally , these systems are designed for a specific health problem , with a predefined library of educational resources .', u'These systems do not take advantage of the increasing amount of educational resources available on the Internet .', u'One of the reasons is that the high availability of content is making it more difficult to find the relevant one .', u'The problem of information overload has been addressed for many years in the field of recommender systems .', u'This paper is focused on the challenges and opportunities of merging recommender systems with personalized health education .', u'It also discusses the usage of social networks and semantic technologies within this approach .']

entities: [[(u'digital repositories', u'Material'), (u'those', u'Generic'), (u'academic scope', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'libraries', u'Material')], [(u'protocols', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'meta-data descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'publication', u'Task')], [(u'them', u'Generic'), (u'syntactical technologies', u'Method'), (u'digital repositories', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'centralized approaches', u'Method'), (u'inter-institutional independence', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'distributed integration architecture', u'Method'), (u'semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'federated queries', u'Material')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'libraries', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'academic scope')], [(u'protocols', u'CONJUNCTION', u'meta-data descriptions'), (u'meta-data descriptions', u'CONJUNCTION', u'technologies')], [(u'syntactical technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'digital repositories')], [], [(u'semantic technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'federated queries')], []]
sentences: [u'Currently , institutions store the information that they produce in digital repositories , especially those within the academic scope , such as universities and libraries .', u'However , the lack of agreement in defining protocols , meta-data descriptions and technologies for publication has caused issues while trying to integrate repositories .', u'Numerous alternatives have been proposed to tackle this problem , however , most of them are based on syntactical technologies , which are exclusive to the ambit of digital repositories , hampering a higher level integration ( Web ) .', u'In addition , much of the research done so far uses centralized approaches , which are hardly scalable and can threaten to inter-institutional independence .', u'In this work a new distributed integration architecture is proposed , which is based on semantic technologies and federated queries .', u'This architecture has been successfully tested to integrate a group of institutional repositories belonging to universities , demonstrating its applicability within this context .']

sentences: [u'Semantic Business Process Management is an emerging research area to support enterprises achieving economic and strategic objectives and improving their daily business .', u'However , the magnitude of changes which are required for models that capture the business processes is a challenge today .', u'The necessity to change process models in order to stay synchronized with the reality is due to changing requirements within enterprises or external events like mergers and acquisitions , changing laws and reactions to changing markets .', u'The approach we describe in this paper shows a way to automatically adapt existing process models when parts of a process have changed .', u'We apply semantic technologies to the automatic planning approach for the adaptation .', u'Categories and Subject Descriptors : D.2.2 ( Software Engineering ) : Design Tools and Techniques ; D.2.13 ( Software Engineering ) : Reusable Software - Reuse models ; H.4.1 ( Information Systems ) : Automation - Workflow Management .']

entities: [[], [(u'knowledge forms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'decisional experience', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'decisional DNA', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reflexive knowledge structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'decisional fingerprints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'explicit decisional experience', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'decisional DNA', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'decisional event', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'decisional event', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'experience knowledge structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'decisional gene', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Multiple decisional genes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'decisional chromosomes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'decisional DNA', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'decisional DNA', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'emerging semantic technologies', u'Method'), (u'decisional DNA', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reflexive knowledge structure', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'reflexive knowledge structure', u'USED-FOR', u'decisional DNA')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Some of the most complicated issues about knowledge are its acquisition and its conversion into explicit and usable knowledge .', u'Nevertheless , among all knowledge forms , storing decisional experience in a knowledge-explicit way becomes an important advance .', u"We introduce the decisional DNA as a reflexive knowledge structure able of capturing organizations ' decisional fingerprints in the form of explicit decisional experience .", u'The construction of the decisional DNA is a journey that starts with a decisional event .', u'This decisional event builds up a Set of experience knowledge structure ( SOEKS ) establishing a decisional gene .', u'Multiple decisional genes comprise decisional chromosomes , and multiple decisional chromosomes lead to the construction of the decisional DNA of an organization .', u'In addition , current implementations and future trends of the decisional DNA are presented through the introduction of emerging semantic technologies and applications turning the decisional DNA into a reflexive knowledge structure .']

entities: [[(u'Matching of semantic service descriptions', u'Task'), (u'automatic service discovery', u'Task')], [(u'Existing approaches', u'Generic'), (u'matchmaking process', u'Method'), (u'signature', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'specification matching', u'Task')], [], [(u'matching algorithm', u'Method'), (u'separated and explicit signature matching step', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'automatic invocation', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Matching of semantic service descriptions', u'USED-FOR', u'automatic service discovery')], [(u'signature', u'CONJUNCTION', u'specification matching')], [], [(u'separated and explicit signature matching step', u'USED-FOR', u'matching algorithm')], []]
sentences: [u'Matching of semantic service descriptions is the key to automatic service discovery and binding .', u'Existing approaches split the matchmaking process in two step : signature and specification matching .', u'However , this leads to the problem that offers are not found although they are functionally suitable if their signature is not fitting the requested one .', u'Therefore , in this paper , we propose a matching algorithm that does not use a separated and explicit signature matching step , but derives the necessary messages from the comparison of pre- and postconditions .', u'As a result , the algorithm not only finds all functionally suitable services even if their signatures do not match , but also is able to derive the messages needed for an automatic invocation .']

sentences: [u'In a complex business network finding a supplier can be a very time consuming task .', u'In advanced supply networks like Build-to-Order supply chains , this task should be carried out under time constraints and under uncertainties both in suppliers and in the orders .', u'The technology of semantic service oriented architectures is aimed to support such kind of tasks , enabling construction of self-organizing flexible supply networks .', u'A novel approach to dynamic network members discovery and selection based on competence profiles included in provided service descriptions is proposed .', u'The approach is grounded in a method for service discovery with incomplete information using query expansion techniques .', u'The approach is illustrated by example from automotive industry .']

entities: [[(u'Cache miss stalls', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'memory and processor speeds', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'server benchmark SPEC JBB2000', u'Method'), (u'memory requests', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Itanium 2 processor', u'Method')], [(u'Traversing linked data structures', u'Task')], [(u'linked data structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'serial data dependencies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'linked data structure', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'prefetching linked data structures', u'Task'), (u'hardware performance monitor', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'type-level metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'type-safe programs', u'Method'), (u'JIT compiler analysis', u'Method')], [(u'garbage collector', u'Method'), (u"HPM 's data cache miss information", u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'cache miss intensive traversal paths', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'linked data structures', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'JIT compiler analysis', u'Method'), (u'prefetch instructions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'deltas', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'MS Delta', u'Method'), (u'StarJIT dynamic compiler', u'Method'), (u'ORP Java virtual machine', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'stall cycles', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'high-latency cache misses', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'MS Delta', u'Method'), (u'cache miss intensive SPEC JBB2000 benchmark', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'technique', u'USED-FOR', u'prefetching linked data structures'), (u'type-level metadata', u'CONJUNCTION', u'JIT compiler analysis'), (u'type-safe programs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'type-level metadata'), (u'type-safe programs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'JIT compiler analysis')], [(u"HPM 's data cache miss information", u'USED-FOR', u'garbage collector')], [(u'JIT compiler analysis', u'USED-FOR', u'prefetch addresses.We'), (u'deltas', u'USED-FOR', u'JIT compiler analysis'), (u'StarJIT dynamic compiler', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ORP Java virtual machine')], []]
sentences: [u'Cache miss stalls hurt performance because of the large gap between memory and processor speeds - for example , the popular server benchmark SPEC JBB2000 spends 45 % of its cycles stalled waiting for memory requests on the Itanium 2 processor .', u'Traversing linked data structures causes a large portion of these stalls .', u'Prefetching for linked data structures remains a major challenge because serial data dependencies between elements in a linked data structure preclude the timely materialization of prefetch addresses .', u"This paper presents Mississippi Delta ( MS Delta ) , a novel technique for prefetching linked data structures that closely integrates the hardware performance monitor ( HPM ) , the garbage collector 's global view of heap and object layout , the type-level metadata inherent in type-safe programs , and JIT compiler analysis .", u"The garbage collector uses the HPM 's data cache miss information to identify cache miss intensive traversal paths through linked data structures , and then discovers regular distances ( deltas ) between these linked objects .", u'JIT compiler analysis injects prefetch instructions using deltas to materialize prefetch addresses.We have implemented MS Delta in a fully dynamic profile-guided optimization system : the StarJIT dynamic compiler [ 1 ] and the ORP Java virtual machine [ 9 ] .', u'We demonstrate a 28-29 % reduction in stall cycles attributable to the high-latency cache misses targeted by MS Delta and a speedup of 11-14 % on the cache miss intensive SPEC JBB2000 benchmark .']

entities: [[(u'geographic scope of documents', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'geographic information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'GIR )', u'Task')], [(u'gazetteers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reference data', u'Material')], [], [(u'linked data sources', u'Material'), (u'gazetteer data', u'Material')], [], [(u'Linked data sources', u'Material'), (u'gazetteer', u'Method'), (u'geographic and semantic relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'geographic and non-geographic terms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'GIR problems', u'Task'), (u'disambiguation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'filtering', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'GeoNames', u'Material'), (u'DBPedia', u'Material'), (u'integrated and semantically-enriched gazetteer', u'Task')], [(u'Wikipedia URLs', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data predicates', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'gazetteer', u'Generic')], [(u'GeoNames', u'Material'), (u'DBPedia', u'Material'), (u'gazetteer data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data sources', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'geographic scope of documents', u'USED-FOR', u'geographic information retrieval')], [], [], [(u'linked data sources', u'USED-FOR', u'gazetteer data')], [], [(u'disambiguation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'GIR problems'), (u'disambiguation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'filtering'), (u'filtering', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'GIR problems')], [(u'GeoNames', u'CONJUNCTION', u'DBPedia')], [], [], [(u'GeoNames', u'CONJUNCTION', u'DBPedia'), (u'Linked Data sources', u'USED-FOR', u'gazetteer data')]]
sentences: [u'The determination of the geographic scope of documents is important for many applications in geographic information retrieval ( GIR ) .', u'Many techniques require the use of gazetteers as a source of reference data .', u'However , creating and maintaining gazetteers is still a complex and demanding task .', u'We propose using linked data sources to put together gazetteer data that can be both broad ( e.g .', u'planetary ) and deep ( e.g. , down to urban detail ) .', u'Linked data sources also allow enriching the resulting gazetteer with a set of geographic and semantic relationships involving place names and other geographic and non-geographic terms , thus expanding the possibilities for solving typical GIR problems such as disambiguation and filtering .', u'This work shows the results of efforts to combine two linked data sources of gazetteer data , namely GeoNames and DBPedia , to populate an integrated and semantically-enriched gazetteer .', u'We used evidence contained in attributes , such as Wikipedia URLs , Linked Data predicates that indicate that places in both sources are the same , and some additional criteria .', u'The resulting gazetteer contains 8,729,833 places , of which 426 ; 317 are found in both data sources .', u'This relatively small overlap is analyzed , indicating that GeoNames and DBPedia are complementary , covering typically different classes of places , thus leading to the idea that further expansion can be achieved by integrating gazetteer data from additional Linked Data sources .']

sentences: [u'In the current web , developers are able to create new applications by composing already existing services from third-party vendors .', u'However , the vast amount of choices , technologies and repositories can make it a tedious task .', u'This paper describes a semantic metadirectory of services that helps in the process of discovering services .', u'We propose a semantic service discovery process and description of existing service repositories , such as Programmable Web and Yahoo Pipes , which are two service repositories which provide plenty of services that can be reused by developers to build new web applications .', u'The challenges behind integrating these repositories involved the problems of defining a common model , identifying relevant data and integrating and ranking the extracted data .']

entities: [[(u'open service-oriented systems', u'Method'), (u'service discovery mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'overlong responding time', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic service discovery mechanism', u'Method'), (u'ontology community', u'Method'), (u'SSD_OC', u'Method'), (u'multi-ontology coexistence', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'semantic matching', u'Method'), (u'F-Measure of service discovery', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic service discovery mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'multi-ontology coexistence'), (u'SSD_OC', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic service discovery mechanism'), (u'bridge axioms', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic service discovery mechanism'), (u'semantic matching', u'USED-FOR', u'F-Measure of service discovery')]]
sentences: [u'In open service-oriented systems , available service discovery mechanisms face some challenges , such as overlong responding time , unfavorable scalability of system , not supporting multiple coexistent ontologies and so on.Aiming to solve these problems , a semantic service discovery mechanism based on ontology community , called SSD_OC , is proposed in this paper.SSD_OC organizes services based on used ontology to supports multi-ontology coexistence and enables users to match service across ontologies by applying bridge axioms and translation between different ontologies.The results of the experiments show that the novel architecture is scalable , and the performance is improved while the system is on a large scale.In addition , semantic matching across ontology community improves the F-Measure of service discovery .']

sentences: [u'Growing attention has been paid to semantic service discovery using ontology-based service description for locating desired services .', u'The service description can be enriched by linking it to a more refined ontology-based specification which represents particular characteristics of the service , including rating .', u'This paper proposes an ontology-based rating model for service quality .', u'Services are rated for quality by a third-party organisation that assigns scores in terms of ontological values .', u'The services will be retrieved by a matching algorithm that follows a flexible match approach and they will be ranked based on service consumers ?', u'preference criteria .', u'Using ratings , service discovery can enable service consumers to accurately locate , with confidence , quality services that meet their requirements .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic service discovery'), (u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'service matching'), (u'semantic service discovery', u'CONJUNCTION', u'service matching')], [(u'semantic approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'Web service composition process')], [], [(u'semantic domain model', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic relations')]]
sentences: [u'In service composition , service discovery and combining suitable services through determination of interoperability among different services are important operations .', u'Utilizing semantics improves the quality and facilitates automation of these operations .', u'There are several previous approaches for semantic service discovery and service matching .', u'In this work , we exploit and extend these semantic approaches in order to make Web service composition process more facilitated , less error prone and more automated .', u'This work includes a service discovery and service interoperability checking technique which extends the previous semantic matching approaches .', u'In addition to this , as a guidance system for the user , a new semantic domain model is proposed that captures semantic relations between concepts in various ontologies .']

entities: [[], [], [(u'mutualistic relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'organizational components', u'Method')], [(u'mathematical model', u'Method'), (u'semantic service description', u'Task')], [(u'fractal social organizations', u'Task')], [(u'fractal organizations', u'Method'), (u'non-fractal organizations', u'Method'), (u'dynamic environments', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'In this paper we consider two social organizations - service-oriented communities and fractal organizations- and discuss how their main characteristics provide an answer to several shortcomings of traditional organizations .', u'In particular , we highlight their ability to tap into the vast basins of social energy of our societies .', u'This is done through the establishing of mutualistic relationships among the organizational components .', u'The paper also introduces a mathematical model of said mutualistic processes as well as its translation in terms of semantic service description and matching .', u'Preliminary investigations of the resilience of fractal social organizations are reported .', u'Simulations show that fractal organizations outperform non-fractal organizations and are able to quickly recover from disruptions and changes characterizing dynamic environments .']

sentences: [u'Die aktuellen Metadatenprinzipien und -standards tendieren dazu , das Dokument und weniger die Daten in den Mittelpunkt zu stellen , d. h. sie fuhren zu menschenlesbaren anstelle von maschinell zu verarbeitenden Metadaten .', u'Damit Bibliotheken gemeinsam nutzbare , miteinander mischbare und weiterverwendbare Metadaten erstellen und nutzbar machen konnen , kann durch die Anpassung der derzeitigen Bibliotheksmodelle wie die Resource Description and Access ( RDA ) und die Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records ( FRBR ) an Modelle , die auf den Linked-Data-Prinzipien basieren , ein konzeptioneller Wechsel erreicht werden .', u'In Bezug auf technische Formate konnen Bibliotheken zu Linked-Data-Formaten wechseln , ohne die aktuellen BibliotheksmetadatenAblaufe zu unterbrechen .', u'Dieser Vortrag liefert sechs wichtige Empfehlungen fur Bibliotheken und Standardisierungsagenturen .', u'Dazu gehort , sich der Herausforderung zu stellen und die Moglichkeiten anzunehmen , welche die aktuellen technologischen Trends bieten , die Minimalanforderungen der Linked-Data-Prinzipien anzunehmen , Ontologien zu entwickeln , daruber zu entscheiden , was aus den gegenwartigen Bibliotheksmodellen beibehalten werden muss , Teil der Linked-Data-Cloud zu werden und gemischte Metadatenansatze ( standardbasiert und von der Community erstellt ) zu entwickeln .', u'Schlieslich endet das Papier mit der Identifizierung und Diskussion von funf wesentlichen Vorteilen einer solchen NeuKonzeption der Metadaten .', u'Zu den Vorteilen gehoren die Offenheit und der Austausch der Metadaten , Serendipity-Effekte bei der Recherche nach Informationsressourcen , die Identifikation von dem Zeitgeist entsprechenden und neu entstehenden Metadaten , facettenbasierte Navigation und mit Links angereicherte Metadaten .', u'Schlagworter : Metadaten , Metadatenstandards , MARC , Linked Data , RDF , communityerzeugte Metadaten , gemischte Metadaten-Ansatze']

relations: [[(u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'natural text')], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'patterns')], [], [(u'DB- pedia', u'USED-FOR', u'Linked Data source')], [(u'Open Information Extraction', u'USED-FOR', u'framework'), (u'Open Information Extraction ( OpenIE )', u'USED-FOR', u'framework')], [], [(u'VerbNet', u'USED-FOR', u'framework'), (u'VerbNet', u'CONJUNCTION', u'WordNet'), (u'WordNet', u'USED-FOR', u'framework')], [(u'DBpedia ontology class hierarchy', u'USED-FOR', u'patterns')], [(u'index embed- ded database', u'USED-FOR', u'pattern collection')], [(u'syntactic accuracy', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'framework'), (u'validity', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'framework')], [(u'accuracy', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'framework'), (u'MRR value', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'framework')]]
sentences: [u'This paper aims at exploiting Linked Data for generating natural text , often referred to as lexicalization .', u'We propose a framework that can generate patterns which can be used to lexicalize Linked Data triples .', u'Linked Data is structured knowledge organized in the form of triples consisting of a subject , a predicate and an object .', u'We use DB- pedia as the Linked Data source which is not only free but is currently the fastest growing data source organized as Linked Data .', u'The proposed framework utilizes the Open Information Extraction ( OpenIE ) to extract relations from natural text and these relations are then aligned with triples to identify lexicalization patterns .', u'We also exploit lexical seman- tic resources which encode knowledge on lexical , semantic and syntactic information about entities .', u'Our framework uses VerbNet and WordNet as semantic resources .', u'The extracted patterns are ranked and categorized based on the DBpedia ontology class hierarchy .', u'The pattern collection is then sorted based on the score assigned and stored in an index embed- ded database for use in the framework as well as for future lexical re- source .', u'The framework was evaluated for syntactic accuracy and validity by measuring the Mean Reciprocal Rank ( MRR ) of the first correct pat- tern .', u'The results indicated that framework can achieve 70.36 % accuracy and a MRR value of 0.72 for five DBpedia ontology classes generating 101 accurate lexicalization patterns .']

entities: [[(u'Cloud4all Service Synthesizer Tool', u'Method'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'orchestration of accessibility services', u'Task'), (u'functional limitations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic service composition', u'Method')], [(u'service composition approach', u'Method'), (u'semantic matching', u'Method'), (u'user needs/preferences', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'automatic composition of accessibility services', u'Task'), (u'assistive solutions', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'semantic matching', u'USED-FOR', u'service composition approach')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper presents the Cloud4all Service Synthesizer Tool , a framework that enables efficient orchestration of accessibility services , as well as their combination into complex forms , providing more advanced functionalities towards increasing the accessibility of end-users with various types of functional limitations .', u'The supported services are described formally within an ontology , enabling , thus , semantic service composition .', u'The proposed service composition approach is based on semantic matching between services specifications on the one hand and user needs/preferences and current context of use on the other hand .', u"The use of automatic composition of accessibility services can significantly enhance end-users ' accessibility , especially in cases where assistive solutions are not available in their device ."]

sentences: [u'The current service discovery mechanisms are syntactic methods that often offer poor quality results .', u'By researching this area we are able to identify issues that limit the quality of the result with these traditional service mechanisms .', u'To overcome this issue we use ontologies to enable semantic matchmaking .', u'By reasoning on concepts and relations , our approach can derive matches that syntactically would not match .', u'Additionaly , by introducing contextual information in the service discovery process , the quality of the service discovery result may improve .', u'In this paper , we present an overview of the architecture for the discovery of context aware services by using ontologies , we also present our context aware semantic service by extending OWL-S with context properties .']

sentences: [u'Nowadays , most grid service discovery use keyword matching and never describe the matching degree .', u"Meantime , a user 's request can not be satisfied by any available service , whereas a composite service obtained by combining available services can be used .", u'When each grid service matches a request best , the service composition may not the best process .', u'In order to solve the two problems , this paper presents a quantification standard for semantic service matching and modifies the classical flexible matching algorithm based on OWL-S. Based upon the quantification standard of service matching and OWL-WS , the service composition algorithm finds the process that best satisfies customer need by constructing a mathematical model and converting the problem to the shortest path problem .']

sentences: [u'Associating a semantic service description ( SSD ) with a service , wherein the SSD comprises a semantic description of the service , including a semantic description of a parameter of the service , according to a computer interpretable language , and , as a service grounding , a mapping between the computer interpretable language expressing the SSD and an interface , including an interface parameter , of the service .', u'A dynamic composition of a task based upon a user selection of a plurality of known services is supported and a dynamic association of the task with a user interface of an application is supported , based upon associating the task with the user selection of a UI object , a UI display screen , and a UI event for the application .']

sentences: [u'Purpose A report on the Charleston Conference , November 2009.Design/methodology/approach Summarizes the presentations , reports , plenary sessions and panels.Findings Both collection development and acquisitions are changing rapidly as a result of the libraries trying to meet the needs of their users .', u'Libraries now own less material and subscribe to many more .', u'Eresources provide both problems and solutions forcing a new level of cooperation between librarians and vendors .', u'Ways to describe materials such as the semantic web are being discussed .', u'The Google settlement also has many implications for libraries.Practical implications Libraries must keep current as to changes in the materials available , especially eresources and be prepared to negotiate with their vendors in order to agree on prices and conditions of licensing .', u'The proliferation of eresources by subscription is changing the way libraries acquire and provide materials.Originality/value This paper provides as uptodate review of a conf ...']

sentences: [u'The semantic share of geo-spatial information is the important content of the research of Geographical Information System .', u'The semantic reference systems will enable producers and users of geographical information to explain the meaning of thematic data and to integrate data across differing semantics .', u'The authors discuss the connotation and layers of geo-spatial information share , make use of research thought of Semantic Web and present the research framework of geo-spatial information share .', u'In order to solve the ambiguous meaning of geo-spatial information research and application , the ontology concept and method are adopted and domain knowledge are defined formally .', u'Furthermore , the authors discuss how to support the semantic information share and inter-operation among kinds of users , present to query information and semantic mapping on the basis of agents to solve the different comprehend among geographical information communities and achieve the common meaning and realization of information .']

entities: [[(u'service-oriented software development', u'Task'), (u'personalized requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'meta-model framework', u'Method'), (u'personalized requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain-related services', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain models', u'Method'), (u'personalized requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'domain models', u'Method')], [(u'rule reasoning approach', u'Method'), (u'domain goal models', u'Method')], [(u'SWRL rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'framework', u'Generic')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'meta-model framework', u'USED-FOR', u'personalized requirements'), (u'meta-model framework', u'USED-FOR', u'domain-related services'), (u'meta-model framework', u'USED-FOR', u'domain models')], [(u'personalized requirements', u'CONJUNCTION', u'domain restrictions')], [(u'rule reasoning approach', u'USED-FOR', u'domain goal models')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'In service-oriented software development , configuring and composing software services for users according to their personalized requirements become increasingly important .', u'In our previous work , we have proposed a meta-model framework to describe personalized requirements involving domain-related services , based on which we can create domain models to be reused in dealing with personalized requirements .', u"Faced with users ' specified requirements , how to select and customize domain models to satisfy both their personalized requirements and domain restrictions remains an important issue .", u'Towards this end , in this paper , we adopt a rule reasoning approach to customize domain goal models using the Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) .', u"Two kinds of SWRL rules are defined for recommending and verifying users ' selected goals .", u"These selected goals can be used to find corresponding processes or services to satisfy users ' requirements within our framework .", u'Experiments and implemented prototype show the feasibility of the proposed approach .']

entities: [[(u'fuzzy extensions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web ( SW ) applications', u'Task')], [(u'tasks', u'Generic'), (u'SW', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'trust', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'matching', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'merging', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ranking', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Fuzzy DLs', u'Method'), (u'vague concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u"`` Tall '' person", u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u"`` MiddleAged '' person", u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'fuzzy extension', u'Method')], [(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reasoning algorithm', u'Method'), (u'inference tasks', u'Task')], [(u'fuzzy reasoning system FiRE', u'Method'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'case scenarios', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DLs', u'Method'), (u'FiRE', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'fuzzy extensions', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology languages'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'fuzzy extensions'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology languages')], [(u'trust', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'tasks'), (u'trust', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'SW'), (u'trust', u'CONJUNCTION', u'matching'), (u'matching', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'tasks'), (u'matching', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'SW'), (u'matching', u'CONJUNCTION', u'merging'), (u'merging', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'SW')], [(u'Fuzzy DLs', u'USED-FOR', u'vague concepts'), (u"`` Tall '' person", u'HYPONYM-OF', u'vague concepts'), (u"`` Tall '' person", u'CONJUNCTION', u"`` MiddleAged '' person"), (u"`` MiddleAged '' person", u'HYPONYM-OF', u'vague concepts')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The last couple of years it is widely acknowledged that uncertainty and fuzzy extensions to ontology languages , like Description Logics ( DLs ) and OWL , could play a significant role in the improvement of many Semantic Web ( SW ) applications .', u'Many of the tasks of SW like trust , matching , merging , ranking usually involve confidence or truth degrees that one requires to represent and reason about .', u"Fuzzy DLs are able to represent vague concepts such as a `` Tall '' person , a `` Hot '' place , a `` MiddleAged '' person , a `` near '' destination and many more .", u'In the current paper we present a fuzzy extension to the DL $ \\mathcal { SHIN } $ .', u'First , we present the semantics while latter a detailed reasoning algorithm that decides most of the key inference tasks of fuzzy- $ \\mathcal { SHIN } $ .', u'Finally , we briefly present the fuzzy reasoning system FiRE , which implements the proposed algorithm and two use case scenarios where we have applied fuzzy DLs through FiRE .']

sentences: [u'We present an implementation of a plan adaptation system , BioPlanner , built for biological pathway prediction across species .', u'BioPlanner formulates a pathway discovery problem as a Hierarchical Task Network ( HTN ) planning problem and solves it by adapting a plan solution of another well-studied pathway .', u'BioPlanner provides the following functionalities : It automatically builds HTN planning models for a biological pathway domain from the semantic web biological knowledge bases ( KBs ) .', u'It retrieves plan cases from the biological KBs .', u'It generates hypothetical pathways using plan adaptation strategies with the aid of biological domain knowledge .', u'It evaluates the hypothetical plan candidates , ranks them , and recommends the most likely hypotheses to users .', u'It employs an information gathering multi-agent system to capture knowledge from heterogeneous sources to help the hypothetical plan generation process .', u'We utilize BioPlanner to predict Signaling Transduction pathways for Mus musculus , Gallus gallus , a ndDrosophila melanogaster from Homo sapiens .']

entities: [[(u'Rapidgrowth andspread ofinformation technology', u'Method'), (u'network technology', u'Method')], [(u'P2P andweb services haverevolutionized theway', u'Method'), (u'andcollaborate andalsomakeitpossible tointegrate desktop data', u'Material')], [(u'theintersection fulfillment ofthese technologies', u'Method'), (u'enterprise desktop', u'Task'), (u'autonomous personal data', u'Material')], [(u'Inthis context', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SDDG', u'Method'), (u'semantic information interoperability environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'scientific positions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'generaland approaches', u'Method'), (u'information integration research', u'Task'), (u'three-tier hybrid framework', u'Method')], [(u'Thearchitecture forSDDG isan extension', u'Method')]]
