sentences: [u"Rapidgrowth andspread ofinformation technology especially network technology enables people to use computersmore naturally andeasily andas a result , more design dataandinformation leave indesigners ' desktops .", u'Recent advances ingrid , semantic web , P2P andweb services haverevolutionized theway we communicate andcollaborate andalsomakeitpossible tointegrate desktop data .', u'Undertaking theintersection fulfillment ofthese technologies on enterprise desktop enables new integrative andcollaborative useofnotonly organizational databutalsodistributed , autonomous personal data on thewebbyfully leveraging potentially useful information sources on many desktops .', u'Inthis context , we introduce SDDG ( Semantic Desktop Data Grid ) a P2P-semantic-grid enabled information sharing infrastructure forentire enterprise information , which wraps bothorganizational andpersonal information sources assemantic grid services andcreates a semantic information interoperability environment following a P2P datacoordination way .', u'Througha discussion of fundamental scientific positions in generaland approaches to information integration research in particular , a three-tier hybrid framework ispresented anddiscussed indetail .', u'Thearchitecture forSDDG isan extension ofour previous workESD [ 1 ] byreflecting principles ofP2Pdataintegration insemantic grid .']

entities: [[(u'Time-efficient link discovery', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'rapid Link Discovery approaches', u'Method'), (u'link specifications', u'Task')], [(u'linear models', u'Method')], [], [(u'non-linear runtime estimation functions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'runtime estimation', u'Task')], [(u'exponential and mixed models', u'Method'), (u'estimation of the runtimes of planners', u'Task')], [(u'models', u'Generic'), (u'link specifications', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'exponential and mixed models', u'Method')], [(u'runtime approximation models', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'rapid Link Discovery approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'link specifications')], [(u'linear models', u'USED-FOR', u'runtime the fastest planners')], [], [(u'non-linear runtime estimation functions', u'USED-FOR', u'runtime estimation')], [(u'exponential and mixed models', u'USED-FOR', u'estimation of the runtimes of planners')], [(u'models', u'USED-FOR', u'runtime'), (u'link specifications', u'USED-FOR', u'models')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Time-efficient link discovery is of central importance to implement the vision of the Semantic Web .', u'Some of the most rapid Link Discovery approaches rely internally on planning to execute link specifications .', u'In newer works , linear models have been used to estimate the runtime the fastest planners .', u'However , no other category of models has been studied for this purpose so far .', u'In this paper , we study non-linear runtime estimation functions for runtime estimation .', u'In particular , we study exponential and mixed models for the estimation of the runtimes of planners .', u'To this end , we evaluate three different models for runtime on six datasets using 400 link specifications .', u'We show that exponential and mixed models achieve better fits when trained but are only to be preferred in some cases .', u'Our evaluation also shows that the use of better runtime approximation models has a positive impact on the overall execution of link specifications .']

entities: [[(u'mobile commerce applications', u'Task'), (u'enterprise applications', u'Task'), (u'mobile functionality', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'real-time business data', u'Material')], [(u'business data', u'Material'), (u'mobile commerce applications', u'Task')], [(u'semantic Web based enterprise information integration platform', u'Method'), (u'mobile commerce', u'Material'), (u'systematic reference approach', u'Method'), (u'heterogeneous information resources', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mobile commerce applications', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'For companies to establish their mobile commerce applications , the fundamental challenge is how to extend existing enterprise applications with mobile functionality in order to provide remote staff with real-time business data while at the same time avoiding alteration of existing system codes .', u'Due to increased diversity of business data and mobile devices , many of current mobile commerce applications are customized applications and serve a specific industry need .', u'In this paper , as a solution to tackle the challenge , we propose an semantic Web based enterprise information integration platform for mobile commerce , which is designed to give developers a systematic reference approach to provide a generic and neutral mechanism to describe and access heterogeneous information resources from existing business applications , support reasoning and auto-discovery of information based on rules , and hide details of underlying wireless networks and mobile devices access from mobile commerce applications .']

entities: [[(u'Web 2.0 applications', u'Task'), (u'social networks', u'Method')], [(u'learning environments', u'Method'), (u'e-learning environments', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'informal unstructured learning contexts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'learning contexts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'social spheres', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic web approach', u'Method'), (u'software platform', u'Method'), (u'learner profiles', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'FOAF ontology', u'Method'), (u'personal relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'IMS Learning Portfolio', u'Method')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'Web 2.0 learning environment', u'Task'), (u'informal learning activi- ties', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'social networks', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'social networks', u'USED-FOR', u'informal learning opportunities')], [], [(u'learning contexts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'social spheres')], [(u'semantic web approach', u'USED-FOR', u'learner profiles'), (u'software platform', u'USED-FOR', u'learner profiles')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Web 2.0 applications and the increasingly use of social networks have been creating new informal learning opportunities .', u'Students interact and collaborate using new learning environments which are structurally different from traditional e-learning environments .', u'In these informal unstructured learning contexts the bound- aries between the learning contexts and social spheres disappear , and the definition of the students competences appears more and more important .', u'In this paper we pro- pose a semantic web approach in order to create the basis for a software platform to model learner profiles .', u"In particular we propose to extend the FOAF ontology , used to describe people and their personal relationships , with an ontology related to the IMS Learning Portfolio used to model students ' competencies .", u"This ontology could be a fundamental layer for a new Web 2.0 learning environment in which students ' informal learning activi- ties carried out in social networks can be managed and evaluated ."]

entities: [[(u'RDF data', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Web community', u'Method'), (u'node', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'scalable RDF data management system', u'Method'), (u'multi-node RDF data management systems', u'Method')], [(u'techniques', u'Generic'), (u'single node RDF-store technology', u'Method'), (u'query processing', u'Task'), (u'locality optimizations', u'Method'), (u'decomposing SPARQL queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'cluster', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'scalable RDF data management system', u'COMPARE', u'multi-node RDF data management systems')], []]
sentences: [u'The generation of RDF data has accelerated to the point where many data sets need to be partitioned across multiple machines in order to achieve reasonable performance when querying the data .', u'Although tremendous progress has been made in the Semantic Web community for achieving high performance data management on a single node , current solutions that allow the data to be partitioned across multiple machines are highly inecient .', u'In this paper , we introduce a scalable RDF data management system that is up to three orders of magnitude more ecient than popular multi-node RDF data management systems .', u'In so doing , we introduce techniques for ( 1 ) leveraging state-of-the-art single node RDF-store technology ( 2 ) partitioning the data across nodes in a manner that helps accelerate query processing through locality optimizations and ( 3 ) decomposing SPARQL queries into high performance fragments that take advantage of how data is partitioned in a cluster .']

sentences: [u'In most developed countries , life expectancy has been increasing steadily and burden of chronic disease continues to grow .', u'The chronic diseases are responsible for increasingly growing health spending .', u'Telemonitoring systems provide a way to monitor patients and their needs within the comfort of their own homes .', u'In the first systems , the data were sent directly to the medical experts to be interpreted .', u'With technological advancements , software and applications have been developed to process the data .', u'In this paper , we will focus on e-Care platform that combines the semantic web and artificial intelligence , for telemonitoring .', u'e-Care is based on generic ontologies to accommodate different conditions and types of sensors and data .', u'A decision support is bases on an inference engine , this engine is used for following up the health of the patient and the detection of abnormal situations and react accordingly , by providing recommendations and informing his physician with alerts .']

relations: [[], [(u'large-scale distributed environment', u'USED-FOR', u'smart devices'), (u'smart devices', u'CONJUNCTION', u'web services'), (u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'agent technologies'), (u'agent technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'serviceoriented architecture')], [(u'prototype platform', u'USED-FOR', u'self-maintained smart resources')], [], [], [(u'interoperability', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'issues'), (u'interoperability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'coordination'), (u'interoperability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'self-manageability'), (u'coordination', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'issues'), (u'coordination', u'CONJUNCTION', u'self-manageability'), (u'coordination', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reputation'), (u'self-manageability', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'issues'), (u'self-manageability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reputation'), (u'reputation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'issues')]]
sentences: [u'The paper summarizes research findings related to SmartResource project ( 2004-2007 ) funded by Tekes and industrial companies .', u'The main objectives was research and development of the large-scale distributed environment for integration of smart devices , web services and humans based on combination of Semantic Web , agent technologies and serviceoriented architecture .', u'A prototype platform for self-maintained smart resources in smart spaces has been designed and implemented for particular tasks of industrial partners .', u'In this paper we will present the summary of research results obtained during the project period and related industrial case study .', u'Several lessons have been learned during the project in addition to published results , which we are going to share with scientific community .', u'We also present a vision how to utilize project results to design various complex smart spaces taking into account such issues as interoperability , coordination , self-manageability , reputation and trust in future generation smart space environments .']

sentences: [u'The internet is the most popular way to retrieve information today .', u'However , many users are overwhelmed by the vast amount of data on the internet , which limits its potential significantly .', u'To maximize the potential , extracting semantics from the raw data is one of the key technologies .', u'The challenge on the extraction is that the data on the internet is often dispersed where a single property of a subject might have a list of values .', u'To address the challenge , this paper proposes a novel framework that can extract useful semantics out of a semantic context in the dispersed data .', u'Since the semantic information is vague in its nature , our framework deploys the fuzzy inference method to effectively extract the useful semantic .', u'Experimental results show that the proposed framework is effective in realizing semantic web with abundant semantic information , which allows web users to entertain full potential of the internet .']

entities: [[(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'social network analysis', u'Method'), (u'collaborative edit log data', u'Material')], [(u'FAO ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'edit log files', u'Material'), (u'graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'social network analysis', u'Method')], [(u'plugin', u'Method'), (u'GUI', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'collaborative edit log data', u'USED-FOR', u'approach'), (u'collaborative edit log data', u'USED-FOR', u'social network analysis')], [], [], [], [], [(u'plugin', u'USED-FOR', u'GUI')]]
sentences: [u'This paper presents an approach applying social network analysis on collaborative edit log data .', u'Semantic Web Wiki and FAO ontologies are given as case studies .', u'A number of users that are editing the same ontology or the same pages can be viewed as a social network of people interacting via the ontology .', u'We propose to represent the edit log files as a graph either of users that are connected if they are editing the same ontology concepts or of concepts that are connected if edited by the same users .', u'We apply social network analysis on such graphs in order to provide some insights into activity of the wiki/ontology editors .', u'Finally , a plugin was developed which provides a comfortable GUI to some of the used analysis techniques , so that the people interested in monitoring the editing activity can perform that analysis and visualization on their own .']

entities: [[(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'annotated Semantic Web data', u'Material'), (u'task', u'Generic'), (u'inconsistent and non-reliable meta-data', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web', u'Material')], [(u'annotated language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'deductive system', u'Method'), (u'query answering problem', u'Task')], [(u'unified reasoning formalism', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'provenance annotations', u'Method')], [(u'annotation domains', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'temporally-annotated fuzzy RDF', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'query language AnQL', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'subqueries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'aggregates', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'assignment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'solution modifiers', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'We describe a generic framework for representing and reasoning with annotated Semantic Web data , a task becoming # R # # N # more important with the recent increased amount of inconsistent and non-reliable meta-data on the web .', u'We formalise # R # # N # the annotated language , the corresponding deductive system and address the query answering problem .', u'Previous # R # # N # contributions on specific RDF annotation domains are encompassed by our unified reasoning formalism as we show # R # # N # by instantiating it on ( i ) temporal , ( ii ) fuzzy , and ( iii ) provenance annotations .', u'Moreover , we provide a generic method # R # # N # for combining multiple annotation domains allowing to represent , e.g. , temporally-annotated fuzzy RDF .', u'Furthermore , # R # # N # we address the development of a query language AnQL that is inspired by SPARQL , including several features # R # # N # of SPARQL 1.1 ( subqueries , aggregates , assignment , solution modifiers ) along with the formal definitions of their # R # # N # semantics .']

sentences: [u"Purpose of this paper is to propose approach and technical infrastructure for improvement of inter-organizational networks ' response in product information acquisition and management .", u'Different approaches ( industrial categorization schemes , functional decomposition and semantic web ) for management of product information are analyzed in context of inter-organizational networks .', u'Process for semantic alignment of product information is defined , resulting with generalized , two-dimensional model , consisting of design and functional perspective .', u'The process is expected to decrease human intervention in product data exchange in networked environments , as well as to create added value , through possible recognition of design intent , automated referencing to related manufacturing competences and reuse potential .', u'Current prototype of system comprises of product ontologies and interfaces for topological model submission and refinement by using lexical term and predicate matching and property transfer .', u'Impact of using formalized functional perspective is only theoretically justified and it still needs to be verified .']

sentences: [u'Doctor usually uses his experience from the clinical practice to confirm a diagnosis and to prescribe an appropriate treatment for a specific patient .', u"The computerized medical reasoning should not only focus on existing medical knowledge but also on physician 's previous experiences and new knowledge .", u'Such knowledge and experience are vague and define uncertain relationships between facts and diagnosis .', u'Case Based Fuzzy Cognitive Maps ( CBFCM ) are proposed as an evolution of Fuzzy Cognitive Maps ( FCM ) that allow more complete representation of knowledge since case-based fuzzy rules are introduced to improve FCM decision support systems .', u'Semantic web is used to implement both FCM approaches .', u'A database of 71 patients with urinary tract infections was used to perform the proposed approach .', u'A comparative study between FCM ( 92 % ) and CBFCM ( 99 % ) was conducted and the results derived by CBFCM approach showed CBFCM to be superior to FCM .']

entities: [[(u'Formal Concept Analysis', u'Method'), (u'FCA )', u'Method'), (u'data technology', u'Method'), (u'collective intelligence', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'hidden meaning', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'disparate and distributed data', u'Material')], [(u'semantics', u'Generic'), (u'In-Close', u'Method')], [(u'tools', u'Generic'), (u'computational intelligence', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Boolean form', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Formal Context', u'Method'), (u'analysis', u'Task'), (u'focused and noise-free sub-Contexts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'prepared data', u'Material'), (u'visualisation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Concept Lattice', u'Method')], [(u'Formal Concepts', u'Method'), (u'FCA tools', u'Method'), (u'datas inherent semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'this', u'Generic'), (u'CUBIST', u'Method'), (u'in-data-warehouse visual analytics', u'Task'), (u'RDF-based triple stores', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'FCA )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Formal Concept Analysis'), (u'disparate and distributed data', u'USED-FOR', u'hidden meaning')], [], [(u'computational intelligence', u'USED-FOR', u'tools')], [(u'FCA tools', u'USED-FOR', u'datas inherent semantics')], [(u'this', u'USED-FOR', u'in-data-warehouse visual analytics'), (u'in-data-warehouse visual analytics', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF-based triple stores')]]
sentences: [u'Formal Concept Analysis ( FCA ) is an emerging data technology that complements collective intelligence such as that identified in the Semantic Web by visualising the hidden meaning in disparate and distributed data .', u'The paper demonstrates the discovery of these novel semantics through a set of FCA open source software tools FcaBedrock and In-Close that were developed by the authors .', u'These tools add computational intelligence by converting data into a Boolean form called a Formal Context , prepare this data for analysis by creating focused and noise-free sub-Contexts and then analyse the prepared data using a visualisation called a Concept Lattice .', u'The Formal Concepts thus visualised highlight how data itself contains meaning , and how FCA tools thereby extract datas inherent semantics .', u'The paper describes how this will be further developed in a project called CUBIST , to provide in-data-warehouse visual analytics for RDF-based triple stores .']

sentences: [u'Pundit 2.0 is a semantic web annotation system that supports users in creating structured data on top of web pages .', u'Annotations in Pundit are RDF triples that users build starting from web page elements , as text or images .', u'Annotations can be made public and developers can access and combine them into RDF knowledge graphs , while authorship of each triple is always retrievable .', u'In this demo we showcase Pundit 2.0 and demonstrate how it can be used to enhance a digital library , by providing a data crowdsourcing platform .', u'Pundit enables users to annotate different kind of entities and to contribute to the collaborative creation of a knowledge graph .', u"This , in turn , refines in real-time the exploration functionalities of the library 's faceted search , providing an immediate added value out of the annotation effort .", u'Ad-hoc configurations can be used to drive specific visualisations , like the timeline-map shown in this demo .']

sentences: [u'This research aims at promoting sharing of knowledge about functionality of artifacts among engineers , which tends to be implicit in practice .', u'In order to provide a conceptual viewpoint for modeling and a controlled vocabulary , we have developed an ontological framework of functional knowledge .', u'This framework has been successfully deployed in a manufacturing company .', u'This paper firstly discusses an ontological definition of the concept of function from a device-centered viewpoint .', u'Then , other types of function are discussed in order to place our definition in the related concepts in the literature .', u'Next , as an application of the ontologies , we propose a metadata schema based on the functional ontologies for functional annotation in the Semantic Web .', u'The functional metadata annotated to technical documents show designers intentions behind the documents and contribute to efficient retrieval of the documents .', u'Moreover , task-oriented transformation and interoperability with other schemata can be realized based on the ontologies .']

entities: [[(u'Web 2.0 technologies', u'Method'), (u'business activities', u'Task')], [(u'technologies', u'Generic'), (u'inter-persons collaboration', u'Task'), (u'information exchange', u'Task'), (u'knowledge sharing', u'Task'), (u'conversational modalities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'business communication', u'Method')], [(u'Enterprise 2.0', u'Method'), (u'social networks', u'Method')], [(u'Web 2.0 tools', u'Method'), (u'enterprise software', u'Method'), (u'external data', u'Material'), (u'knowledge representations', u'Method'), (u'Enterprise 2.0 context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web techniques', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'The term Enterprise 2.0 applies to the use of Web 2.0 technologies as a support for business activities within the organizations .', u'These technologies are exploited to foster inter-persons collaboration , information exchange and knowledge sharing , also outside the organization , to establish relationships based on conversational modalities rather than on traditional business communication .', u'The vision of Enterprise 2.0 places a high value on the importance of social networks inside and outside the organization stimulating flexibility , adaptability and innovation between workers , managers , customers , suppliers and consultants .', u'The integration between the Web 2.0 tools with traditional enterprise software , the aggregation of organization inner data with external data and the choice of adequate knowledge representations are critical aspects to be faced in order to further the growth of smart applications in the Enterprise 2.0 context .', u'In this work we propose an approach , based on Semantic Web techniques , to relax the aforementioned critical issues .']

relations: [[], [(u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Information Retrieval'), (u'Information Retrieval', u'CONJUNCTION', u'NLP')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The semantic relatedness between two concepts is a measure that quantifies the extent to which two concepts are semantically related .', u'Due to the growing interest of researchers in areas such as Semantic Web , Information Retrieval and NLP , various approaches have been proposed in the literature for automatically computing the semantic relatedness .', u'However , despite the growing number of proposed approaches , there are still significant criticalities in evaluating the results returned by different semantic relatedness methods .', u'The limitations of the state of the art evaluation mechanisms prevent an effective evaluation and several works in the literature emphasize that the exploited approaches are rather inconsistent .', u'In this paper we describe the limitations of the mechanisms used for evaluating the results of semantic relatedness methods .', u'By taking into account these limitations , we propose a new methodology and new resources for comparing in an effective way different semantic relatedness approaches .']

sentences: [u'Aufbau , Pflege und Nutzung groer Wissensdatenbanken erfordern den kombinierten Einsatz menschlicher und maschineller Informationsverarbeitung .', u'Da groe Teile des menschlichen Wissens in Textform vorliegen , bieten sich Methoden des Text Mining zur Extraktion von Wissensinhalten an .', u'Dieser Artikel behandelt Grundlagen des Text Mining im Kontext des Semantic Web .', u'Methoden des Text Mining werden besprochen , die fur die halbautomatische Annotierung von Texten und Textteilen eingesetzt werden , insbesondere Eigennamenerkennung ( Named-Entity Recognition ) , automatische Schlusselworterkennung ( Keyword Recognition ) , automatische Dokumentenklassifikation , teilautomatisches Erstellen von Ontologien und halbautomatische Faktenerkennung ( Fact Recognition , Event Recognition ) .', u'Es werden auch kritische Hintergrundfragen aufgegriffen .', u'Das Problem der zu hohen Fehlerrate und der zu geringen Performanz automatischer Verfahren wird diskutiert .', u'Zwei Beispiele aus der Praxis werden vorgestellt : Erstens das Forschungsprojekt OntoGene der Universitat Zurich , in dem Protein-Protein-Interaktionen als Relationstripel aus der Fachliteratur extrahiert werden , und zweitens ein ontologiebasierter Tag-Recommender , der die manuelle Vergabe von Schlusselwortern an Wissensressourcen unterstutzt .']

sentences: [u'Purpose The purpose of this paper is to introduce the advantages of semanticsaware representation formalisms in the integration of digital rights management ( DRM ) infrastructures grounded on heterogeneous formats.Design/methodology/approach After discussing the notion of semanticsaware IPR and its relationship with Semantic Webstyle metadata , we exemplify the advantages of adopting it by providing two different use cases .', u'XMLbased DRMLs are mapped with a shared ontologybased representation in such a way that dependencies between elements can be drawn.Findings Individual formalisms may take advantage of a semanticsaware infrastructure to check consistency of DRM policies according to dependencies not explicit in the specification language .', u'On the other hand , distinct formalisms can be integrated with each other according to finegrained translation mechanisms.Originality/value Inference procedures can preprocess this knowledge base and derive implicit knowledge that can be used by programmin ...']

relations: [[], [], [(u'freeform key/value `` tagging', u'USED-FOR', u'Entity descriptions'), (u'precise formalism', u'USED-FOR', u'Entity descriptions')], [], [(u'problem', u'USED-FOR', u'entity matching'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'problem'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'entity matching')], [(u'OAEI committee', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'FBEM')]]
sentences: [u'To investigate the problem of entity recognition , we deal with the creation of the so-called Entity Name System ( ENS ) which is an open , public back-bone infrastructure for the ( Semantic ) Web that enables the creation and systematic re-use of unique identifiers for entities .', u"The ENS can be seen as a very large , distributed `` phonebook for everything '' , and ENS identifiers might be considered as a `` phone number '' of entities .", u"Entity descriptions are based on freeform key/value `` tagging '' rather than on some precise formalism .", u'However , such a genericity has its shortcomings : the ENS can never know what type of entity it is dealing with .', u'We tackle this problem in a novel approach for entity matching that is called Feature Based Entity Matching ( FBEM ) .', u'In the current paper , we report an evaluation of FBEM on datasets provided by the OAEI committee for the instance matching contest .']

entities: [[(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'World Wide Web', u'Material')], [(u'Webs user interaction experience', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Webs original navigation paradigm', u'Method'), (u'URIs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'URLs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information objects', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'URIs', u'Method'), (u'superset of URLs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'webpage-like presentations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'UI element', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information object', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'UI elements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information objects', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Uniform support', u'Method'), (u'direct manipulation', u'Task'), (u'Webs navigation paradigm', u'Method'), (u'informationcentric environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'small cooperative tools', u'Method'), (u'information-centric paradigm', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'The Semantic Web project [ 2 ] aims to add semantics to the existing World Wide Web .', u'We propose an extension of the Webs user interaction experience to take advantage of the added semantics .', u'This user experience maintains the Webs original navigation paradigm , although all URIs , not just URLs , can be used to address information objects .', u'URIs form the superset of URLs and can name resources other than just those with retrievable contents .', u'Information is displayed in webpage-like presentations in which each UI element is associated with the information object that the element represents .', u'UI elements serve as proxies through which the user can manipulate information objects .', u'Uniform support for direct manipulation complements the Webs navigation paradigm to create an informationcentric environment for interacting with information .', u'In addition , we advocate the use of small cooperative tools over large standalone applications to further promote this information-centric paradigm .']

entities: [[(u'Negotiation', u'Task')], [], [(u'Ontology', u'Task'), (u'modeling technology', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'Task'), (u'negotiation ability of agents', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic expressions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'negotiation process', u'Task')], [(u'negotiation ontology researches', u'Method')], [(u'ontology notation system', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic')], []]

sentences: [u'Negotiation is defined as two or more agents making agreement on the common interests , which provides an efficient approach for companies to gain business intelligence from suppliers and customers .', u'Current negotiation research focuses on automatically stimulating negotiation behaviors among agents .', u'Ontology , as a modeling technology in semantic web , is regarded as an effective tool to improve the negotiation ability of agents , considering that ontology can provide richer semantic expressions for agents in negotiation process .', u'In this paper , we make a brief review on the current negotiation ontology researches .', u'In addition , by means of a unique ontology notation system , we unify the notations used in these ontologies , to maximally promote knowledge sharing outcome in this field .', u'By comparing and contrasting the ontologies from five perspectives , we draw a brief conclusion to the present status of negotiation ontology researches , and make our suggestions to the further research in this field .']

sentences: [u'Search engines and directories are the main tools used to find desired information into the ocean of digital contents that is the Web .', u'However , they are not presently able to understand the user specific needs and starting knowledge because their inability to simulate the processes of human mind .', u'Natural Language Processing , Folksonomy , Semantic Web and Serendipitous Surfing are some of the recent research fields towards understanding and satisfying the different user needs .', u'This work aims to add one step more to this evolution path by presenting a new web search methodology that allows to create new knowledge paths based on user specific requirements .', u"Thus , we consider different web-searcher typologies such as `` basic searchers '' , `` deep searchers '' and `` wide searchers '' with different search expectations and starting knowledge .", u'Some preliminary experiments have been performed to validate this methodology and build a new search engine around it .']

sentences: [u'This paper presents the development and application of a software tool for modeling knowledge to be used in knowledge-based systems or the Semantic Web .', u'The inferential modeling technique , which is a technique for modeling the static and dynamic knowledge elements of a problem domain , provided the basis for the tool .', u'A survey of existing knowledge modeling tools revealed they typically failed to provide support in four main areas : support for an ontological engineering methodology or technique , support for dynamic knowledge modeling , support for dynamic knowledge testing , and support for ontology management .', u'Dyna , a Protege plug-in , has been developed , which supports the Inferential Modeling Technique , dynamic knowledge modeling , and dynamic knowledge testing .', u'Protege and Dyna are applied for constructing an ontological model in the domain of selecting a remediation technology for petroleum contaminated sites .', u'Dynamic knowledge testing in Dyna enabled creation of a more complete knowledge model .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'evaluating and ranking ontologies', u'Task'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'retrieval mechanism', u'Method'), (u'candidate ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'metrics', u'Generic'), (u'ontology aspects', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'metrics', u'Generic')], [(u'evaluations', u'Generic'), (u'framework', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'evaluating and ranking ontologies'), (u'features', u'USED-FOR', u'framework')], [(u'retrieval mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'candidate ontologies')], [(u'metrics', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology aspects')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Reusing the increasing number of available ontologies is extremely important for the advancement and the growth of Semantic Web , because it reduces the required costs , efforts and amount of time to build new ontologies .', u'However , the lack of standard frameworks to assess their quality and their suitability for being used in a specific context remains a barrier to their wide adoption and reuse .', u'To address this problem , we present in this paper a framework for evaluating and ranking ontologies , with three distinctive features .', u'First , it provides an advanced retrieval mechanism that gathers the best set of candidate ontologies .', u'Second , it defines a rich set of metrics for assessing several ontology aspects .', u'Third , it supplies a helpful way for visualising and interpreting the results .', u'We implemented and evaluated the proposed metrics .', u'The results of these evaluations are presented , indicating the usefulness of the overall framework .']

entities: [[(u'semantic-related web technologies', u'Method')], [(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'WS', u'Method'), (u'semantic WS', u'Task')], [(u'syntactic and semantic approaches', u'Method'), (u'WS', u'Task')], [(u'syntactic and semantic WS interaction networks', u'Method')], [], [(u'WS interaction networks', u'Method'), (u'real-world networks', u'Method'), (u'short average distance', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'community structure', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'syntactic and semantic networks', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'WS descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'composition process', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'semantic web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'WS'), (u'WS', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic WS')], [(u'syntactic and semantic approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'WS')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The number of publicly available Web services ( WS ) is continuously growing , and in parallel , we are witnessing a rapid development in semantic-related web technologies .', u'The intersection of the semantic web and WS allows the development of semantic WS .', u'In this work , we adopt a complex network perspective to perform a comparative analysis of the syntactic and semantic approaches used to describe WS .', u'From a collection of publicly available WS descriptions , we extract syntactic and semantic WS interaction networks .', u'We take advantage of tools from the complex network field to analyze them and determine their properties .', u'We show that WS interaction networks exhibit some of the typical characteristics observed in real-world networks , such as short average distance between nodes and community structure .', u'By comparing syntactic and semantic networks through their properties , we show the introduction of semantics in WS descriptions should improve the composition process .']

sentences: [u'Grid technologies provide a robust infrastructure for distributed computing , and are widely used in large-scale scientific applications that generate terabytes ( soon petabytes ) of data .', u'This data is described with metadata attributes about the data properties and provenance , and is organized in a variety of metadata catalogs distributed over the grid .', u'In order to find a collection of data that share certain properties , these metadata catalogs need to be identified and queried on an individual basis .', u'This paper introduces Artemis , a system developed to integrate distributed metadata catalogs on the grid .', u'Artemis exploits several AI techniques including a query mediator , a query planning and execution system , ontologies and semantic web tools to model metadata attributes , and an intelligent user interface that guides users through these ontologies to formulate queries .', u'We describe our experiences using Artemis with large metadata catalogs from two projects in the physics domain .']

sentences: [u'Open data is fuel for the future economy .', u'Opening and sharing data owned by public bodies , communities and companies has an incredible economic value .', u'This will potentially lead our society to a new data-driven thinking paradigm .', u'They also enable a smarter urban space where companies can provide better and innovative services .', u'In particular , accessing to government data held by public bodies generates accountability , transparency and fosters economic growth .', u'Two main aspects define data as open : data formats and licenses .', u'This paper aims at listing some preliminary notes on the copyright framework in which open data are released and presenting the idea of considering licenses as metadata .', u'Many tools , according to the semantic web paradigm , aim at enforcing this aspect , managing data exchange in a more compliance way and reducing costs for reuse of data .', u'Finally , a research path for a new approach to digital ownership will be presented .']

sentences: [u'With the internet technology development and the popularization of multimedia technology , especially images and visual information because of its rich and varied information , has become an important part of information retrieval .', u'The traditional information retrieval techniques do not meet the users demand .', u'Recently content based image retrieval has become the hottest topic and techniques of content based image retrieval has achieved great development .', u'Image retrieval methods based on color , texture shape and semantics are discussed , analyzed and compared .', u'The semantic based image retrieval is a better way to solve the semantic gap problem , so Ontology based web image retrieval method is stressed in this article .', u'This model considers the ontological requirements in usability , intelligence and effectiveness .', u'Based on the proposed content based and model based annotation models , the image query becomes easy and effective .', u'Through empirical evaluations , our annotation models can deliver accurate results for semantic web image retrieval .']

entities: [[(u'Ontology', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'knowledge presentation', u'Task')], [(u'Hospital Accreditation', u'Method')], [], [(u'Medical adverse event reporting', u'Task'), (u'Hospital Accreditation', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'medical adverse event reporting', u'Task')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'inconsistent knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'human negligence', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'framework', u'Generic')], [(u'extraction of information', u'Task'), (u'classification of events', u'Task')], [(u'variable and dynamic ontology', u'Task'), (u'medical adverse event reporting', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Ontology is the fundamental element of the semantic web that is a kind of knowledge presentation and can present the variety of property for concept .', u'According to the regulation of Department of Health , Executive Yuan , R.O.C , the hospital has implemented the new Hospital Accreditation from 2005 .', u'Furthermore , the Hospital Accreditation evolves the variety of items of accreditation .', u'Medical adverse event reporting is a kind of the Hospital Accreditation .', u'The system which can deal with the medical adverse event reporting is operated by human at present .', u'None the less , the system caused some questions , such as inconsistent knowledge and human negligence .', u'The research proposed a new framework which can replace the human automatically .', u'First , we get concepts through extraction of information and analyze sentences through classification of events .', u'After that we analyze those classes which can construct variable and dynamic ontology in medical adverse event reporting .']

entities: [[(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'e-learning', u'Method')], [(u'integrated approach', u'Method'), (u'constraints', u'Generic'), (u'timeadjusted knowledge volume', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'real-time approach', u'Method'), (u'contextual instruction', u'Task'), (u'learner', u'Generic'), (u'preset duration', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rule-based representation', u'Method'), (u'domain context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'domain knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'learning objects', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'progressive inference engine', u'Method'), (u'ontological entities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'timed learning objects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'temporal attributes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'learners schedule', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'e-learning')], [], [(u'semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'real-time approach')], [(u'rule-based representation', u'USED-FOR', u'domain context')], [], [(u'progressive inference engine', u'USED-FOR', u'timed learning objects')]]
sentences: [u'It has been widely argued across e-learning research literature that the most innovative approaches to e-learning are those which allow learners to receive customized training material according to their needs and their own time and place .', u'In this paper we propose an integrated approach which combines these constraints in generating a timeadjusted knowledge volume on-the-fly .', u'Recent progress in semantic web could facilitate a real-time approach to learning whereby contextual instruction is delivered at a time where the learner is ready to receive it and within a preset duration which satisfies the learners schedule .', u'To achieve these objectives , we propose a rule-based representation to model a domain context .', u'The related domain knowledge is encapsulated within standard learning objects .', u'A progressive inference engine maps selected ontological entities into timed learning objects which temporal attributes are deemed feasible with respect to the learners schedule .']

entities: [[(u'inference techniques', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'Material')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'them', u'Generic')], [(u'Existing measures', u'Generic'), (u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'schema and instance levels', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'subjective parameters', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology complexity', u'Metric')], [(u'semi-automated framework', u'Method'), (u'structural complexity', u'Metric'), (u'abstraction levels', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'metrics', u'Generic'), (u'ontology editors', u'Method'), (u'ontology designer', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'complexity', u'Metric')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'component-based software complexity metrics', u'Metric'), (u'metrics', u'Generic'), (u"Briand 's and Weyuker 's benchmarks", u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'public ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'Existing measures', u'USED-FOR', u'complexity'), (u'Existing measures', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology'), (u'complexity', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'ontology'), (u'complexity', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'ontology')], [(u'semi-automated framework', u'USED-FOR', u'structural complexity'), (u'abstraction levels', u'FEATURE-OF', u'ontology')], [(u'metrics', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology designer'), (u'ontology editors', u'USED-FOR', u'metrics')], [(u'component-based software complexity metrics', u'USED-FOR', u'framework')], []]
sentences: [u'Ontologies represent knowledge of a particular domain and form an elementary unit for inference techniques on the semantic web .', u'It is important to measure the complexity of ontologies in order for users to better understand , maintain , reuse and integrate them .', u'Existing measures for the complexity of an ontology either handle complexity at schema and instance levels or define subjective parameters to measure ontology complexity .', u'To this end , we present a semi-automated framework to measure the structural complexity at different abstraction levels of an ontology .', u'Moreover , our metrics leverage the information provided by ontology editors , which can be useful to the ontology designer for selection of the ontology with optimum complexity among alternative ontologies .', u"Our framework is inspired by the concept of component-based software complexity metrics and its metrics have been validated against Briand 's and Weyuker 's benchmarks .", u'We have also performed comparative analysis on public ontologies .']

entities: [[(u'this', u'Generic'), (u'open access publishing', u'Task'), (u'policy development', u'Task')], [(u'APO', u'Method')], [(u'grey literature', u'Material'), (u'bibliographic exchange', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'APO', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'full text digital resources', u'Material'), (u'semantic web', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'open access publishing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'policy development')], [], [(u'bibliographic exchange', u'CONJUNCTION', u'interoperability')], []]
sentences: [u"This paper looks at the role of Australian Policy Online ( APO ) as a collection of 'grey ' public policy research and considers how this fits within the broader context of open access publishing and policy development .", u'The amount of grey literature now being produced presents challenges for APO as well as other collecting agencies and society in general .', u'This paper looks at who is operating in this space in Australia , the issues for collecting and preserving grey literature , and how bibliographic exchange and interoperability can help us to manage the flood of new material and reduce the duplicated effort that currently exists .', u'While APO has been a foundational player in this field , it has reached a stage where a new solution is required - a national online collaborative collection of full text digital resources created with a vision for the benefits that the semantic web will bring .']

relations: [[(u'Google', u'PART-OF', u'search market')], [], [], [(u'C #', u'USED-FOR', u'framework SearchBadger')], [(u'graphical user interface', u'CONJUNCTION', u'search behaviour')], [(u'Keyterm significance', u'CONJUNCTION', u'stemming'), (u'instant user feedback', u'USED-FOR', u'page re-ranking')], [(u'framework', u'CONJUNCTION', u'search engines')]]
sentences: [u'Google represents a significant share in the search market and dominates the world of search engines .', u'Although Google has constantly made effort to improve its search results by adding a result page preview and offering a block URL option , individual user feedback to the real time search operation is still very limited .', u'In this paper , a new framework called SearchBadger is proposed to optimise search results in real time by interacting with user and taking into account immediate user feedback .', u'The proposed framework SearchBadger is developed using C # , db4o and Visual Studio .', u'SearchBadger architecture contains the major component BadgerWorkspace and is followed by graphical user interface and search behaviour .', u'Keyterm significance and stemming are discussed and then page re-ranking is achieved by instant user feedback .', u'The framework can be integrated to the existing search engines or served as a test bed for future development of semantic web .']

sentences: [u'Despite the fact that adaptive hypermedia techniques have proven their ability to provide user guidance and orientation in hyperspace , we do not currently see the widespread adoption of these techniques .', u'A couple of reasons may explain this phenomenon .', u"One of them is the current lack of reusability and interoperability between adaptive techniques/systems , which - to some degree - originates in the so-called `` open corpus problem '' found in adaptive hypermedia .", u'In this article , we analyze this problem in a popular arena : adaptive hypermedia systems with an emphasis on education .', u'The origins and effects of the open corpus problem are discussed , and recent approaches are demonstrated that have - in one way or the other - developed as strategies for solving the open corpus problem .', u'We summarize these findings and discuss how solution strategies can be successfully employed in the future , enabling adaptive hypermedia techniques within open , dynamic information spaces , such as the Semantic Web .']

relations: [[], [(u'ontology reasoning', u'USED-FOR', u'mechanism'), (u'ontology reasoning', u'USED-FOR', u'two-tier service registration management system'), (u'ontology reasoning', u'USED-FOR', u'category Chord ring'), (u'category Chord ring', u'CONJUNCTION', u'area Chord ring'), (u'OWL-S', u'USED-FOR', u'centralized UDDI')], [(u'distributed search', u'USED-FOR', u'service discovery')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'two-stage matching'), (u'services syntax', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantics informations'), (u'semantics informations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantics informations')], [(u'prototype system', u'USED-FOR', u'mechanism')]]
sentences: [u'With the maturation and development of the Web services technology , the distributed semantic Web services publishing and discovery mechanism is presented in order to find the target service quickly , accurately and efficiently in the flood of Web services .', u'The mechanism is two-tier service registration management system which is constructed by the ontology reasoning to form the category Chord ring and the area Chord ring based on the distribution of the chord protocal , and extending the centralized UDDI by the OWL-S .', u'It can overcome the performance bottle-necks and single-point-failure of UDDI , and improves the efficiency of service discovery as distributed search .', u'During the services discovery process , it proceeds two-stage matching to find based on the services syntax and semantics informations , to ensure the precision of services discovery .', u'Then a designed and implemented prototype system approves that the mechanism is reasonable and efficient .']

sentences: [u'We purpose a system that can semi-automatically generate ontology-based annotations for a social network by leveraging the annotations provided by the most active user ( also known as the central actor ) .', u'Social context of an image is of central importance in our approach towards semantic semi-automatic annotation .', u'For the context of an image , we consider several factors like geo-reference , time and relationship among actors in social networks .', u'Our system leverages the context , which is automatically available along with the image .', u'We have also extended Social Network Analysis techniques by considering the granularity of relationships among actors under consideration .', u'In this paper a semantic web framework is used to represent the social network and to deal with the diversity of relationships .', u'OntoCAIM ontology is developed which not only encompasses Social Network Analysis functionality but also defines mechanism to annotate images with an underlying ontology .']

sentences: [u'Objective : To discover the the new latent concept , which is significant to self-learning and machine learning .', u'To better understand the conceptual relations of the query terms .', u'Methods : The application of Fuzzy Formal Concept to construct a Concept Lattice that better describes the semantic relations of incoming patterns for a collection of documents .', u'There has been little work that evaluates the effect of various techniques and parameter settings in the word space construction from corpora .', u'Findings : The present paper experimentally investigates how the choice of a particular domain helps the user to discover the information which is much closer to his preferences .', u'Applications/Improvements : The results generated using our novel approach has been experimented for the context of finding the Sea side Schools based on user requirements .', u'A comparision of related papers is performed to encounter the challenging issues of Ontology construction for text classification in Semantic Web .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic analysis', u'Method'), (u'ambiguity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'interpretation of natural language discourse', u'Task')], [(u'Computing', u'Task'), (u'linguistic analysis', u'Task')], [(u'linguistic studies', u'Task'), (u'theoretical background of ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'metaphysical approach', u'Method'), (u'relativistic account', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'dialectical definition', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic analysis of the definiendum', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'With the advent of the semantic web , the problem of ambiguity is becoming more and more urgent .', u'Semantic analysis is necessary for explaining and resolving some sorts of ambiguity by inquiring into the relation between possibilities of predication and definition of a concept in order to solve problems of interpretation of natural language discourse .', u'Computing is now confronting such problems of linguistic analysis ( Diggelen et al .', u'2004 ) , and it is worth inquir- ing into the development of linguistic studies that can be useful for developing the theoretical background of ontologies .', u'Our proposal is to develop a workable solution that passes between the horns of the dilemma posed by the traditional metaphysical approach versus the modern relativistic account .', u'We interpret the ancient notion of essential definition in a pragmatic perspective , and show how the dialectical definition by genus and difference corresponds to the semantic analysis of the definiendum .']

entities: [[(u'mathematical knowledge management', u'Method'), (u'generic representation language MMT', u'Method'), (u'mathematical query language QMT', u'Method'), (u'simplicity', u'Metric'), (u'expressivity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'scalability', u'Metric'), (u'logical formalism', u'Method')], [(u'QMT', u'Method'), (u'search paradigms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'unification', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'XQuery style queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'QMT queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'QMT', u'Method'), (u'MMT API', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'mathematical knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'content markup language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'QMT', u'Method'), (u'presentation and narration markup languages', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'One of the most promising applications of mathematical knowledge management is search : Even if we restrict attention to the tiny fragment of mathematics that has been formalized , the amount exceeds the comprehension of an individual human. # R # # N # # R # # N # Based on the generic representation language MMT , we introduce the mathematical query language QMT : It combines simplicity , expressivity , and scalability while avoiding a commitment to a particular logical formalism .', u'QMT can integrate various search paradigms such as unification , semantic web , or XQuery style queries , and QMT queries can span different mathematical libraries. # R # # N # # R # # N # We have implemented QMT as a part of the MMT API .', u'This combination provides a scalable indexing and query engine that can be readily applied to any library of mathematical knowledge .', u'While our focus here is on libraries that are available in a content markup language , QMT naturally extends to presentation and narration markup languages .']

sentences: [u'Massive real-world data are network-structured , such as semantic web , social network , relationship between proteins , etc .', u'Modeling a network is an effective way for better understanding the properties of a network , while avoiding the complexity of the full description .', u'This paper proposes a novel hierarchical Bayesian model for relational data , which is an extension of Mixed Membership Stochastic Block model .', u'Unlike previous work assumes edges to be of atomic , our model recognizes that each edge is composed of multiple elementary relationships and the weight on this edge is a includes all the weights of these elementary relationships .', u'This allows our model to incorporate more information about the network and increases its ability of uncertainty tolerance .', u'A fast inference based on variational inference is offered .', u'Empirical results on a synthetic data and three real-world data sets demonstrate the effectiveness and the robustness of our method .']

relations: [[], [(u'term-based patterns', u'USED-FOR', u'Prior methods')], [(u'Semantic Web standards', u'USED-FOR', u'autism phenotypes')], [(u'ontology- and rule-based semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'text-mining method')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'text extraction'), (u'full-text articles', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge base')], [(u'method', u'COMPARE', u'term-based approach'), (u'precision', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'method'), (u'precision', u'CONJUNCTION', u'recall'), (u'precision', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'term-based approach'), (u'recall', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'method'), (u'recall', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'term-based approach'), (u'term-based approach', u'USED-FOR', u'definitions')]]
sentences: [u'Many developers of biomedical knowledge bases typically validate and update formalized knowledge based on reviews of full -text scientific articles , but finding text relevant to domain concepts can be tedious and prone to errors .', u'Prior methods have automated this process by matching term-based patterns within a single sentence .', u'In our work developing a knowledge base of autism phenotypes , specified using Semantic Web standards , we are interested in finding multi-sentence sections of text that contains complex phenotype definitions .', u'In this paper , we present a text-mining method that incorporates both ontology- and rule-based semantics to determine which section is relevant .', u'We evaluated our method in undertaking text extraction for the set of full-text articles used to create the knowledge base .', u'We show that our method has higher precision and recall than a term-based approach in identifying definitions that contain complex patterns and occur across sentence boundaries .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'classical first-order logic', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'classical logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Autoepistemic logic', u'Method'), (u'AEL )', u'Method'), (u'uniform host language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'nonmonotonic logic programs', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'propositional setting', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'stable-model semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'first-order AEL', u'Method'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'classical theories', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge combination', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'nonmonotonic logic programs')], [], [], [(u'embedding', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge combination')]]
sentences: [u'In the context of the Semantic Web , several approaches to the combination of ontologies , given in terms of theories of classical first-order logic , and rule bases have been proposed .', u'They either cast rules into classical logic or limit the interaction between rules and ontologies .', u'Autoepistemic logic ( AEL ) is an attractive formalismwhich allows to overcome these limitations , by serving as a uniform host language to embed ontologies and nonmonotonic logic programs into it .', u'For the latter , so far only the propositional setting has been considered .', u'In this paper , we present several embeddings of normal and disjunctive non-ground logic programs under the stable-model semantics into first-order AEL , and compare them in combination with classical theories , with respect to stable expansions and autoepistemic consequences .', u'Our results reveal differences and correspondences of the embeddings and provide a useful guidance in the choice of a particular embedding for knowledge combination .']

sentences: [u'Purpose There is still little support for the consumer decisionmaking process on the web , especially when prices are not the primary property of a product .', u'Reasons for that are complex product specifications as well as often volitional weak interoperability between ecommerce sites .', u'This paper aims to address this issue.Design/methodology/approach The semantic web is supposed to make product information more interoperable between different sites .', u'Additionally , some products with limited time frames of availability , like real estates or secondhand cars , require periodical searches over several days , weeks , or even months .', u'For those kinds of products existing systems can not be applied .', u'Instant information about new offers on the market is therefore crucial .', u'Wireless access to the web enables services to become instantaneous and to provide uptodate information to users.Findings This paper presents a framework which is based on multivariate product comparison allowing users to delegate search reques ...']

relations: [[(u'human immune system', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge acquisition bottleneck'), (u'knowledge acquisition bottleneck', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web application'), (u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge acquisition bottleneck'), (u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web application')], [(u'Artificial Immune Network ( AIN ) algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'concept hierarchy')], [(u'IT', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Biochemistry'), (u'Biochemistry', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Fiqh'), (u'it', u'COMPARE', u'GAHC')], [(u'pre-processing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'concept hierarchy induction'), (u'concept hierarchy induction', u'PART-OF', u'approach'), (u'GAHC', u'USED-FOR', u'concept hierarchy induction'), (u'GAHC', u'CONJUNCTION', u'concept hierarchy learning'), (u'AIN', u'USED-FOR', u'concept hierarchy learning')], [(u'concept hierarchy', u'USED-FOR', u'reference ontology')], []]
sentences: [u'The human immune system provides inspiration in the attempt of solving the knowledge acquisition bottleneck in developing ontology for semantic web application .', u'In this paper , we proposed an extension to the Guided Agglomerative Hierarchical Clustering ( GAHC ) method that uses an Artificial Immune Network ( AIN ) algorithm to improve the process of automatically building and expanding the concept hierarchy .', u'A small collection of Malay text is used from three different domains which are IT , Biochemistry and Fiqh to test the effectiveness of the proposed approach and also by comparing it with GAHC .', u'The proposed approach consists of three stages : pre-processing , concept hierarchy induction using GAHC and concept hierarchy learning using AIN .', u'To validate our approach , the automatically learned concept hierarchy is compared to a reference ontology developed by human experts .', u'Thus it can be concluded that the proposed approach has greater ability to be used in learning concept hierarchy .']

relations: [[(u'polysemy', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'linguistic problems'), (u'polysemy', u'CONJUNCTION', u'underspecification'), (u'underspecification', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'linguistic problems'), (u'underspecification', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontological problems'), (u'underspecification', u'CONJUNCTION', u'underspecification'), (u'underspecification', u'CONJUNCTION', u'disagreements'), (u'disagreements', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'linguistic problems'), (u'disagreements', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontological problems'), (u'disagreements', u'CONJUNCTION', u'disagreements and/or false agreements'), (u'disagreements and/or false agreements', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'linguistic problems'), (u'disagreements and/or false agreements', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontological problems')], [], [], [(u'semantic deficiencies', u'FEATURE-OF', u'Brazilian legal codes')], [(u'laws', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web scenario')], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'linguistic and conceptual problems')]]
sentences: [u'Official documents , and particularly legal ones like law codes , often contain ambiguities and/or inconsistencies , due to linguistic problems like polysemy , as well as ontological problems like underspecification , disagreements and/or false agreements .', u'Such problems can be identified by formalizing the terminology of a domain in terms of an ontology .', u'We show this phenomenon in a particular domain , the definition of different classes of vehicles .', u"Defining accurately these different vehicle types shed light on some of these semantic deficiencies present in two Brazilian legal codes responsible for defining vehicles ' categories in an unambiguous manner for many purposes , e.g .", u'tax calculations , and , more importantly , to make e-government systems interoperate while taking laws into account in a Semantic Web scenario .', u"In this work , we define a framework linking the linguistic and conceptual problems to semantic deficiencies and show how these deficiencies were identified during the vehicles ' ontology construction ."]

entities: [[(u'structured data format', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF/OWL', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'free text', u'Material'), (u'RDF/OWL', u'Material'), (u'SPARQL query', u'Material'), (u'free text', u'Material')], [(u'SPARQL query', u'Material'), (u'recall', u'Metric'), (u'recall', u'Metric'), (u'dedicated queries', u'Material')], [(u'SPARQL query', u'Material'), (u'recall', u'Metric'), (u'precision', u'Metric')], [(u'SPARQL query', u'Material')], [(u'RDF/OWL', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL query', u'Material')], [(u'inference', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'structured data format', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web')], [], [(u'recall', u'CONJUNCTION', u'recall')], [], [], [(u'SPARQL query', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF/OWL')], []]
sentences: [u'Recently , the structured data format in RDF/OWL has played an increasingly vital role in the semantic web .', u'We converted pediatric and oncologic nuclear medicine imaging reports in free text into RDF/OWL format and evaluated the usefulness of nuclear medicine imaging reports in RDF/OWL by comparing SPARQL query results with the manually retrieved results by physicians from the reports in free text .', u'SPARQL query showed 95 % recall for simple queries and 91 % recall for dedicated queries .', u'In total , SPARQL query retrieved 93 % ( 51 lesions of 55 ) recall and 100 % precision for 20 clinical query items .', u'All query results missed by SPARQL query were of some inference .', u'Nuclear medicine imaging reports in the format of RDF/OWL were very useful for retrieving simple and dedicated query results using SPARQL query .', u'Further study using more number of cases and knowledge for inference is warranted .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'Material')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies interpretability', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'similarity measures', u'Metric'), (u'user feedback', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SVM )', u'Method'), (u'AdaBoost classifiers', u'Method')], [(u'classifier', u'Method'), (u'classification rate', u'Metric')], [(u'F-measure criterion', u'Metric'), (u'feature selection', u'Method'), (u'AdaBoost', u'Method'), (u'DT classifiers', u'Method'), (u'F-measures', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'In the semantic web , ontology plays an important role to provide formal definitions of concepts and relationships .', u'Therefore , communicating similar ontologies becomes essential to provide ontologies interpretability and extendibility .', u'Thus , it is inevitable to have similar but not the same ontologies in a particular domain since there might be several definitions for a given concept .', u'This paper presents a method to combine similarity measures of different categories without having ontology instances or any user feedback in regard with alignment of two given ontologies .', u'To align different ontologies efficiently , K Nearest Neighbor ( KNN ) , Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) , Decision Tree ( DT ) and AdaBoost classifiers are investigated .', u'Each classifier is optimized based on the lower cost and better classification rate .', u'Experimental results demonstrate that the F-measure criterion improves up to 99 % using feature selection and combination of AdaBoost and DT classifiers , which is highly comparable , and outperforms the previous reported F-measures .']

entities: [[(u'fuzzy cognitive maps', u'Method'), (u'FCM )', u'Method'), (u'Web knowledge aggregation', u'Task'), (u'representation', u'Task')], [(u'Web KnowARR framework', u'Method'), (u'fuzzy logic', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Web KnowARR framework', u'Method'), (u'stakeholder management use case', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'frameworks usefulness', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'management form', u'Method'), (u'company decisions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'they', u'Generic'), (u'non-public content', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'public content of stakeholder maps', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'This chapter presents fuzzy cognitive maps ( FCM ) as a vehicle for Web knowledge aggregation , representation , and reasoning .', u'The corresponding Web KnowARR framework incorporates findings from fuzzy logic .', u'To this end , a first emphasis is particularly on the Web KnowARR framework along with a stakeholder management use case to illustrate the frameworks usefulness as a second focal point .', u'This management form is to help projects to acceptance and assertiveness where claims for company decisions are actively involved in the management process .', u'Stakeholder maps visually ( re- ) present these claims .', u'On one hand , they resort to non-public content and on the other they resort to content that is available to the public ( mostly on the Web ) .', u'The Semantic Web offers opportunities not only to present public content descriptively but also to show relationships .', u'The proposed framework can serve as the basis for the public content of stakeholder maps .']

sentences: [u'Semantic Web knowledge bases , in particular large cross-domain data , are often noisy , incorrect , and incomplete with respect to type information .', u'This incompleteness can be reduced , as previous work shows , with automatic type prediction methods .', u'Most knowledge bases contain an ontology defining a type hierarchy , and , in general , entities are allowed to have multiple types ( classes of an instance assigned with the rdf : type relation ) .', u'In this paper , we exploit these characteristics and formulate the type prediction problem as hierarchical multi classification , where the labels are types .', u'We evaluate different sets of features , including entity embeddings , which can be extracted from the knowledge graph exclusively .', u'We propose SLCN , a modification of the local classifier per node approach , which performs feature selection , instance sampling , and class balancing for each local classifier with the objective of improving scalability .', u'Furthermore , we explore different variants of creating features for the classi ...']

entities: [[(u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic formalization of usage logs', u'Task'), (u'querying expressive usage patterns', u'Task')], [(u'query answering approach', u'Method'), (u'semantic and temporal-based constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'user browsing sessions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'usage logs', u'Material')], [(u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF representations', u'Method'), (u'Web resources', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'theWeb of Data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic formalization of usage logs')], [], [(u'usage logs', u'USED-FOR', u'user browsing sessions')], [(u'domain ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RDF representations')], []]
sentences: [u'A useful step towards better interpretation and analysis of the usage patterns is to formalize the semantics of the resources that users are accessing in the Web .', u'We focus on this problem and present an approach for the semantic formalization of usage logs , which lays the basis for eective techniques of querying expressive usage patterns .', u'We also present a query answering approach , which is useful to nd in the logs expressive patterns of usage behavior via formulation of semantic and temporal-based constraints .', u'We have processed over 30 thousand user browsing sessions extracted from usage logs of DBPedia and Semantic Web Dog Food .', u'All these events are formalized semantically using respective domain ontologies and RDF representations of the Web resources being accessed .', u'We show the eectiveness of our approach through experimental results , providing in this way an exploratory analysis of the way users browse theWeb of Data .']

sentences: [u'The IRF-SIC laboratory comprises three research teams ( IRF , R2IS , and MS2I ) .', u'Its research themes are the following : Image Processing and Pattern Recognition and their Applications : classification , watermarking and applications , document analysis , handwritten , character and handwritten signature recognition , satellite imagery and applications , videos analysis and motion tracking , etc .', u'Information Retrieval : electronic and multimedia document , and digital typography ; data warehouse , data mining and graphs ; social networks , archiving and indexing of Arabic documents Systems Engineering : information system engineering ; business intelligence , big data and cloud computing ; Real-time and embedded systems , service-oriented architecture and distributed systems , services ( modeling , design , QoS , etc .', u') , systems and network security ( fixed and mobile ) .', u'Modeling , Simulation , Interaction and Intelligence : Intelligent tutoring systems , knowledge engineering and semantic web , agent-based modeling and simulation of complex ecological social systems , Natural Language Processing and Machine Learning , logistic and transport , and cellular automata for spatio-temporal dynamics simulation .']

sentences: [u'As more data are provided in Semantic Web , processing large amounts of data with triple-format triple-data , and interlinking the applications with triples , have become important for a variety of applications .', u'A challenge is to index a triple database efficiently .', u'Most existing triple indexing techniques suffer from data duplication and the oversized index tree problem .', u'We analyzed the drawbacks of existing triple indexing methods from the viewpoint of the consistency and effectiveness of a triple database .', u'We also considered the issues that need to be addressed to build a triple index for the management of relational database ( RDB ) -based triple data .', u'Tridex is a lightweight B+-tree index structure designed to facilitate efficient processing of RDB-based triple databases .', u'Tridex is beneficial in reduced index tree size and less data redundancy .', u'We conducted an experimental evaluation to demonstrate the superiority of Tridex compared to existing triple index structures .']
