sentences: [u'Educational web-based systems exemplify the increasing need for personalisation .', u'Applications that adapt to individual users need a model of the user that contains as accurate data as possible .', u'On the web , learners use multiple educational systems and spend their time over many applications : these are individually limited in their user modelling but can gain from joining forces .', u'This boils down to establishing semantic interoperability of user or learner models .', u'While semantic interoperability is hard , the emerging Semantic Web ( SW ) might offer just the mechanisms we need .', u'In this paper , we develop the Generic User model Component ( GUC ) : a generic software that utilises SW technology to support the exchange of user model data between applications .', u'For a semantically effective user model exchange , GUC allows the configuration of a distributed management of mappings between user models .', u'Thus , applications can choose different levels of uniting user models to maximise their personalisation .']

entities: [[(u'Cloud computing', u'Method'), (u'business model', u'Method'), (u'cloud resources', u'Material')], [(u'cloud computing', u'Method'), (u'representing knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'cloud applications', u'Task'), (u'cloud computing', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Agent', u'Method'), (u'Service SAaaS', u'Method'), (u'Unified Modeling Language modelling', u'Method')], [(u'SAaaS architecture', u'Method'), (u'Cloud Computing', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'Multi-Agent Systems', u'Task')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'cloud service models', u'Method'), (u'Software', u'Method'), (u'Infrastructure', u'Method'), (u'intelligent cloud computing applications', u'Task')], [(u'SAaaS', u'Method'), (u'Semantic-based Project Resources Sharing Platform', u'Method'), (u'intelligent cloud computing application', u'Method'), (u'SAaaS framework', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'cloud computing', u'USED-FOR', u'cloud applications')], [(u'Unified Modeling Language modelling', u'USED-FOR', u'Service SAaaS')], [(u'Cloud Computing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web'), (u'Cloud Computing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Multi-Agent Systems'), (u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Multi-Agent Systems')], [(u'Software', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'cloud service models'), (u'Software', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Infrastructure'), (u'Platform', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Infrastructure')], [(u'SAaaS', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic-based Project Resources Sharing Platform'), (u'SAaaS', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'intelligent cloud computing application'), (u'Semantic-based Project Resources Sharing Platform', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'intelligent cloud computing application'), (u'SAaaS framework', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic-based Project Resources Sharing Platform'), (u'SAaaS framework', u'USED-FOR', u'intelligent cloud computing application')]]
sentences: [u'Cloud computing , a common business model , provides cloud resources on demand to consumers over the Internet .', u'However , because cloud computing lacks a uniform method of representing knowledge , which can offer customers a comprehensive solution for managing and developing cloud applications , cloud computing has low reuse potential .', u'This work proposes a Semantic Agent as a Service SAaaS , which was developed using Unified Modeling Language modelling .', u'The SAaaS architecture is based on research into Cloud Computing , Semantic Web and Multi-Agent Systems .', u'The architecture can be combined with existing cloud service models , such as Software as a Service , Platform as a Service and Infrastructure as a Service , to design intelligent cloud computing applications .', u'To demonstrate the efficacy of SAaaS , a Semantic-based Project Resources Sharing Platform , an intelligent cloud computing application based on the SAaaS framework , is implemented to provide project resources on demand , consistent with the needs of project members .']

entities: [[(u'web-based and community-oriented social software', u'Task'), (u'software engineering', u'Task')], [(u'user orientation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'self organization', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'emergent nature', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'continual social feedback', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'agile requirements definition exercise', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'agile requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'social platforms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'social software engineering discipline', u'Method'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'online environments', u'Task')], [(u'semantic and collaborative platform', u'Method'), (u'social software principles', u'Method'), (u'semantic web concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge-assisted agile requirements definition', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'The characteristics of web-based and community-oriented social software are very useful in the context of software engineering in general and requirements engineering in particular .', u'Their ease of use , transparency of communication , user orientation , self organization and emergent nature resulting from a continual social feedback are particularly relevant to an agile requirements definition exercise .', u'The reason is that agile requirements are inherently meant to be collaboration-intensive .', u'However , while the benefits of social platforms are valuable , they are necessary and not sufficient in themselves for making the exercise effective .', u'The emerging social software engineering discipline is about enabling community-driven creation , management and deployment of software by applying methods , processes and tools in online environments .', u'In this paper , we report our work on a semantic and collaborative platform that combines the virtues of social software principles and the semantic web concepts to enable knowledge-assisted agile requirements definition .']

entities: [[(u'web resources', u'Material')], [(u'events', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'people', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'situations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'inCloud', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'web resource clouding', u'Task'), (u'construction of inClouds', u'Task')], [(u'inClouds', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web resources', u'Material'), (u'reciprocal levels of closeness', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'real web resources', u'Material')], []]

sentences: [u'The variety of web resources available to users for their business or personal needs is growing , spanning from fast , short , ready-to-consume news/posts to well-structured , formal ontology instances of the Semantic Web .', u'In this context , users require to retrieve very fast all available prominent information about target entities regarding events , people , situations and similar .', u'In this paper , we introduce the notion of inCloud ( information Cloud ) and we propose an approach to web resource clouding for the construction of inClouds .', u'inClouds are built for a target entity of interest by distinguishing , also in a visual way , how much prominent the retrieved web resource ( s ) are with respect to the target entity and by organizing web resources according to their reciprocal levels of closeness .', u'An application of the proposed approach to a collection of real web resources about movies is presented .', u'Applicability and evaluation issues are also discussed .']

entities: [[(u'Technology-enhanced learning', u'Method')], [(u'engineering education', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'pedagogical problems', u'Task')], [(u'semantic web portal', u'Method'), (u'service broker platform', u'Method')], [(u'Web 3.0 technology', u'Method')], [(u'search and publishing mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'self-growing grid', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Online laboratories', u'Material'), (u'software simulations', u'Task'), (u'real hardware equipment', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'semantic web portal', u'CONJUNCTION', u'service broker platform')], [(u'Web 3.0 technology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Web technologies')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Technology-enhanced learning is becoming a new important trend in higher education worldwide .', u'In particular , engineering education is becoming an exciting emerging field of research because it involves a multitude of disciplines which aim to resolve the pedagogical problems that arise with the advancement of technology .', u'This paper discusses the creation of a common grid of online laboratories based on a semantic web portal and service broker platform including experiment applications for the use in different levels of education .', u'The so called Web 3.0 technology is actually growing daily and is proposed to be one of the leading Web technologies within the next years .', u'Improved search and publishing mechanisms are some key features of the self-growing grid .', u'Online laboratories are interactive experiments which are available over the Internet and can be divided into two main groups , software simulations and laboratories made up of real hardware equipment .']

entities: [[], [(u'decision-making', u'Task')], [(u'Comparison shopping agents', u'Method'), (u'online shopping experience', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'systems', u'Generic')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The huge growth of e-commerce has had a profound impact on users who can now choose from a vast number of options online .', u'Inevitably , as the number of choices has increased , so has the need for tools to help users organize , manage and utilize information on these for better decision-making .', u'Comparison shopping agents or shopbots can help users decide what to buy and enhance their online shopping experience .', u'However , despite the high expectations , the immense potential of shopbots has not been fully realized .', u'In this chapter , the author identifies the limitations and drawbacks of current shopbots , in particular , with regard to the underlying technology for building such systems .', u'She then discusses how these technical limitations can be overcome by making use of the Semantic Web and Web Services .', u'She also considers how shopbots can truly serve the user by providing personalized , impartial and flexible services .']

entities: [[(u'QoSaware services', u'Method'), (u'P2Pbased business process enactment framework', u'Method'), (u'workflow prototype', u'Method')], [(u'Design/methodology/approach', u'Method'), (u'eservice workflow', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'QoS specifications', u'Method'), (u'monitoring mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'P2P workflow framework', u'Method')], [(u'specifications', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web facilitators', u'Method'), (u'QoSOWL approach', u'Method'), (u'eservices', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'QoSOWL', u'Method'), (u'deliberation of geographic information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'eservices', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'business processes', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'dynamic online information system environment', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Purpose This paper aims to explore the feasible mining and proper selection of QoSaware services for a P2Pbased business process enactment framework , and enhance the relevant workflow prototype .', u'Design/methodology/approach Through observing and analysing unpredictable dynamic changes that commonly exist in eservice workflow , a set of QoS specifications and monitoring mechanisms in a P2P workflow framework is proposed .', u"These specifications are an evolving extension of services ' description with semantic web facilitators for P2Pbased eservices.Findings It has been demonstrated that the QoSOWL approach can be effectively used to describe and exploit eservices , particularly in a decentralised environment .", u"QoSOWL is also able to provide the deliberation of geographic information for eservices , and facilitates the peers ' effective cooperation and automates business processes .", u'It is recommended that the approach be adopted in the dynamic online information system environment to increase efficiency ...']

entities: [[(u'domain-suited ontology', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'semantic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Electronic Catalog', u'Material'), (u'e-commerce domain', u'Material')], [(u'business transactions', u'Task')], [(u'semantic relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'catalog domain', u'Material'), (u'ontological modeling of e-catalog', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'Task'), (u'semantic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'inferencing capability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'model', u'Generic')], [(u'EER', u'Method'), (u'model', u'Generic')], [(u'modeling construct', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'EER', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'domain-suited ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [(u'catalog domain', u'FEATURE-OF', u'semantic relationships')], [], [], [(u'DL', u'USED-FOR', u'modeling construct')], []]
sentences: [u'Building a domain-suited ontology , as a means to implement the Semantic Web , is widely believed to offer users the benefit of exploiting the semantic knowledge constrained in the application .', u'Electronic Catalog , shortly e-Catalog , manages the information about the goods or conditions play an important role in e-commerce domain .', u'Consequently , semantically enriched yet precise information by the ontology may elaborate the business transactions .', u'In this paper , we analyze the semantic relationships embodied within the catalog domain , as the first step towards the ontological modeling of e-catalog .', u'Exploring ontology should leverage not only the representation of semantic knowledge but also provide the inferencing capability for the model .', u'We employ the EER ( extended Entity Relationships ) for the basic model .', u'Each modeling construct can be directly translated by DL ( Description Logics ) .', u'Semantic constraints that can be hardly represented in EER are directly modeled in DL .']

entities: [[(u'E-learning', u'Task'), (u'learning resources personalized recommendation algorithm', u'Method'), (u'domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u"user 's preference similarity", u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic similarity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'learning objects', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'personalized learning resources recommendation system', u'Method'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'algorithm', u'PART-OF', u'personalized learning resources recommendation system')]]
sentences: [u"In E-learning , in order to satisfy users ' personalized demands for learning resources , in this paper we present a learning resources personalized recommendation algorithm based on semantic web technology.First of all , based on users ' evaluations and browsing behaviors of the learning resources , we define the learning resource set and core concept set for a user ; secondly , based on the relations of concepts in domain ontology , we obtain the user 's preference similarity by computing semantic similarity between the different users ' learning resource sets and core concept sets respectively.At last , we recommend collaboratively the learning resources according to the user 's preference similarity.In addition , the learning objects for management of learning resources can reduce the complexity of similarity computation.We applied this algorithm to the personalized learning resources recommendation system , the experiments show that the algorithm improved the effectiveness of the recommended learning resources , especially for new resources and new registered users ."]

sentences: [u'Answer Set Programming ( ASP ) is a declarative problem solving paradigm , rooted in Logic Programming and Nonmonotonic Reasoning , which has been gaining increasing attention during the last years .', u'This article is a gentle introduction to the subject ; it starts with motivation and follows the historical development of the challenge of defining a semantics for logic programs with negation .', u'It looks into positive programs over stratified programs to arbitrary programs , and then proceeds to extensions with two kinds of negation ( named weak and strong negation ) , and disjunction in rule heads .', u'The second part then considers the ASP paradigm itself , and describes the basic idea .', u'It shows some programming techniques and briefly overviews Answer Set solvers .', u'The third part is devoted to ASP in the context of the Semantic Web , presenting some formalisms and mentioning some applications in this area .', u'The article concludes with issues of current and future ASP research .']

sentences: [u'The goal of the series of studies is to examine through a survey the need a theoretical foundation and potentialities of Knowmatics and knowledge technology .', u'The objectives of the present study are : 1 ) to examine the effectiveness of Information Technology ( IT ) in knowledge processing ; and 2 ) to examine the need and possibility of developing a new technology for knowledge processing .', u'Based on the findings of the survey suggests the following : to give training and provide experience in advanced web technologies like data mining/XML/Semantic web , etc .', u'; to establish a new data mining/knowledge management technology considered as helpful in processing information into knowledge ; conduct awareness programmes about the need to develop new algorithms or software for knowledge processing different from those used for data processing ; and to include the subjects Structure and development of knowledge , Information economy and Information society in the educational courses for information professionals .']

entities: [[(u'Abstract Ontology', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Method')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'common and shared ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'terminological , syntactic and semantic heterogeneity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'matching system', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic')]]
sentences: [u'Abstract Ontology is a new paradigm introduced with the semantic web to describe in an explicit and formal way the various aspects of knowledge of a specific field .', u'For this purpose , a single ontology may not be comprehensive to represent all due to the lack of a common and shared ontology between communities .', u'Ontologies need to establish a number of interlinks to ensure communication between them , which is not always obvious because of their terminological , syntactic and semantic heterogeneity .', u'The proposed matching system aims to discover in an automatic way , the correspondence links between two intrinsically heterogeneous ontologies , through different techniques of calculations of similarity between their entities .It allows to reveal on one hand the issue of searching for the most relevant , coherent and meaningful alignments and on the other hand , to propose a new strategy that ensures flexibility and scalability of the system by the combination of the matchers .']

entities: [[(u'conceptual framework', u'Method'), (u'ontology based knowledge representation', u'Task'), (u'comorbidities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Paper based CP', u'Method'), (u'CP', u'Method'), (u'disease management', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'decision support purpose', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Representation of comorbidity CP', u'Task'), (u'OWL ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'merged ontology', u'Method'), (u'OWL reasoner', u'Method'), (u'CP mediated decision support', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Evaluation of recommendations', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'comorbidity scenarios', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'computerized CP', u'Material'), (u'clinical pragmatics', u'Material'), (u'medical correctness', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'conceptual framework', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology based knowledge representation')], [], [], [], [], [(u'OWL reasoner', u'USED-FOR', u'merged ontology'), (u'OWL reasoner', u'USED-FOR', u'CP mediated decision support')], [(u'comorbidity scenarios', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')], [(u'clinical pragmatics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'medical correctness')], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper we present a conceptual framework for ontology based knowledge representation and merging of Clinical Pathways ( CP ) of comorbidities .', u"Paper based CP are static documents which do not have adaptability to accommodate dynamic changes in a patient 's conditions , particularly in case of co-morbidity , since most CP are focused on a single disease management .", u'Our approach to computerize and merge CP of comorbidities for decision support purpose include ; 1 .', u'Representation of comorbidity CP as OWL ontologies , 2 .', u'Merging ontologies along common tasks , 3 .', u'Execution of merged ontology using OWL reasoner to provide CP mediated decision support , 4 .', u'Evaluation of recommendations by instantiating the ontology with comorbidity scenarios .', u'Most challenging and unique aspect of this research is that it involves the dynamic integration of computerized CP of two concurrent comorbid diseases , whilst maintaining clinical pragmatics and medical correctness .', u'We believe that Semantic Web has enormous potential to achieve this goal .']

sentences: [u'Establishing a geospatial cyberinfrastructure is essential for the future development of geospatial information systems and services .', u'Geospatial cyberinfrastructure will foster seamless integration of heterogeneous geospatial information , web-based mapping and geo-analytical services across the Internet .', u'This paper will first discuss the significance of geospatial cyberinfrastructure for the GIS community and highlight several underpinning techniques of geospatial cyberinfrastructure , including Grid computing , Web Services , OGC ( Open Geospatial Consortium ) interoperability standards and Semantic Web .', u'Emphasis is given to the discussion of developing intelligent and analytical geospatial information services in the geospatial cyberinfrastructure .', u'An analytical problem solving multi-tier architecture is proposed as a theoretical foundation for the geospatial cyberinfrastructure .', u'Part of the architecture is demonstrated by a simplified prototype which is used to test the feasibility of the proposed multi-tier geospatial cyberinfrastructure .', u'( 2006 ) COPYRIGHT SPIE -- The International Society for Optical Engineering .', u'Downloading of the abstract is permitted for personal use only .']

sentences: [u"The purpose of the paper is trying to summarize the international conference `` Noetics versus Computer Science : the New Structures of the Scientific Communication '' , held in Rome 19 to 20 November 2013 .", u'In the light of the epistemic conflict , as set out in the title , I tried to highlight the main conceptual issues emerged during the four working sessions , that suggest a careful reconsideration of the role of bibliography , library services and the traditional paradigms of information organization , especially in light of the latest trends related to the development of the semantic web , discovery tools , social networks , open access and digital libraries .', u'The emphasis is particularly on those contributions that have activated critical thinking about the current state and prospects of digital knowledge ecosystem , considering that it seems essential to adopt semantic ontologies , cognitive maps and indexical infrastructures that are able to explode the epistemological potential of the recorded knowledge .']

sentences: [u'Since the invention of Web , it became part of our daily life replacing the routine information search and effecting many activities which otherwise could have been done off-line without it .', u'It was a natural evolution of the web technology , which had started out as a simple test based pattern matching , to be based on the optimized match process for its multi-media Web environment , like still images , music and movies that we are to face today .', u'In this paper , we proposed and implemented the model which the multimedia resources can be efficiently shared in semantic web .', u'After converting multimedia resource information ( metadata ) into RDF , for efficient management , the model separate and allotment actual multimedia resource and corresponding metadata changed to RDF to each server .', u'The proposed model could be applied in all multimedia resources .', u'For easy explanation and implementation , however , we applied it to the digital photograph in example .']

sentences: [u'Ontology together with Semantic Web has a vital role in knowledge management on a global scale .', u'Since manual construction of ontology leads to complex , time consuming and inconsistent results , automatic construction of ontology is more preferred .', u'This consists of two phases , such as concept based retrieval and the generation of ontology .', u'The extraction of the semantic concept from unstructured input document is focused in this paper .', u'Semantic concepts can be extracted based on the analysis of a set of texts and using WordNet .', u'Challenges facing are finding of semantic relationships among concepts and elimination of irrelevant documents by identifying conceptual mismatches .', u'For each word in the text document , corresponding synonym , hyponym , and hypernym will be extracted from the WordNet .', u'These concepts and their relationships can be used to make the taxonomy for the automatic construction of ontology .', u'JDK and Net Beans IDE are used with WordNet for the implementation .']

sentences: [u"`` W3QL : A Query Language for the WWW '' , published in 1995 , presented a language with several distinctive features .", u'Employing existing indexes as access paths , it allowed the selection of documents using conditions on semi-structured documents and maintaining dynamic views of navigational queries .', u'W3QL was capable of automatically filling out forms and navigating through them .', u'Finally , in the SQL tradition , it was a declarative query language , that could be the subject of optimization.Ten years later , we examine some current trends in the domain of search , namely the emergence of system-level search services and of the semantic web .', u"In this context , we explore whether W3QL 's ideas are still relevant to help improve information search and retrieval .", u'We identify two main environments for searching , the enterprise and the web at large .', u'Both environments could benefit from database-inspired integration language , and an execution system that implements it .']

sentences: [u'We study fundamental aspects related to the efficient processing of the SPARQL query language for RDF , proposed by the W3C to encode machine-readable information in the Semantic Web .', u'Our key contributions are ( i ) a complete complexity analysis for all operator fragments of the SPARQL query language , which -- as a central result -- shows that the SPARQL operator Optional alone is responsible for the PSpace-completeness of the evaluation problem , ( ii ) a study of equivalences over SPARQL algebra , including both rewriting rules like filter and projection pushing that are well-known from relational algebra optimization as well as SPARQL-specific rewriting schemes , and ( iii ) an approach to the semantic optimization of SPARQL queries , built on top of the classical chase algorithm .', u'While studied in the context of a theoretically motivated set semantics , almost all results carry over to the official , bag-based semantics and therefore are of immediate practical relevance .']

relations: [[(u'bioprocess efficiency comparison', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'decision tasks'), (u'scientific literature', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'decision tasks')], [], [], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web methods')], [(u'data incompleteness', u'CONJUNCTION', u'variability')], [], [], [(u'Soft computing methods', u'USED-FOR', u'decision support systems')], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'pipeline')]]
sentences: [u'In decision tasks such as bioprocess efficiency comparison , scientific literature is a valuable source of data .', u'This large number of scientific data is heterogeneously structured , mainly in textual format .', u'Innovative tools able to integrate and treat constantly new information are required .', u'In this context , the use of semantic web methods such as ontologies seems relevant to structure the experimental information .', u'Imprecision and uncertainty can arise from data incompleteness and variability .', u'This is particularly true for processes involving biological materials .', u'Document reliability should also be considered .', u'Soft computing methods have the potential to be the kingpin of specialized software that can be integrated in decision support systems ( DSS ) intended to solve these issues .', u'This paper presents the implementation of a pipeline which permits to : ( 1 ) structure and integrate the experimental data of interest by using ontologies , ( 2 ) assess data source reliability , ( 3 ) compute and visualize indicators taking into account data imprecision .']

entities: [[(u'semantic annotation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology population', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'Web resources', u'Material'), (u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic annotation', u'Task')], [(u'Information Extraction tools', u'Method'), (u'IE )', u'Method'), (u'WS knowledge representation ones', u'Method')], [(u'tools', u'Generic')], [(u'mediator', u'Method'), (u'tags', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'IE tools', u'Method'), (u'formal representation', u'Method'), (u'semantic annotations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology instances', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'This thesis approaches the issues related to semantic annotation and ontology population within the framework defined by the Semantic Web .', u'The explicit representation of the contents of the Web resources is possible thanks to domain ontologies .', u'They model the concepts , their attributes and the relations used to annotate the contents of the documents .', u'And the knowledge base , associated with the ontology , must contain the instances to be used for semantic annotation .', u'The idea suggested here is to combine the Information Extraction tools ( IE ) with the WS knowledge representation ones for the tasks of annotation and population .', u'But there is currently a gap between the formats of representation used by these tools .', u'This thesis proposes to fill this gap by designing a mediator able to transform the tags generated by the IE tools into a more formal representation , being the semantic annotations or the ontology instances .']

sentences: [u'Interconnected and integrated electrical power systems , by their very dynamic nature are complex .', u'These multifaceted systems are subject to a host of challenges - aging infrastructure , generation availability near load centers , transmission expansion to meet growing demands , distributed resources , dynamic reactive compensation , congestion management , grid ownership vs. system operation , reliability coordination , supply and cost of natural resources for generation , etc .', u'Other types of challenges facing the industry today include balancing between resource adequacy , reliability , economics , environmental constraints , and other public purpose objectives to optimize transmission and distribution resources to meet the needs of the end users .', u'The goal is to provide a vision for a comprehensive and systematic approach to meeting the grid management challenges through new information services .', u'These services will have as the heart of their data streams a sensor web enablement that will make the grid a part of the semantic Web .']

sentences: [u'Abstract : The issue of combining ( noisy ) textual material ( the Web ) with semi-structured data ( like Wikipedia or slightly more structured data sources like IMDB ) is however an interesting line of research .', u'As many data sources , and in particular those being constructed as so-called Linked Open Data ( LOD ) , are naturally organized around entities , it would be reasonable to examine this problem in the context of entity retrieval .', u'To foster research in this direction , we introduced the new Entity List Completion ( ELC ) pilot task .', u'ELC is motivated by the same user scenario as REF , but with the main difference that entities are represented by their URIs in a Semantic Web crawl ( the Billion Triple Collection ) .', u'In addition , a small number of example entities ( defined by their URIs ) are made available as part of the topic definition .', u"Our goal is to turn this pilot task to an `` official '' task in 2011 ."]

sentences: [u'Automated annotation of web documents is a key challenge of the Se- mantic Web effort .', u'Semantic metadata can be created manually or using automated annotation or tagging tools .', u'Automated semantic annotation tools with best results are built on various machine learning algorithms which require training sets .', u'Other approach is to use pattern based semantic annotation solutions built on natural language processing , information retrieval or information extraction methods .', u'The paper presents Ontea platform for automated semantic annotation or semantic tag- ging .', u'Implementation based on regular expression patterns is presented with eval- uation of results .', u'Extensible architecture for integrating pattern based approaches is presented .', u'Most of existing semi-automatic annotation solutions can not prove it real usage on large scale data such as web or email communication , but semantic web can be exploited only when computer understandable metadata will reach critical mass .', u'Thus we also present approach to large scale pattern based annotation .']

sentences: [u'This paper suggests that as pervasive computing technologies have gained purchase in urban space they have also become more implicitly blended with everyday life and more contingent on information that is inductively compiled from Internet-based data services .', u'It is argued that existing theorizations of the technologically mediated production of urban must engage with the increasingly implicit nature of informational transactions as well as the emergent semantic structuring of information .', u'Drawing on examples of ongoing pervasive computing projects , implicit computing procedures are explored in relation to the mediation of everyday urban life .', u'Literatures from computing science and geographical theory are brought into conversation in order to examine the consequences of a convergence between implicit pervasive technologies and the spaces of everyday life .', u'Keywords : pervasive computing , semantic web , ambient information , inductive intelligence , anticipatory technology , locative technology , mobile technology , geosocial media , urban space , everyday life , production of space , relationality , spatial practice']

entities: [[(u'physical environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'information and device levels', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'interoperability platform', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web information sharing infrastructure', u'Method'), (u'Smart-M3', u'Method'), (u'Multi-part', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OSGi ( Open Service Gateway initiative ) framework', u'Method'), (u'information level interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'former', u'Generic'), (u'service level interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'interoperability platform', u'Method'), (u'ICT ) systems', u'Method'), (u'Smart Space Applications', u'Task')], [(u'maintenance scenario', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'The design of applications that may benefit from the data gathered from the surrounding physical environment represents a challenging and promising research field .', u'Because of the heterogeneity of such systems interoperability is becoming more difficult to achieve at the service , information and device levels .', u'In this paper , we report on the first attempt to design an interoperability platform by integrating a Semantic Web information sharing infrastructure , namely Smart-M3 ( Multi-part , Multi-device and Multi-vendor ) , within the OSGi ( Open Service Gateway initiative ) framework , enhancing the information level interoperability of the former with the service level interoperability of the latter .', u'Such an interoperability platform can grant the unanticipated evolution of existing Information and Communication Technology ( ICT ) systems by providing a generic and simple solution to develop what are generally called Smart Space Applications .', u'As proof of concept a maintenance scenario will be discussed and detailed .']

sentences: [u'Changes in an ontology may have a disruptive impact on any system using it .', u'This impact may depend on structural changes such as name changes or relations between concepts , or it may be related to a change in the expected performance of the reasoning tasks .', u'As the number of systems using ontologies is expected to increase this problem is likely to occur more frequently , and , given the open nature of the Semantic Web , new ontologies and modifications to existing ones are to be expected .', u'Dynamically handling these changes , without requiring human intervention , is a key requirement for successful applications .', u'This paper presents a system that isolates groups of related axioms in an OWL ontology , so that a change in one or more axioms can be automatically localised to a part of the ontology .', u'In addition , we report the results on evaluating the effectiveness of our approach on large ontologies .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic web document representation', u'Method'), (u'RDF/OWL', u'Method')], [(u'RDF representation', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'software agents', u'Method')], [(u'W3C', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'de facto query language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'Method')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'preposition', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RDF data source', u'Material'), (u'Triple pattern', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF repository', u'Method'), (u'Object Model', u'Method')], [(u'Predicate', u'Method')], [(u'information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'preposition', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Semantic web document representation is formulated using RDF/OWL .', u'RDF representation is in the form of triples & OWL in form of ontologies .', u'The above representation leads to a data set which needs to be queried using software agents , machines .', u'W3C has recommended SPARQL to be the de facto query language for RDF .', u'This paper proposes to suggest a model to enable SPARQL to make search efficient , easier and produce meaningful search distinguished on the basis of preposition .', u'An RDF data source primarily consist of data that is represented in the form of a Triple pattern which has an appropriate RDF syntax and further results into an RDF Graph .The RDF repository stores the Data on Subject , Predicate , Object Model .', u'The Predicate may also be thought of as a property linking the Subject and Object .', u'This paper shall evaluate the information retrieval by incorporating preposition as property .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web framework', u'Method'), (u'precedent modelling', u'Task')], [(u'theoretical models', u'Method'), (u'legal knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'rule interchange', u'Task'), (u'legal domain', u'Material'), (u'real legal documents', u'Material')], [(u'legal concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'argumentation patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'judicial text', u'Material')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'judicial concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology library', u'Material'), (u'argumentation system', u'Method'), (u'defeasible rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'metadata and ontology layers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'argumentation layers', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Carneades Argumentation System', u'Method'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'legal interpretations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reasoning path', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web framework', u'USED-FOR', u'precedent modelling')], [(u'legal knowledge representation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rule interchange'), (u'rule interchange', u'USED-FOR', u'legal domain')], [], [], [], [(u'Carneades Argumentation System', u'USED-FOR', u'legal interpretations')]]
sentences: [u'This paper presents part of a Semantic Web framework for precedent modelling .', u'The research applies theoretical models of legal knowledge representation and rule interchange for applications in the legal domain to a set of real legal documents .', u'The aim is to represent the legal concepts and the argumentation patterns contained in a judgement , as expressed by the judicial text .', u'The bases of the framework are a set of metadata associated with judicial concepts and an ontology library , providing a solid ground for an argumentation system based on defeasible rules .', u'The present paper shortly presents the metadata and ontology layers , focusing on the rules and argumentation layers .', u'In the example provided an application of the Carneades Argumentation System the framework reconstructs the legal interpretations performed by the judge in a specific judicial decision , presenting its reasoning path , and suggesting possible different interpretations in the light of relevant code- and case-law .']

entities: [[(u'semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'method', u'Generic'), (u'semantic reasoning', u'Method'), (u'DL reasoning', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'Task'), (u'ontology construction', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'DL reasoning', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic reasoning'), (u'DL reasoning', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology construction')]]
sentences: [u"With the rapid development of internet , the semantic Web is being doubly paid close attention as new generation Web , because semantic interpretation and reasoning are the keys to be solved in the semantic Web.In order to solve this problem , based on the concept and the principle of ontology language and description logic foundation , have brought forward one kind of new method : let the body express language and describe that the logic combines each other , be that semanteme speculate rationality and validity have provided guarantee thereby.The principle of semantic reasoning about DL is analyzed , and the issues are discussed such as the importance and implemental technologies of consistent test and subsuming test based on DL reasoning in the process of ontology construction.Finally , the fruits domain 's main body being taken as the example of ontology construction , the practical reasoning tasks about a constructs are performed and testified ."]

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web research', u'Method')], [(u'meaning of words', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'service exchange system', u'Method'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'thesauri', u'Method'), (u'semantic heterogeneity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'exchange system', u'Method'), (u'aglet platform', u'Method'), (u'secure aglet server SAS', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'exchange system', u'Method'), (u'prototyped pharmaceutical marketplace', u'Method'), (u'exchange system framework', u'Method')], [(u'prototype', u'Generic'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'intelligent information processing', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'thesauri', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic heterogeneity')], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'exchange system'), (u'aglet platform', u'USED-FOR', u'exchange system')], [(u'exchange system framework', u'USED-FOR', u'prototyped pharmaceutical marketplace')], [(u'prototype', u'USED-FOR', u'intelligent information processing'), (u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'intelligent information processing')]]
sentences: [u'Semantic Web research aims at bridging the gap between how humans and agents process information readily available on the Internet .', u'One of the great challenges to this goal lies in the fact that humans , contrary to agents , can extract the meaning of words based on its context .', u'This work introduces a service exchange system for the Web that allows agents to intelligently process information , as would humans .', u'This is achieved by the use of thesauri to help agents resolve semantic heterogeneity in the information being processed .', u'The framework for the exchange system has been realized under the aglet platform on the secure aglet server SAS , thus providing it with a secure execution environment .', u'This article discusses the exchange system and presents a prototyped pharmaceutical marketplace built using the exchange system framework .', u'The prototype showcases the ability of the system to support intelligent information processing by agents and humans alike .']

entities: [[(u'Web-searching and -mining tools', u'Method'), (u'link analysis', u'Method'), (u'ranking and crawling algorithms', u'Method')], [(u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'link information', u'Material'), (u'lexical and semantic Web content', u'Material')], [(u'link-content conjecture', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'link-cluster conjecture', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'conjectures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web search tools', u'Method'), (u'assumptions', u'Generic')], [(u'Web-mining techniques', u'Method'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'crawling algorithms', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'link analysis', u'USED-FOR', u'Web-searching and -mining tools'), (u'link analysis', u'USED-FOR', u'ranking and crawling algorithms')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Recent Web-searching and -mining tools are combining text and link analysis to improve ranking and crawling algorithms .', u'The central assumption behind such approaches is that there is a correlation between the graph structure of the Web and the text and meaning of pages .', u'Here I formalize and empirically evaluate two general conjectures drawing connections from link information to lexical and semantic Web content .', u'The link-content conjecture states that a page is similar to the pages that link to it , and the link-cluster conjecture that pages about the same topic are clustered together .', u'These conjectures are often simply assumed to hold , and Web search tools are built on such assumptions .', u'The present quantitative confirmation sheds light on the connection between the success of the latest Web-mining techniques and the small world topology of the Web , with encouraging implications for the design of better crawling algorithms .']

sentences: [u'This article presents a method for ontology construction and its application in developing an ontology in the domain of natural gas pipeline operations .', u'Both the method , as well as the application ontology developed , contribute to the infrastructure of Semantic Web that provides semantic foundation for supporting information processing by autonomous software agents .', u'This article presents the processes of knowledge acquisition and ontology construction for developing a knowledge-based decision support system for monitoring and control of natural gas pipeline operations .', u'Knowledge on the problem domain was acquired and analyzed using the Inferential Modeling Technique ; then the analyzed knowledge was organized into an application ontology and represented in the Knowledge Modeling System .', u'Since an ontology is an explicit specification of a conceptualization that provides a comprehensive foundation specification of knowledge in a domain , it provides semantic clarifications for autonomous software agents that process information on the Internet .']

sentences: [u'In web-based collaborative systems practitioners can share messages about their problems on daily work activities .', u'These messages can also be used for analytical purposes .', u'This possibility depends on a proper classification and adequate recovery of the messages regarding semantic and pragmatic aspects .', u'The construction of a knowledge representation model that considers the pragmatic aspects of the messages is still an open research challenge .', u"We argue that a model of this nature must include the association of semantics with illocutionary aspects of the users ' communication .", u'This paper proposes an ontology using Semantic Web ( SemWeb ) standards to associate messages to illocutions and ontology terms , as an integrated representation .', u'The proposed model is grounded in the Pragmatic Web ( PragWeb ) perspective including Semiotics and Speech Act Theory ( SAT ) .', u'Furthermore , we conduct a case study with scenarios of two different systems , where special education specialists share problems of their daily work activi ...']

sentences: [u'After the institution of cyberspace in the 1990s , the Web has become its main construct and has been folding and unfolding in several directions : Invisible Web , Visible Web , Semantic Web , Pragmatic Web , Web 2.0 or Social , among others .', u'In particular , the Invisible Web , according to the authors who write on the subject , there is a disturbing question : what to call this ( un ) territory ?', u'Invisible Web , Deep , Hidden , Dark ?', u'From understanding the concept of fold , created by Leibniz and reframed by Deleuze , which explains the machinic assemblages and pragmatic view of the technical aspects of semiotics and material , a conceptual exploration of the Invisible Web and of some search engines was made that make the fold with these webs in cyberspace .', u'Going beyond the literature , a Web truly dark was discovered , DarkWeb , parallel and underground , used for good and for evil , as expected of the human species .']

entities: [[(u'Digital libraries and archives', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web ( SW )', u'Method'), (u'end-user functions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'`` Image Preser- vation', u'Metric'), (u'Information Systems', u'Task'), (u'digital library application', u'Task'), (u'semantically modeled data', u'Material')], [(u'library and archive scenarios', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'photographic prints', u'Material'), (u'negatives', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'drawings', u'Material'), (u'periodicals', u'Material'), (u'books', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'processing information', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'user interface', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user input', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'model', u'Generic')], [(u'problem', u'Generic'), (u'full-text search mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'record display configuration', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Digital libraries and archives stand to benefit greatly from the Semantic Web ( SW ) , which may provide a basis for novel end-user functions targeted at research and teaching .', u"The project `` Image Preser- vation , Information Systems , Access and Research '' seeks to develop an adaptable digital library application based on a back-end of semantically modeled data .", u"By `` adaptable '' we mean able to adapt to diverse library and archive scenarios , especially involving the integration of dierent types of material ( photographic prints , negatives , drawings , periodicals , books , etc . )", u'in a single system .', u'A problem we have encountered is : the design of algorithms for processing information as it moves from the model to the user interface , and , following user input , from the interface back into the model .', u'In this paper we discuss two specific issues that are encompassed by this general problem : full-text search mechanisms and record display configuration .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'Material'), (u'life and clinical sciences', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'Domain experts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge', u'Generic')], [(u'model exploration', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology engineers', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'life and clinical sciences', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Ontologies play an increasingly important role in areas such as the life and clinical sciences and the Semantic Web .', u'Domain experts , i.e .', u'biologists and clinicians , build and re-use ( parts of ) ontologies , and make use of reasoners to explicate some of the knowledge captured in an ontology .', u'Understanding this knowledge is a highly complex task for which some tool support has recently become available , yet it has also become clear that more support is needed .', u'The goal of this work was to investigate whether model exploration , i.e .', u'the interactive generation and presentation of models of an ontology , can be used to help ontology engineers understand the knowledge captured in an ontology .', u'In order to achieve this goal , a Protege 4 plug-in supporting generation of and interaction with models was implemented .', u'In addition , a pilot study was carried out to evaluate its effectiveness in supporting users in understanding an ontology .']

sentences: [u'Nowadays , ontology is being studied on the various parts .', u'Especially , as the study on the semantic Web has actively progressed , the applicable range of the ontology is getting wide .', u'At the result , many ontologies are existed in the web .', u'Based on this theory , several problems happened on the ontology side .', u'Among these problems , the significant issue is how to address the heterogeneity and consistency between the ontologies that were made about the same domain .', u'In this paper , we give the possibility for building the ontology automatically based on the existing knowledge data .', u'And we could expect to address the problem of the ontology reliability .', u'In this paper , we suggest the new methodology for building the ontology automatically based on the WordNet and we design and implement the automatic ontology building system .', u'Thus , we could expect that the users are able to build the ontology more consistently and easily .']

entities: [[(u'semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'MOJOHON architecture', u'Method'), (u'message exchanging', u'Task')], [(u'S-MOJOHON', u'Method'), (u'distributed application', u'Task'), (u'abstraction', u'Task'), (u'communication facilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'context information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'S-MOJOHON', u'Method'), (u'multimedia flow', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'autonomous systems', u'Method')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF documents', u'Material'), (u'semantic web framework', u'Method'), (u'reasoning engine', u'Method')], [(u'S-MOJOHON', u'Method'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'context information')], [(u'S-MOJOHON', u'USED-FOR', u'proofof-concept implementation')], [(u'semantic web framework', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF documents'), (u'semantic web framework', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reasoning engine')], []]
sentences: [u'This paper presents our efforts on adding semantic information to our MOJOHON architecture creating S- MOJOHON - Semantic , Modular , Java-oriented and Hostile NAT-proof - middleware for message exchanging .', u'We developed S-MOJOHON aiming at allowing the communication among two or more instances of a distributed application while maintaining a high level of abstraction with respect to the communication facilities available and exploiting context information provided by an ontology .', u'In our proofof-concept implementation , we use S-MOJOHON to select a rendezvous point for a multimedia flow using information about which autonomous systems it belongs to and its uptime .', u'We represent these information using an ontology developed by us , which produces RDF documents that are handled by a semantic web framework and a reasoning engine .', u'In preliminary tests , S-MOJOHON were able to successfully select the best rendezvous point considering information provided by the knowledge base .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web knowledge representation standards', u'Method'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'Material')], [(u'knowledge representation formalisms', u'Method'), (u'logical entailment', u'Method'), (u'central design criterion', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'decidable formalisms', u'Method')], [], [(u'undecidable formalisms', u'Method'), (u'first-order predicate logic', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology language OWL 2', u'Material'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'role model', u'Method'), (u'knowledge representation formalisms', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web knowledge representation standards'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web knowledge representation standards')], [], [], [], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge representation formalisms'), (u'role model', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge representation formalisms'), (u'Conceptual Structures community', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge representation formalisms')]]
sentences: [u'Semantic Web knowledge representation standards such as RDF and OWL have gained momentum in the last years and are widely applied today .', u'In the course of the standardization process of these and other knowledge representation formalisms , decidability of logical entailment has often been advocated as a central design criterion .', u'On the other hand , restricting to decidable formalisms inevitably comes with constraints in terms of modeling power .', u'Therefore , in this paper , we examine the requirement of decidability and weigh its importance in different scenarios .', u'Subsequently , we discuss a way to establish incomplete - yet useful - reasoning support for undecidable formalisms by deploying machinery from the successful domain of theorem proving in first-order predicate logic .', u'While elaborating on the undecidable variants of the ontology language OWL 2 as our primary examples , we argue that this approach could likewise serve as a role model for knowledge representation formalisms from the Conceptual Structures community .']

relations: [[(u'Description logics', u'USED-FOR', u'real-life applications')], [(u'implementation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'applications')], [(u'description logics', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge representation systems')], [(u'ontology languages', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web')], [(u'knowledge representation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'artificial intelligence courses')]]
sentences: [u'Description logics are embodied in several knowledge-based systems and are used to develop various real-life applications .', u'Now in paperback , The Description Logic Handbook provides a thorough account of the subject , covering all aspects of research in this field , namely : theory , implementation , and applications .', u'Its appeal will be broad , ranging from more theoretically oriented readers , to those with more practically oriented interests who need a sound and modern understanding of knowledge representation systems based on description logics .', u'As well as general revision throughout the book , this new edition presents a new chapter on ontology languages for the semantic web , an area of great importance for the future development of the web .', u'In sum , the book will serve as a unique resource for the subject , and can also be used for self-study or as a reference for knowledge representation and artificial intelligence courses .']

entities: [[(u'online data sets', u'Material'), (u'hardware platforms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'set-top boxes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mobile phones', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'user model', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'iFanzy', u'Method'), (u'context-sensitive personalized TV guide', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user model', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web techniques', u'Method'), (u'activities', u'Generic')], [(u"'cold start ' problem", u'Task'), (u'user data', u'Material'), (u'iFanzy online applications', u'Task')], [(u'background ontological knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'imported concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'iFanzy', u'Method'), (u'user model', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'With the rising integration of more and more online data sets with various hardware platforms , such as set-top boxes , mobile phones , it becomes increasingly crucial to have intelligent systems guiding the user through the maze of data .', u'A necessity in such systems is a comprehensive user model which allows the system to know how and what the user might expect .', u"In iFanzy , a context-sensitive personalized TV guide , we amass such a user model by monitoring the user 's actions and behavior and extensively making use of Semantic Web techniques to interpret these activities and offer in the right moment the right content to the user .", u"We focus on solving the 'cold start ' problem by importing user data from external to iFanzy online applications .", u'This is realized by exploiting background ontological knowledge to map the imported concepts , so that iFanzy can minimize the effort in accumulating a complete user model .']

entities: [[(u'Web environment', u'Task')], [(u'methodologies', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'information medium', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'machine point of view', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'upgrade', u'Generic'), (u'Web automation capabilities', u'Task')], [(u'digitalised multimedia', u'Material'), (u'Internet adventure', u'Material')], [], [(u'broker component', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web layered architecture', u'Method')], [], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'Intellectual Property Rights ( IPR ) domain', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'New approaches in the Web environment are underway .', u'These new methodologies try to leverage it from an information medium to a knowledgeable level , from a machine point of view .', u'This upgrade , mainly focused on improving Web automation capabilities , can solve some of the problems derived from its widespread adoption .', u'Among them , the necessity of a framework to manage the enormous market of digitalised multimedia and to ensure that all the intervening actors get a satisfactory experience from the Internet adventure .', u'An application under development is described and future plans in this direction are presented .', u'A broker component has already been implemented applying a Semantic Web layered architecture .', u'Its mission is to mediate in a restricted community of digital video providers and distributors , benefiting also final purchasers .', u'The intention is to use it as a test bed for this promising initiative and its application in the Intellectual Property Rights ( IPR ) domain .']

sentences: [u'Current web search mostly relies on the keywords in the web pages .', u'This method lacks of semantics ii many ways .', u"For example , a search for a person by the person 's name means to find the web pages that contain the text of the name .", u'On the contrary , search semantic is to find the information about the person in the real world .', u'It is hard to achieve this goal in current content based web search engines because text is not useful during inference .', u'The semantic web brings semantic to current web with formalized knowledge and data that computers can process .', u'Therefore search can be benefit from the inference which is supported by ontology .', u'In this paper , we propose a novel method to enhance the search semantic using ontology language DAML+OIL .', u'Experiment shows preferable results comparing to the traditional search .', u'The conclusion and future work will also be discussed in this paper .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'identifier', u'Generic')], [(u'problem', u'Generic'), (u'referential integrity', u'Metric'), (u'ontology-based knowledge service', u'Method')], [(u'coreference management service', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology based knowledge service', u'Method'), (u'CoPs )', u'Method'), (u'coreference management system', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'UK computer science departments', u'Material'), (u'generic web-accessible ontology', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'heuristics', u'USED-FOR', u'coreference management system')], []]
sentences: [u'The diversity and distributed nature of the resources available in the semantic web poses significant challenges when these are used to help automatically build an ontology .', u'One persistent and pervasive problem is that of the resolution or elimination of coreference that arises when more than one identifier is used to refer to the same resource .', u'Tackling this problem is crucial for the referential integrity , and subsequently the quality of results , of any ontology-based knowledge service .', u'We have built a coreference management service to be used alongside the population and maintenance of an ontology .', u'An ontology based knowledge service that identifies communities of practice ( CoPs ) is also used to maintain the heuristics used in the coreference management system .', u'This approach is currently being applied in a large scale experiment harvesting resources from various UK computer science departments with the aim of building a large , generic web-accessible ontology .']

entities: [[(u"Mobile agents ' applications", u'Task')], [(u'They', u'Generic')], [(u'mobile agents', u'Method'), (u'reasoning process', u'Method'), (u'detecting suspect situations', u'Task')], [(u'formal ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'agent migration', u'Method'), (u'reasoning process', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic')], [(u'reasoning', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web techniques', u'Method'), (u'mapping ontologies', u'Task')], [(u'mapping process', u'Method'), (u'semantic relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'adaptation policies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'reasoning process', u'USED-FOR', u'mobile agents')], [(u'formal ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u"agents ' execution context")], [], [(u'semantic web techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning'), (u'semantic web techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'mapping ontologies')], []]
sentences: [u"Mobile agents ' applications have to operate within environments having continuously changing execution conditions that are not easily predictable .", u"They have to dynamically adapt to changes in their context resulting from other 's activities and resources variation .", u'To be aware of their execution context , mobile agents require a formal and structured model of the context and a reasoning process for detecting suspect situations .', u"In this work , we use formal ontologies to model the agents ' execution context as well as its composing elements .", u'After each agent migration , a reasoning process is carried out upon these ontologies to detect meaningful environmental changes .', u'This reasoning is based on semantic web techniques for mapping ontologies .', u'The output of the mapping process is a set of semantic relations among the ontologies concepts that will be used by the agent to trigger a reconfiguration of its structure according to some adaptation policies .']

sentences: [u'The Semantic Web has motivated many communities to provide data in a machinereadable format .', u'However , the available data has not been utilized to far to the extent possible .', u'The data , which has been created by a large number of people , is dispersed across the Web .', u'Creating the data without central coordination results in RDF of varying quality and makes it obligatory to cleanse the collected data before integration .', u'The SECO system presented in this paper harvests RDF files from the Web and consolidates the different data sets into a coherent representation aligned along an internal schema .', u'SECO provides interfaces for humans to browse and for software agents to query the data repository .', u'In this paper , we describe the characteristics of RDF data available online , the architecture and implementation of the SECO application , and discuss some of the experienced gained while collecting and integrating RDF on the Web .']

entities: [[(u'Abstract Semantic annotation of named entities', u'Task'), (u'enriching unstructured content', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'Natural Language Processing applications', u'Task')], [(u'them', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'hybrid method', u'Method'), (u'heuristics', u'Method'), (u'statistics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'named entity disambiguation', u'Task')], [(u'disambiguation process', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'robust entity disambiguation system', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Abstract Semantic annotation of named entities for enriching unstructured content is a critical step in development of Semantic Web and many Natural Language Processing applications .', u'To this end , this paper addresses the named entity disambiguation problem that aims at detecting entity mentions in a text and then linking them to entries in a knowledge base .', u'In this paper , we propose a hybrid method , combining heuristics and statistics , for named entity disambiguation .', u'The novelty is that the disambiguation process is incremental and includes several rounds that filter the candidate referents , by exploiting previously identified entities and extending the text by those entity attributes every time they are successfully resolved in a round .', u'Experiments are conducted to evaluate and show the advantages of the proposed method .', u'The experiment results show that our approach achieves high accuracy and can be used to construct a robust entity disambiguation system .']

entities: [[(u'Live Social Semantics', u'Method'), (u'social networking', u'Task')], [(u'application', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'online social networks', u'Method'), (u'face-to-face contact sensing platform', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'real-world networking activities', u'Task')], [(u'application', u'Generic')], [(u'Live Social Semantics application', u'Task'), (u'Web 2.0 sources', u'Material'), (u'Profiles of Interest', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'accuracy of profiles', u'Metric'), (u'external social networking sites', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user questionnaires', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'The Live Social Semantics is an innovative application that encourages and guides social networking between researchers at conferences and similar events .', u'The application integrates data from the Semantic Web , online social networks , and a face-to-face contact sensing platform .', u'It helps researchers to find like-minded and influential researchers , to identify and meet people in their community of practice , and to capture and later retrace their real-world networking activities .', u'The application was successfully deployed at two international conferences , attracting more than 300 users in total .', u'This paper describes the Live Social Semantics application , with a focus on how data from Web 2.0 sources can be used to automatically generate Profiles of Interest .', u'We evaluate and discuss the results of its two deployments , assessing the accuracy of profiles generated , the willingness to link to external social networking sites , and the feedback given through user questionnaires .']

sentences: [u'This article will focus on music indexing and retrieval from different points of view .', u'Four elements will be examined : music metadata , indexing and retrieval methods ( classic indexing , collaborative indexing and social tagging ) , tools and users .', u'Regarding the users , we will look at their access modes , their possible participation in indexing , and their music information-seek ing behaviors .', u'Do they look for music information in pay-for-music sites ( iTunes ) , radio stations , blogs , or social networks ( MySpace , YouTube , etc ) ?', u'The question we raise is which music information systems would be suitable in a social web era .', u'An evaluation of the existing indexing and retrieval modes was conducted .', u'It was based on both quantitative and qualitative approaches .', u'Our research methodology used interviews , online questionnaires and semi-directed questionnaires .', u'We believe that the results of our evaluation will be useful for music information indexing in a Socio-Semantic Web context .']

entities: [[(u'Textual Knowledge Flow', u'Method'), (u'intelligent browsing', u'Task')], [], [(u'Element Fuzzy Cognitive Maps', u'Method'), (u'semantic influences of relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'E-FCMs library', u'Material')], [(u'semantic similarity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'TKF', u'Method'), (u"user 's browsing behavior", u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'browsing path of topics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'method', u'Generic')], [(u'TKF based topic browsing', u'Task'), (u'intelligent browsing', u'Task'), (u'knowledge grid', u'Task'), (u'semantic Web', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'TKF based topic browsing', u'USED-FOR', u'intelligent browsing'), (u'intelligent browsing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'knowledge grid'), (u'intelligent browsing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic Web'), (u'knowledge grid', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic Web')]]
sentences: [u'Textual Knowledge Flow ( TKF ) provides an effective technique and theoretical support for intelligent browsing .', u'In order to realize the intelligent browsing of topics in Web or Library , TKF based intelligent browsing of topics is proposed .', u'Firstly , topics are represented by Element Fuzzy Cognitive Maps ( E-FCMs ) ; then semantic values of concepts and semantic influences of relations are calculated based on their frequencies and weights in E-FCMs library .', u'Thirdly , semantic similarity degrees between topics are calculated for building the Semantic Link Network ( SLN ) .', u"Fourthly , with the help of SLN and user 's demand , TKF between similar topics is activated as browsing path of topics to guide user 's browsing behavior .", u'Experimental results show that the browsing path of topics is easy to be built by the proposed method .', u'TKF based topic browsing has a brilliant perspective in the applications of intelligent browsing , knowledge grid and semantic Web .']

entities: [[(u'ontology-based approach', u'Method'), (u'data quality inference', u'Task'), (u'streaming observation data', u'Material'), (u'large-scale sensor networks', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'river basin monitoring program', u'Method'), (u'Intelligent River', u'Material')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'data quality evaluation', u'Task'), (u'ontology-based inference methods', u'Method')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'semantic inference', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'publish/subscribe messaging middleware', u'Method'), (u'data quality inference', u'Task'), (u'real-time data streams', u'Material')], [(u'semantic web software framework', u'Method')], [(u'sensor data traffic rates', u'Metric'), (u'inference software agents', u'Method')], [(u'data quality inference', u'Task'), (u'semantic sensor network paradigm', u'Method'), (u'large-scale sensor networks', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'ontology-based approach', u'USED-FOR', u'data quality inference'), (u'large-scale sensor networks', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology-based approach')], [(u'river basin monitoring program', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'approach'), (u'Intelligent River', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'river basin monitoring program')], [(u'methods', u'USED-FOR', u'data quality evaluation'), (u'methods', u'COMPARE', u'ontology-based inference methods')], [(u'semantic inference', u'PART-OF', u'publish/subscribe messaging middleware')], [], [], [(u'semantic sensor network paradigm', u'USED-FOR', u'data quality inference'), (u'semantic sensor network paradigm', u'USED-FOR', u'large-scale sensor networks')]]
sentences: [u'This paper presents an ontology-based approach for data quality inference on streaming observation data originating from large-scale sensor networks .', u'We evaluate this approach in the context of an existing river basin monitoring program called the Intelligent River .', u'Our current methods for data quality evaluation are compared with the ontology-based inference methods described in this paper .', u'We present an architecture that incorporates semantic inference into a publish/subscribe messaging middleware , allowing data quality inference to occur on real-time data streams .', u'Our preliminary benchmark results indicate delays of 100ms for basic data quality checks based on an existing semantic web software framework .', u'We demonstrate how these results can be maintained under increasing sensor data traffic rates by allowing inference software agents to work in parallel .', u'These results indicate that data quality inference using the semantic sensor network paradigm is viable solution for data intensive , large-scale sensor networks .']
