sentences: [u'Specifying clear quality of service ( QoS ) agreements between service providers and consumers is particularly important for the successful deployment of service-oriented architectures .', u'The related challenges include correctly elaborating and monitoring QoS contracts ( SLA : service level agreement ) to detect and handle their violations .', u'In this paper , first , we study and analyze existing SLA-related models .', u'Then , we elaborate a complete , generic and semantically richer ontology-based model of SLA .', u'We used the Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) to express SLA obligations in our model .', u'This language facilitates the SLA monitoring process and the eventual action triggering in case of violations .', u'We used this model to automatically generate semantic-enabled QoS obligations monitors .', u'We have also developed a prototype to validate our model and our monitoring approach .', u'Finally , we believe that this work is a step ahead to the total automation of the SLA management process .']

entities: [[(u'entity coreference algorithm', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web instances', u'Task')], [(u'context information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'context information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF graph', u'Method')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'neighborhood graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'URIs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'domain-independent matches', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'discriminability of triples', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'distance-based discounting approach', u'Method')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic')], [(u'triple discrimination', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'entity coreference algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web instances')], [], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'instance categories', u'USED-FOR', u'algorithm')], [(u'triple discrimination', u'CONJUNCTION', u'discounting approaches')]]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we present a novel entity coreference algorithm for Semantic Web instances .', u'The key issues include how to locate context information and how to utilize the context appropriately .', u'To collect context information , we select a neighborhood ( consisting of triples ) of each instance from the RDF graph .', u'To determine the similarity between two instances , our algorithm computes the similarity between comparable property values in the neighborhood graphs .', u'The similarity of distinct URIs and blank nodes is computed by comparing their outgoing links .', u'To provide the best possible domain-independent matches , we examine an appropriate way to compute the discriminability of triples .', u'To reduce the impact of distant nodes , we explore a distance-based discounting approach .', u'We evaluated our algorithm using different instance categories in two datasets .', u'Our experiments show that the best results are achieved by including both our triple discrimination and discounting approaches .']

entities: [[(u'sensors', u'Generic'), (u'sensor networks', u'Method')], [(u'sensor network deployments', u'Method'), (u'communication', u'Task')], [(u'large-scale pervasive systems', u'Method'), (u'sensor networks', u'Method')], [(u'aggregating sensor data', u'Task'), (u'levels', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'units', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rates', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'resolutions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'pervasive sensor network search environment', u'Method'), (u'natural language processing', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'Material')], [(u'natural language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'domain-specific natural language queries', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'sensor networks', u'USED-FOR', u'diverse environments')], [(u'communication', u'CONJUNCTION', u'communication and data storage')], [], [(u'levels', u'CONJUNCTION', u'units'), (u'levels', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rates'), (u'units', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rates'), (u'rates', u'CONJUNCTION', u'resolutions')], [(u'natural language processing', u'USED-FOR', u'pervasive sensor network search environment'), (u'natural language processing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web'), (u'semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'pervasive sensor network search environment')], [], [], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'domain-specific natural language queries')]]
sentences: [u'As sensors become more affordable , sensor networks are increasingly deployed to monitor diverse environments .', u'However , these sensor network deployments often utilize different standards for communication and data storage .', u'As a result , it is challenging to build large-scale pervasive systems able to find , query , and analyze information across a diverse set of sensor networks .', u'Additionally , aggregating sensor data from various sources is difficult because data can be sampled using different levels , units , rates , and resolutions .', u'To address these challenges , we have developed a pervasive sensor network search environment based on natural language processing and the semantic web .', u'By using natural language , we can understand the context of the query and use semantic rules about the data to aggregate and transform data to more useful results .', u'To demonstrate the system , we have deployed the environment in two application domains .', u'In each domain , the system successfully answers domain-specific natural language queries .']

entities: [[(u'Internet network', u'Method')], [], [(u'web', u'Material')], [(u'content sharing', u'Task')], [], [(u'smart web', u'Method')], [(u'Web 3.0', u'Task'), (u'semantic web definition', u'Method')], [(u'web', u'Material'), (u'E-Tourism', u'Method'), (u'business models', u'Method')], [(u'web evolution', u'Task'), (u'E-Tourism', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'semantic web definition', u'USED-FOR', u'Web 3.0')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The most important event following the establishmenet of the Internet network was the Web introduced by Tim Berners-Lee .', u'Websites give their owners features that allow sharing with which they can publish their content with users and visitors .', u'In the last 5 years , we have seen some changes in the use of web .', u'Users want to participate in content sharing and they like to interact with each other .', u'This is known as Web 2.0 .', u'In the last year , Web 2.0 has reached maturity and now we need a smart web which will be accordingly be called Web 3.0 .', u'Web 3.0 is based on semantic web definition .', u'Changing the way of using the web has had a clear impact on E-Tourism and its development and also on business models .', u'In this paper , we review the definitions and describe the impacts of web evolution on E-Tourism .']

entities: [[(u'methodologies', u'Generic'), (u'information system development', u'Task'), (u'Web paradigm', u'Method')], [(u'Web Information Systems', u'Method'), (u'Web technologies', u'Method'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'Hera', u'Method'), (u'model-driven methodology', u'Method'), (u'WIS design', u'Method'), (u'integration', u'Task'), (u'data retrieval', u'Task'), (u'presentation generation', u'Task')], [(u'Integration', u'Task'), (u'data retrieval', u'Task'), (u'Web sources', u'Material'), (u'user query', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Presentation generation', u'Task'), (u'theWeb or hypermedia presentation format', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'processes', u'Generic'), (u'data transformations', u'Task'), (u'RDF ( S ) models', u'Method')], [(u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'WIS design', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web Information Systems', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'methodologies', u'USED-FOR', u'information system development'), (u'Web paradigm', u'USED-FOR', u'systems')], [(u'Web technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'Web Information Systems')], [(u'Hera', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'model-driven methodology'), (u'Hera', u'USED-FOR', u'WIS design'), (u'model-driven methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'WIS design'), (u'integration', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data retrieval'), (u'data retrieval', u'CONJUNCTION', u'presentation generation')], [(u'Integration', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data retrieval')], [], [], [(u'RDF ( S )', u'USED-FOR', u'WIS design')]]
sentences: [u'As a consequence of the success of the Web , methodologies for information system development need to consider systems that use the Web paradigm .', u'These Web Information Systems ( WIS ) use Web technologies to retrieve information from the Web and to deliver information in a Web presentation to the users .', u'Hera is a model-driven methodology supporting WIS design , focusing on the processes of integration , data retrieval , and presentation generation .', u'Integration and data retrieval gather from Web sources the data that composes the result of a user query .', u"Presentation generation produces theWeb or hypermedia presentation format for the query result , such that the presentation and specifically its navigation suits the user 's browser .", u'We show how in Hera all these processes lead to data transformations based on RDF ( S ) models .', u'Proving the value of RDF ( S ) for WIS design , we pave the way for the development of Semantic Web Information Systems .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic relatedness', u'Method'), (u'semantic relationships', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic relatedness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Natural Language Processing', u'Task'), (u'Information Retrieval', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'policy based ranking of documents', u'Task'), (u'ontology tree', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic computation', u'Task')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'ranking documents', u'Task')], [(u'ontology concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ranking algorithm', u'Method')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ranking algorithm', u'Method'), (u'user query', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Natural Language Processing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Information Retrieval'), (u'Information Retrieval', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web')], [], [(u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'ranking documents')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic relatedness measures the degree to which some words or concepts are related , considering possible semantic relationships among them .', u'Semantic relatedness is of great interest in different areas , such as Natural Language Processing , Information Retrieval , or the Semantic Web .', u'This paper proposes policy based ranking of documents , where policy directs which path of the ontology tree is to be considered for semantic computation .', u'An algorithm for ranking documents according to their relevance to a query is used .', u'The given query is expanded based on the ontology concepts and the given polices .', u'As the policy changes , the concept set used for the ranking algorithm varies .', u'Depending on the requirements , using the same ontology , documents can be ranked differently based on the policies which in turn depend on the structure of the ontology .', u'A ranking algorithm calculates the similarity degree of each document with respect to the user query .']

entities: [[(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'semantic query answering', u'Task')], [(u'answering queries', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Description Logic formalisms', u'Method'), (u'worst-case complexity', u'Metric')], [(u'problem', u'Generic'), (u'fuzzy ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy DLs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'human-like expression', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approximate reasoning', u'Method')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'query rewriting', u'Task'), (u'crisp query processing', u'Task')], [(u'query rewriting', u'Task'), (u'query Q', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'assertional level', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Query rewriting', u'Task'), (u'fuzzy knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'query rewriting', u'Task'), (u'fuzzy OWL2EL ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rule based reasoning', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'ontologies', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web'), (u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic query answering'), (u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic query answering')], [(u'Description Logic formalisms', u'USED-FOR', u'answering queries')], [(u'fuzzy ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'problem'), (u'human-like expression', u'CONJUNCTION', u'approximate reasoning')], [(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'query rewriting'), (u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'crisp query processing'), (u'query rewriting', u'USED-FOR', u'crisp query processing')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'query rewriting')], [(u'Query rewriting', u'USED-FOR', u'fuzzy knowledge base')], [(u'query rewriting', u'USED-FOR', u'fuzzy OWL2EL ontologies')]]
sentences: [u'The use of ontologies in the Semantic Web allows for semantic query answering .', u'The problem of answering queries in term of ontologies defined using Description Logic formalisms suffers from high worst-case complexity .', u'The problem becomes more complex with fuzzy ontologies as fuzzy DLs should allow human-like expression and approximate reasoning .', u'Many approaches for query rewriting have been proposed for enhancing crisp query processing .', u'Given a query Q , the most common approach to query rewriting is the use of the terminological level of the knowledge base in order to define a query Q that can be correctly evaluated on the assertional level only .', u'Query rewriting for fuzzy knowledge base is not well treated in the literature .', u'In this paper , we discuss different aspects of query rewriting for fuzzy OWL2EL ontologies and we propose to use rule based reasoning and views to enhance this process .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u"`` Web of Trust ''", u'Material')], [], [(u'web mining approach', u'Method'), (u'social network', u'Method')], [(u'edge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'search engine', u'Method')], [(u'edge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'classification rules', u'Method'), (u'page content', u'Material')], [(u'RDF format', u'Method')], [(u'social network', u'Method'), (u'node', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'social trust', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Trust is a necessary concept to realize the Semantic Web .', u"But how can we build a `` Web of Trust '' ?", u"We first argue that a small `` Web of Trust '' for each community is very essential to realize a huge `` Web of Trust . ''", u"Then , we focus on an academic community as a microcosm of a `` Web of Trust '' and show a web mining approach to generate a social network automatically .", u"Each edge is added using the number of retrieved pages by a search engine which includes both persons ' names .", u"Moreover , each edge is given a label , such as `` coauthors '' or `` members of the same project , '' by applying classification rules to the page content .", u"The relation of persons such as `` coauthor '' or `` same laboratory '' can be described by an RDF format .", u'Finally , using the social network , we calculate authoritativeness of a node as a social trust and an individual trust .']

entities: [[(u'eco-informatics application', u'Task'), (u'environmental datasets', u'Material'), (u'ecological hypotheses', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'environmental systems', u'Method')], [(u'automated data processing', u'Task'), (u'knowledge discovery system', u'Method'), (u'Remote environmental monitoring', u'Method'), (u'sensor networks', u'Method'), (u'collecting real-time data', u'Task')], [(u'data analysis phases', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data processing procedures', u'Method'), (u'manual manipulation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Web and Knowledge Representation fields', u'Task'), (u'automated data synthesis technologies', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Reef', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'eco-informatics application'), (u'eco-informatics application', u'USED-FOR', u'ecological hypotheses'), (u'environmental datasets', u'USED-FOR', u'eco-informatics application')], [], [], [(u'automated data synthesis technologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'use-case implementations')]]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Reef project is an eco-informatics application that aims to combine multiple environmental datasets to test ecological hypotheses and to derive information about environmental systems .', u'The intention is to develop an automated data processing , problem-solving and knowledge discovery system that will assist in developing our understanding and management of coral reef ecosystems. # R # # N # # R # # N # Remote environmental monitoring ( including sensor networks ) is being widely developed and used for collecting real-time data across widely distributed locations .', u'As the volume of raw data increases , it is envisaged that bottlenecks will develop in the data analysis phases , where current data processing procedures still involve manual manipulation that will soon become unfeasible to manage .', u"Research communities , such as the Semantic Web and Knowledge Representation fields , aim to address this `` data deluge '' , through the development of the automated data synthesis technologies and use-case implementations such as described here ."]

entities: [[(u'STHoles', u'Method'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'multi-dimensional histograms of numerical data', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'they', u'Generic'), (u'STHoles concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'numerical specialization', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'string domain', u'Method'), (u'these', u'Generic'), (u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'string prefixes', u'Method')], [(u'regular expressions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'prefixes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hierarchically structured string domains', u'Material'), (u'filesystem pathnames', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'URIs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web data', u'Material'), (u'histograms', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'multi-dimensional histograms of numerical data'), (u'query results', u'USED-FOR', u'algorithm')], [], [], [], [(u'filesystem pathnames', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'hierarchically structured string domains'), (u'filesystem pathnames', u'CONJUNCTION', u'URIs'), (u'URIs', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'hierarchically structured string domains')], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper we extend STHoles , a very successful algorithm that uses query results to build and maintain multi-dimensional histograms of numerical data .', u'Our contribution is the formal definition of extensions of all relevant concepts ; such that they are independent of the domain of the data , but subsume STHoles concepts as their numerical specialization .', u'At the same time , we also derive specializations for the string domain and implement these into a prototype that we use to empirically validate our approach .', u'Our current implementation uses string prefixes as the machinery for describing string ranges .', u'Although weaker than regular expressions , prefixes can be very efficiently applied and can capture interesting ranges in hierarchically structured string domains , such as those of filesystem pathnames and URIs .', u'In fact , we base the empirical validation of the approach on existing , publicly available Semantic Web data where we demonstrate convergence to accurate and efficient histograms .']

relations: [[(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'enterprise knowledge management'), (u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology management systems'), (u'Minerva', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology management systems'), (u'Minerva', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'storage and inference system'), (u'storage and inference system', u'USED-FOR', u'large-scale OWL ontologies'), (u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'TBox inference'), (u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'database schema'), (u'Description Logic reasoners', u'PART-OF', u'storage and inference system'), (u'Description Logic reasoners', u'USED-FOR', u'database schema'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'database schema'), (u'back-end database', u'USED-FOR', u'database schema'), (u'reasoning efficiency', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'database schema')]]
sentences: [u'With the increasing use of ontologies in Semantic Web and enterprise knowledge management , it is critical to develop scalable and efficient ontology management systems In this paper , we present Minerva , a storage and inference system for large-scale OWL ontologies on top of relational databases It aims to meet scalability requirements of real applications and provide practical reasoning capability as well as high query performance The method combines Description Logic reasoners for the TBox inference with logic rules for the ABox inference Furthermore , it customizes the database schema based on inference requirements User queries are answered by directly retrieving materialized results from the back-end database The effective integration of ontology inference and storage is expected to improve reasoning efficiency , while querying without runtime inference guarantees satisfactory response time Extensive experiments on University Ontology Benchmark show the high efficiency and scalability of Minerva system .']

sentences: [u'The Web contains huge amounts of data intended for clients .', u'This information is mainly stored in hypertext form .', u'This will lead to make the information semantically annotated to be accessible by the clients .', u'Annotating provides a great help for the machine to realize the data put on the web .', u'Annotating web pages could be achieved by using various tools which are available most of them are semi-automatic .', u'In this paper some current Semantic Web Annotation platforms are examined .', u'The lack of these annotations is avoided by creating and developing an Automatic web Annotation platform based on Ontology for a normal user .', u'This offers easy , flexible and user-friendly interfaces by integrating the web page with an Ontology file for sharing a semantic metadata with other resources by providing APIs for improving storage structures for this annotation while separating the content of a page from the Annotation .']

entities: [[], [(u'dynamic and self-organizing systems', u'Method'), (u'resource utilization', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ad-hoc interaction', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Web based approach', u'Method')], [(u'agent', u'Generic'), (u'action intention', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dynamic ontology', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Agent Programming Language', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'Semantic Agent Programming Language', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'approach')]]
sentences: [u'In open systems where the components , i.e .', u'the agents and the resources , may be unknown at design time , or in dynamic and self-organizing systems evolving with time , there is a need to enable the agents to communicate their intentions with respect to future activities and resource utilization to resolve coordination issues dynamically .', u'Ideally , we would like to allow ad-hoc interaction , where two standalone independently-designed systems are able to coordinate whenever a need arises .', u'The Semantic Web based approach presented in this paper aims at enabling agents to coordinate without assuming any design-time ontological alignment of them .', u'An agent can express an action intention using own vocabulary , and through the process of dynamic ontology linking other agents will be able to arrive at a practical interpretation of that intention .', u'We also show how our approach can be realized on top of the Semantic Agent Programming Language .']

entities: [[], [(u'meaning of language strings', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Natural Language Processing', u'Task'), (u'machine translation', u'Task'), (u'question answering', u'Task')], [(u'Information Extraction techniques', u'Method'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'formal semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'annotation methods', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'machine translation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Natural Language Processing'), (u'machine translation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'question answering'), (u'question answering', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Natural Language Processing')], []]
sentences: [u'The paper argues , briefly , that much work in formal Computational Semantics ( alias CompSem ) is not computational at all , and does not attempt to be ; there is some mis-description going on here on a large and long-term scale .', u'Moreover , the examples used to support its value for the representation of the meaning of language strings have no place in normal English usage , or their corpora , and this should be better understood .', u'The recent large-scale developments in Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) , such as machine translation or question answering , which are quite successful and undeniably semantic and computational , have made no use of such techniques .', u'Most importantly , the Semantic Web ( and Information Extraction techniques generally ) now offer the possibility of large scale use of language data so as to achieve concrete results achieved by methods deemed impossible in formal semantics , namely annotation methods that are fundamentally forms of Lewis ( 1970 ) markerese .']

entities: [[(u'rule', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology layers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'options', u'Generic'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'integrated ontology/rule language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'layering rules', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RuleML', u'Material'), (u'OWL', u'Material')], [(u'SWORIER system', u'Method'), (u'automated reasoning', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'Prolog', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'negation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'complementary classes', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'disjunctive heads', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'cardinality', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material')], [(u'techniques', u'Generic'), (u'extensionalization', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reanalysis', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'code minimization', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'ontology layers', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web'), (u'OWL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rule extension SWRL'), (u'RuleML', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL')], [(u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rules')], [], [(u'negation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'complementary classes'), (u'negation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'disjunctive heads'), (u'complementary classes', u'CONJUNCTION', u'disjunctive heads'), (u'disjunctive heads', u'CONJUNCTION', u'cardinality')], [(u'extensionalization', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'techniques'), (u'extensionalization', u'CONJUNCTION', u'reanalysis'), (u'reanalysis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'code minimization')]]
sentences: [u'We are researching the interaction between the rule and the ontology layers of the Semantic Web , by comparing two options : 1 ) using OWL and its rule extension SWRL to develop an integrated ontology/rule language , and 2 ) layering rules on top of an ontology with RuleML and OWL .', u'Toward this end , we are developing the SWORIER system , which enables efficient automated reasoning on ontologies and rules , by translating all of them into Prolog and adding a set of general rules that properly capture the semantics of OWL .', u'We have also enabled the user to make dynamic changes on the fly , at run time .', u'This work addresses several of the concerns expressed in previous work , such as negation , complementary classes , disjunctive heads , and cardinality , and it discusses alternative approaches for dealing with inconsistencies in the knowledge base .', u'In addition , for efficiency , we implemented techniques called extensionalization , avoiding reanalysis , and code minimization .']

sentences: [u'Ontology specifies the concepts of a domain and their semantic relationships .', u'It is widely used for solving the information heterogeneity problems on the web because of their capability to provide explicit meaning to the information .', u'Different ontologies are created by developer for a same domain .', u'To solve the heterogeneity problem among the specific domain several matching strategies are designed such as linguistic matcher , semantic similarity , structural comparison .', u'Similarities among ontologies are obtained based on the term , concept relationship and terminological relationship as synonyms , hyponyms and homonyms .', u'SWRL ( Semantic Web Rule Language ) rule is developed for common repository knowledge base to detect the homonyms .', u'A merging framework combines the matching strategies for indentifying the similarities and dissimilarities of source ontologies then the similar concept are automatically merged and dissimilarities are directly merged in to the global ontology that resolve the synonyms and homonyms conflict among the domain specific ontologies .']

sentences: [u'Web mining is used to automatically discover and extract information from Web-related data sources such as documents , log , services , and user profiles .', u'Although standard data mining methods may be applied for mining on the Web , many specific algorithms need to be developed and applied for various purposes of Web based information processing in multiple Web resources , effectively and efficiently .', u'In the paper , we propose an abstract Web mining model for extracting approximate concepts hidden in user profiles on the semantic Web .', u"The abstract Web mining model represents knowledge on user profiles by using an ontology which consists of both `` part-of '' and `` is-a '' relations .", u'We also describe the details of using the abstract Web mining model for information gathering .', u'In this application , classes of the ontology are represented as subsets of a list of keywords .', u'An efficient filtering algorithm is also developed to filter out most non-relevant inputs .']

sentences: [u'Information retrieval consisting of huge number of available documents on the Web makes finding relevant ones a challenging task .', u'The quality of results that traditional keyword-based search provide is still not optimal for many types of user queries .', u'Especially the semantic relation of the user query is handled inadequately by keyword-based search .', u'The semantic based information retrieval can provide a solution for the above mentioned problem .', u'This paper explains how semantic approach can be optimally exploited during the information retrieval process , and proposes a general framework by which efficient information retrieval can be made using semantic web approach .', u'The framework can handle semantic based information retrieval by combining results from various approaches such as tokenization , Stop word removal , semantic checking and information retrieval .', u'This allows integrating results from above mentioned approaches , and thus supports a gradual transition from classical keyword-based search to semantic-based ones .']

entities: [[(u'embedded systems', u'Method'), (u'architectural styles', u'Method')], [(u'service-oriented architectural framework', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web services', u'Method'), (u'public domain', u'Material'), (u'integrated development environments', u'Task')], [(u'web service-based IDE', u'Method')], [(u'web services', u'Method'), (u'services', u'Generic')], [(u'device model', u'Method'), (u'modelling', u'Method')], [(u'demand-led development process', u'Method'), (u'industrial automation domain', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'service-oriented architectural framework', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web')], [], [], [], [], [(u'industrial automation domain', u'FEATURE-OF', u'demand-led development process')]]
sentences: [u'Currently available toolsets for the development of embedded systems adopt traditional architectural styles and do not cover the whole requirements of the development process , with extensibility being the major drawback .', u'In this paper , a service-oriented architectural framework that exploits semantic web is defined .', u"Features required in the development process are defined as web services and published into the public domain , so as to be used on demand by developers to construct their projects ' specific integrated development environments ( IDEs ) .", u'The infrastructure required to build a web service-based IDE is presented .', u'Specific web services are defined and the way these services affect the development process is discussed .', u'Special focus is given on the device model and the means that such a modelling can significantly improve the development process .', u'A prototype implementation demonstrates the applicability and usefulness of the proposed demand-led development process in the industrial automation domain .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web application', u'Task'), (u'e-learning', u'Task'), (u'e-learning systems', u'Method')], [(u'ontol- ogies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u"learner 's behavior", u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'e-learning environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'OLAP technologies', u'Method'), (u'SMEUS e-learning environment', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'decision-making', u'Task'), (u'case study model', u'Method'), (u'technologies', u'Generic'), (u'semantic e-learning environment', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web application')], [], [(u'e-learning environment', u'FEATURE-OF', u"learner 's interaction")], [], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'decision-making'), (u'technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic e-learning environment')]]
sentences: [u'Ontologies represent an efficient way of semantic web application on e-learning and offer great opportunity by bringing great advantages to e-learning systems .', u"Nevertheless , despite the many advantages that we get from using ontol- ogies , in terms of structuring the data , there are still many unresolved problems related to the difficulties about getting proper information about a learner 's behavior .", u"Consequently , there is a need of developing tools that enable analysis of the learner 's interaction with the e-learning environment .", u'In this paper , we propose a framework for the application of Business Intelligence ( BI ) and OLAP technologies in SMEUS e-learning environment .', u"Hence , on one hand , the proposed framework will enable and support the decision-making by answering some questions related to learner 's performance , and on the other hand , will present a case study model for implementing these technologies into a semantic e-learning environment ."]

sentences: [u"With the Web 's emergence and generalization in various domains such as economy , commerce , education , culture , etc , the Web application reverse-engineering process becomes necessary in order to facilitate the maintenance of such applications and the evolution towards new Web technology like XML , semantic Web , etc .", u'In this paper , we propose a new approach for the Web application reverse-engineering .', u'The approach is based on ontology and it generates a conceptual schema modelling the Web application .', u'This conceptual schema is rich in semantic but reduced in relation to the global ontology .', u'The proposed approach mainly relies on HTML pages analysis , i.e .', u'to analyse tables , lists , forms , etc .', u'It consists of three successive phases : First , the extraction of useful information from the HTML pages .', u'Second phase is the analysis of the extracted information using the domain ontology .', u'And finally , we generate the corresponding UML conceptual schema .']

entities: [[(u'Web services', u'Task'), (u'distributed computing', u'Task'), (u'electronic business', u'Task')], [(u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'automated service discovery', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'service interface', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'similarity score', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'matching algorithm', u'Method')], [(u"wu & palmer 's similarity measure", u'Metric')], [(u'OWLTC collection', u'Material'), (u'system', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'Web services', u'USED-FOR', u'distributed computing'), (u'distributed computing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'electronic business')], [], [(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'automated service discovery')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'web services')], [(u"wu & palmer 's similarity measure", u'USED-FOR', u'later')], []]
sentences: [u'Web services are becoming the most important paradigm for distributed computing and electronic business .', u'They are self-contained Internet accessible applications that are capable not only of performing business activities on their own , but they also possess the ability to engage with other Web services in order to build new value-added services .', u'In this paper we present a work that focuses on the issue of automated service discovery in conjunction with the Semantic Web .', u'To get this aim , we propose an approach which exploits the service interface ( inputs/outputs ) and the domain ontology , in order to model the web services , after that , we compute a similarity score between the request and the modeled web services through a matching algorithm .', u"This later is based on the wu & palmer 's similarity measure .", u'A test based on the OWLTC collection is shown to elucidate the system functioning .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web ( SW )', u'Method'), (u'SW', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'computer programs', u'Method')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'HTML Web Pages', u'Material')], [(u'domain model', u'Method'), (u'domain ontology', u'Method')], [(u'automatic generation of metadata', u'Task'), (u'SWby relation extraction techniques', u'Method')], [(u'web pages', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'relation extraction', u'Task')], [(u'Relation extraction', u'Task'), (u'hyperlink structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'relation extraction', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'metadata')], [(u'domain ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'domain model')], [(u'automatic generation of metadata', u'USED-FOR', u'SWby relation extraction techniques')], [], [], [(u'hyperlink structure', u'USED-FOR', u'relation extraction'), (u'Web', u'USED-FOR', u'relation extraction')]]
sentences: [u'The idea of the Semantic Web ( SW ) is based on metadata and the future usage scenarios of the SW assume the availability of metadata needed by agents and computer programs to perform sophisticated tasks .', u'We have proposed an architecture needed to generate metadata for the SW. Our proposed architecture is designed to generate metadata from HTML Web Pages from the domain of our interest .', u'The domain model is represented by using domain ontology .', u'The focus of the paper is to investigate the automatic generation of metadata for the SWby relation extraction techniques .', u'Our assumption is that any two web pages that have some kind of relationship must be connected by a link or a path .', u'Our algorithm exploits the link structure of web using breadth first search for relation extraction .', u'Relation extraction results show that hyperlink structure of the Web can be used for relation extraction .']

sentences: [u'Semantic web is becoming a controversial issue in current research era .', u'There must be an automated approach to transform ontology constructs into relational database so that it can be queried efficiently .', u'The previous research work based on transformation of RDF/OWL concepts into relational database contains flaws in complete transformation of ontology constructs into relational database .', u'Some researchers claim that their technique of transformation is entirely automated , however their approach of mapping is incomplete and miss essential OWL constructs .', u'This paper presents a tool called OWLMap that is fully automatic and provides lossless approach for transformation of ontology into relational database format .', u'Number of experiments have been performed for ontology to relational database transformation .', u'Experiments show that proposed approach is fully automatic , effective and quick .', u'Our OWLMap is based on an approach that is lossless as well as it does not loose data , data types and structure .']

relations: [[(u'Graph data model', u'CONJUNCTION', u'graph databases'), (u'bioinformatics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web'), (u'semantic web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'social networks')], [], [], [(u'answer processing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'debugging')], [(u'polynomial time', u'FEATURE-OF', u'grammar')], [(u'generalized LL parsing algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'Proposed algorithm'), (u'CYK or Earley algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'solutions')]]
sentences: [u'Graph data model and graph databases are very popular in various areas such as bioinformatics , semantic web , and social networks .', u'One specific problem in the area is a path querying with constraints formulated in terms of formal grammars .', u'The query in this approach is written as grammar , and paths querying is graph parsing with respect to given grammar .', u'There are several solutions to it , but how to provide structural representation of query result which is practical for answer processing and debugging is still an open problem .', u'In this paper we propose a graph parsing technique which allows one to build such representation with respect to given grammar in polynomial time and space for arbitrary context-free grammar and graph .', u'Proposed algorithm is based on generalized LL parsing algorithm , while previous solutions are based mostly on CYK or Earley algorithms , which reduces time complexity in some cases .']

sentences: [u'Ontology provides a shared and reusable piece of knowledge about a specific domain , and has been applied in many fields , such as semantic Web , e-commerce and information retrieval , etc .', u'However , building ontology by hand is a very hard and error-prone task .', u'Learning ontology from existing resources is a good solution .', u'Because relational database is widely used for storing data and OWL is the latest standard recommended by W3C , this paper proposes an approach of learning OWL ontology from data in relational database .', u'Compared with existing methods , the approach can acquire ontology from relational database automatically by using a group of learning rules instead of using a middle model .', u'In addition , it can obtain OWL ontology , including the classes , properties , properties characteristics , cardinality and instances , while none of existing methods can acquire all of them .', u'The proposed learning rules have been proven to be correct by practice .']

sentences: [u'Purpose The present paper aims to describe an approach for building the Semantic Web rules for interoperation between heterogeneous learning objects , namely course outlines from different universities , and one of the rule uses : identifying ( in ) compatibilities between course descriptions.Design/methodology/approach As proof of concept , a rule set is implemented using the rule markup language ( RuleML ) , a member of XMLbased languages .', u'This representation in RuleML allows the rule base to be platformindependent , flexibly extensible and executable.Findings The RuleML source representation is easily converted to other XMLbased languages ( such as RDF , OWL and XMI ) as well as incorporated into , and extracted from , existing XMLbased repositories ( such as IEEE LOM and CanLOM ) using XSL Transformations ( XSLT ) .Practical implications The RuleML facts and rules represented in the positional slotted language are used by the OO jDREW reasoning engine to detect and map between semantically equivalent component ...']

sentences: [u'Web legal information retrieval systems need the capability to reason with the knowledge modeled by legal ontologies .', u'Using this knowledge it is possible to represent and to make inferences about the semantic content of legal documents .', u'In this paper a methodology for applying NLP techniques to automatically create a legal ontology is proposed .', u'The ontology is defined in the OWL semantic web language and it is used in a logic programming framework , EVOLP+ISCO , to allow users to query the semantic content of the documents .', u'ISCO allows an easy and efficient integration of declarative , object-oriented and constraint-based programming techniques with the capability to create connections with external databases .', u'EVOLP is a dynamic logic programming framework allowing the definition of rules for actions and events .', u'An application of the proposed methodology to the legal web information retrieval system of the Portuguese Attorney Generals Office is described .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'Material'), (u'Multi-Agent Systems', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'open MASs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'communication failures', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic negotiation', u'Method'), (u'problem', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'semantic negotiations', u'Task'), (u'solution', u'Generic')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantic negotiation', u'Method'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'HISENE semantic negotiation framework', u'Method')], [(u'semantic negotiation', u'Method'), (u'global ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u"Ontologies play a key role in the development of Multi-Agent Systems ( MASs ) for the Semantic Web , providing conceptual description of the agents ' world .", u'However , especially in open MASs , agents use different ontologies and this often leads to communication failures .', u'Semantic negotiation is a recent framework which provides an effective solution to such a problem , but it is a too heavy framework to be implemented in large agent communities .', u'In this paper , we deal with the inefficiency in semantic negotiations , and we show how a possible solution is to build a common representation of the different terms used by the agents .', u'We argue that a reasonable compromise to use a common ontology consists of combining it with semantic negotiation and we propose an algorithm which implements this idea in the recent HISENE semantic negotiation framework .', u'Moreover , the semantic negotiation is exploited , in our proposal , to dynamically enrich the global ontology .']

sentences: [u'Situation awareness computing employs sensor networks to collect large amounts of heterogeneous data in different and complex environments .', u'The rapid development and deployment of sensor technology stress the problem related to the availability of too much and heterogeneous data .', u'Last trend emphasizes the semantic annotation of acquired sensor data .', u'Semantic sensor data provides machine understandable contextual information .', u'In particular , the availability of semantic sensor data allows situation awareness in several application domains .', u'This paper introduces a swarm-based approach to semantic web reasoning in order to identify situations .', u'On one hand , fuzzy control has been employed in order to face with uncertainty of happening situations .', u'On the other hand , Situation Theory has been used in order to model situation awareness .', u'A multi agent swarm architecture enables to monitor complex environments by using spatially distributed autonomous sensors .', u'An application scenario for bank intrusion detection has been described .']

entities: [[(u'semantically-driven approach', u'Method'), (u'uncertainties', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Ontologies', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'artificial systems', u'Method')], [(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Uncertainties', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontological representation', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology constructions', u'Task'), (u'ontology constructions', u'Task'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'complexity', u'Metric')], [(u'spatially-aware systems', u'Method'), (u'indoor environments', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'indoor environments', u'FEATURE-OF', u'spatially-aware systems')]]
sentences: [u'We present a semantically-driven approach to uncertainties within and across ontologies .', u'Ontologies are widely used not only by the Semantic Web but also by artificial systems in general .', u'They represent and structure a domain with respect to its semantics .', u"Uncertainties , however , have been rarely taken into account in ontological representation , even though they are inevitable when applying ontologies in ` real world ' applications .", u'In this paper , we analyze why uncertainties are necessary for ontologies , how and where uncertainties have to be represented in ontologies , and what their semantics are .', u'In particular , we investigate which ontology constructions need to address uncertainty issues and which ontology constructions should not be affected by uncertainties on the basis of their semantics .', u'As a result , the use of uncertainties is restricted to appropriate cases , which reduces complexity and guides ontology development .', u'We give examples and motivation from the field of spatially-aware systems in indoor environments .']

sentences: [u'The Semantic Web is evolving very quickly .', u'There are already many theories and tools to model various kinds of semantics using ontologies .', u'However after organizations completed modeling the ontology structure , the ontologies must also be filled with instances and relationships to make them practical .', u'This process of ontology population could be hard because we are facing a cold start problem .', u'On the other hand , the potential instances could already exist in LOD , online encyclopedia , or corporate databases in the form of structured data .', u'We think these instances along with their related features could remedy the cold start problem a lot .', u'We present a practical framework to verify this hypothesis .', u'In this framework , first a semiautomated seed discovery method is used to bootstrap the population .', u'Then , we use semi-supervised learning methods to refine and expand the seed instances .', u'Finally the population quality is verified using an effective evaluation process .']

sentences: [u'The current specification covers various new algorithms , methods , and systems for , e.g. , image recognition ( e.g. , for action , gesture , emotion , expression , biometrics , fingerprint , facial , OCR ( text recognition ) , background , relationship , position , pattern , and object ) , machine learning , training schemes , feature space , clustering , classification , similarity measures , optimization , search engine , ranking , question-answering system , soft ( fuzzy or unsharp ) boundaries/impreciseness/fuzziness in language , clustering , and recognition , Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) , Computing with Words ( CWW ) , parsing , machine translation , sound and speech recognition , video search and analysis ( e.g .', u'tracking ) , image annotation , geometrical abstraction , image correction , semantic web , context analysis , data reliability ( e.g. , using Z-number ( e.g. , About 45 minutes ; Very sure ) ) , rules engine , control system , autonomous vehicle , system diagnosis , medical diagnosis , biomedicine , large number of images analytics , event prediction , financial forecasting , economics , risk assessment , e-mail management , database management , indexing and join operation , memory management , data compression , and crowd-sourcing ( using experts or humans ) .']

entities: [[(u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Material')], [], [(u'SPARQL query language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'named graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF data model', u'Method')], [(u'IRI', u'Method')], [(u'virtual origin', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'inference engine', u'Method'), (u'entailment regime', u'Task')], [(u'member submission', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'name graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RDF/XML syntax extension', u'Method'), (u'RDF/XML representation', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'inference engine', u'CONJUNCTION', u'entailment regime')], [], []]
sentences: [u'When querying or reasoning on metadata from the semantic web , the source of this metadata as well as a number of other characteristics ( date , trust , etc . )', u'can be of great importance .', u'While the SPARQL query language provides a keyword to match patterns against named graphs , the RDF data model focuses on expressing triples .', u'In many cases it is interesting to augment these RDF triples with the notion of a provenance for each triple ( or set of triples ) , typically an IRI specifying their real ( e.g .', u'author ) or virtual origin ( e.g .', u'inference engine and entailment regime ) .', u'This position paper extends on a member submission from INRIA ( RDF/XML Source Declaration [ 1 ] ) expressing the importance for us to provide a standard mechanism in RDF to name graphs .', u'It proposes and discusses an RDF/XML syntax extension providing an attribute to specify the provenance of triples in an RDF/XML representation .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'interrelating information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Social Networks', u'Method'), (u'well-organised Taxonomies', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'Social Web', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'unlimited Semantic Ontology', u'Material')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'encyclopaedia of information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'interconnected data', u'Material')], [(u'3D Web interface', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology management mechanisms', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'interconnected data', u'USED-FOR', u'encyclopaedia of information')], [(u'ontology management mechanisms', u'USED-FOR', u'3D Web interface')]]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web was introduced in 1999 as a method of interrelating information to help computers derive conclusions based on the links between data .', u'With the rising popularity of Social Networks though , unconnected pieces of information have only chaotically increased instead of becoming parts of well-organised Taxonomies .', u'In this paper , we suggest a system which will take advantage of the Social Web and put it to work so that it will operate under the common cause of categorising old and new data into an unlimited Semantic Ontology .', u'This ontology will be created gradually and ever-changing , like a versatile encyclopaedia of information compiled from interconnected data .', u'With the addition of a 3D Web interface on top of the ontology management mechanisms , the entire experience will become more user friendly , providing graphical presentation of all opinions and interpretations in a clear and comparable manner .']

entities: [[(u'Petri net infrastructure', u'Method'), (u'Petri nets', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'Petri net tools', u'Method')], [(u'Petri net ontology', u'Method')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'Petri Net Markup Language', u'Material')], [(u'Petri net ontology', u'Method'), (u'UML', u'Method'), (u'Protege tool', u'Method'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Petri net software tool P3', u'Method'), (u'Petri net ontology compliant models', u'Method'), (u'Petri net tools', u'Method'), (u'DaNAMiCS', u'Method'), (u'Petri Net Kernel', u'Method'), (u'eXtensible Stylesheet Language Transformations', u'Method')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'educational web application', u'Method'), (u'RDF-annotated ontology-based Petri net learning materials', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Petri net tools', u'USED-FOR', u'model interchange mechanisms')], [], [], [(u'UML', u'USED-FOR', u'Petri net ontology'), (u'UML', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Protege tool'), (u'Protege tool', u'USED-FOR', u'Petri net ontology'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL')], [(u'Petri net software tool P3', u'USED-FOR', u'Petri net ontology compliant models'), (u'Petri net software tool P3', u'USED-FOR', u'Petri net tools'), (u'DaNAMiCS', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Petri net tools'), (u'DaNAMiCS', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Petri Net Kernel'), (u'Petri Net Kernel', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Petri net tools')], [(u'RDF-annotated ontology-based Petri net learning materials', u'USED-FOR', u'educational web application')]]
sentences: [u'The paper presents a Petri net infrastructure that should allow sharing Petri nets on the Semantic Web .', u'Previous solutions only provide model interchange mechanisms between Petri net tools .', u'The Petri net ontology is a central part of our solution .', u'The ontology is closely related to the Petri Net Markup Language ( PNML ) an ongoing Petri net community sharing effort .', u'We developed the Petri net ontology using both UML and the Protege tool , whereas we use RDF and OWL to represent the ontology .', u'We implemented a Petri net software tool P3 that can be used to convert the Petri net ontology compliant models to the formats of current Petri net tools ( e.g. , DaNAMiCS , Petri Net Kernel , PIPE ) using eXtensible Stylesheet Language Transformations ( XSLT ) .', u'In order to show how the ontology can be used , we developed a simple educational web application that uses RDF-annotated ontology-based Petri net learning materials .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'semantic queries', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Intelligent presentation generation engines', u'Method'), (u'models', u'Generic'), (u'adaptive presentations', u'Task')], [(u'models', u'Generic'), (u'animation languages', u'Material')], [(u'dynamic , adaptive web content', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'declarative description', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'presentation language', u'Material')], [(u'scripting/coding approach', u'Method'), (u'non-programmers', u'Method')], [(u'XML language extensions', u'Method'), (u'web authors', u'Material'), (u'declarative modeling', u'Method')], [(u'extensions', u'Generic'), (u'SMIL Animation', u'Method'), (u'SVG', u'Method'), (u'XML-based languages', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'declarative modeling', u'USED-FOR', u'web')], [(u'SMIL Animation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SVG')]]
sentences: [u'The move towards a semantic web will produce an increasing number of presentations whose creation is based upon semantic queries .', u'Intelligent presentation generation engines have already begun to appear , as have models and platforms for adaptive presentations .', u'However , in many cases these models are constrained by the lack of expressiveness in current generation presentation and animation languages .', u'Moreover , authors of dynamic , adaptive web content must often use considerable amounts of script or code , thus breaking the declarative description possible in the original presentation language .', u'Furthermore , the scripting/coding approach does not lend itself to authoring by non-programmers .', u'In this paper we describe a set of XML language extensions that bring tools from the functional programming world to web authors , extending the power of declarative modeling for the web .', u'The extensions are described in the context of SMIL Animation and SVG , but could be applied to many XML-based languages .']

entities: [[(u'Automatic dialogue systems', u'Method'), (u'speech', u'Material'), (u'noise', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mobile device', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'modalities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'speech and video signal', u'Material'), (u'spoken request', u'Material'), (u"user 's gaze direction", u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'speech signal', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'prosodic features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'recognition rates', u'Metric'), (u'speech-only condition', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'mobile device', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web')]]
sentences: [u"Automatic dialogue systems get easily confused if speech is recognized which is not directed to the system Besides noise or other people 's conversation , even the user 's utterance can cause difficulties when he is talking to someone else or to himself ( Off-Talk ) In this paper the automatic classification of the user 's focus of attention is investigated In the German SmartWeb project , a mobile device is used to get access to the semantic web In this scenario , two modalities are provided speech and video signal This makes it possible to classify whether a spoken request is addressed to the system or not : with the camera of the mobile device , the user 's gaze direction is detected ; in the speech signal , prosodic features are analyzed Encouraging recognition rates of up to 93 % are achieved in the speech-only condition Further improvement is expected from the fusion of the two information sources ."]

entities: [[(u'semantic Web approaches', u'Method')], [(u'tools-such', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic MediaWiki', u'Material')], [(u'org/wiki/SemanticMediaWiki )', u'Material'), (u'BOWiki', u'Material')], [(u'Platypus Wiki', u'Material')], [(u'wiki extensions', u'Method')], [(u'semantic structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pOWL', u'Material'), (u'distributed and collaborative development of ontologies', u'Task')], [(u'Commercial tools', u'Method'), (u'Freebase', u'Material')], [(u'tools', u'Generic')], [], [(u'collaborative knowledge construction challenge', u'Task')], []]
relations: [[(u'Web 2.0', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic Web approaches')], [(u'Semantic MediaWiki', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'tools-such'), (u'//meta.wikimedia', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'tools-such')], [], [], [], [], [(u'Freebase', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Commercial tools')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'A new generation of tools supports the integration of Web 2.0 and semantic Web approaches .', u'Some of these tools-such as Semantic MediaWiki ( http : //meta.wikimedia .', u'org/wiki/SemanticMediaWiki ) , BOWiki , ( http : //onto.eva .', u'mpg.de/bowiki ) , and Platypus Wiki ( http : //platypuswiki .', u'sourceforge.net ) -provide wiki extensions for creating semantic links between pages .', u'Other tools let users organize tags in some semantic structure , and fully fledged ontology editors such as pOWL support the distributed and collaborative development of ontologies .', u'Commercial tools such as Freebase ( http : //freebase.com ) are also entering the field .', u'Most of these tools are in early development-the collaborative-knowledge-construction field is in its infancy .', u"Few , if any , user studies outline what users expect from such tools and what does or does n't work .", u'So , we organized the collaborative knowledge construction challenge .', u'The CKC challenge let users try different tools and provide feedback to help us assess the state of the art .']

entities: [[(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'intelligent learning systems', u'Task'), (u'self-regulated contents', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'learning cycles', u'Method')], [(u'Learning', u'Task'), (u'workplace environment', u'Task'), (u'e-Learning', u'Method')], [(u'technological and behavioral standards', u'Method'), (u'Social Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'intrinsic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'systems', u'Generic')], []]
relations: [[(u'model', u'USED-FOR', u'intelligent learning systems'), (u'self-regulated contents', u'USED-FOR', u'model')], [], [], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'This work aims to purpose the creation of a model to develop intelligent learning systems with self-regulated contents .', u'Its main goal is to support self-oriented learning in workplace , to improve performance levels and skills .', u"Our target is mainly software industries , where the novelty of knowledge and learning needs are critical success factors for the companies ' competitiveness , and the learning cycles are being shortened .", u'Learning in workplace environment is a recent research phenomenon , which has been taking place along with the evolutional trend of e-Learning .', u'The innovative component is based on technological and behavioral standards arising mainly from the Social Semantic Web .', u"To approach these challenges one main issue is to find out if the organization 's intrinsic knowledge is recognized and organized .", u'Besides , organizations also need to recognize the practical use of this kind of systems .', u'Both issues have been surveyed in a case study .']

entities: [[(u'Healthcare knowledge management', u'Task')], [(u'healthcare knowledge management', u'Task'), (u'healthcare knowledge management', u'Task'), (u'knowledge-centric services', u'Method')], [(u'healthcare knowledge management', u'Task'), (u'organizational learning', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge-theoretic', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'epistemological perspective', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'healthcare knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneous modalities', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'healthcare knowledge management services', u'Method'), (u'healthcare stakeholders', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'healthcare knowledge management', u'Task'), (u'patient management', u'Task'), (u'decision support', u'Task'), (u'care planning', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web based healthcare knowledge management framework', u'Method')], [(u'healthcare knowledge management', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'knowledge-centric services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'healthcare knowledge management'), (u'healthcare delivery', u'CONJUNCTION', u'health outcomes')], [(u'epistemological', u'CONJUNCTION', u'organizational learning'), (u'organizational learning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'knowledge-theoretic')], [(u'healthcare knowledge', u'CONJUNCTION', u'heterogeneous modalities')], [(u'healthcare knowledge management services', u'USED-FOR', u'healthcare stakeholders')], [(u'healthcare knowledge management', u'USED-FOR', u'patient management'), (u'decision support', u'CONJUNCTION', u'care planning'), (u'Semantic Web based healthcare knowledge management framework', u'USED-FOR', u'care planning')], []]
sentences: [u'Healthcare knowledge management is an active , yet not a well characterized research topic .', u'In this chapter , we attempt to characterize healthcare knowledge management and highlight the practical aspects of healthcare knowledge management vis-a-vis knowledge-centric services that aim to improve healthcare delivery and health outcomes .', u'We investigate healthcare knowledge management from various perspectives -- such as epistemological , organizational learning , knowledge-theoretic and functional .', u'From an epistemological perspective we elicit the different types of healthcare knowledge and the heterogeneous modalities representing it .', u'From a functional perspective we present a suite of healthcare knowledge management services that aim to assist healthcare stakeholders .', u'From a knowledge-theoretic perspective , we present the frontiers of healthcare knowledge management , in particular for patient management through decision support and care planning via a Semantic Web based healthcare knowledge management framework .', u'We conclude by highlighting the role and future outlook of healthcare knowledge management .']

entities: [[(u'WQA ( Web Question Answering ) approach', u'Method'), (u'semantic-level accuracy', u'Metric'), (u'deep text understanding capabilities', u'Material')], [(u'DL based semantic modeling', u'Method'), (u'lambda-expression encoding of question meaning', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL based semantic representations', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'semantic resource', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DL ontology', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'conceptual modeling', u'Task')], [(u'object property restrictions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic representations', u'Method'), (u'CCG parsing', u'Method'), (u'DL reasoning', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'question understanding', u'Task'), (u'semantic level', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'accuracy promotion', u'Metric'), (u'semantic resource exploitation', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'lambda-expression encoding of question meaning', u'USED-FOR', u'DL based semantic representations')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'conceptual modeling')], [], [(u'semantic representations', u'USED-FOR', u'question understanding'), (u'CCG parsing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'DL reasoning'), (u'DL reasoning', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic representations'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'question understanding'), (u'understanding accuracy promotion', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic resource exploitation'), (u'accuracy promotion', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic resource exploitation')]]
sentences: [u'This paper presents a novel WQA ( Web Question Answering ) approach based on the combination CCG ( Combinatory Categorial Grammar ) and DL ( Description Logic ) ontology , in order to promote semantic-level accuracy through deep text understanding capabilities .', u'We propose to take DL based semantic modeling , i.e. , translating lambda-expression encoding of question meaning into DL based semantic representations .', u'The advantage of such approach is a seamless exploitation of existing semantic resource coded as DL ontology , which is widespread in such area as the Semantic Web and conceptual modeling .', u'The experiments are conducted with a repository of complex Chinese questions which involves the satisfaction of some object property restrictions .', u'The experimental results show that producing the semantic representations with the combination of CCG parsing and DL reasoning is an effective approach for question understanding at semantic level , in terms of both understanding accuracy promotion and semantic resource exploitation .']

entities: [[(u'selforganized semantic storage services', u'Task')], [(u'semantic web', u'Method')], [(u'software component', u'Method'), (u'storage and retrieval of semantic information', u'Task'), (u'applications', u'Generic')], [(u'mere functionality', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'storage components', u'Method'), (u'nonfunctional requirements scalability', u'Metric'), (u'adaptability', u'Metric'), (u'robustness', u'Metric')], [(u'querying semantic information', u'Task')], [(u'communication network', u'Method')], [(u'selforganized technologies', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'largescale semantic storage systems', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Purpose The purpose of this paper is to show the potential of selforganized semantic storage services .', u'The semantic web has provided a vision of how to build the applications of the future .', u'A software component dedicated to the storage and retrieval of semantic information is an important but generic part of these applications .', u'Apart from mere functionality , these storage components also have to provide good performance regarding the nonfunctional requirements scalability , adaptability and robustness .', u'Distributing the task of storing and querying semantic information onto multiple computers is a way of achieving this performance .', u'However , the distribution of a task onto a set of computers connected using a communication network is not trivial .', u"One solution is selforganized technologies , where no central entity coordinates the system 's operation.Design/methodology/approach Based on the available literature on largescale semantic storage systems , the paper analyzes the underlying distribution algori ..."]

entities: [[(u'Automation of Web service composition', u'Task')], [(u'automated Web service composition', u'Task'), (u'semantic matchmaking', u'Method'), (u'Web service parameters', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'matchmaking', u'Method'), (u'run time', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic compatibilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web service descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Web services', u'Task')], [(u'Web service compositions', u'Method'), (u'semantic connections', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'hard constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'composition process', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'Web services', u'Task'), (u'Telecom scenario', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'semantic matchmaking', u'USED-FOR', u'automated Web service composition')], [(u'semantic compatibilities', u'USED-FOR', u'Web service descriptions')], [], [], [], [(u'Telecom scenario', u'USED-FOR', u'Web services')], []]
sentences: [u'Automation of Web service composition is one of the most interesting challenges facing the Semantic Web today .', u'In this paper we propose a mean of performing automated Web service composition by exploiting semantic matchmaking between Web service parameters ( i.e. , outputs and inputs ) to enable their connection and interaction .', u'The key idea is that the matchmaking enables , at run time , finding semantic compatibilities among independently defined Web service descriptions .', u'To this end , our approach extends existing methods in order to explain misconnections between Web services .', u'From this we generate Web service compositions that realize the goal , satisfying and optimizing the semantic connections between Web services .', u'Moreover a process of relaxing the hard constraints is introduced in case the composition process failed .', u'Our system is implemented and interacting with Web services dedicated on a Telecom scenario .', u'The preliminary evaluation results showed high efficiency and effectiveness of the proposed approach .']

sentences: [u'Information retrieval in the Web needs more efficient way than traditional approaches .', u'That is , traditional information retrieval approaches are not accurate because they consider only the syntactical level when processing Web resources .', u'So , more conceptual approaches are needed to increase accuracy of information retrieval .', u'In the next generation of the Web , namely the semantic Web , the challenge of information retrieval approaches is to design automatic programs that are able to understand and process semantics of Web resources .', u'Therefore , semantics needs to be clearly formalized and processed by programs .', u'In this chapter , we use a knowledge representation formalism to represent the semantics of Web resources and then to perform semantic navigation .', u'The knowledge representation formalism is used to design a semantic index of the Web resources .', u'Generally , it references a huge amount of Web resources .', u'So we present an efficient navigation strategy of this index to make more accurate information retrieval .']

sentences: [u'Semantic web mining is getting more attention in intelligent web applications .', u'Many web sites , especially those dynamically generate HTML pages to display the results of user queries , present information in the form of lists or tables .', u'It is very useful to extract concept instances from these tables for many web applications such as intelligent agent systems for on-line product recommendations .', u'This paper describes a technique for extracting data from tables in two steps , namely table detection and table analysis .', u'The table detection step identifies the existence of a table and extracts its contents , and the table analysis step discovers the semantic meanings embedded in the table and associates them with the concepts described in the domain ontology that are used for semantic annotation on these tables .', u'Our algorithm has been tested based on real-life web documents and the experimental results are encouraging .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'open world ontology languages', u'Material'), (u'OWL-based ones', u'Method'), (u'closed world rule-based languages', u'Material')], [(u'combination', u'Generic'), (u'hybrid MKNF knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'Stable Model Semantics', u'Method'), (u'knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'ontology axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'well-founded semantics', u'Method'), (u'nondisjunctive hybrid MKNF knowledge bases', u'Task'), (u'reasoning', u'Task'), (u'OWL-based semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Well-Founded Semantics', u'Method'), (u'logic programs', u'Task')], [(u'detection of inconsistencies', u'Task'), (u'tightly integrated ontology axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], []]
relations: [[(u'OWL-based ones', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'open world ontology languages')], [(u'ontology axioms', u'USED-FOR', u'it'), (u'ontology axioms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rules'), (u'rules', u'USED-FOR', u'it'), (u'rules', u'PART-OF', u'Stable Model Semantics')], [(u'well-founded semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'nondisjunctive hybrid MKNF knowledge bases'), (u'OWL-based semantics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Well-Founded Semantics'), (u'Well-Founded Semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'logic programs')], [], []]
sentences: [u'An important question for the upcoming Semantic Web is how to best combine open world ontology languages , such as the OWL-based ones , with closed world rule-based languages .', u'One of the most mature proposals for this combination is known as hybrid MKNF knowledge bases ( Motik and Rosati , 2010 [ 52 ] ) , and it is based on an adaptation of the Stable Model Semantics to knowledge bases consisting of ontology axioms and rules .', u'In this paper we propose a well-founded semantics for nondisjunctive hybrid MKNF knowledge bases that promises to provide better efficiency of reasoning , and that is compatible with both the OWL-based semantics and the traditional Well-Founded Semantics for logic programs .', u'Moreover , our proposal allows for the detection of inconsistencies , possibly occurring in tightly integrated ontology axioms and rules , with only little additional effort .', u'We also identify tractable fragments of the resulting language .']

sentences: [u'We propose that stem cell advocacy must engage in self-analysis to determine how to be maximally effective .', u'For this analysis , eight advocacy elements can be measured : agitation , legislation , regulation , litigation , policy development , collaboration , education and innovation .', u'For several of these elements , we show that stem cell advocates , particularly advocates for human embryonic stem cell research , have been matched by their opponents .', u'This demonstrates the need for combining innovation and collaboration with advocacy-oriented education .', u'To pursue innovative and collaborative education , we propose a bench-to-public knowledge model and present some preliminary observations made with this model for different stem cell types .', u'We also propose development of a semantic web information system to be operated within Internet Cloud/Apps/Social Media .', u'We call this system the Stem Cell Information Technology Accelerator Platform .', u'Toward its construction , we propose formation of a working group to conceive sem ...']
