sentences: [u'Ontologies , as representation of shared conceptualization for variety of specific domains , are the heart of the Semantic Web .', u'In order to facilitate interoperability across multiple ontologies , we need an automatic mechanism to align ontologies .', u'Therefore , many methods to measure similarity between concepts existing in two different ontologies are proposed .', u'In this paper , we will enumerate these methods along with their shortcomings in each case .', u'In information content ( IC ) based similarity measures , the process of IC computation for concepts is so challenging and in many cases with failing .', u'We will propose our new approach that is based on concepts definitions .', u'These definitions would help us to compute reliable and easy to calculate information contents for concepts .', u'Applying these methods to the biomedical domain , using MEDLINE as corpus , International Classification of Diseases , Ninth Revision , Clinical Modification ( ICD9CM ) as thesaurus , and available reference standard , we will find our method outperforms other similarity measures .']

sentences: [u'As a new computing paradigm , peer-to-peer ( P2P ) has gained great popularity .', u'However resource sharing , resource management and resource localization meets great challenge due to the distribute nature of P2P network .', u'In this paper we introduce the using of Semantic Web recommendation RDF in P2P network .', u'Through annotating resources with RDF metadata , the distributed resources link to each other in a semantic way .', u'Thus application like resource discovery and searching , semantic routing and collaborative activities can become more efficient .', u'For this purpose , we propose Web-based P2P metadata Network Infrastructure ( WMNI ) to support RDF metadata management , exchange and query .', u'Another feature of WMNI is that it supports accessing P2P resources simply via a web browser i.e .', u'User need not to install P2P application and bootstrap to join the P2P network .', u'This feature is really important to capability- constraint devices like PDA and cell phone .']

sentences: [u'Hera is a design methodology that supports the development of Web information systems .', u'It is a model-driven method that distinguishes four steps : data retrieval , application model generation , application model instance generation , and presentation data generation .', u'Data retrieval populates the conceptual model with data .', u'In the application model generation the navigational aspects of the application are specified in the application model .', u'Also , the application model needs to be adapted for different user/channel profiles .', u'In the third step of the Hera method , the application model is populated with the retrieved data .', u'The last step considers the physical aspects of the presentation : the retrieved data wrapped in application logic is translated to different implementation platforms ( e.g .', u'HTML , WML , SMIL ) .', u'Having in mind the advantage of Web application interoperability we chose to implement an experimental prototype for the Hera method using RDF ( S ) , the foundation of the semantic Web .']

sentences: [u'Organizing multimedia data is very challenging .', u'One of the most important approaches to support users in searching and navigating media collections is collaborative filtering .', u'Recently , systems as flickr or last.fm have become popular .', u'They allow users to not only rate but also tag items with arbitrary labels .', u"Such systems replace the concept of a global common ontology , as envisioned by the Semantic Web , with a paradigm of heterogeneous , local `` folksonomies '' .", u'The problem of such tagging systems is , however , that resulting taggings carry only little semantics .', u'In this paper , we present an extension to the tagging approach .', u'We allow tags to be grouped into aspects .', u'We show that introducing aspects does not only help the user to manage large numbers of tags , but also facilitates data mining in various ways .', u'We exemplify our approach on Nemoz , a distributed media organizer based on tagging and distributed data mining .']

entities: [[(u'mass self-publishing', u'Task'), (u'death of professional intermediaries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'editor', u'Method')], [(u'editor', u'Method')], [], [(u'third-party intermediary', u'Method'), (u'automated types of intervention', u'Task')], [(u'intervention', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'writing process', u'Task')]]
sentences: [u'With the shift to mass self-publishing on the internet , commentators have hailed - or sometimes mourned - the death of professional intermediaries such as the editor .', u'The question remains , however : does editing disappear along with the editor ?', u"The short answer is 'no ' , when one understands editing generically , as an essential part of the process of creating meaning in a text .", u'In reviewing examples on the internet , one sees that it does not disappear , but shifts from a third-party intermediary to the author and the reader , and from human to more automated types of intervention .', u"However , despite the promise of the 'semantic web ' , these kinds of intervention are unlikely to reach high standards on a consistent basis .", u'The absence of experienced human mediation in the writing process - as in other areas of life - can be harmful to public life , and ways should be found to show the added value that they make .']

sentences: [u'Semantic coordination , namely the problem of finding an agreement on the meaning of heterogeneous semantic models , is one of the key issues in the development of the Semantic Web .', u'In this paper , we propose a new algorithm for discovering semantic mappings across hierarchical classifications based on a new approach to semantic coordination .', u'This approach shifts the problem of semantic coordination from the problem of computing linguistic or structural similarities ( what most other proposed approaches do ) to the problem of deducing relations between sets of logical formulae that represent the meaning of concepts belonging to different models .', u'We show how to apply the approach and the algorithm to an interesting family of semantic models , namely hierarchical classifications , and present the results of preliminary tests on two types of hierarchical classifications , web directories and catalogs .', u'Finally , we argue why this is a significant improvement on previous approaches .']

relations: [[(u'ontology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic web information system'), (u'caching mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'query processing'), (u'caching mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'query response time')], [], [(u'data transformation', u'USED-FOR', u'query processing')], [], [], [(u'semantic caching method', u'USED-FOR', u'cache')], [], [(u'schema data filtering technique', u'CONJUNCTION', u'schema similarity cache replacement method')]]
sentences: [u'In semantic web information system like ontology that access distributed information from network , efficient query processing requires an advanced caching mechanism to reduce the query response time .', u'P2P network system have become an important infra structure in web environment .', u'In P2P network system , when the query is initiated , reducing the demand of data transformation to source peer is important aspect of efficient query processing .', u'Caching of query and query result takes a particular advantage by adding or removing a query term .', u'Many of the answers may already be cached and can be delivered to the user right away .', u'In web environment , semantic caching method has been proposed which manages the cache as a collection of semantic regions .', u'In this paper , we propose the semantic caching technique in cluster environment of peers .', u'Especially , using schema data filtering technique and schema similarity cache replacement method , we enhanced the query processing efficiency .']

sentences: [u'A Curriculum Vitae ( CV ) or a resume , in general , consists of personal information , education information , work experience , qualifications and preferences parts .', u'Scanning or making structural transformation of the millions of free-formatted resumes from the databases of companies / institutions with human factor will result in the loss of too much time and human effort .', u'In the literature , a limited number of studies have been done to change the resumes of the free-format to a structural format .', u"The overall objective of the study is to infer required information such as user 's experience , features , business and education from resumes of the potential user of a human resources system .", u'In this article , we proposed an ontology driven information parsing system that is planned to operate on few millions of resumes to convert them structured format for the purpose of expert finding through the Semantic Web approach .']

sentences: [u'With the emergence of the Semantic Web , ontologies are being exposed on the Web to support a variety of applications , including enhanced search and discovery , rapid enterprise integration and cross-domain knowledge sharing .', u'This explosion of knowledge sharing on the web is also leading to the formation of knowledge silos and a growing need for integration of these sources .', u'Automated solutions to mapping ontologies are emerging that address this growing need with very promising results .', u'However , most approaches have focused on mapping ontologies using relationships of similarity and equivalence and very few have applied knowledge in upper ontologies .', u'We built algorithms to acquire relationships between ontological components beyond similarity and equivalence that include hyponymy and more importantly , algorithms to map ontologies based on relationships that are specified within the ontologies .', u'These algorithms employ the semantics of OWL in conjunction with online linguistic resources and upper ontologies .', u'Initial test results are promising .']

sentences: [u'There is a critical need to design and develop tools that abstract away the fundamental complexity of XML-based Web services specifications and toolkits , and provide an elegant , intuitive , simple , and powerful query-based invocation system to end users .', u'Web services based tools and standards have been designed to facilitate seamless integration and development for application developers .', u'As a result , current implementations require the end user to have intimate knowledge of Web services and related toolkits , and users often play an informed role in the overall Web services execution process .', u'We employ a self-learning mechanism and a set of algorithms and optimizations to match user queries with corresponding operations in Web services .', u'Our system uses Semantic Web concepts and Ontologies in the process of automating Web services matchmaking .', u'We present performance analysis of our system and quantify the exact gains in precision and recall due to the knowledge acquisition algorithms .']

sentences: [u'This article addresses a question regarding relevant information in a social media such as a wiki that can contain huge amount of text , written in slang or in natural language , without necessarily observing a fixed terminology set .', u'This text could not always be adherent to the discussed subject .', u'The main motivation leads to the need of developing methods that would allow the extraction of relevant information in such scenario .', u'A result system was designed upon ideas from the semantic Web combined with an adaptation of the classic vector model for information retrieval .', u'The semantic information is not embedded in the media but within a structurally independent ontology .', u'It was implemented using Java and a MySQL database .', u'The objective was the achievement of , at least , 80 % for recall and precision on the system results .', u'The system was considered successful by achieving rates of 100 % of recall and approximately 93 % of precision .']

entities: [[(u'knowledge management', u'Method'), (u'orchestration of dynamic communities', u'Method'), (u'customized schemas', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'K-Forms', u'Method'), (u'K-Search', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web tools', u'Method'), (u'distributed and networked knowledge acquisition', u'Task'), (u'retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'domain views', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'tools', u'Generic'), (u'reuse of existing ontologies', u'Task')], [(u'knowledge capture', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'Modern knowledge management is based on the orchestration of dynamic communities that acquire and share knowledge according to customized schemas .', u'However , while independence of ontological views is favoured , these communities must also be able to share their knowledge with the rest of the organization .', u'In this paper we introduce K-Forms and K-Search , a suite of Semantic Web tools for supporting distributed and networked knowledge acquisition , capturing , retrieval and sharing .', u'They enable communities of users to define their own domain views in an intuitive way ( automatically translated into formal ontologies ) and capture and share knowledge according to them .', u'The tools favour reuse of existing ontologies ; reuse creates as side effect a network of ( partially ) interconnected ontologies that form the basis for knowledge exchange among communities .', u'The suite is under release to support knowledge capture , retrieval and sharing in a large jet engine company .']

entities: [[(u'popularity email', u'Material'), (u'information overload', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'technology', u'Generic'), (u'electronic mail', u'Material'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'email communication genre', u'Method')], [(u'explicit semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'email content', u'Material'), (u'speech act theory', u'Method')], [(u'ontology', u'Method'), (u'email speech acts', u'Material'), (u'non-deterministic models', u'Method'), (u'email', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'technology', u'USED-FOR', u'electronic mail')], [], [], [(u'speech act theory', u'USED-FOR', u'email content')], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'email speech acts')]]
sentences: [u'Despite persisting in popularity email is still plagued with information overload , hindering the workflow of data the user has to handle .', u'While the revolutionization of the Web by the semantic Web is underway , we aspire to use the same technology to enhance electronic mail with useful semantics .', u'In so doing we will tackle one of the largest flaws of the email communication genre - the lack of shared expectations about the form and content of the interaction .', u'This can be attributed to the lack of explicit semantics covering the context and content of exchanged email messages .', u'Earlier research showed that email content can be captured by applying speech act theory .', u'We will refine and extend this work to develop an ontology for email speech acts and outline non-deterministic models to support the user in deciding the best course of action upon sending or receiving an email .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web concept', u'Method'), (u'ontological and terminological resources', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'heterogeneous resources', u'Material')], [], [(u'Matching entities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'alignment resources', u'Material')], [(u'alignments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'alignments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'alignments', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'repository of heterogeneous alignments', u'Task')], [(u'alignments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'generic model', u'Method'), (u'operators', u'Generic'), (u'alignments', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology alignments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'parallel corpora', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'repository of heterogeneous alignments')], [(u'generic model', u'USED-FOR', u'alignments')], []]
sentences: [u'Since the invention of the Semantic Web concept , the number of ontological and terminological resources on the Web has been increasing .', u'These heterogeneous resources may share entities or contain similar ones .', u'To cope with the diversity of these resources and collect them , resources repositories have been created .', u'Matching entities belonging to different resources is then required to use or combine them , which generates alignment resources .', u'Thus , collecting and managing resulting alignments is useful in order to compose them , compare sets of alignments for the same input resources , enrich existing alignments from each other or enhance their quality .', u'In this paper we introduce our approach for building a repository of heterogeneous alignments .', u'We propose to represent alignments by means of a generic model and we introduce some operators and algorithms to import , compose , intersect and merge alignments .', u'For a concrete application we use ontology alignments and parallel corpora .']

entities: [[(u'personalized services', u'Task')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic')], [(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'service personalization', u'Method'), (u'automated instantiation of services', u'Task')], [(u'constructive Description Logics reasoning', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'concept abduction', u'Task')]]
sentences: [u'Nowadays web users have clearly expressed their wishes to receive and interact with personalized services directly .', u'However , existing approaches , largely syntactic content-based , fail to provide robust , accurate and useful personalized services to its users .', u"Towards such an issue , the semantic web provides technologies to annotate and match services ' descriptions with users ' features , interests and preferences , thus allowing for more efficient access to services and more generally information .", u'The aim of our work , part of service personalization , is on automated instantiation of services which is crucial for advanced usability i.e. , how to prepare and present services ready to be executed while limiting useless interactions with users ?', u'We introduce the constructive Description Logics reasoning join and couple it with concept abduction to i ) identify useful parts of users profiles that satisfy services requirements and ii ) compute the description required by a service to be executed but not provided by users profiles .']

entities: [[(u'social-semantic web endeavors', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'representation', u'Generic'), (u'dynamically maintained taxonomy', u'Method'), (u'non-taxonomic relations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'class axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'non-taxonomic relations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'intricate reasoning techniques', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'statistical text processing methods', u'Method'), (u'feed-back', u'Method'), (u'user interfaces', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'logic programming approaches', u'Method')], [(u'search and exploration applications', u'Task'), (u'populated representation', u'Method')], []]
relations: [[], [(u'non-taxonomic relations', u'FEATURE-OF', u'dynamically maintained taxonomy')], [(u'class axioms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'non-taxonomic relations')], [(u'statistical text processing methods', u'PART-OF', u'approach'), (u'feed-back', u'CONJUNCTION', u'logic programming approaches'), (u'user interfaces', u'USED-FOR', u'statistical text processing methods'), (u'user interfaces', u'CONJUNCTION', u'feed-back')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this article we present the Indiana Philosophy Ontology ( InPhO ) project as one of the first social-semantic web endeavors which aims to harness feedback from users who are unfamiliar with designing and populating ontologies to build a precise conceptual representation of a particular domain .', u'This representation is initially a dynamically maintained taxonomy with several non-taxonomic relations .', u'More complex components like class axioms and additional non-taxonomic relations will be iteratively added once more intricate reasoning techniques and a finer granularity of the representation is needed .', u'Our approach combines statistical text processing methods , feed-back gathered through user interfaces , and logic programming approaches to create a dynamically changing , semantic representation of the discipline of philosophy .', u'The long-term goal of the project is to build novel search and exploration applications on top of this populated representation .', u'We describe the basic ideas and methodology of the project .']

entities: [[(u'Networks of ontologies', u'Task'), (u'logic theories', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'alignments', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'distributed contexts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Material')], [(u'inconsistency', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'local inconsistency', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'alignment', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'global inconsistency', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Belief revision', u'Task'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'revision postulates', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'alignments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics of networks of ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'revision operators', u'Method'), (u'local revision operators', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'alignments', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'partial meet revision framework', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'revision postulates', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'strategies', u'Generic'), (u'network characteristics', u'Method'), (u'concrete revision operators', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'ontologies', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'logic theories')], [], [(u'ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'alignment')], [(u'Belief revision', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies')], [(u'revision postulates', u'USED-FOR', u'alignments')], [(u'local revision operators', u'USED-FOR', u'revision operators'), (u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'alignments')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'revision postulates')], [(u'strategies', u'USED-FOR', u'concrete revision operators'), (u'network characteristics', u'USED-FOR', u'strategies'), (u'network characteristics', u'USED-FOR', u'concrete revision operators')]]
sentences: [u'Networks of ontologies are made of a collection of logic theories , called ontologies , related by alignments .', u'They arise naturally in distributed contexts in which theories are developed and maintained independently , such as the semantic web .', u'In networks of ontologies , inconsistency can come from two different sources : local inconsistency in a particular ontology or alignment , and global inconsistency between them .', u'Belief revision is well-defined for dealing with ontologies ; we investigate how it can apply to networks of ontologies .', u'We formulate revision postulates for alignments and networks of ontologies based on an abstraction of existing semantics of networks of ontologies .', u'We show that revision operators can not be simply based on local revision operators on both ontologies and alignments .', u'We adapt the partial meet revision framework to networks of ontologies and show that it indeed satisfies the revision postulates .', u'Finally , we consider strategies based on network characteristics for designing concrete revision operators .']

sentences: [u'Ontologies are being increasingly used in a varied number of fields such as knowledge management , information extraction , and the semantic web .', u"In this context , it 's possible to verify the feasibility of using ontologies in healthcare .", u"The number of seropositive people in relation to HIV , and its early detection is still a problem in today 's world , especially in Brazil .", u'Therefore , this study reports the creation and evaluation of an ontology meant to be used in healthcare applications , focused on telehealth .', u"This ontology 's main objective is to define the profiles of patients who attend the health centers of a city .", u'The ontology proposed here can be used in a range of applications related to healthcare , not only to HIV , but also other diseases categorized as chronic .', u'The article details the creation of ontology and its grounding .', u'The evaluation that was made is described and its results , which are considered promising , are commented .']

sentences: [u'In order to realize the sharing of HLA simulation resources on Internet , the infrastructure and realizing framework of a cloud simulation based on HLA Evolved were put forward on the reference of cloud computing and the technical improvement of HLA Evolved.RTI component , modular FOM/SOM object model and WSDL API for the Web services were studied.The key techniques were settled , such as the technique of semantic service registration , discovery and composition , the technique of monitoring and prediction and the technique of distributed simulating and storage based on Hadoop.Then , the research was tested by the designed simulation supposition.The result shows that cloud simulation based on HLA Evolved design approach is feasible and effective .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic service-oriented architecture', u'Method'), (u'SSOA )', u'Method'), (u'new-style software architecture', u'Method'), (u'distributed and heterogeneous information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'interoperable models', u'Method'), (u'task', u'Generic')], [(u'interoperable model', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'interface technology', u'Method'), (u'service provider', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'heterogeneous problems', u'Task')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'online healthy consultant system', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'SSOA )', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'new-style software architecture')], [], [(u'interface technology', u'USED-FOR', u'communication'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'heterogeneous problems')], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic service-oriented architecture ( SSOA ) is a new-style software architecture , its goal is to process distributed and heterogeneous information on Web .', u'Unfortunately , previous interoperable models are not completely competent for this complicated task .', u'Thus , a new interoperable model is presented , it adopts interface technology to abstractly describe the behavior of the service , which is helpful to solve the problems of communication and collaboration between service requester and service provider , it also uses appropriate mediators to solve various kinds of heterogeneous problems .', u'In order to testify the model , the paper presents a use case - online healthy consultant system ( OHCS ) , and then illustrates the working principle and interoperable implementation of the system in detail']

entities: [[(u'Service-oriented software architectures', u'Method'), (u'business processes', u'Method'), (u'operational IT landscapes', u'Task')], [(u'service-oriented architectures', u'Method')], [(u'semantically rich descriptions of services', u'Task'), (u'service-oriented architectures', u'Method'), (u'enterprise environments', u'Task')], [], [(u'semantic service platform', u'Method'), (u'dynamic matchmaking', u'Method'), (u'semantically described services', u'Task')], []]
relations: [[(u'Service-oriented software architectures', u'USED-FOR', u'operational IT landscapes')], [], [(u'semantically rich descriptions of services', u'USED-FOR', u'service-oriented architectures')], [], [(u'dynamic matchmaking', u'CONJUNCTION', u'composition'), (u'composition', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantically described services')], []]
sentences: [u'Service-oriented software architectures that are aware of business processes will form the core of operational IT landscapes in the future .', u'This contribution starts with a brief introduction of the state of the art in service-oriented architectures .', u'The authors argue that semantically rich descriptions of services are essential to tap the full potential of service-oriented architectures in enterprise environments .', u'This regards matchmaking and binding of services , integration of new services as well as the cost-efficient development of added value services by composing semantically described basic services .', u'This paper introduces a semantic service platform that implements dynamic matchmaking , composition and binding of semantically described services .', u'Finally its functionality and a possible application scenario are outlined .']

entities: [[(u'service-oriented computing', u'Method'), (u'agile networks', u'Method')], [(u'Agile networks', u'Method')], [(u'semantic service description', u'Method')], [(u'service description language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL-S', u'Method'), (u'WSMO', u'Method')], [(u'language constructs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'prototypical language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DIANE Service Description', u'Method'), (u'constructs', u'Generic')], [(u'DSD', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'service-oriented computing', u'USED-FOR', u'agile networks')], [], [], [(u'OWL-S', u'CONJUNCTION', u'WSMO')], [(u'DIANE Service Description', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'prototypical language')], []]
sentences: [u'The big promise of service-oriented computing is the ability to form agile networks .', u"Agile networks are networks of loosely coupled participants that cooperate by dynamically discovering and invoking each other 's services at run-time .", u'The major prerequisite for this promise to be fulfilled is an appropriate semantic service description .', u'In this paper , we identify requirements towards such a service description language and show that neither of the two main current approaches , OWL-S and WSMO , is able to fully meet these requirements .', u'We then proceed to suggest additional language constructs and a prototypical language , the DIANE Service Description ( DSD ) , which implements these constructs .', u'We explain how service offers and requests can be described and matched using DSD .']

entities: [[(u'ontology repository', u'Method'), (u'Ontology Web Language OWL', u'Material')], [(u'concepts', u'Generic'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'HTML pages', u'Material'), (u'product catalogues', u'Material'), (u'semanti-cally rich information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDFa', u'Method')], [(u'mechanism', u'Generic'), (u'instance-of relationship', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Web standards', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'RDFa', u'Method'), (u'product catalogues', u'Material')], [(u'Open Source persistency frameworks', u'Method'), (u'real-world products', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'RDFa', u'USED-FOR', u'product catalogues'), (u'RDFa', u'USED-FOR', u'semanti-cally rich information')], [], [(u'SPARQL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web standards'), (u'SPARQL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RDFa'), (u'RDFa', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web standards')], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper we describe a prototype implementation of an ontology repository that captures the concepts in the Ontology Web Language OWL .', u'We describe how these concepts can be used directly by embedding them in standard HTML pages and thus augmenting traditional product catalogues with semanti-cally rich information by means of RDFa .', u'As an addition to the ISO part 12006-3 , where such a mechanism is not specified explicitly , we propose a way to instantiate actual products , their types and attributes through an instance-of relationship .', u'Building upon the rich family of Semantic Web standards such as SPARQL and RDFa , we demonstrate how information in building product catalogues can be made machine-accessible in more efficient and generic ways .', u'Using the Open Source persistency frameworks we demonstrate how real-world products can be linked to 13,000+ concepts with some 44,000 names in different languages in efficient ways .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web activity', u'Task'), (u'electronic content', u'Material')], [(u'vision', u'Generic'), (u'automated sharing of metadata terms', u'Task'), (u'Web applications', u'Task')], [(u'metadata registries', u'Material'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'exchange of semantics', u'Task')], [], [(u'registry issues', u'Task')], [(u'metadata registries', u'Method'), (u'prototypes', u'Generic'), (u'Dublin Core Metadata Initiative', u'Material')], [(u'prototypes', u'Generic'), (u'functional requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'technology solutions', u'Method'), (u'metadata registries', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'automated sharing of metadata terms', u'USED-FOR', u'vision')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'exchange of semantics')], [], [], [], [(u'prototypes', u'USED-FOR', u'functional requirements'), (u'prototypes', u'USED-FOR', u'metadata registries'), (u'application scope', u'CONJUNCTION', u'functional requirements'), (u'functional requirements', u'CONJUNCTION', u'technology solutions'), (u'technology solutions', u'USED-FOR', u'metadata registries')]]
sentences: [u"The Semantic Web activity is a W3C project whose goal is to enable a 'cooperative ' Web where machines and humans can exchange electronic content that has clear-cut , unambiguous meaning .", u'This vision is based on the automated sharing of metadata terms across Web applications .', u'The declaration of schemas in metadata registries advance this vision by providing a common approach for the discovery , understanding , and exchange of semantics .', u'However , many of the issues regarding registries are not clear , and ideas vary regarding their scope and purpose .', u'Additionally , registry issues are often difficult to describe and comprehend without a working example .', u'This article will explore the role of metadata registries and will describe three prototypes , written by the Dublin Core Metadata Initiative .', u'The article will outline how the prototypes are being used to demonstrate and evaluate application scope , functional requirements , and technology solutions for metadata registries .']

entities: [[(u'OWL documents', u'Material'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'role assertions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'systematic approach', u'Method'), (u'documents', u'Generic')], [(u'fast detection of independence', u'Task')], [], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'independence', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'large scale OWL data', u'Material')], [(u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web system', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'systematic approach', u'USED-FOR', u'documents')], [], [], [(u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'independence')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we investigate the ( in ) dependence among OWL documents with respect to the logical consequence when they are combined , in particular the inference of concept and role assertions about individuals .', u'On the one hand , we present a systematic approach to identifying those documents that affect the inference of a given fact .', u'On the other hand , we consider ways for fast detection of independence .', u'First , we demonstrate several special cases in which two documents are independent of each other .', u'Secondly , we introduce an algorithm for checking the independence in the general case .', u'In addition , we describe two applications in which the above results have allowed us to develop novel approaches to overcome some difficulties in reasoning with large scale OWL data .', u'Both applications demonstrate the usefulness of this work for improving the scalability of a practical Semantic Web system that relies on the reasoning about individuals .']

entities: [[(u'Cooperative Question Answering System', u'Method'), (u'natural language queries', u'Material'), (u'semantic web resources', u'Material'), (u'DBpedia', u'Material'), (u'OWL/RDF', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'WordNet', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reasoning', u'Task')], [(u'natural language question', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic representation', u'Method'), (u'semantics sources of information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'ambiguity', u'Task')], [(u'semantic meaning', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Cooperative Question Answering System', u'USED-FOR', u'cooperative answer'), (u'semantic web resources', u'USED-FOR', u'cooperative answer'), (u'OWL/RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'WordNet')], [(u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'ontologies'), (u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'We propose a Cooperative Question Answering System that takes as input natural language queries and is able to return a cooperative answer based on semantic web resources , more specifically DBpedia represented in OWL/RDF as knowledge base and WordNet to build similar questions .', u'Our system resorts to ontologies not only for reasoning but also to find answers and is independent of prior knowledge of the semantic resources by the user .', u'The natural language question is translated into its semantic representation and then answered by consulting the semantics sources of information .', u'The system is able to clarify the problems of ambiguity and helps finding the path to the correct answer .', u'If there are multiple answers to the question posed ( or to the similar questions for which DBpedia contains answers ) , they will be grouped according to their semantic meaning , providing a more cooperative and clarified answer to the user .']

entities: [[(u'Web', u'Material'), (u'integrative analytical framework', u'Method')], [(u'Actor Network Theory', u'Method'), (u'ANT', u'Method'), (u'Social Science', u'Material'), (u'Web', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Open Data Community', u'Method'), (u'Open Public Sector Community )', u'Method')], [], [(u'ANT', u'Method'), (u'Web', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
sentences: [u'Whilst it is widely understood that the Web is a socio-technical phenomenon produced by both human and non-human actors existing research tends to emphasize either the social or the technical rather than offering an integrative analytical framework .', u'In contrast , this paper examines the affordances of Actor Network Theory ( ANT ) derived from Social Science in offering a better understanding of the Web as a socio-technical phenomenon .', u'Our case study traces the evolution of the Linked Open Data Community ( and specifically the Open Public Sector Community ) which promises to shape the next iteration of the Web the Semantic Web .', u'The analysis highlights the formation of the network and relationships and interaction between important actors .', u'We conclude with some remarks regarding possible disconnects within the network , and discuss the potential future usage of ANT as a framework to inform and analyse the Web as it evolves over time .']

entities: [[], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'ontology', u'Generic')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web', u'Method')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'creation of subject headings', u'Task'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'rules', u'USED-FOR', u'creation of subject headings')], []]
sentences: [u'In this postgraduate thesis , there is an attempt to find and model the relations , which connect the subject headings to their potential subdivisions .', u'Considering this , it has been created an ontology , which contains an amount of the subject headings of the library of the Ionian University .', u'These subject headings are connected to each other , when there is a common subdivision .', u'The ontology was constructed with the contribution of the program Protege .', u'The ultimate purpose was to embody this ontology to an ontology navigation application of semantic web .', u'There is a detailed reference to the Library of Congress and the rules that exist for the creation of subject headings , which they have been used as a standard for the composition of the subject headings of the Library of Ionian University .', u'Thereafter , there is an analysis of the subject headings and a detailed description of the process that followed to create the ontologies .']

entities: [[(u'Domotics', u'Method'), (u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'self-management of electrical equipments', u'Task'), (u'solutions', u'Generic'), (u'static scenarios', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'knowledge representation and reasoning techniques', u'Method'), (u'autonomicity', u'Metric'), (u'controllability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user comfort', u'Metric')], [(u'EIB Konnex ( EIB/KNX ) protocol', u'Method'), (u'annotated profiles', u'Material'), (u'ontology-based home appliance infrastructure', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'Main outcomes', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Domotics', u'USED-FOR', u'features'), (u'Domotics', u'USED-FOR', u'appliances')], [(u'solutions', u'USED-FOR', u'static scenarios')], [], [(u'autonomicity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'controllability')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Domotics aims to improve features and capabilities of building systems and appliances .', u'In spite of increasing self-management of electrical equipments , current solutions refer to static scenarios and require an explicit and elementary interaction with the user .', u'Hence the real pervasiveness and context-awareness of enabled functions is still poor .', u'The integration of knowledge representation and reasoning techniques ( originally devised for the Semantic Web ) in most common building automation Standard protocols can allow to reach higher levels of autonomicity and controllability , so improving user comfort and building efficiency .', u'This paper proposes a semantic-based evolution of EIB Konnex ( EIB/KNX ) protocol able to interface users ( whose needs are expressed via their annotated profiles ) with an ontology-based home appliance infrastructure in a fully automated fashion .', u'The proposed approach has been simulated in a prototype in order to test feasibility and prove benefits .', u'Main outcomes are reported .']

entities: [[(u'STSIM', u'Method')], [(u'It', u'Generic')], [(u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'psychomotors', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'cognitives', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'activity execution', u'Task')], [(u'STSIM', u'Method'), (u'flexible student model', u'Method'), (u'ontology network', u'Method')], [(u'tool', u'Generic')], [(u'STSIM', u'Method'), (u'UML-based web engineering ( UWE ) methodology', u'Method'), (u'Model-View-Controller ( MVC ) pattern', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'tool'), (u'psychomotors', u'CONJUNCTION', u'cognitives'), (u'cognitives', u'CONJUNCTION', u'affective competences')], [(u'flexible student model', u'USED-FOR', u'STSIM'), (u'ontology network', u'USED-FOR', u'STSIM'), (u'ontology network', u'USED-FOR', u'flexible student model')], [], [(u'UWE ) methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'STSIM'), (u'Model-View-Controller ( MVC ) pattern', u'USED-FOR', u'STSIM')]]
sentences: [u'In this article , a tool so-called STSIM is presented .', u'It is able to monitor the student progress along learning experiences .', u'The tool , based on semantic web , allows teachers and students monitoring the knowledge student state including , among others , the learning objective state -achieved and not achieved- in different types of activities with psychomotors , cognitives or affective competences , and the efficiency accomplished in activity execution to facilitate the tutor or student the supervision of learning in a more adaptive way according to the individual characteristics and student knowledge state in each moment .', u'To achieve this goal , STSIM uses a flexible student model supported by an ontology network , the \\textit { Student Ontology } .', u'The tool has been developped to be multiplatform , multilingual , based on current and open source web technology and characterized by its usability .', u'STSIM is built on the UML-based web engineering ( UWE ) methodology and the Model-View-Controller ( MVC ) pattern .']

sentences: [u'In the smart internet interactions must be situation-aware and smart .', u"That is , they must be realized with awareness of , and adaptation to users ' individual and collective context situations .", u"Therefore , context management is crucial to deliver contents and services that are relevant to the user 's matters of concern .", u'This paper presents the SmarterContext ontology , our semantic web approach to context representation and reasoning applicable to user-centric domains of the smart internet .', u"We illustrate the application of the SmarterContext ontology using a personal web case study based on IBM 's smarter commerce initiative .", u'This case study demonstrates how our ontology supports context representation and reasoning to improve the relevance of retailer offers with respect to shopper situations .', u'Our ontology is the core of the SmarterContext infrastructure , our context management solution that exploits user web interactions as sources of meaningful personal context information , and empowers users to control context gathering and provisioning .']

relations: [[(u'human society', u'CONJUNCTION', u'economics')], [(u'interdisciplinary and participatory process', u'USED-FOR', u'Integrated assessment'), (u'integration', u'CONJUNCTION', u'interpreting')], [(u'methods', u'USED-FOR', u'interdisciplinary integrated flood assessment')], [(u'perceptual models of watershed flood risk', u'USED-FOR', u'integrated watershed flood risk assessment ontology')], [(u'Pressure-State-Impact-Response model', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'conceptual models')], [], [(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'flood risk assessment ontology')], [(u'rainfall excess indicator computing ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'vulnerability index computing ontology')]]
sentences: [u'Floods belong to the most threatening natural hazards for human society and economics , and are enhanced by urbanization and climate change .', u'Integrated assessment is defined as an interdisciplinary and participatory process of combining , integration , interpreting , and communicating knowledge from diverse scientific disciplines to allow a better understanding of complex phenomena .', u'Ontology , as a formal knowledge representation , will provide methods for the interdisciplinary integrated flood assessment .', u'This paper will develop integrated watershed flood risk assessment ontology from different perceptual models of watershed flood risk .', u'First , different conceptual models , such as Pressure-State-Impact-Response model , are introduced .', u'Then the development framework of ontology is given .', u'The flood risk assessment ontology is designed based on the upper level ontology of Semantic Web for Earth and Environmental Terminology ( SWEET ) .', u'Finally the rainfall excess indicator computing ontology and vulnerability index computing ontology were given as the examples of application development .']

sentences: [u'Provided are an ontology system , a method for managing the ontology system , and a recording medium storing the same .', u'The ontology system includes : a context broker unit for receiving context information from a sensing device and verifying a validity of the received context information ; a context managing unit for controlling to generate an ontology structure by transforming the verified context information from the context broker unit to ontology web language ( OWL ) data and processing the OWL data ; a rule-based inference engine unit for transforming the processed context information from the context managing unit to semantic web rule language ( SWRL ) data and processing the SWRL data through an inference process ; a learning managing unit for processing the processed context information from the context managing unit through learning ; and a database for storing the context information processed at the context managing unit , the rule-based engine unit , and the learning managing unit .']

entities: [[(u'Social networks', u'Method'), (u'electronic interaction', u'Material')], [(u'e-learning prototype', u'Method'), (u'social and semantic web', u'Material')], [(u'electronic means', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'services', u'Generic'), (u'social network platform application', u'Task')], [(u'Graphical User Interface ( GUI )', u'Method'), (u'User-Centered principles', u'Method')], [(u'services', u'Generic'), (u'user-friendly application', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'services', u'USED-FOR', u'social network platform application')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Social networks have risen to prominence over the last years as the predominant form of electronic interaction between individuals .', u'In an attempt to harness the power of the large user base which they have managed to attract , this study proposes an e-learning prototype which integrates concepts of the social and semantic web .', u'A selected set of services are deployed which have been scientifically proven to positively impact the learning process of users via electronic means .', u'The integrability of these services into a social network platform application is visualized through an exploratory prototype .', u'The Graphical User Interface ( GUI ) which is developed to implement these key features is in alignment with User-Centered principles .', u'The designed prototype proves that a number of services can be integrated in a user-friendly application and can potentially serve to gain feedback regarding additional aspects that should be included .']

entities: [[(u'Web services', u'Task'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'semantic interoperability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed systems', u'Method'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'Multi agent systems', u'Method'), (u'areas', u'Generic'), (u'electronic commerce agent systems', u'Method')], [(u'Multi agent systems', u'Method'), (u'encoding specifications', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web services', u'Method'), (u'XML', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Web services', u'Task'), (u'multi-agent systems', u'Method'), (u'middleware layer', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'middleware', u'Generic')], [(u'WSDL parser', u'Method'), (u'middleware', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'they', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic interoperability')], [], [(u'encoding specifications', u'USED-FOR', u'Multi agent systems'), (u'XML', u'USED-FOR', u'Web services')], [(u'Web services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'multi-agent systems')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Web services are an integral part of industry standards and they can act as a basis for semantic interoperability among the various distributed systems across the Web in order to achieve the concept of semantic Web .', u'Multi agent systems also have their utilization in such areas for example in electronic commerce agent systems are already supporting the automation and semiautomation of information gathering activities and transactions over the Internet .', u'Multi agent systems use their own encoding specifications where as Web services use XML as a basis for communication .', u'Therefore , in order to provide interoperability between Web services and multi-agent systems , our aim is to develop a middleware layer between the two .', u'The middleware will facilitate the integration of the two technologies without changing their existing specifications .', u'This research paper presents the design , architecture and implementation details of a WSDL parser that is part of this middleware']

relations: [[], [], [(u'word-level natural language data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'concept-level sentiments'), (u'opinion mining', u'CONJUNCTION', u'sentiment analysis')], [(u'sentic computing', u'USED-FOR', u'SenticNet 2'), (u'AI and Semantic Web techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'natural language opinions')], [(u'semantics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'sentics'), (u'semantics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'cognitive and affective information'), (u'sentics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'sentics'), (u'social data mining', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'affect-sensitive applications'), (u'social data mining', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'fields'), (u'social data mining', u'CONJUNCTION', u'multimodal affective HCI'), (u'multimodal affective HCI', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'affect-sensitive applications'), (u'multimodal affective HCI', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'fields'), (u'multimodal affective HCI', u'CONJUNCTION', u'social media marketing'), (u'social media marketing', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'affect-sensitive applications'), (u'social media marketing', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'fields')]]
sentences: [u'Web 2.0 has changed the ways people communicate , collaborate , and express their opinions and sentiments .', u'But despite social data on the Web being perfectly suitable for human consumption , they remain hardly accessible to machines .', u'To bridge the cognitive and affective gap between word-level natural language data and the concept-level sentiments conveyed by them , we developed SenticNet 2 , a publicly available semantic and affective resource for opinion mining and sentiment analysis .', u'SenticNet 2 is built by means of sentic computing , a new paradigm that exploits both AI and Semantic Web techniques to better recognize , interpret , and process natural language opinions .', u'By providing the semantics and sentics ( that is , the cognitive and affective information ) associated with over 14,000 concepts , SenticNet 2 represents one of the most comprehensive semantic resources for the development of affect-sensitive applications in fields such as social data mining , multimodal affective HCI , and social media marketing .']

sentences: [u'The Region Connection Calculus based on 8 relations ( RCC8 ) is one of several extensively researched methods to use for qualitative spatial representation and reasoning .', u'We discuss several issues arising when representing RCC8 in OWL DL , a decidable fragment of OWL .', u'There is no direct encoding of such a calculus in OWL DL , as the language lacks required features such as role reflexivity , role Boolean operators , and role inclusion axioms .', u'Some of these features are to be included in the new version of the OWL standard , OWL 2 , but this language still lacks the expressive power to support role negations , conjunctions , disjunctions , and complex role inclusion axioms .', u'Recently , advances in description logics languages as SROIQBs have made possible expressing some of the above constructs , while maintaining the decidability of the language .', u'In this paper , we exploit these new opportunities by providing qualitative spatial knowledge representation on the Semantic Web .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'semantic queries', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Intelligent presentation generation engines', u'Method'), (u'models', u'Generic'), (u'adaptive presentations', u'Task')], [(u'models', u'Generic'), (u'animation languages', u'Material')], [(u'dynamic , adaptive web content', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'declarative description', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'presentation language', u'Material')], [(u'scripting/coding approach', u'Method'), (u'non-programmers', u'Method')], [(u'XML language extensions', u'Method'), (u'web authors', u'Material'), (u'declarative modeling', u'Method')], [(u'extensions', u'Generic'), (u'SMIL Animation', u'Method'), (u'SVG', u'Method'), (u'XML-based languages', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'declarative modeling', u'USED-FOR', u'web')], [(u'SMIL Animation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SVG')]]
sentences: [u'move towards a semantic web will produce an increasing number of presentations whose creation is based upon semantic queries .', u'Intelligent presentation generation engines have already begun to appear , as have models and platforms for adaptive presentations .', u'However , in many cases these models are constrained by the lack of expressiveness in current generation presentation and animation languages .', u'Moreover , authors of dynamic , adaptive web content must often use considerable amounts of script or code , thus breaking the declarative description possible in the original presentation language .', u'Furthermore , the scripting/coding approach does not lend itself to authoring by non-programmers .', u'In this paper we describe a set of XML language extensions that bring tools from the functional programming world to web authors , extending the power of declarative modeling for the web .', u'The extensions are described in the context of SMIL Animation and SVG , but could be applied to many XML-based languages .']

entities: [[(u'document authoring systems', u'Method'), (u'text+pictures document', u'Material'), (u'linguistic and graphical details', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'functionality', u'Generic'), (u'ILLUSTRATE prototype', u'Method'), (u'text authoring systems', u'Method')], [(u'Multimedia WYSIWYM', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'Multimedia WYSIWYM', u'Method'), (u'general-purpose picture retrieval', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'ILLUSTRATE prototype', u'PART-OF', u'text authoring systems')], [], [(u'Multimedia WYSIWYM', u'USED-FOR', u'general-purpose picture retrieval')]]
sentences: [u'This paper starts by introducing a class of future document authoring systems that will allow authors to specify the content and form of a text+pictures document at a high level of abstraction , while leaving responsibility for linguistic and graphical details to the system .', u'Next , we describe two working prototypes that implement parts of this functionality , based on semantic modeling of the pictures and the text of the document ; one of these two , the ILLUSTRATE prototype , is a multimedia extension of previous text authoring systems in the What You See Is What You Meant ( WYSIWYM ) tradition .', u'The paper concludes with an exploration of the ways in which Multimedia WYSIWYM can be further enhanced , allowing it to approximate the ideal systems that were sketched earlier in the paper .', u'Applications of Multimedia WYSIWYM to general-purpose picture retrieval ( in the context of the Semantic Web , for example ) are also discussed .']

entities: [[], [(u'metrics', u'Generic'), (u'instruments', u'Generic'), (u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'linguistics', u'Material'), (u'text mining', u'Task')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'hand-crafted taxonomic dictionaries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Word Net', u'Material'), (u'real-world concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'locations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'brand names', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'Google', u'Material'), (u'semantic proximity', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'taxonomy-driven proximity metric', u'Method'), (u'framework', u'Generic')], [(u'metric', u'Generic'), (u'benchmark semantic proximity metrics', u'Metric'), (u'human judgement', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Taxonomic measures of semantic proximity allow us to compute the relatedness of two concepts .', u'These metrics are versatile instruments required for diverse applications , e.g. , the Semantic Web , linguistics , and also text mining .', u'However , most approaches are only geared towards hand-crafted taxonomic dictionaries such as Word Net , which only feature a limited fraction of real-world concepts .', u'More specific concepts , and particularly instances of concepts , i.e. , names of artists , locations , brand names , etc. , are not covered.The contributions of this paper are two fold .', u'First , we introduce a framework based on Google and the Open Directory Project ( ODP ) , enabling us to derive the semantic proximity between arbitrary concepts and instances .', u'Second , we introduce a new taxonomy-driven proximity metric tailored for our framework .', u'Studies with human subjects corroborate our hypothesis that our new metric outperforms benchmark semantic proximity metrics and comes close to human judgement .']

sentences: [u'Customization of interactive three-dimensional content according to consumers requirements is a complex task , as it demands knowledge of such aspects of 3D content as geometry , structure , space , appearance and animation .', u'In this paper , a new method of customizing interactive 3D content is presented .', u'The method leverages semantic web techniques to enable conceptual , generalized representation of 3D content ( 3D meta-scenes ) and on-demand customization of meta-scenes with semantic queries .', u'Query-based content customization with the proposed method can be performed independently by different content consumers at different domain-specific levels of abstraction , with the inference of tacit knowledge .', u'Content customization covers selection of 3D content objects , properties and relations between objects to be presented as well as introduction of new objects , properties and relations .', u'The method has been implemented and evaluated .', u'It significantly improves 3D content customization in comparison to previous approaches .']

entities: [[(u'knowledge lattice approach', u'Method'), (u'Web-based courseware authoringsupport system.Knowledge lattice', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web environment.Onlotogy', u'Task')], [(u'Knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'subject content', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web-based learning environment', u'Task')], [(u'Knowledge lattice', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'system modules', u'Method')], [(u'lattice', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge chunks', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'ontology', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web environment.Onlotogy')], [], [], [(u'subject content', u'PART-OF', u'Web-based learning environment')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we present the application of knowledge lattice approach in a Web-based courseware authoringsupport system.Knowledge lattice is widely known as ontology in Semantic Web environment.Onlotogy is a formal and declarative representation for knowledge .', u'Knowledge is represented in the form of chunks in # R # # N # several layers .', u'This approach is being used to develop Instructional Management Support System ( IMSS ) .IMSS aims to support students , teachers , courseware developers , administrators , and parents .', u'For example , it supports teachers by managing tasks such as monitoring progress and presenting subject content in a Web-based learning environment .', u'Knowledge lattice is applied as # R # # N # the main interface to navigate the system modules .', u'The lattice is used to represent the subject domain by linking the basic knowledge chunks to more advanced knowledge chunks.To further explain this approach , we define a set of functions related to each knowledge chunks .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'knowledge representations', u'Method'), (u'accessibility of knowledge', u'Metric'), (u'retrieval capabilities', u'Task')], [(u'knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'semantic structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web search engines', u'Method'), (u'contextualized conceptual retrieval', u'Task')], [], [(u'ad-hoc knowledge representations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'metadata vocabularies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reuse', u'Metric')], [(u'semantic documents', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'retrieval of heterogeneous semantic schemas', u'Task'), (u'multilevel ontological structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reference ontology', u'Method'), (u'conceptual retrieval', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'knowledge representations', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [], [], [(u'ad-hoc knowledge representations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'metadata vocabularies'), (u'reuse', u'CONJUNCTION', u'interoperability')], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'retrieval of heterogeneous semantic schemas')]]
sentences: [u'The development of the Semantic Web depends on agreed and unambiguous knowledge representations , on the availability and accessibility of knowledge , and on retrieval capabilities .', u'The scarce agreement on knowledge representation and the lack of techniques to process semantic structures in web search engines makes it impossible to perform contextualized conceptual retrieval .', u'These limitations imply that users must know beforehand the existence and location of this knowledge to be able to retrieve it .', u'Thus , different ad-hoc knowledge representations and metadata vocabularies , scarcely formalized and agreed on , have been published , hindering the reuse and interoperability .', u'Our proposal has as its main goal the elaboration of different views to improve the representation of semantic documents .', u'This approach facilitates the management and retrieval of heterogeneous semantic schemas by means of a multilevel ontological structure and the alignment with a reference ontology that provides conceptual retrieval and reuse of knowledge .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'machine-oriented information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'human intervention', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'web information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'vagueness', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'web information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'swimming pool', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'vagueness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'representation scheme', u'Method'), (u'imperfect concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reasoning method', u'Method'), (u'imperfect data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'Uncertainty', u'CONJUNCTION', u'vagueness')], [(u'reasoning method', u'USED-FOR', u'imperfect data')]]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web introduces the concept of machine-oriented information , i.e .', u'information that can be processed by machines or agents without human intervention .', u'In order to achieve this , web information should be represented in a way that its semantics is understandable by agents .', u'Defining semantics for web information is not an easy process , as the web information is not always clear-cut .', u'For example , a web search for comfortable hotels introduces the vague concept comfortable .', u'So , semantics are always related to some kind of vagueness .', u'Moreover , the source of web information is always characterized by a notion of uncertainty , e.g Ninety percent of four star hotels have a swimming pool .', u'Uncertainty and vagueness can be strongly related and this relation demands an extension of any representation scheme in order to capture imperfect concepts .', u'Towards this notion we propose an ontology as well as a reasoning method suitable for imperfect data .']

entities: [[(u'DBpedia.org', u'Material'), (u'structured information', u'Material'), (u'Wikipedia', u'Material')], [(u'RDF triple', u'Method'), (u'semantic web standard', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'structured data', u'Material'), (u'DBpedia', u'Material')], [(u'PageRank analysis', u'Method'), (u'link structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'DBpedia', u'Method'), (u'mining agent', u'Method'), (u'DBpedia', u'Material')], [], [(u'PageRank analysis', u'Method'), (u'DBpedia link structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Wikipedia', u'Material')], [(u'Wikipedia', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Wikipedia', u'USED-FOR', u'structured information')], [], [], [(u'mining agent', u'USED-FOR', u'PageRank analysis')], [], [(u'PageRank analysis', u'USED-FOR', u'DBpedia link structure')], []]
sentences: [u'DBpedia.org is a community effort that tries to extract structured information from Wikipedia such that the extracted information can be queried just like a database .', u'This information is opened to public in the form of RDF triple which is compatible with the semantic web standard .', u'Various applications are developed for the purpose of utilizing the structured data in DBpedia .', u'This paper makes an attempt to apply PageRank analysis on the link structure of DBpedia using a mining agent to mine significant concepts in DBpedia .', u'Based on the result , popular concepts have the tendency to be ranked higher than the less popular ones .', u'This paper also proposes an alternative view on how PageRank analysis can be applied to DBpedia link structure based on special characteristics of Wikipedia .', u'The result shows that even concepts with a low PageRank value can be used as a valuable resource for recommending pages in Wikipedia .']

sentences: [u'The volume of documents and online resources has been increasing significantly on the Web for many years .', u'Effectively , organizing this huge amount of information has become a challenging problem .', u'Tagging is a mechanism to aggregate information and a great step towards the Semantic Web vision .', u'Tagging aims to organize , summarize , share and search the Web resources in an effective way .', u'One important problem facing tagging systems is to automatically determine the most appropriate tags for Web documents .', u'In this paper , we propose a probabilistic topic model that incorporates DBpedia knowledge into the topic model for tagging Web pages and online documents with topics discovered in them .', u'Our method is based on integration of the DBpedia hierarchical category network with statistical topic models , where DBpedia categories are considered as topics .', u'We have conducted extensive experiments on two different datasets to demonstrate the effectiveness of our method .']

sentences: [u'ABSTRACT While Internet-based information technology ( IT ) has certainly affected the field of human services , observation suggests that the impact has been relatively less powerful than in other fields of endeavor .', u'In other fields of endeavor , information technologies have been applied to whole-system transformations , involving process re-engineering , job and task restructuring , expert system support , customer management , and the emergence of matrix , network , and virtual organizational designs .', u'Far fewer of such changes have occurred as a result of the introduction of IT into organizations dominated by professional social workers .', u'In this essay we attempt to : ( 1 ) explain why the field of social work has been relatively immune to IT-supported transformations by outlining the organizational , administrative , policy , and technical barriers to such transformations in the social services domain ; ( 2 ) identify the important emerging information technologies ( agents , the Semantic Web , and machine learning ) that co ...']

sentences: [u"In this paper we present a problem/solution system based on logic formula calculation scheme preserving the user 's privacy .", u'Semantic computing extends semantic Web both in breadth and depth .', u'This article discusses the essences of semantic computing with a description of semantic services .', u'The logic formula calculation schemes are an indispensable technique currently .', u"However , suppose these schemes are served in cloud computing services in near future , the users poses a significant risk to the privacy regarding to their problem , since a curious cloud administrator can follow the user 's problem ( query ) and infer what the user is after .", u"Indeed , in case where the user 's intensions are to be kept secret , users are often cautious about using this services .", u'In this paper we also discuss on a problem/solution system with the representative examples , such as biological analysis and simple logic reasoning together with the privacy preserving techniques .']

sentences: [u'The development of Internet technologies makes it possible to obtain data in near real time about the financial state of companies .', u'Moreover , tools such as XBRL have been developed to deal with the automatic generation of business reports .', u'However the available tools are not suitable to support the current tendency towards the so called , Continuous Reporting .', u'Here , for a specific purpose , the wealth of available information should be summarized in short reports where the relevant information is remarked while the irrelevant remains hidden .', u"Using a combination of Zadeh 's Computational Theory of Perceptions and Semantic Web techniques , we propose a first approach to a computational framework to generate short reports that consist of few but meaningful Natural Language sentences .", u'These sentences are designed to solve the user needs in a specific context of meaning defined with the help of an ontology .', u'A practical demonstration of the computational framework is included .']

sentences: [u'In this paper it is presented our contribution for carrying out adaptive and intelligent Web-based Education Systems ( WBES ) that take into account the individual student learning requirements , by means of a holistic architecture and Framework for developing WBES .', u'In addition , three basic modules of the proposed WBES are outlined : an Authoring tool , a Semantic Web-based Evaluation , and a Cognitive Maps-based Student Model .', u'As well , it is stated a Service Oriented Architecture ( SOA ) oriented to deploy reusable , accessible , durable and interoperable services .', u'The approach enhances the Learning Technology Standard Architecture , proposed by IEEE-LTSA ( Learning Technology System Architecture ) [ IEEE 1484.1/D9 LTSA ( 2001 ) .', u'Draft standard for learning technology - learning technology systems architecture ( LTSA ) .', u'New York , USA .', u'URL : http : //ieee.ltsc.org/wg1 ] , and the Sharable Content Object Reusable Model ( SCORM ) , claimed by Advanced Distributed Learning ( ADL ) [ Advanced Distributed Learning Initiative ( 2004 ) .', u'URL : http : //www.adlnet.org ] .']

entities: [[(u'IT management', u'Task')], [(u'IT services', u'Task'), (u'infrastructural elements', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'IT service catalog', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'central information system', u'Method')], [(u'semantic-web-based IT service catalog', u'Task'), (u'solution space analysis', u'Method')], [(u'organizational and technical preconditions', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
sentences: [u'The challenges in IT management are growing in all kinds of organizations .', u'Even small and medium ones are faced with an accelerating variety and disparity of IT services as serious resources , infrastructural elements , as well as outputs of essential business processes .', u'A proved approach to cope with such challenges is a sustainable service orientation ; and one reasonable starting point may be an IT service catalog as central information system for all user groups within and outside the organization .', u'The paper describes a project for developing a semantic-web-based IT service catalog in a public university in Germany , starting from the initial situation , moving to requirements and solution space analysis , and finally passing over to the successful development of a prototypical implementation .', u'Along that process , organizational and technical preconditions and decisions , lessons learned , as well as issues and opportunities for further work are discussed .']
