relations: [[(u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic graphs')], [], [(u'semantics', u'PART-OF', u'information systems')], [(u'semantic web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'model checking')], [(u'RDF2SPIN', u'USED-FOR', u'SPIN language'), (u'RDF graphs', u'PART-OF', u'SPIN language')], [], [(u'IFC files', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF graphs')], [(u'files', u'USED-FOR', u'digital 3D building model')], []]
sentences: [u'The most frequently used language to represent the semantic graphs is the RDF ( W3C standard for meta-modeling ) .', u'The construction of semantic graphs is a source of numerous errors of interpretation .', u'The processing of large semantic graphs is a limit to the use of semantics in current information systems .', u'The work presented in this paper is part of a new research at the border between two areas : the semantic web and the model checking .', u'For this , we developed a tool , RDF2SPIN , which converts RDF graphs into SPIN language .', u'This conversion aims checking the semantic graphs with the model checker SPIN in order to verify the consistency of the data .', u'To illustrate our proposal we used RDF graphs derived from IFC files .', u'These files represent digital 3D building model .', u'Our final goal is to check the consistency of the IFC files that are made from a cooperation of heterogeneous information sources .']

entities: [[], [(u'social and political debates', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SW', u'Method'), (u'epistemological base', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'epistemological underpinnings', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'social networks', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'technology', u'Generic')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The development of the Semantic Web ( SW ) raises a number of difficult and interesting technical issues .', u'Less often remarked , however , are the social and political debates that it will engender , if and when the technologies become widely accepted .', u'As the SW is a technology for transferring information and knowledge efficiently and effectively , then many of these questions have an epistemological base .', u'In this paper I want to focus especially on the epistemological underpinnings of these social issues , to think about the interaction between the epistemological and the political .', u'How does technology affect the social networks in which it is embedded ?', u'How can technology be successfully transplanted into a new context ?', u'And , perhaps most importantly for us , how is technology affected by its context ?', u'In particular , I want to look at how our decisions about how we treat knowledge can impact quite dramatically on the technologies we produce .']

entities: [[(u'Web 3.0 scenario', u'Material'), (u'business and service descriptions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'scenario', u'Generic'), (u'Seman- tic Peer', u'Method'), (u'Peer', u'Method')], [(u'value networks', u'Method'), (u'organizational model', u'Method'), (u'fluid boundaries', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'modular and multi-Layer Peer', u'Method'), (u'SOA-based applications', u'Task')], [(u'technological infrastructure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'P2P technologies', u'Method'), (u'Internetworked Enterprise configurations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed registry', u'Method'), (u'routing mechanisms', u'Method')], [(u'it', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'fluid boundaries', u'USED-FOR', u'organizational model'), (u'fluid boundaries', u'CONJUNCTION', u'complex relationships'), (u'complex relationships', u'USED-FOR', u'organizational model')], [(u'modular and multi-Layer Peer', u'USED-FOR', u'SOA-based applications'), (u'Peer infrastructure', u'USED-FOR', u'SOA-based applications')], [(u'technological infrastructure', u'USED-FOR', u'Internetworked Enterprise configurations'), (u'P2P technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'technological infrastructure')], []]
sentences: [u'In the Web 3.0 scenario , where information and services are connected by means of their semantics , organizations can improve their competitive advan- tage by publishing their business and service descriptions .', u'In this scenario , Seman- tic Peer to Peer ( P2P ) can play a key role in defining dynamic and highly reconfi- gurable infrastructures .', u'Organizations can share knowledge and services , using this infrastructure to move towards value networks , an emerging organizational model characterized by fluid boundaries and complex relationships .', u'This chapter collects and defines the technological requirements and architecture of a modular and multi-Layer Peer to Peer infrastructure for SOA-based applications .', u'This technological infrastructure , based on the combination of Semantic Web and P2P technologies , is intended to sustain Internetworked Enterprise configurations , de- fining a distributed registry and enabling more expressive queries and efficient routing mechanisms .', u'The following sections focus on the overall architecture , while describing the layers that form it .']

entities: [[], [(u'language resources', u'Material'), (u'integrated metadata domain', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ad hoc techniques', u'Method')], [(u'machine readable and ISO compliant concept definitions', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'XML', u'Method')], [(u'concept definitions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'open Data Category Repositories', u'Material'), (u'RDF assertions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ad hoc solutions', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'Within two European projects metadata interoperability is one of the central topics .', u'While the INTERA project has as one of its goals to achieve an interoperability between two widely used metadata sets for the domain of language resources , the ECHO project created an integrated metadata domain of in total nine data providers from five different disciplines from the humanities .', u'In both projects ad hoc techniques are used to achieve results .', u'In the INTERA project , however , machine readable and ISO compliant concept definitions are created as a first step towards the Semantic Web .', u'In the ECHO project a complex ontology was realized purely relying on XML .', u'It is argued that concept definitions should be registered in open Data Category Repositories and that relations between them should be described as RDF assertions .', u'Yet we are missing standards that would allow us to overcome the ad hoc solutions .']

entities: [[(u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'e-Learning', u'Method')], [(u'metadata standards', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'LOM', u'Method'), (u'e-Learning repositories', u'Material'), (u'e-Learning content', u'Material')], [(u'Service-Oriented Architectures', u'Method'), (u'open systems', u'Task')], [(u'distributed systems', u'Method')], [(u'system architecture', u'Method')], [(u'e-Learning Repository share.loc', u'Method'), (u'LOM', u'Method')], [(u'service tier', u'Method'), (u'LOM-compliant representations of metadata', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'metadata', u'USED-FOR', u'e-Learning')], [(u'LOM', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'metadata standards')], [(u'Service-Oriented Architectures', u'USED-FOR', u'open systems')], [], [], [(u'LOM', u'USED-FOR', u'e-Learning Repository share.loc')], [(u'service tier', u'USED-FOR', u'LOM-compliant representations of metadata')]]
sentences: [u'The importance of metadata for e-Learning is undisputed , particularly in terms of the Semantic Web .', u'Based on metadata standards such as LOM ( Learning Object Metadata ) , e-Learning repositories can offer an effective and efficient search for e-Learning content .', u'The emerging paradigm of Service-Oriented Architectures ( SOAs ) enables developers to implement open systems instead of monolithic ones .', u'Well-defined interfaces for distributed systems have to be provided to enable easy integration of functionalities .', u'In this context it is important to build the entire system architecture on a suitably chosen metadata standard .', u'The e-Learning Repository share.loc presented in this paper uses special implementations of LOM within its different tiers of the entire architecture .', u'An additional service tier that is implemented vertically to the common application tiers enables remote systems to request LOM-compliant representations of metadata from each tier that are tailored towards their individual needs .']

entities: [[(u'modelling approach', u'Method'), (u'adaptive cloud infrastructure', u'Task'), (u'virtualized resources', u'Material'), (u'automated management tasks', u'Task'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'human administrator', u'Method')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'customer demand', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic')], [(u'modelling approach', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'incomplete or erroneous systems', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'operations', u'Generic'), (u'query', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'models', u'Generic'), (u'policies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'distributed modelling', u'Method'), (u'sub-models', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data merging', u'Task'), (u'shared vocabularies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'modelling approach', u'USED-FOR', u'adaptive cloud infrastructure'), (u'modelling approach', u'USED-FOR', u'automated management tasks')], [], [], [(u'modelling approach', u'USED-FOR', u'incomplete or erroneous systems'), (u'modelling approach', u'USED-FOR', u'operations'), (u'semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'modelling approach'), (u'query', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'operations')], [(u'data merging', u'CONJUNCTION', u'shared vocabularies')]]
sentences: [u'We present a modelling approach for an adaptive cloud infrastructure consisting of secure pools of virtualized resources , in order to facilitate automated management tasks and interaction with the system by a human administrator , or programmatically by a higher level service .', u'The topology of such a system is rapidly changing as , for example , it has the abilities to create , modify or destroy pools of virtual resources according to customer demand , as well as dynamically modify the mapping of virtual to physical resources .', u'It is also highly distributed and management data needs to be compiled from disparate sources .', u'Our modelling approach , based on the semantic web , allows us to represent complex topologies , model incomplete or erroneous systems and perform operations such as query , while still allowing validation of the models against system invariants and policies .', u'It also supports distributed modelling , allowing sub-models to be combined , data merging , and shared vocabularies .']

entities: [[(u'Graph databases', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'Social Networks Analysis', u'Task')], [(u'querying graph databases', u'Task'), (u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'general-purpose query languages', u'Material'), (u'regular path queries', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'languages', u'Generic')], [(u'one', u'Generic'), (u'paths', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'languages', u'Generic'), (u'graph databases', u'Material')], [(u'topology of the graph', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Social Networks Analysis')], [(u'regular path queries', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'general-purpose query languages')], [(u'semantics', u'USED-FOR', u'languages')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Graph databases have gained renewed interest in the last years , due to its applications in areas such as the Semantic Web and Social Networks Analysis .', u'We study the problem of querying graph databases , and , in particular , the expressiveness and complexity of evaluation for several general-purpose query languages , such as the regular path queries and its extensions with conjunctions and inverses .', u'We distinguish between two semantics for these languages .', u'The first one , based on simple paths , easily leads to intractability , while the second one , based on arbitrary paths , allows tractable evaluation for an expressive family of languages .', u'We also study two recent extensions of these languages that have been motivated by modern applications of graph databases .', u'The first one allows to treat paths as first-class citizens , while the second one permits to express queries that combine the topology of the graph with its underlying data .']

entities: [[(u'acupuncture-moxibustion 3-D image browser', u'Method'), (u'VOXEL-MAN framework.Methods Points', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'3-D location', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'3-D division', u'Method'), (u'graphical model', u'Method'), (u'medical knowledge bank', u'Material'), (u'semantic web and intelligence object model', u'Method'), (u'anatomic structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'medical knowledge bank', u'Material'), (u'teaching method', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'teaching method', u'USED-FOR', u'anatomy of acupuncture points')]]
sentences: [u'Objective To establish acupuncture-moxibustion 3-D image browser by incorporating 16 dangerous points into the visible man within the VOXEL-MAN framework.Methods Points were located by 3-D location of standardized 2-D described points.Ball models indicate points.Muscles were divided by 3-D division with double chroma ellipsoids.Blood vessels and nerves were constructed by graphical model making.A relevant medical knowledge bank was established by semantic web and intelligence object model making.Results Location and indication of dangerous points in the visible man were accomplished.Division and visualization of the relevant anatomic structure were achieved.A relevant medical knowledge bank was established.Intelligence animated pictures of QTVR format were produced.Conclusion Multilevel and multi-angular stereoscopic visualization of the anatomic structure of points and the whole process of acupuncture helps to improve the clinical curative effect of acupuncture and avoid its accidents and provides a satisfactory teaching method for the anatomy of acupuncture points .']

entities: [[(u'Peer-to-peer ( P2P ) computing', u'Method'), (u'P2P systems', u'Method'), (u'P2P data management systems', u'Method'), (u'schema ) information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web languages', u'Material'), (u'RDF/S', u'Method'), (u'semantic queries', u'Material'), (u'peer RDF/S bases', u'Material'), (u'ICS-FORTH SQPeer middleware', u'Method'), (u'SQPeer', u'Method'), (u'intensional active schemas', u'Method'), (u'distributed query plans', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SQPeer query plans', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'schema ) information', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic queries'), (u'Semantic Web languages', u'USED-FOR', u'P2P data management systems'), (u'Semantic Web languages', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic queries'), (u'ICS-FORTH SQPeer middleware', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic queries'), (u'intensional active schemas', u'USED-FOR', u'P2P data management systems'), (u'intensional active schemas', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic queries'), (u'intensional active schemas', u'USED-FOR', u'ICS-FORTH SQPeer middleware'), (u'optimization opportunities', u'USED-FOR', u'SQPeer query plans')]]
sentences: [u'Peer-to-peer ( P2P ) computing is currently attracting enormous attention In P2P systems a very large number of autonomous computing nodes ( the peers ) pool together their resources and rely on each other for data and services More and more P2P data management systems rely nowadays on intensional ( i.e schema ) information for integrating and querying peer bases Such information can be easily captured by emerging Semantic Web languages such as RDF/S However , a fully-fledged framework for evaluating semantic queries over peer RDF/S bases ( materialized or virtual ) is missing In this paper we present the ICS-FORTH SQPeer middleware for routing and processing RQL queries and RVL views The novelty of SQPeer lies on the use of intensional active schemas for determining relevant peer bases , as well as , constructing distributed query plans In this context , we consider optimization opportunities for SQPeer query plans .']

entities: [[(u'Ontologies', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'World Wide Web', u'Material')], [(u'large-scale high quality domain ontologies', u'Task'), (u'ontology building', u'Task')], [(u'Ontology building', u'Task'), (u'structural and logical complexity', u'Metric'), (u'production of software artefacts', u'Task')], [(u'ontology building methodology', u'Method'), (u'software engineering', u'Method'), (u'Unified Software Development Process', u'Method'), (u'Unified Process', u'Method')], [(u'UP', u'Method'), (u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'ontology building', u'Task'), (u'UP', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'UPON', u'Method'), (u'eBusiness domain', u'Material')], [(u'methodologies', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'Unified Software Development Process', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'software engineering'), (u'Unified Software Development Process', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Unified Process'), (u'Unified Process', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'software engineering')], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology building'), (u'UP', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology building')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Ontologies are the backbone of the Semantic Web , a semantic-aware version of the World Wide Web .', u'The availability of large-scale high quality domain ontologies depends on effective and usable methodologies aimed at supporting the crucial process of ontology building .', u'Ontology building exhibits a structural and logical complexity that is comparable to the production of software artefacts .', u'This paper proposes an ontology building methodology that capitalizes the large experience drawn from a widely used standard in software engineering : the Unified Software Development Process or Unified Process ( UP ) .', u'In particular , we propose UP for ONtology ( UPON ) building , a methodology for ontology building derived from the UP .', u'UPON is presented with the support of a practical example in the eBusiness domain .', u'A comparative evaluation with other methodologies and the results of its adoption in the context of the Athena EU Integrated Project are also discussed .']

sentences: [u'Recently ontologies are playing very important part in many areas , such as intelligent information retrieve , knowledge management and organization , electronic commerce and so on , however , several drawbacks must be overcome before ontologies become useful and practical tools .', u'As the number of ontologies are made publicly available and accessible on the web increases steadily , a single ontology is no longer enough to support the tasks envisaged by a distributed environment like the semantic web .', u'Multiple ontologies need to be accessed for several applications .', u'A critical issue is ontology integration , which can largely improve the efficiency to enrich such a domain ontology with less time and lower cost for obtaining related knowledge .', u'This paper has deeply studied the principles of ontology integration , then proposes a procedure model for ontology construction and a new framework for ontology integration based on machine learning through analyzing the characteristics and problems in the process of ontology integration .']

relations: [[(u'DBpedia', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web resources'), (u'structured knowledge', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web resources'), (u'geographical features', u'FEATURE-OF', u'structured knowledge'), (u'towns', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'geographical features'), (u'rivers and historical buildings', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'geographical features'), (u'historical buildings', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'geographical features')], [(u'containment', u'CONJUNCTION', u'proximity')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic Web resources such as DBpedia provide a rich source of structured knowledge about geographical features such as towns , rivers and historical buildings .', u'Retrieval from these resources of all content that is relevant to a particular spatial query of , for example , containment or proximity is not always straightforward because there is considerable inconsistency in the way in which geographical features are referenced to location .', u'In DBpedia some geographical feature instances have point coordinates , some have qualitative properties that provide explicit or implicit locational information via place names , and some have neither of these .', u'Here we show how structured geo-spatial query , a form of question answering , on DBpedia can be performed with a hybrid strategy that exploits both quantitative and qualitative spatial properties in combination with a high quality reference geo-dataset that can help to support a full range of geo-spatial query operators .']

entities: [[(u'semantic markup', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'user-oriented tools', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'candidates', u'Generic'), (u'XML', u'Material'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'DAML+OIL', u'Method'), (u'ontology specifications', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'XML', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'markup languages', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'XML', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RDF'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'DAML+OIL')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Several languages have been proposed as candidates for semantic markup .', u'We needed to adopt a language for our current research on developing user-oriented tools operating over the Semantic Web .', u'This paper presents the results of our analysis of three candidates that we considered : XML , RDF , and DAML+OIL along with their associated schemas and ontology specifications .', u'The analysis focuses on the expressiveness of each language , and is presented along several dimensions and summarized in a comparison table .', u'A surprising result of our analysis is the decision to adopt XML ( Schema ) for practical reasons , since it is able to accommodate a relatively expressive set of constructs and is widely known and commercially supported .', u'We also discuss how we plan to complement XML ( S ) with a small set of conventions , so that we will have an easier transition to other markup languages in the future .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'interfaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'QoS prediction method', u'Method'), (u'Web service', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'QoS', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'QoS prediction', u'Task'), (u'Web services', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'capabilities', u'CONJUNCTION', u'interfaces')], [], [(u'QoS prediction method', u'USED-FOR', u'Web service')], [], [(u'QoS prediction', u'USED-FOR', u'Web services')]]
sentences: [u'The realization of the Semantic Web is underway with the development of an arena of services providing similar properties , capabilities , interfaces , and effects .', u"To pick one of such similar and useful services that matches the user 's requirements is a difficult task and necessitates the use of an intelligent decision making framework .", u'This paper proposes a QoS prediction method used to recommend Web service for solving the problem of choosing high quality Web service .', u'According to the different feeling of different users to the same service , and the different similarity among the QoS of different services , the approach first divides the users and services into several modes , and then calculates the means of one mode to predict the QoS of a service that the user never used before .', u'Experimental simulation results show that with this approach the preciseness of QoS prediction for Web services can be improved significantly .']

sentences: [u'Bringing Interoperability among heterogeneous semantic information services developed for open environments is a great challenge .', u'Software agents have been realized as pivotal technology to drive semantic web and grid services ultimately leading to automation of e-Science , e-Health and e-Commerce applications .', u'Ontologies play a vital role as source of semantic representation of web services , grid services and agent services .', u'Different ontology languages have been proposed for semantic representation of these technologies .', u'OWL is W3C standard for description of services on web and grid while FIPA SL is used as semantic language in agents .', u'Both semantic languages differ in terms , syntax and semantics .', u'We proposed software agent driven system architecture i.e.middleware ontology service ( MOS ) which provide translation of ontologies between these two languages .', u'At the end , we provide comparative study of MOS with previous developed system i.e .', u'Ontology Gateway and describe its implementation and results .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web vision', u'Method'), (u'machine understandable Web resources', u'Material'), (u'automatic semantic reconciliation', u'Task')], [(u'tools', u'Generic')], [(u'formal model', u'Generic'), (u'semantic reconciliation', u'Task'), (u'matching process', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'mappings', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'automatic semantic reconciliation', u'Task'), (u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'algorithms', u'Generic')], [(u'algorithms', u'Generic')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'automatic semantic reconciliation', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'The introduction of the Semantic Web vision and the shift toward machine understandable Web resources has unearthed the importance of automatic semantic reconciliation .', u'Consequently , new tools for automating the process were proposed .', u'In this work we present a formal model of semantic reconciliation and analyze in a systematic manner the properties of the process outcome , primarily the inherent uncertainty of the matching process and how it reflects on the resulting mappings .', u'An important feature of this research is the identification and analysis of factors that impact the effectiveness of algorithms for automatic semantic reconciliation , leading , it is hoped , to the design of better algorithms by reducing the uncertainty of existing algorithms .', u'Against this background we empirically study the aptitude of two algorithms to correctly match concepts .', u'This research is both timely and practical in light of recent attempts to develop and utilize methods for automatic semantic reconciliation .']

entities: [[(u'Rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'inference rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SWRL', u'Method'), (u'membership degree', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'imprecise knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'membership degree intervals', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SWRL', u'Method'), (u'vague-SWRL', u'Material')], [(u'f-SWRL', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'membership degrees', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'membership degrees', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'vague-SWRL', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RuleML', u'Method'), (u'vague-SWRL', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'imprecision', u'CONJUNCTION', u'uncertainty')], [(u'membership degree intervals', u'USED-FOR', u'fuzzy information')], [], [], [(u'RuleML', u'USED-FOR', u'vague-SWRL')]]
sentences: [u'Rules in the Web have become a mainstream topic since inference rules are marked up for e-commerce and are identified as a design issue of the semantic web [ 7 ] .', u'SWRL [ 4 ] is incapable of representing the imprecision and uncertainty , and a single membership degree in fuzzy sets [ 6 ] is inaccurate to represent the imprecise knowledge .', u'Based on vague sets [ 2 ] which employ membership degree intervals to represent fuzzy information , we propose a fuzzy extension of SWRL ( vague-SWRL .', u"What 's more , weights in f-SWRL [ 5 ] have no power to represent the importance of membership degrees .", u'In order to modify the membership degrees and to balance and supplement the weights of vague classes and properties ( i.e. , first degree weights ) , we present the notion of second degree weight to represent weights of the membership degrees in vague-SWRL .', u'In addition , we extend RuleML to express vague-SWRL .']

sentences: [u'The semantic languages like Ontology Web Language , Web Services Modeling Language and Foundation for Intelligent Physical Agent Semantic Language , differ in syntax and semantic representation , result in mismatches that required mapping and interoperability for cross service utilisation among these semantic languages .', u'In this paper , we compiled our work that is a middleware technique to make possible translation among heterogeneous contents on the bases of similar objectives that FIPA Ontology Service Specification provides to agent community .', u'The paper addresses and motivates the relevant topic of achieving semantic interoperability among software agents and semantic web through the development of agent based middleware architecture .', u"Semantic description languages used in our architecture are FIPA SL , W3C 's OWL and WSML , in order to dynamically obtain the semantic interoperability in a heterogeneous and distributed environment .", u'The results are evaluated for ontology mappings with traditional parsing technique and SPARQL query based approach .']

entities: [[(u'Information and Communication Technologies', u'Method'), (u'maintenance', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Web-Enabled Knowledge Management System', u'Method'), (u'ICT related problems', u'Task')], [(u'web', u'Material'), (u'online dialogue', u'Material')], [(u'Knowledge Management System', u'Method')], [(u'Knowledge Management System', u'Method'), (u'systems Administrators', u'Method')]]
sentences: [u'The core and one of the major important aspects of the Information and Communication Technologies in the area of maintenance and supports to aid sustainability of its equipment .', u'The design and implementation of Model Driven Development of Semantic Web-Enabled Knowledge Management System is to help any ICT based organization in making the solutions to all their ICT related problems available , step by step to their ICT expert inform of a repository .', u'The use of web makes online dialogue and exchange of ideas possible .', u'The richness and the effectiveness/efficiency of the Knowledge Management System depend solely on how the solutions to all reported problems are readily available .', u'Knowledge Management System was designed to keep the data base of the problems vide the steps taken towards getting solutions , such that the systems Administrators get assisted on how to solve problems without necessarily making references to manuals .']

sentences: [u'As the world of Internet transforms more and more to the interactive community of Web 2.0 and stretching forward towards the semantic Web 3.0 , the need for tools and frameworks that can support these philosophies and technologies that come with it becomes apparent .', u'This paper will propose a new framework that allows all Internet users to edit and participate in every single aspect of the web experience , as well as allowing web developers to embed all forms of advanced solutions like AI and content awareness .', u"From previous research on meme media architecture and knowledge federation , known as IntelligentPad/IntelligentBox , has risen an evolved and extended web based framework that allows every user to bring their ideas and knowledge to the table in order to create a true federation of humanity 's collected knowledge , that is in constant progress and evolution .", u'We have chosen to call this framework Webble World .']

entities: [[(u"`` E-Novation ''", u'Method'), (u'combination innovation', u'Method'), (u'e-marketing', u'Method'), (u'collaborative platforms', u'Method'), (u'Web 2.0 methodologies', u'Method'), (u'connectivity', u'Metric')], [(u'collaborative information platform', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'E-marketing', u'Method'), (u'marketing', u'Task'), (u'computer-mediated environments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'service-dominant logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'collaborative value creation approaches', u'Method')], [(u'collaborative information platform', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web 2.0 applications', u'Task'), (u'e-marketing and innovation perspectives', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], []]

sentences: [u"`` E-Novation '' is defined as a combination innovation and e-marketing enabled by new collaborative platforms that are being developed and released using Web 2.0 methodologies , allowing for a different level of connectivity around the world .", u'This chapter explores innovation and its contribution to firm performance , links to market orientation-and development of a new collaborative information platform to support innovation .', u'E-marketing is also defined in terms of marketing in computer-mediated environments with emphasis on service-dominant logic ( SDL ) and collaborative value creation approaches .', u'Aspects of the evolving new collaborative information platform such as the Semantic Web and Web 2.0 applications are discussed from e-marketing and innovation perspectives .', u"Will `` e-novation '' challenge businesses to rethink how their employees will create or participate in collaborative groups with others where future revenue prospects appear to mainly from service development ?", u'This question is also explored through subsequent chapters in the book .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'Semantic Web 3.0', u'USED-FOR', u'Knowledge Organization systems'), (u'shared meta data', u'USED-FOR', u'Knowledge Organization systems'), (u'shared meta data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'formalized ontologies')], [(u'semantic approaches', u'USED-FOR', u"'social driven systems"), (u'approach', u'COMPARE', u'semantic approaches'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u"'social driven systems")], [], []]
sentences: [u'Traditionally Knowledge Organization is the ordering of documents on a bookshelf and the indexing of these in a more or less one-dimensional catalog .', u'Now with the Web , its many and hyperlinked , distributed and heterogeneous sources the plain terminological approaches are no longer sufficient .', u'In the same way ISKO society has to rethink its mission .', u'The New Knowledge Organization , which aims at the Semantic Web 3.0 tries to combine different Knowledge Organization systems by shared meta data and formalized ontologies that are logical deductive .', u"Whereas the semantic approaches have quite an opposite approach to the 'social driven systems the future might lay in a combination of logical descriptions , specialized evaluation , and self-organizing principles , what could be named Self Organizing Knowledge Organization Systems .", u'But still there are open questions which might be solved in future by ISKO and neighbor societies .', u'Not at least ethics and trust are key parameters .']

sentences: [u'This paper documents the case to address the distributed data storage and widely used unique identifiers which are in use from the beginning of databases and backend systems .', u'The importance of uniqueness for object system identifiers is crucial for efficient data retrieval , storage and comparison .', u'We are representing the new method for objects tagging using synergy mechanism between well known Geohash algorithm and Universally Unique Identifiers we call GHUUID ( Geohash+UUID ) gaining the agent system spatio-temporal identification of all data available .', u'Multi-Agent systems in their nature strongly rely upon distributed databases across vast amount of data .', u'Some of the interoperability issues are solved with usage of semantic web principles which can be cumbersome to implement and maintain .', u'Most systems need the basic space-time correlation which can be the corner stone for the efficient analysis and data aligning regardless of objects stored and their nature .']

entities: [[(u'Cancer registry information systems', u'Method'), (u'data sets', u'Material'), (u'coding systems', u'Method')], [(u'datasets', u'Generic'), (u'semantic issues', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'coding systems', u'Method')], [(u'biomedical ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Grid service infrastructure', u'Method'), (u'semantic and coding models', u'Method'), (u'cancer registries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'accuracy', u'Metric'), (u'knowledge modelling', u'Task'), (u'knowledge sharing', u'Task'), (u'registries', u'Generic'), (u'related data sources', u'Material'), (u'automation of information retrieval', u'Task')], [], [(u'formal semantic layer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'cancer registries', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'biomedical ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'cancer registries'), (u'Grid service infrastructure', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic and coding models'), (u'knowledge modelling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'interoperability'), (u'interoperability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'knowledge sharing')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Cancer registry information systems need to deal with several data sets annotated with different coding systems .', u'Designing , maintaining and linking these datasets involves dealing with semantic issues , tackling the shortcomings exhibited by coding systems as well as considering an appropriate computing infrastructure .', u'We argue that biomedical ontologies and a Grid service infrastructure , together with a clear separation between semantic and coding models , can prove beneficial to cancer registries in terms of accuracy of knowledge modelling , interoperability and knowledge sharing with other registries and related data sources , automation of information retrieval .', u'A real-life example is illustrated and a brief review of related projects is provided .', u'We conclude that a formal semantic layer , which is the basis of large scale meaning-oriented projects such as the Semantic Web , is the key to the provision of a uniform , science-based view across cancer registries and related systems .']

entities: [[(u'Social interactions', u'Task')], [(u'application', u'Generic'), (u'data', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web', u'Material'), (u'online social networks', u'Method'), (u'real-world contact sensing platform', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'application', u'Generic')], [(u'Personal profiles', u'Generic'), (u'Web 2.0 systems', u'Method'), (u'semantic academic data sources', u'Material'), (u'face-to-face contact networks', u'Method'), (u'wearable sensors', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'heterogeneous data layers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'visualisation of contact data', u'Material')], [(u'application', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Social interactions are one of the key factors to the success of conferences and similar community gatherings .', u'This paper describes a novel application that integrates data from the semantic web , online social networks , and a real-world contact sensing platform .', u'This application was successfully deployed at ESWC09 , and actively used by 139 people .', u'Personal profiles of the participants were automatically generated using several Web 2.0 systems and semantic academic data sources , and integrated in real-time with face-to-face contact networks derived from wearable sensors .', u'Integration of all these heterogeneous data layers made it possible to offer various services to conference attendees to enhance their social experience such as visualisation of contact data , and a site to explore and connect with other participants .', u'This paper describes the architecture of the application , the services we provided , and the results we achieved in this deployment .']

entities: [[(u'Edutella/JXTA', u'Method'), (u'P2P ( peer-to-peer ) semantic Web application', u'Task'), (u'heterogeneous resource metadata repositories', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'P2P manner', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'Method')], [(u'Edutella/JXTA', u'Method'), (u'pure P2P setting', u'Method'), (u'Web services', u'Task'), (u'distributed functionalities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'interaction scenarios', u'Method'), (u'Edutella/JXTA P2P services', u'Method'), (u'Web services', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'service layer interaction', u'Task'), (u'Web services', u'Task'), (u'Web services/Edutella proxies', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Edutella/JXTA', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'P2P ( peer-to-peer ) semantic Web application')], [(u'Edutella/JXTA', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web services')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'service layer interaction'), (u'Web services/Edutella proxies', u'USED-FOR', u'service layer interaction'), (u'Web services/Edutella proxies', u'USED-FOR', u'Web services')]]
sentences: [u'Edutella/JXTA is a P2P ( peer-to-peer ) semantic Web application , which is aimed to accommodate heterogeneous resource metadata repositories in a P2P manner and further facilitate the exchange of the resource metadata based on RDF .', u'Whereas the initial use cases of Edutella/JXTA are defined and implemented in the context of a pure P2P setting , where all Edutella participants are JXTA peers interacting with each other via various P2P services , in this paper we investigate the interaction between Edutella/JXTA and Web services with the purpose of exchanging distributed functionalities between the two platforms .', u'In terms of two typical interaction scenarios : ( 1 ) exposing existing Edutella/JXTA P2P services as Web services ; and ( 2 ) integrating Web services enabled content providers into Edutella/JXTA , we propose an approach for achieving the service layer interaction between Edutella/JXTA and Web services through so-called Web services/Edutella proxies .']

entities: [[(u'ontology-based information retrieval model', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'OWL Lite', u'Method'), (u'ontology language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'reasoning problems', u'Task'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u"Web 's content", u'Material'), (u'semantic markups', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic index terms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'semantic index terms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'description logic reasoner', u'Method')], [(u'semantic index terms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'ranking function', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'model', u'Generic')], []]
relations: [[(u'ontology-based information retrieval model', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'complexity', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'reasoning problems'), (u'domain ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology')], [(u'semantic markups', u'USED-FOR', u'information retrieval'), (u'semantic index terms', u'USED-FOR', u'information retrieval')], [(u'description logic reasoner', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic index terms')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we describe ontology-based information retrieval model for the Semantic Web .', u'By using OWL Lite as standard ontology language , which is a suitable tradeoff between expressivity of knowledge and complexity of reasoning problems , ontology is generated through translating and integrating domain ontologies .', u"The terms defined in ontology are used as metadata to markup the Web 's content ; these semantic markups are semantic index terms for information retrieval .", u'We can obtain the equivalent classes of semantic index terms by using description logic reasoner .', u'The logical views of documents and user information needs , generated in terms of the equivalent classes of semantic index terms , can represent documents and user information needs well , so the performance of information retrieval can be improved effectively when suitable ranking function is chosen .', u'The practicability of this model is discussed .', u'Finally , the related works are introduced , and the conclusion and our future work are given .']

relations: [[(u'social software', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dynamic content generation'), (u'Web 2.0', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dynamic content generation')], [], [(u'scalable and secure cross-platform reputation system', u'USED-FOR', u'Web 2.0')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The recent development of the Internet , especially the expanding use of social software and dynamic content generation commonly termed as Web 2.0 enables users to find information about almost every possible topic on the Web .', u'On the downside , it becomes more and more difficult to decide which informa- tion can be trusted in .', u"In this paper we propose the enhancement of Web 2.0 by a scalable and secure cross-platform reputation system that takes into account a user 's social network .", u'Our proposed solution Jason is based on standard meth- ods of the semantic web and does not need a central entity .', u'It enables the fast and flexible evaluation of arbitrary content on the World Wide Web .', u'In contrast to many other reputation systems it provides mechanisms to ensure the authen- ticity of web content , thus , enabling the user to explicitely choose information published by trusted authors .']

relations: [[], [], [(u'marketing campaigns', u'CONJUNCTION', u'social networks'), (u'marketing campaigns', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontologies'), (u'marketing campaigns', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web'), (u'marketing campaigns', u'CONJUNCTION', u'social networks'), (u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web'), (u'social network information', u'USED-FOR', u'information processing')]]
sentences: [u'Social networks have interesting properties .', u'They influence our lives enormously without us being aware of the implications they raise .', u"The authors investigate the following areas concerning social networks : how to exploit our unprecedented wealth of data and how we can mine social networks for purposes such as marketing campaigns ; social networks as a particular form of influence , i.e .. , the way that people agree on terminology and this phenomenon 's implications for the way we build ontologies and the Semantic Web ; social networks as something we can discover from data ; the use of social network information to offer a wealth of new applications such as better recommendations for restaurants , trustworthy email senders , or ( maybe ) blind dates ; investigation of the richness and difficulty of harvesting FOAF ( friend-of-a-friend ) information ; and by looking at how information processing is bound to social context , the resulting ways that network topology 's definition determines its outcomes ."]

entities: [[(u'ideologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ideology engineering tools', u'Method'), (u'analyzing ideologies', u'Task')], [(u'ideologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'graph analysis techniques', u'Method')], [(u'anti-pattern ideology', u'Method'), (u'knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'SPARSE', u'Method'), (u'anti-patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'anti-patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'social networks', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'ideology engineering tools', u'USED-FOR', u'analyzing ideologies')], [], [], [], [(u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Semantic Web')], []]
sentences: [u'A key argument for modelling knowledge in ideologies is the simple reuse of the facts .', u'However , nearby reliability checking , current ideology engineering tools give only essential functionalities for analyzing ideologies .', u'Since ideologies can be considered as graphs , graph analysis techniques are an apt answer for this necessity .', u'The anti-pattern ideology has been recently proposed as a knowledge base for SPARSE , an intelligent system that can detect the anti-patterns that exist in a software project .', u'However , apart from the excess of anti-patterns that are intrinsically informal and vague , the data used in the anti-pattern ideology itself is many times inexactly defined .', u'We exemplify in this paper the benefits of applying social networks to ontologies and the Semantic Web and discuss which research themes happen on the edge between the two particular fields .', u'Particularly , we confer how different ideas of centrality portray the core content and structure of ontology']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'e-science', u'Task')], [(u'concise and intuitive deltas', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'change detection algorithm', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'real ontologies', u'Material'), (u'cultural and bioinformatics domains', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'scientific communities')], [], [], [], [], [(u'real ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'framework'), (u'cultural and bioinformatics domains', u'USED-FOR', u'framework')]]
sentences: [u'An increasing number of scientific communities rely on Semantic Web ontologies to share and interpret data within and across research domains .', u'These common knowledge representation resources are usually developed and maintained manually and essentially co-evolve along with experimental evidence produced by scientists worldwide .', u'Detecting automatically the differences between ( two ) versions of the same ontology in order to store or visualize their deltas is a challenging task for e-science .', u'In this paper , we focus on languages allowing the formulation of concise and intuitive deltas , which are expressive enough to describe unambiguously any possible change and that can be effectively and efficiently detected .', u'We propose a specific language that provably exhibits those characteristics and provide a change detection algorithm which is sound and complete with respect to the proposed language .', u'Finally , we provide a promising experimental evaluation of our framework using real ontologies from the cultural and bioinformatics domains .']

entities: [[(u'geographical information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'computational applications', u'Task'), (u'Web maps', u'Material'), (u'natural language query', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'geographic information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'technological features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'geographic information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'location based services', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'natural languge queries', u'Material')], [(u'prototype', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'geographical information', u'USED-FOR', u'computational applications')], [], [(u'location based services', u'CONJUNCTION', u'collaborative user participation')], []]
sentences: [u'One of the elements that have popularized and facilitated the use of geographical information on a variety of computational applications has been the use of Web maps ; this has opened new research challenges on different subjects , from locating places and people , the study of social behavior or the analyzing of the hidden structures of the terms used in a natural language query used for locating a place .', u'However , the use of geographic information under technological features is not new , instead it has been part of a development and technological integration process .', u'This paper presents a state of the art review about the application of geographic information under different approaches : its use on location based services , the collaborative user participation on it , its contextual-awareness , its use in the Semantic Web and the challenges of its use in natural languge queries .', u'Finally , a prototype that integrates most of these areas is presented .']

entities: [[(u'Exploratory search', u'Task'), (u'information base', u'Material')], [(u'retrieval search', u'Task'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'Logical Information Systems', u'Method'), (u'exploratory search', u'Task'), (u'construction of queries', u'Task')], [(u'LIS', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'summarization and navigation data structure', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'guiding', u'Task')], [(u'query language', u'Material'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'description logics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'tools', u'Generic'), (u'storing', u'Task'), (u'reasoning', u'Task'), (u'querying', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Exploratory search is about browsing and understanding an information base .', u'It requires a more interactive process than retrieval search , where the user sends a query and the system returns answers .', u'Logical Information Systems ( LIS ) support exploratory search by guiding users in the construction of queries , and by giving summaries of query results .', u'The contribution of this paper is to adapt and extend LIS to the Semantic Web .', u'We define a summarization and navigation data structure that provides rich views over data , and guides users from view to view .', u'This guiding is proved consistent ( i.e. , never leads to an empty result set ) , and complete ( i.e. , every query can be reached by navigation only ) .', u'The query language covers a large fragment of SPARQL , and is more concise by using a syntax close to description logics .', u'Our approach could be implemented on top of existing tools for storing , reasoning and querying .']

entities: [[(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'Generic'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed systems', u'Method'), (u'Web Services', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Webcommunity', u'Method'), (u'Web Services', u'Task'), (u'OWL-S', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'OWL-S', u'Method'), (u'foundational ontology', u'Method')], [(u'Core Ontology of Services', u'Method'), (u'foundational ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL-S', u'Material')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'Web Service description languages', u'Material')], [(u'CongoBuy', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Semantic Webcommunity', u'USED-FOR', u'Web Services')], [], [(u'foundational ontology', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL-S')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Clarity in semantics and a rich formalization of this semantics are important requirements for ontologies designed to be deployed in large-scale , open , distributed systems such as the envisioned Semantic Web This is especially important for the description of Web Services , which should enable complex tasks involving multiple agents .', u'As one of the first initiatives of the Semantic Webcommunity for describing Web Services , OWL-S attracts a lot of interest even though it is still under development .', u'We identify problematic aspects of OWL-S and suggest enhancements through alignment to a foundational ontology .', u'Another contribution of ourwork is the Core Ontology of Services that tries to fill the epistemological gap between the foundational ontology and OWL-S .', u'It can be reused to align other Web Service description languages as well .', u"Finally , we demonstrate the applicability of our work byaligning OWL-S ' standard example called CongoBuy ."]

entities: [[(u'Process Framework', u'Method'), (u'Interoperable Semantic Enterprise Environment', u'Task'), (u'business process activities', u'Method'), (u'Knowledge Transfer Cycle', u'Method')], [(u'PF-ISEE', u'Method'), (u'activity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Knowledge Transfer Cycle', u'Method')], [(u'Knowledge Transfer Cycle', u'Method'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'templates', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Knowledge Transfer Cycle', u'Method'), (u'business process activities', u'Task'), (u'rep- resentation model', u'Method')], [(u'Knowledge Transfer Cycle', u'Task')], [(u'PF-ISEE', u'Method'), (u'Enterprise Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'se- mantic tools', u'Method'), (u'enterprise applications', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Process Framework', u'USED-FOR', u'Interoperable Semantic Enterprise Environment'), (u'business process activities', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Knowledge Transfer Cycle')], [], [], [], [], [(u'PF-ISEE', u'USED-FOR', u'se- mantic tools'), (u'Enterprise Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'se- mantic tools'), (u'se- mantic tools', u'USED-FOR', u'enterprise applications')]]
sentences: [u'This paper describes a Process Framework for an Interoperable Semantic Enterprise Environment ( PF-ISEE ) for conceptualising knowledge by coupling business process activities and the Knowledge Transfer Cycle .', u'The PF-ISEE is triggered by an activity and starts the Knowledge Transfer Cycle .', u'The Knowledge Transfer Cycle provides six core concepts with methods , tools and templates to create , manipulate , store and retrieve information .', u'Within the Knowledge Transfer Cycle , special methods are applied in the context of knowledge intensive business process activities with a rep- resentation model that can be a global , role depended or an application inherited concept representation .', u'The paper in- troduces the main advantages and challenges of each core concept and explains its position in the Knowledge Transfer Cycle .', u'Furthermore , it is shown how the PF-ISEE can be part of an Enterprise Semantic Web in order to integrate se- mantic tools and technologies in standard enterprise applications .']

relations: [[(u'ADL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'formal language')], [], [(u'XML', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'languages'), (u'XML', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'languages')], [(u'semantics oriented models', u'USED-FOR', u'Exchanging and transforming data'), (u'OWL', u'USED-FOR', u'Web ontologies'), (u'W3C', u'USED-FOR', u'Web ontologies')], [], [(u'OWL ontologies', u'FEATURE-OF', u'openEHR ADL archetypes representation')], []]
sentences: [u'ADL is a formal language to express archetypes , independent of standards or domain .', u'However , its specification is not precise enough in relation to the specialization and semantic of archetypes , presenting difficulties in implementation and a few available tools .', u'Archetypes may be implemented using other languages such as XML or OWL , increasing integration with Semantic Web tools .', u'Exchanging and transforming data can be better implemented with semantics oriented models , for example using OWL which is a language to define and instantiate Web ontologies defined by W3C .', u'OWL permits defining significant , detailed , precise and consistent distinctions among classes , properties and relations by the user , ensuring the consistency of knowledge than using ADL techniques .', u'This paper presents a process of an openEHR ADL archetypes representation in OWL ontologies .', u'This process consists of ADL archetypes conversion in OWL ontologies and validation of OWL resultant ontologies using the mutation test .']

entities: [[(u'hidden Information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concept subsumption', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concept satisfiability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL reasoners', u'Method')], [(u'tableau algorithm', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'Medusa', u'Task')], [(u'Medusa', u'Method'), (u'DL-reasoner', u'Method'), (u'well-founded semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Description Logic', u'Method')], [(u'Description logic based ontology reasoners', u'Method'), (u'knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'concept languages', u'Material')], [(u'logics', u'Generic'), (u'rule-based reasoning mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'assertional knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'logic programming', u'Method'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'enriched reasoning', u'Method'), (u'Medusa', u'Method'), (u'DL-knowledge base', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rule based reasoner', u'Method')], [(u'prototype', u'Generic'), (u'API', u'Method'), (u'controlling communication', u'Task'), (u'ontology reasoner', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'concept subsumption', u'CONJUNCTION', u'concept satisfiability')], [], [], [(u'architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'Medusa')], [], [(u'Description logic based ontology reasoners', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge representation')], [(u'rule-based reasoning mechanisms', u'USED-FOR', u'assertional knowledge base')], [(u'DL-knowledge base', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rule based reasoner')], [(u'API', u'USED-FOR', u'prototype')]]
sentences: [u'In order to derive hidden Information ( concept subsumption , concept satisfiability and realization ) of OWL ontologies , a number of OWL reasoners have been introduced .', u'Most of the reasoners were implemented to be based on tableau algorithm .', u'However this approach has certain limitation .', u'This paper presents architecture for Medusa .', u'The Medusa is an extended DL-reasoner for SWRL ( Semantic Web Rule Language ) reasoning under well-founded semantics with ontologies specified in Description Logic .', u'Description logic based ontology reasoners theoretically explore knowledge representation and its reasoning in concept languages .', u'However these logics are not equipped with rule-based reasoning mechanisms for assertional knowledge base ; specifically , rule and facts in logic programming , or interaction of rules and facts with terminology .', u'In order to deal with the enriched reasoning , The Medusa provides combining DL-knowledge base and rule based reasoner .', u'The described prototype uses API [ 1 ] for controlling communication with the ontology reasoner .']

entities: [[(u'GoodRelations Web vocabulary', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'e-commerce', u'Task')], [(u'products', u'Generic')], [(u'item specificity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'search', u'Task')], [], [(u'product features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'FreeClassOWL ontology', u'Method'), (u'multi-dimensional search', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'GoodRelations Web vocabulary', u'USED-FOR', u'e-commerce')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'In this paper , we describe the technical approach of and experiences gained in exposing a major share of the European building and construction materials market on the basis of the GoodRelations Web vocabulary for e-commerce .', u'This allows for the fine-grained search for products , suppliers , and warehouses for any building-related sourcing needs .', u'Because building materials show a very high item specificity , they are very interesting for new types of search .', u'Also , transportation costs for building materials are very significant , which makes the distance from the warehouse to the point of consumption a critical dimension of search .', u'Based on existing data sources , we were able to include a rich , machine-readable description of individual product features using the FreeClassOWL ontology , which allow for multi-dimensional search .', u'The result is one of the largest and richest public datasets for a well-defined trade sector that is available on the Semantic Web .']

entities: [[(u'RDF framework', u'Method'), (u'semantic web stack', u'Method'), (u'widespread adoption', u'Method'), (u'RDF data', u'Material')], [(u'local RDF stores', u'Method'), (u'distributed indexing', u'Method'), (u'distributed query processing', u'Method'), (u'fail-safe solutions', u'Method')], [(u'Zeus', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'RDF graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'grid computing', u'Method')], [(u'Zeus', u'Method'), (u'distributed architecture', u'Method'), (u'specialised nodes', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'query processing framework', u'Method'), (u'query execution algorithm', u'Method'), (u'RDF triples', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'mechanism', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'RDF framework', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic web stack')], [(u'distributed indexing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'distributed query processing')], [(u'grid computing', u'USED-FOR', u'approach')], [(u'distributed architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'Zeus')], [(u'query execution algorithm', u'PART-OF', u'query processing framework')], []]
sentences: [u'The RDF framework is the underpinning element of semantic web stack ; its widespread adoption requires efficient tools to store and query RDF data .', u'A number of efficient local RDF stores already exist , while distributed indexing and distributed query processing are only starting to appear ; furthermore dynamically growing and fail-safe solutions are not yet available .', u'To remedy this situation , in this paper we present Zeus : an approach for efficient and scalable query processing over RDF graphs based on grid computing .', u'Zeus is based on a distributed architecture , where neither single point of failure nor specialised nodes exist .', u'The query processing framework , presented in the paper , includes a sophisticated query planning and query execution algorithm , which is designed expressively for storage and query of a stream of RDF triples .', u'This mechanism allows Zeus users to register queries that will be notified in real time of new relevant results .']

entities: [[(u'Web technologies', u'Method'), (u'Web-based service applications', u'Task'), (u'business process integration', u'Task'), (u'supply chain management', u'Task'), (u'knowledge management perspectives', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Web-based services', u'Task'), (u'Web-based services', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'Web-based services', u'Task'), (u'components', u'Generic')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'Web technologies', u'Method'), (u'Web service', u'Material'), (u'semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'Web information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'mining', u'Task')], [(u'insurance and knowledge services', u'Task'), (u'Web-based service framework', u'Method'), (u'business processes', u'Task')], [(u'Web-based services', u'Task'), (u'Web-based services and techniques', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Web technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'Web-based service applications'), (u'business process integration', u'USED-FOR', u'Web-based service applications'), (u'business process integration', u'CONJUNCTION', u'supply chain management'), (u'supply chain management', u'CONJUNCTION', u'knowledge management perspectives')], [], [], [(u'Web service', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Web technologies'), (u'Web service', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic Web'), (u'semantic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Web technologies'), (u'Web information retrieval', u'CONJUNCTION', u'mining')], [(u'knowledge services', u'FEATURE-OF', u'Web-based service framework')], []]
sentences: [u'The emergence of Web technologies enables a variety of Web-based service applications , which can be examined from business process integration , supply chain management , and knowledge management perspectives .', u'To categorize existing Web-based services while foreseeing potential new types , a unified view is needed to represent the structures and processes of Web-based services .', u'This paper proposes a general framework to identify essential structures and operations of Web-based services , and then models these components .', u'We articulate the framework with Web technologies , such as Web service and semantic Web , multi-agent and peer-to-peer , and Web information retrieval and mining .', u'Two comprehensive examples in insurance and knowledge services are used to elaborate the use of Web-based service framework in fulfilling business processes .', u'This study synthesizes essential structures and processes of Web-based services to build a framework for researchers and practitioners to develop Web-based services and techniques .']

entities: [[(u'Managing time-stamped data', u'Material'), (u'clinical research activities', u'Task'), (u'domain knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'temporal data', u'Material'), (u'database technologies', u'Method'), (u'clinical research systems', u'Task')], [(u'database representation of research data', u'Method'), (u'domain knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'clinical research concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methodologies', u'Generic'), (u'ontology-based specification of temporal information', u'Task'), (u'application', u'Generic'), (u'verification of protocol-specific temporal constraints', u'Task'), (u'clinical trial activities', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge-level temporal constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'operational trial data', u'Material'), (u'relational databases', u'Material')], [(u'SWRL', u'Material'), (u'research data management', u'Task'), (u'low-level representations of relational data', u'Task'), (u'high-level domain concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'study design', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'Managing time-stamped data', u'USED-FOR', u'clinical research activities')], [(u'temporal data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'domain knowledge'), (u'database technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'clinical research systems')], [(u'database representation of research data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'domain knowledge'), (u'database representation of research data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'clinical research concepts'), (u'domain knowledge', u'FEATURE-OF', u'clinical research concepts')], [(u'methodologies', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology-based specification of temporal information')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge-level temporal constraints')], [(u'rule languages OWL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SWRL')]]
sentences: [u'Managing time-stamped data is essential to clinical research activities and often requires the use of considerable domain knowledge .', u'Adequately representing and integrating temporal data and domain knowledge is difficult with the database technologies used in most clinical research systems .', u'There is often a disconnect between the database representation of research data and corresponding domain knowledge of clinical research concepts .', u'In this paper , we present a set of methodologies for undertaking ontology-based specification of temporal information , and discuss their application to the verification of protocol-specific temporal constraints among clinical trial activities .', u'Our approach allows knowledge-level temporal constraints to be evaluated against operational trial data stored in relational databases .', u'We show how the Semantic Web ontology and rule languages OWL and SWRL , respectively , can support tools for research data management that automatically integrate low-level representations of relational data with high-level domain concepts used in study design .']

relations: [[], [(u'semantic data access', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'astronomy'), (u'semantic data access', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mining'), (u'semantic data access', u'CONJUNCTION', u'distributed annotation'), (u'data mining', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'astronomy'), (u'data mining', u'CONJUNCTION', u'intelligent data dissemination'), (u'distributed annotation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mining'), (u'distributed annotation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'heterogeneous sources'), (u'distributed annotation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'intelligent data dissemination'), (u'heterogeneous sources', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'astronomy'), (u'heterogeneous sources', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data mining'), (u'heterogeneous sources', u'CONJUNCTION', u'heterogeneous sources'), (u'heterogeneous sources', u'CONJUNCTION', u'intelligent data dissemination'), (u'intelligent data dissemination', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Virtual Observatory semantic applications')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web has turned from W3C vision into a set of practical engineering challenges ; at the same time , the success of Web~2.0 applications has illustrated a broad variety of new ways that users ( and indeed machines ) can interact with data sources .', u'Now is an excellent time to examine the many opportunities for astronomy , including semantic data access , data mining ( exploiting distributed annotation and heterogeneous sources ) , and intelligent data dissemination and discovery. # R # # N # This paper presents a brief review of the technologies , illustrating it with examples of the wide range of existing Virtual Observatory semantic applications , from the elaborate and formal to the informal and lightweight .', u"The latter tools overlap with Web-2.0 style applications , and indicate how we might adapt some of that community 's more successful ideas .", u'Throughout , the emphasis will be on how existing applications help us imagine further possibilities of the emerging field of Semantic Astronomy .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'decision making', u'Task'), (u'route planning', u'Task')], [(u'solutions', u'Generic'), (u'semantically annotated data', u'Material'), (u'real-world applications', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic data', u'Material'), (u'actionable events', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Web services', u'Task')], [(u'data model', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'actionable events', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic applications', u'Task'), (u'programming language-dependent implementations', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'extensions', u'Generic'), (u'semantic applications', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'decision making', u'CONJUNCTION', u'route planning')], [(u'real-world applications', u'CONJUNCTION', u'real-world applications')], [], [(u'data model', u'CONJUNCTION', u'specification'), (u'specification', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology')], [], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'extensions')]]
sentences: [u'Applications built on top of the Semantic Web are emerging as a novel solution in different areas , such as decision making and route planning .', u'However , to connect results of these solutions -i.e. , the semantically annotated data - with real-world applications , this semantic data needs to be connected to actionable events .', u'A lot of work has been done ( both semantically as non-semantically ) to describe and define Web services , but there is still a gap on a more abstract level , i.e. , describing interfaces independent of the technology used .', u'In this paper , we present a data model , specification , and ontology to semantically declare and describe functions independently of the used technology .', u'This way , we can declare and use actionable events in semantic applications , without restricting ourselves to programming language-dependent implementations .', u'The ontology allows for extensions , and is proposed as a possible solution for semantic applications in various domains .']

entities: [[(u'Ontology', u'Method'), (u'modeling instrument', u'Method'), (u'knowledge pattern', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic and knowledge levels', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'tourism-information-library', u'Method'), (u'ontology building tool', u'Method'), (u'reasoning rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'uncertainty knowledge reasoning', u'Method'), (u'description logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Bayesian Network', u'Method'), (u'Netica', u'Method'), (u'bayesian network topology structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'conditioned probability table', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'probabilistic reasoning', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Ontology', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'modeling instrument'), (u'modeling instrument', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge pattern'), (u'modeling instrument', u'USED-FOR', u'bayesian network topology structure')]]
sentences: [u"Ontology , as a modeling instrument to describe knowledge pattern can be basically used on the platform of semantic and knowledge levels , also can provide a standardization describing of concept and fix a foundation for knowledge shared.To structure a field of ontology called tourism-information-library by using an ontology building tool , it can implement a series of reasoning on the knowledge bases.Meanwhile , reasoning rules can be structured manually in order to provide deeper knowledge digging , thus a key target of semantic web called `` machine can understand '' will be completed.For uncertainty knowledge reasoning which can not be described by description logic , the Bayesian Network has been introduced.So using the tool of Netica to build bayesian network topology structure , can not only structure a conditioned probability table easily , but also can rapidly and rationally give out a probabilistic reasoning , then a feasible traveling plan meet the people 's needs can be approximately put forward ."]

sentences: [u'The EU funded collaborative research project STREAMER aims on Energy-efficient Buildings ( EeB ) , focusing on mixed-use healthcare districts .', u'Besides innovations in EeB technology , special emphasis is laid on improving methodologies and tools used in the design process of new or retrofitted hospital buildings .', u'STREAMER follows a model-based , holistic approach by integrating design data on both building and district level.Advanced ICT methods like Semantic Web , Ontologies , Parametric Modelling or Knowledge Based Systems , will be reviewed , adapted , and improved to use them during the energy-efficient-buildings design process .', u'The project not only aims on developing theoretical concepts , but also on practical case studies : based on already existing software , a number of interoperable software tools shall be developed and evaluated in four demonstration projects .', u'The paper describes the system architecture and provides a functional spectrum of the design tools , focusing on interoperability issues .', u'2015 Taylor & Francis Group .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'Linked Open Data initiative', u'Task')], [(u'knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'instance data', u'Material'), (u'schema', u'Generic')], [(u'knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'schema information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'others', u'Generic')], [(u'rich schema', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'consistency checking', u'Method'), (u'querying possibilities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'light-weight method', u'Method'), (u'knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'SPARQL endpoints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL 2 axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'schemata', u'Method'), (u'DBpedia', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'The Semantic Web has seen a rise in the availability and usage of knowledge bases over the past years , in particular in the Linked Open Data initiative .', u'Despite this growth , there is still a lack of knowledge bases that consist of high quality schema information and instance data adhering to this schema .', u'Several knowledge bases only consist of schema information , while others are , to a large extent , a mere collection of facts without a clear structure .', u'The combination of rich schema and instance data would allow powerful reasoning , consistency checking , and improved querying possibilities as well as provide more generic ways to interact with the underlying data .', u'In this article , we present a light-weight method to enrich knowledge bases accessible via SPARQL endpoints with almost all types of OWL 2 axioms .', u'This allows to semi-automatically create schemata , which we evaluate and discuss using DBpedia .']

entities: [[(u'Cloud', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information age', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'computing resources', u'Material')], [(u'generation network', u'Method'), (u'Big data', u'Material'), (u'Cloud technology', u'Method')], [(u'Cloud', u'Method')], [(u'data transmission', u'Task'), (u'public cloud', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Security', u'Task'), (u'certificate', u'Task'), (u'time consuming task', u'Task'), (u'cloud environment', u'Task')], [(u'mediated certificate-less encryption scheme', u'Method'), (u'pairing operation', u'Method'), (u'public clouds', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RSA algorithm', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'encrypted file', u'Material'), (u'file key', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'certificate based security algorithms', u'Method')]]
