sentences: [u'Cloud is a new growing field in the present information age used in internet that provides computing resources as a service over online .', u'The third generation network move towards Big data , Semantic web and Cloud technology .', u'Cloud provides various services over online where people can store , process and retrieve data from it .', u'During the data transmission via public cloud , security is the most important concern .', u'Security using certificate is a cost effective and time consuming task in the cloud environment .', u'To address the limitations , a mediated certificate-less encryption scheme without pairing operation is proposed for securely sharing sensitive information in public clouds using RSA algorithm .', u'In this approach multiple users can access the information at the same time .', u'Here , the encrypted file send to client and the client will decrypt the encrypted file using file key .', u'The proposed method performs better compared with existing certificate based security algorithms .']

sentences: [u'Learning objects strive for reusability in eLearning to reduce cost and allow personalization of content .', u'We show why learning objects require adapted Information Retrieval systems .', u'In the spirit of the Semantic Web , we discuss the semantic description , discovery , and composition of learning objects .', u'As part of our project , we tag learning objects with both objective ( e.g. , title , date , and author ) and subjective ( e.g. , quality and relevance ) metadata .', u'We present the RACOFI ( RuleApplying Collaborative Filtering ) Composer prototype with its novel combination of two libraries and their associated engines : a collaborative filtering system and an inference rule system .', u'We developed RACOFI to generate contextaware recommendation lists .', u'Context is handled by multidimensional predictions produced from a databasedriven scalable collaborative filtering algorithm .', u'Rules are then applied to the predictions to customize the recommendations according to user profiles .', u'The RACOFI Composer architecture has been deve ...']

entities: [[(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'techniques', u'Generic'), (u'Data Inte- gration', u'Task'), (u'Information Extraction', u'Task'), (u'unstructured data', u'Material'), (u'application domains', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'structured data sources', u'Material'), (u'ontologies', u'Material')], [(u'ESTEST system', u'Method'), (u'structured and semi-structured data sources', u'Material'), (u'virtual global schema', u'Method'), (u'information extraction process', u'Task')], [(u'infor- mation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'virtual global database', u'Material'), (u'query processing', u'Task')], [(u'semantic integration', u'Method'), (u'structured and semi-structured data', u'Material')], [(u'ESTEST system', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'We describe an approach which builds on techniques from Data Inte- gration and Information Extraction in order to make better use of the unstructured data found in application domains such as the Semantic Web which require the integration of information from structured data sources , ontologies and text .', u'We describe the design and implementation of the ESTEST system which integrates available structured and semi-structured data sources into a virtual global schema which is used to partially configure an information extraction process .', u'The infor- mation extracted from the text is merged with this virtual global database and is available for query processing over the entire integrated resource .', u'As a result of this semantic integration , new queries can now be answered which would not be possible from the structured and semi-structured data alone .', u'We give some exper- imental results from the ESTEST system in use .']

sentences: [u'Educational processes supported by eLearning represent not only an # N # investment in the future of educational institutions , but a reality which constitutes # N # a highly innovative field of study .', u'In the technological scenario of online # N # assessment , full of dubious innovations concerning knowledge contents creation # N # and tagging , BABIECA proposes a Web 2.0 approach , arranged by Semantic Web # N # technologies .', u'BABIECA is based on two different modules : The first one consists in # N # a social network that allows teachers to share exam questions , and the second one # N # is a system where exams can be taken and corrected .', u'Both applications conform a # N # collaborative environment across Web Services , allowing the creation of a public , # N # and based on standards , knowledge base of assessment items , which could be used # N # by third party applications , and incorporating users opinions ( both teachers and # N # students ) in the exams creation process .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method')], [(u'real-world ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'description logic reasoning systems', u'Method'), (u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'assertional axioms', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'description logic reasoning systems', u'Method')], [(u'technique', u'Generic'), (u'description logic systems', u'Method'), (u'assertional data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'technique', u'USED-FOR', u'description logic systems')]]
sentences: [u'In the last years , the vision of the Semantic Web fostered the interest in reasoning over ever larger sets of assertional statements in ontologies .', u'It is easily conjectured that , soon , real-world ontologies will not fit into main memory anymore .', u'If this was the case , state-of-the-art description logic reasoning systems can not deal with these ontologies any longer , since they rely on in-memory structures. # R # # N # # R # # N # We propose a way to overcome this problem by reducing instance checking for an individual in an ontology to a ( usually small ) relevant subset of assertional axioms .', u'This subset can then be processed by state-of-the-art description logic reasoning systems to perform sound and complete instance checks for the given individual .', u'We think that this technique will support description logic systems to deal with the upcoming large amounts of assertional data .']

entities: [[], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'content-based approach', u'Method')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'E-learning sudah menjadi kebutuhan utama di dunia pendidikan saat ini .', u'Hal ini ditunjukkan denganmakin banyaknya institusi pendidikan yang menggunakannya .', u'Namun sistem e-learning yang banyakdipakai saat ini merupakan sistem yang pasif .', u'Pasif dalam hal ini berarti sistem tidak dapat mengetahuikebutuhan masing-masing pengguna atau dengan kata lain sitem tidak dapat melakukan personalisasi.Supaya sistem e-learning bisa lebih bermanfaat bagi pengguna , sistem seharusnya bisa melakukanpersonalisasi terhadap masing-masing penggunanya .', u'Salah satu bentuk personalisasi dalam sistem elearningcerdas adalah kemampuan untuk merekomendasikan artikel yang sesuai dengan kebutuhan tiaptiappengguna .', u'Fitur semacam ini disebut dengan recommender .', u'Selama ini recommender pada sistem elearningmasih menggunakan teknik pengambilan berdasar isi ( content-based approach ) .', u'Teknik ini akanmenghasilkan banyak artikel yang tidak relevan dengan yang dibutuhkan oleh pengguna .', u'Oleh karenaitu dibutuhkan sebuah teknik baru untuk mengambil artikel dari internet .', u'Berdasarkan masalah diatasmaka penulis mengusulkan untuk membuat intelligent recommender menggunakan semantic web supayabisa menyeleksi artikel yang akan direkomendasikan dengan lebih baik .']

relations: [[(u'Interpersonal trust', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'network systems'), (u'peer-to-peer networks', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'network systems'), (u'peer-to-peer networks', u'CONJUNCTION', u'e-commerce'), (u'e-commerce', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'network systems'), (u'e-commerce', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic web'), (u'semantic web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'network systems')], [(u'collecting data', u'USED-FOR', u'interpersonal trust')], [], [(u'social interaction frequencies', u'USED-FOR', u'interpersonal trust')], [(u'bidirectional interacting data', u'USED-FOR', u"user 's social behavior"), (u'principal component analysis', u'USED-FOR', u'interpersonal trust')], [(u'Facebook app', u'USED-FOR', u'interaction data'), (u'itrust', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Facebook app'), (u'itrust', u'USED-FOR', u'interaction data')], [(u'interpersonal trust measurements', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'itrust')]]
sentences: [u'Interpersonal trust is widely cited as an important component in several network systems such as peer-to-peer networks , e-commerce , and semantic web .', u'However , there has been less research on measuring interpersonal trust due to the difficulty of collecting data that accurately reflect interpersonal trust .', u'Currently , friends of a user in almost all OSNs are indistinguishable , that is , there is no explicit indication of the strength of trust between a user and his/her close friends , as opposed to acquaintances .', u'To address this issue , we quantify interpersonal trust by analyzing the social interaction frequencies between users and their friends on Facebook .', u"We consider bidirectional interacting data in OSNs to deconstruct a user 's social behavior and apply principal component analysis to estimate interpersonal trust .", u'A Facebook app , itrust , is developed to collect interaction data and calculate interpersonal trust .', u'Results show that itrust achieves more accurate interpersonal trust measurements than existing methods .']

entities: [[(u'Automatic dialogue systems', u'Method'), (u'speech', u'Material'), (u'system', u'Generic')], [(u'noise', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'mobile device', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'modalities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'-speech and video signal', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'spoken request', u'Material'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u"user 's gaze direction", u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'speech signal', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'prosodic features', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'recognition rates', u'Metric'), (u'speech-only condition', u'OtherScientificTerm')], []]

sentences: [u'Automatic dialogue systems get easily confused if speech is recognized which is not directed to the system .', u"Besides noise or other people 's conversation , even the user 's utterance can cause difficulties when he is talking to someone else or to himself ( Off-Talk ) .", u"In this paper the automatic classification of the user 's focus of attention is investigated .", u'In the German SmartWeb project , a mobile device is used to get access to the semantic web .', u'In this scenario , two modalities are provided -speech and video signal .', u"This makes it possible to classify whether a spoken request is addressed to the system or not : with the camera of the mobile device , the user 's gaze direction is detected ; in the speech signal , prosodic features are analyzed .", u'Encouraging recognition rates of up to 93 % are achieved in the speech-only condition .', u'Further improvement is expected from the fusion of the two information sources .']

sentences: [u'Standardisation efforts in the geospatial domain , provided by ISO TC 211 and OpenGIS Consortium , have brought many specifications and standards that define structure and encoding rules of data and interfaces of services .', u'These standards provide syntactic interoperability of geospatial data and services , while neglecting their semantics .', u'In order to achieve semantic interoperability , i.e .', u'explicitly define the meaning of data and services to make them understandable both to machines and humans , there are attempts to develop Geospatial Semantic Web , where semantics of data will be expressed explicitly and formally .', u'An important part of this process is the development of domain ontologies , i.e .', u'a common vocabulary in some domain .', u'In order to bring semantics into cadastral systems , it is necessary to develop ontology for real estate cadastre .', u'Therefore , the authors propose the ontology based knowledge model in the field of real estate cadastre based on ISO 19152 international standard and other geospatial sta ...']

entities: [[(u'Ontology', u'Task'), (u'W3C standards', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'conceptual vocabularies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'reusable knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'heterogeneous systems', u'Method')], [(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'vague information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'application domains', u'Material')], [(u'fuzzy ability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'classical ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'fuzzy ontology generation framework', u'Method'), (u'fuzzy relational databases', u'Material'), (u'fuzzy ontology', u'Method'), (u'fuzzy ontology structure', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'fuzzy relational databases', u'Material'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'fuzzy ontology structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'fuzzy RDF data model', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'fuzzy relational databases', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Ontology', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web'), (u'W3C standards', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'vague information')], [], [(u'fuzzy relational databases', u'USED-FOR', u'fuzzy ontology generation framework')], [(u'them', u'USED-FOR', u'fuzzy ontology structure'), (u'fuzzy ontology structure', u'CONJUNCTION', u'fuzzy RDF data model')], []]
sentences: [u'Ontology is an important part of the W3C standards for the Semantic Web used to specify standard conceptual vocabularies to exchange data among systems , provide reusable knowledge bases , and facilitate interoperability across multiple heterogeneous systems and databases .', u'However , current ontology is not sufficient for handling vague information that is commonly found in many application domains .', u'A feasible solution is to import the fuzzy ability to extend the classical ontology .', u'In this article , we propose a fuzzy ontology generation framework from the fuzzy relational databases , in which the fuzzy ontology consists of fuzzy ontology structure and instances .', u'We simultaneously consider the schema and instances of the fuzzy relational databases , and respectively transform them to fuzzy ontology structure and fuzzy RDF data model .', u'This can ensure the integrality of the original structure as well as the completeness and consistency of the original instances in the fuzzy relational databases .']

sentences: [u'Next-generation patients are far from being peripheral to health-care .', u'They are central to understanding the effectiveness and efficiency of services and how they can be improved .', u'Today a lot of patients are used to reviewing local health services on-line but this social information is just stored in natural language text and it is not machine-accessible and machine-processable .', u'To distil knowledge from this extremely unstructured information we use Sentie Computing , a new opinion mining and sentiment analysis paradigm which exploits AI and Semantic Web techniques to better recognize , interpret and process opinions and sentiments in natural language text .', u'In particular , we use a language visualization and analysis system , a novel emotion categorization model , a resource for opinion mining based on a web ontology and novel techniques for finding and defining topic dependent concepts , namely spectral association and CF-IOF weighting respectively .']

sentences: [u'In this article , we address the question of how efficiently Semantic Web ( SW ) reasoners perform in processing ( classifying and querying ) taxonomies of enormous size and whether it is possible to improve on existing implementations .', u'We use a bit-vector encoding technique to implement taxonomic concept classification and Boolean-query answering .', u'We describe the technique we have used , which achieves high performance , and discuss implementation issues .', u'We compare the performance of our implementation with those of the best existing SW reasoning systems over several very large taxonomies under the exact same conditions for so-called TBox reasoning .', u'The results show that our system is among the best for concept classification and several orders-of-magnitude more efficient in terms of response time for query answering .', u'We present these results in detail and comment them .', u'We also discuss pragmatic issues such as cycle detection and decoding .']

sentences: [u'Knowledge discovery from non-interactive literature is a new method in informatics , which is useful to efficient usage of literature and discovery of implicit knowledge .', u'In order to introduce the method into the research of the traditional Chinese medicine , using natural language processing ( NLP ) technique and method , this paper focuses on the research of data base required by Chinese non-interactive literature-based knowledge discovery .', u'Based on the above research , it constructs a pertinence stop list and develops an subsidiary system of Chinese non-interactive literature-based knowledge discovery .', u'Using some techniques and approaches such as semantic Web , explicit relation exclusion , semantic constraint , frequency filtering , etc .', u'the system intelligently chooses the relations among non-interactive literatures .', u'It simulates the process of non-interactive literature-based knowledge discovery successfully , aiming at the anticipative target to help scientific researchers to disclose implicit relation in Chinese literatures and introduce them to achieve knowledge discovery .']

sentences: [u'Summary form only given .', u'Language resources ( LR ) and semantics , dynamic resources automatically acquired , interoperability among LRs and Language Technology ( LT ) , and how to go for a new generation of LRs in the Semantic Web ( SW ) framework , pointing at the potentialities and the need of a cross-fertilisation between the two communities of Human Language Technology ( HLT ) and SW. Large scale LRs are unanimously recognised as the necessary infrastructure underlying LT .', u'This paper explains about how computational lexicons and textual corpora should be considered as complementary views on the lexical space , in the perspective of modelling a new type of resource which is both a lexicon and a corpus together .', u"A 'complete ' computational lexicon should incorporate and represent our 'knowledge of the world ' .", u"We claim that it is theoretically impossible to achieve completeness within any 'static ' lexicon .", u'Moreover , choices on the syntagmatic axis are pervasive in language .']

relations: [[], [], [], [], [(u'Web 2.0 features', u'USED-FOR', u'structured knowledge construction')], []]
sentences: [u'The fast growth and spread of Web 2.0 environments have demonstrated the great willingness of general Web users to contribute and share various type of content and information .', u'Many very successful web sites currently exist which thrive on the wisdom of the crowd , where web users in general are the sole data providers and curators .', u'The Semantic Web calls for knowledge to be semantically represented using ontologies to allow for better access and sharing of data .', u'However , constructing ontologies collaboratively is not well supported by most existing ontology and knowledge-base editing tools .', u'This has resulted in the recent emergence of a new range of collaborative ontology construction tools with the aim of integrating some Web 2.0 features into the process of structured knowledge construction .', u'This paper provides a survey of the start of the art of these tools , and highlights their significant features and capabilities .']

relations: [[(u'Methods', u'CONJUNCTION', u'apparatus')], [(u'literal values', u'USED-FOR', u'index database')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Methods and apparatus for searching Semantic Web structured resources and presenting the search results to a user can increase the likelihood that the search can produce meaningful results .', u'An index database can be constructed by parsing literal values from statements from the resources to obtain component words of the literal values , with the index relating the component words to the statements from which they were parsed .', u'A search engine can obtain component words from the database that match search terms in a query prepared by the user and can obtain the related statements for the matching words .', u'A servlet or other application using the search engine and database can obtain predicates , instances , types of said instances , and full literal values of said instances for the related statements .', u'The search results can be presented to the user as a summary of the predicates , instances , types , and full literal values .']

sentences: [u'The number of digital photos in the personal computer is exploding .', u'Existing photo annotation and management systems suffer from some problems ( some among them are quite serious ) , which discussed at the beginning of the full paper .', u'Aiming at these problems , this paper proposed a solution based on ontology .', u'First of all , the Family Album ontology is built to organize the domain knowledge and provide formal , explicit and conceptual annotation .', u'Then we annotate preliminary semantic information for digital photos by automated extraction of semantic concepts from file titles , photo description texts , EXIF metadata and visual features of images etc ..', u'Furthermore , the SWRL ( Semantic Web Rule Language ) rules are written and executed to extend previous semantic annotations and support knowledge inference .', u'Finally , an Onto Album prototype system is developed for verifying the validity of the proposed approach .', u'Experimental results show that the proposed approach is very effective and promising .']

entities: [[], [(u'Web Applications', u'Task')], [(u'Web Applications', u'Task')], [(u'human-centric Web Applications', u'Task')], [(u'addressing credibility', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'human-centric Web Applications', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'them', u'Generic')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'human participation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'collaboration')], [], [], [], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'human-centric Web Applications')], [], []]
sentences: [u"The apparent `` socialization '' of the Web brings new prospects as well as challenges .", u'In this paper , the issue of credibility of Web Applications in the light of increased human participation and collaboration is considered .', u'The stakeholder types to which credibility of Web Applications is relevant are identified .', u'Based on a taxonomy of credibility , the origins of the issue of credibility specific to human-centric Web Applications are explored and examples in support are presented .', u'The role of addressing credibility within the auspices of flexible and iterative development processes is emphasized .', u'A framework for understanding and addressing the credibility of human-centric Web Applications in a methodical manner is proposed .', u'This framework includes quality attributes of concern to stakeholders and process- and product-oriented means for addressing them in a feasible manner .', u'Finally , extensions of the framework , including implications towards the Semantic Web , are briefly outlined .']

sentences: [u'With the Webs emergence and generalization in various domains such as economy , commerce , education , culture , etc , the Web application reverse-engineering process becomes necessary in order to facilitate the maintenance of such applications and the evolution towards new Web technology like XML , semantic Web , etc .', u'In this paper , we propose a new approach for the Web application reverse-engineering .', u'The approach is based on ontology and it generates a conceptual schema modelling the Web application .', u'This conceptual schema is rich in semantic but reduced in relation to the global ontology .', u'The proposed approach mainly relies on HTML pages analysis , i.e .', u'to analyse tables , lists , forms , etc .', u'It consists of three successive phases : First , the extraction of useful information from the HTML pages .', u'Second phase is the analysis of the extracted information using the domain ontology .', u'And finally , we generate the corresponding UML conceptual schema .']

entities: [[(u'patterns', u'Generic'), (u'problem-solving approach', u'Method')], [(u'pattern engineering', u'Method'), (u'actors', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'activities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'artifacts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pattern realization process', u'Task')], [(u'theoretical framework', u'Method'), (u'Social Web', u'Material')], [(u'Social Web', u'Method')], [(u'Social Web', u'Method'), (u'actors', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Social Web applications', u'Task'), (u'Social Web', u'Material'), (u'pattern engineering', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'In the last decade , patterns have emerged as a notable problem-solving approach in various disciplines .', u'This paper aims to address the communication requirements of the elements of pattern engineering ( namely , actors , activities , and artifacts ) in general and the pattern realization process in particular .', u'To that regard , a theoretical framework using the Social Web as the medium is proposed and its implications are explored .', u'The prospects of using the Social Web are analyzed by means of practical scenarios and concrete examples .', u'The concerns of using the Social Web related to cost to actors , decentralization and distribution of control , and semiotic quality of representations of patterns are highlighted .', u'The directions for future research including the use of patterns for Social Web applications , and the potential of the confluence of the Social Web and the Semantic Web for communicating the elements of pattern engineering , are briefly explored .']

entities: [[(u'biological and biomedical information sets', u'Material'), (u'semantic web', u'Material')], [(u'RDF data sets', u'Material')], [(u'language IML', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'graph transformations', u'Method'), (u'dataflow style', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u"language 's operations", u'Method'), (u'visual editor', u'Method')], [(u'transformations', u'Generic'), (u'query rewriting engine', u'Method'), (u'IML views', u'Material')], [(u'rewriter', u'Generic'), (u"IML 's dataflow style", u'Method'), (u'optimizations', u'Method'), (u'unnecessary transformations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'IML view', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rewriter', u'Generic'), (u'biomedical ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'graph transformations', u'USED-FOR', u'language IML')], [], [], [(u'rewriter', u'USED-FOR', u'unnecessary transformations'), (u"IML 's dataflow style", u'USED-FOR', u'rewriter'), (u"IML 's dataflow style", u'CONJUNCTION', u'optimizations'), (u'optimizations', u'USED-FOR', u'rewriter')], []]
sentences: [u'Users interested in biological and biomedical information sets on the semantic web are frequently not computer scientists .', u'These researchers often find it difficult to use declarative query and view definition languages to manipulate these RDF data sets .', u'We define a language IML consisting of a small number of graph transformations that can be composed in a dataflow style to transform RDF ontologies .', u"The language 's operations closely map to the high-level manipulations users undertake when transforming ontologies using a visual editor .", u'To reduce the potentially high cost of evaluating queries over these transformations on demand , we describe a query rewriting engine for evaluating queries on IML views .', u"The rewriter leverages IML 's dataflow style and optimizations to eliminate unnecessary transformations in answering a query over an IML view .", u"We evaluate our rewriter 's performance on queries over use case view definitions on one or more biomedical ontologies ."]

entities: [[(u'Concept lattices', u'Method'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'navigation', u'Task')], [(u'Conceptual navigation', u'Task'), (u'hierarchical navigation', u'Task'), (u'plain querying', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'formal , logical , and relational contexts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Task'), (u'inference mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'expressive query languages', u'Material'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method')], [(u'conceptual navigation', u'Task'), (u'browsing of RDF graphs', u'Task'), (u'concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SPARQL-like queries', u'Material')], [(u'conceptual navigation', u'Method')], [], [(u'conjunctive fragment of the query language', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'query language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'expressivity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method'), (u'natural syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'description logics', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Concept lattices', u'USED-FOR', u'information retrieval'), (u'Concept lattices', u'USED-FOR', u'browsing'), (u'information retrieval', u'CONJUNCTION', u'browsing')], [(u'querying', u'CONJUNCTION', u'navigation')], [(u'Conceptual navigation', u'COMPARE', u'hierarchical navigation')], [(u'inference mechanisms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'expressive query languages'), (u'SPARQL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'inference mechanisms'), (u'SPARQL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'expressive query languages')], [(u'conceptual navigation', u'USED-FOR', u'browsing of RDF graphs')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Concept lattices have been successfully used for information retrieval and browsing .', u'They offer the advantage of combining querying and navigation in a consistent way .', u'Conceptual navigation is more flexible than hierarchical navigation , and easier to use than plain querying .', u'It has already been applied to formal , logical , and relational contexts , but its application to the semantic web is a challenge because of inference mechanisms and expressive query languages such as SPARQL .', u'The contribution of this paper is to extend conceptual navigation to the browsing of RDF graphs , where concepts are accessed through SPARQL-like queries .', u'This extended conceptual navigation is proved consistent w.r.t .', u'the context ( i.e. , never leads to an empty result set ) , and complete w.r.t .', u'the conjunctive fragment of the query language ( i.e. , every query can be reached by navigation only ) .', u'Our query language has an expressivity similar to SPARQL , and has a more natural syntax close to description logics .']

sentences: [u'Named Graphs are a simple extension to the RDF abstract syntax and enable statements to be made about RDF graphs .', u'This is beneficial for a variety of application areas like data syndication , provenance tracking , ontology versioning , signing RDF , and for specifying access rights to parts of RDF repositories .', u'The Named Graph abstract syntax has been adopted by the W3C Data Access Working Group with a slight modification as the basis for SPARQL .', u'In this poster we present NG4J Named Graph API for Jena , an implementation of Named Graphs on top of the Jena Semantic Web Framework .', u'NG4J provides APIs for manipulating sets of Named Graphs , TriX and TriG readers and writers for serializing multiple graphs in one document and an implementation of the TriQL query language .', u'The SWP API provides methods for adding meta-information like propositional attitudes to graphs and for signing graphsets using digital signatures .']

sentences: [u"'The Imaginary Voyage ' is an interactive opera , conceived for the web .", u'It was created during KTP ( funded by the TSB ) with The Opera Group .', u"The Associate was Lee Scott ( supervised by Hugill ) . # R # # N # The opera deploys a new technology called The Syzygy Surfer ( Hugill , A & Hendler , J 2013 ) that navigates 'creatively ' repositories of Image ( still and moving ) , sound , and text according to principles of both The Semantic Web and Pataphysics .", u'# R # # N # This was subsequently built by a team headed by Hugill , with Professor Hongji Yang and three PhD students .', u'# R # # N # The opera was conceived as a series of islands that may be visited by the user .', u'The narrative derives from the navigation from Paris to Paris by sea in Alfred Jarrys Exploits and Opinions of Dr Faustroll , pataphysician ( 1911 ) .', u'It is expandable : new islands may be added over time .', u'Five islands have so far been made .']

entities: [[(u'conceptual modeling', u'Method'), (u'extensional model', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'OWL-Full', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web ontology languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'extensional model', u'Method'), (u'feature', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'metamodeling', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'metamodeling', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL-Full', u'Material'), (u'undecidability of basic inference problems', u'Task'), (u'logical and metalogical symbols', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'metamodeling', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'description logic', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL-DL', u'Material'), (u'metamodeling', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'metaconcepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'A common practice in conceptual modeling is to separate the intensional from the extensional model .', u'Although very intuitive , this approach is inadequate for many complex domains , where the borderline between the two models is not clear-cut .', u'Therefore , OWL-Full , the most expressive of the Semantic Web ontology languages , allows combining the intensional and the extensional model by a feature we refer to as metamodeling .', u'In this paper , we show that the semantics of metamodeling adopted in OWL-Full leads to undecidability of basic inference problems , due to free mixing of logical and metalogical symbols .', u'Based on this result , we propose two alternative semantics for metamodeling : the contextual and the HiLog semantics .', u'We show that a description logic underlying OWL-DL extended with metamodeling under either semantics is decidable .', u'Finally , we show how the latter semantics can be used in practice to axiomatize the logical interaction between concepts and metaconcepts .']

sentences: [u'After the institution of cyberspace in the 1990s , the Web has become its main construct and has been folding and unfolding in several directions : Invisible Web , Visible Web , Semantic Web , Pragmatic Web , Web 2.0 or Social , among others .', u'In particular , the Invisible Web , according to the authors who write on the subject , there is a disturbing question : what to call this ( un ) territory ?', u'Invisible Web , Deep , Hidden , Dark ?', u'From understanding the concept of fold , created by Leibniz and reframed by Deleuze , which explains the machinic assemblages and pragmatic view of the technical aspects of semiotics and material , a conceptual exploration of the Invisible Web and of some search engines was made that make the fold with these webs in cyberspace .', u'Going beyond the literature , a Web truly dark was discovered , DarkWeb , parallel and underground , used for good and for evil , as expected of the human species .']

entities: [[(u'CombeChem', u'Method'), (u'e-science semantic support', u'Task'), (u'chemical data lifecycle', u'Task'), (u'dissemination of data', u'Task'), (u'laboratory data', u'Material'), (u'electronic laboratory notebooks', u'Material')], [(u'Chemical information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'chemical data storage methodologies', u'Method'), (u'data', u'Generic'), (u'computer readable form', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'automated access', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'human intervention', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic web approach', u'Method'), (u'identifiers', u'Generic'), (u'RDF', u'Method')], [(u'dissemination', u'Task'), (u'parallel but linked methods', u'Method'), (u'Grid style access', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'national repositories', u'Material'), (u'Publication @ Source', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'CombeChem', u'USED-FOR', u'e-science semantic support'), (u'CombeChem', u'USED-FOR', u'chemical data lifecycle'), (u'CombeChem', u'USED-FOR', u'dissemination of data'), (u'e-science semantic support', u'USED-FOR', u'chemical data lifecycle')], [], [(u'data', u'USED-FOR', u'chemical data storage methodologies')], [], []]
sentences: [u'CombeChem provided experience of e-science semantic support for the chemical data lifecycle , from inception in the laboratory to dissemination of data , showing how laboratory data should be recorded , using electronic laboratory notebooks , enriched with appropriate metadata , to ensure information can be correctly understood when subsequently accessed , ( Annotation @ Source ) .', u'Chemical information results from a chain of analysis & data integration .', u'Current chemical data storage methodologies place restrictions on the use of this data ; absence of sufficient high-quality metadata , particularly in a computer readable form , prevents automated access to the data without significant human intervention .', u'The Semantic web approach enhances the data by making use of unique identifiers and relationships described with RDF .', u'This informs new routes to dissemination , with data and ideas being treated by parallel but linked methods ; a Grid style access to information spread across several administrative domains - individual laboratories to national repositories - the concept of Publication @ Source .']

sentences: [u'Automated service composition refers to automating the en- tire process of composing a workflow .', u'This involves automating the dis- covery and selection of the service , ensuring semantic and data type compatibility .', u'We present a framework to facilitate automated service composition in Service-Oriented Architectures using Semantic Web tech- nologies .', u'The main objective of the framework is to support the discov- ery , selection , and composition of semantically-described heterogeneous services .', u'Our framework has three main features which distinguish it from other work in this area .', u'First , we propose a dynamic , adaptive , and highly fault-tolerant service discovery and composition algorithm .', u'Second , we distinguish between different levels of granularity of loosely coupled workflows .', u'Finally , our framework allows the user to specify and refine a high-level objective .', u'In this paper , we describe the main compo- nents of our framework and describe a scenario in the genealogy domain .']

sentences: [u'Location and time independent interaction and collaboration among the multidisciplinary competencies of building industry at early design stage highly influence the quality of final building products .', u'A cross -platform IT supported virtual workspace is therefore necessary .', u'This semantic web based distributed virtual workspace will be built on meta -structured languages , XML and RDF , and integrated with ontologies to serve as a dynamic knowledge pool for decision- making support .', u"Virtual building with time tracking capability to formulate the redundant building 's descriptions throughout its simulated lifecycle to support decision-making is a resolution to replace physical prototype .", u'A temporal database will be formulated to populate all of the necessary properties of a virtual building for archiving , retrieving , processing and producing building artifacts/documents fast and efficiently .', u'A demonstrator at low -medium cost will be developed for public access in a distributed environment to enable consistent evaluation from the participated end users .']

relations: [[], [(u'dimension hierarchies', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'MD concepts'), (u'dimension hierarchies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'aggregate functions'), (u'aggregate functions', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'MD concepts')], [], [(u'manual annotation', u'USED-FOR', u'QB4OLAP')], [], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'semi-automatic transformation')]]
sentences: [u'Publication and sharing of multidimensional ( MD ) data on the Semantic Web ( SW ) opens new opportunities for the use of On-Line Analytical Processing ( OLAP ) .', u'The RDF Data Cube ( QB ) vocabulary , the current standard for statistical data publishing , however , lacks key MD concepts such as dimension hierarchies and aggregate functions .', u'QB4OLAP was proposed to remedy this .', u'However , QB4OLAP requires extensive manual annotation and users must still write queries in SPARQL , the standard query language for RDF , which typical OLAP users are not familiar with .', u'In this demo , we present QB2OLAP , a tool for enabling OLAP on existing QB data .', u'Without requiring any RDF , QB ( 4OLAP ) , or SPARQL skills , it allows semi-automatic transformation of a QB data set into a QB4OLAP one via enrichment with QB4OLAP semantics , exploration of the enriched schema , and querying with the high-level OLAP language QL that exploits the QB4OLAP semantics and is automatically translated to SPARQL .']

entities: [[(u'computer science', u'Task'), (u'ontology design patterns', u'Task')], [], [(u'semantic web conferences', u'Material')], [(u'ontology design patterns', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
sentences: [u'While the use of patterns in computer science is well established , research into ontology design patterns is a fairly recent development .', u'We believe that it is important to develop an overview of the state of research in this new field , in order to stake out possibilities for future research and in order to provide an introduction for researchers new to the topic .', u'This paper presents a systematic literature review of all papers published at the three large semantic web conferences and their associated workshops in the last five years .', u'Our findings indicate among other things that a lot of papers in this field are lacking in empirical validation , that ontology design patterns tend to be one of the main focuses of papers that mention them , and that although research on using patterns is being performed , studying patterns as artifacts of their own is less common .']

entities: [[], [(u'communication network', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic Entities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'aggregated ) sensor values', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Sensors', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'smartphones', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Web of Things', u'Method'), (u'RDF1', u'Method')], [(u'resource constraints', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'sensor platforms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'scalable caching mechanism', u'Method'), (u'RDF data', u'Material'), (u'proxies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Semantic Entities', u'Method'), (u'SPARQL', u'Method')], [(u'scalability', u'Metric'), (u'sensor platforms diversity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'communication interfaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'scalable caching mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'resource constraints'), (u'scalable caching mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF data')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The Internet of Things ( IoT ) aims to integrate arbitrary things with the Internet .', u'Sadly , the majority of things lacks of the ability to communicate which makes a direct integration with a communication network , i.e. , the Internet , impossible .', u'We overcome this limitation by introducing refined versions of Semantic Entities , i.e. , Web representations of arbitrary real-world things states using ( possibly aggregated ) sensor values .', u'Sensors can be considered ubiquitous , e.g. , due to the omnipresence of smartphones .', u'Our architecture of a Semantic Web of Things bases on sensors providing their measurements in the form of RDF1 .', u'We account for the common fact of resource constraints on sensor platforms by introducing a scalable caching mechanism for RDF data within a network of proxies ( SSPs ) .', u'Consequently , the individual Semantic Entities find and aggregate relevant ( sensor ) data via SPARQL .', u'Besides scalability , the proxies also solve the issue of the sensor platforms diversity in terms of communication interfaces .']

relations: [[(u'primary data', u'USED-FOR', u'life sciences')], [], [(u'semantics driven approach', u'USED-FOR', u'data integration'), (u'semantics driven approach', u'USED-FOR', u'data integration')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Research in the life sciences requires ready access to primary data , derived information and relevant knowledge from a multitude of sources .', u'Integration and interoperability of such resources are crucial for sharing content across research domains relevant to the life sciences .', u'In this article we present a perspective review of data integration with emphasis on a semantics driven approach to data integration that pushes content into a shared infrastructure , reduces data redundancy and clarifies any inconsistencies .', u'This enables much improved access to life science data from numerous primary sources .', u'The Semantic Enrichment of the Scientific Literature ( SESL ) pilot project demonstrates feasibility for using already available open semantic web standards and technologies to integrate public and proprietary data resources , which span structured and unstructured content .', u'This has been accomplished through a precompetitive consortium , which provides a cost effective approach for numerous stakeholders to work together to solve common problems .']

entities: [[(u'hybrid networks', u'Method'), (u'routed IP', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'paths', u'Generic'), (u'network provisioning systems', u'Method'), (u'topology information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'semantic web technique', u'Method')], [(u'language', u'Generic'), (u'hybrid networks', u'Method'), (u'administrative domains', u'Material'), (u'topology information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'lightpath reservation request', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'automatic correlation of information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'GLIF', u'Method'), (u'Lambda Networking', u'Task')], [(u'automatic provisioning', u'Task')], [(u'tools', u'Generic'), (u'NDL', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic web technique')], [(u'language', u'USED-FOR', u'hybrid networks')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Several research networks around the world are implementing hybrid networks , that provide end-users with traditional routed IP together with lightpaths .', u'These paths are dynamically configured at user request and network provisioning systems must have topology information , both intra- and inter-domain.We developed the Network Description Language ( NDL ) , based on RDF , a semantic web technique .', u'This language can be used to describe hybrid networks , so that different administrative domains can share and correlate topology information .', u'It supports the end-user to express a lightpath reservation request , and helps the service provider to validate the feasibility of requests .', u'It facilitates generation and exchange of network maps by allowing automatic correlation of information across domains.Our first application ground is GLIF , a collaboration promoting co-operation for Lambda Networking .', u'Several tools for automatic provisioning are in development .', u'However , these tools lack a common network description , which NDL can provide .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'complexity', u'Metric')], [(u'RDF vocabularies', u'Material')], [(u'RDF databases', u'Material'), (u'RDF Objects', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'RDF Objects', u'Method'), (u'compound data structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'database', u'Generic')], [(u'Applications', u'Generic'), (u'Object extraction algorithm', u'Method')], [(u'hypertext links', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'distributed data sources', u'Material')], [], [(u'URIs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'HTTP implementation', u'Method'), (u'RDF Object Serverhas', u'Method'), (u'W3C Working Groups', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'RDF Objects', u'USED-FOR', u'compound data structures')], [], [], [], [(u'DAML', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL ontologies')], [(u'RDF Object Serverhas', u'USED-FOR', u'W3C Working Groups')]]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web is growing in both size and complexity .', u'The number of RDF vocabularies and data sources are both increasing .', u'This paper shows how large RDF databases can be accessed in smaller and more manageable chunks called RDF Objects .', u'RDF Objects encapsulate compound data structures to give applications a more granular view of a database .', u'Applications can control the size and structure of Objects by specifying the Object extraction algorithm and filtering the returned data by vocabulary .', u'Links between Objects , analogous to hypertext links , allow applications to navigate across distributed data sources and leave link-trails for other applications to follow .', u'Information can be aggregated from multiple data sources by recursively following Object links .', u'Resources without URIs in different databases are cross-matched using DAML and OWL ontologies .', u'An HTTP implementation of an RDF Object Serverhas been developed and used to develop tools for W3C Working Groups .']

relations: [[(u'database systems', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ontology development')], [(u'semantic web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'application domains'), (u'semantic web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'schema'), (u'schema', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'application domains'), (u'schema', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data integration'), (u'data integration', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'application domains'), (u'data integration', u'CONJUNCTION', u'data translation'), (u'data translation', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'application domains')], [], [], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'metamodel matching techniques evaluation'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'benchmarking'), (u'metamodel matching techniques evaluation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'benchmarking')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'metamodel matching')], [], [(u'Similarity Flooding', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ModeICVS'), (u'ModeICVS', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SAMT4MDE andAML'), (u'real-world metamodels', u'CONJUNCTION', u'real-world metamodels')]]
sentences: [u'During the last decades , the matching operation has been thoroughly studied in database systems and ontology development .', u'Matching is critical in many application domains such as semantic web , schema and data integration , data translation .', u'In the Model Driven Engineering ( MDE ) context , matching techniques between two metamodels are the centerpiece of a semi-automatic transformation process .', u'Metamodel matching allows discovering mappings between two metamodels and then generating transformation rules .', u'In this paper , we propose an approach for metamodel matching techniques evaluation and benchmarking .', u'This approach firstly provides a benchmark for metamodel matching and , secondly prepares to semi-automate the transformation process according to the Model Driven Architecture ( MDA ) .', u'A benchmark is useful to compare the strengths and weaknesses of different metamodel matching techniques .', u'Experimental results comparing the effectiveness of the application of various implementations of four recent techniques ( Similarity Flooding , ModeICVS , SAMT4MDE andAML ) on real-world metamodels are given .']

sentences: [u'With the emergence of Semantic Web and Web 2.0 , the paradigm shift of the Web is on resource-centered services .', u'That is , the focus now moves from having just rich resources to the meta-information of describing the resources .', u'The relevant standards , RDF ( Resource Description Language ) and Topic Maps , of describing the meta-information are defined and adopted by W3C and ISO respectively .', u'Describing meta-information in such a XML form could be burdensome to participants .', u'Semantic Wiki extended from 1 ) WikiWikiWeb is proposed to deal with the problem .', u'It enables users to generate RDF meta-information about Wiki pages with simple usages of the grammar .', u'We discuss the way of improving interoperability between Topic Maps-based semantic Wiki papges and RDF-based ones .', u'The method proposed by RDFTM task force is present with the usage of high-level Wiki grammar for facilitating low-level transformation .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'model', u'USED-FOR', u'encoding semantics'), (u'cognitive principles', u'USED-FOR', u'model')], [], [(u'land-use and land-cover domain', u'USED-FOR', u'it')], [(u'cognitive model', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic similarity measure')]]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web aims to provide a more intelligent web by automatically combining information from different , heterogeneous systems .', u'To overcome the barriers posed by this heterogeneity it is necessary to have some kind of automatic integration system .', u'This system not only needs to provide integration services on the syntactic level , but also has to provide integration of the different semantics .', u'This thesis introduces a model for encoding semantics that is based on cognitive principles .', u'Building on this cognitive model a semantic similarity measure is designed that makes it possible to compare the semantics of two or more data sources in order to provide integration services .', u'To show that the approach is usable in real-world situations it is applied to data from the land-use and land-cover domain .', u'Evaluation of this application proves that the cognitive model and semantic similarity measure provide semantically valid results .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic data integration', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Material')], [(u'graph based databases', u'Material'), (u'triplestores', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [], [(u'databases systems', u'Method')], [(u'problem domain', u'Task'), (u'Java application implementation', u'Task')], [(u'problem domain', u'Material')], [], [], [(u'triplestore databases', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'triplestores', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'graph based databases')], [], [], [], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Semantic data integration is one of the key tasks of emerging technologies on semantic web .', u'Mainly used are graph based databases also known as triplestores .', u'The aim of this thesis is to provide an overview of the area and to compare main triplestore solutions .', u'Thesis consists of two parts .', u'The first part defines criteria for comparison of selected database systems , followed by description of databases systems and their comparison based on defined criteria .', u'The second part describes the problem domain with different use case scenarios , details of Java application implementation and testing .', u'The practical part of thesis consists of the implementation of databases in Java application and testing of scenarios provided in the problem domain .', u'Test results are presented and analyzed .', u'Furthermore , the key findings gained from test results are presented .', u'Conclusion provides summary of the area and final recommendations for use of presented triplestore databases .']

relations: [[], [(u'draft methods', u'USED-FOR', u'solution'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL')], [], [(u'Datalog', u'USED-FOR', u'mapping')], [(u'information preservation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'query preservation')], [], [(u'monotonicity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantics preservation')], [(u'ours', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'monotone mapping')], [(u'semantics preserving', u'FEATURE-OF', u'non-monotone direct mapping')]]
sentences: [u'Mapping relational databases to RDF is a fundamental problem for the development of the Semantic Web .', u'We present a solution , inspired by draft methods defined by the W3C where relational databases are directly mapped to RDF and OWL .', u'Given a relational database schema and its integrity constraints , this direct mapping produces an OWL ontology , which , provides the basis for generating RDF instances .', u'The semantics of this mapping is defined using Datalog .', u'Two fundamental properties are information preservation and query preservation .', u'We prove that our mapping satisfies both conditions , even for relational databases that contain null values .', u'We also consider two desirable properties : monotonicity and semantics preservation .', u'We prove that our mapping is monotone and also prove that no monotone mapping , including ours , is semantic preserving .', u'We realize that monotonicity is an obstacle for semantic preservation and thus present a non-monotone direct mapping that is semantics preserving .']

entities: [[(u'e-learning', u'Method'), (u'asynchronous nature', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'online learning', u'Task'), (u'reusability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'learner personalization', u'Task')], [(u'reusable and learner-centered content', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'e-learning', u'Method')], [(u'e-learning context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'e-learning system architecture', u'Method'), (u'knowledge model', u'Method'), (u'continuous dialogue', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'inquiry-based knowl- edge learning', u'Task'), (u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'formalized knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'e-learning , shows much promise in accessibility and opportunity to learn , due to its asynchronous nature and its ability to transmit knowledge fast and effectively .', u"However without a universal standard for online learning and teaching , many systems are proclaimed as `` e-learning-compliant '' , offering nothing more than automated services for delivering courses online , providing no additional enhancement to reusability and learner personalization .", u'Hence , the focus is not on providing reusable and learner-centered content , but on develop- ing the technology aspects of e-learning .', u'This current trend has made it crucial to find a more refined definition of what constitutes knowledge in the e-learning context .', u'We propose an e-learning system architecture that makes use of a knowledge model to facilitate continuous dialogue and inquiry-based knowl- edge learning , by exploiting the full benefits of the semantic web as a medium capable for supplying the web with formalized knowledge .']

entities: [[(u'Artificial agents', u'Method'), (u'software agents', u'Method'), (u'software engineering', u'Task'), (u'Artificial Intelligence', u'Task')], [], [(u'artificial agent', u'Method'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rule-based agents', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web languages', u'Material')], [(u'agents', u'Generic'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'Mandarax', u'Material'), (u'Java rule platform', u'Method')], [(u'portfolio agent', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'software engineering', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Artificial Intelligence')], [], [], [(u'architecture', u'USED-FOR', u'rule-based agents'), (u'Semantic Web languages', u'USED-FOR', u'it')], [(u'Mandarax', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Java rule platform')], []]
sentences: [u'Artificial agents , subsuming both robots and software agents , represent a new paradigm in software engineering and Artificial Intelligence .', u'Depending on the technologies used in their implementation , they may exhibit various skills ; in particular , they may act more or less autonomously , they may be able to learn and to adapt to a changing environment , and they may be able to pursue their goals pro-actively .', u'An artificial agent is called rule-based , if its behaviour and/or its knowledge is expressed by means of rules .', u'In this paper , we discuss a general architecture for rule-based agents and how it can be realized with the help of Semantic Web languages .', u'We also show how such agents can go live on the Web by presenting an implementation in Mandarax , a Java rule platform .', u'The concept and implementation are complemented by a running example , the portfolio agent .']

entities: [[(u'SMARTWEB', u'Method'), (u'Web-based information services', u'Task')], [(u'prototype', u'Generic'), (u'smartphone client interface', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'ontology-based representation of facts and media structures', u'Method'), (u'rich media content', u'Material')], [(u'web service middleware', u'Method'), (u'ontological knowledge base', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'intelligent web service composition module', u'Method'), (u'external web services', u'Method'), (u'XML-based data structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user queries', u'Material')], [(u'presentation module', u'Method'), (u'media content', u'Material'), (u'fusion module', u'Method')], [(u'modalities', u'Generic'), (u'speech and gestures', u'Material'), (u'multimedia material', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'SMARTWEB aims to provide intuitive multimodal access to a rich selection of Web-based information services .', u'We report on the current prototype with a smartphone client interface to the Semantic Web .', u'An advanced ontology-based representation of facts and media structures serves as the central description for rich media content .', u'Underlying content is accessed through conventional web service middleware to connect the ontological knowledge base and an intelligent web service composition module for external web services , which is able to translate between ordinary XML-based data structures and explicit semantic representations for user queries and system responses .', u'The presentation module renders the media content and the results generated from the services and provides a detailed description of the content and its layout to the fusion module .', u'The user is then able to employ multiple modalities , like speech and gestures , to interact with the presented multimedia material in a multimodal way .']

sentences: [u'Schema matching is an important and difcult problem in many database application domains , such as data integration , semantic web and data warehousing and so on .', u'In order to use experts knowledge to improve the matching quality efectively , a schema matching model is proposed based on partial verified matching relations .', u'In this model , first , a small amount of correspondences between schemas elements are verified by manual , and the partial known matching relations and default weights of diferent matchers are reasoned on the current task ; second , the similarity matrices of multiple matchers are combined based on the collected priori knowledge , and optimized under global scope ; finally , the selectivity of the optimization matrix is evaluated , and the most reasonable candidate matching generation plans for diferent matching tasks are generated .', u'Experimental results show that the use of partial verified matching helps to improve the quality of schema matching .']

sentences: [u'As the semantic web emerges , the problems related to the management of ontologies are gaining relevance .', u'Ontology management is considered as one of the main issues in artificial intelligence and knowledge engineering .', u'Ontology modularisation aims at structuring ontologies to facilitate its reuse and maintenance .', u'Compositional methodologies intend to integrate a set of modules into a larger ontology .', u'This paper presents a dynamic approach for ontology modules composition based on semantic similarity measures between concepts on the web , and aiming to improve the resulting modular ontologys structure and content .', u'The proposed approach takes place in three main phases , namely : cooccurrence graph construction of ontology modules , cooccurrence graph clustering of modular ontologies and hierarchical modules clusters construction .', u'To evaluate our approach , we compare the obtained results with those of other compositional approaches in the literature , and we also show how these modular ontologies can be used to ...']

sentences: [u'In this paper , we propose a fuzzy description logic named fom-DL by combining the classical view in cognitive psychology and fuzzy set theory .', u'A formal mechanism used to determine object memberships automatically in concepts is also proposed , which is lacked in previous work fuzzy description logics .', u'In this mechanism , object membership is based on the defining properties of concept definition and properties in object description .', u'Moreover , while previous works can not express the qualitative measurements of an object possessing a property , we introduce two kinds of properties named N-property and L-property , which are quantitative measurements and qualitative measurements of an object possessing a property respectively .', u'The subsumption and implication of concepts and properties are also explored in our work .', u'We believe that it is useful to the Semantic Web community for reasoning the fuzzy membership of objects for concepts in fuzzy ontologies .']

sentences: [u'As companies move forward to source globally , supply chain management has gained attention more than ever before .', u'In particular , the discovery and selection of capable suppliers has become a prerequisite for a global supply chain operation .', u'Manufacturing e-marketplaces have helped companies quickly and effectively discover new suppliers and/or buyers for their products and services .', u'However , as the requirements and capabilities in isolation , their true meanings may not be uniformly interpreted by each other .', u'The issue of semantics between suppliers and buyers , then , remains an obstacle .', u'The main objective of this paper is to propose a semantic web-based supplier discovery system for building a long-term strategic supply chain .', u'Specifically , ( 1 ) a key ontology is developed to represent the suppliers capability information and the buyers requirements ; ( 2 ) suppliers potential capability is reasoned ; and ( 3 ) and buyers requirements are semantically matched with suppliers capability based on a similarity ...']

sentences: [u"Healthcare information systems needs to share and to reuse the patient 's information not only in a department where the information is being formed , but also between the departments of an organization and also among the different organizations .", u'The requirements of health services like providing efficient services and ensuring continuity causes privatization of information .', u'As patient health information is dispersed and specialized , sharing personal health information became more prevalent .', u"A blood test ontology in a clinical information system could help physicians to learn more about the patient 's health status .", u"Hence , patients medical history is widely recognized as a good indicator for the patient 's treatment plan .", u'In this work , a methodology is proposed to infer the opportunities of using blood test with the help of semantic web knowledge representation .', u'In order to provide a personalized , manageable and privacy protected system , user profiles are fully integrated with blood test ontology and consent management model .']

sentences: [u'Purpose Matter is an important topic of science as a discipline since its inception .', u'Nevertheless , along with the evolution of semantic web , matter has got equal importance among the ontology developers .', u'The current work describes an ontology of matter that the authors developed in the lab .', u'The purpose of this paper is to come up with an exhaustive list of concepts and relations to cover matter domain under one umbrella , after identifying the gaps in the present ontologies .', u'Design/methodology/approach Ontology was developed following faceted analytico-synthetic approach of knowledge organization .', u'The authors followed hybrid developmental approach which includes top-down as well as bottom-up development strategy , for creating classes and subclasses .', u'The authors modelled matter domain comprehensively considering different aspects of matter .', u'The theories behind the modelling approach helps to maintain the consistency of further extensions .', u'Findings Final ontology has around 280 concepts and as many as ...']

sentences: [u'Ontologies have become the de-facto modeling tool of choice , employed in a variety of applications and prominently in the Semantic Web .', u'Nevertheless , ontology construction remains a daunting task .', u'Ontological bootstrapping , which aims at automatically generating concepts and their relations in a given domain , is a promising technique for ontology construction .', u'Bootstrapping an ontology based on a set of predefined textual sources , such as Web services , must address the problem of multiple concepts that are largely unrelated .', u'This paper exploits the advantage that Web services usually consist of both WSDL and free text descriptors .', u'The WSDL descriptor is evaluated using two methods , namely Term Frequency/Inverse Document Frequency ( TF/IDF ) and Web context generation .', u'We propose an ontology bootstrapping process that integrates the results of both methods and validates the concepts using the free text descriptors , thereby offering a more accurate definition of ontologies .']

sentences: [u'The W3C has embarked on a new standardization effort : the Rules Interchange Format ( RIF ) .', u'The goal of the effort has undergone several changes from the initial idea of creating a standard rules layer for the semantic web , and its official mission is to provide a standardized interchange for rules .', u'This change , from creating a rule language to an interchange standard , has been driven mainly by the large number of interests the effort is trying to satisfy , which make it seem impossible to settle on a single language and potentially more feasible to design a method for interoperability .', u'Even with this slightly less politically charged agenda , the number of interests are large , from Business Rules , Production Rules , Reactive Rules , etc. , to query languages , First-order logic , alethic and deontic modal logic , etc. , to bayes nets , fuzzy logic , etc. , to programming languages themselves .', u'Will anything usable ever arise from this morass ?']

sentences: [u'Mobile Semantic Web provides a new way of developing context-aware social networking applications .', u'Social networking applications are changing the way of communication by using users context-information .', u'For example , micro-blogging has become a smart way of conveying the current situation and activity by using user context .', u'There is currently a significant difference between using social networking applications on a static computer compared to a mobile device , even if current mobile devices are powerful and have good connectivity .', u'The difference is primarily related to the mobility aspect since the user contexts may change more frequently and the user may not be able to interact with the mobile device .', u'In this paper we identify common characteristics of current social networking applications and how they attract users .', u'Finally , we propose an agent-based system architecture that is based on a distributed platform for developing semantic and semi-automated mobile social networking applications .']

sentences: [u'Networks have changed little since the rise and dominance of the IP protocol .', u'Networks are focused on the transmission of transactions and information but have not played a significant role in the processing .', u'They have focused on layers 1 through 4 in the OSI model .', u'However , as more complex distributed systems are being developed increased intelligence in the network is becoming necessary .', u'With the advent of next generation protocols and formats for information there is an opportunity to increase the capabilities of networks at the higher levels of the OSI model .', u'Leveraging the technologies of the Semantic Web as well as Web Services in Layers 5 through 7 can lead to very powerful models for solving problems in developing and integrating distributed systems .', u'This paper describes a model for the Semantic Enabled Network .', u'It will address the basic concepts , architectural components and the characteristics of usage .']

sentences: [u'As the work with semantics and services grows more ambitious in the semantic Web community , there is an increasing appreciation on the need for principled approaches for representing and reasoning under uncertainty .', u'Reacting to this trend , the World Wide Web Consortium ( W3C ) has created the Uncertainty Reasoning for the World Wide Web Incubator Group ( URW3-XG ) to better define the challenge of reasoning with and representing uncertain information available through the World Wide Web and related WWW technologies .', u'In according to the URW3-XG effort this paper presents the implementation of a graphical user interface for building probabilistic ontologies , an application programming interface for saving and loading these ontologies and a proposal to specify formulas for creating conditional probabilistic tables dynamically .', u'The language used for building probabilistic ontologies is probabilistic OWL ( Pr-OWL ) , an extension for OWL based on multi-entity Bayesian network ( MEBN ) .']

sentences: [u'Abstract The success and proliferation of the Semantic Web depends heavily on construction of Web ontologies .', u'However , classical ontology construction approaches are not sufficient for handling imprecise and uncertain information that is commonly found in many application domains .', u'Therefore , great efforts on construction of fuzzy ontologies have been made in recent years .', u'In this paper , we propose a formal approach and develop an automated tool for constructing fuzzy ontologies from fuzzy UML models .', u'Firstly , we propose formalization methods of fuzzy UML models and fuzzy ontologies , where fuzzy UML models and fuzzy ontologies can be represented and interpreted by their respective formal definitions and semantic interpretation methods .', u'Then , we propose an approach for constructing fuzzy ontologies from fuzzy UML models , i.e. , transforming fuzzy UML models ( including the structure and instance information of fuzzy UML models ) into fuzzy ontologies .', u'Furthermore , following the proposed approach , we implement ...']

sentences: [u'Annotation : the main problems of ontological knowledge management for Web are analyzed , e.g .', u'the problem of integration of knowledge from different sources , knowledge acquisition and knowledge retrieval for specific task .', u'Methods of automated generation of metadata described the semantics of informational resources and for personalized search on base of thesauri and ontologies of user subject domain are proposed .', u'These methods are realized in design of informational retrieval system MAIPS where the retrieval procedure is personified on multiagent paradigm and ontological analysis .', u'MAIPS uses technologies and standards of Semantic Web and Web 2.0 ( e.g .', u'OWL for interoperable ontology and thesauri representation , RDF for metadata representation of informational resources , tag clouds for visualization of search thesauri , social services for user interaction ) , some set-theoretic operations on thesauri and creation of thesauri by natural language texts are realized .', u'Text readability criteria are used for retrieval of information pertinent to personal informational needs of user .']

sentences: [u'To recommend a travel plan for elderly people , we have to consider more constraints related to ability and health .', u'Existing Web services of travel do not consider these constraints .', u'In order to enhance the quality of live ( QoL ) of elderly people , we propose a pattern Web service , which takes into account these constraints .', u'Our goal consist to use advantage of semantic Web in order to consider fully user constraints and preferences .', u'We present in this paper , a method of collaboration between request , profile and tourism models to elaborate a recommendation system , which allows to select the travel plan according to user ability .', u'This latter is described by the user profile .', u'The models base on the semantic description of all : user profile , user request and tourism data base .', u'In addition , both of existed user profile ontology and tourism ontology have to be extended to consider constraints and preferences of elderly people .']

sentences: [u'Within the Semantic Web community , resource description frameworks ( RDF ) and logical reasoning engines work together to provide semantic support and reasoning for Web applications .', u'This paper explores the use of RDF graphs for the representation of graphs of requirements and specification of design component properties .', u'We show that the component selection design problem and associated trade-space analysis can be cast as a sequence inference analyses on RDF graphs .', u'Inference procedures are provided for assessment of requirements in terms of component attribute values , identification of compatible component interface pairs , component selection to meet the system architecture requirements , and computation of system cost , performance and reliability .', u'Our prototype implementation makes extensive use of Java and Python , and focuses on the satisfaction of requirements and component selection for a home theater design problem .', u'2013 The Authors .', u'Published by Elsevier B.V .', u'Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of Georgia Institute of Technology .']
