sentences: [u"Resume # R # # N # # TAB # L'industrie avionique , extremement critique , se trouve egalement extremement contrainte ; par les normes de securite et de certification d'une part , mais aussi par les besoins de personnalisation de ses clients d'autre part .", u'Dans ce contexte , la gestion de variabilite des systemes est un probleme de fond des projets de re-ingenierie de systemes avioniques .', u"Nous presentons dans ce memoire des travaux visant a aider la gestion de variabilite en s'appuyant sur l'analyse de concepts formels et sur le web semantique. # R # # N # # TAB # Le premier objectif de recherche consiste a identifier des comportements typiques et des interactions pour les variables de configuration d'un logiciel configure dynamiquement .", u"Pour identifier de tels elements , nous nous sommes servi de l'analyse de concepts formels a differents niveaux de precision dans le systeme ainsi que de la definition de nouvelles metriques sur le systeme .", u'Pour repondre a ce premier objectif nous avons defini une typologie des variables de configuration et de leurs interactions .', u"Nous avons egalement etudie les partages de controles entre variables de configuration au niveau du code. # R # # N # # TAB # Un autre objectif de recherche etait de construire une base de connaissance permettant de recenser les resultats des differentes analyses effectuees , mais aussi d'ajouter tout nouvel element pouvant aider a la gestion de variabilite , notamment a la definition des processus de re-ingenierie pour chacune des categories de la typologie .", u"Pour repondre a cet objectif , nous avons construit une solution fondee sur le web semantique , en definissant une nouvelle ontologie de description , extensible , et permettant la construction d'inference pour les traitements evoques plus haut. # R # # N # # TAB # Les travaux presentes ici representent , a notre connaissance la premiere typologie de variables de configuration pour un logiciel configure dynamiquement , mais aussi l'application au domaine de l'aeronautique des techniques de documentation et de gestion de variabilites basees sur le web semantique .", u"Les travaux effectues et les resultats montrent que l'analyse de concepts formels permet effectivement de comprendre certaines proprietes et interactions des variables et que le web semantique fournit les outils adequats pour conserver et exploiter les resultats .", u"Toutefois , l'utilisation de l'analyse de concepts formels a partir d'autres relations booleennes , telles que l'appartenance d'une variable de configuration a un produit , et la construction de nouvelles inferences plus precises permettraient de tirer de nouvelles conclusions .", u"L'application de la methode a d'autres systemes permettrait egalement de valider la pertinence de la classification dans d'autres contextes. -- -- -- -- -Abstract # R # # N # # TAB # Because of its critical nature , avionic industry is bound with numerous constraints such as security standards and certifications while having to fulfill the clients desires for personalization .", u'In this context , variability management is a very important issue for re-engineering projects of avionic software .', u'In this thesis , we propose a new approach , based on formal concept analysis and semantic web , to support variability management. # R # # N # # TAB # The first goal of this research is to identify characteristic behaviors and interactions of configuration variables in a dynamically configured system .', u'To identify such elements , we used formal concept analysis on different levels of abstractions in the system and defined new metrics .', u"Then , we built a classification for the configuration variables and their relations in order to enable a quick identification of a variable 's behavior in the system .", u'This classification could help finding a systematic approach to process variables during a re-engineering operation , depending on their category .', u'To have a better understanding of the system , we also studied the shared controls of code between configuration variables. # R # # N # # TAB # A second objective of this research is to build a knowledge platform to gather the results of all the analysis performed , and to store any additional element relevant in the variability management context , for instance new results helping define re-engineering process for each of the categories .', u'To address this goal , we built a solution based on a semantic web , defining a new ontology , very extensive and enabling to build inferences related to the evolution processes. # R # # N # # TAB # The approach presented here is , to the best of our knowledge , the first classification of configuration variables of a dynamically configured software and an original use of documentation and variability management techniques using semantic web in the aeronautic field .', u'The analysis performed and the final results show that formal concept analysis is a way to identify specific properties and behaviors and that semantic web is a good solution to store and explore the results .', u'However , the use of formal concept analysis with new boolean relations , such as the link between configuration variables and files , and the definition of new inferences may be a way to draw better conclusions .', u'The use of the same methodology with other systems would enable to validate the approach in other contexts .']

entities: [[], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'context-specific ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'intelligent applications/devices', u'Task'), (u'Ambient Intelligence', u'Task')], [(u'networked ontology ( Meta ) model', u'Method'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'virtual and implicit network of ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web')]]
sentences: [u'Currently many ontologies are available for addressing different domains .', u'However , it is not always possible to deploy such ontologies to support collaborative working , so that their full potential can be exploited to implement intelligent cooperative applications capable of reasoning over a network of context-specific ontologies .', u'The main problem arises from the fact that presently ontologies are created in an isolated way to address specific needs .', u'However we foresee the need for a network of ontologies which will support the next generation of intelligent applications/devices , and , the vision of Ambient Intelligence .', u'The main objective of this paper is to motivate the design of a networked ontology ( Meta ) model which formalises ways of connecting available ontologies so that they are easy to search , to characterise and to maintain .', u'The aim is to make explicit the virtual and implicit network of ontologies serving the Semantic Web .']

sentences: [u'The Internet Registry Information Service ( IRIS ) registers domain names while the Domain Name System ( DNS ) publishes domain addresses with mapping of names to addresses for the original web .', u'Analogously , the Problem Oriented Registry of Tags And Labels ( PORTAL ) registers resource labels and tags while the Domain Ontology Oriented Resource System ( DOORS ) publishes resource locations and descriptions with mapping of labels to locations for the semantic web .', u'Both the IRIS-DNS System and the PORTAL-DOORS System share a common architectural style for pervasive metadata networks that operate as distributed metadata management systems with hierarchical authorities for entity registering and attribute publishing .', u'Hierarchical control of metadata redistribution throughout the registry-directory networks constitutes an essential characteristic of this architectural style called Hierarchically Distributed Mobile Metadata ( HDMM ) with its focus on moving the metadata for who what where as fast as possible from servers in response to requests from clients .']

sentences: [u'Multiple tasks related to documents , such as indexing , retrieving , annotation , or translation are based on linguistic , terminological and ontological knowledge existing in resources of different types represented using various formalisms .', u'Building bridges between these resources and using them together is a complex task .', u'Solving this problem relies on finding the right resources before extracting the required data .', u'Ontology repositories have been created to help in this task by collecting ontologies and offering effective indexing of these resources .', u'However , these repositories treat a single category of resources and do not provide operations for generating new resources .', u'To meet these needs in terms of knowledge engineering , our contributions are ( 1 ) an ontology for representing heterogeneous resources and knowledge combination operators ; ( 2 ) an approach based on the principles of semantic web to ensure the representation , storage and alignment of heterogeneous resources and ( 3 ) the development of an ontology-based repository for combining alignment resources .']

sentences: [u'The range of topics addressed in this volume is broader than in previous JURIX volumes .', u'All the main legal functions are covered : legal drafting , legal negotiating , legal decision making and legal argumentation .', u'The traditional tools in AI have been greatly improved : expert systems interfaces become more friendly by using procedure maps .', u'Generally speaking , progress has been made in process design for various legal tasks : to evaluate infringement and to implement e-governance models .', u'Legal retrieval systems have shifted to the web and the recurrent question of legal language has become crucial in the building of the semantic web .', u'Theoretical aspects of Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) and law continue to be explored and modelling is the new way of making legal theory .', u'Legal theorists continue to renew their concerns in logical aspects of legal reasoning and more and more AI and Law projects are interested in legal theory .']

sentences: [u'Web Service has emerged as a dominant paradigm for distributed computing in industry as well as academia .', u'Current Web service discovery methods are based on centralized approaches where Web services are identified based on service functionality .', u'However , as the number of Web Services grows and becomes more dynamic , such a centralized approach quickly becomes impractical , which suffers from problems such as high operational and maintenance cost , single point of failure , and scalability .', u'This paper proposes a semantic web based peer-to-peer architecture for building dynamic , scalable , decentralized service discovery and binding mechanism used for intelligent business process platform of Virtual Travel Agency .', u'In addition , it integrates a scalable mechanism to rank Web services based on domain ontology and group ontology used for service publication , discovery and process generation .', u'Finally , the performance analysis and evaluation of the method has been discussed and the prospects for the future research are presented .']

sentences: [u'The web has revolutionised information sharing , management , interoperability and # R # # N # knowledge discovery .', u'The union of the two prominent web frameworks , Web 2.0 and the # R # # N # Semantic Web is often referred to as Web 3.0 .', u'This paper explores the basics behind # R # # N # the two paradigms , assesses their influence over organisational change and considers # R # # N # their effectiveness in supporting innovative solutions .', u'It then outlines the challenges of # R # # N # combining the two web paradigms to form Web 3.0 and critically evaluates the impact # R # # N # that Web 3.0 will have on the social organisation .', u"The research carried out follows action # R # # N # research principles and adopts an investigative and reviewing approach to the emerging # R # # N # trends and patterns that develop from the web 's changing use , examining the # R # # N # underpinning enabling technologies that facilitate access , innovation and organisational # R # # N # change ."]

relations: [[(u'clustering method', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge bases'), (u'clustering method', u'USED-FOR', u'semantically annotated resources')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'groupings of structured objects'), (u'concept languages', u'USED-FOR', u'groupings of structured objects'), (u'concept languages', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'language-independent semi-distance measures', u'USED-FOR', u'method')], [], [], [(u'feature construction procedure', u'USED-FOR', u'maximally discriminating group of features'), (u'genetic programming', u'USED-FOR', u'maximally discriminating group of features'), (u'genetic programming', u'USED-FOR', u'feature construction procedure')], [(u'notion of medoids', u'USED-FOR', u'evolutionary clustering algorithm'), (u'notion of medoids', u'USED-FOR', u'relational representations')], [(u'defined distance', u'USED-FOR', u'It'), (u'defined distance', u'CONJUNCTION', u'discernibility criterion'), (u'discernibility criterion', u'USED-FOR', u'It')], []]
sentences: [u'A clustering method is presented which can be applied to knowledge bases storing semantically annotated resources .', u'The method can be used to discover groupings of structured objects expressed in the standard concept languages employed in the Semantic Web .', u'The method exploits effective language-independent semi-distance measures over the space of resources .', u'These are based on their semantics w.r.t .', u'a number of dimensions corresponding to a committee of features represented by a group of discriminating concept descriptions .', u'We show how to obtain a maximally discriminating group of features through a feature construction procedure based on genetic programming .', u'The evolutionary clustering algorithm employed is based on the notion of medoids applied to relational representations .', u'It is able to induce an optimal set of clusters by means of a proper fitness function based on the defined distance and the discernibility criterion .', u'An experimentation with some real ontologies proves the feasibility of our method .']

entities: [[(u'enterprise architectures', u'Method'), (u'architecture modeling process', u'Method')], [(u'Semantic Web techniques', u'Method'), (u'EA issues', u'Task')], [(u'Zachman Framework', u'Method'), (u'approach', u'Generic')], [(u'General systems theory', u'Method'), (u'wholeness of systems order', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'EA reusability', u'Task'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'hierarchy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'holism', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Semantic Web techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'EA issues')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'After repeated attempts to improve methods for developing the enterprise architectures used during complex Department of Defense ( DoD ) projects , consensus from project managers still indicates the architecture modeling process is costly and returns less that cost-effective benefits .', u'A recent proposal from within the DoD to incorporate Semantic Web techniques into the process promises to resolve identified EA issues .', u'The purpose of this study is to examine the proposed improvements using the Zachman Framework , regarded as a lexicon for understanding architectures ; and systems principles as a qualitative predictor of the effectiveness of this approach .', u'General systems theory is concerned with the wholeness of systems order not understandable by investigation of their respective parts in isolation .', u'Conclusions of this analysis show that proposed changes should yield some improvement in the area of EA reusability , however , the methods fall short of incorporating major system principle aspects of hierarchy , and holism .']

sentences: [u'As a kind of knowledge description methods , ontology has been used in reasoning related field to obtain more reasonable results , such as Semantic Web , Decision Support System , Data Integration etc .', u'However , the construction of the ontology is still a time-consuming work for the experts .', u'Although there are many ontology learning methods to acquire ontology from structured or unstructured data , it is still difficult to exclude logic errors using reinforcement learning on ontology construction .', u'Ontology extension is a key step when the new knowledge adds into the existing ontology in the process ontology learning .', u'This proposal designs and validates the method of ontology extension based on the axiomatic cognitive model , which include the ontology extension postulates , axioms and operations of the learning model .', u'Our approach aims at improving the efficiency and accuracy of the Ontology construction .', u'It is proved that these operators subject to the established axiom system .']

entities: [[(u'eleMEK', u'Method'), (u'modular software system', u'Method'), (u'recording and retrieval of metadata of digital documents', u'Task'), (u'conversion of metadata', u'Task'), (u'eXtensible Markup Language', u'Material'), (u'Dublin Core', u'Material'), (u'Open Archives Initiative', u'Metric')], [(u'software', u'Generic'), (u'Hungarian digital archives', u'Material'), (u'National Digital Data Archives initiative', u'Material')], [(u'eleMEK', u'Method'), (u'Java-based platform independent system', u'Method'), (u'data management system', u'Method'), (u'Hungarian Electronic Library', u'Material')], [(u'software', u'Generic'), (u'Hungarian Electronic Library Association', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'eleMEK', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'modular software system'), (u'eXtensible Markup Language', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Dublin Core'), (u'eXtensible Markup Language', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Open Archives Initiative'), (u'Dublin Core', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Open Archives Initiative')], [(u'software', u'USED-FOR', u'Hungarian digital archives')], [(u'eleMEK', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Java-based platform independent system')], [], []]
sentences: [u'eleMEK is a freely available , modular software system developed in Hungary for the recording and retrieval of metadata of digital documents and for the conversion of metadata into various internationally standardised data exchange formats ( eXtensible Markup Language , Dublin Core , Open Archives Initiative , MARC ) .', u'The software allows for Hungarian digital archives to join the recently launched National Digital Data Archives initiative as well as to become part of the worldwide semantic web in development phase .', u'eleMEK is a Java-based platform independent system designed on the basis of the experiences of the data management system of the Hungarian Electronic Library .', u'The software was developed with the support of the Ministry of Informatics and Communication , the National Information Infrastructure Development Program and the Hungarian Electronic Library Association .', u'The homepage of the project can be found at http : //www.oszk.hu and the system can be tested under http : //elemek.niif.hu/index.jsp']

relations: [[(u'information retrieval', u'CONJUNCTION', u'information extraction')], [], [(u'semantic web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'information extraction')], [], [(u'Wikipedia', u'CONJUNCTION', u'WordNet'), (u'WordNet', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ACM Digital Library')], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'information extraction system')], [(u'algorithms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'machine learning'), (u'machine learning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'natural language processing')], []]
sentences: [u'Ontologies play an important role in the distinct areas , such as information retrieval , information extraction , question and answer .', u'They help us in capturing and storing knowledge in a particular domain and can be used for distinct applications .', u'In recent years , research relevant to ontology development has produced tangible results concerning semantic web , information extraction , etc .', u'In this paper , a domain specific ontology called Information Technology Ontology ( ITO ) is proposed .', u'This ontology is built basing on three distinct sources of Wikipedia , WordNet and ACM Digital Library .', u'An information extraction system focusing on computing domain based on this ontology in the future will be built .', u'In order to have an ontology with highest quality and performance as expected , the authors combine some algorithms between machine learning and natural language processing ( NLP ) for building ontology .', u'Results generated by such experiments show that these algorithms outperform others , especially in semantic relations among entities of ontology .']

relations: [[(u'information sharing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'interoperability')], [(u'weather', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'navigation information'), (u'weather', u'CONJUNCTION', u'tides'), (u'tides', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'navigation information'), (u'tides', u'CONJUNCTION', u'chart information'), (u'chart information', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'navigation information')], [], [], [(u'navigation information ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'applications'), (u'disparate databases', u'CONJUNCTION', u'applications'), (u'applications', u'CONJUNCTION', u'user communities')], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'navigation information ontology')]]
sentences: [u'This paper analyzes some problems on information sharing and interoperability exiting in navigation information domain .', u'Due to different understanding of knowledge of navigation domain , different communities organize and express navigation information ( such as weather , tides , and chart information ) in different ways .', u'The different formats of information lead to many difficulties on data sharing , interoperation between disparate communities and systems .', u'This paper then analyzes the effects of ontology , and presents the necessity and essentiality of developing navigation information ontology , conceptual models that can present hierarchy and semantic meaning of concepts of navigation domain .', u'The navigation information ontology would enhance the sharing and exchange of navigation information between disparate databases , applications , and user communities , and lay a foundation for the next generation of intelligent navigation information system and the semantic web of the domain .', u'Based on detailed analysis of navigation information domain , this paper finally proposes a methodology for building navigation information ontology .']

entities: [[(u'Web Information Systems', u'Task')], [(u'WIS engineering', u'Method'), (u'design methodologies', u'Method')], [(u'distributed WIS', u'Material')], [(u'model', u'Generic'), (u'WIS design trajectory', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web RDF', u'Method')], [(u'integration model', u'Method'), (u'semantic heterogeneities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'disparate RDF sources', u'Material')], [(u'distributed RDF query processing', u'Task'), (u'framework', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [], [], [(u'integration model', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic heterogeneities'), (u'disparate RDF sources', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic heterogeneities')], [(u'distributed RDF query processing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'optimization')]]
sentences: [u'There is an apparent need for specifying the integration of multiple knowledge sources during the design of Web Information Systems ( WIS ) where the actual data is often retrieved from several content providers .', u'Despite that , there exists very little work on integration within the context of WIS engineering and the related design methodologies in particular .', u'We argue that this new context brings several additional requirements which must be dealt with in order to be able to successfully deploy distributed WIS .', u'In this paper we elaborate a model that covers the integration phase of the WIS design trajectory .', u'We centered our approach around the emerging data standard on the Semantic Web RDF .', u'The proposed integration model is able to reconcile many semantic heterogeneities that frequently occur among disparate RDF sources .', u'We also address the issues of distributed RDF query processing and optimization , and test the performance of our framework .']

entities: [[(u'information exchanges', u'Material'), (u'business transactions', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'XML-related technologies', u'Method'), (u'automatic and human agents', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'electronic business', u'Task'), (u'business processes', u'Method'), (u'business rules', u'Method')], [(u'business rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'business systems', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'business rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'information exchanges', u'CONJUNCTION', u'business transactions')], [(u'ontologies', u'CONJUNCTION', u'XML-related technologies')], [(u'business rules', u'USED-FOR', u'business processes')], [], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'business systems')], []]
sentences: [u'Businesses operate today in an increasingly dynamic environment through a worldwide network of information exchanges and business transactions .', u'The Semantic Web - an extension of the current Web - which comprises ontologies and XML-related technologies , provides a shared and standardized vocabulary that can be communicated among automatic and human agents to share information and knowledge .', u'Consider that an electronic business is a set of business processes governed by business rules that run over the Internet .', u'These business rules play a significant role in determining the success or failure of a business as a whole .', u'The goal of this paper is to introduce a framework that is designed to build business systems faster and which can more easily accommodate changes within a business .', u'The advantages of this framework arise from its unity and simplicity , and especially its ability to effectively change , add , and/or delete business rules .']

entities: [[(u'Web services technology', u'Method'), (u'software reuse', u'Task')], [(u'Web service discovery and composition', u'Task'), (u'online Web service repositories', u'Material'), (u'them', u'Generic')], [(u'online repositories', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'software libraries', u'Method'), (u'they', u'Generic'), (u'service discovery', u'Task')], [(u'automatically deriving metadata', u'Task'), (u'Web service collections', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'ontology learning', u'Task'), (u'matching', u'Task'), (u'metadata based presentation', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'software reuse', u'CONJUNCTION', u'discovery')], [], [], [], [(u'ontology learning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'matching'), (u'matching', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web'), (u'matching', u'CONJUNCTION', u'metadata based presentation')]]
sentences: [u'The success of the Web services technology has brought topics as software reuse and discovery once again on the agenda of software engineers .', u'While there are several efforts towards automating Web service discovery and composition , many developers still search for services via online Web service repositories and then combine them manually .', u'However , from our analysis of these online repositories , it yields that , unlike traditional software libraries , they rely on little metadata to support service discovery .', u'We believe that the major cause is the difficulty of automatically deriving metadata that would describe rapidly changing Web service collections .', u'In this paper , we discuss the major shortcomings of state of the art Web service repositories and as a solution , we report on ongoing work and ideas on how to use techniques developed in the context of the Semantic Web ( ontology learning , matching , metadata based presentation ) to improve the current situation .']

entities: [[(u'Business intelligence BI', u'Method'), (u'business actors customer', u'Metric')], [(u'Business Intelligence BI tools', u'Method')], [(u'business intelligence tools', u'Method')], [(u'BI', u'Method'), (u'BI', u'Method'), (u'BI', u'Method'), (u'business intelligence', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'proposal', u'Generic'), (u'BI', u'Metric'), (u'semantic Web', u'Task')], [(u'open sources OS', u'Material'), (u'competitive and marketing intelligence', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'business actors customer', u'CONJUNCTION', u'supplier')], [], [], [(u'BI', u'CONJUNCTION', u'proposal'), (u'BI', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic Web')], []]
sentences: [u"Business intelligence BI is a promising way which let companies to gather large amounts of data , accessing , analyzing that data , and presenting a high-level set of reports that condense the huge amount of that data so that they can make fundamental business decisions regarding business actors customer , supplier , logistics ' .", u'To learn from the past and present time and anticipate the new market trends , many companies are adopting Business Intelligence BI tools and systems .', u'There are numerous business intelligence tools to help managers in making the best decisions .', u'The paper give some explanation of the concepts and the components of BI , benefits of BI , tools for BI , the implementation of business intelligence , and a proposal to combine BI and semantic Web .', u'Additionally , the paper describes the popularity and the increase of data and information use from open sources OS and its impacts in competitive and marketing intelligence .']

entities: [[(u'retrieval of relevant information', u'Task'), (u'users query', u'Material')], [(u'search engines', u'Method'), (u'web pages', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'semantic information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'web', u'Material')], [(u'intelligent agent', u'Method'), (u'querys context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'intelligent agent', u'Method'), (u'WordNet', u'Material'), (u'users query', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'syntactic , semantic , and pragmatic constructs', u'Task'), (u'DAML ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'intelligent agent', u'Task')], [(u'constructs', u'Generic'), (u'tool', u'Generic'), (u'Ontology Auditor', u'Method'), (u'intelligent agent', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'retrieval of relevant information', u'USED-FOR', u'users query')], [], [(u'semantic information', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web'), (u'web', u'FEATURE-OF', u'semantic information')], [], [(u'WordNet', u'USED-FOR', u'intelligent agent')], [(u'syntactic , semantic , and pragmatic constructs', u'USED-FOR', u'DAML ontologies')], []]
sentences: [u'The continued growth of the World Wide Web makes the retrieval of relevant information for a users query increasingly difficult .', u'Current search engines provide the user with many web pages , but varying levels of relevancy .', u'In response , the Semantic Web has been proposed to retrieve and use more semantic information from the web .', u'Our prior research has developed an intelligent agent to automate the processing of a users query while taking into account the querys context .', u'The intelligent agent uses WordNet and the DARPA Agent Markup Language ( DAML ) ontologies to act as surrogates for understanding the context of terms in a users query .', u'This research develops a set of syntactic , semantic , and pragmatic constructs to assess the effectiveness of the DAML ontologies so that the intelligent agent can select the most useful ontologies .', u'These constructs have been implemented in a tool called the Ontology Auditor for use by the intelligent agent .']

entities: [[(u'features', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Method')], [], [(u'imported knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic ground', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'notions of transformations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic properties', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'description logics markup language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'compound transformations', u'Method')], [(u'functions', u'Generic'), (u'web standard languages', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'notions of transformations', u'USED-FOR', u'infrastructure')], [], [(u'web standard languages', u'USED-FOR', u'functions')]]
sentences: [u'Because different applications and different communities require different features , the semantic web might have to face the heterogeneity of the languages for expressing knowledge .', u'Yet , it will be necessary for many applications to use knowledge coming from different sources .', u'In such a context , ensuring the correct understanding of imported knowledge on a semantic ground is very important .', u'We present here an infrastructure based on the notions of transformations from one language to another and of properties satisfied by transformations .', u'We show , in the particular context of semantic properties and description logics markup language , how it is possible ( 1 ) to define properties of transformations , ( 2 ) to express , in a form easily processed by machine , the proof of a property and ( 3 ) to construct by composition a proof of properties satisfied by compound transformations .', u'All these functions are based on extensions of current web standard languages .']

entities: [[(u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'named entities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'unstructured text', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'mapping entity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mapping entity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mapping real world entity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'APOLLO', u'Method'), (u'LO gy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'named entities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'APOLLO', u'Method'), (u'rich semantic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Wikipedia', u'Material')], [(u'APOLLO', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'ontology', u'FEATURE-OF', u'mapping real world entity')], [], [], [(u'rich semantic knowledge', u'USED-FOR', u'APOLLO'), (u'Wikipedia', u'USED-FOR', u'APOLLO')], []]
sentences: [u'Automatically populating ontology with named entities extracted from the unstructured text has become a key issue for Semantic Web .', u'This issue naturally consists of two subtasks : ( 1 ) for the entity mention whose mapping entity does not exist in the ontology , attach it to the right category in the ontology ( i.e. , fine-grained named entity classification ) , and ( 2 ) for the entity mention whose mapping entity is contained in the ontology , link it with its mapping real world entity in the ontology ( i.e. , entity linking ) .', u'Previous studies only focus on one of the two subtasks .', u'This paper proposes APOLLO , a general weakly supervised fr A mework for PO pu L ating onto LO gy with named entities .', u'APOLLO leverages the rich semantic knowledge embedded in the Wikipedia to resolve this task via random walks on graphs .', u'An experimental study has been conducted to show the effectiveness of APOLLO .']

entities: [[(u'web page content', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'Generating ontological information', u'Task'), (u'web', u'Material'), (u'machine learning', u'Method')], [(u'LASSO', u'Method'), (u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'distributed components', u'Method'), (u'machine learning', u'Task'), (u'information extraction', u'Task'), (u'classifiers', u'Method')], [(u'LASSO', u'Method'), (u'semantic models of web pages', u'Method'), (u'database back end', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'models', u'Generic')], [(u'LASSO', u'Method'), (u'collaborative experimentation workbench', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'proof-of-concept prototype', u'Method'), (u'ontological search engine', u'Method')], [(u'LASSO', u'Method'), (u'machine learning algorithms', u'Method'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'code reuse metric', u'Metric')]]
relations: [[], [(u'machine learning', u'USED-FOR', u'Generating ontological information')], [(u'machine learning', u'CONJUNCTION', u'information extraction')], [], [(u'LASSO', u'USED-FOR', u'collaborative experimentation workbench')], [], [(u'LASSO', u'USED-FOR', u'machine learning algorithms'), (u'code reuse metric', u'USED-FOR', u'system')]]
sentences: [u'Expressing web page content in a way that computers can understand is the key to a semantic web .', u'Generating ontological information from the web automatically using machine learning shows great promise towards this goal .', u'We present LASSO , an architecture that combines distributed components for training web page classifiers via machine learning and information extraction , and then labels new pages with the classifiers .', u"LASSO 's results are semantic models of web pages stored in a database back end , and the models are defined with respect to whatever ontology the user chooses .", u'LASSO can be used to build a wide variety of applications or can be used as a collaborative experimentation workbench .', u'We give as part of our proof-of-concept prototype an application of an enhanced ontological search engine .', u'We also describe how LASSO can be used to compare machine learning algorithms and analyze our system with a code reuse metric .']

entities: [[(u'personalized information recommendation', u'Task')], [(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'grid technology', u'Method'), (u'personalized information recommendation', u'Task')], [(u'personalized information recommendation model', u'Method'), (u'semantic grid', u'Method'), (u'personalized information recommendation solution', u'Method'), (u'distributed , heterogeneous , massive information environment', u'Task')], [(u'solution', u'Generic'), (u'semantic grid', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantic grid', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'recommendation intelligence', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'grid monitoring technology', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'In this paper , we analyzed the drawbacks existing in the current personalized information recommendation .', u'Then we analyzed the limitations of the application of the Internet , the semantic web and the grid technology in the field of personalized information recommendation .', u'Ground on the analysis above , we put forward a personalized information recommendation model based on semantic grid , and preliminary advanced the personalized information recommendation solution of large-scale , high accuracy , strong timeliness , which is geared to the distributed , heterogeneous , massive information environment .', u'Specifically speaking , the solution makes use of the high-performance computing and information service capability of semantic grid to resolve the problem of recommendation scale and timeliness ; it makes use of the semantic processing ability of semantic grid to resolve the problem of recommendation intelligence ; In addtion , it makes use of the grid monitoring technology to resolve the problem of the real-time information acquisiton of the candidate grid nodes .']

entities: [[(u'collective knowledge engineering', u'Task')], [(u'semantic wikis', u'Method'), (u'tools', u'Generic')], [(u'semantic wikis implementations', u'Method'), (u'conceptual and technological limitations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'limitations', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge representation', u'Method'), (u'strong reasoning', u'Method'), (u'user interfaces', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic wiki', u'Method')], [(u'Loki', u'Method'), (u'coherent logic-based representation', u'Method'), (u'semantic annotations of the content', u'Task')], [(u'representation', u'Generic'), (u'reasoning procedures', u'Method')], [(u'representation', u'Generic'), (u'logic programming paradigm', u'Method'), (u'Prolog programming language', u'Material')], [(u'architecture', u'Generic'), (u'rule-based reasoning', u'Task'), (u'wiki', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'compatibility layer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic MediaWiki ( SMW ) platform', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'annotations', u'Generic')], [(u'prototype implementation', u'Method'), (u'PlWiki', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'To fulfill its ambitious promises , Semantic Web needs practical and accessible tools for collective knowledge engineering .', u'Recent developments in the area of semantic wikis show how such tools can be built .', u'However , existing semantic wikis implementations have both conceptual and technological limitations .', u'These limitations are in the areas of knowledge representation , strong reasoning as well as appropriate user interfaces .', u'In this paper a proposal of a new semantic wiki is presented .', u'Loki uses a coherent logic-based representation for semantic annotations of the content .', u'The same representation is used for implementing reasoning procedures .', u'The representation uses the logic programming paradigm and the Prolog programming language .', u'The proposed architecture allows for rule-based reasoning in the wiki .', u'It also provides a compatibility layer with the popular Semantic MediaWiki ( SMW ) platform , directly parsing its annotations .', u'In the paper a prototype implementation called PlWiki is described , and a practical use case is given']

sentences: [u'Next generation of knowledge management systems will utilize different met- hods and techniques from the following commu- nities to achieve the vision of ubiquitous know- ledge : Semantic Web and Web Services , Agent Technologies , Mobility .', u'A knowledge asset ( Web resource or service ) to become an intellectu- al capital must be shared ; it increases in value while being used .', u'We consider an infrastructu- re of distributed Web service components , which can be discovered in the Web based on semantic annotations , move to any target platform car- ried by mobile agents and perform their tasks locally and cooperatively .', u'The challenge to use agents allows not only mobility of service comp- onents but also their learning while performing tasks locally .', u'We are implementing this concept for automated monitoring and maintenance of field devices .', u'A Model of Distributed Industrial Product Maintenance System based on intera- ction of heterogeneous distributed mobile Web services is described .']

entities: [[(u'generation services', u'Method'), (u'telecom service architectures', u'Method'), (u'triple awareness', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'context', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'connectivity', u'Metric'), (u'information/content', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'Internet-based architectures', u'Method'), (u'transformations', u'Generic'), (u'semantic Web properties', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'service oriented architectures', u'Method'), (u'service/information ontology', u'Task')], [(u'example service architecture', u'Method')], [(u'service discovery and composition tests', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u"Next generation services are challenging today 's telecom service architectures with triple awareness : context , connectivity and information/content .", u'Their heterogeneity , distribution and dynamics make the transformation to these properties demanding .', u'As in most of the Internet-based architectures these transformations are heading to direction of : semantic Web properties , service oriented architectures and service/information ontology .', u'In this paper we present a practical analysis of design and implementation efforts , and performance overhead introduced by reorganizing the example service architecture in the above-mentioned three directions .', u'We focus on the service discovery and composition tests , in particular two cases : ( 1 ) when if is possible to find an end-service providing the wanted results ( 2 ) when it is not possible to find a wanted end-service , but it is possible to find components/enablers that can be combined and produce the wanted results , or the results with similar QoS and quality of information .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Task')], [(u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'static nature', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontological structures', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'educational metadata', u'Material')], [], [(u'Contextualized and Community-Centred Metadata', u'Material')]]
sentences: [u"Abstract : Heidrun Allert 's paper is , at least for this reader , a very interesting contribution to the debate over the future of the semantic web from an educational perspective .", u"The main contribution is a proposal for a new form of metadata relating to the notion of a # R # # N # '' Learning Role '' which is used to provide a way of avoiding the static nature of many schemes for describing ontological structures .", u'This is a constructive approach to a somewhat difficult situation in the world of educational metadata .', u'At the very least , the proposal deserves to be # R # # N # fleshed out into a more substantial proposal and discussed by various interested parties .', u'# R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # Paper : Allert , H. ( 2004 ) Coherent Social Systems for Learning : An Approach for Contextualized and Community-Centred Metadata . # R # # N # # R # # N # # R # # N # Editors : Terry Anderson and Denise Whitelock .']

entities: [[(u'Sharing of open government data', u'Task'), (u'data models', u'Method'), (u'data collections', u'Material')], [(u'environmental domain', u'Material'), (u'data models', u'Method')], [(u'data model', u'Method'), (u'spatial information platform', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'open government data', u'Material'), (u'water sciences', u'Material')], [(u'information model', u'Method')], [(u'information model', u'Method'), (u'extension mechanisms', u'Method'), (u'ISO19000 series', u'Material'), (u'Comprehensive Knowledge Archive Network', u'Method'), (u'dynamic tag extension', u'Task'), (u'dynamic content extension', u'Task')], [(u'CKAN domain model', u'Method'), (u'semantic- web-compatible standards', u'Method'), (u'Dublin Core', u'Material'), (u'Data Catalogue Vocabulary', u'Material'), (u'World Wide Web Consortium', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'data model', u'PART-OF', u'spatial information platform'), (u'data model', u'USED-FOR', u'open government data')], [], [(u'extension mechanisms', u'USED-FOR', u'information model'), (u'ISO19000 series', u'CONJUNCTION', u'extension mechanisms'), (u'Comprehensive Knowledge Archive Network', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'extension mechanisms'), (u'Comprehensive Knowledge Archive Network', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dynamic tag extension'), (u'dynamic tag extension', u'CONJUNCTION', u'dynamic content extension')], [(u'Dublin Core', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic- web-compatible standards')]]
sentences: [u'Sharing of open government data is amongst other reasons hindered by incompatibility of data models in different data collections .', u'Only a few areas in the environmental domain have progressed towards commonly used data models .', u'The purpose of this paper is to share with the community a data model which is used in a spatial information platform being built for the purpose of sharing open government data in the domain of water sciences .', u'The objective when building the information model was not to be restricted to one and only one ( meta ) data standard .', u'The information model therefore uses several stan- dards and extension mechanisms : the ISO19000 series , the Comprehensive Knowledge Archive Network ( CKAN ) , dynamic tag extension and dynamic content extension .', u'The CKAN domain model can also be mapped to semantic- web-compatible standards like Dublin Core and the Data Catalogue Vocabulary of the World Wide Web Consortium .']

relations: [[], [(u'catalogs of data repositories', u'CONJUNCTION', u'meta-level descriptors')], [], [(u'semantic web index', u'USED-FOR', u'candidate datasets')], [(u'ontology schema matching techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'candidate datasets')]]
sentences: [u'With more data repositories constantly being published on the Web , choosing appropriate data sources to interlink with newly published datasets becomes a non-trivial problem .', u'While catalogs of data repositories and meta-level descriptors such as VoiD provide valuable information to take these decisions , more detailed information about the instances included into repositories is often required to assess the relevance of datasets and the part of the dataset to link to .', u'However , retrieving and processing such information for a potentially large number of datasets is practically unfeasible .', u'In this paper , we examine how using an existing semantic web index can help identifying candidate datasets for linking .', u'We further apply ontology schema matching techniques to rank these candidate datasets and extract the sub-dataset to use for linking , in the form of classes with instances more likely to match the ones of the local dataset .']

entities: [[(u'Ontological structures', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'Fuzzy Sets', u'Method'), (u'Fuzzy Logic techniques', u'Method'), (u'human knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'logical formulas', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'fuzzy approach', u'Method'), (u'crispness problem', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'ambiguity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'deficient discernibility of objects', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rough approximations of fuzzy concepts and relations', u'Task'), (u'roughness of generated ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'fuzzy concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'entailments', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'sub-sumptions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ontologies', u'Generic'), (u'reasoning', u'Task'), (u'incomplete domains', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Ontological structures', u'PART-OF', u'Semantic Web')], [(u'Fuzzy Sets', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Fuzzy Logic techniques')], [(u'fuzzy approach', u'USED-FOR', u'crispness problem'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'ambiguity')], [], [(u'fuzzy concepts', u'CONJUNCTION', u'entailments'), (u'entailments', u'CONJUNCTION', u'sub-sumptions')], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning')]]
sentences: [u'Ontological structures play a major role in the Semantic Web ; they became the target of an extensive research over the last decade .', u'An important advance was the attempt to employ Fuzzy Sets and Fuzzy Logic techniques in representing ontologies for intrinsically vague domains of interest where most of human knowledge can not be expressed in crisp logical formulas .', u'Although the fuzzy approach alleviates the crispness problem , it does not deal satisfactory with the ambiguity caused by deficient discernibility of objects .', u'We consider building rough approximations of fuzzy concepts and relations to measure the roughness of generated ontologies .', u"The key objective of this work is to roughly approximate fuzzy concepts , entailments and sub-sumptions of a given ontology to have a better understanding of both ontology 's quality and boundaries of usage .", u'This will be useful for estimating appropriateness of existing ontologies for reasoning in incomplete domains .']

sentences: [u'Purpose This paper proposes enhancing libraries to act as knowledge management centers for small businesses , providing both knowledge management ( KM ) and competitive intelligence ( CI ) services .', u'Design/methodology/approach The requirements for a Library Knowledge Management Center ( LKMC ) are presented and briefly examined .', u'KM , CI , ontologies , and the Semantic Web are all considered , and the steps needed to realize a LKMC are presented .', u'Findings An approach to developing a LKMC is provided , as is a rationale for the proposal .', u'Future research issues for realization of this proposal are addressed .', u'Research limitations/implications This paper presents a conceptual overview of a project that is still in its early stages , and as such its practicality is difficult to evaluate .', u'Practical implications This proposal , if followed up with future research , will prove beneficial to both small business and to libraries .', u'Small businesses are not always able to gather sufficient internal and external knowledge to ...']

sentences: [u'Key Words : ontology model , inventory information , VCD and DVD Rental , Protege ABSTRACT : With the development of information technology today , it is the nature of todays information is also experiencing growth .', u'These growth pushed sources of information become increasingly dynamic , autonomous , diverse and large .', u'The diversity that occurs not only at the technical level but it is also at the level of representation of information .', u'This difference can occur in syntactic , schematic and semantic level .', u'Because of this diversity , it is for the exchange of information between the various sources will be a constraint .', u'To overcome those problems , it is developed a method .', u'This method is by using a Semantic Web ontology approach Through this research , it discuss the use of an approach to ontology-based data model for storing a database of inventory information on VCD and DVD Rental Video Club with protege3.2 Beta .']

relations: [[], [(u'draft methods', u'USED-FOR', u'solution'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL')], [], [(u'Datalog', u'USED-FOR', u'mapping')], [(u'information preservation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'query preservation')], [], [(u'monotonicity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantics preservation')], [(u'ours', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'monotone mapping')], [(u'semantics preserving', u'FEATURE-OF', u'non-monotone direct mapping')]]
sentences: [u'Mapping relational databases to RDF is a fundamental problem for the development of the Semantic Web .', u'We present a solution , inspired by draft methods defined by the W3C where relational databases are directly mapped to RDF and OWL .', u'Given a relational database schema and its integrity constraints , this direct mapping produces an OWL ontology , which , provides the basis for generating RDF instances .', u'The semantics of this mapping is defined using Datalog .', u'Two fundamental properties are information preservation and query preservation .', u'We prove that our mapping satisfies both conditions , even for relational databases that contain null values .', u'We also consider two desirable properties : monotonicity and semantics preservation .', u'We prove that our mapping is monotone and also prove that no monotone mapping , including ours , is semantic preserving .', u'We realize that monotonicity is an obstacle for semantic preservation and thus present a non-monotone direct mapping that is semantics preserving .']

entities: [[(u'social network analysis', u'Method')], [(u'social network', u'Method'), (u'graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'edges', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'edges', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'SNA community', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'homophily', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multiplexity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'graph analytic techniques', u'Method'), (u'social networks', u'Method')], [(u'social network', u'Method'), (u'Friend of a Friend ontology', u'Method'), (u'Organization ontology', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'This chapter introduced the concept of social network analysis ( SNA ) , which , although not invented by , was certainly made famous by Stanley Milgram and his six degrees of separation findings .', u'It described how a social network can be represented as a graph , with people as nodes and the relationships among people serving as edges where edges can also reflect things like whether the relationship is strong or weak , and whether it has directionality .', u'It introduced some terms specific to the SNA community such as homophily and multiplexity , and it described the graph analytic techniques that can be used to explore social networks .', u'Finally we explored two upper level Semantic Web ontologies for representing facts about a social network , the Friend of a Friend ontology for expressing facts about people , and the Organization ontology , for describing organizations , and a persons relationship to and role in an organization .']

sentences: [u'Identity resolution capability for social networking profiles is important for a range of purposes , from open-source intelligence applications to forming semantic web connections .', u'Yet replication of research in this area is hampered by the lack of access to ground-truth data linking the identities of profiles from different networks .', u'Almost all data sources previously used by researchers are no longer available , and historic datasets are both of decreasing relevance to the modern social networking landscape and ethically troublesome regarding the preservation and publication of personal data .', u'We present and evaluate a method which provides researchers in identity resolution with easy access to a realistically-challenging labelled dataset of online profiles , drawing on four of the currently largest and most influential online social networks .', u'We validate the comparability of samples drawn through this method and discuss the implications of this mechanism for researchers as well as potential alternatives and extensions .']

sentences: [u'Web mining is used to automatically discover and extract information from Web-related data sources such as documents , log , services , and user profiles .', u'Although standard data mining methods may be applied for mining on the Web , many specific algorithms need to be developed and applied for various purposes of Web based information processing in multiple Web resources , effectively and efficiently .', u'In the paper , we propose an abstract Web mining model for extracting approximate concepts hidden in user profiles on the semantic Web .', u'The abstract Web mining model represents knowledge on user profiles by using an ontology which consists of both part-of and is-a relations .', u'We also describe the details of using the abstract Web mining model for information gathering .', u'In this application , classes of the ontology are represented as subsets of a list of keywords .', u'An efficient filtering algorithm is also developed to filter out most non-relevant inputs .']

entities: [[(u'semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'automatic semantic annotation', u'Task')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'semantic annotation of Chinese Web pages', u'Task'), (u'domain ontology', u'Method')], [(u'statistical method', u'Method'), (u'natural language processing technology', u'Method')], [(u'mapping', u'Task'), (u'RDF representations', u'Method'), (u'identification phase', u'Task'), (u'grouping phase', u'Task')], [(u'domain lexicon', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'statistical method', u'Method'), (u'linguistic ontology', u'Method'), (u'external domain knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'explicit property type tagging algorithm', u'Method'), (u'relation extraction', u'Task'), (u'dependency trees', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF statements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'dependency relationship', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Chinese words', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic annotation of Chinese Web pages')], [(u'statistical method', u'CONJUNCTION', u'natural language processing technology')], [(u'RDF representations', u'USED-FOR', u'mapping'), (u'identification phase', u'CONJUNCTION', u'grouping phase')], [], []]
sentences: [u'To fulfill the vision of the semantic Web , we need a method of automatic semantic annotation .', u'This paper has proposed a methodology for semantic annotation of Chinese Web pages , which is guided by domain ontology .', u'The statistical method and the natural language processing technology have been employed .', u'The mapping from sentences to RDF representations has been realized through the identification phase and the grouping phase .', u'The major technical contributions are : the domain lexicon constructed by the statistical method rather than the linguistic ontology has been used as the external domain knowledge ; the explicit property type tagging algorithm has been used to recognize both instances and properties of sentences to facilitate relation extraction ; after building dependency trees of sentences , the identified instances and properties can be grouped into RDF statements according to the dependency relationship among Chinese words .', u'The experimental result shows that this method is effective .']

relations: [[], [(u'Petri net tools', u'USED-FOR', u'model interchange mechanisms')], [], [], [(u'UML', u'USED-FOR', u'Petri net ontology'), (u'UML', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Protege tool'), (u'Protege tool', u'USED-FOR', u'Petri net ontology'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL')], [(u'Petri net software tool', u'USED-FOR', u'Petri net ontology compliant models'), (u'DaNAMiCS', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Petri net tools'), (u'DaNAMiCS', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Petri Net Kernel'), (u'Petri Net Kernel', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Petri net tools')], [(u'RDF-annotated ontology-based Petri net learning materials', u'USED-FOR', u'educational web application')]]
sentences: [u'The paper presents a Petri net infrastructure that should allow sharing Petri nets on the Semantic Web .', u'Previous solutions only provide model interchange mechanisms between Petri net tools .', u'The Petri net ontology is a central part of our solution .', u'The ontology is closely related to the Petri Net Markup Language ( PNML ) - an ongoing Petri net community sharing effort .', u'We developed the Petri net ontology using both UML and the Protege tool , whereas we use RDF and OWL to represent the ontology .', u'We implemented a Petri net software tool - P3 - that can be used to convert the Petri net ontology compliant models to the formats of current Petri net tools ( e.g. , DaNAMiCS , Petri Net Kernel , PIPE ) using eXtensible Stylesheet Language Transformations ( XSLT ) .', u'In order to show how the ontology can be used , we developed a simple educational web application that uses RDF-annotated ontology-based Petri net learning materials .']

entities: [[(u'agent communication languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'communication', u'Task'), (u'mental states of agents', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'agent middleware', u'Method'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'agent communication theory', u'Method'), (u'logic', u'Generic')], [(u'language', u'Generic'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'modal and description logics', u'Method')], [(u'description logic foundation', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'ontology definition language', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web', u'Material')], [(u'sound and complete decision algorithm', u'Method'), (u'reasoning services', u'Method')], [(u'multi-agent development framework', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [(u'agent middleware', u'USED-FOR', u'semantics')], [], [(u'modal and description logics', u'USED-FOR', u'it')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology definition language')], [(u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'agents')], [(u'reasoning services', u'USED-FOR', u'logic')], []]
sentences: [u'Abstract : Current standards on agent communication languages explain communication by changes in the mental states of agents .', u'It is rather a striking issue that none of the popular agent middleware adheres to this semantics in a formal way .', u"Therefore , this paper tries to close the gap between agent communication theory and practice by implementing a logic that is capable of representing agents ' beliefs and intentions .", u'An interesting property of this language , named , is that it is a hybrid of modal and description logics .', u'Due to its description logic foundation , it can also be used as an ontology definition language .', u'Thus , it is well suited for agents working on the semantic web .', u'In this paper , a sound and complete decision algorithm as well as other reasoning services for the logic are presented .', u'Finally , the application of the language in a multi-agent development framework is discussed .']

entities: [[(u'Web services', u'Task'), (u'academia', u'Material')], [(u'technology', u'Generic'), (u'SemanticWeb', u'Material')], [(u'Web services', u'Task'), (u'case studies', u'Material'), (u'Web services', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'semantically annotated commercial and governmental Web services', u'Task')], [(u'commercial and governmental Web services', u'Task')], [(u'semantic integration of Web services', u'Task')], [(u'Web services', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'SemanticWeb', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'frameworks')], [(u'Semantic Web context', u'FEATURE-OF', u'Web services')], [], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Recently the field of Web services has gained focus both in industry and academia .', u'While industry has been mostly interested in standardisation and promotion of the technology , academia has been looking for ways to fit the technology into other frameworks , such as the SemanticWeb .', u'Anyway , despite of the increased academic and commercial interest to Web services , there are currently only few case studies available about Web services in the Semantic Web context .', u'Moreover , according to authors knowledge , there is no publicly available study analysing which data is currently mostly provided/required by Web services .', u'In this paper we target these shortcomings by providing a case study of semantically annotated commercial and governmental Web services .', u'We analyse interaction and potential synergy between commercial and governmental Web services .', u'Also the role ontologies for semantic integration of Web services is analysed .', u'Moreover , we identify the most common data exploited by current Web services .']

entities: [[(u'e-government', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'e-government service provision', u'Task'), (u'administrative processes', u'Method'), (u'regulating processes', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic')], [(u'governmental regulating processes', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web languages', u'Material'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'Material')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'descriptive facilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic representation of arbitrary axioms', u'Method'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'regulatory knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Knowledge Management ( KM ) system', u'Method')], [(u'They', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'e-government service provision', u'CONJUNCTION', u'administrative processes'), (u'administrative processes', u'CONJUNCTION', u'regulating processes')], [], [(u'RDF', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web languages'), (u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL'), (u'OWL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Semantic Web languages')], [(u'rules', u'CONJUNCTION', u'constraints')], [], []]
sentences: [u'In the domain of e-government , knowledge plays an important role in enhancing the effectiveness of e-government service provision , administrative processes and regulating processes .', u'It comprises four kinds : terminological ( or ontological ) , factual , empirical and regulatory .', u'With an emphasis on governmental regulating processes , this paper proposes a framework for the modelling and management of as well as reasoning with these four types of knowledge by means of prominent Semantic Web languages , namely RDF and OWL .', u'Moreover , the framework provides additional descriptive facilities on top of such languages by employment of XML Declarative Description ( XDD ) theory ; hence , enabling semantic representation of arbitrary axioms , rules and constraints the key components in regulatory knowledge .', u'Examples from a prototype of a Knowledge Management ( KM ) system for the regulating process of the Securities and Exchange Commission of Thailand are presented .', u'They can also be applied to other regulatory agencies .']

entities: [[(u'conception rank based algorithm', u'Method'), (u'semantic Web', u'Material'), (u'synonymous words matching algorithm', u'Method'), (u'string matching', u'Method'), (u'conception structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'conception ranks', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'weighted linguistically matching degree', u'Metric'), (u'conception matching degree', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'accuracy', u'Metric'), (u'semantic matching', u'Task'), (u'structure coefficient', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'matching degree', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'synonymous words matching algorithm', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'conception rank based algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic Web'), (u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic matching')]]
sentences: [u'A conception rank based algorithm for semantic Web is presented to improve the low efficiency and poor precision of the synonymous words matching algorithm and the string matching algorithm.For an ontology with large amount of conception , the conception structure of the ontology is constructed by the algorithm based on the relationship among conceptions.Then the algorithm calculates the contribution for each conception such that the general conception has low contribution and the special conception has high contribution , and then the contributions are quantified into conception ranks.The resulting conception ranks are used as weights and the weighted linguistically matching degree is used to calculate a new conception matching degree in semantic matching.The new matching degree can improve the accuracy of semantic matching because the structure coefficient is taken into account.Experiments show that the matching degree can be increased by 20 % compared with the synonymous words matching algorithm .']

entities: [[(u'information overload', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'systems', u'Generic')], [(u'Tourist Information System', u'Method')], [(u'Personalized , Location-Aware Tourist Information System', u'Method'), (u'personal data', u'Material'), (u'social network profiles', u'Material'), (u'destination data', u'Material'), (u'online sources', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Method')], [(u'Bayesian Network', u'Method')], [(u'interactive map', u'Material')]]
sentences: [u'Tourist Information Systems ( TIS ) provide recommendations and help users avoid information overload while planning their trip .', u"In an effort to provide better results , most systems categorize users indiscreetly into pre-determined groups without considering users ' complex preferences , resulting to suggestions that miss uniqueness and adaptation to users needs .", u"We present a Tourist Information System that matches users ' preferences to the places they wish to visit in a more personalized and integrated way , combining modern aspects and widely adopted technologies .", u"More specifically , the proposed Personalized , Location-Aware Tourist Information System ( PLATIS ) collects personal data from users ' social network profiles and destination data from several online sources and conceptualizes this information into corresponding ontologies with the help of Semantic Web .", u'A Bayesian Network is used to match the ontologies and calculate the most probable recommendations .', u'The final results are gathered and presented dynamically to an interactive map .']

entities: [[(u'Web', u'Material'), (u'social interaction', u'Material')], [(u'microblogging', u'Method'), (u'Twitter', u'Material'), (u'Identica', u'Material'), (u'Google Buzz', u'Material')], [(u'interaction pattern', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'structured knowledge representations', u'Method')], [(u'syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'triple-like statements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Twitter messages', u'Material'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query expansion', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'prototype implementation', u'Method')], [(u'RDF graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Semantic Web data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Twitter', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Identica'), (u'Identica', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Google Buzz')], [], [], [(u'Semantic Web data', u'USED-FOR', u'RDF graphs')]]
sentences: [u'A recent trend in the evolution of the Web is the massive contribution of small chunks of content by regular users , typically in combination with mechanisms for fostering social interaction .', u'Such is often referred to as microblogging , with Twitter , Identica , and Google Buzz being the most widely known services .', u'In this paper , we propose to use the underlying interaction pattern , and existing respective services , for the collaborative construction and maintenance of structured knowledge representations .', u'We define ( 1 ) a syntax for embedding triple-like statements in Twitter messages , ( 2 ) develop a transformation into RDF , ( 3 ) suggest mechanisms for controlling the inclusion of such statements made by other users , ( 4 ) exploit the resulting graph for query expansion , and thereby provide a direct incentive for users to adopt our syntax ; and ( 5 ) demonstrate the approach by means of a prototype implementation .', u'The resulting RDF graphs can be combined easily with other Semantic Web data .']

entities: [[(u'Web legal information retrieval systems', u'Task'), (u'legal ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic content', u'Material'), (u'legal documents', u'Material')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'NLP techniques', u'Method'), (u'legal ontology', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'OWL semantic web language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'logic programming framework', u'Method'), (u'EVOLP+ISCO', u'Method'), (u'semantic content', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ISCO', u'Method'), (u'declarative , object-oriented and constraint-based programming techniques', u'Method')], [(u'EVOLP', u'Method'), (u'dynamic logic programming framework', u'Method'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'actions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'events', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'methodology', u'Generic'), (u'legal web information retrieval system', u'Method'), (u'Portuguese Attorney Generals Oce', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'legal documents', u'FEATURE-OF', u'semantic content')], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'legal ontology'), (u'NLP techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'legal ontology')], [(u'it', u'PART-OF', u'logic programming framework'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic content'), (u'EVOLP+ISCO', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'logic programming framework')], [], [(u'EVOLP', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'dynamic logic programming framework'), (u'actions', u'CONJUNCTION', u'events')], [(u'methodology', u'USED-FOR', u'legal web information retrieval system')]]
sentences: [u'Web legal information retrieval systems need the capability to reason with the knowledge modelled by legal ontologies .', u'Using this knowledge it is possible to represent and to make inferences about the semantic content of legal documents .', u'In this paper a methodology for applying NLP techniques to automatically create a legal ontology is proposed .', u'The ontology is dened in the OWL semantic web language and it is used in a logic programming framework , EVOLP+ISCO , to allow users to query the semantic content of the documents .', u'ISCO allows an easy and ecien t integration of declarative , object-oriented and constraint-based programming techniques with the capability to create connections with external databases .', u'EVOLP is a dynamic logic programming framework allowing the denition of rules for actions and events .', u'An application of the proposed methodology to the legal web information retrieval system of the Portuguese Attorney Generals Oce is described .']
