relations: [[], [(u'federated platforms', u'PART-OF', u'Future Internet')], [(u'federative operations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'information exchanges'), (u'information exchanges', u'CONJUNCTION', u'service support')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'information model'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'federating virtual infrastructures'), (u'information model', u'USED-FOR', u'federating virtual infrastructures')], [(u'context-awareness', u'FEATURE-OF', u'semantic resource descriptions'), (u'context-awareness', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web descriptions')], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'computer networks'), (u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'network monitoring'), (u'NDL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontologies'), (u'NDL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'MOMENT')], [(u'concrete use-case', u'USED-FOR', u'Information and Data models'), (u'PlanetLab', u'CONJUNCTION', u'FEDERICA')]]
sentences: [u'Users of the Future Internet will expect seamless and secure access to virtual resources distributed across multiple domains .', u'These federated platforms are the core of the Future Internet .', u'It is clear that information models , and concrete implementation in data models , are necessary prerequisites for all federative operations , information exchanges , and service support .', u'This position paper describes our approach to the development of an information model for federating virtual infrastructures .', u'Our basic assumption is that semantic resource descriptions with context-awareness , in the form of Semantic Web descriptions , better support services in federated platforms .', u'We use our experiences in the development of two ontologies for computer networks and for network monitoring , NDL and MOMENT , to support and guide our development .', u'The requirements of our envisaged Information and Data models are driven from a concrete use-case , using PlanetLab and FEDERICA as examples of virtualized platforms in a Future Internet federated environment .']

entities: [[(u'semantic Web and Web services technologies', u'Method'), (u'intelligent Web applications', u'Task')], [(u'technologies', u'Generic'), (u'Web services', u'Task'), (u'semantic definitions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web services based application', u'Task')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'OWL-S', u'Method'), (u'service groundings', u'Task'), (u'mapping processes', u'Method'), (u'function calls', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'agent communication languages', u'Material')], [(u'agent communication language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'FIPA-ACL', u'Method'), (u'FIPA-SL', u'Method'), (u'intelligent physical agents', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL based representations', u'Method'), (u'Web services environment', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic Web and Web services technologies', u'USED-FOR', u'intelligent Web applications')], [], [(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'service groundings'), (u'mapping processes', u'USED-FOR', u'service groundings'), (u'mapping processes', u'USED-FOR', u'function calls')], [(u'FIPA-ACL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'agent communication language'), (u'FIPA-ACL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'FIPA-SL'), (u'FIPA-SL', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'agent communication language'), (u'FIPA-SL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'associated standards'), (u'OWL based representations', u'USED-FOR', u'Web services environment')]]
sentences: [u'The integration of semantic Web and Web services technologies promises to be one of the most promising new areas for development of intelligent Web applications .', u'One challenging area where these technologies meet is in explicit definitions of meaning for the messages exchanged between Web services - in other words , semantic definitions of the meanings of data / commands exchanged in the execution of a Web services based application .', u'While current approaches such as OWL-S tackle these elements in service groundings by mapping processes to function calls with specific arguments , agent communication languages could provide a potentially richer alternative .', u'The work presented here shows how this could be done by mapping the existing agent communication language ( FIPA-ACL , FIPA-SL and associated standards developed by the foundation for intelligent physical agents ) into OWL based representations which may then be readily used in a Web services environment .']

entities: [[(u'hybrid method', u'Method'), (u'content based visual information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'shape analysis of objects', u'Task'), (u'image', u'Material'), (u'automatic indexing', u'Task'), (u'textual descriptions', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'semantic Web approaches', u'Method'), (u'visual information description', u'Task'), (u'low-level image characteristics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'user-oriented textual queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'image characteristics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'matching analysis', u'Task')], [(u'user queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'shape convergence star field', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'two-segment turning functions', u'Method'), (u'them', u'Generic'), (u'machine-understandable semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'Image Retrieval', u'Task'), (u'Ontological Description of Shapes ) system', u'Method'), (u'image-restricted domains', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'hybrid method', u'USED-FOR', u'content based visual information retrieval'), (u'textual descriptions', u'USED-FOR', u'automatic indexing')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'visual information description'), (u'semantic Web approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'method'), (u'semantic Web approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'visual information description'), (u'low-level image characteristics', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic Web approaches')], [], [(u'shape convergence star field', u'CONJUNCTION', u'two-segment turning functions')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'Image Retrieval'), (u'Ontological Description of Shapes ) system', u'USED-FOR', u'Image Retrieval')]]
sentences: [u'This paper presents a novel hybrid method for content based visual information retrieval ( CBIR ) that combines shape analysis of objects in image with their automatic indexing by textual descriptions .', u'The principal goal of proposed method is the applying semantic Web approaches for visual information description in systems which use the low-level image characteristics .', u'In the proposed method the user-oriented textual queries are converted to image characteristics which are used for visual information seeking and matching analysis .', u'A decision about similarity between a retrieved image and user queries is taken by computing the shape convergence star field or two-segment turning functions combining them with matching of ontological annotations of objects in image providing in this way the machine-understandable semantics .', u'For analysis of proposed method the image retrieval IRONS ( Image Retrieval by Ontological Description of Shapes ) system has been designed and evaluated in some specific image-restricted domains']

entities: [[(u'todays fluctuating markets', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'virtual enterprise ( VE ) concept', u'Method')], [(u'VE', u'Method')], [(u'framework', u'Generic')], [(u'distributed manufacturing', u'Method'), (u'web service framework', u'Method'), (u'activity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information flow diagrams', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'process-capability models', u'Method'), (u'ontology definition language', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'stochastic discrete-event simulation', u'Method'), (u'model', u'Generic'), (u'resource and process models', u'Method'), (u'nonlinear process plans', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'prototype system', u'Generic'), (u'interoperable collaboration', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'To cope with todays fluctuating markets , a virtual enterprise ( VE ) concept can be employed to achieve the cooperation among independently operating enterprises .', u'The success of VE depends on reliable interoperation among trading partners .', u'This paper describes a framework based on semantic web of manufacturing and simulation services to enable business and engineering collaborations between VE partners , particularly a design house and manufacturing suppliers .', u'To this end , we first give an overview of distributed manufacturing in the web service framework , including detailed activity and information flow diagrams .', u'Second , we propose an ontological definition of resource models and process-capability models using an ontology definition language .', u'Third , we propose a method based on stochastic discrete-event simulation , whose model is automatically generated from the resource and process models , to evaluate highly nonlinear process plans .', u'Finally , we present a prototype system to demonstrate an interoperable collaboration using semantic webs.Copyright 2005 by ASME']

sentences: [u'There are more and more xml document , web services , feeds and so on and so forth cheap , network accessible resources to use .', u'As one of the most widely used semantic web project , FOAF ( Friend of a Friend ) pays more and more attention to FOAF semantic features to analyze users interest and to recommend to FOAF users recent years .', u'This essay focuses on applying FOAF to a latest online television programs recommendation system for a particular user .', u'In this paper television programs come from various online video web sites that a user has registered in are watched at different time .', u'The article describes the approach to such services based on HMM ( Hidden Markov Model ) and FOAF project .', u'In order to protect the users privacy when providing services , this system is designed as a local-service desktop model .', u'We conduct experiments to illustrate users high degree of satisfaction to our techniques .']

entities: [[(u'Touristsimage perception of tourism destination', u'Task'), (u'content analysis', u'Task'), (u'network text', u'Material'), (u'content analysis method', u'Method'), (u'word frequency analysis', u'Method'), (u'emotional analysis technology', u'Method'), (u'cultural feature destination', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ancient town', u'Material'), (u'ethnic culture', u'Material'), (u'food shopping.Positive emotion', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'long-tail distribution.Text semantic network', u'Method'), (u'ring structure', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'content analysis method', u'USED-FOR', u'Touristsimage perception of tourism destination'), (u'content analysis method', u'USED-FOR', u'content analysis'), (u'content analysis method', u'USED-FOR', u'food shopping.Positive emotion'), (u'word frequency analysis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'emotional analysis technology'), (u'word frequency analysis', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ethnic culture'), (u'ancient town', u'CONJUNCTION', u'ethnic culture'), (u'ethnic culture', u'CONJUNCTION', u'leisure and entertainment'), (u'leisure and entertainment', u'CONJUNCTION', u'emotional analysis technology'), (u'leisure and entertainment', u'CONJUNCTION', u'food shopping.Positive emotion')]]
sentences: [u"Touristsimage perception of tourism destination on Web is a research hotspot , but in China mainland it is very necessary to perfect research method of content analysis and to carry out case study of different area.Taking the example of Fenghuang Ancient Town in middle China , based on network text , using the content analysis method of word frequency analysis , semantic web , emotional analysis technology , this paper presented analyzes touristsperception characteristics of destination image of the town.Results show that touristsperception of overall image is that it is a cultural feature destination , which couples with image promoted by local management organization.Cognitive component of destination image includes four subjects : ancient town , ethnic culture , leisure and entertainment , and food shopping.Positive emotion dominates in emotional components.Analysis of high frequency word shows that it has a long-tail distribution.Text semantic network with three ring structure of `` core-subcore-periphery '' characterizes the whole configuration of tourist attractions ."]

entities: [[(u'OWLWeb Ontology Language', u'Material'), (u'expressive limitations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Horn clause rules extension', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'Method')], [(u'ORL', u'Method'), (u'OWL', u'Method'), (u'ORL rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'abstract syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL DL', u'Method'), (u'ORL rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWLDL model-theoretic semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ORL rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'XML syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL XML presentation syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'ORL rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF graphs', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'OWL RDF/XML exchange syntax', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ORL', u'Method'), (u'ontology consistency problem', u'Task'), (u'ORLusage', u'Method'), (u'ORL', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'OWL', u'USED-FOR', u'ORL'), (u'OWL', u'USED-FOR', u'ORL rules'), (u'abstract syntax', u'USED-FOR', u'ORL rules'), (u'OWL DL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWLLite')], [(u'reasoning support', u'USED-FOR', u'ORL')]]
sentences: [u'Although the OWLWeb Ontology Language adds considerable expressive power to the Semantic Web it does have expressive limitations , particularly with respect to what can be said about properties .', u'Wepresent ORL ( OWL Rules Language ) , a Horn clause rules extension to OWL that overcomes many of these limitations .', u'ORL extends OWL in a syntactically and semantically coherent manner : the basic syntax for ORL rules is an extension of the abstract syntax for OWL DL and OWLLite ; ORL rules are given formal meaning via an extension of the OWLDL model-theoretic semantics ; ORL rules are given an XML syntax basedon the OWL XML presentation syntax ; and a mapping from ORL rules to RDF graphs is given based on the OWL RDF/XML exchange syntax .', u'Wediscuss the expressive power of ORL , showing that the ontology consistency problem is undecidable , provide several examples of ORLusage , and discuss how reasoning support for ORL might be provided .']

entities: [[(u'ontology', u'Task'), (u'knowledge representation', u'Method')], [(u'aSPOCMS', u'Method'), (u'Paperless Office Content Management System', u'Task'), (u'university ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'aSPOCMS', u'Method')], [(u'paperless environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'university knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'university ontology', u'Method')], [(u'Generalized structure of Indian universities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'workflow processes', u'Method'), (u'ontology development', u'Task'), (u'class hierarchy', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'graphical view of ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'univer sity ontology', u'Method'), (u'intelligent query', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'In these days , ontology is the most popular and widespread formalism of knowledge representation .', u'With the requirement of our system aSPOCMS ( An Agent-based Semantic Web for Paperless Office Content Management System ) , we present the construction of university ontology to retrieve the information and accomplish the proc ess of files of various sections by using the predefined w orkflow in university ontology .', u'The aSPOCMS aims to provide the facility to manage and process the files/documents of various departments and sections of higher educational inst itutions ( i.e .', u'universities ) in paperless environment .', u'This paper reveals the conceptualization of university knowledge through construction of university ontology .', u'Generalized structure of Indian universities and workflow processes have been taken for ontology development by describing the class hierarchy , and demonstrate the graphical view of ontology .', u'We also demonstrate the ability of univer sity ontology to execute intelligent query to retrieve t he information .']

entities: [[(u'Linked open data tools', u'Method'), (u'BnF data', u'Material')], [(u'it', u'Generic')], [(u'archival purposes', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'rich RDF ontologies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'light HTML embedded data', u'Material'), (u'schema.org', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'Linked open data tools have been implemented through data.bnf.fr , a project which aims at making the BnF data more useful on the Web.data.bnf.fr gathers data automatically from different databases on pages about authors , works and themes .', u'Online since July 2011 , it is still under development and has feedbacks from several users , already .', u'First the article will present the issues linked to our data and stress the impor- tance of useful links and of persistency for archival purposes .', u'We will discuss our solution and methodology , showing their strengths and weaknesses , to create new services for the library .', u"An insight on the ontology and vocabularies will be given , with a `` business '' view of the interaction between rich RDF ontologies and light HTML embedded data such as schema.org .", u'The broader question of Libraries on the Semantic Web will be addressed so as to help specify similar projects .']

relations: [[], [(u'language', u'CONJUNCTION', u'modelling'), (u'modelling', u'CONJUNCTION', u'systems'), (u'modelling', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'contexts'), (u'Grid', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'contexts'), (u'Grid', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic Web'), (u'semantic Web', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'contexts')], [(u'graphical tool', u'USED-FOR', u'authoring workflows')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Workflows have an increasing role in scientific applications programming and business environment development because they are an effective technology to define composition of different pieces of knowledge , both in the application domain and in the business context .', u'However , workflows are addressed in a number of different perspectives and no consensus has been reached yet on the language , modelling , and systems , to adopt in advanced contexts like Grid or semantic Web .', u'In this paper , we describe a graphical tool for supporting different kinds of users in authoring workflows running on next generation Grids .', u'The tool , named Semantic Workflow Programming Tool , is based on a reference workflow model that has been developed to provide advanced functionality with respect to the currently available workflow description .', u'Design and functionality of the tool resulted from requirements and scenarios emerged in the EU funded NextGRID project , in whose context the tool is developed .']

entities: [[(u'computer system resilience', u'Task'), (u'dependability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'security', u'Task')], [(u'publication repositories', u'Material')], [(u'RKB technology', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'semantic web techniques', u'Method')], [(u'RKB', u'Method'), (u'Resilience-Explicit Computing', u'Task'), (u'metadata-based mechanism descriptions', u'Method')], [(u'RKB Explorer', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'dependability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'security'), (u'partly-overlapping communities', u'CONJUNCTION', u'partly-overlapping communities')], [], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'Research on computer system resilience , indeed on dependability and security generally , suffers from fragmentation into numerous partly-overlapping communities , and inconsistencies in terminology .', u'As a partial response to this situation , we report on the development and use of a Resilience Knowledge Base ( RKB ) which currently contains over 60 million information items drawn from publication repositories and funding agencies worldwide .', u'We describe the RKB technology , showing how it can support exploration of the research space using semantic web techniques to ameliorate difficulties caused by differences in terminology .', u'We discuss the potential for the RKB to support Resilience-Explicit Computing , in which the decision to select a tool or configure a component from among alternatives is supported using metadata-based mechanism descriptions .', u'The RKB Explorer can identify indirect but potentially significant inter-relationships not only between people , between these and information about tools , components and training materials .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'construction industry', u'Task'), (u'intelligent knowledge management systems', u'Method')], [(u'systems', u'Generic'), (u'decisions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [(u'Existing representations', u'Generic'), (u'classification systems', u'Method'), (u'product data models', u'Method'), (u'concept semanticsa fundamental requirement', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'human-based exchange of knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'domain taxonomy', u'Method')], [(u'taxonomy', u'Generic'), (u'domain ontology', u'Task'), (u'construction', u'Task')], [(u'taxonomy', u'Generic'), (u'classification systems', u'Method'), (u'BS6100', u'Material'), (u'Master Format', u'Method'), (u'UniClass', u'Method')], [(u'taxonomy', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'With the advancement of the semantic web , the construction industry is at a stage where intelligent knowledge management systems can be used .', u'Such systems support more effective collaboration , where virtual teams of skilled users , not software , exchange ideas , decisions , and best practice .', u'To achieve that , there is a need to create consistent semantic representation of construction knowledge .', u'Existing representations , in the form of classification systems and product data models , lack effective modeling of concept semanticsa fundamental requirement for human-based exchange of knowledge .', u'Toward this objective , this paper presents a domain taxonomy that was developed as part of the e-COGNOS project .', u'The taxonomy was developed as a first step in the establishment of domain ontology for construction .', u'The taxonomy was developed to be process-centered and to allow for utilization of already existing classification systems ( BS6100 , Master Format , and UniClass , for example ) .', u'The taxonomy uses seven major domains ...']

relations: [[(u'Smalltalk', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'dynamic languages'), (u'Smalltalk', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Lisp'), (u'Lisp', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'dynamic languages'), (u'Lisp', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Lisp'), (u'Lisp', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Self'), (u'Self', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'dynamic languages')], [(u'languages', u'CONJUNCTION', u'operating systems'), (u'languages', u'CONJUNCTION', u'applications'), (u'operating systems', u'CONJUNCTION', u'applications'), (u'operating systems', u'CONJUNCTION', u'databases'), (u'applications', u'CONJUNCTION', u'databases')], [(u"spreadsheet-style `` liveness ''", u'HYPONYM-OF', u'dynamic paradigm'), (u"spreadsheet-style `` liveness ''", u'CONJUNCTION', u'versioned execution'), (u"spreadsheet-style `` liveness ''", u'CONJUNCTION', u'transactions'), (u'versioned execution', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'dynamic paradigm'), (u'versioned execution', u'CONJUNCTION', u'transactions'), (u'versioned execution', u'CONJUNCTION', u'full incrementality'), (u'transactions', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'dynamic paradigm'), (u'transactions', u'CONJUNCTION', u'full incrementality'), (u'full incrementality', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'dynamic paradigm'), (u'development tools', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'components'), (u'development tools', u'CONJUNCTION', u'next-generation applications'), (u'next-generation applications', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web')], [(u'Observer', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'notification schemes')], [(u'Transactions', u'CONJUNCTION', u'versioning'), (u'granularity', u'CONJUNCTION', u'versioning')], []]
sentences: [u'domain/object is a new software environment in the tradition of dynamic languages like Smalltalk , Lisp and Self .', u'Like its predecessors , domain/object blurs the usual distinctions between tools , languages , operating systems , applications and databases .', u"domain/object also adds some interesting twists to the familiar dynamic paradigm , including spreadsheet-style `` liveness '' , versioned execution , transactions , full incrementality and transparency.domain/object is intended as a delivery platform for software that requires tight semantic integration between components , such as development tools and next-generation applications for the semantic web .", u'Incrementality and liveness obviate the need for standard notification schemes such as Observer , ensuring that data and programs are synchronised automatically .', u'Transactions and versioning allow the granularity and frequency of synchronisation to be adjusted to suit the particular application or user .', u'Transparency means that the full structure of the executing program is available for queries , suggesting a considerably more dynamic realisation of aspect-oriented programming .']

sentences: [u'The vision of the Semantic Web is to reduce manual discovery and usage of Web resources ( documents and services ) and to allow intelligent agents to automatically identify these Web resources , integrate them and execute them for achieving the intended goals of the user .', u'The composed Web service is represented as a workflow , called service flow .', u'This paper presents different types of compositional knowledge required for automatic Web service flow generation : operational ( syntactic ) , semantic and pragmatic knowledge .', u'Operational knowledge deals with the right output and input types for possible service composition , while semantic knowledge is domain-specific expert knowledge that governs the Web service compositionality .', u'In addition , pragmatic knowledge allows the contextual as well as common sense knowledge to constrain the Web service composition .', u'We show how to extend the current XML-based standards to represent the compositional knowledge or rules that play a role in service discovery and composition .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'machine readable data', u'Material')], [(u'RDF data', u'Material'), (u'object-oriented programming languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'data source', u'Material'), (u'SPARQL endpoint', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'published schema information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'integrated tool-chain', u'Method'), (u'creation of persistent data objects', u'Task')], [(u'LITEQ', u'Method'), (u'paradigm', u'Generic'), (u'RDF data sources', u'Material'), (u'programming languages', u'Material')], [(u'LITEQ', u'Method'), (u'Halstead metric', u'Metric')]]

sentences: [u'The Semantic Web is intended as a web of machine readable data where every data source can be the data provider for different kinds of applications .', u'However , due to a lack of support it is still cumbersome to work with RDF data in modern , object-oriented programming languages , in particular if the data source is only available through a SPARQL endpoint without further documentation or published schema information .', u'In this setting , it is desirable to have an integrated tool-chain that helps to understand the data source during development and supports the developer in the creation of persistent data objects .', u'To tackle these issues , we introduce LITEQ , a paradigm for integrating RDF data sources into programming languages and strongly typing the data .', u'Additionally , we report on two use cases and show that compared to existing approaches LITEQ performs competitively according to the Halstead metric .']

entities: [[(u'Web resources', u'Material'), (u'embedded intelligence', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'they', u'Generic'), (u'online services', u'Task'), (u'condition monitoring', u'Task'), (u'remote diagnostics', u'Task'), (u'maintenance', u'Task')], [(u'implementation framework', u'Method'), (u'Web services', u'Task')], [(u'Service Network', u'Method'), (u'internal and external agents platforms', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'heterogeneous mobile agents', u'Method'), (u'them', u'Generic')], [(u'mobile service component', u'Method'), (u'service responses', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'field devices local environment', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Service components', u'Method'), (u'online learning', u'Method')], [(u'Heterogeneous service components discovery', u'Method'), (u'semantic P2P search', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'Among traditional users of Web resources , industry has a growing set of smart industrial devices with embedded intelligence .', u'Just like humans , they need online services ( i.e. , for condition monitoring , remote diagnostics , maintenance , etc . ) .', u'In this paper , we present one possible implementation framework for such Web services .', u'Such services should be Semantic Web enabled and form a Service Network based on internal and external agents platforms , which can host heterogeneous mobile agents and coordinate them to perform needed tasks .', u'The concept of a mobile service component assumes not only exchanging queries and service responses , but also delivering and composition of a service provider .', u'Mobile service component carrier ( agent ) can move to a field devices local environment ( embedded agent platform ) and perform its activities locally .', u'Service components improve their performance through online learning and communication with other components .', u'Heterogeneous service components discovery is based on semantic P2P search .']

relations: [[], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning'), (u'SWRL rules', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL ontologies')], [(u'OWL DL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'SWRL rules')], [(u'computing T-invariants', u'USED-FOR', u'Rule inference')], [(u'rule inference', u'CONJUNCTION', u'T-invariants methods')], [], [(u'SWRL rule base', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL ontology')], [(u'SWRL', u'CONJUNCTION', u'OWL')]]
sentences: [u'Using rules in conjunction with ontologies is a major challenge for the Semantic Web .', u'This paper propose a novel approach for reasoning with SWRL rules and OWL ontologies based on Predicate Transition net ( PrT-net ) .', u'A feasible method for transforming OWL DL and SWRL rules into PrT-nets is presented .', u'Rule inference is modeled exactly via computing T-invariants of the PrT-net .', u'The main motivation of this work is to provide new insights for computation of T-invariants for rule inference in PrTnet models and to reveal analogies among rule inference and T-invariants methods in Petri net analysis .', u'A small example shows that all the domain knowledge , i.e .', u'the SWRL rule base and the OWL ontology , is required to obtain complete inferences .', u'It illustrates that a whole reasoning model must be provided to interoperate between SWRL and OWL , not only syntactically and semantically , but also inferentially .']

sentences: [u"Since similar-functioned web services are gradually increasing in Semantic Web of Things , it 's difficult for users to select services they need quickly and efficiently .", u'To solve this problem , this paper proposes a mono-service oriented selection method - Granular Computing Neural Network Service Selection ( GCNNSS ) , which combines Granular Computing with Back-propagation Artificial Neural Network ( BPANN ) .', u"Firstly , match users ' service request description with services in services repository to generate satisfying candidate services set .", u'Then , filter the original attribute set of candidate services by service graining , using the minimum attribute set algorithm to get minimum attribute set of original attribute set .', u'Finally , reorder the candidate service set by using the iterative learning method of BPANN and return the result to users .', u'According to the contrast research and simulation experiment , the proposed method GCNNSS is superior to other representative service selection methods in effectiveness and reliability .']

sentences: [u'RDB2RDF mapping has been a hot topic in the Semantic Web research community .', u'In order to standardize the mapping mechanism and then facilitate sharing and reuse of the mapping definitions , the W3C RDB2RDF Working Group published a general purpose RDB2RDF mapping language standard , R2RML , in September 2012 .', u'Several mapping tools or ongoing projects have been gradually supporting the R2RML standard .', u'But they rarely write up and report the design and implementation techniques for the mapping algorithms .', u'This paper presents the algorithm design of a prototype R2RML processor for materializing RDF view of relational data .', u'Experimental tests on the effectiveness and the run-time efficiency of the algorithm were conducted with the W3C-defined R2RML mapping test cases .', u'The experimental results show that the proposed RDB2RDF mapping approach is implementable with Java language , and the run-time of the algorithm exhibits a linear growth rate as the generated RDF triples size increases .']

sentences: [u'Purpose This paper seeks to describe the process used to develop the multimedia design and planning pyramid ( MUDPY ) ontology , and the role played by the MUDPY ontology as a planning , design and development tool in multimedia projects.Design/methodology/approach The MUDPY model was implemented for the semantic web by developing an ontology for it .', u'This ontology facilitates defining the concepts existing in that domain , their attributes and the relationships between them.Findings The MUDPY ontology can guide developers through the various phases of a multimedia project in a systematic fashion by allowing them to create a project proposal , specify the functional requirements , decide on the navigational structure and create a storyboard , and thus create highquality projects.Research limitations/implications The current system is a prototype .', u'This MUDPY ontology can be extended by adding more classes in order to increase its functionality ; for example , one can develop special plugin widgets to genera ...']

sentences: [u'This paper makes a step in identifying the state of the art in semantic P2P systems .', u'On one hand , lot of research in the P2P systems community has focused on fault-tolerance and scalability , resulting in numberous algorithms , systems such as Chord , Pastry and P-Grid .', u'These systems , however , have no notion of semantics and consequently , have difficulty in knowledge sharing .', u'On the other hand , research in the semantic web community have focused on knowledge sharing among different nodes with possibly different schemas .', u'These have tended to use centralized repositories .', u'The obvious benefits of combining P2P and semantic systems would be to have large scale collection of structured data .', u'Several recent efforts have focused on this combination .', u'However , there have been no attempt to have these efforts grouped in one place for easy assimilation and for finding interesting future directions ; this paper fills the gap .']

entities: [[(u'Web services technology', u'Method')], [(u'Web service discovery and composition', u'Task'), (u'online Web service repositories', u'Material'), (u'them', u'Generic')], [(u'repositories', u'Generic'), (u'software libraries', u'Method'), (u'they', u'Generic')], [(u'automatically deriving metadata', u'Task'), (u'Web service collections', u'Material')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'ontology learning', u'Task'), (u'mapping', u'Task'), (u'metadata based presentation', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'The success of the Web services technology has brought topicsas software reuse and discovery once again on the agenda of software engineers .', u'While there are several efforts towards automating Web service discovery and composition , many developers still search for services # R # # N # via online Web service repositories and then combine them manually .', u'However , from our analysis of these repositories , it yields that , unlike traditional software libraries , they rely on little metadata to support # R # # N # service discovery .', u'We believe that the major cause is the difficulty of automatically deriving metadata that would describe rapidly changing Web service collections .', u'In this paper , we discuss the major shortcomings of state of the art Web service repositories and , as a solution , we # R # # N # report on ongoing work and ideas on how to use techniques developed in the context of the Semantic Web ( ontology learning , mapping , metadata based presentation ) to improve the current situation .']

entities: [[(u'Semantic Web concept', u'Method')], [(u'metadata schemas', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'digital libraries', u'Material'), (u'collections', u'Material')], [(u'RDF based framework', u'Method')], [(u'SZTAKI', u'Method')], [(u'metadata schema registration', u'Task')], [(u'It', u'Generic')], [(u'service', u'Generic'), (u'metadata schemas', u'Method'), (u'public utility', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'data management', u'Task'), (u'data retrieval', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'The ability to semantically relate various data and metadata is a basic criterion of the Semantic Web concept .', u'The most obvious and most urgent subtask in this area is to share and align metadata schemas used in digital libraries , collections and databases .', u'As a result of international research activities , an RDF based framework is evolving which provides a common metadata schema definition format and the possibility to reuse existing schemas and schema elements .', u'The Department of Distributed Systems of MTA SZTAKI tries to introduce these results in Hungary .', u'Our open service provides metadata schema registration , overview of registered schemas and their interconnections .', u'It can also support the creation of new schemas using elements also from existing schemas .', u'Such service could facilitate the reuse and standardization of metadata schemas , which is of public utility , as it can make data management and data retrieval more economical .']

entities: [[(u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'semantic annotation', u'Method'), (u'construction and production of ontology', u'Task')], [(u'semantic annotation', u'Task'), (u'knowledge expressions', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'rule-based ontology instances', u'Task'), (u'semantic annotation', u'Method'), (u'web sites', u'Material')], [(u'manual process', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'keyword data', u'Material'), (u'extracted information', u'Material'), (u'rule information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'web documents', u'Material'), (u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'ontology instance generation', u'Task'), (u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'semantic annotation', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic web'), (u'semantic annotation', u'USED-FOR', u'construction and production of ontology')], [(u'semantic annotation', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge expressions'), (u'semantic annotation', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology instances')], [], [], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'keyword data'), (u'extracted information', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rule information'), (u'rule information', u'USED-FOR', u'method')], [(u'keywords', u'CONJUNCTION', u'rules')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'ontology instance generation')]]
sentences: [u'The success of semantic web depends largely on the semantic annotation which systematizes knowledge for the construction and production of ontology .', u'Therefore , the efficiency of semantic annotation is very important in order to change many knowledge expressions and generate into ontology instances .', u'In this paper , we presents a generation system of rule-based ontology instances which are produced accurately and efficiently via semantic annotation in conventional web sites .', u'In conventional studies , the manual process is necessary for finding relevant information , comparing it with ontology , and entering information .', u'We propose a new method that manages keyword data regarding extracted information and rule information separately .', u'Thus , it is quite practical to extract information efficiently from various web documents by adding a small number of keywords and rules .', u'The proposed method shows the possibility of ontology instance generation which reuses the rules and keywords from the various websites .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'Ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'annotating resources and reasoning'), (u'Ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'reasoning')], [], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'framework')], [], [], [(u'usability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'recommendation')]]
sentences: [u'Knowledge is one the most valuable assets in todays companies .', u'Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) techniques aim to represent the knowledge in a way that can be applied to solving complex problems or supporting decision making processes .', u'During the last years the semantic web techniques have supported the share of knowledge by means of ontologies .', u'Ontologies have been used for both annotating resources and reasoning .', u'Business Process Management is one of the specific fields in which the use of ontologies has been widely applied .', u'This paper presents SABUMO , a framework based on ontologies that allows experts to represent and share their knowledge with other experts by means of shared and controlled vocabularies .', u'The framework also allows the execution of business processes represented by experts .', u'The execution of this knowledge does not require the installation of complex AI programs .', u'Initial results of the evaluation setup show promising results both in usability and recommendation .']

sentences: [u'RuleML is considered to be a markup language for the semantic web .', u'It allows the enrichment of web ontologies by adding definitions of derived concepts and it enhances interoperability among different systems and tools by publishing rules in an XML format .', u'Moreover the in-creasing demand for interfaces that enhance information sharing has given rise to XML doc-uments that include embedded calls to web services .', u'In this paper we propose a variation of RuleML that is based on modular logic programming .', u'Our approach is based in a two level architecture .', u'In the first level a modular logic language , called M-log , is presented .', u'This lan-guage encompasses several mechanisms for invoking web services .', u'In the second level we ex-ploit the semantics of M-log to present a variation of RuleML with rich modeling capabilities .', u'Formal foundations for this variation are given through direct translation to M-log semantics .']

entities: [[(u'HTML', u'Material')], [(u'XML', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'information integration', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [], [], [(u'XML', u'Method'), (u'Electronic Data Interchange', u'Task')], [(u'managerial and technical challenges', u'Task')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The eXtensible Markup Language ( XML ) offers many important benefits and improvements over its predecessor , HTML .', u"But , articles have appeared about XML with exaggerated claims of it being a `` Rosetta Stone '' with `` miraculuous ways '' to almost automatically provide information integration .", u'These claims are actually being believed by some executives .', u'It is almost surprising that no one has claimed that XML can cure cancer and provide world peace !', u'In reality , XML must face many of the same challenges that plagued Electronic Data Interchange ( EDI ) and database integration efforts of the past .', u'To a large extent , there are both managerial and technical challenges - much related to the difficulties of attaining universally accepted semantically-rich standards .', u"In this paper , these challenges will be discussed with specific emphasis on the issue of dealing with a real-world with multiple `` contexts . ''", u"Some promising research directions , some overlapping with the `` semantic web '' effort , will be presented ."]

relations: [[(u'shared common knowledge base', u'USED-FOR', u'system interoperability')], [], [], [(u'Web documents', u'CONJUNCTION', u'folksonomies')], [], [(u'NLP techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'SW'), (u'information retrieval', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'document engineering application'), (u'information retrieval', u'USED-FOR', u'online medical resources'), (u'online medical resources', u'USED-FOR', u'document engineering application')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'multi-granular terminological resources'), (u'NLP techniques', u'USED-FOR', u'multi-granular terminological resources')]]
sentences: [u'The Semantic Web ( SW ) originally aims at studying a system interoperability based on a shared common knowledge base ( ontology ) .', u'Henceforth , the SW sets its heart on a semantic coordination of community parlance representative resources ( in complement to a common knowledge base shared by the users ) .', u'The matter is not only to use techniques to handle a large amount of data , but also to use approaches to keep the community parlance features .', u'Thus , Web documents and folksonomies are the main semantic vehicle .', u'They are little structured and Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) methods are then beneficial to analyze language specificities with a view to automating tasks about text .', u'This paper describes a use of NLP techniques for the SW through a document engineering application : the information retrieval in a catalogue of online medical resources .', u'Our approach emphasizes benefits of NLP techniques to handle multi-granular terminological resources .']

entities: [[(u'Personalization', u'Task')], [(u'personalized services', u'Task'), (u'user profiles', u'Material')], [(u'personalized services', u'Task')], [(u'user-centric personalization approach', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'user-centric user profile', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Ontology Web Language ( OWL-DL )', u'Method')], [(u'profile and privacy enhancement mechanism', u'Method'), (u'profile applicability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'user privacy', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'policy based approach', u'Method')], [(u'authorization policies', u'Method'), (u'policies', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Personalization is one of the key features of the future Internet .', u'However , the success of personalized services mostly relies on user profiles .', u'Therefore , a generic , shareable , and reusable user profile is crucial for service providers for the uptake of personalized services .', u'This paper proposes a user-centric personalization approach .', u'The core of this approach is a user-centric user profile where user is in the center and experience perceived control over his information .', u'We use Ontology Web Language ( OWL-DL ) to formally represent user relevant information in ontology .', u'We present profile and privacy enhancement mechanism to increase profile applicability and user privacy respectively .', u'The paper also offers a policy based approach to ensure authorized access of user profiles among third parties .', u'Furthermore , we formally represent authorization policies by exploiting Semantic Web Rule Language ( SWRL ) and evaluate policies by employing Semantic Query Enhanced Web Rule Language ( SQWRL ) .']

entities: [[(u'Model-based design methods', u'Method'), (u'model-based architectures', u'Method'), (u'WWW', u'Task')], [(u'semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'models', u'Generic'), (u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'search functionalities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'proximity ) measures', u'Method'), (u'search mechanism', u'Method')], [(u'semantic similarity evaluation engine', u'Method'), (u'Web-based applications', u'Task')], [(u'infrastructure', u'Generic'), (u'inferred ordering', u'Task'), (u'semantic closeness', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'engine', u'Generic'), (u'hybrid spread activation algorithm', u'Method'), (u'concept instances graph', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'Model-based design methods', u'CONJUNCTION', u'model-based architectures')], [], [(u'proximity ) measures', u'USED-FOR', u'search mechanism')], [(u'semantic similarity evaluation engine', u'USED-FOR', u'Web-based applications')], [], [(u'hybrid spread activation algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'engine'), (u'hybrid spread activation algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'concept instances graph')]]
sentences: [u'Model-based design methods , and model-based architectures , have gained adoption in authoring applications for the WWW .', u'This is further reinforced by the increasing visibility of the semantic Web , where models are intrinsic , described as metadata associated with the data made available to users and applications .', u'Several proposals attempt to leverage this additional information to improve search functionalities , by incorporating semantic similarity ( or proximity ) measures into the search mechanism .', u'In this paper we show how the availability of a semantic similarity evaluation engine can be used to enhance several functionalities of Web-based applications .', u'In particular we show how such an infrastructure can be used to detect and suggest new relation instances , as well as propose an inferred ordering for the presentation of related information that reflects the semantic closeness of the corresponding information .', u'The proposed engine is based on a hybrid spread activation algorithm applied to the concept instances graph .']

entities: [[(u'business reporting language', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pervasive computing processes', u'Method')], [(u'business reporting languages', u'Material'), (u'Extensible Business Reporting Language', u'Material'), (u'XBRL', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'XBRL', u'Method'), (u'XML technology', u'Method'), (u'globalised stakeholders', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'XBRL', u'Method'), (u'pervasive computing', u'Method'), (u'XBRL', u'Method'), (u'smart computing technologies', u'Method'), (u'financial requirements', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'pervasive computing productions', u'Method')], [(u'intelligent computing technologies', u'Method'), (u'semantic web', u'Method'), (u'XBRL', u'Method'), (u'XBRL', u'Method')]]

sentences: [u'This paper presents the first stage of our proposed research work , i.e. , integrating a business reporting language into pervasive computing processes and products .', u'In general , our first stage is to identify and review one of the key business reporting languages , namely , Extensible Business Reporting Language ( XBRL ) and discuss an integrating XBRL into pervasive computing fields .', u'XBRL is an emerging standard based on XML technology , particularly to streamline a diversification of financial information throughout the world for globalised stakeholders .', u'This paper gives an overview and discusses potential of using XBRL for pervasive computing , as well as strengthening XBRL using smart computing technologies , bridging gaps between financial requirements and pervasive computing productions .', u'Furthermore , current development of relevant intelligent computing technologies especially semantic web is investigated , identified and developed to assist XBRL for a more automated manner and to enhance usability of XBRL for both business users and pervasive computing researchers .']

entities: [[(u'eDonkey', u'Method'), (u'P2P file sharing software', u'Task')], [], [(u'searching method', u'Method'), (u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'semantic searching', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic-based study', u'Task'), (u'nature language processing field', u'Task')], [(u'eDonkey systems', u'Method')], [(u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'words', u'Generic'), (u'clustering analysis method', u'Method'), (u'other', u'Generic'), (u'similarity analysis method', u'Method')], [(u'clustering and similarity methods', u'Method')], [], [(u'semantic web', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'clusters', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'similarity', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'search engines', u'Task'), (u'P2P systems', u'Task')]]

sentences: [u'eDonkey has become the most reliable and popular P2P file sharing software with largest users .', u'But currently it is still a problem that how to find resources you need exactly and quickly .', u'The traditional searching method which is based on keywords can not fulfill the needs of people .', u'The effective and promising method is semantic searching .', u'Semantic-based study has become one of hot spots in the nature language processing field .', u'After collecting the sharing file names of eDonkey systems , we pay our attention on the analysis of words of file names .', u'We adopt two methods in the paper to character these words , one is the clustering analysis method and the other is similarity analysis method .', u'Through careful study some conclusions are drawn using clustering and similarity methods .', u'Words are successfully clustered into 5 groups .', u'Constructing the semantic web through clusters and similarity can be used in search engines in P2P systems .']

entities: [[(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'machine learning of denotational concept semantics', u'Task')], [(u'software agents', u'Method'), (u'real-world applications', u'Task'), (u'framework', u'Generic')], [(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'machine learning', u'Task'), (u'word sense', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'text corpora', u'Material'), (u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'interactive learning of concepts', u'Task'), (u'dialog of human and agent', u'Task'), (u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'Relational Reinforcement Learning', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'interactive acquisition of semantic categories', u'Task'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'Human-Computer Interaction', u'Task'), (u'interactive ) Information Retrieval', u'Task'), (u'Natural Language Processing', u'Task')]]
relations: [[(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'machine learning of denotational concept semantics')], [(u'software agents', u'CONJUNCTION', u'robots')], [(u'approaches', u'USED-FOR', u'machine learning'), (u'text corpora', u'USED-FOR', u'approaches')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Human-Computer Interaction'), (u'Human-Computer Interaction', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'applications'), (u'Human-Computer Interaction', u'CONJUNCTION', u'interactive ) Information Retrieval'), (u'interactive ) Information Retrieval', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'applications'), (u'interactive ) Information Retrieval', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Natural Language Processing'), (u'Natural Language Processing', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'applications')]]
sentences: [u'We present a framework for the machine learning of denotational concept semantics using a simple form of symbolic interaction of machines with human users .', u'The capability of software agents and robots to learn how to communicate verbally with human users would obviously be highly useful in several real-world applications , and our framework is meant to provide a further step towards this goal .', u'Whereas the large majority of existing approaches to the machine learning of word sense and other language aspects focuses on learning using text corpora , our framework allows for the interactive learning of concepts in a dialog of human and agent , using an approach in the area of Relational Reinforcement Learning .', u'Such an approach has a wide range of possible applications , e.g. , the interactive acquisition of semantic categories for the Semantic Web , Human-Computer Interaction , ( interactive ) Information Retrieval , and Natural Language Processing .']

relations: [[], [(u'registry', u'PART-OF', u'ebXML/R & R system')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'USED-FOR', u'registry classification information'), (u'ontology', u'PART-OF', u'registry classification information'), (u'registry classification model', u'USED-FOR', u'registry classification information')], [], [(u'ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'registry classification model')]]
sentences: [u'In Web service , one of the essential requirements in e-business is to classify and register the complex information .', u'How to describe the registry classification information and construct the registry classification model is a keystone of realizing complex information classification and registry in ebXML/R & R system .', u'Semantic Web is an important initiative in this respect , we introduce ontology into the description of registry classification information and describe registry classification information ontology with OWL , and then we retrieve a registry classification model ( RCM ) to manage the registry classification information specially , which is abstracted from ebXML/RIM .', u'Finally , an example of constructing the ebXML/R & R classification model based ontology is presented to illustrate the approach .', u'The study of registry classification model based on ontology has theoretic and practical significance for realizing the interoperability between ebXML/R & R and other information source R & R classification registry technology .']

sentences: [u"An increasing number of recent information retrieval systems make use of ontologies to help the users clarify their information needs and come up with semantic representations of documents A particular concern here is the integration of these semantic approaches with traditional search technology The research presented in this paper examines how ontologies can be efficiently applied to large-scale search systems for the web We describe how these systems can be enriched with adapted ontologies to provide both an in-depth understanding of the user 's needs as well as an easy integration with standard vector-space retrieval systems The ontology concepts are adapted to the domain terminology by computing a feature vector for each concept Later , the feature vectors are used to enrich a provided query The whole retrieval system is under development as part of a larger Semantic Web standardization project for the Norwegian oil & gas sector ."]

sentences: [u'The semantic web is based on ontologies and metadata that indexes resources using ontologies .', u'This indexing is called annotation .', u'Ontology based information retrieval is an operation that matches the relevance of an annotation or a user generated query against an ontology-based knowledge-base .', u'Typically systems utilising ontology-based knowledge-bases are semantic portals that provide search facilities over the annotations .', u'Handling large answer sets require effective methods to rank the search results based on relevance to the query or annotation .', u'A method for determining such relevance is a pre-requisite for effective ontology-based information retrieval .', u'This paper presents a method for determining relevance between two annotations .', u'The method considers essential features of domain ontologies and RDF ( S ) languages to support determining this relevance .', u'As a novel use case , the method was used to implement a knowledgebased recommendation system .', u'A user study showing promising results was conducted .']

entities: [[(u'Datalog+/-', u'Method'), (u'ontology languages', u'Material'), (u'high expressive power', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Datalog+/- languages', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web languages', u'Material')], [(u'weakly-sticky ( WS ) Datalog+/- programs', u'Method'), (u'rule bodies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'weakly-acyclic TGDs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'non-deterministic algorithms', u'Method'), (u'WS Datalog+/- programs', u'Task')], [(u'deterministic query answering algorithms', u'Method'), (u'WS Datalog+/-', u'Method')], [(u'bottom-up grounding algorithm', u'Method'), (u'query-driven chase', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'hybrid approach', u'Method'), (u'WS program', u'Method'), (u'query rewriting techniques', u'Method')], [(u'algorithms', u'Generic'), (u'query answering', u'Task'), (u'real-world scenarios', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Datalog+/-', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'ontology languages')], [(u'Datalog+/- languages', u'USED-FOR', u'Semantic Web languages')], [], [], [(u'WS Datalog+/-', u'USED-FOR', u'deterministic query answering algorithms')], [(u'query-driven chase', u'USED-FOR', u'bottom-up grounding algorithm'), (u'WS program', u'USED-FOR', u'hybrid approach')], [(u'algorithms', u'USED-FOR', u'query answering')]]
sentences: [u'Datalog+/- is a family of ontology languages that combine good computational properties with high expressive power .', u'Datalog+/- languages are provably able to capture the most relevant Semantic Web languages .', u'In this paper we consider the class of weakly-sticky ( WS ) Datalog+/- programs , which allow for certain useful forms of joins in rule bodies as well as extending the well-known class of weakly-acyclic TGDs .', u'So far , only non-deterministic algorithms were known for answering queries on WS Datalog+/- programs .', u'We present novel deterministic query answering algorithms under WS Datalog+/- .', u'In particular , we propose : ( 1 ) a bottom-up grounding algorithm based on a query-driven chase , and ( 2 ) a hybrid approach based on transforming a WS program into a so-called sticky one , for which query rewriting techniques are known .', u'We discuss how our algorithms can be optimized and effectively applied for query answering in real-world scenarios .']

sentences: [u'Purpose Knowledge capture from experts is important when that knowledge is of value , scarce , and threatened by loss , as is the case with the expected departure of baby boomers from the workforce .', u'This paper seeks to provide a theoretically grounded , practical methodology for initial knowledge capture and ongoing maintenance of this knowledge using Web 2.0 technologies.Design/methodology/approach The paper used a participatory action research project in which a methodology was developed for the capture of knowledge from experts in an organization experiencing both knowledge loss and rapid growth .', u'The methodology used simple , affordable technologies such as digital cameras and digital editors , Wikis with a semantic web and social tagging.Findings The paper was able to integrate an initial knowledge capture into an ongoing cycle of knowledge organizing , sharing and maintenance .', u'It was found that , whilst it is an economical and appropriate solution to problems of knowledge loss and knowledge shari ...']

entities: [[(u'home electronics devices', u'Method')], [], [], [(u'metadatabased content search', u'Method'), (u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'DLNA architecture', u'Method')], [(u'device', u'Generic'), (u'serviceenabling platform', u'Method'), (u'complexity', u'Metric'), (u'distributed content storage', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'metadata', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantics')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'With the multitude of home electronics devices available , it is becoming difficult for consumers to manage their digital content .', u'The Digital Living Network Alliance ( DLNA ) has specified an architecture that enables interoperability between the various devices and allows a user to enjoy the desired content .', u'However , in a typical home , users might store thousands of multimedia items across several devices and it is tedious to search every single device individually .', u'Additionally , in the case of a metadatabased content search , not all metadata or the semantics associated with it might be available , resulting in incomplete search results .', u'In this paper , we extend the DLNA architecture to address these problems .', u'We use a specialized device as a serviceenabling platform and also to hide the complexity of distributed content storage .', u'Furthermore , we use the Semantic Web to provide an enriched and more comprehensive metadata-based multimedia search experience .']

sentences: [u'Abstract : The fusing of information to provide a real-time situational awareness and common relevant operational picture of events both within and outside the battlespace requires the integration and use of heterogeneous civilian and military sources .', u'Knowledge fusion , also called information fusion and multisensor data fusion , names the body of techniques needed to accomplish this critical need of the U.S. Army .', u'The area builds upon and integrates results from a variety of fields , including multiagent systems , information integration , the semantic web , and the classical ( mathematically based , engineering in orientation ) fusion methodologies .', u'The goal of work in knowledge fusion is to intelligently fuse massive amounts of heterogeneous information ( not only from sensors , but also from databases , files , web pages , etc . )', u'into a form which may be used by humans to yield actionable knowledge .', u'This report surveys the literature relevant to the evolving field of knowledge fusion .']

entities: [[(u'approaches', u'Generic'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'formalism', u'Generic'), (u'Web Sources Global Ontology', u'Method'), (u'data meta-model', u'Method'), (u'description of Web sources', u'Task'), (u'query-processing capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'service and navigation information', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'WebSOGO', u'Method'), (u'Object-Oriented paradigm', u'Method'), (u'Unified Modeling Language ( UML )', u'Method')], [(u'WebSOGO-S', u'Method'), (u'multi-layered system', u'Method'), (u'Web sources', u'Material'), (u'WebSOGO catalog of source ontologies', u'Material')], [(u'UML specification', u'Method'), (u'WebSOGO', u'Method'), (u'Object-Relational ( OR ) model', u'Method'), (u'Oracle cartridge', u'Method'), (u'methods', u'Generic'), (u'SQL queries', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'WebSOGO catalog', u'Material')], [(u'JDBC and ODBC drivers', u'Method'), (u'Oracle', u'Method'), (u'WebSOGO-S', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'data meta-model', u'USED-FOR', u'description of Web sources'), (u'data meta-model', u'USED-FOR', u'Web sources'), (u'query-processing capabilities', u'CONJUNCTION', u'service and navigation information')], [(u'Unified Modeling Language ( UML )', u'USED-FOR', u'WebSOGO'), (u'Unified Modeling Language ( UML )', u'USED-FOR', u'Object-Oriented paradigm')], [(u'WebSOGO-S', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'multi-layered system'), (u'multi-layered system', u'USED-FOR', u'Web sources')], [(u'UML specification', u'USED-FOR', u'Object-Relational ( OR ) model')], []]
sentences: [u'Based on the limitations raised by existing approaches in the context of the Semantic Web , we propose a formalism , Web Sources Global Ontology ( WebSOGO ) , a data meta-model for the description of Web sources in terms of content , query-processing capabilities , service and navigation information .', u'WebSOGO is formalized in the Object-Oriented paradigm using the Unified Modeling Language ( UML ) .', u'We also describe WebSOGO-S , a multi-layered system that will allow agents to discover , execute and compose Web sources through queries against a WebSOGO catalog of source ontologies .', u'The UML specification of WebSOGO has been mapped to the Object-Relational ( OR ) model in Oracle ; we define an Oracle cartridge with a list of types and methods that allow the specification of SQL queries against the WebSOGO catalog .', u'By using the JDBC and ODBC drivers provided by Oracle , any agent or application will be able to contact WebSOGO-S .']

entities: [[(u'Web content nowadays', u'Method'), (u'Internet connected TVs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'products', u'Generic'), (u'online content', u'Material')], [(u'personal computers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web content', u'Material')], [(u'online content', u'Material'), (u'personal computers', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'mobile devices', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge graph based video generation system', u'Method'), (u'textual Web content', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'computer graphics based technologies', u'Method')], [(u'Wikipedia articles', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'opinion surveys', u'Material')], [(u'system', u'Generic'), (u'Web content', u'Material')]]

sentences: [u'Web content nowadays can also be accessed through new generation of Internet connected TVs .', u'However , these products failed to change users behavior when consuming online content .', u'Users still prefer personal computers to access Web content .', u'Certainly , most of the online content is still designed to be accessed by personal computers or mobile devices .', u'In order to overcome the usability problem of Web content consumption on TVs , this paper presents a knowledge graph based video generation system that automatically converts textual Web content into videos using semantic Web and computer graphics based technologies .', u'As a use case , Wikipedia articles are automatically converted into videos .', u'The effectiveness of the proposed system is validated empirically via opinion surveys .', u'Fifty percent of survey users indicated that they found generated videos enjoyable and 42 % of them indicated that they would like to use our system to consume Web content on their TVs .']

entities: [[(u'search engines', u'Method'), (u'spiders', u'Method'), (u'learning spiders', u'Task')], [(u'Semantic Web', u'Method'), (u'un- derstandable information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'accuracy', u'Metric'), (u'search engines', u'Method')], [(u'BioSpider', u'Method'), (u'agent-based simulation framework', u'Method')], [(u'BioSpider', u'Method'), (u'multi-variate ecosystem', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'ecosystem', u'Generic'), (u'cooperative spiders', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'communica- tion', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'learning skills', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'effi- ciency', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Genetic algorithms', u'Method'), (u'classifier rules', u'Method'), (u'spider adaptation', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic')]]

sentences: [u'Although search engines traditionally use spiders for traversing and indexing the web , there has not yet been any methodological attempt to model , deploy and test learning spiders .', u'The flourishing of the Semantic Web provides un- derstandable information that may improve the accuracy of search engines .', u'In this paper , we introduce BioSpider , an agent-based simulation framework for developing and test- ing autonomous , intelligent , semantically-focused web spi- ders .', u'BioSpider assumes a direct analogy of the problem at hand with a multi-variate ecosystem , where each mem- ber is self-maintaining .', u'The population of the ecosystem comprises cooperative spiders incorporating communica- tion , mobility and learning skills , striving to improve effi- ciency .', u'Genetic algorithms and classifier rules have been employed for spider adaptation and learning .', u'A set of ex- periments has been performed in order to qualitatively test the efficacy and applicability of the proposed approach .']

entities: [[(u'Social networks', u'Method')], [(u'social networks', u'Method'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Task'), (u'automatic extraction of social networks', u'Task')], [(u'extraction of the strength of relations', u'Task')], [(u'social networks', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'collective contexts', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Web documents', u'Material')], [(u'descriptive labels', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'clustering', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'social network extraction methods', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'ontology population', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'social networks', u'Method')], [(u'political social networks', u'Method'), (u'clustering', u'Method'), (u'precision', u'Metric'), (u'recall', u'Metric')], []]

sentences: [u'Social networks have recently garnered considerable interest .', u'With the intention of utilizing social networks for the Semantic Web , several studies have examined automatic extraction of social networks .', u'However , most methods have addressed extraction of the strength of relations .', u'Our goal is extracting the underlying relations between entities that are embedded in social networks .', u'To this end , we propose a method that automatically extracts labels that describe relations among entities .', u'Fundamentally , the method clusters similar entity pairs according to their collective contexts in Web documents .', u'The descriptive labels for relations are obtained from results of clustering .', u'The proposed method is entirely unsupervised and is easily incorporated into existing social network extraction methods .', u'Our method also contributes to ontology population by elucidating relations between instances in social networks .', u'Our experiments conducted on entities in political social networks achieved clustering with high precision and recall .', u'We extracted appropriate relation labels to represent the entities .']

entities: [[(u'multilingual semantic web', u'Material'), (u'online global multilingual context', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'knowledge bases', u'Material'), (u'multilingualism', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'procedures', u'Generic'), (u'conceptual modelling', u'Method')], [(u'common-sense knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'cultural knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multilingual framework', u'Method')], [(u'FunGramKB', u'Method'), (u'lexico-conceptual knowledge base', u'Material'), (u'natural language understanding', u'Task')], [(u'lexical and the conceptual dimensions of knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'conceptual layer', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'modules', u'Generic'), (u'semantic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'procedural knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'episodic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Cultural mismatches', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'FunGramKB', u'Method')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'common-sense knowledge', u'CONJUNCTION', u'cultural knowledge'), (u'cultural knowledge', u'PART-OF', u'multilingual framework')], [(u'FunGramKB', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'lexico-conceptual knowledge base'), (u'FunGramKB', u'USED-FOR', u'natural language understanding'), (u'lexico-conceptual knowledge base', u'USED-FOR', u'natural language understanding')], [], [(u'semantic knowledge', u'CONJUNCTION', u'procedural knowledge'), (u'Ontology )', u'CONJUNCTION', u'procedural knowledge'), (u'procedural knowledge', u'CONJUNCTION', u'episodic knowledge'), (u'Cognicon )', u'CONJUNCTION', u'episodic knowledge')], []]
sentences: [u'One of the leading motivations behind the multilingual semantic web is to make resources accessible digitally in an online global multilingual context .', u'Consequently , it is fundamental for knowledge bases to find a way to manage multilingualism and thus be equipped with those procedures for its conceptual modelling .', u'In this context , the goal of this paper is to discuss how common-sense knowledge and cultural knowledge are modelled in a multilingual framework .', u'More particularly , multilingualism and conceptual modelling are dealt with from the perspective of FunGramKB , a lexico-conceptual knowledge base for natural language understanding .', u'This project argues for a clear division between the lexical and the conceptual dimensions of knowledge .', u'Moreover , the conceptual layer is organized into three modules , which result from a strong commitment towards capturing semantic knowledge ( Ontology ) , procedural knowledge ( Cognicon ) and episodic knowledge ( Onomasticon ) .', u'Cultural mismatches are discussed and formally represented at the three conceptual levels of FunGramKB .']

sentences: [u'The Intelligence Community , among others , is increasingly using document metadata to improve document search and discovery on intranets and extranets .', u'Document markup is still often incomplete , inconsistent , incorrect , and limited to keywords via HTML and XML tags .', u'OWL promises to bring semantics to this markup to improve its machine understandability .', u'A usable markup tool is becoming a barrier to the more widespread use of OWL markup in operational settings .', u'This paper describes some of our attempts at building markup tools , lessons learned , and our latest markup tool , the Semantic Markup Tool ( SMT ) .', u'SMT uses automatic text extractors and templates to hide ontological complexity from end users and helps them quickly specify events and relationships of interest in the document .', u'SMT automatically generates correct and consistent OWL markup .', u'This comes at a cost to expressivity .', u'We are evaluating SMT on several pilot semantic web efforts .']

entities: [[(u'WarSampo system', u'Method'), (u'heterogeneous , distributed data', u'Material'), (u'Second World War', u'Material'), (u'Semantic Web', u'Material')], [(u'WarSampo', u'Material'), (u'harmonizing massive datasets', u'Method'), (u'event-based modeling', u'Method')], [(u'WarSampo', u'Method'), (u'Linked Open Data LOD service WarSampo Data', u'Material'), (u'Digital Humanities DH research', u'Task'), (u'war history', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic WarSampo Portal', u'Method'), (u'data service', u'Generic')], [(u'WarSampo Portal', u'Material')], [(u'WarSampo Portal', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'Semantic Web', u'FEATURE-OF', u'Second World War')], [(u'harmonizing massive datasets', u'USED-FOR', u'WarSampo'), (u'event-based modeling', u'USED-FOR', u'WarSampo'), (u'event-based modeling', u'USED-FOR', u'harmonizing massive datasets')], [], [(u'semantic WarSampo Portal', u'USED-FOR', u'data service')], [], []]
sentences: [u'This paper presents the WarSampo system for publishing collections of heterogeneous , distributed data about the Second World War on the Semantic Web .', u"WarSampo is based on harmonizing massive datasets using event-based modeling , which makes it possible to enrich datasets semantically with each others ' contents .", u'WarSampo has two components : First , a Linked Open Data LOD service WarSampo Data for Digital Humanities DH research and for creating applications related to war history .', u'Second , a semantic WarSampo Portal has been created to test and demonstrate the usability of the data service .', u'The WarSampo Portal allows both historians and laymen to study war history and destinies of their family members in the war from different interlinked perspectives .', u'Published in November 2015 , the WarSampo Portal had some 20,000 distinct visitors during the first three days , showing that the public has a great interest in this kind of applications .']
