sentences: [u'Visual knowledge maps are being used to improve the communication processes within global organizations .', u'Knowledge maps are graphical presentations of ontological knowledge as well as of business processes .', u'Especially for enterprises working in a multi-cultural space the explicit formalization of knowledge and business rules using graphical models seems to be a very promising approach in order to improve discussion and learning processes .', u'Publishing and automatic inference or search techniques are becoming available due to the latest standards for Semantic Web worked out by W3C .', u"This article gives an impression how to create end user interfaces for the `` Corporate Knowledge Base '' using MS Office and Visio with the modeling tool SemTalk .", u'Several problems on capturing and maintaining large scale knowledge bases are discussed .', u'Specific attention is given to the problem of weighting and association of information from orthogonal ontologies , which arises while using the same concepts in different graphical scenarios .']

entities: [[(u'XML', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic')], [], [(u'limitation', u'Generic'), (u'remedy', u'Generic'), (u'reification', u'Method'), (u'RDF', u'Method')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'encoding typed predicate calculus', u'Task'), (u'reification', u'Method'), (u'bound variables', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'system', u'Generic'), (u'program', u'Generic'), (u'PDDAML', u'Method'), (u'domain specifications', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'PDDL', u'Method')], [(u'reification', u'Task'), (u'algorithm', u'Generic'), (u'logical notations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'predicate calculus', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic web', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'encoding typed predicate calculus'), (u'reification', u'USED-FOR', u'method')], [], [], [(u'semantic web', u'USED-FOR', u'predicate calculus')]]
sentences: [u'The advantage of the RDF/DAML+OIL family of languages over ordinary XML is that it is topic-neutral and composable .', u'However , its expressivity is severely limited .', u'This limitation is well known , and the usual remedy is reification , in which RDF is used to describe formulas in a richer language .', u'We propose a method for encoding typed predicate calculus using reification , which handles bound variables cleanly and causes the size to increase by only a constant multiple .', u'The method generalizes to virtually any system , a claim which we illustrate by describing our program , PDDAML , which encodes domain specifications in PDDL using our technique .', u"We argue that reification , while logically suspect , is in practice benign because any algorithm capable of doing inferences using logical notations can be easily extended to `` unreify '' those notations as needed .", u'We also argue that the ability to represent predicate calculus on the semantic web is crucial .']

entities: [[(u'entity retrieval', u'Task'), (u'Web', u'Material'), (u'metadata', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF', u'Method'), (u'RDFa', u'Material'), (u'Microformats', u'Material')], [(u'Web', u'Material'), (u'entity-oriented search infrastructure', u'Method'), (u'retrieval models', u'Method')], [(u'Sindice-2011 data collection', u'Material'), (u'Sindice semantic search engine', u'Method')], [(u'data collection', u'Generic'), (u'web entity retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'corpus', u'Generic'), (u'data collection', u'Generic'), (u'search infrastructure', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'RDF', u'CONJUNCTION', u'RDFa'), (u'RDFa', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'metadata'), (u'RDFa', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Microformats')], [(u'entity-oriented search infrastructure', u'USED-FOR', u'retrieval models')], [(u'Sindice semantic search engine', u'USED-FOR', u'Sindice-2011 data collection')], [], []]
sentences: [u'The task of entity retrieval becomes increasingly prevalent as more and more ( semi- ) structured information about objects is available on the Web in the form of documents embedding metadata ( RDF , RDFa , Microformats , and others ) .', u'However , research and development in that direction is dependent on ( 1 ) the availability of a representative corpus of entities that are found on the Web , and ( 2 ) the availability of an entity-oriented search infrastructure for experimenting with new retrieval models .', u'In this paper , we introduce the Sindice-2011 data collection which is derived from data collected by the Sindice semantic search engine .', u'The data collection ( available at http : //data.sindice.com/trec2011/ ) is especially designed for supporting research in the domain of web entity retrieval .', u'We describe how the corpus is organised , discuss statistics of the data collection , and introduce a search infrastructure to foster research and development .']

entities: [[(u'multi-model ontology-based framework', u'Method'), (u'semantic search of educational content', u'Task'), (u'lectures', u'Material'), (u'multimedia resources', u'Material')], [(u'hybrid recommender system', u'Method'), (u'recommendations', u'Generic')], [(u'domain ontology', u'Method'), (u'learning materials', u'Task')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'sub-concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'learners ontology model', u'Method'), (u'domain ontology', u'Method'), (u'cluster-based recommendations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic recommendations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'model', u'Generic')], [], [], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'HyperManyMedia1 platform', u'Method')]]
relations: [[(u'lectures', u'CONJUNCTION', u'multimedia resources')], [(u'recommendations', u'USED-FOR', u'hybrid recommender system')], [(u'domain ontology', u'USED-FOR', u'learning materials')], [], [], [], [], [(u'HyperManyMedia1 platform', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'approach')]]
sentences: [u'This paper introduces a multi-model ontology-based framework for semantic search of educational content in E-learning repository of courses , lectures , multimedia resources , etc .', u'This hybrid recommender system is driven by two types of recommendations : content-based ( domain ontology model ) and rule-based ( learners interest-based and cluster-based ) .', u'The domain ontology is used to represent the learning materials .', u'In this context , the ontology is composed by a hierarchy of concepts and sub-concepts .', u'Whereas , the learners ontology model represents a subset of the domain ontology , and the cluster-based recommendations are added as additional semantic recommendations to the model .', u'Combining the content-based with the rule-based provides the user with hybrid recommendations .', u'All of them influenced the re-ranking of the retrieved documents with different weights .', u'Our proposed approach has been implemented on the HyperManyMedia1 platform .']

entities: [[(u'Web of Data', u'Material'), (u'retrieval of textual Web sites', u'Task'), (u'search engines', u'Method'), (u'domain-specific entity data', u'Material'), (u'domain-specific entities', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'textual doc- uments', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'semantic annotation', u'Method'), (u'knowledge graph', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain-specific entity search', u'Task')], [(u'query-expansion strategies', u'Method'), (u'entity search', u'Task')], [(u'semantic an- notation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'background knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'retrieval effec- tiveness', u'Task'), (u'graph structures', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'information and data retrieval methods', u'Method'), (u'semantic search engines', u'Method'), (u'structured domain-specific Web data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'textual doc- uments', u'USED-FOR', u'domain-specific entities')], [(u'semantic annotation', u'USED-FOR', u'domain-specific entity search'), (u'knowledge graph', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic annotation'), (u'knowledge graph', u'USED-FOR', u'domain-specific entity search')], [(u'query-expansion strategies', u'USED-FOR', u'entity search')], [(u'semantic an- notation', u'CONJUNCTION', u'background knowledge')], [(u'information and data retrieval methods', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search engines'), (u'structured domain-specific Web data', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search engines')]]
sentences: [u'Searches on the Web of Data go beyond the retrieval of textual Web sites , and shifts the focus of search engines towards domain-specific entity data , for which the units of retrieval are domain-specific entities instead of textual doc- uments .', u'We study the effect of using semantic annotation in combination with a knowledge graph for domain-specific entity search .', u'Different reasoning , indexing and query-expansion strategies are compared to study their effect in improving the effectiveness of entity search .', u'The results show that the use of semantic an- notation and background knowledge can significantly improve the retrieval effec- tiveness , but require graph structures to be exploited beyond standard reasoning .', u'Our findings can help to develop more effective information and data retrieval methods that can enhance the performance of semantic search engines that oper- ate with structured domain-specific Web data .']

relations: [[(u'human cognition', u'USED-FOR', u'search engine'), (u'human cognition', u'USED-FOR', u'information retrieval'), (u'search engine', u'USED-FOR', u'information retrieval')], [(u'inference engines', u'USED-FOR', u'Natural language processing systems')], [(u'predicate clauses', u'PART-OF', u'Knowledge base-Natural Language Processing System')], [(u'knowledge representation module', u'USED-FOR', u'System')], [(u'It', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search engines'), (u'first-order logic', u'USED-FOR', u'It'), (u'first-order logic', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search engines'), (u'semantic search engines', u'USED-FOR', u'natural language')], []]
sentences: [u'Applying human cognition to a search engine for information retrieval is an emerging task employed to various implementations and one among them is natural language understanding by the machine in a semantic manner .', u'Natural language processing systems will be constructed using inference engines along with a knowledge base ( KB ) to store rules and facts .', u'High-Performance Linguistics ( HPL ) Scheme is an expert Knowledge base-Natural Language Processing System ( K-NLP ) that encompasses predicate clauses .', u'Principally this paper focuses about knowledge representation module of the System .', u'It utilizes the first-order logic which is a formal language that is used to train the semantic search engines to give effective results for natural language through the knowledge base .', u'Thus the machine provides relevant and accurate information for the user queries by preserving semantics of the natural language query .']

relations: [[], [(u'virtual community', u'USED-FOR', u'software development'), (u'e-mails', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'informal and semi-structured artifacts'), (u'e-mails', u'CONJUNCTION', u'meeting notes'), (u'meeting notes', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'informal and semi-structured artifacts'), (u'meeting notes', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Wikis'), (u'Wikis', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'informal and semi-structured artifacts')], [(u'framework', u'USED-FOR', u'software architecture information')], [(u'ontology-based semantic search mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'framework'), (u'ontology-based semantic search mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'architecture properties')], [(u'ontologies', u'USED-FOR', u'visualization of the search results')], [(u'Brazilian Public Software Community context', u'USED-FOR', u'framework')]]
sentences: [u'Every software has an architecture , but in most cases it is poorly documented .', u'Thats especially true in virtual community for software development , where creating and updating documents is not a high priority activity and architectural knowledge remain hidden in informal and semi-structured artifacts , such as e-mails , meeting notes and Wikis .', u'We propose a framework that enables the search for software architecture information in the artifacts generated in virtual communities environments .', u'An ontology-based semantic search mechanism is used in the framework to retrieve not only architecture properties , but also the rationale behind decisions taken during the construction of the software .', u'The ontologies defined are also used in the visualization of the search results , providing an interactive environment for users to explore , discover , and analyze the information .', u'The framework is preliminary validated in the Brazilian Public Software Community context .']

sentences: [u'Semantic search promises to provide more accurate result than present-day keyword matching-based search by using the knowledge represented logically ( i.e. , knowledge base ) .', u"But , the ordinary users do n't know well the complex formal query language and schema of the knowledge base .", u"So , the system should interpret the meaning of user 's keywords .", u'Such requirements are conspicuous especially in smart media such as smart phone , IPTV and smart TV .', u'In this paper , we describe a framework for the semantic retrieval of multimedia contents .', u'Our framework is ontological knowledge base-driven in the sense that the interpretation process is integrated into a unified structure around a knowledge base , which is built on domain ontologies .', u'Our framework also integrates such components as for knowledge base augmentation by user preference and context .', u'We also present our prototype system we have been developing to test our framework ideas .']

sentences: [u'Named entities play an important role in many Natural Language Processing applications .', u'Currently , most named entity recognition systems rely on a small set of general named entity ( NE ) types .', u'Though some efforts have been proposed to expand the hierarchy of NE types , there are still a fixed number of NE types .', u'In real applications , such as question answering or semantic search systems , users may be interested in more diverse specific NE types .', u'This paper proposes a method to extract categories of person named entities from text documents .', u'Based on Dual Iterative Pattern Relation Extraction method , we develop a more suitable model for solving our problem , and explore the generation of different pattern types .', u'A method for validating whether a category is valid or not is proposed to improve the performance , and experiments on Wall Street Journal corpus give promising results .']

sentences: [u'A method and system to facilitate the collaborative development and discovery of evidence-based , clinical pathways .', u'Clinicians , medical professionals or researchers , may use the Platform to build and find clinical pathways through a graphical interface , creating relational data records between steps in pathways .', u"Further , users of the Platform may be able to associate relevant content such as published evidence , supplemental content items ( e.g. , videos , images , documents , ICD-11 , CPT , SNOMED Clinical Terms , and external web pages ) , and other associated pathways which reside in the system 's database .", u'Users of the Platform may be able organize themselves into groups and networks to develop single pathways collaboratively .', u'Users may be able to find specific pathways in the Platform through semantic search , querying for relationships which exist inside of individual pathways .', u'Search results may be generated for a variety of user driven data , both explicit and implicit .']

entities: [[(u'content management', u'Task')], [(u'problem domain', u'Generic'), (u'open hypermedia systems', u'Method'), (u'link databases', u'Material')], [(u'RDF specification', u'Method')], [(u'semantic search mechanism', u'Method'), (u'semantically related resources', u'Task'), (u'distributed linkbases', u'Material')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'crawler based search mechanism', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'clustering of semantically related entities', u'Method'), (u'randomly created network', u'Method'), (u'distance-vector based heuristics', u'Method'), (u'search', u'Task')], [(u'algorithm', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'collaborative application', u'USED-FOR', u'problem domain')], [], [(u'semantic search mechanism', u'USED-FOR', u'semantically related resources')], [(u'approach', u'COMPARE', u'crawler based search mechanism'), (u'distance-vector based heuristics', u'USED-FOR', u'clustering of semantically related entities')], []]
sentences: [u'We consider the problem of content management in dynamically created collaborative environments .', u'We describe the problem domain with the aid of a collaborative application in open hypermedia systems , which allow individual users to share their link databases , otherwise known as link bases .', u'The RDF specification is utilised to express and categorise resources stored in a link base .', u'we describe a semantic search mechanism to discover semantically related resources across such distributed linkbases .', u'Our approach differs from the traditional crawler based search mechanism since it relies on the clustering of semantically related entities to expedite the search for resources in a randomly created network and uses distance-vector based heuristics to guide the search .', u'Our experimental results indicate that the algorithm yields high search effectiveness in collaborative environments where changes in content published by each participant are rapid and random .']

relations: [[(u'binary hash bits', u'USED-FOR', u'fast similarity search')], [], [(u'data-driven hashing method', u'USED-FOR', u'data hashing'), (u'forest hashing', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'data-driven hashing method'), (u'tree structures', u'USED-FOR', u'data-driven hashing method')], [], [], [(u'forest hashing', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search'), (u'semi-supervised label information', u'USED-FOR', u'forest hashing'), (u'semi-supervised label information', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic search')], [(u'benchmark datasets', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'hashing methods')]]
sentences: [u'Indexing images and videos using binary hash bits has shown promising results for fast similarity search .', u'Existing datadriven hashing methods learn compact hash codes from the data , but usually with the cost of generating unbalanced hash buckets , thus affecting the search efficiency .', u'We propose a novel data-driven hashing method called forest hashing , which utilizes multiple tree structures to perform data hashing .', u'By leveraging the index structure of trees , we can significantly improve the hashing efficacy by generating balanced hash buckets .', u'Moreover , forest hashing naturally supports scalable coding where more trees can improve the coding quality with a longer code .', u'Last but not the least , our forest hashing can be easily extended for semantic search by integrating semi-supervised label information .', u'Experiments on two benchmark datasets show favorable results compared with the state-of-the-art hashing methods .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'graphical user interface', u'USED-FOR', u'visual information seeker'), (u'system', u'USED-FOR', u'visual information seeker'), (u'semantic concept association', u'USED-FOR', u'visual information seeker'), (u'spatially related visual concepts', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic concept association')], [], [(u'depiction schema', u'USED-FOR', u'video search system')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Video search and retrieval becoming hot topic in multimedia information retrieval .', u'However , the semantic gap still persists and urges effective mechanisms to bridge the gap .', u'This paper presents an empirical framework , which grabs the user experience to reduce the semantic gap .', u'The graphical user interface of the system allows visual information seeker to express his idea using semantic concept association by spatially related visual concepts .', u'This study comes with a video content depiction schema that has created the foundation for the semantic search mechanism of Spatial Concept Association Based Search ( SCABS ) .', u'In this approach , the communication between the end user and the video search system has been linked through the depiction schema .', u'This visual retrieval mechanism provides advantages in contrast to common tag based retrieval systems .', u'The experimental results pave the path for the possible improvements inline with semantic video retrieval .']

entities: [[(u'keyword-based information retrieval methods', u'Method')], [(u'article metadata', u'Material'), (u'digital collections', u'Material')], [(u'automatic semantic enrichment and search methods', u'Method')], [(u'Linked Open Data resources', u'Material'), (u'environmental science', u'Material')], [(u'semantic searches', u'Task'), (u'form-based semantic search interface', u'Method')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'semantically enriched content', u'Material')], [(u'location-based searches', u'Task')], [(u'web interface', u'Method'), (u'user-based study', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [(u'article metadata', u'PART-OF', u'digital collections')], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'user-based study', u'EVALUATE-FOR', u'web interface')]]
sentences: [u'As information discovery needs become more and more challenging , traditional keyword-based information retrieval methods are increasingly falling short in providing adequate support .', u'The problem is often compounded by the poor quality of article metadata in some digital collections .', u'This paper investigates automatic semantic enrichment and search methods , as ways to meet these challenges .', u'In particular , the benefits of enriching articles with knowledge from Linked Open Data resources are investigated , with focus on the domain of environmental science .', u'In order to facilitate environmental science researchers in carrying out better semantic searches , a form-based semantic search interface is proposed .', u'It helps researchers to benefit from the semantically enriched content , e.g .', u'to carry out sophisticated location-based searches .', u'The usability and ease of learning of this web interface were evaluated in a user-based study , the results of which are also reported .']

relations: [[], [(u'topics', u'CONJUNCTION', u'terminology')], [(u'Argument Workbench', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'processing cascade')], [], [(u'argument indicators', u'CONJUNCTION', u'epistemic terminology')], [(u'argument', u'CONJUNCTION', u'domain terminology')], []]
sentences: [u'The paper discusses the architecture and development of an Argument Workbench , which is a interactive , integrated , modular tool set to extract , reconstruct , and visualise arguments .', u'We consider a corpora with dispersed information across texts , making it essential to conceptually search for argument elements , topics , and terminology .', u'The Argument Workbench is a processing cascade , developed in collaboration with DebateGraph .', u'The tool supports an argument engineer to reconstruct arguments from textual sources , using information processed at one stage as input to a subsequent stage of analysis , and then building an argument graph .', u'We harvest and preprocess comments ; highlight argument indicators , speech act and epistemic terminology ; model topics ; and identify domain terminology .', u'We use conceptual semantic search over the corpus to extract sentences relative to argument and domain terminology .', u'The argument engineer uses the extracts for the construction of arguments in DebateGraph .']

relations: [[], [], [], [(u'knowledge resources', u'CONJUNCTION', u'usability'), (u'usability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'expressivity')], [], [(u'scalability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'guidance'), (u'guidance', u'CONJUNCTION', u'visualisation'), (u'readability', u'CONJUNCTION', u'visualisation')], [], [], [], [(u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'result ranking'), (u'layout schema', u'USED-FOR', u'user interface')]]
sentences: [u'Linked open data end-points are accessible to users and applications to exploit semantic data .', u'However it is not very usable for non-expert users .', u'A search tool can be evaluated on certain criteria i.e .', u'Access to knowledge resources , usability , expressivity and scalability .', u'For a user friendly semantic search tool , there is a number of challenges e.g .', u'Translating user query to formal SPARQL query , scalability , guidance , optimising query results for better readability and visualisation etc .', u'The focus of this paper is the result optimisation for the data received as a result of running queries over different SPARQL end-points .', u'The paper highlights two aspects of the result optimisation i.e .', u'( i ) result ranking and ( ii ) result readability .', u'The paper introduces algorithm for result ranking and suggests the layout schema that defines the result template for the user interface .']

sentences: [u'Most existing semantic search systems expand search keywords using domain ontology to deal with semantic heterogeneity .', u'They focus on matching the semantic similarity of individual keywords in a multiple-keywords query ; however , they ignore the semantic relationships that exist among the keywords of the query themselves .', u'The systems return less relevant answers for these types of queries .', u'More relevant documents for a multiple-keywords query can be retrieved if the systems know the relationships that exist among multiple keywords in the query .', u'The proposed search methodology matches patterns of keywords for capturing the context of keywords , and then the relevant documents are ranked according to their pattern relevance score .', u'A prototype system has been implemented to validate the proposed search methodology .', u'The system has been compared with existing systems for evaluation .', u'The results demonstrate improvement in precision and recall of search .']

sentences: [u'This research pertains to the design and development of a shopbot called WebShopper+ .', u'This shopbot is intended to help customers find and compare e-tailers that market their wares using different languages .', u'WebShopper+ is built with a multilingual ontology to overcome the language barriers that arise with global e-commerce .', u'This research proposes a semi-automatic method of constructing a multilingual ontology by using the formal concept analysis and association analysis .', u"It also proposes an automatic method for the categorization of product data into predefined classes , with the aim of alleviating administrators ' task load .", u'Additionally , a semantic search mechanism based on concept similarity is designed to assist customers in finding more desirable products .', u'The experimental results show that these methods perform well and the shopbot can help customers find real bargains on the Web and to find products that can not be bought locally .']

sentences: [u'The growth of recent interest in casual multiplayer online games comes at a time when the Web is increasingly involved in connecting people , notably through Web-based social networking platforms .', u'Online games are increasingly being embedded into social networking sites where they can form new connections between the network inhabitants .', u'Semantic Web ontologies can be used to put social networking profiles in a format that can be used as a foundation for intelligent socially-aware software services .', u'Defining an ontology for a games rule set and recording the significant events in a game session in an RDF-based format could bring the Semantic Web to games analysis and pave the way for new software services built around multiplayer online games .', u'This paper proposes a methodology for defining the application logic layer of a games application from its rule set .', u'We present a software framework that can translate game rules defined in a subset of OWL-DL combined with SWRL into a Java library that can be used as the application logic layer for a simple game .', u'By defining an ontology for a simple board game rule set we show how a subset of OWL-DL with rules can be used to represent game logic .', u'We then describe in detail how the application framework does this conversion through the freely available software libraries .', u'The use of reflection to implement the application logic layer in Java is discussed in some technical depth .', u'We provide an overview of how rules are implemented in the system , showing how they are expressed in a subset of SWRL that understands Events , Conditions and Actions .', u'This part of the paper provides justification for the choice of description logic features that the rules language keeps from OWL-DL ; however , this justification is kept short as it is not the main focus of the paper .', u'Our approach to generic and ontology-based application logic development presents problems in terms of its ease of implementation and computational tractability .', u'These problems are discussed in some depth , but again they do not form the main focus of the paper .', u'We give an architectural overview of a generated instance of the framework , showing how the event handling and dispatching mechanism is generated to fit the rules defined in the board game rules ontology .', u'We show how a framework instance can be re-used seamlessly across different hardware and network platforms and show how the generated application logic library can be integrated with different types of application client through the event handling mechanism .', u'Our work has primarily been turned towards growing software services for turn-based games around ontologies and rule-sets with OWL and SWRL , together with RDF-based session data .', u'Our main use case scenario is an extended turn-based game that builds a detailed game narrative from a wide range of session events .', u'The games rules are briefly defined and their corresponding ontology is described .', u'The main game session events are presented and a sample RDF-based game session output is sketched out .', u'We suggest how the game session output produced by this framework could be used in the design of game-related software services and how it could be blended with other datasets from the Semantic Web graph to provide greater scope for game immersion and social connectivity .', u'Our position is that publishing game rule sets and the linkable data that describes game sessions may well be a good way of promoting ubiquitous and platform-independent games .', u'We relate these ideas to current thinking about how online game-playing communities are being defined .', u'We also consider how the definition of game logics in Semantic Web ontology languages could potentially influence Web-based game development .', u'Outside the realm of video game culture we consider how the widespread publishing of semantically defined application session events on the Web could feed into educational software development and healthcare , and how it could be related to any application domain where there is an opportunity for recording and analysing a sequential data stream .', u'We present two further diverse scenarios for deployment of a framework like the one we have developed .', u'The first of these is a lightweight portable application for interpreting events from a heart-rate monitor to provide detailed physical exercise profiles .', u'The second is an educational software application that can assess confidence of answers to questions from semantic event session events .', u'We provide extracts from the ontologies and sessions for these outlined application scenarios , though they are treated in less detail than the main scenario outlined above .', u'We conclude that our methodology is applicable for domains which only require a small simple set of rules and entities , like board games .', u'Suggestions for further development of our approach are provided .']

sentences: [u'Recently mathematical formula retrieval has become a hot and difficult problem in the field of information science research .', u'The paper presents an N-grams division method of mathematical formula , determines the granularities of division by experiments , and proposes calculating method of a sub-formula weight based on the complexity of formula , the length of N-grams and depth .', u'In addition , this paper considers the impact that operators made on weights of sub-formulas and gives a method of calculating the weight that sub-formula shares in the whole formula .', u'Experiments show that the methods of N-grams division and index construction have great help for sub-formula matching and weighting computation .', u'The methods can also improve the recall and precision of sub-formulas .', u'The quick and feasible semantic based method can greatly enhance the semantic search capabilities of mathematical search .']

sentences: [u'In collaborative environment , since each agent generally uses different words for the same meaning , there is an obstacle for information sharing .', u'In collaborative product development environment , each agent has different words for representing same product information .', u'As a result , it is hard to share product information in this situation .', u'For solving this problem , semantic-based product information is needed .', u'In this paper , a ontology-based semantic searching system which is able to interact with legacy PDM systems is proposed for product information sharing in collaborative environment Product ontology is represented with OWL format , and the product ontology is processed by Pellet reasoning engine for semantic searching .', u'The system is implemented as a web service which can be integrated with other systems .', u'This paper also introduces the approach with which a PDM system provides a function of semantic search with this search system .']

entities: [[(u'keyword search', u'Task'), (u'distributed inverted index', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'it', u'Generic'), (u'unscalable resources', u'Material')], [(u'bandwidth', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'storage ) consumption', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SKS', u'Method'), (u'scalable keyword search approach', u'Method'), (u'DHTs based P2P system', u'Method')], [(u'SKS', u'Method'), (u'ontology', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic relations', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'SKS', u'Method'), (u'distributed inverted index', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'multi-keyword search', u'Task')], [(u'concept index SKS', u'Method'), (u'keyword search', u'Method'), (u'semantic search', u'Method')], [(u'SKS', u'Method'), (u'distributed inverted index', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'keywords', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'overhead', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'query overhead', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[(u'Distributed Hash Tables', u'USED-FOR', u'keyword search')], [], [], [], [], [], [(u'concept index SKS', u'USED-FOR', u'keyword search')], [(u'SKS', u'COMPARE', u'distributed inverted index'), (u'overhead', u'CONJUNCTION', u'query overhead')]]
sentences: [u'The common way for keyword search in Distributed Hash Tables ( DHTs ) based Peer-to-Peer ( P2P ) system is to construct distributed inverted index by keywords .', u'But it suffers from the problem of unscalable resources ( e.g .', u'bandwidth , storage ) consumption .', u'In this paper , we present SKS , a scalable keyword search approach in DHTs based P2P system .', u'SKS introduces the ontology to organize the specific domain , which captures the semantic relations between words .', u'SKS constructs distributed inverted index by concepts , which decreases the number of index entries publishing for documents and avoids the intersection of inverted lists between nodes when executing multi-keyword search .', u'With the concept index SKS transforms the keyword search to the match process of concepts , implementing semantic search .', u'Simulation experiment shows that SKS is more efficient than the approach of distributed inverted index by keywords in indices publishing overhead and query overhead .']

entities: [[(u'collaborative innovation', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'TasLab portal', u'Method'), (u'domain knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'portal', u'Generic'), (u'collaborative innovation', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semi-automatic innovation tripole generation', u'Task'), (u'user created content', u'Material'), (u'semantic search', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'innovation', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'In this paper we present our experience with fostering collaborative innovation within the Trentino as a Lab ( TasLab ) environment , by creating the conditions for a successful integration of the innovation stakeholders in Trentino , Italy .', u'In order to technically foster innovation we have implemented the TasLab portal , with the aim of promoting the synergic coordination and technology transfer among the three main innovation stakeholders that form the so-called innovation tripole : ( i ) final users , bringing domain knowledge and expectations , ( ii ) enterprises and SMEs , bringing knowledge of the market , and ( iii ) research centres , bringing the latest research results .', u'The portal provides various functionalities related to collaborative innovation , including semi-automatic innovation tripole generation from the user created content , semantic search and so on .', u'Finally , we discuss some implications of the approach implemented on the body of knowledge on innovation and concurrent enterprising .']

sentences: [u'This paper discusses on a novel technique for semantic searching and retrieval of information about learning materials .', u'A novel structured metametadata model has been created to provide the foundation for a semantic search engine to extract , match and map queries to retrieve relevant results .', u'Metametadata encapsulate metadata instances by using the properties and attributes provided by ontologies rather than describing learning objects .', u'The use of ontological views assists the pedagogical content of metadata extracted from learning objects by using the control vocabularies as identified from the metametadata taxonomy .', u'The use of metametadata ( based on the metametadata taxonomy ) supported by the ontologies have contributed towards a novel semantic searching mechanism .', u'This research has presented a metametadata model for identifying semantics and describing learning objects in finer-grain detail that allows for intelligent and smart retrieval by automated search and retrieval software .']

sentences: [u'GIS has emerged as powerful tool which has potential to organize complex spatial environment with tabular relationships but still desktop GIS softwares fails to answer users spatial questions directly .', u'GIS skills and functionality cause semantic gap between Complex hierarchical organization & users spatial thinking as non-expert user identify or use different GIS tools without specific training or skill .', u'To overcome such problem we design a question based GUI framework which use different ontologys like spatial , domain & task ontology to identify core spatial concept & select appropriate tool to complete a task .', u'This framework enhances performance of the GUI software not only for a desktop but on web map services also .', u'The semantic framework would be useful to enhance the ability of spatial reasoning in web search engines ( e.g .', u'Google semantic search ) and answering questions in location based services as well ( e.g .', u'iPhone Siri assistant ) .']

relations: [[(u'Computer-enabled social services', u'USED-FOR', u'web applications'), (u'tagging', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Computer-enabled social services'), (u'tagging', u'CONJUNCTION', u'sharing'), (u'sharing', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'Computer-enabled social services')], [], [(u'user-created content', u'USED-FOR', u'social networks'), (u'user-created content', u'CONJUNCTION', u'activity logs')], [(u'semantic annotations', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic-based functionalities'), (u'semantic annotations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic search semantic-enhanced access control'), (u'semantic search semantic-enhanced access control', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic-based functionalities'), (u'semantic search semantic-enhanced access control', u'CONJUNCTION', u'user privacy protection'), (u'user privacy protection', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'semantic-based functionalities')], [(u'Social Core', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'SmartCampus mobile platform')]]
sentences: [u'Computer-enabled social services like tagging or sharing are ubiquitous in current web applications that are aimed to a group of users .', u'These services do not only add value and new functionalities to their applications but also create a network of users and services that interconnect them to a wider on-line ecosystem .', u'Currently these social networks mainly use the vast amount of user-created content , and activity logs to apply to provide recommendations and more complex services .', u'This paper presents the Social Core a social network engine that implements semantic-based functionalities like semantic annotations , semantic search semantic-enhanced access control and user privacy protection .', u'The Social Core was integrated as part of the SmartCampus mobile platform , which was tested by around one hundred students , and it is currently being further developed as part of European FP7 project SmartSociety .']

relations: [[(u'conceptual graphs', u'FEATURE-OF', u'database')], [(u'conceptual graphs', u'CONJUNCTION', u'graph homomorphism'), (u'conceptual graphs', u'USED-FOR', u'query-answering mechanism'), (u'graph homomorphism', u'USED-FOR', u'query-answering mechanism'), (u'semantic search', u'USED-FOR', u'query-answering mechanism')], [], [(u'NP-Complete problem', u'USED-FOR', u'graph homomorphism checking'), (u'database organizing', u'CONJUNCTION', u'managing algorithms')], [(u'Searching', u'USED-FOR', u'database manipulating problems')], [], [], [], [(u'algorithm', u'USED-FOR', u'subclass of lattices')], []]
sentences: [u'We consider a database composed of a set of conceptual graphs .', u'Using conceptual graphs and graph homomorphism it is possible to build a basic query-answering mechanism based on semantic search .', u'Graph homomorphism defines a partial order over conceptual graphs .', u'Since graph homomorphism checking is an NP-Complete problem , the main requirement for database organizing and managing algorithms is to reduce the number of homomorphism checks .', u'Searching is a basic operation for database manipulating problems .', u'We consider the problem of searching for an element in a partially ordered set .', u'The goal is to minimize the number of queries required to find a target element in the worst case .', u'First we analyse conceptual graph database operations .', u'Then we propose a new algorithm for a subclass of lattices .', u'Finally , we suggest a parallel search algorithm for a general poset .']

relations: [[(u'applications .Education system', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge base Learning'), (u'virtual classrooms', u'CONJUNCTION', u'distance learning'), (u'remote courses', u'CONJUNCTION', u'distance learning')], [], [(u'semantic model', u'USED-FOR', u'e-learning system')], [], [(u'semantic model', u'USED-FOR', u'E-Learning')], []]
sentences: [u'Extensive Research works in the field of knowledge base Learning are represented by a broad spectrum of applications .Education system transform from class room system to E- Learning system which are ranged from virtual classrooms to remote courses or distance learning .', u'E Learning system offer obvious advantages for learners by making access to educational resources very fast ; just-in-time and relevance , at any time or place .', u'Our research is based on proposal of usage of semantic model in e-learning system .', u'Semantic search enables better possibilities for navigating through the cyberspace and accessing its contents .', u'This paper presents an approach of semantic model in implementation for E-Learning .', u'Focus of this approach is on Ontology based semantic model for its content , context and structure of the learning materials and thus provides flexible and personalized access to these learning .']

sentences: [u'The Fuzzy-Go search engine develops a fuzzy ontology to capture the similarities of terms in the ontology for accomplishing the semantic search of keywords , a web crawler to gather and classify web pages , and a fuzzy search mechanism to aggregate all fuzzy factors based on their degrees of importance and degrees of satisfaction .', u'In this paper , we apply the genetic algorithm to propose a self-adaptation approach to Fuzzy-Go search engine .', u"For each search , the fuzzy search engine records the difference between the ordering of search results and user 's real behavior on clicking web pages .", u'The feedbacks are gathered and analyzed to adjust the fuzzy similarities between terms in the fuzzy ontology , the domain classification of web pages , and the importance degrees of fuzzy factors .', u'The ordering of search results can thus be improved gradually by continuous learning and adaptation .']

sentences: [u'Most scholarly papers contain one or multiple figures .', u'Often these figures show experimental results , e.g , line graphs are used to compare various methods .', u'Compared to the text of the paper , figures and their semantics have received relatively less attention .', u'This has significantly limited semantic search capabilities in scholarly search engines .', u'Here , we report scalable algorithms for generating semantic metadata for figures .', u'Our system has four sequential modules : 1 .', u'Extraction of figure , caption and mention ; 2 .', u'Binary classification of figures as compound ( contains sub-figures ) or not ; 3 .', u'Three class classification of non compound figures as line graph , bar graph or others ; and 4 .', u'Automatic processing of line graphs to generate a textual summary .', u'In each step a metadata file is generated , each having richer information than the previous one .', u'The algorithms are scalable yet each individual step has an accuracy greater than 80 % .']

sentences: [u'For forensic accountants and lawyers , E-discovery is essential to support findings in order to prosecute organizations that are in violation with US , EU or national regulations .', u'For instance , the EU aims to reduce all forms of corruption at every level , in all EU countries and institutions and even outside the EU .', u'It also aims to prevent fraud by setting up EU anti fraud offices and actively investigates and prosecutes violations of competition regulations .', u'This position paper proposes to address the application of intelligent language processing to the field of e- discovery to improve the quality of review and discovery .', u'The focus will be on semantic search , combining data-driven search technology with explicit structured knowledge through the extraction of aspects , topics , entities , events and relationships from unstructured information based on email messages and postings on discussion forum .']

sentences: [u'Video indexing based on shots obtained by visual features is useful for content-based video browsing but has more limited success in facilitating semantic search of videos .', u'Meanwhile , recent developments in speech recognition allow the option of surpassing many difficulties associated with the detections of semantic meanings over visual features by operating directly on the verbal content .', u'The use of language based indexing inspires a new video segmentation technique based on speaker change detection .', u'This paper deals with the improvement of existing speaker change detectors by introducing an extra preprocessing step which aligns the audio features with syllables .', u'We investigate the benefits of such synchronization and propose a variable presegmentation scheme that utilizes both magnitude and frequency information to attain such alignment .', u'The experimental results show that the quality of the extracted audio feature is improved , resulting in a better recall rate .']

sentences: [u'Purpose Previous work highlights two key challenges in searching for information about individual entities ( such as persons , places and organisations ) over semantic data : query ambiguity and redundant attributes .', u'The purpose of this paper is to consider these challenges and proposes the Attribute Importance Model ( AIM ) for clustering and ranking aggregated entity search to improve the overall users experience of finding and navigating entities over the Web of Data .', u'Design/methodology/approach The proposed model describes three distinct techniques for augmenting semantic search : first , presenting entity type-based query suggestions ; second , clustering aggregated attributes ; and third , ranking attributes based on their importance to a given query .', u'To evaluate the model , 36 subjects were recruited to experience entity search with and without AIM .', u'Findings The experimental results show that the model achieves significant improvements over the default method of semantic aggregated search provided by Sig ...']

sentences: [u'Virtual learning communities encourage members to learn and contribute knowledge .', u'However , knowledge sharing requires mutual-trust collaboration between learners and the contribution of quality knowledge .', u'This task can not be accomplished by simply storing learning content in repositories .', u'It requires a mechanism to help learners find relevant learning content as well as knowledgeable collaborators to work with .', u'In this paper , we present a peer-to-peer based social network to enhance the quality of e-learning regarding knowledge sharing in virtual learning communities .', u'From a technical viewpoint , we will present advanced semantic search mechanisms for finding quality content and trustworthy collaborators .', u'From the social viewpoint , we will address how to support a trustworthy social network that encourages learners to share .', u'Results of this research demonstrate that applying such mechanisms to knowledge sharing can improve the quality of e-learning in virtual learning communities .']

entities: [[(u'Identifying semantic expressions', u'Task'), (u'multilingual corpora', u'Material'), (u'NLP task', u'Task'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'web search engines', u'Method')], [(u'legal domain', u'Material'), (u'keyword search', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'Concept Strings Framework', u'Method'), (u'CSs', u'Method'), (u'semantic search', u'Task'), (u'them', u'Generic')], [(u'CSs', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'WordNet concepts', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'interactive web-based toolkit', u'Method'), (u'Template Editor', u'Method'), (u'CSs', u'Method')], []]
relations: [[(u'so-called concept strings', u'USED-FOR', u'Identifying semantic expressions'), (u'multilingual corpora', u'USED-FOR', u'Identifying semantic expressions'), (u'it', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic queries'), (u'web search engines', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic queries')], [(u'legal domain', u'COMPARE', u'keyword search')], [], [], [], [(u'Template Editor', u'HYPONYM-OF', u'interactive web-based toolkit')], []]
sentences: [u'Identifying semantic expressions ( so-called concept strings ( CSs ) ) in multilingual corpora is an important NLP task , as it allows web search engines to dene and perform semantic queries over large collection of documents .', u'Existing web search engines in the legal domain are mainly limited to keyword search , in which the query word is matched against the textual content of the documents .', u'This paper presents a novel framework named the Concept Strings Framework that makes use of CSs for representing the content of the documents , and for allowing semantic search over them .', u'These CSs can consist of individual knowledge base ( KB ) concepts ( e.g .', u'WordNet concepts ) or combination of them .', u'In addition , this paper presents an interactive web-based toolkit , called the Template Editor that enables the creation , editing and evaluation of CSs .', u'Experiments on two publicly available legislation websites show satisfactory results .']

entities: [[(u'Open Information Extraction OpenIE systems', u'Method'), (u'grammatical structure', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'recall', u'Metric')], [], [(u'ICRW', u'Method'), (u'non-profit organization', u'Method')], [(u'semantic search applications', u'Task'), (u'triples', u'Generic'), (u'triple extraction', u'Task')], [(u'inference rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'extraction process', u'Task')], [(u'rules', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'informative triples', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'recall', u'Metric')], [(u'triples', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[(u'grammatical structure', u'USED-FOR', u'Open Information Extraction OpenIE systems')], [], [], [], [(u'inference rules', u'USED-FOR', u'extraction process')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Recent Open Information Extraction OpenIE systems utilize grammatical structure to extract facts with very high recall and good precision .', u'In this paper , we point out that a significant fraction of the extracted facts is , however , not informative .', u'For example , for the sentence The ICRW is a non-profit organization headquartered in Washington , the extracted fact a non-profit organization is headquartered in Washington is not informative .', u'This is a problem for semantic search applications utilizing these triples , which is hard to fix once the triple extraction is completed .', u'We therefore propose to integrate a set of simple inference rules into the extraction process .', u'Our evaluation shows that , even with these simple rules , the percentage of informative triples can be improved considerably and the already high recall can be improved even further .', u'Both improvements directly increase the quality of search on these triples .']

sentences: [u'The rapid development of wireless communication technologies and the easy access to mobile computing devices has generated an increase in the development of innovative applications to leverage the benefits of these mobile technologies .', u'Also , over the last decades new platforms and paradigms for intelligent data processing have gained much attention from practitioners and researchers : mobile computing , use of ontologies and Web services for the rapid information processing : In this article , we present an approach for semantic search of academic resources based on the integration of a multi-dimensional ontology model with inference facilities for query answering , and the deployment of Web services for supporting a mobile application .', u'The approach was evaluated based on a set of general competency questions which were translated into a rule-based query language .', u'Results show that the overall solution approach is technologically viable and promising .']

sentences: [u'Semantic search techniques have increasingly gained attention in information retrieval literature .', u'Authors are great sources of semantic interpretation for documents , especially in scholarly domains where articles mostly reflect the research interests of the authors .', u'Being able to interpret semantic meanings of documents from their authors would give rise to many interesting applications , especially in academic digital library literature .', u'In this paper , we present taxonomy-based query-dependent schemes for computing author profile similarity .', u'Our schemes have the capability to capture partial similarities , as opposed to traditional topic overlap based approaches .', u'We generalize our schemes so that they can be easily adopted to other application domains .', u'We acquire resources from multiple places such as Wikipedia , Citeseer X , ArnetMiner , and WikipediaMiner as part of our work .', u'We provide encouraging anecdotal results along with suggestions on potential applications of the proposed schemes .']

entities: [[(u'discourse of sustainability', u'Task'), (u'multinational electricity sector', u'Method'), (u'speech of people', u'Material')], [(u'Sociological Discourse Analysis', u'Method'), (u'methodological approach', u'Method'), (u'Spanish Tradition of Qualitative Social Research', u'Material')], [(u'method', u'Generic'), (u'discourse of sustainability', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'concrete communicative spaces', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'discourse of the actors', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'discursive styles', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'discursive positions', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'settings', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'narrative spaces semantic search', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'discourse of sustainability', u'Task')], [(u'discourse', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'environmental and social responsibility', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'The objective of this research is to analyze the construction of the discourse of sustainability in a multinational electricity sector from the speech of people directly related to the preparation of Sustainability Reports .', u'Sociological Discourse Analysis ( SDA ) , the methodological approach used and systematized in this study , is linked to the Spanish Tradition of Qualitative Social Research .', u'As a method , revealed the discourse of sustainability in the company considering the social aspect and concrete communicative spaces that formed and elaborated the discourse of the actors as signifying practices .', u'The analysis of discursive styles , discursive positions , settings and narrative spaces semantic search were performed in the construction of the discourse of sustainability .', u'The company presents itself through a discourse aligned with economic goals , considering also other dimensions of sustainability - environmental , social and manifesting its environmental and social responsibility .']

entities: [[(u'personalized systems', u'Method'), (u'knowledge management', u'Task')], [(u'systems', u'Generic')], [(u'flexible knowledge management approach', u'Method'), (u'personalization', u'Task')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge management platform', u'Method'), (u'folksonomies', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantics', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'domain-specific recommendations', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic search capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'knowledge retrieval', u'Task'), (u'homemade explosives', u'Material')], [(u'law enforcement', u'Task')]]
relations: [[], [], [(u'flexible knowledge management approach', u'USED-FOR', u'personalization')], [(u'domain-specific recommendations', u'CONJUNCTION', u'semantic search capabilities')], [(u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'knowledge retrieval'), (u'approach', u'USED-FOR', u'homemade explosives'), (u'knowledge retrieval', u'USED-FOR', u'homemade explosives')], []]
sentences: [u'Organizations invest considerable development effort in personalized systems to reap the benefits of knowledge management .', u'Competition and the need for innovation imply in ever-changing and emerging needs that result in costly effort to redesign such systems .', u'A flexible knowledge management approach should achieve personalization for organizations by adapting to the domain of the organization , meanwhile simplifying the incorporation of future knowledge retrieval needs .', u'We describe such an approach that employs a knowledge management platform at its core , which supports adding and removing multiple folksonomies , constantly enriches them with semantics and provides domain-specific recommendations and semantic search capabilities .', u'This approach to knowledge retrieval has been applied to the domain of homemade explosives and counter-terrorism efforts as part of the HOMER project .', u'Preliminary evaluation from the perspective of the end-users - law enforcement , security and related agencies - is presented .']

entities: [[(u'semantic search engines', u'Method'), (u'postprocessing techniques', u'Method'), (u'clustering routines', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'routines', u'Generic'), (u'hierarchical clustering', u'Task')], [(u'2D', u'Task'), (u'abundant visual cues', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'3D metaphor', u'Method'), (u'visualization of hierarchical clustered results', u'Task')], [(u'metaphor', u'Generic'), (u'fractal trees', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'linear recursive algorithms', u'Method'), (u'node-link hierarchies', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'hierarchical clustering algorithms', u'Method'), (u'single-tree or forest metaphors', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u"user 's customizable alternatives", u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'forest depiction', u'Task'), (u'approach', u'Generic')]]
relations: [[], [(u'hierarchical clustering', u'USED-FOR', u'routines')], [(u'3D metaphor', u'USED-FOR', u'visualization of hierarchical clustered results')], [(u'fractal trees', u'USED-FOR', u'metaphor'), (u'node-link hierarchies', u'USED-FOR', u'linear recursive algorithms')], [(u'single-tree or forest metaphors', u'USED-FOR', u'hierarchical clustering algorithms')], []]
sentences: [u'The immaturity of semantic search engines has initiated researchers to apply various novel postprocessing techniques on traditional search engine results among which clustering routines are most conspicuous .', u'While many of these routines are focused on hierarchical clustering , little has been done toward an effective visualization of such data .', u'Due to the richness of information observed in 3D in comparison with 2D ( because of its abundant visual cues ) , we have proposed an intuitive 3D metaphor for the visualization of hierarchical clustered results .', u'Our metaphor is based on fractal trees which are usually constructed by linear recursive algorithms traversing node-link hierarchies .', u"The search results of different hierarchical clustering algorithms shall be visualized as either single-tree or forest metaphors which are user 's customizable alternatives in our implemented prototype .", u'In the forest depiction , our approach is even applicable to flat clustered results .']

sentences: [u'A semantic tagging method may add context to a sentence in order to increase search efficiency .', u"Regardless of an author 's writing style , translating semantic concepts into tags may increase search efficiency .", u'Automatic semantic tagging of documents may allow semantic search and reasoning .', u'Text for semantic tagging may include an email , a website chat room , an internet forum , or a text message .', u'Additional texts may include aggregating general consensus of an emailed topic across multiple emails , whether in the same email chain or separate emails .', u'To increase search efficiency , the analysis of prior communications within the body of text may comprise analyzing structured contextual information to facilitate with homophora resolution .', u'The structured contextual information may include at least one of a sender email address , one or more recipient email addresses , a subject field , a message date and time stamp , and an attachment title .']

entities: [[(u'structured information', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'semantic data', u'Material')], [(u'It', u'Generic'), (u'semantic search', u'Task'), (u'Web data integration', u'Task')], [], [(u'usability', u'Metric'), (u'scalability', u'Metric'), (u'uncertainty', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Dataplorer', u'Method'), (u'solution', u'Generic')], [(u'hybrid queries', u'Material'), (u'faceted search', u'Method'), (u'scalability', u'Metric')], [(u'Dataplorer', u'Method'), (u'ranking scheme', u'Method')], [(u'approach', u'Generic'), (u'IR infrastructure', u'Method'), (u'Web of data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[], [(u'semantic search', u'CONJUNCTION', u'Web data integration')], [], [], [], [(u'hybrid queries', u'CONJUNCTION', u'faceted search')], [], [(u'IR infrastructure', u'USED-FOR', u'Web of data')]]
sentences: [u'More and more structured information in the form of semantic data is nowadays available .', u'It offers a wide range of new possibilities especially for semantic search and Web data integration .', u'However , their effective exploitation still brings about a number of challenges , e.g .', u'usability , scalability and uncertainty .', u'In this paper , we present Dataplorer , a solution designed to address these challenges .', u'We consider the usability through the use of hybrid queries and faceted search , while still preserving the scalability thanks to an extension of inverted index to support this type of query .', u'Moreover , Dataplorer deals with uncertainty by means of a powerful ranking scheme to find relevant results .', u'Our experimental results show that our proposed approach is promising and it makes us believe that it is possible to extend the current IR infrastructure to query and search the Web of data .']

entities: [[(u'Biological data', u'Material'), (u'data storing', u'Task'), (u'mining', u'Task')], [(u'database management system', u'Method'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task'), (u'in-house Monogenean-host database', u'Material')], [(u'ontology', u'Generic'), (u'dataset', u'Generic'), (u'semantic technology', u'Method')], [(u'Taxonomy ontology', u'Method'), (u'accepted taxonomic classification system', u'Method'), (u'semantic key identifier', u'Method'), (u'information retrieval', u'Task')], [(u'semantic identifiers', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Biological data is huge and increasing rapidly therefore data storing and mining will become major challenges .', u'We have encountered several key problems related to limitations in the database management system ( DBMS ) used and information retrieval in our in-house Monogenean-host database .', u'In this paper we will be presenting the ontology developed that is specific to our dataset using semantic technology to overcome these problems .', u'Our Taxonomy ontology is built based on accepted taxonomic classification system and semantic key identifier therefore problems in information retrieval are minimized .', u'Our focus is on the images used in taxonomy and how to retrieve them based on semantic identifiers .']

entities: [[(u'search engines', u'Method')], [(u'semantic search and recommendation field', u'Task')], [], [], [(u'computational intelligence techniques', u'Method'), (u'entity recommendation and understanding', u'Task')], []]
sentences: [u'Entities and the Knowledge about the entities have become indispensable building blocks in modern search engines .', u'This tutorial aims to present the current state of research in the emerging semantic search and recommendation field by studying how to help users effectively explore the knowledge base as well as answer their information needs .', u'Many live applications and systems will be demonstrated throughout this tutorial .', u'After the completion of the tutorial , the audience will have an introduction and overview of what is the emerging topics of entity recommendation and understanding .', u'The audience will learn and be able to understand some current research work as well as industry practices using computational intelligence techniques in entity recommendation and understanding .', u'One of the major goals of this tutorial is to help audience identify a few research directions that could have big impact in the near future .']

sentences: [u'To protect the privacy , sensitive information has to be encrypted before outsourcing to the cloud .', u'Thus the effective data uct keyword search .', u'Related works on searchable encryption emphasis on single keyword based search or Boolean keyword based search , and hardly work on sorting the search results .', u'Our work focuses on realizing secure semantic search through query keyword semantic extension .', u'We mix-ups and used architecture of two clouds , explicitly private cloud and public cloud .', u'The search process is distributed into two steps .', u'The leading step develops the question keyword upon warehoused database in the private cloud .', u'The subsequent step uses the drawn-out query keywords set to recover the index on public cloud .', u'Finally the matched files are resumed in order .', u'Complete security analysis shows that our explanation is privacy-preserving and secure .', u'Trial evaluation determines the efficiency and effectiveness of the scheme .']

entities: [[], [(u'applications', u'Generic'), (u'semantic search', u'Task'), (u'extraction of multimedia contents', u'Task')], [(u'video event detection', u'Task')], [(u'raw data', u'Material')], [(u'Video Semantic Content Meta Model', u'Method')], [(u'video semantic content model', u'Method'), (u'Domain ontology', u'Method'), (u'it', u'Generic'), (u'spatial/temporal relationship', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Extraction process', u'Task'), (u'object extraction', u'Task'), (u'event extraction', u'Task')], [(u'object extraction', u'Task'), (u'Depth Image Based Rendering', u'Method')], [(u'DIBR', u'Method'), (u'object detection', u'Task')], [(u'framework', u'Generic'), (u'extraction capabilities', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]

sentences: [u'Now days , mostly video based applications are used .', u'In those applications , we need to do semantic search and extraction of multimedia contents .', u'To summarize video , video event detection is necessary .', u'Using raw data and low level features user can not fulfill his need , so deeper understanding of video is necessary .', u'Here , Video Semantic Content Meta Model is presented , using which automatically extraction of objects , events and concepts is possible .', u'This video semantic content model is based on Domain ontology and it uses spatial/temporal relationship in events and concepts .', u'Extraction process starts with object extraction and then objects are used as input for event extraction .', u'For object extraction , Depth Image Based Rendering ( DIBR ) is used .', u'In DIBR , views for objects are considered so that object detection will be more correct .', u'In proposed framework , we considered viewing angle of camera to improve extraction capabilities .']

entities: [[(u'primary research data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material'), (u'tasks', u'Generic')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'extraction of knowledge', u'Task'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Visual Analytics approaches', u'Method')], [(u'tasks', u'Generic'), (u'Big Data issues', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [], [], [(u'public release', u'USED-FOR', u'extraction of knowledge')], [], []]
sentences: [u'Research depends to a large degree on the availability and quality of primary research data , i.e. , data generated through experiments and evaluations .', u'While the Web in general and Linked Data in particular provide a platform and the necessary technologies for sharing , managing and utilizing research data , an ecosystem supporting those tasks is still missing .', u'The vision of the CODE project is the establishment of a sophisticated ecosystem for Linked Data .', u'Here , the extraction of knowledge encapsulated in scientific research paper along with its public release as Linked Data serves as the major use case .', u'Further , Visual Analytics approaches empower end users to analyse , integrate and organize data .', u'During these tasks , specific Big Data issues are present .']

entities: [[(u'library sphere', u'OtherScientificTerm')], [(u'Open Data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'Linked Data', u'Material')], [(u'bibliographic data', u'Material')], [(u'hbz library network', u'Method'), (u'matter', u'Generic'), (u'lobid-organisations', u'OtherScientificTerm')]]
relations: [[], [(u'Linked Data', u'USED-FOR', u'interoperability of data')], [], [], []]
sentences: [u'The topic Linked Open Data is pushing more and more into the library sphere .', u'While Open Data is all about the legal status of any kind of data , Linked Data aims at augmenting the interoperability of data by consistently applying ( web- ) standards .', u'This article begins with an illustration of why Linked Data is relevant to the library world .', u'This is followed by a short introduction to the most important Linked Data standards and some thoughts on how to migrate bibliographic data to these standards .', u'Finally the current activities of the hbz library network concerning this matter are presented as the experimental Linked ( Open ) Bibliographic Data platform lobid.org and its services lobid-resources and lobid-organisations .']

relations: [[], [(u'RDF links', u'USED-FOR', u'semantically related information')], [], [], [(u'ontology reasoning', u'USED-FOR', u'Link discovery of library linked data'), (u'ontology reasoning', u'USED-FOR', u'library linked data')], []]
sentences: [u'The library is an important application domain of government open linked data .', u'The value of linked data lies in discovering more semantically related information by RDF links .', u'Ontology is a key technology by providing a source of shared and precisely defined terms that can be used in descriptions of resources .', u'Reasoning over such descriptions will be essential if resources are to be more accessible to automated process .', u'For utilizing ontology reasoning on Link discovery of library linked data , in this paper , a Link discovery framework is proposed and its workflow is introduced .', u'Taking library domain for example , we showcase the value of framework in knowledge discovery and the result can be applied to open the digital government resources .']

sentences: [u'This paper discusses how to design robot-human communication us- ing Ontological Semantic Technology ( OST ) , which is to address meanings of phrases or sentences in natural languages , in a firefighting domain .', u'The OST is a system in an ontology-based structure to deal with different natural languages .', u'In this study , English and Korean were selected to be implemented for the OST .', u'The problem set is designed with Natural English , direct translation from the natural English to Korean , natural Korean , and direct translation from the natu- ral Korean to English , which can be compared to examine the similarity of meanings with a language-independent ontology in processing English and Korean .']

relations: [[(u'Semantic technology', u'USED-FOR', u'classical information retrieval')], [], [], [], [(u'linguistic patterns', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic natural language')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'linguistic expressions')], [(u'linguistic expressions processing', u'USED-FOR', u'linguistic coverage')]]
sentences: [u'Semantic technology improves classical information retrieval by representing the information in a structured form and with notion of understanding .', u'The querying process however requires formal language which could be challenging to novice users .', u"The natural language interface research addresses this issue by translating the user 's question into the formal query .", u'Existing studies have provided limited question understanding coverage due to limitation on single triple translation only .', u'This paper addresses deeper understanding of semantic natural language through twelve linguistic patterns .', u'The result has shown that the method manages to extract the linguistic expressions and aid the translation process .', u'This concludes that wider linguistic coverage can be provided by higher linguistic expressions processing .']

sentences: [u'In this study , a novel metacrawling method is proposed for discovering and monitoring linked data sources on the Web .', u'We implemented the method in a prototype system , named SPARQL Endpoints Discovery ( SpEnD ) .', u"SpEnD starts with a `` search keyword '' discovery process for finding relevant keywords for the linked data domain and specifically SPARQL endpoints .", u'Then , these search keywords are utilized to find linked data sources via popular search engines ( Google , Bing , Yahoo , Yandex ) .', u'By using this method , most of the currently listed SPARQL endpoints in existing endpoint repositories , as well as a significant number of new SPARQL endpoints , have been discovered .', u'Finally , we have developed a new SPARQL endpoint crawler ( SpEC ) for crawling and link analysis .']

sentences: [u'A system , method and article of manufacture are provided for providing a user interface for a data management application that extracts data from several data sources across an enterprise .', u'First , a user is allowed to input a search query .', u'Data items found during a search based on the query are received and displayed in nodes arranged in a tree format .', u'A portion of the data items are hyper linked to detailed views of the data items .', u'A detailed view of one of the hyper linked data items is displayed upon selection of the one of the hyper linked data items by the user .', u'The selected hyper linked data items are added to a history list .']

relations: [[], [(u'semantic integration method', u'USED-FOR', u'digital museumd'), (u'concept identification', u'CONJUNCTION', u'correlation detection'), (u'correlation detection', u'CONJUNCTION', u'concept similarity calculations')], [(u'method', u'USED-FOR', u'semantic integration in museums')]]
sentences: [u'With the rapid development of linked data in digital museums , research on interlinking between linked data-based datasets has become a focus of attention .', u'In the light of the existing problems with current methods , herein we propose a semantic integration method for digital museumd , which successfully converts interlinking between linked data-based datasets into an arithmetical operation of concept similarity by using concept identification , correlation detection , and concept similarity calculations .', u'The method in this paper was applied to semantic integration in museums , and the experimental results show that it can build rich semantic associations with good accuracy.Moreover , the user interface is designed so that it can check matching results to ensure the quality of links .']

entities: [[(u'lexical data', u'Material'), (u'representation formalisms', u'Method'), (u'data', u'Generic'), (u'Linked Data framework', u'Method')], [(u'Linguistic Linked Open Data', u'Material'), (u'less-resourced language data', u'Material'), (u'mainstream languages', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'linking language data', u'Task'), (u'language data', u'Material'), (u'encyclopaedic knowledge', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'Linked Data cloud', u'OtherScientificTerm'), (u'RDF encoded lexical data', u'Material'), (u'Linked Data', u'Material')]]
relations: [[(u'representation formalisms', u'USED-FOR', u'lexical data'), (u'data', u'PART-OF', u'Linked Data framework')], [(u'language data', u'CONJUNCTION', u'encyclopaedic knowledge'), (u'encyclopaedic knowledge', u'PART-OF', u'Linked Data cloud')]]
sentences: [u'In this position paper we discuss some of the experiences we made in describing lexical data using representation formalisms that are compatible for the publication of such data in the Linked Data framework .', u'While we see a huge potential in the emerging Linguistic Linked Open Data , also supporting the publication of less-resourced language data on the same platform as for mainstream languages , we are wondering if , parallel to the widening of linking language data to both other language data and encyclopaedic knowledge present in the Linked Data cloud , it would not be beneficial to give more focus more on harmonization and merging of RDF encoded lexical data , instead of establishing links between such resources in the Linked Data .']
